REVIEW_BODY:
Fewer fences than most zoos I've been to, especially many of the monkeys seem to have a large range of movement. The enclosures are big and all animals appear to have water and shade at all times, they also look healthy and cared for. Feeding times are sett so anyone who wishes can observe them._x000D_
_x000D_
One could easily spend an entire day here, or an afternoon if one wanted to catch the night safari (which we didn't, but would have loved to)._x000D_
_x000D_
Only drawback is that it's som distance from the city, for obvious reasons of course, but there is some traveling time._x000D_
_x000D_
Very interesting and beautiful zoo!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Simply amazing experience - the Gardens by the Bay, the Cloud Forest and the Flower Dome were out of this world! Everything was immaculately maintained and beautifully presented. One of the greatest tourists attractions we have ever experienced.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Botanic garden is right in the city center of Singapore. And is very accessible by mrt, botanic gardens station. Itâ€™s a great place to hang out with friends or have a picnic. There are restaurants there but itâ€™s on the more expensive side.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Check temples time of opening ahead of your visit
REVIEW_BODY:
Little India has more India than Chinatown has China in Singapore (just in case you have time for only one place). Exiting the metro, there is the food court with delicious choices, sometimes very spicy._x000D_
The temples are often closed 12-4pm so you need to time your visit accordingly.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: very nice view and perfect for all ages. good place to take photos and good memories. Will go again only if there is promotions.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I am not a fan of heights, but this was a great experience and opportunity to see the Singapore skyline. We did an early morning trip due to the heat and humidity. I would recommend this.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the many highlights of our visit to Singapore well worth the trip out on the tour bus i think it was the green tour from Suntech tourist hub
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Sunrise View of Garden by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: This location can be reach from Bayfront MRT station. It about 5 min walk from the station. Climb up the stair or take the elevator and from there you can view the sunrise from there. Excellent view
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing light show every night at 19.30, child and wheelchair friendly. Everyone should visit this especially after sun set.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We actually went on the river on a boat tour, what lovely views, we had a 40 minute trip up to the bay and back from Clarke Quay.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When you are in Singapore you shouldn't miss Gardens by the Bay, A really nice place to walk around and see the nature in the middle of the city.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited last September 25, 2018 It was cold inside the dome, I am sensitive to cold, bring jacket or cardigan. If you are born in the country (like me Philippines) with lots of trees and green plants this place is not appealing to you. Though the view below you will makes you feel, liking the place. Wonderful exterior design is the attraction on this place.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you want to buy something this is the place to go but I will warn you itâ€™s not cheap . Everything is expensive in Singapore so donâ€™t go there thinking you will get anything cheap not going to happen.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This crowded market place offers souvneirs of every kind imaginable. The problem is that almost every stall is the same and the prices mostly the same as well - so get in, get what you want and leave - there are much more interesting places to go in Singapore
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
You could easily spend a whole day here._x000D_
Do not miss the Super trees light show it was fab I only wish we had more time to see it again._x000D_
Go to the rooftop bar for just before sunset and watch the sun go down you can see for miles in all directions :)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The night safari was easy on weekday, with minimum crowd, we were allowed early entry with minimum hestitation. The ride was smooth and the sufficient to allow the young children a good view of the animals at each station.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful expo about botanical plants and trees. Both pavilions have a hug collection of plants, flowers, and arrangements in different climates zones, that are very unique and presented in a great and impressive way.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Treasures of the World - British Museum Exhibit.
REVIEW_BODY:
Very well done exhibit. I saw this exhibit on a tour - which was good and given it was only an hour, insufficient for viewing the entire exhibit. It will require one and a half to two hours to get the scope of this exhibit - and it is well worth it if you are interested in an historical view of our planet._x000D_
For young children, there are lots of activities they can do there._x000D_
_x000D_
See it before it leaves at the end of May
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I went to the Flower Dome in February for about 2 hours - it is well worth a visit. The architecture of the dome, the views in the background made the visit a very enjoyable experience. The displays apparently change once a quarter, so it can be visited again during subsequent visits as well._x000D_
_x000D_
There is a paid shuttle near the Gardens entrance available, but the 10 minute walk through the gardens is quite enjoyable.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Always a great place to hangout with family =)
REVIEW_BODY: Coming to Macritchie for a little curry puff and a walk is always a joy. The best time to come is in the mid afternoon where the crowds have thinned.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Visiting India from outside of India
REVIEW_BODY:
As its name implies it's a small Indian town within the city. packed with shop selling Indian product and food. it's really carry a favor you won't find in other part of the city._x000D_
_x000D_
I'd suggesting dropping by the heritage center for a quick visit of the local Indian history so you can get more appreciation of the coming of the town
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A night time walk through is such fun and a wonderful experience. I felt safe and the park was so clean and staff members were very friendly
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: After exploring the fabulous high-end attractions of Singapore, one must come here to experience the beauty of Nature.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: very good maintained also when there are many visitors
REVIEW_BODY: Take your time and walk throug this beautiful garden. It is amazing, how many different types and colours you will see.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a must visit place. Beautiful place,colorful and u will love it. Try making this place while visiting Singapore.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: History of Ancient Chinese culture. History of Hell & Heaven. History of Monkey God to the pilgrims with the Monk . Many others
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful gardens- free to visit and just $5 to enter the Orchard garden. Easy commute via MRT. However, I left it too late in the day and it was hard to enjoy due to the heat. Glad I came, but wouldn't come again. Especially when Gardens by the bay is so impressive.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I had visited Night Safari during the month of November, and have not got long queues any where. They have a few shows, which needs booking. On busy weekends its better to book entry tickets in advance. Tram rides needs a waiting of maximum 10 to 15 minutes. You can also choose to book it on spot. There are few walking trials inside the park, which are absolutely safe and very well maintained. Unfortunately, if you reach there very late in the evening, you may miss few things. Best time to go would be post afternoon, the weather will be pleasant and you would get lot of time to explore the entire safari.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice garden but crowded with tour groups.
REVIEW_BODY: We had limited time so we took the trolley tour. It gives you a good overview of the garden but you need to go on foot to look at things that interest you and to see details.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Being a regular traveller through Singapore I tend to avoid the tourist attractions... but a friend was visiting for the first time so we went to the Gardens and I was pleasantly surprised. Fantastic environment and great for photographers... It also had the added bonus of being nice escape from the afternoon heat/humidity.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Can't miss this icon in downtown Singapore. Worth taking a ride to have aerial view of Singapore's skyline. Great for young families.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well this was definitely in my itinerary while planning my trip to Singapore as itâ€™s must and worth visit place.. u can get to see so many species of birds, animals, reptiles and much more .. it takes so much of time to cover all the zones.. we booked tickets online with tram ticket as itâ€™s better and gives u breathing space for some time .. this zoo is very big and houses finest of the finest animals in good health .. in their free nature without Any problem or stress. U take map at the entrance and cover zones one by one.. seal show is must without missing .. v. Really enjoyed it ... but Go bit early to occupy seats in front row.. there are lot of eating options inside so no need to worry about food.. plus u can carry also your food .. my favourite animals were orang utangs they are so cute and roams freely .. plus chimpanzees and zebra with giraffe too.. they also have a kangaroo and raccoon too .. no matter if u r adult or kid u will definitely enjoy the zoo without any second thought .. â¤ï¸â¤ï¸
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great way to spend a day
REVIEW_BODY: We spent a day and covered every inch of Orchard Road! Great window displays in the designer stores, floral arrangements in the streets, footpaths covered by trees which provide respite from the heat and clever air conditioned underpasses make it easy to cross the road! Had a fabulous lunch at Food Republic which offers a huge range of food outlets and a refreshment station. Great shopping choices which provide escape from the heat. A great dayâ€™s activity with every shop your heart could desire!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We had a hot, but nice walk along the river after visiting Merlion Park. There are many restaurants alongside and you may join a sightseeng tour as well._x000D_
_x000D_
I was impressed when I glimpsed a boat with outfit to clean the river for leaves that had fallen from the trees on either side. This would never have happend in my country._x000D_
_x000D_
Look for more reviews by MulleEllum.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is hardly a cathedral and better from the outside. Not spiritual, very noisy with leaf blowers and builders, not beautiful at all. Full of noisy Chattering locals .don't bother going in . There are so many amazing cathedrals to be seen in England and abroad ._x000D_
Disappointing.
ADDRESS: 11 St. Andrew's Road St. Andrew's Cathedral, Singapore 178959, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not many flowers and too many people
REVIEW_BODY: it was really crowded when we visited and everyone was so busy taking selfies next to the plants that one couldn't really appreciate them. there weren't too many flower varieties.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Start at ION and make your way down fantastic shopping and food on orchard road. You can do this inside in AC comfort or outside from block to block. Food galore, merchandise galore....just keep going....
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice walk, beautiful park and close to many other sites. Beautiful parks to walk around and see the sites of Singapore and the waterfront.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A little tip. Board right after the sun dips into the horizon, so you can get some pretty good light against the city skyline.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the finest riverside where you can relax, have good food, have creazy time all together. Amazing walk and good disco.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: very enriching experience. owner of the Intan is very welcoming and the tour is very well planned. learnt a lot about the peranakan culture and wonderful stories.
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is actually a great place to visit. You get the village feeling in the middle of a big city. The noise from the traffic is switched with bird's song from the trees. Small narrow lanes with restaurants and cafes._x000D_
_x000D_
A peaceful retreat from the big city.
ADDRESS: Kampong Glam, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Watching the animals in the night is a good experience especially for kids. Very safe and quite a lot of animals to see. Dont miss the feeding schedule, especially the otters. There are two shows in the evening before the safari starts. Be there 30 mins before, and yes u can combine both the night safari and the zoo activity in one day.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Nice experience._x000D_
_x000D_
But everyone said the cloud Forrest was better._x000D_
_x000D_
Very pretty, very pleasant - make a day of it but don't take the kids as they will get bored._x000D_
_x000D_
Had coffee at cafe inside and this took 25 mins to get 2 coffees and cost $15 sgd - won't be back._x000D_
_x000D_
Make sure you pay $3sgd and get the unlimited transport._x000D_
_x000D_
This is a must for a green thumbs at heart.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: All tour buses leave from this location. It has a good food court and a nice garden. The surrounding area is good for jogging too.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A fitting tribute, and solemn reminder.
REVIEW_BODY: This is a beautifully peaceful memorial for those from many nations who fought in the cause of liberty. It is set on a hillside, with uniform white headstones reminding one of Arlington National Cemetery. However, carefully tended plantings between graves enhance the beauty of this place, and large stone memorials help provide tribute to those here honored.
ADDRESS: 9 Woodlands Road, Singapore 738656, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Definitely needs to see if you want to joint to the paradise in the Earth. So many kinds of orchids! Paradise smelling!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you're flower lover or just like to see various plants and flowers, this is a must go if you're in Singapore. It is not as big as the Cloud Forest so about 2 hours should be sufficient. The dome is cool and covered so like Cloud Forest next door, it is quite suitable for a hot day or a wet and rainy day.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
There are different exhibitions available, based on the â€˜seasonâ€™ you go , so search it up on the internet before going._x000D_
_x000D_
I went for the â€˜Future World exhibitionâ€™. However, when I was at the ticketing counter , the person told me that one of the stations was closed due to upgrading works (space). It was kind of disappointing because we had one less exhibition to go to but nonetheless it was a great experience._x000D_
_x000D_
Future world exhibition comprises of nature, town, space,park and sanctuary stations. Visitors get to experience digital art. Young children can also colour and scan their artwork for it to be featured on a big screen. Its also a great place for photography shoots due to the array of colours.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When in Singapore visiting the Cloud Forest is an absolute must do as its truly unique. Spent around an hour wandering through here taking many great photos.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Had a Wonderful walk around lots to see and do , fantastic restaurants and great places to take photos
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It is one thing not to be missed in Singapore._x000D_
Itâ€™s like being Alice in Wonderland....._x000D_
the garden is impressive and although itâ€™s all artificial but the creative minds of the designers would leave you breathless. It opens till 10:00 pm so if you are planning a trip to this beautiful country make sure you visit the gardens. Itâ€™s definitely worth your while
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth the time and experience when in Singapore. Cost just over $20 to go to the top. Need to be a guest to see close up infinity pool. Could do with a better public restaurant offer when up there.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is costly to go up and the entrance was hard to find at first, its outside the hotel and downstairs where you find the ticket box before going up in a different lift. It is costly but was in our budget so we went just before dusk and stayed for about an hour to watch the sunset and the supertree lightshow which is across the road at the gardens by the bay. There is a bar up there with some beverages and snacks available, the prices didn't look too expensive but we didnt buy anything.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great part of the Singapore Botanical Gardens. I think you had to pay extra to visit it, but if you love orchids, there are some beautiful ones to look at.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A lovely place to visit when in Singapore. It is situated slightly out of town, and a nice break from the city busslle and noise.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you don't mind the walk.....there are malls also hundreds of multi storey departments sores...even underground...everything from a pin to $750,000.00 plus diamond rings...Thousands of eating places
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: In the day time this heritage area is quiet and dull. But after 6pm it become very vibrant and there are a lot eateries to try different cuisines.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Breathtaking cloud walk with raised and suspended walkway, a man-made waterfall right at the entrance, a bouquet of exotic-for-these-parts flora of mountainous and semi-arid regions & a whole Lego-garden make Cloud Forest the most unusual botanical garden experience.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I did not enjoy much as I suffer from vertigo. The scenery from top is beautiful. It moves slowly so u can cherish every moment
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore eye or flyer is just like another flyer. I think it is bit smaller ther Londen one. If you are short of time and seen other , you can give a miss. Otherwise it is worth seeing. you can have a beautiful view on clear day. All tourist activity all so starts from here like bus etc. so if you have spare time hope in.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: a lot of places were covered up due to expansion progress. the animals are very cute. the staffs are very friendly too. recommended when you have a lot of time to walk in the zoo.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing place. Visited here a few years ago. Still a moving and humbling experience. Well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We came here at night and did not regret doing so. We were lucky to witness the show at night where the lights dance along with music! It is a must try experience. Will definitely be back here.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved visiting Gardens by the Bay. You can walk around Supertree Grove and the grounds for free - there's lots of wildlife nearby including otters and turtles! I would definitely recommend buying tickets for the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest. It's a great place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city and is a very cool temperature inside compared to Singapore's hot air! Also lots of great stuff on the environment and a very effective video on climate change. Fabulous way to spend a couple of hours. Would also recommend visiting at night to see the free light show in Supertree Grove which is equally as amazing!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: a Park that offers a variety of artificial natural beauty
REVIEW_BODY: Flower dome, super tree, Cloud forest. Beauty and modern technology offered therein. The blend of nature and the technology it offers is so dazzling
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Better to visit late afternoon or early evening. The lighting decoration at night is fantastic. Bettet to avoid visiting holidays and peak period because of crowd.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The river is beautiful when lit up and night with views of the Merlion statue. Nice place to relax and get a bite to eat.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good Place to Hang Out and Having Meals
REVIEW_BODY: This area is located at clarke quay, and cover quite big area. Mostly if i came here i like to having dinner arround this area. This area have so many restaurants, pub, cafe and sometime we see the attraction from the Turkish Ice Cream Seller who make a joke to the buyer. Here is very nice spot to relax and have a sit and chit chat.
ADDRESS: 1 Bonham Street Uob Building, Singapore 049782, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The Best Zoo in The World
REVIEW_BODY:
Ok, I know the title sounds too much, but trust me, this is the best zoo I ever visited, not only in South East Asia, but in the world._x000D_
_x000D_
The zoo is really big, and there are lots of different sections for the animals to roam around, and not to worry, the enclosure is really big, and they also think about the condition of the animals' natural habitat inside the enclosure to make sure they are comfortable._x000D_
_x000D_
The information being provided regarding the animals are really cute and interactive, and there are lots of good spot to take a nice picture :)_x000D_
_x000D_
The facilities inside the zoo also really good, the toilets are clean, there are some vending machines for beverages and snacks, restaurants, and also merchandise shops._x000D_
_x000D_
You really have to go here, when you are in Singapore
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a beautiful experience. The large crowds were a bit hard to take, but the gardens and light spectacular was amazing!! Well worth a visit. The cloud dome and super trees are well worth the price, however we were a little disappointed with the flower dome - even though beautiful, it didnâ€™t compare to the others.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: We had a good time - worth a visit
REVIEW_BODY: lots to look at & we had a good time, it was a good walk around the zoo for a couple of good hours, there we're a lot of interactive displays & lots of information
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We headed off to the Supertree Grove at about 2pm - we wanted to do the treetop walk (which closed when there was bad weather)._x000D_
_x000D_
Going to look and photograph the Supertrees is free, there is also a free light show at (I believe) 7:45 & 8:45 (but check as the times may change seasonally) which was great._x000D_
_x000D_
There are also two paid activities there:_x000D_
â€¢ the Supertree walk (not available in bad weather) - 8$S_x000D_
â€¢ the Treetop bar and dinning - 12$S for access and a soft drink / juice, 20$S for access and an alcoholic beverage (food is additional and MAY require a booking)_x000D_
_x000D_
I personally liked the Treetop bar the best out of these two activities, but they were fairly inexpensive, so I had no problem doing both._x000D_
_x000D_
A warning I will give: the restaurant at the top is an IndoChina restaurant - we did have some food there and it was quite good. But there is a trap here. There is a minimum spend of 80$S PER PERSON. For dinner. We were there late afternoon and had a platter which was cost effective and good. If you do this activity I would consider lunch or a late afternoon meal, NOT dinner._x000D_
_x000D_
All in all, I would say a visit is a "must do", the paid activities are up to the individual but we enjoyed them.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Situated opposite the Fullerton hotel, it was a short walk to visit this site. At night the Merlion was illuminated as part of the ilight show which was on when we visited. It's worth going to see.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a wonderful place, when I had just arrived home, I already miss the atmosphere at this place! later when I went to singapore again, I am sure I will visit this place again. then do not forget to clear your memory card to be able to photograph beautiful places which this xixixi
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A diverse, fun and cheap experience! Plenty to see, lots to eat and all easily accessible! Great for familyâ€™s
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fun part of town with great restaurants, shopping, and sites. The Buddha Tooth Relic Temple is a highlight of the area. Singapore is known for its tailors and there are several in this area.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best eco experiences
REVIEW_BODY: This is an outstanding attraction within the Gardens by the Bay, reproducing 2000m of altitude variation in one huge conservatory /glasshouse. Sobering facts on the damage we're doing to the planet, but educational and throughly enjoyable at the same time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Make two visits, one by day, one at night.
REVIEW_BODY:
A key image of modern Singapore, well illustrated in guidebooks, for me this is a "must see". The gardens are huge, well laid out and just right for strolling by day admiring the plants, the Chinese and Indian Gardens and the Futuristic "Giant Trees"._x000D_
_x000D_
At night paths are well lit and give the feeling that you have walked onto the film set of some Sci-Fi film set in 25th Century. Importantly though even late at night one feels completely safe._x000D_
_x000D_
We chose simply to stroll so the gardens rate as one of the best "free" attractions we have visited.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
was a nice day out at the zoo. very family friendly place to go just for an entire day of chilling around. alot of animals to see and it was very enjoyable._x000D_
_x000D_
do bring a water bottle as it can get really hot, and there are places to refill along the way. do also check out the feeding/show timings before you go so you won't miss anything.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must not missed walk when in Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY: One of my favourite places, for personal retreat or to bring friends visiting Singapore. It gets better everytime I visit. Not to be missed is the orchid enclosure and herbal garden. So many places to have beautiful photos, dont miss the iconic gazebo where families, couples must have in their photo albums. Check out for dates where orchestra performs, a lovely time to have a picnic before doing a cool walk in the evening.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gifts of nature is here with all the plants and different kinds of herbs. The oldest tree of this country was here and the history and even the uses of all the plants and the healing capabilities. I love the nature and I love green.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Looking for branded products from all over the world? Come to Orchard road. A true shoppers dream including places to relax over an inexpensive or excellent gourmet meal.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We started the 11km walk in the blazing sun and ended it completely soaked through after a huge storm hit while we were high above the forest on the tree walk. It is a beautiful place very easily accessible on public transport. We saw lots of monkeys and monitor lizards, plus lots of insects and birds. The walk is easy but long, but there are toilets and water available at a lodge just under half way round. A really nice day and worth the effort.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Just don't visit during the day!
REVIEW_BODY: Odd, Tacky, novelty additions throughout, wouldn't visit again and still not sure what to make of it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We took a train out to the gardens from the city, wandering through the gardens down to the exit at the other end, and then up to and along Orchard Road. The gardens are beautifully kept, and have several ponds of varying sizes, attracting numerous birds (and also containing turtles). Well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Watch out for the chilli crab!
REVIEW_BODY:
Clarke Quay is great for a night out -live music ,bars and restaurants everywhere._x000D_
Prices for booze is expensive though even in happy hour._x000D_
One major rookie error was the night I ordered chilli crab.I have never ordered crab before and the waitress asked what size crab I would like (well I said medium) big mistake it was huge!!._x000D_
I assumed the cost of the crab would be similar to all the other items on the menu.(another rookie mistake).The cost of the crab exceeded Â£70.0-I nearly fell through the floor.(my wife is still giggling at my reaction)_x000D_
Really enjoyed it though -too much to eat all of it.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: you can spend as long as you need here for free! but well worth going into both the indoor enclosed displays as well, The worlds highest indoor waterfall is really quiet something
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A lovely way to spend half a day where you can marvel at the time and effort that has been put into these exhibitions. The Supertrees also put on a fantastic light show twice a night - never a dull moment!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There was a new Dragons attraction on this trip - it replaced the previous event/attraction. *please have certified Halal food throughout the Zoo, Thank You.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A cool oasis of the flowering kind.
REVIEW_BODY:
The Gardens present a great cool venue, almost in the heart of Singapore, to show off some beautiful flora. It has 2 sections and food eateries on site._x000D_
_x000D_
It was cherry blossom time when we visited taking some overseas relatives there. Seniors citizens n PR's are given special ticket prices and more if you're a NTUC member._x000D_
_x000D_
Nearly everyone there had a camera or smart phone and was happily snapping away at the beautiful floral presentations._x000D_
_x000D_
Just don't forget a jacket as it gets pretty chilly inside the domes.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Obviously, if you are in the area and want to see the Singapore skyline, what better place is there to witness the beauty? That said, it can get quite crowded and there were a lot of folks that decided to set up camp at the railing and were actually sitting down in large numbers making it difficult for others to enjoy the view. Once you do find a spot, you will enjoy some of the most spectacular skylines in the world.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore Botanic Gardens are a gem. One of only two public gardens to receive the coveted UNESCO designation. There are a number of different environments to explore and there are often events happening on the pond-set stage. I've visited the gardens each time I'm in Singapore. Aside from the National Orchid Garden area ($5) the gardens are free. The Orchid garden is absolutely worth the money, by the way. Singapore can be wickedly hot, so visiting in the morning is your best bet. Accessible by both subway and bus.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Time to visit this place is Sunday late afternoon or early evening._x000D_
But be prepared for quite an experience. Either take a cab to the mustafa center or take MRT to Little India stop._x000D_
Warning: If you are claustrophobic, stay away. Lol. Visit during the weekday and stop by the Little India arcade.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We would give this a five were we able to have an adults -only experience. The children on our tram screamed at the animals and too many adults on the tram used flash and were not supposed to because the flash disturbs the animals and can provoke epilepsy in those susceptible. Had people controlled their kids' screaming, and had the tram operator not have to repeatedly ask the offenders not to use flash, I would rate the venue a five. We enjoyed seeing all the animals feeding. We saw more active animals in this venue than in zoos in daytime when they would be sleeping. The tapir was amazing and so close to the tram we thought we could pet him! The white lions were absolutely majestic glowing in the dark in the light._x000D_
The hippo, water buffalo, hyenas, and the other animals were beautiful. The recording of the female narrator was excellent._x000D_
A few of her "rights" and "lefts" were incorrect as far as which animal was where, but we saw them clearly anyway._x000D_
We arrived at 7:30 and chose to take the 8:15 tram. I think the next time we would eat a bit and then take the 9:15 tram as that one seemed less crowded. The food and beverages are a bit more expensive but that is to be expected. The toilets are immaculate as is typical of Singapore. The sink bowls are in the shape of large white flowers. All the staff at this venue are friendly and kind and helpful. I noticed a sign at the venue listing private four hours tours with private tram, a dinner, and an elephant experience for 200.00. That would be great treat for a special occasion.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great trip out of the city - all super easy on the MRT
REVIEW_BODY: We wanted to see more than the centre and this trip did it for us on our short visit to Singapore. That is not to downplay the gardens themselves - very pleasant. Awe-inspiring bonsai - the oldest one we saw was 1837!! Enjoyed the views from the pagoda too - nice cooling breeze up there.
ADDRESS: 1 Chinese Garden Road Chinese Garden, Singapore 619795, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic day out. Beautiful gardens, very scenic - great for photos. Well worth a day trip and take plenty of photos! IndoChine restaurant in middle flower quite expensive but includes drink in price
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Cloud dome is a wonderful forest environment in a huge dome structure._x000D_
_x000D_
The temperature is cool, great after Singapore heat._x000D_
_x000D_
As you enter make your way through to the lifts and go the level 7. Then follow the various ramps and paths, escalators back to the bottom._x000D_
_x000D_
Lots of photo opportunities but the photos donâ€™t do it justice._x000D_
_x000D_
We paid half price for tickets. Search internet, we used Vidi which was linked to Airasia.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This has got to be one of the best views in Singapore. Even if you donâ€™t ride it, the Flyer is still part of the Singapore skyline. The kids will love it!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Love this place, especially at night
REVIEW_BODY: Just get lost in these gardens! I usually jog there at night. Closes late. Many restaurants within the park.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful place for one day entertainment
REVIEW_BODY: Amazing places to see onsite. Amazing flowers, water falls inside. Just get ready with a stroller for child & energy to roam around. Also, itâ€™s very safe & secured place .
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited this temple last March when walking around China Town. There was a wedding there and lot of people came to pray. This is India's Temple - quite large. You should not wear short or mini skirt, no photos are taken inside...
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This hotel is a must see during your trip to Singapore. Make sure you visit on a clear day. First I would recommend you take the river cruise from Clarkes Quay and you will see the Hotel, with its ship on top, spanning the 3 large towers from many different viewpoints. After your cruise go to the hotel. Go up in the lift to the viewing platform and bar (you will be on the ship) cost is 20 Singapores Dollers. Great place for photos of other city attractions including the theatres, the Grand Prix circuit, gardens below and many more. Finish your visit at the top with a drink in the bar and marvel at the huge swimming pool. Take a look around on the ground floor and see the large number of people checking in or out of the hotel then visit the large shopping mall with its designer outlets. If possible visit the hotel again after dark, go to the top and watch the light show in the park below (you will need to check the times). Arrive early to get the best position.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A very beautiful garden superbly maintained with a calm and serene environment_x000D_
Amazing trees and plants all clearly titled with lovely curated garden paths amidst lakes n water falls in the frindge of a bustling city._x000D_
Kudos to the Singapore government for maintaining this lovely and charming UNESCo site, a true tribute to the garden city.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really really good place .Proves that human beings can create anything as close to nature - Rain forest , Flower dome , Light and sound etc.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Too many shopping location in this street. Perfect place for spend money in branded stores, mall. I can meet many travellers from around the world in there.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Been To Singapore Many Time- First Time At the Gardens
REVIEW_BODY: I have been to Singapore many times but this was my first visit to the Marina Sands Bay district. The gardens are fantastic and I highly recommended you put aside 3-4 hours to fully explore this wonderful asset in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic futuristic architecture and open public space. The light and sound show at night is simply awe-inspiring.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Flower dome and cloud dome is worth a visit
REVIEW_BODY: Not impressively large but it was definitely spectacular to witness horticulture done in a controlled environment. Came to visit with friends and we enjoyed the sights
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We arrived close to closing so we had to rush around a bit, and I am sure we missed out on some of the atmosphere of the place. But it is absolutely beautiful, just allow yourself more than 30 minutes!
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth a visit. This is very well done. Easily accessible for all, lots to see and a wonderful thought invoking display about green house effects on the planet
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are "flower" person, this is your paradise. You can smell, feel, enjoy with lots of colors, make tons of pictures and simply enjoy the place. You can easy spend 2-3 hours and still have a filling that it was not enough.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Our time at the Singapore zoo will never be forgotten. We were there with our two kids - 2 year old and 4 year old and their grandparents. The 6 of us opted for the buggy tour and with our fantastic tour guide Crystal we were able to experience the zoo in a wonderful way. We fed the elephants and had interactions with the giant tortoises among other things. We will definitely visit over and over again. A Must do if you are in Singapore!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place to hide from burning sun
REVIEW_BODY: We were in botanical garden during orchid exhibition. Not so crowded, a lot of different kind orchids. Thatâ€™s was awesome!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth a look. I went early in the morning when it was clear and there was very few people around. Great way to get an overview of Singapore
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The boulevard is a good place for a stroll and a place to be amazed at the architecture of the City Of Singapore.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As a person who's own parent was a POW (in Stanley Prison Hong Kong) during the second world war, the museum and the audio tour was an extremely moving experience. It brought to light the true horrors and hardships of war, and hopefully the lessons learnt and never to be experienced again. A must for history lovers and gives a great insight to the way of life in Singapore during those troubled times.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful way too cool off after touring the outdoor gardens. The waterfall is beautiful. Lots of greenery. The cloud forest is a walkway that wraps around the waterfall. It can be accessed via elevator or escalators. It was a very nice walk.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Children's garden at gardens by the bay
REVIEW_BODY: Best time to visit would be during the late afternoon when it's less scorching. We were there with our 5 year old and she really enjoyed playing at the water play area. There's also the dry playground where children can climb around the structures. And the best part, entry to the children's garden is free.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: In Singapore's humid weather, this place is just like a heaven. The moment you enter inside, the chill out weather welcomes you. It is pretty cool inside so take a jacket. The flowers, the trees that you will see will be very unique. There is a nice walk way inside but no cafes which is a miss actually. But overall, a must see, definitely recommend.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Inside this building, you'll see varieties of pub, cafes and restaurants. Nice place to hangout with friends after work. Cozy place. Many choices of dishes. Worth to spend time there
ADDRESS: 30 Victoria Street Chijmes, Singapore 187996, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Do It at Sunset and Enjoy
REVIEW_BODY: As the afternoon cools down and walking becomes attractive get out to look at these fantastic gardens. Don't just do the Super Trees or The Dome of the Cloud, but also walk the gardens and enjoy the whole area. As night falls and the lights come on, enjoy a completely different perspective and see the sights and sounds that echo through the gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very beautiful park, with free entrance (although we ended up spending a lot in the gift shop instead). Nice selection of cafes and restaurants and views are stunning. Rain forest was beautiful and serene. Can strongly recommend a visit to the orchid garden inside the park, which is well worth its 5 dollar entrance fee.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: For those times when the hectic pace of Singapore gets just too much. a day wandering slowly an peacefully around the botanic gardens is just what is needed. Beautifully maintained and a living encyclopedia of flora (and some fauna). Chill, stroll, relax, enjoy and maybe even learn a little if you so desire.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not the highest in the world any more
REVIEW_BODY: They tell you it is the world's tallest but there are several taller ones now. Despite this, it is a good attraction provided you avoid the exhibits before the wheel and are not there when the tour groups arrive - usually morning and evening. Finding the ticket office is confusing and poorly signposted so offices at the river end are closed with arrows pointing nowhere in particular.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Great experience, there was a free entry to the venue and it is conveniently located steps from the Haw Par Villa train station. It has a lot of statues and some are very interesting._x000D_
_x000D_
There is a section called gates of hell - it shows the various ways people were punished- it is very graphic intensive and definitely not recommended for the kids. But after seeing this section, now I know where Mortal Kombat got their fatalities ideas from ;-)
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Filled with tremendous varieties of orchid. A very good place if you like a leisurely stroll through nature.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visit around 6:30 PM to get the last bit of daylight and stay for the light show at 7:45. It gets very crowded, but it's beautiful.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The light show is a must for anybody visiting singapore. Located outside the shopping mall on the riverfront, the first show is at 8pm. Arrive a little early as seats fill up fast. The show lasts 15 mins and is good for all ages and is free. Don't leave singapore without seeing this show.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What an amazing experience it was to take the Cable Car from Faber Park to Sentosa Island. The smooth ride over the landscape of rainforest and water was exciting and breathtaking! High up in the air gave an excellent overview of the Fun Island with all the facilities in view. You could literally see for miles!
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I liked the long indoor waterfall. It really creates an illusion of clouds or fog. I really liked the foggy waterfall within that greenery. It's a must visit place. It is in the garden by the bay. You can walk around at garden by the bay for free but to enter cloud forest and flower done, you have to purchase ticket. It is one ticket and you visit both cloud forest and the flower dome.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Love this spacious and green environment. If weather and time permit, you may take a slow leisure walk from one end of the park to the other end. You may enjoy beautiful flowers and trees and even spot a few squirrels and swans along the way :)
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You get an amazing view of SG from Skypark, specifically Marina Bay Area Access pool, restaurant and have fun To go to observation deck, pay SGD 28 but it's worth
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Just do it, you wonâ€™t be dissatisfied!
REVIEW_BODY: Probably one of my favourite places in all of Singapore! We have been every year since opening and i am always amazed!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My mother enjoyed it as the garden is suitable for old people in wheelchair in addition to great variety of unique species of flower. Tks.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: After the end of the war, the Battlebox remained hidden, unknown, for 40+ years. The only clue there was anything inside the mound was a door with a padlock on it - as the guide said "looking a bit like a garden shed". Finally, a journalist, having heard rumours of something under the hill, broke the padlock and found this historic series of chambers which housed the British WWII Underground Command Centre. It was inside one of these underground rooms that the historic decision was made to surrender Singapore to the Japanese, in the hope of saving the lives of many soldiers and civilians. Entrance is by guided tour only, and the entrance money helps support the maintenance of the site. Our guide, Jerome, certainly knew his facts, and communicated it to us all in a very clear manner. Well done, and thank you, Jerome!
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the Gardens by the Bay in May 2016. We only had a few hours in transit in Singapore, so decided to leave the airport and head to the Gardens. It was a wonderful couple of hours and one we would highly recommend. The Flower Dome was a spectacular display of colour and plant variety. We loved the gardens from around the world, that included plants from Australia, South Africa, North America and Europe. The colourful displays of tulips were delightful (one of my favourite flowers). The Cloud Dome was lush and green with fantastic views of the plants from the raised walkways. The views of Singapore from the "clouds" was also great as was the ecological message. Both domes had many wooden sculptures to admire, and being climate controlled was quite cool inside, so an extra layer of clothing might be needed for some people. The $28 fee is very reasonable for such an amazing attraction, even from an engineering point of view. The outside areas of the garden are free to explore. We didn't have much time to explore outside. I suggest two visits to the Gardens would be ideal - one in the day (for those keen on photography) and one in the evening for the lights. Trust Singaporeans to come up with another fantastic tourist attraction.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was a great trip going back to GBTB with my family and nice to see that it still looks beautiful.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was a great experience to see how the people lived. It only costs $15 singapore to go in, you will need about 3+ hours to take your time in there. It is about 100 metres to the MRT Station China Town, or buses,taxis. in the cost when you come out you can get free dumplings and a drink at some outlets when you show your ticket.It,s Good Value.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I heard a lot about Orchard Road as prime commercial location of Singapore. This place is also a hub of shopping mall, flagship brandshops like Rolex, Robinson etc. Arriving at Singapore we had the information that following Merry Christmas Orchard Road decorated magnificently. So we planned to visit there in the evening to have a glimpse of amazing decoration on the eve of Merry Christmas. Really the road was nicely decorated with effigies of animals and carts with multi colour lights. We had also a chance to observe activities performed by several street performers. Many best hotels are situated here. This road is very vibrant followed by huge gathering of tourists. This is worthy to stay hotels beside Orchard Road for those who are eager to be engaged in huge shopping from flagship stores.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Awsome area to visit and stay
REVIEW_BODY: We stayed in orchard rd and loved how convenient it was ,shopping everywhere food halls were abundant ,places to go things to see we wont stay in another area in singapore just the best and most convenient for us
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The place to go for a romantic evening, champagne and amazing views of Singapore. Make a reservation for an outside table. You will not be disappointed.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When we arrived joined a giant line, was unable to see the fireshow along the side as there was way to many people in front. Once through the first gate was told the show was already full and to join the "tram safari" line, this line was also extremely long. After a long wait we finally got on board. The safari its self was great very dark so a little hard to see some animals. Good variety of animals. Went for about half an hour. Had an audio about the animals as we went around. After the tram ride we got directed down the path, but realised this was the exit when we asked the lady at the gate about how to get in to do the walking tracks or show she said we would have to go all the way back through. This was very messy organisation. The restaurants here were also very overpriced although good variety.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a beautiful place to enjoy some quiet time and relax in the wonderful gardens. The gardens itself is very large and you should cater for at least half a day to submerse yourself fully in all it has to offer. In the evening, enjoy the light display of the giant trees.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you want to shop this is the place to come, there is a number of malls up and down the road and depending on your time you could spend a number of hours here. Plenty of shops for everyone, from the high end designer to the local.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice view but the buildingâ€™s cooler seen from below
REVIEW_BODY:
Karl Pilkington nails this in â€œAn Idiot Abroadâ€: itâ€™s better to live in the caves *opposite* to Petra faÃ§ade than in the Petra caves themselves. The view is very nice indeed â€“ the city skyline, the river and the seemingly endless weird swarm of ships â€“ but after all itâ€™s just a high place and the building itself is cooler and much more impressive when you look at it from below._x000D_
A sort of must-visit place, I suppose, nevertheless. Would probably be more impressed if weâ€™d been there around sunset.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place should be on everyone's to do list for Singapore. All ages will love it, my son (18) and not a gardener thought it was great. The domes are awesome in content and engineering. Go in the afternoon and stay for the light show after dark, well worth it. A must visit!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The only bad service in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Went to use this very expensive facility but as no clear instructions we arrived at the rooftop entrance to pay our admittance fees. Brusquely and embarrasingly told "you can't come in, you have to pay on the ground floor" OK I said but could my tired wife wait here while I go and get the tickets. "No!" was the answer. I said she only needed a chair to sit on till I get the tickets as she is feeling tired in the heat. "Not my problem" was the reply in front of other visitors. Needless to say we left the building. If the management feel this needs further action and want to contact me as to the exact time and person involved please feel free.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I think the park is much more interesting when viewed from the ground, but you can pay over $20. for an elevator ride up to the top to take photos of Singapore. Hopefully_x000D_
you will choose a clear day. There is a viewing platform (no seating or shade) on one level and an expensive outdoor bar & cafe up one level. There is an infinity pool that is reserved for guests but you can catch a glimpse of it from the cafe._x000D_
If you want to skip the viewing deck, you can ride up to the bar level for free, but the views aren't quite as expansive and you pay $24. Singapore dollars for one cocktail. Definitely won't do it again, but if it's on your bucket list...
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Getting to the start was easy, I got the MRT to the harbour front. Leave the station through exit D, turn right and marang road is right there. I'm pretty fit but found the run tough. Most of the run is actually steps which are slippy in running shoes and the combination of exertion and heat are pretty harsh. Although I enjoyed the run I do have a gripe, the signage is ambiguous and very easy to miss if you are travelling at speed. You also won't see a sign saying southern ridges; you have to know the order of the landmarks and the last bit is just signed 'pond. I also got pretty annoyed around hort park. My advice to runners is; if you are in town do it, treat it as an interval session, take plenty of water and prepare for the labyrinth of paths. Oh and finally the route I did - harbourfront to ridge park is 6km not 6 miles.
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I warmly recommend Singapore Botanic Gardens to visit while in Singapore. Really calm and relaxing place to sit and enjoy the beautifle nature. Also good for children and easy to get. Bus stop right next to the entrance.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Interesting area of Singapore, with its own story
REVIEW_BODY:
One of the very distinct & historically important ethnic neighbourhoods of Singapore, Kampong Glam is the Arab quarter also, the Malay Muslim quarter._x000D_
_x000D_
Prior to the British colonisation, Kampong was the home of the Malay aristocracy ( still part of Malaysia at this time)._x000D_
_x000D_
In fact it was the treaty signed between the Sultan of Johor and the British East India Company that saw Singapore become a Free Port._x000D_
_x000D_
Under Raffles, the settlement was set-up into distinctly ethnic enclaves which is why Chinatown, Little India & Kampong Glam developed with such distinctly different styles, which mostly remain today. And all tourists can be thankful for that._x000D_
_x000D_
Arab Street, Bussirah Street & Haji Lane are the most visited and most distinctive.
ADDRESS: Kampong Glam, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Cool flowery escape from the tropical heat
REVIEW_BODY: We came to see the cherry blossoms in the Flower Dome and weren't disappointed. It still amazes me how they manage to get all kinds of exotic temperate plants from ancient olive trees to delicate peach and cherry blossoms to survive and even thrive in this giant cooled conservatory insulated from the sweltering tropical heat in Singapore. It's a great way to escape the heat for a couple of hours, strolling in the cool comfort of the dome and enjoying the carefully manicured temperate gardens inside. Lots of photo opportunities. We have been to the Flower Dome a few times before to enjoy the seasonal flowers eg tulips, chrysanthemums, and pussywillow at Chinese New Year, etc. Definitely a must see for visitors to Singapore. Where else would you see temperate gardens in a tropical country?
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing birds in the natural environment
REVIEW_BODY: The Jurong Bird Park is a must if you like to see birds in their natural environment. Lovely settings.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Educational time, pleasant place to walk around
REVIEW_BODY: The building style is unique, and feels like I'm in another country. I'm not much of a museum person but this was pretty educational and I feel like I understand the Singapore culture better.
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The zoo is beautifully kept. The my do a great job with temporary display, maintaining the facility, keep the animal looking healthy and happy (except the old orangutan but it could just be my impression...). From my experience and recollection 7+ years ago, they really have kept it up magnificently!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Do not miss out on going!
REVIEW_BODY: I have been to the Cloud Forest too many times to number. I am a member of Gardens by the Bay so can basically go as many times as I want as part of my subscription. I would have to say wandering through the Cloud Forest is always refreshing and I am continually amazed at how it was built but more importantly how they can grow so many plants that survive together in harmony. I always take my visitors here and it is always interesting to see the different parts of the Cloud Forest that they enjoy the most. Sometimes it might be 6 months before we go through the Cloud Forest and usually there are things that have changed or been added so again a pure delight to see!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When i go to garden by the bay there is 2 indoor park..and flower dome was one of it.many collection of flower from all around the world especially from asia. We can learn and see with our eye all flower that was very very good. Please use jacket..
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We loved our visit to the Night Safari! We arrived at 8:15 and queued for the tram (cars that take you around), which didnâ€™t take too long even though it looked very busy. In the queue, the restaurants and cafes looked really good, but we never got a chance to go to them. We didnâ€™t leave the park until 11:45 and we were busy throughout! So if you fancy some food, I recommend getting there a little earlier and eat before you start._x000D_
_x000D_
Once on the tram safari, we listened to information about the animals and got to see a huge array of animals. They were all where you could see them and relatively well-lit but not enough for clear photos, so put your camera phones away and just enjoy the eerie but amazing feeling of being in the wild amongst these animals! Our favourite moment was seeing the wolves howling stood upon a rock! It was like a scene from The Jungle Book!_x000D_
_x000D_
After the tram part of the tour, youâ€™ll be able to take yourself along the walking route, which is split into 4 parts, but very simple to follow. This part was really nice as you could go at your own pace and read all the information labels that tell you about the animals and their habitats. As it got later, at times we felt alone in the jungle - a really memorable feeling. Staff were positioned mainly to guide you in the right directions, but whenever we spoke to any of them, they knew lots of details about their animals._x000D_
_x000D_
We left the park at midnight absolutely buzzing! We arrived in Singapore that morning, travelling from Thailand, so to still feel so awake says a lot about how exciting the Night Safari was. It is a must see!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went on the flyer, took about 30 minutes to go around, had plenty of photo opportunities of the CBD and marina bay. was definitely worth it! 10/10
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Marina bay and merlion park can be visited to spend few hours and capture pics by the day and the night . Dont miss to click pics at night because the area is well lit. You can also opt for river cruise, I didnt go for it due to lack of time.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Paid $20 to go up but that was redeemable towards price of a drink. Amazing views and beautiful surroundings. Service was excellent.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I loved te whole Gardens by the Bay area - the contemporary mixed with nature is refreshing. I especially loved the Cloud Forest Dome more than the Flower Dome; the green grass where you can sit down and picnic with friends and family. :)_x000D_
_x000D_
Super trees is also a sight to behold!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We used this facility as part of our accommodation at Marina Bay Sands. The park offers great spas, a park area and swimming pool. The views are great especially from the infinity pool. A selfie stick is a must to get that great photo in the pool with the city in the background. The only downside is the pool really needs to be heated as I found it quite cool.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Huge area...Flower dome was dazzling with rose. Just love it. Cloud forest was also mesmerizing. Must visit..dont miss
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you like orchids, or indeed any flowers, this is the place to visit. The variety of forms and colours on display is staggering. The garden is beautifully maintained, and the plants thoughtfully displayed to their best advantage.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the bay is unique place. This living place is still growing, not in size but all the plant based objects. The bio-domes form a highlight and without revealing, something you have to experience since this is specular, not in adrenalin but in amazement and tranquility. Must see for anyone visiting Singapore, repeated visits recommended for anyone living of frequently visiting Singapore. (did not visit in Jan 2017, but this was the earliest option, visited a few years ago and plan to go there again to see how it is developing). The park is free, the bio-domes are not.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Under cover, so viewable in any weather, this is a wonderful display. From the fabulous waterfall which falls from the top of the done to the bottom you wander up a path to the summit, viewing an amazing selection of flowers, plants, shrubs and foliage. Terrific views from the top. There is a lift if needed.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Pretty, free, but in the end - just a bridge
REVIEW_BODY: Unless you're into construction, it's really just a fancy bridge. But it's free and you probably need to cross at some point anyway, so go for it.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are into all things Botanical then this place is the go. The two flower domes were simply amazing. Managed to spend 3 hours in each and still didn't have enough time as I had another tour to attend. If you are into photography and love beautiful flora then this is a must. Such a lot of work for such beautiful displays. Well Done Singapore!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Provides a Great History of Chinatown
REVIEW_BODY: The entry fee is S$15 per adult which includes an audio tour. The museum is set out on three floors and illustrates how individual Chinese lived in a shophouse as well as a wider history of Chinatown. Well worth a visit
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This temple is beautiful and the location is nearly china town and maxwell street. All of there for Buddhist. this is nice place and can praying for your faithful.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: If you love garden or flowers go for it
REVIEW_BODY: Dont go in the morning you will get dismayed as the towering tree looks plain also the burning heat will make you sit and stay in just one place rather than roaming around the garden. Do visit at night cause this is when the garden comes to life but very artificial. This is something I would not be really keen on visiting it just happened to be near Marina Bay Sanda that's why we had a quick stop. But seriously the heat will make you get out of there really quick.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When I am in Chinatown i like to pop in and visit this temple as it is always a breath of relaxation and wonder. Everytime I visit there is something different going one, always an abudance of colour, vibrancy and incense. Orchid garden on top floor a must.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The whole reason that I wanted to go to Singapore was to see this. I loved everything about it. Went early in the day to avoid the heat. Visited both domes, did the sky walk and watched light show. If you have kids bring bathers, as there is a water park on site. Loved every minute and will visit again when I am in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: NEVER MISS this Heaven on Earth
REVIEW_BODY: There two conservatories. One is the Flower Garden and the other is the cloud forest. If you got limited time go through the Flower garden quickly(1hr) and rush to the Cloud forest,( for me this is the best) where you need at least 2 hours. Both domes are air conditioned so you can visit at any time but make it before 8pm coz they close at 9 pm. Go there around 3pm in the evening. You have to see these domes in sunlight as well as in Artificial light(night). it is two different experiences. One might say it is expensive but i would say it is worth the amount you have paid. They have put so much effort to make these the best among all attractions in Singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Just mesmerizing,A must see for everyone Free entry in the park though you have to buy a ticket to go on the bridge and the queue was quite long.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: immaculate gardens and surrounds, very pleasant and relaxing place to visit. lots of things to see and photo
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is another very well done site. One â€œpodâ€ features gardens and settings from around the world...such as Africa and Australia. Unusual sculptures are set into the plantings also. The secondâ€podâ€ includes a 6-story waterfall and walls of plants. There is also an educational section on climate and ecology which is very well done. We were a bit hurried though as we were trying to make the 7:45 light show of the Super Trees in the outer areas. Late afternoon/ early evening is a great time to visit....as the park and city change from day to night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Well connected with MRT. Entry Ticket is $28 to go into the 2 domes, which are the most interesting things to see in the gardens. The Sky walk for $8 additional, very short but a nice view of the city. The rest of the gardens are nice just to walk around and enjoy the greenery. I recommend to go there in evening before sunset and then stay there till night so can enjoy greenery in daylight and then beautiful light and music show in dark ._x000D_
There are entries so need not to worry about food .
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I had a great few hours at river safari, I went on Friday afternoon so wasnâ€™t too busy. I loved the animal show, it was great being able to feed the animals and have photos taken with them. The Panda was very cute, since it wasnâ€™t busy when I went I didnâ€™t have to wait. The amazon river quest was definitely worth the money, a relaxing boat ride and brilliant views of the animals. However, the other cruise (the free one) I didnâ€™t get to see any animals so that was a waste of time. I definitely recommend river safari, thereâ€™s not enough to see there for a full day so maybe do river safari and then night safari.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely visit with facets of new experiences!
REVIEW_BODY:
Since signing up on the annual membership, we have been visiting the zoo weekly. So far, we had visited 8 times for the last 6 weeks._x000D_
Each visit lasted about 2-3 hours, usually in the early morning or occasionally in the afternoon._x000D_
We enjoyed the feeding sessions with the animals - favourites were with the elephants, giraffes - experienced feeding them by hand. We paid a token amount of 5 dollars per baskets of fruits - usually queued up about 5-10 minutes before actual stated time._x000D_
Each visit was punctuated with new experiences._x000D_
We are looking forward to the next visit.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: beautiful view , walking through the Bay walk and roaming here , making all the views beautiful. Better to go at sun set time to enjoy both day light and the night light view. make you fell like peace and overall very good place to visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My wife and I spent the entire day doing the gardens. We started around 10 and finished with the light show at 9. We were beat but had a lovely day with a stop at McDonalds for a burger( excuse us we had just been in Japan for two weeks and had all the raw fish we could take). The three different parts are all quite unique and you could spend much more time in each than we did. We loved each but probably the flower dome the best.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The beautiful bay in a beautiful city
REVIEW_BODY:
Marina Bay is the big and semi-artificial bay that has become the scenic heart of the City._x000D_
From the Esplanade with its durian shaped theatres, to the river, to the Merlion, to the spectacular cluster of skyscrapers of the CBD/ Downtown area to the Marina Bay Sands hotel, a walk around the bay is a perfect way to spend a day taking in the beauty and buzz of the city (and taking hundreds of photos of the very photogenic views, palms, architecture). In the evening there is a nice light and sounds show with water jets just in front of the Marina Bay Sands.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautifull gardens, a lot of plants and flowers, exceptional
REVIEW_BODY: When visiting Singapore, you must visit the gardens by the bay. A beautiful park with 2 parks indoor one with a waterfall. Very beautifull and nice to see.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: this garden by the bay near in the city best time afternoon ! you can enjoy the day time views as well night time views.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Although heights arenâ€™t my thing the views from the flyer are just amazing. Clean and efficient and only a short walk away from the Gardens.
