ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well I'm wrong......I'm not into gardens but this is different, start at Marina Bay then walk to the Gardens. It's just great to chill and walk around. When your kids are done then take them to the Water Park.... And it's free. Our son just enjoyed running around with the other kids, a good mix of everyone from all over the world. Great to chat with other parents. Just a good fun time out
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fascinating structure, intriguing views of nature
REVIEW_BODY: To be honest, the experience is far better than this description- it's a concrete and steel structure more or less covered in greenery and flowers. But once inside, the view and the variety of flora are captivating.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went for a walk last night down Orchard Road, there where 4 of us all adults but the christmas lights where great, just to see the reaction of the children made us all feel like kids again. If yor are in Singapore for the Christmas season you must not miss this.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It has shown great scenary. My son and parents have been very satisfied. Gave us the feeling in some fairy land:-)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These gardens were one of the main reasons why i wanted to visit Singapore and they did not disappoint. We were lucky enough to visit on a sunny day, which helped in capturing the beauty in some photos. The colours of the trees and size cannot be captured in photos so this is a must see for those in Singapore. Visiting the gardens is free entry and i recommend walking around the entire place to ensure you don't miss anything. To see the gardens in free entry, however to see inside the two conservatories (Cloud Forest and Flower Dome) and entry for the skywalk incurs a fee, but these are definitely recommended to visit. May be worthwhile to check online for closure dates for the conservatories, because we arrived one day and the cloud forest was closed for maintenance. The Gardens were wonderful to see in person, and a major attraction for those visiting Singapore, truly a garden city.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the best place need to visit in Singapore,It is the landmark of Singapore.This place is crowded still amazing.Marina bay sands hotel view from marina is awesome.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wow! This is the most fun my family and I have had at a museum. We spent a whole afternoon creating and being totally mesmerized by their exhibits. Highly highly recommended to visit. I will definitely be back if I get the chance again. Be prepared to have your mind blown by art and science.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
After spending several hours here I noticed this is one of the cleanest zoo's of not the cleanest zoo in the world._x000D_
_x000D_
All the staff were very friendly and happy to help._x000D_
_x000D_
There is a great selection of animals to see and they all look to be well cared for.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The only reason we went to Little India was to see the Hindu Temples along Serangon Road and the colourful House of Tan Teng Niah.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great vantage point for taking pictures of Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Most people don't know it has been there longer than the hotel. It achieved its goal of a tourist icon.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Marina Bay Towers are simply AWESOME!!! The Wife and I wasted no time in going there and getting to the top, to the Sky Park, the views are fantastic, Great park for couples or families, restaurants, pools and a park. From the top we picked out just about every thing and every place we want to see. tickets are not expensive, $23.00 SGD, well worth it.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
My children loves this place especially the eldest, she took lots and lits of picture with camera._x000D_
I've been here before so i know exactly to come afternoon when sun going down, waiting for sunset, good time to take picture from any angle possible, also light show at the night is gorgeus.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Arrived here at 8.30am and there was no queue. We had a gondola all to ourselves (just 2 of us), which was awesome. We were only in Singapore for a day as we were on a cruise ship, so this was our first stop, just to get a general overview of the sights of Singapore, It was a slow ride, and the gondola was huge. There was a seat in the middle, but we spent the whole time walking around. We took some amazing photographs from in there, and perfectly clear even though they were taken through the glass windows. The views were amazing, and I'm so glad we did this!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An oasis of greenery in Singapores busy metropolis. Worth a visit on a hot day to escape the heat of the sun!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It's located near Marina Bay Sands Hotel/ Casino. No fee entrance for some part. You need to pay if you you want to enter some garden or get to high part. There's music when you go to upstairs. If in high season it will be crowded._x000D_
_x000D_
Better come here around noon. There will be a lot of beautiful light and panorama looks better at night._x000D_
_x000D_
There's resto or bar that offer drink.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: THE INTAN is a must visit!
REVIEW_BODY:
If you want to know more about the Peranakan Culture ... then this is where to go! Truly a wonderful experience with loads of information. Its a treasure trove of amazing items to see, plus of course all the wonderful history that comes alive._x000D_
_x000D_
We can all attend a museum, but a visit to THE INTAN is a very different experience. A great adventure for all the family!_x000D_
_x000D_
.... and yes, should be on all the 'must see and do in Singapore' lists for all visitors.
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must for any orchid fan
REVIEW_BODY: Note that this is a paid exhibit within the garden ~usd$5/person admission was reasonable imo. Celebrity named species section was amusing. Many other unique and beautiful species.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the famous shopping destination for tourists. We as a local do come here often as it is where we can find anything that we requires to buy. From branded items to daily stuffs
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: If like lights and night life : must go place
REVIEW_BODY:
If you are in Singapore and like nigh life, then you should not miss this place. Very colorful and lively during night time. There is light show happen every day around 7.30 & 9.30 evening time, which is must to watch out for._x000D_
You can take a boat ride as well, which covers Marina Bay and Clark Quey.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fabulous place and a must if you visit Singapore ,beautiful flowers and gardens and the satay from the food stalls were the best I have ever had.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An absolute "must do" if you're visiting Singapore. Immaculate grounds. Unbelievable range and amount of animals! Highly recommend Breakfast with the Orangutans. Just beautiful. It's just such an amazing Zoo. Would go again for sure!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really amazing and beautiful place. Lot of varieties of birds and animals. The shows are really good. Could easily spent half a day here.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great variety of flowers and very well maintained. Spent around an hour here and it was a great experience.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited in November very nice view of Singapore enjoyed every bit of it. It was great experience with my family.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is an enormous greenhouse dome with beautiful orchids and thousands of plant species, rare and exotic trees from many continents, and succulent plants as well. It and the Cloud forest dome are well worth seeing at Gardens by the Bay.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic Show and Good Choice of Food
REVIEW_BODY:
Went along to the light show this evening with kids aged 10, 12 and 15. Prior to the show we ate at Hawker food place just along from the gardens. Great choice of food at excellent prices. Mango Mountain..was to die for.._x000D_
_x000D_
Light show only lasted 15 minutes but it's excellent and kept all entertained. It's a really good show and worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Some amazing views on both the lines of this Cable Car! One of the Santosa visits (maybe Acquarium day) should be done by this CC.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Famous with its luxury malls this place offers nothing but luxury shopping. If you wanna spend your time between Gucci, Prada shops thats the place , if not then it is waste of time visiting Orchard Road
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There are lots of shops where you can get souvenier items. Food stalls are also abundant. Towards on corner you can visit the Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My wife and I went to the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest on our 25th Wedding Anniversary - we saw the sakuras and took lots of photos - it was very memorable, spending 4 hours and thoroughly enjoying our trip
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Sky Park is in the 56th floor if the Marina Bay Hotel but visitors for not have access to the hotel bar and infinity pool. The views are amazing and not those uncomfortable at heights
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
if like me you and your family were posted with the armed forces to Singapore in the 60's you have got to remember this place? it was in those days called Tiger balm gardens and its a theme park designed to promote the ointment of its original name._x000D_
_x000D_
It unique in every way, the statues depict Chinese folk law and some are very grizzly. I had haunting memories of this place being only 6 yrs old when my parents took me, it was a regular day out, how times have changed._x000D_
_x000D_
Anyway its not really changed and is well worth a visit if you are in Singapore ( don't take your 6 yr old into the 10 courts of hell ) it is something you will not see anywhere else, its on the metro route and its peacefully quiet and away from the hustle and bustle and free to enter.
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Such beautiful and interesting plantings. The dome can be difficult to negotiate if you have a wheelchair or disability as ramps turn to steps.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is a unique attraction experience. Well worth the effort to get there. We got a 10% discount because we flew with Singapore Airlines which was a bonus. The tram ride does not cover the whole park but they light the enclosures and you can see the animals feeding. There are also walking tracks but it is harder to see the animals as their enclosures are not lit. We couldnâ€™t see the shows due to bad weather. The queues are amazing with the 7:15 and 8:15 slots the most popular. If you get there early go over the the zoo because people start queuing over and hour before the show._x000D_
_x000D_
They are very efficient at managing the queues and they move along at a consistent pace
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Think it must be great for connoisseurs of the art, but unfortunately for the rest of us plebians -- it's hard to appreciate the place. Revitalized from old Supreme Court, the grandeur and decorum of the place still holds true till today. For example, the kids area, at the Keppel Centre for Art Education tells you specifically that the children are not allowed to run, jump and to keep as quiet as possible! Great place for muzzled kids in strait-jackets!_x000D_
_x000D_
Nice to see the grand-dame fully restored, but certainly don't expect warm welcomes (especially from those greeting you at the door). The staff must have been told that all visitors must toe the line and they keep you in their cross-hairs -- all the time._x000D_
_x000D_
The architecture is certainly marvelous and distinctive. But unfortunately, there's a lot of dead-space all over the place. Pretty bewildering -- just ask for directions -- that's the best way._x000D_
_x000D_
Great for tourist -- but don't bring the kids until they turn 21. If you're wondering around the vicinity, drop by for a cool respite from the heat, and even cooler reception by their fellow staffers!_x000D_
_x000D_
I would bring visitors to the place just to appreciate it's rich historical past, but if anyone were to ask me for my personal opinion of the National Gallery of Singapore, I would tell them it's much like a vacuum cleaner -- it sucks!
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Although a good idea, if you can't book to go as soon as it opens you can't possibly see everything you'd like. It's much like a conveyor and seems to be set up primarily to maximize the amount of money they can get. It was a disappointment.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The experience was amazing. From tiny penguins, colorful Macau, parakeet to 'Kings of the Skies'. They were all so well bred and well taken care of._x000D_
The ambiance of the bird park was great and the largest man made waterfall in a Bird Park...they thought of a perfect place for the birds, while showing them off to the world. That is simply world-class.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
So besides being an amazing building/work of art itself, this museum contains a long term exhibition (Future world) and a variety of shorter term exhibitions on other floors. if you have kids, then future world is just awesome. It features an interactive light and sensory and craft experience. it's also huge. There's not 4 things to create, build, try, play, slide down etc... theres LOADS!!!! From whole sensory rooms with surround interactive light shows to pictures you colour then scan and upload to interactive walls. BUT IT GOES ONE STEP FURTHER... -- it can take your scan upload it to another machine and print a card template for you to make a 3D MODEL! It was super great. I made one there and printed the rest to take back to the hotel to do later. They won't survive the suitcase home but were fun to make._x000D_
While I was there, I saw a graffiti exhibition on the upper floors, though I think that part of the exhibition space changes regularly and tickets for those are sold separately._x000D_
Don't miss this.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Love to walk in this garden
REVIEW_BODY: I was just love to walk in this garden its just amazing feeling you cant describe in words, everyone must visit it
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you would only have one day in Singapore I would definitely recommend going to Gardens by the bay. The park itself is free but donâ€™t miss out on Flower Dome and Cloud Forest even though they have an entrance fee of around 20 USD (in total for both). A recommendation would be to arrive during the afternoon perhaps around 4 pm and walk around the park and do Flower Dome and Cloud Forest which will take you at least 3h. If it is hot outside you can go in the domes and cool off (you might need an extra sweater inside as it can be a bit cold after a while). Then in the evening you stick around and catch the free light show at Supertree Grove which starts at 7.45 and 8.45 pm. Be there a little earlier if you want to get a good viewing spot. As you end your evening in the Gardens you can walk to Marina Bay and catch the water and light show there.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Planned to spend an hour here. How wrong we were._x000D_
_x000D_
Excellent exhibits with so easy to go around seeing the various HUGE aquariums. Unbelievable to see some of the size of the tanks and the size of the fish. Really well presented._x000D_
_x000D_
Pandas were in a lovely exhibit and so close to see as was the huge polar bear._x000D_
Big boat ride ok, river ride very good, especially so close to the flamingos and a walk through the monkey cage incredible.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Really enjoyed our visit reciently....... watched the polar bear and elephants being fed ..... seem well looked after !! .....some of the enclosures are definitely small and the honey bear was pacing ..... but the gibbons and other varieties of primates were all busy with youngsters ...very sweet ._x000D_
Worth a trip .
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Marina Bay is one of the best place in the Singapore to be hang out.such a lovely place it was.i love the vibes there .Great location and view is fantastic.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent way to see Asian wildlife
REVIEW_BODY: The zoo is a half an hour from downtown, but the experience is worth the taxi ride. Four shows nightly allow for lots of people to participate in this event. Admission is controlled for each show. A short wait is required before being allowed into the outdoor auditorium. Our hostess had a great personality and kept the event moving nicely. We were introduced to several Asian animals that had been trained to do some thingsâ€”like the owls doing a flyover or the blond raccoon appearing on stage. After the show, we left for the tram ride which showed other animals in a more or less natural habitat. Many of these animals are endangered, and this zoo has worked to help preserve them with breeding programs. Only the tiger was sequestered, but he was active as we went by. Excellent organization and execution of this event made it worth its price. The only difficulty was that foreigners cannot book this event online, but the website tells which performances have room.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent half a day there walking about and taking in the great structures and plants.. lovely place for family and dating couples. :)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: You Havenâ€™t Been To Singapore If...
REVIEW_BODY:
There are a couple things that people will tell you must be seen/done if you visit Singapore, and that you havenâ€™t really been there if you miss it. Merlion Park is one of those things._x000D_
_x000D_
The statue itself is quite beautiful and impressive, and locals will tell you that it brings good fortune to Singapore (at least thatâ€™s what they told us!). You will need to be patient and well-positioned if you want to get good pictures, so take your time, and enjoy the people watching! You will see countless people lining up shots to catch the Merlionâ€™s water in their mouth, hands, coffee cup...the pinnacle of tourist photos akin to holding up the leaning tower of Pisa._x000D_
_x000D_
There are a lot of nice views of the skyline in the area, and plenty of places to grab a quick bite or coffee nearby. As with essentially anywhere you go in Singapore, Merlion Park is very well maintained, safe and extremely clean.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very scenografic temple...expecially in the night when lights exalt its facade..good visit and good district
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A unique part of Gardens by the Sea
REVIEW_BODY: For those who have not ever seen a real cloud forest, the Cloud forest with take you there. The moisture loving plants are all in perfect condition, The coolness of the bubble is a relief from the hot Singapore are. Visit it anytime of the day. Expect to see lots of people in this wonderful display.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the best attractions in any city. The gardens are composed of several themed gardens (e.g. Chinese, Malaysian etc.), super large constructed trees, two large greenhouse domes and more. We focused on the domes (which require a ticket purchase) and which are quite spectacular - one focused on cloud forests and one more familiar environment types. Both are very well laid our and maintained and have the advantage of being air conditioned. Next time we are in Singapore we will visit at night when the lights are reportedly well worth seeing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: excellent tour guide and good explanation as well as know the subject very well . We learn a lot about the battlebox and Singapore history
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Even if you're not a flower lover you have to see them! They are amazing, I don't think you could find anything alike anywhere else right now!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You would love the views. Takes about an hour but time well spent. Kids love it. It can be closed at certain times.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Really cool way to see Chinatown History
REVIEW_BODY: This is inexpensive and relatively quick. They give you an audio guide and you can go your own pace. Well thought out exhibits. One piece of advice would be to walk around Chinatown a bit, then come back here for an air conditioning break.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A fantastic experience, the best tropical garden we have been to. We especially loved the Cloud Forest and the skywalk. A must for a visitor to Singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The views from the Skypark are certainly spectacular! Just be ware -- you can only go to the bar or only to the area outside the bar, but not both! If you pay to go up to the bar, it includes $20 toward a drink; but you cannot go down to the main observation area. While the ticket person will tell you it's the same view, it's definitely not as good as the main observation area. It's $24 to go to the main observation area - which is what I recommend.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place has been my favorite place to visit every time I went to Singapore. I havenâ€™t visited all malls here,, need more time and money :p
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The view from the Skypark is fantastic!You can see the whole Singapore from the top. The cost is 23SGD, about 15â‚¬. It is a must visit.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wish we could have actually seen it!!
REVIEW_BODY: We came to see the Garden Rhapsody sound & light show. We'd looked forward to it for some time, arrived in Singapore & made a special trip to the Gardens to see the evening show. Unfortunately we arrived to find that the area where the Garden Rhapsody is held, had been fenced off, with a Christmas display inside - only accessible if you paid for entry. When the Garden Rhapsody is usually a free event, we were bitterly disappointed. We had no interest in seeing the Christmas display & weren't willing to pay to get inside so that we could see a usually free event.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A place to cool don and admire with beauty
REVIEW_BODY: Take a taxi or the MRT to Bayfront after walking through the gardens to the domes you will need to cool down we only had a limited time so we paid $16 for the one dome (it is cheaper for both) Once inside you are immediately blown away with the cascading waterfall in front of you , seeing people walking underneath you know you're in for a treat and it doesn't disappoint. We spent 1 1/2 hours admiring the gardens, the view from the walkways high up is fabulous .
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
From a few different zoos we saw around the world, this was one of the best._x000D_
Loved the Tropical Forest part, where animals and lizzards and birds were just in front of you, free to walk or fly around_x000D_
same with kangaroos.. we were walking on the alee and they were crossing the same alee just in front of us._x000D_
5euros extra if you want to feed the giraffes :)_x000D_
BUY THE TICKETS ONLINE, is much cheaper!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a temple in chinatown! As you enter the temple you will see many buddhist people praying and practicing religious event. The interior is shining gold too.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a beautiful spot to visit if you love gardens. To see gardens from all over the world is beautiful.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were glad that we paid a visit to gardens by the bay. Well worth the trip and the walkway in the roof of the Cloud Forest was great.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The range of orchids is incredible, the presentation amazing, and the whole experience a must-do if you have any interest in flowers and the beauty of nature
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It's a wonderful attraction located practically adjacent to Orchard Road. It is 150+ years old but it is a peaceful haven for locals and tourists alike. There is something for all age groups. Many fitness freaks use the peaceful environment for their running activities without the chaos of the traffic and the associated noise._x000D_
_x000D_
It requires a certain basic level of fitness as the Botanical garden path is undulating and there are many instances of uphill and downhill slopes so the elderly need to proceed with caution. It's important to carry sunscreen as the garden is exposed to the elements. There are small covered wooden shelters for conducting picnics._x000D_
_x000D_
This is a unique place to locate swans both black and white in the various waterbodies. There are many sightings of monitor lizards especially around the water bodies but they are small and harmless. There are quite a few places to feed koi fish with specially prepared fish food._x000D_
_x000D_
The Orchid Garden is a must see attraction, though the entry fee is separate but reasonable. There is also a Shaw Foundation Symphony Stage in the centre of the garden. It is a wonderful atmosphere to listen to live music during concerts.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These rotating wheels are virtually in every major city and the views from some of them are nothing special. But you won't be disappointed with this one. The views from this one are fantastic. It is situated inside part of the Formula 1 circuit. The prices are reasonable and it's hassle free. It takes about half an hour to complete the revolution. The views are fantastic. Take your camera. !!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best way to get to Sentosa Island
REVIEW_BODY: We didn't think this would be as much fun as it was. After deciding to purchase the ride all day option we rode both cable cars numerous times.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: So many orchids and such a fun beautiful exhibit! There was a small fee but was very cheap. The displays are amazing, this was my favorite part of my visit to the botanical gardens.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is full of Indian tradition and shops. Indian heritage center potrays Indian values. Many Indian restaurants are available.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Flower Dome - Cloud Forest Cherry Blossoms
REVIEW_BODY: A great Sunday spent with a great friend. It was very impromptu to catch the Cherry Blossoms on its last day. The architecture design was a splendid backdrop to be featured in a lot of Getty Image like photos.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Breathe Taking Views from this spot
REVIEW_BODY: I suggest go this spot by 5 pm and wait till the evening. Can see a really beautiful sky and a great sunset! Everything just become orange from the horozon at evening. You can enjoy the drinks (which are extremely overpriced) along with your visit. A worthy visit to pay, currently they charge $23 for adult to access the skypark where you can only the observation deck. (Do not spend this value if you are going for the infinity pool as it is only accessible by hotel guests). Else it is a best spot for viewing the beauty of singapore!!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you want to be up there when the light show is on, then be aware that you will be restricted to around 15 minutes upstairs as the staff are required to move people along due to number restrictions. NB the light show did not start at the suggested time on our visit!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Well Connected and Good Attraction for water lover
REVIEW_BODY: Good Place for water lover and nice breeze along with river and fountain. Lot of restaurants and fun activities. nice location
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is a must see for anyone who loves flowers! Equally, at just $5 entry it is also nice to walk around as it is quite relaxing and the colours and flowers are a nice change of the cityscape pace. Donâ€™t forget to charge your camera battery as it is a photographerâ€™s paradise!_x000D_
My friend and I caught a taxi here (from Orchard Rd) which was around $6 due to earlier signs of rain. The information desk were also very helpful and arranged a return taxi for us._x000D_
Such a wonderful day!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The zoo has everything, including an animated dinosaur section, and the trees and gardens are lush and beautiful.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As a tourist I found this was a pricey but absolutely worth the visit. These gardens are well taken care of and generally beautiful. Give yourself at least 2 hours to appreciate both domes and the super trees. We went at 530 pm which worked out well to watch the super tree light show at 7:45 pm, also well with it and free.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I think it is admirable that there is a rainforest in the middle of a city so buzzing and high tech as Singapore. If you do not hail from South East Asia rainforests are particularly hard to come by so it was a real treat. It was busy today ( Sunday) with slightly varied terrain. We took the 'Tree Top' Walk which was amazing to walk across the suspension bridge to see the full panorama and feel you were amongst the tree tops._x000D_
It took three hours and we are reasonably fit and walked at a medium pace. My advice is start early ( even though under the canopy of the rainforest it is noticeably cooler) as it was really hot at midday when we finished. Also if you are afraid of heights probably don't take the "Tree Top" walk option. There are others to choose from. And it's free.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were all freezing inside because of the cooler temperature and the water, but the view was amazing. We ended up staying there for a few hours ... there are lots to see. Strongly recommended, but bring a jacket!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Weâ€™re Zoologists and were very impressed. Did the zoo and the river safari. Heck of a lot of walking but so worth it. Amazing diversity and beautiful habitats.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A very interetsing story on the Fall of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The Battle box is located 10m underground in Fort Canning Park and was the command post during the invasion of Singapore by the Japanese. Opens your eyes to the complete stuff up by the British on the fall of Singapore during the WW2.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to visit and love the night show magic its a must you will not be disappointed it'a magical day or night fantastic viewing platform as well enjoy
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Bought the combined tickets to Flower Dome and Cloud Garden. Flower dome was full of exotic flowers. Cloud garden has a feel of mystical wonders.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Better of the two indoor experiences at Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY:
BOTTOM LINE: A refreshing stop when visiting Gardens by the Bay_x000D_
_x000D_
GOOD:_x000D_
* Aircon. If you're in the midst of the Singapore heat, the aircon in here is a Godsend_x000D_
* Waterfall concept - Weaving in and around the waterfall from top to bottom is really interesting concept, and make it a lot of fun_x000D_
* Better than the Flower Dome. If you can only go to one, go here_x000D_
* Crowds - I've been here a few times and it's never too bad_x000D_
_x000D_
BAD_x000D_
* Value - tickets a are *rough*
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great park and gardens for the whole family
REVIEW_BODY: Nature lovers must head there. Apart from the Botanic Gardens, this has gotta be the crown jewel for Singapore! It has a lot to offer ... head there to find out yourself! ;)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When there during Sakura season... went there on late sakura season... plus the humidity in singapore, some of the sakura were whithering. Still a place to visit whenever a new season arrives.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Of course you must visit Orchard Road. Very expensive shopping these days. Not like the Singapore of old. But still worth a walk up and down and a look
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was a great place to visit and see the gardens. Afterward we went to spago to watch the sunset and see the lights in the park.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic insight to the workings of Battlebox and inside history/story to fall of Singapore .Staff and guide were friendly and knowledgeable
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I was there alone and slowly enjoyed the architecture there. Honestly, the space is not wide and broad but the design is so great to extend to space. Not only above, the modern design was so nice to make people feel amazing._x000D_
I will visit there again to see new plants there.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This must be the best experience in Singapore for the money. S$20.00 will let you into a paradise of some 3000 different types of Orchids. There are orchids by rivers, orchids in garden settings, orchids in specially prepared green houses._x000D_
Everywhere is a mass of beautiful colour and my favorite plants - orchids!!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Get everything on fashion, food and lifestyles in this stretch of road. Need more than a day to explore the road but it is really worth it.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You will soon realise that Singapore is in fact a city composed of villages and areas, each with their own highlights. Kampong Glam was originally the home of the Malay population, but has become gentrified over recent years to become an arty area full of interesting shops and restaurants. Some of the shops are the original fabric and carpet vendors, but recently there has been an influx of home design outlets. Restaurants range from Swedish to Lebanese...take your pick!
ADDRESS: Kampong Glam, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I can't imaging how anyone conceived of these towering artificial trees covered with vines. It is not just one grove; there are multiple groves. They are just another fascinating wonder of Singapore's Gardens by the Bay.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth going especially during a hot sunny day
REVIEW_BODY: A place that you can really relax after many tiring visits around Singapore. The place is fully air conditioning. FB B outlets at short distance.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A Unique Garden Unlike Anything Else
REVIEW_BODY: These indoor gardens were constructed in recent years and (as I understand it) are powered and cooled entirely off the solar energy produced from the solar arrays in the 18 on-site artificial trees. The two sets of gardens have a multitude of plants from various locations around the world. The rain forest area is particularly nice. Find your way to the top and then follow the long meandering walkway to the bottom. A definite must-see when visiting Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Surprisingly fun futuristic attraction with domes, flowers, and waterfalls
REVIEW_BODY:
Surprisingly fun futuristic attraction._x000D_
_x000D_
Highlights:_x000D_
- Huge enclosed gardens in interesting domes_x000D_
- Futuristic feel of fabricated environments_x000D_
- Waterfall and sky walks_x000D_
- Tall light up flowers in the middle_x000D_
- View from dome to Sands hotel and Ferris wheel_x000D_
- Cheesy photo upon entering the flower dome to add to my attractions collection._x000D_
_x000D_
Midlights:_x000D_
- Flower dome: didn't find it as exciting as the other and some areas didn't have much_x000D_
_x000D_
Lowlights_x000D_
- Playground closed Mondays. It looked so cool and my lil guy would've loved it. Big water area too._x000D_
- Have to pay for each dome separately_x000D_
_x000D_
Wasn't thinking much about visiting here but it was nice and worth the stop.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I had no idea such beautiful creations existed. It's amazing what people can do to uplift a place when they put their heart into managing a country.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We love the ride it took about half an hour to finish. You can see the city and learn about the different places.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A lot of variety for eating and shopping, in the end you get so much tired that you cant realize it before
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Chinatown covers about 35 square blocks in Singapore. It has lots and lots of tourist shops, restaurants, hawkers, nooks and crannies, as well as a cultural center and several indoor shopping malls. Lots of cheap food at the Food areas on Smith street. Crowded in the evenings.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A UNESCO Heritage site that is as beautiful as the day it was first planted
REVIEW_BODY:
The Singapore Botanic Gardens (SBC) has always been one of my favourite places in Singapore because it just holds so many fond memories of my growing up years till today._x000D_
_x000D_
I remember when I was little my parents would bring my siblings and I there to feed the fish and swans (not so encouraged these days because the park wardens don't want the animals to get sick). So those times were wonderful times of simple fun._x000D_
_x000D_
Then when I was older, I brought my girlfriend there for many of our dates - she loves being near nature, and plants just make her happy. So the place became our favourite for long romantic walks in he evenings._x000D_
_x000D_
Well, eventually I married her :) And when the kids came along, SBC became one of our favourite places for family picnics and enjoying the free musical performances at the stage area. It was also a useful place to visit for the kids' botany projects from school. I still remember spending hours with them taking photos of different kinds of plant categories - and there are many, many varieties to study there!!_x000D_
_x000D_
And now, the kids have all grown up, and I hear they sometimes go there for their dates with their special someone too! My wife and I still enjoy going there on our dates, and our favorite places are the Cool House and the Orchid Garden._x000D_
_x000D_
So yes, whether you are a resident in Singapore, or you are a visitor, I would recommend SBC as a "must see" - for the huge variety of plant life to learn from, for a romantic hiatus (especially in the evenings when it is cooler), for a place to bring the kids and the dog and to let them loose, or just a place to find some solace from the madness of everyday life.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Worth the visit for the building's architecture in itself. It's a welcome respite in the ultra-modern glass jungle of center city. The collections are not extraordinary, but they are very well presented, the light is carefully thought out, and the rooms are esthetically pleasing._x000D_
I didn't find the history of the island very well explained, if anything it made me buy a history book at the bookshop.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Bustling area with small streets and lots of Indian shopping/food
REVIEW_BODY:
Good place to get cheap good Indian food and a few bars around. Lots of small shops_x000D_
_x000D_
Walking around here is very unlike the rest of Singapore and more like other parts of Asia. Small roads packed with vehicles. Get a taxi to nearby and walk in_x000D_
_x000D_
Very large shopping centre called The Mustafa Centre that sells everything
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Interesting historic area of Singapore featuring the impressive Sultan Mosque. Also various textile shops on Arab Street and many middle eastern restaurants on Bussorah Street.
ADDRESS: Kampong Glam, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When In Singapore try to go an visit the Kranji War Memorial. This is the location where Australians/ British / New Zealanders / Indian / Singaporeans tried to hold off the huge Japanese hoard charging down the Malay Peninsula. When you look at the magnificently maintained grounds you cant help but get a huge lump in your throat and feel saddened at the loss of young life trying to save Singapore. A sad but moving visit is a must.
ADDRESS: 9 Woodlands Road, Singapore 738656, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Interesting history of the world war 2 bunker at Fort Canning. The guide was excellent and the exhibits displayed nicely.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A visit to see the nightly light show not to be missed.The lighting of the trees in sync with the music being played was amazing
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: made our way via MRT and spent a leisurely 3 hours in the flower and then cloud domes with great displays of flowers and plants from all over the world.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: If you see nothing else in Singapore you would still leave happy!
REVIEW_BODY: Amazing gardens... litrle bus audio tour was great... so informative. .. wonderful aromas... good food.... lovely gift shops and that waa by day. At night the light show to classical music was breathtaking at the tall 'fake trees'..... would come back to Singapore again just to visit these gardens. Enjoy
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Yes, it's true. Forget the shady, seedy chinatowns you may find around the world, this is so pristine you have the feeling it was built yeasterday.

REVIEW_BODY: Go to the gardens in the early morning. In addition to the plants you will see Singaporeans at play. However to see the orchid displays you will need to return later.

REVIEW_BODY: Very crowded on this skyway. Very beautiful view. Worth for money. Don't go above if you fear about height.

REVIEW_BODY: Captivating!! Knowledgeable!! Wonderful experience. Thank you!! We both learnt so much and enjoyed the morning of educational tourism. Brilliant!

REVIEW_BODY: One of the most visited places. Good sourroundings agood restaurants around enjoy the evening with good food and drinks
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the finest places to relax and walk in the lap of nature. So near the city centre it's an oasis of calm, clean and green, perfect for a few hours of picnic or just contemplation. Weekend evenings often promise lovely music concerts in the amphitheater free for the public.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is a big place situated in the back side of Marina bay Sands. There are 4 main attractions:_x000D_
1. Flower Dome : This is very huge superbly air conditioned greenhouse. You will get to see a lot flowers and plants in flower dome . If you have interest in Botany you can read out the description on plants. or If you are interested in photography you have good chance here to capture colorful flower setup. If you are into plants, visit might take up to 2-3 hours but if you are not interested (like me), you can wrap up the place in 30 mins._x000D_
_x000D_
2. Cloud Forest : It is also a huge superbly air conditioned greenhouse but with a big waterfall inside and walkway bridge from 7th floor. It also has science museum. Once you enter this place, you will be greeted by a huge artificial waterfall. Then you have to take elevator to go the top floor from where you can walk in the bridge toward the downstairs._x000D_
_x000D_
3. OCBC SkyWay : This is a glass bridge connecting the super grove tress. You can take 15-30 minutes walk on this . You can get good view of overall garden and Singapore city from here. But preferred time is 7:30-7:45pm when there will be light show._x000D_
_x000D_
4. Light Show: There is free and awesome light show that you can enjoy at night 7.45pm and 8.45pm. Go to Sky way to enjoy this show more._x000D_
_x000D_
This place is huge so expect lot of walking. In addition to this, there is no good restaurants out here and one that is here is super expensive. So it will be wise to bring some snacks with us to eat while we roam. As greenhouses are superbly air conditioned, you might want to carry light jacket. Overall this place needs 4-5 hours to roam completely and after you finish you can also walk towards marina bay sands.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is worth paying the entrance charge to visit these gardens located in the free Botanical gardens. So many varieties of orchids of all different shapes and sizes. Very well set out.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Keepers shared many interesting facts of the animals during the feeding times. I recommend walking on foot rather than taking the tram to get the full experience.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Admittedly touristy but still a must-see part of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The first thing you will see at Merlion Park is the swarms of tourists trying to get a snapshot of the giant merlion spewing water. Once you get past the crowds of people, though, and start to explore the area, you will realize there is so much more to see. On my visit, there was a wind symphony performing nearby as well as several street performers. There are various stores in which to shop or eat. There is always something to do in this area of town, and if you like the backdrop of skyscrapers, you will love the photo opportunities here.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice for a evening drinks & stroll
REVIEW_BODY: We expected the waterfront to be overcrowded by night, but was easy to get a table right by the water in the bar we liked most. Very nice for a evening drinks, bites & stroll
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We had a great time at the flower dome. Its wheelchair friendly, wheelchair is provided free of cost. Its a must visit for flower enthusiasts.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Unlike anything I've seen. Impressive from a distance and just as much close up. Definitely do the walkway unless you have issues with heights but do check the operating times as we found they closed at 2.45pm during Christmas & New Year holidays. Cost SG$8 each which gives you a 15 minute walk along the top of the supertree grove.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lost my STP but I love this place
REVIEW_BODY:
Went to Pasir Panjang & stop in Haw Par Villa mrt station. Nice place, awesome story of Buddhist / Journey to the west / Cementery etc. Free entry! A lot stairs_x000D_
_x000D_
We went there monday noon. A few visitors after us (4-5 people)_x000D_
A lot beautiful spot to take pic & I lost my STP near cementery (i forgot)_x000D_
I love this place.. cozyyyy.. and historical_x000D_
Will comeback soon..
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very interesting and wonderful place to visit especially with families. The only issue is that you need to plan your tour properly to make sure you see all the attractive places withinn the timeframe you have and not to miss any of the shows. Also, you need to know which kind of ticket you buy and what kind of tour you are eligible to have according to the price you paid.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful view especially after the sunset
REVIEW_BODY: This is the place to visit at least twice during your trip to Singapore. Once during the day time to take good pictures and definitely during the late evening when everything is lit up. This place is truly mesmerizing. This was my second time so I exactly knew where I would like to spend more time. We took the battery operated cycles and circled around Marina Bay and that was real fun. We stopped in between to take beautiful pictures and then finally settled at Esplanade. During the evening we were lucky to see the laser light show sitting on the exact opposite side of Marina Bay Sands. It was so beautiful.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: . Must! One of the hallmarks and wealth of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: One of the hallmarks and wealth of Singapore. It is also recommended to visit on day and night. Two different things. !Lots of attractions around it. must
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A lovely ride down the river at night with all the lights. Enjoyed. Sit our the back and a great breeze and even better view
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The lights at night absolutely make it a great place to visit whilst enjoying the local delights at the restaurants/cafes
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Explore this area - local restuarants are gaining new customers.
REVIEW_BODY:
My local friend and his family live in this area, tonight we dined at the Danji Korean BBQ Buffet restaurant in Tanjong Katong Rd._x000D_
_x000D_
The BBQ was cooked by the kids at the table, the meat and vegetables were matched by the sauces and kimchee - it was a perfect meal....I think my favourite was the chicken thighs cooked with kimchee._x000D_
_x000D_
Recommend this Joo Chiat Rd, Haig Rd, Tanjong Rd and East Coast Rd for something different - I'm sure you will find a local restaurant to suit.
ADDRESS: East Coast Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited Gardens by the bay last week. Absolutely beautiful. The Cloud Forest and Flower Garden are well worth a visit. Lovely and cool in them as well. At night it is all lit up and spectacular to look at.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really cool bridge linking the Singapore flyer to the rest of the marina. Really cool views from here. Just hang out there for a little bit and take it all in.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you want to see cityscape from a height you are better going to Marina Bay Skypark. Kids may like it but just average to me.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful gardens right in the city
REVIEW_BODY:
A beautiful leisurely walk in the park. We are very impressed with the upkeep of this botanical Gardens. Very well thought out space that captures many beautiful settings. The creative landscaping to create gardens from around the world was very well done. Very nice way to spend a few hours or the day with single couples families etc. definitely recommend the botanical gardens and don't forget to visit the orchids section..really beautiful ._x000D_
Take the SMRT leaves you off right at one of the gates and then you walk through to get to the main section or you could figure out how to take a bus that leaves you off at the other gate .
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Fantastic place...worth visiting.._x000D_
should devote atleast 5 hrs. ideal to come say around 3:00 pm and stay till the light & musical show under the canopies. Would suggest buying tickets online to avoid the lines._x000D_
Take a mat or bedsheet to watch the lights show - lie down and watch it - its best seen lying down...the domes are worth spending quality time - get a stroller if you have young kids - can be rented at the place (for $ 2).
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice but we did not like that much
REVIEW_BODY:
River safari is considered to be one of the major attraction for tourist. However me and my wife visited this place after visitibg night safari, zoo and universal studios and we didnt felt this attraction really worth may be because of nany repeatative things._x000D_
They have created artificial view near mandai river comparing amaxon and other major rivers but somehow we found this attractio as average compared to other attractions in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Air con place with a lot of flowers to showcase. Enjoying nature while escaping the heat. Nice place for friends, couples and family.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: On our recent visit to Singapore, the Zoo was the best attraction we experienced. Our 5 year old was most excited to see so many animals up close. The Zoo is big, so plan accordingly to spend the whole day. Must visit for all.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a great idea - letting guests experience nocturnal animals when they are awake. We started off watching the Thumbuakar fire breathing performance - that is a must see, those men can do things with fire I have never seen. We then did a walking tour of the park - you see more that way and it gave time for the line for the Tram to die down. We then jumped on the tram - you really should do the tram tour this is the only way to see some of the animals. Then we saw the creatures of the night show - very clever. The otters were very cool. I really enjoyed how the park had such a conservation message.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The whole place was beautiful from start to finish. The variety if plants was superb. The breath of fresh air and the serenity was absolutely wonderful.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The sound and light show at Gardens by the bay is a must watch. Plan so that you are able to see the show at 7:45. The cloud forest dome is better than the flower dome. Post the show you can cross over tot he marina bay sands and watch the sound and light show there at 9:30. You wont be able to make it for the 8 PM show after gardens by the bay
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Stunning With a Twist, And An Amazing Example Of What You Can Do With Money
REVIEW_BODY:
When I was last in Singapore in December 2010 this area was just a building site, indeed having got lost in the middle of it at that time I can tell you that I had trouble finding my way out of it.... See the photos_x000D_
_x000D_
At the time I asked someone what they were doing and was told ''Building a garden'' which did not really at the time explain the futuristic buildings which looked more like a sports building of some sort._x000D_
_x000D_
Now it is finished all becomes clear and just shows what can you can do when you throw 60 million US$ or so, at a project. I bet the Cranbourne Botanic Garden in Melbourne wishes they had that kind of money to throw around!_x000D_
_x000D_
Bearing in mind that dry land is at something of a premium in_x000D_
Singapore and bearing in mind that they already had the exquisite National Botanic Garden, a World Heritage site, it seems to be odd building another Botanic Garden, but this garden is for everyone so it is a botanic garden without the labels on the plants!_x000D_
_x000D_
The whole area is huge and is more of a pleasure ground to be visited over and over and as such has a children's area, an eating area, and so on. Plus the futuristic vertical gardens which remind me of the old movie version of The Time Machine although am not sure why._x000D_
_x000D_
Right in the middle are the two ''Domes'', one of which is the Flower Dome which is pretty self explanatory, and the other is The Cloud Forest Dome. While the gardens outside are free these two centrepieces will cost you extra, for my money the Cloud Forest is the better deal._x000D_
_x000D_
Doing the easy one first, probably the first things that hits you in the Flower Dome is the scent of flowers, but you have to remember that flowers don't last forever so what you see will vary, while I was there the main theme was the Dahlia Exhibition, but many of the displays are permanent with mini botanic gardens from South Africa, Australasia, and the Americas._x000D_
_x000D_
For me the piece de resistance was without a doubt The Cloud Forest Dome, inside the visitor is greeted with what can only be described as an awe inspiring scene rising almost to the very roof of the dome itself and accessible by lifts and walkways which take you up to the tops and bring you slowly back down again on foot (wheelchair access is brilliant by the way)._x000D_
_x000D_
There is also a rather disturbing exhibition/animation of the effect that global warming is having on our environment especially the cloud forests which are just as important as the rain forests._x000D_
_x000D_
I am not going to spoil the fun too much here but of you want a good tip for the Cloud Forest Dome make sure that your camera or smartphone is covered as you walk in!_x000D_
_x000D_
Well worth a visit when you are in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A view of a World Class City State
REVIEW_BODY: Living in Asia it makes me appreciate how so many things are new and world class and Singapore is a world class city you can stand @ Marina Bay and enjoy the city by day or the beauty by night. Absolutely amazing place.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good to overwin your fear of heights
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful plants in a special environment. Very nice visit to this big dome. You can descent from above with an air bridge with possibility to look down......
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We had a wonderful day at Singapore's botanic garden. We really enjoyed the layout of separate sections, especially the medicinal use, the gardens through the age, the foliage garden, the ginger garden, and so much more! The fact that the gardens are free is more than commendable. We did also visit the orchid garden though which was not expensive and worth paying for. There are several food and drink outlets within the gardens too which is great on a hot day. Despite a lengthy visit we still didn't see the entire gardens, we'd be more than happy to return though.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We are travelling families in a big group with a senior and young children, we bought the coupon at klook.. so we have to exchanges the ticket at The Red Dot Museum, we having difficulties to find the garden by the bay. We have a long walk on the road in a sunny day.. but it will not happen if we just go back to the MRT and follow the sign.._x000D_
_x000D_
And again its a holiday season, at xmas eve.. the place is very crowded .. and we can not enjoy the place very much..._x000D_
_x000D_
But the place ( flower dome, or rain forests) they have priority lane for senior so its help us very much.._x000D_
_x000D_
The place is very nice to take photo.. but my suggestion to come here not in the holiday season...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A highlight of my trip -- one of the best gardens I've visited
REVIEW_BODY:
The expansive botanic gardens are some of the best maintained I've ever seen. I loved the variety of plants, including the heritage plants. Wandering around, trying not to get lost -- this garden is not to be missed. You can forget you are in the midst of a city, and just enjoy the plants and flowers! Follow the map if you must! Be sure that you stop in the Orchid Garden (for a fee). (I had planned to spend only a couple of hours, and four hours later I was still wandering in the midst of the garden!)_x000D_
_x000D_
TIPS: Dress in cool clothing, bring water, and wear comfy shoes. You will do a lot of walking! There are plenty of places to rest, so take advantage!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must-go shopping heaven for tourists
REVIEW_BODY: Walk from one end to the other. one day is not enough. Spare maybe 2 days to enjoy this shopping street. Go during Great Singapore Sales which starts in June n lasts about 2 months.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was lovely to visit very humid though but fantastic. Wasn't too crowded when we went on a Friday
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
When you arrive at the opening of little India all you see is colour hanging from the rafters. Walk through the arch and you wonâ€™t know were to look. Everybody is friendly and you will find the more you speak with the retailers the more you will find that they have lived in Australia or have a relation living in Australia._x000D_
You feel safe and they love to bargain, so donâ€™t hesitate, never pay what they ask, they love the fun of it. Walk through all the streets and see all the fresh produce, have a curry puff, or a curry from one of the vendors, itâ€™s great.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Even though Bird park quite far away from the city center, it is worth a visit. Plan to reach early so that you can catch all the shows during the first half of the day and can easily finish seeing the park by 2-3 PM._x000D_
_x000D_
We traveled by the MRT and then took a bus from the Boon lay bus interchange, Bus No. 194 drops you right outside the birdpark._x000D_
_x000D_
Lory Loft where one can feed the birds was a different experience. The birds are very friendly & if lucky you can have one perched on your hand or shoulder.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Pre-booked this trip before arriving, sounded great with the wildlife but wasnâ€™t exactly sure how this was going to work out. Picked up on time, out guide was called Siwa, and he was really nice and gave a lot of information on the way to the zoo. Arrived at the zoo in good time, so we were seated for our buffet breakfast in the dining area which was just a nice size. The orangutans were brought out to a feeding platform next to dining area. You were able to take pictures freely, and also queue for a closer look to have picture taken...with option to buy. You were then free to explore the park on foot, the tram, or both. We opted to explore ourselves, you can then decide where and what to see yourself._x000D_
_x000D_
Overall: Nice day, breakfast was decent with plenty choice, and transfers n guide were spot on.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wow this is a must when in singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This was a great experience really pleased we went .Fantastic view , really great One of us had a fear of heights but was easily overcome distracted by the amazing skyline !
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: End of afternoon visit, cool and animals were active
REVIEW_BODY: We visited from 4 to 7 PM (and continued afterwords with the Night Safari) so enjoyed cool temperature and could see the animals quite active. The panda exhibit is fabulous. The boat ride is a must-do, since the animals from that area cannot be seen from the trail. Pity that the boat ride ticket is not directly included in the River Safari entry ticket. However, when you have it, you can do the boat several times by just queuing again.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well laid-out zoo, with a wide variety of animals from all over the world. They have a (paid) tram service with 4 stops at different points in the zoo, that helps alleviate all the walking you have to otherwise do. Some good shows at specific times, as well.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic museum with added bonus of free kids activities!
REVIEW_BODY: We visited this wonderful museum on a Family Friday which meant no entry fee and free kids activities. I think these run on school holidays so check the museum website for details. This museum includes a fantastic collection from a ship wreck that will interest the whole family - we spent lots of time imagining what all those treasures were going to be used for. Located near Raffles Place MRT station it is also in a lovely part of the city. Well worth the visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Maybe it was saturday But i found it to be overcrowded and too many malls It was crazy However plenty of places to eat at
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are looking for that souvenir and night market experience, then you must come to Chinatown. You will not be disappointed. Don't forget to barter with the store holders but with in reason as everything is already very cheap
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic, make the journey out of town.
REVIEW_BODY:
We were suffering from a little bit of jetlag so decided to do something slightly less involved and popped into the zoo._x000D_
_x000D_
We were very fortunate because it was very quiet and it was easy to find our way around without hassle or fuss of crowds._x000D_
_x000D_
Luckily we were looking at the white tigers when the feeding time was announced. They were amazing, jumping around in the water etc_x000D_
_x000D_
All of the attractions and exhibits were excellent, all the animals seemed well cared for and had plenty of space._x000D_
_x000D_
My highlight was definitely the orangutans, their inclosure stretched all over the place meaning they were above your head at times!_x000D_
_x000D_
Little tip, purchase your pass online before you arrive and the tickets are 15% less and you don't have to queue for ticket.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went during special display on CNY. beautiful flowers and wonderful to see the indoor waterfall. Photogenic.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Even if you donâ€™t go to the Cloud Forest or the Flower Dome it is wort the time to stroll through this lovely park. There is even a free light show at 7:45 and 8:45 every night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What can I say if this was in the UK it would be treble the price and overcrowded. It was a joy! Great aquarium's to look at as you walk down to the river safari and even see the Panda enclosure with a Panda there 10 metres away eating some bamboo and the River safari although short was superb. If you are in Sing def worth doing!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A place to breath and relax
REVIEW_BODY: It would take more than a day to explore the whole park. It is well kept ( as most places in Singapore) and i understand singaporeans who has their picnics there. I cant think of a more harmonic place. Almost film-like in many ways.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth pf visitng because of various temples
REVIEW_BODY: Got here actually by an accident, this is a specific part of the city with ethnical minority and with specific architecture. I would say that Little India had a bigger wow effect one, but this place holds more temples, even from various religion, so it might be interesting from this point of view.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved our visit to China Town and all the interesting stalls and shops. Plenty of character, lots of people, and feeling very safe. Lots of restaurants and eateries on Smith Street, but recommend the stalls in the middle of the street as they are much cheaper than the small restaurants that try to entice you to dine with them. Good variety of choices and great taste
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The National Gallery Singapore opened in late 2015. It combines the former city hall and supreme court buildings in a stunning reconfiguration and preservation of both. The rehabilitation preserved many of the best features of both buildings while creating new gallery spaces. Some of the galleries were devoted to very modern art by artists from Singapore or SE Asian countries. Some galleries were devoted to more traditional Chinese artists, which we found more to our liking/ We enjoyed walking through both buildings and enjoying what was available in the galleries. There are several places to eat from simple coffee shops to upscale gourmet restaurants. There is an entry fee and discounts for seniors.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A most impressive zoo which does not feel like a zoo but rather a trip through a jungle!
REVIEW_BODY: A very well designed and maintained facility which feels more like a safari than a trip through a zoo. A wonderful day with great facilities for our 4 year old. Most importantly the animal seemed well looked after and healthy
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We went to visit the mosque, and they had a womenâ€™s section upstairs. With a lift for easy too which was impressive!_x000D_
_x000D_
Around the mosque are some lovely shops - great for souvenirs and places to eat too, which we found overpriced for what it was compared to the rest of Singapore. Anyway donâ€™t think many other areas offer the same cuisine so we made the most of it._x000D_
_x000D_
This area is worth a stroll and spending a couple of hours if youâ€™re already visiting the mosque. Remember to cover up out of respect and courtesy, this applies to men too if youâ€™re wearing shorts.
ADDRESS: 3 Muscat Street Masjid Sultan, Singapore 198833, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Brought the kids here for the lights festival a few days ago. Wasn't really that impressed by the light exhibits themselves, but Marina Bay continues to look good in the evening. All the buildings of the city are always an impressive site.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When we had our tour here, I have to admit it was so tiring for me, but then the place is still worth all the tiredness.
ADDRESS: 8 Marina Gardens Drive Marina Barrage, Singapore 018951, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are a amazing and a most if you visit singapore great layout easy to find your way around suitable for all ages
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: good place to chill out on a hot day
REVIEW_BODY: the tallest indoor waterfall. It was cool inside. We can walk around man made mountain and enjoy the view from the top. There are alot of rare orchids on display.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the most beautiful sightseeing place that I have ever seen. It is super easy to visit the Garden by the Bay solo because of the excellent directions, paths and maps. This is a must do in Singapore!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very impressive, Singapore just keeps raising the bar and this is pretty amazing. Very comfortable due to the huge air conditioned conservatories
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Makes for a wonderful evening stroll, nice to take photos and learn about different species of flowers. After that you can eat dinner at "Satay by the bay". While walking back to the MRT station, you will walk through the gardens again and the night view with the super trees lighted up is spectacular.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Quite close to Busy orchard road high rise buildings you can come here for a nice walk for some Traditional glance of Singapore which you dont get to see being a tourist
ADDRESS: Off Orchard Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A World-Class, Can't Miss Slice of Wildlife in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: I spent most of the day at the Singapore Zoo. One of the most unique features is the number of environments that visitors can enter where the animals are truly free-roaming-- I saw monkeys relaxing on the zoo grounds and shared a covered space with some beautiful birds, mouse deer, flying foxes and lemurs. The exhibits are mostly animals who do well in a tropical environment, so you can see a white tiger, elephants, tapirs, orangutans, a wide variety of primates, some rare types of pig and deer, and a lot of reptiles. The animals appear to be well-cared-for, socialized with others of their species, and the public-facing exhibits don't seem to be the limit of space that they have. The zoo also has a pretty strong conservation message woven into its exhibits.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A MUST TO SEE FOR THE EXPERIENCE
REVIEW_BODY: This is a fun and educational street to visit. You experience one of the different parts of Singapore.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These are the best gardens we have been to. As all things in Singapore it is meticulously designed and very well maintained. The orchid gardens are a must see, so many varieties & the colours are amazing. It would be easy to spend 3 to 4 hours at the gardens and it is accessed by the very efficient MRT with the station right at the entrance.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the place to come to if you want a tour of Singapore River in a bumboat. Also lots of old style chinese buildings with pins and food places.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must visit place specially for school students as the place is very informative on flora and fauna found in tropical forests.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Botanical gardens are beautiful. Pay a few Singapore dollars extra for entry into the stunning orchid gardens. You won't be disappointed.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore
