REVIEW_BODY: Do not miss this. This ride will give you a wonderful birds eye view of the city and Sentosa. Plan the ride in the night.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As I commented in another review posted on the Gardens by the Bay, it is worth getting up on the Skyway to view the gardens from different angles. You take an elevator to go up, and to come down, you have a choice of taking the other elevator or walking down the spiral staircase. We walked down and was able to observe the artificial Supertree in detail from the inside.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Family had a wonderful time exploring the colourful and beautiful flower arrangements and decorations. Very picturesque and since the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest are all indoors, there's plenty to admire without weather interventions.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens of Bay is an interesting place and I had heard a lot about it before my arrival. It's a nice place to spend an evening and the two major attractions, the Flower Dome and Cloud Dome are nice too, though the Cloud Dome was under maintenance, when we decided to visit. Could not stay to see the Lighting's on the Artificially made flower. It's once a visit place.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely way to get an overview of the city. Suggest going during the day so that you can get good pictures. If you go at night, it is difficult to get any good pictures because of the reflections from the lights on the glass. Worth the money for a full 30 minute rotation. Suggest buying tickets online to avoid the que.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The music and light show at Gardens by the Bay is something that has to be experienced. Fantastic light show, fantastic music and fantastic atmosphere. And all free of charge. Fantastic!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing garden but closes too early
REVIEW_BODY:
We had a great time here but it was a short visit since the park closes very early. The park is beautiful at night time and it's a shame that it's not opened during a few hours in the night (until 10 or 11 pm)._x000D_
It's worth the visit for families, couples or even friend groups.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This was a good spot for us and our 17 month old. They have frequent bird shows that vary and bird feedings as well. These were fascinating to our daughter. There is also a tram that goes around the park so you don't need to worry about walking with your little one very far between attractions. We paid for the tram ticket ($5 online) but they never asked to see our tickets as a heads up._x000D_
_x000D_
Also, for small kids, there is a water park area which is free and open till 5pm or so. You need to bring swimwear though so be forewarned. It looked amazing but we didn't have time to go in since it was close to closing time. Additionally there are eateries on site and basically it's just a relaxing place to spend an afternoon. Well worth checking out if you have little people who are into birds like ours!
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Chinatown was included as part of our city tour. It was a busy area, very clean and tidy, and a wonderful place to purchase some souvenirs. It has places to eat, pharmacies and a variety of other shops. Well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went on our day using the hop on hop off bus. A gorgeous place to visit if you like gardens. Free but need money to get into the National Orchid Garden which I would recommend. Lovely waterfalls, check what's on as there it is a concert venue too.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The guided tour was very informative and the presentation of each room was so realistic. A real insight into Singapore's role in the war.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing landscaping showcasing a wide variety of flora and fauna!
REVIEW_BODY:
Well manicured gardens, spacious walkways and wheelchair friendly park show casing a wide variety of flora and fauna from all over the world. Visited both domes and was pleasantly surprised by the air conditioning which was a nice relief from the topical heat. Loved the Chinese New Year themes and â€œphoto boothsâ€ where staff would help take photos. Staff anywhere else were helpful with touristy shots as well!_x000D_
In all a delightful experience and would highly recommend to visitors and locals alike!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The gardens are beautiful with a wide range of orchids. It's a photographer's delight with so many excellent breeds to see and shoot. Never seen such variety of Orchids in so many colours before. We are so glad that we included the gardens in our itinerary._x000D_
The 5 SGD entry ticket is totally worth it. The souvenir shop is interesting and sells Orchid tea.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There are several activities for the whole family. There are garden displays, tree to walks, light shows at night, restaurants, a fountain area for children to play in to cool off and a children's play area.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I often walk there. Great scenery across the harbour. The high walking bridges are remarkable. I recommend to visitors. Wear a sun hat.
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The best place to see business district in Singapore at noon. At this place, you can watch the fountain show. With many light effect made this show very beautiful. Pick your seat, enjoy the show, and you will be feel amazed.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Was truly amazed at the sight that this garden provided against the skyline of Singapore. Beautiful lights in the evening and huge place to explore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A place for people that love flowers.... We like to shot the Beautiful flowers there. I like the weather inside the doom.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great experience. Must visit. After the tram ride, one must walk inside the zoo also to feel its beauty
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not a place for a polar bear
REVIEW_BODY:
Great friendly service from all staff ._x000D_
Well designed enclosures . Informative displays ._x000D_
Beautiful grounds ._x000D_
BUT the one thing that is difficult to accept is that an old polar bear , which appears to be lame , is kept in an enclosure that is open to the tropical heat . Surely if you must have a polar bear please give it an air conditioned enclosure .
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: if you like a traditional chinese architecture and buddhist place, don't miss this place. very easy walking from Chinatown and famous food street.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice pathway for cycle, jog or walk
REVIEW_BODY:
This park/pathway runs for about 10 Km along the beachfront alongside the east Coast Parkway. I usually cycle with relatives from Singapore on a borrowed bicycle, but there are bike rental stations at both ends. You are on a path the whole way, so no need to worry about vehicle traffic. Plenty of other cyclists, joggers and walkers, so there's always someone to say hi to, or even help if in trouble._x000D_
There's a hawker centre at the eastern end near Changi/ferry area, with plenty of good, cheap food. I usually get some nasi lemak here, and then do the return trip back to town._x000D_
Singapore has some great urban planning, and this park/pathway is an example of that. I try to do it every time I come
ADDRESS: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road, Singapore 455486, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I bought e ticket for all access.._x000D_
My family including 5 yo boy enjoyed every attractions._x000D_
Really amazing way to combine art and science._x000D_
A bit confused to get there when using bus..but not a big issue.._x000D_
You just need consider walking distance if you need to walk with small kids
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited these gardens only briefly whilst staying overnight on a stop over. I would love to have had longer to look around._x000D_
The trees are amazing but I did think the cost of the walkway between them (up high) was a little pricey._x000D_
We didn't haveanywhere near long enough to have a good look round and would like to spend longer there in the future as they are big gardens._x000D_
My only criticism is how difficult they are to find on foot- we had to ask a few different people to be able to find them.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a cool bridge to get photos of the bay and surrounds from, especially at night or at dawn when the sun is just rising.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is great especially if you have kids but even adults can enjoy and more importantly learn a lot about various species of birds. This bird park is on the jurong Island but very easily accessible by taxi and by bus. By taxi it takes 22 Singapore dollars. As you enter you have an opportunity to get close with some birds and take pictures and then you have two options. A ride by tram which takes 20 minutes around the park.There is commentary so one can know what one is seeing. one can stop at each junction and visit the birds before getting on the tram again. The other option is to do the entire stretch by walk which would be my recommendation so one can take some great pictures of the birds up close. so, start your day early incase you are planning to visit this place. In addition, there are two shows-king of skies and birds. both are recommended as its fun to watch. The message of conservation, environment protection was very clear in this park. Must see in Singapore. One can visit this park separately or buy combined tickets for the zoo and the safari and the bird park.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: GBTB is nice to visit in the day time for pictures, knowledge (about flora and fauna in the area), and also to jog. At night, there are lights shows along with music which is a must see!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The streets are well lit up in the evenings making it quite lively and colourful. There are several eateries all around offering local cuisine are very affordable prices
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Marina bay as a place is nice but a bit expenssive for everyone, but it is a nice place to enjoy and taking pictures of high buildings
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice but not for family with young kids
REVIEW_BODY: Starts at nights. When the tram drive through sleeping animals . Young kids got sleepy. The animal show not bad interrupted by rain . Fire show at the entry good too. I would go again I will go without kids!!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We are not the biggest horticulture fans, but the Botanical Gardens and the orchid garden are definitely worth a visit. A lovely way to spend a couple of hours.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: While in Singapore we went to see gardens by the bay. Its actually air conditioned garden which is manmade yet comforting to see lot of variety. Witnessed cherry blossoms of Japan in March here which was beautifully done. One should visit it to beat the heat also.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fresh air, enjoyable walk. Really live the orchid and the gazebo in th middle of the garden. It is really good also for running or jogging. And it's Free.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Stopped by after dinner to see the laser show and look at the night view of the beautiful city skyline. Marina Bay Sands is the center of it all and offers beautiful view at night (seen from across the hotel). if you are in Singapre, definitely have to stop by at least for a few minutes to absorb the beautiful night skyline.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited at 15:30 and walked straight up to the flyer and into a pod by ourselves. Staff very friendly and welcoming. The walk to the flyer through the exhibits was a bit boring and I felt like it's just a typical sales promotional thing to make you feel you are getting your moneys worth and also to distract if you have to wait in line for ages._x000D_
Views spectacular and ride very smooth. Probably one of the highlights of Singapore. A night time trip would be great also however imagine it would be busier.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion moved from its location since I last visited it in 2008. A lot has changed, and the new location provides a close up view of the Merlion and the surrounding Marina Bay where you can see the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and the opera house.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful way to spend a few hours.
REVIEW_BODY: Since Singapore is such a vibrant bustling city we found a free walking tour of the gardens a beautiful change. We booked a free Heritage walking tour on line and were escorted by a very knowlegable mature lady who moved at a cracking pace and filled us with a huge amount of information. We had our own personal guide which was lovely. The gardens are beautiful and well worth a visit .
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to breakaway and chill in nature
REVIEW_BODY: Be sure to enjoy the late afternoon here and wait till the light show. Kids will love all the colours and photographers paradise to grab amazing colourful shots.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The extensive Botanic Gardens are well worth visiting and one of my favourite gardens to date. There are many different areas to explore , including the Orchid Garden which is a must. The gardens do not charge an entrance fee, but there is a small charge for the Orchid Gardens which were very beautiful._x000D_
There is an area where food and refreshments can be bought, plus a shop to buy souvenirs._x000D_
I would definitely recommend a visit here.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A spectacular venue! Wonderfully, yet surprisingly, laid out for a pleasant and streamlined visit. Well worth visiting.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth doing if you are holidaying in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The half hour ride around the flyer gave plenty of time for photo opportunities of all the city views. May be considered expensive - however most activities are. Would recommend for first time visitors to Singapore, and have been told by may locals not to do the flyer of a night as you don't get to see much of the city (just lights), we went late afternoon and were able to see most things expect it was cloudy obscuring more distant parts of the island.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very good experience as a visitor and the way it is made and maintained, one could appreciate the thought process behind this development
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Cheery Blossoms Season at Flower Dome
REVIEW_BODY: I think the ticketing price is reasonable I brought my parents there. However, I did not enjoy the promotions cos I bought it online. Hope that Gardens by the bay could include promotions online too. The Cherry Blossoms experience was awesome. There were 3 colours - Pink, white and light green. I always like flower dome cos it is air conditioned. The plants were well-maintained, sufficient seat benches for elderly to walk and rest frequently. The effort to set up in Jpanesed-themed garden was good too. Timed entry allows crowd control too, it was an awesome experience to visit Gardens by the Bay with my parents for their first time and my multiple times. Thank you for organizing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We loved these garden, wish we had more time. We wandered through and saw some awesome sights including large reptiles and the beautiful orchid gardens ($5). This is a UNESCO world heritage site, which are always good to see. Take a picnic, spend time amongst the trees or on the lawns- there are a lot of places to relax and enjoy the space.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: we went there after dinner and the show is very nice with very good sound effects, really enjoying there
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: In Orchard Road you will find alot of Hotels, eateries and malls, its a good thing our hotel was just walking distance, actually it was just around the corner.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great place to chill out in the shady walks around n a good orchid n plant Nursery which houses one of the most exotic flowers. There are nice n inexpensive cafes n pavilion to take in the greenery n fresh are at the same time indulge in a nice cuppa..highly recommended to visit on your stop over..
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the few free places to visit whilst in Singapore. I spent hours here walking all over these beautiful gardens easy to get to with MRT or busses.The more you walk the more beauty you discover. Don't miss this treasure while in Singapore. Bring a hat and water.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I recommend to visit this place at around afternoon. There are few spots to see and itâ€™s better to visit while daylight is still there because orchid garden closes in the evening. I would suggest to start with the map of the place so that you know where are you now exactly and which spots are nearby to you and you can plan accordingly. Enjoying the â€œsong of the treesâ€ is worthwhile. There are two schedules with one hour difference between them. Trying the sky bridge was a good experience indeed and it didnâ€™t cost much too! From there you can enjoy a good view of the Singapore City._x000D_
_x000D_
Additional tips: Itâ€™s 15minutes walking distance from Marina Bay.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Marina Bay is amazing place to see and visit. It is very nice to see it at nights with lights reflection on sea. Great city side to be in. Don't miss it.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An excellent experience. Make sure you visit the various different dome attractions. The preservation of the natural environments in the domes is amazing and allows you a close-up view.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This garden has the widest variety of orchids I have ever seen or even imagined. There are even insectivorous varieties! The colors are all amazing - every one of them. Too beautiful to describe.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: unique exhibition of large river habitats
REVIEW_BODY:
Very interesting exhibition of life in the largest river systems of the globe (Mississippi, Amazon, Nile, Yangtze and others). Never seen anything comparable and I've been in many zoos and aquariums around the world._x000D_
_x000D_
Small drawback: The provided information is quite minimalistic, but hey - there is always wikipedia if you want to know more about the animals you are watching. i.e. bring your smartphone with data enabled.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Easily accessed from the city by train and bus. Well laid out, easy to get around (walking or tram), plenty of food options and lots to see. The animal enclosures are nice and plenty of cool animals to see. Expect to spend at least 4 or 5 hours there - at a leisurely pace._x000D_
_x000D_
Tip: get the multi park ticket - they are all next to each other and better value for money
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
So, this place is great for some inexpensive retail therapy. You practically get everything here. Curios, antiques, clothes, household items etc..you name it and it is there._x000D_
_x000D_
I was particularly impressed by the art shops that carried some inspiring work and the Tintin shop that just took my breath away. There are a lot of eating joints where you can rest your tired feet and eat a morsel or two._x000D_
_x000D_
Go here in the evening. the weather will be bearable.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Even though I don't like heights
REVIEW_BODY: Not that great at heights but this has to be done. It's well planned and feels like a little adventure as you climb to the top and then work your way down.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I did not get to see the tooth but liked hearing the monks chant and sing on the first floor right inside the entrance. I have seen Buddhist monks praying in Japan and Thailand, and I found this Chinese style to be very interesting.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This safari is always a pleaser. Have been here multiple times and always great to see the animals at night. Only complaint I have is the food on the outside. The food is extremely overpriced! We paid $55 for 2 burgers and chips then $15 for a 1 scoop ice cream cone.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Must visit this whilst the light show is on, the music and lights is amazing. Well worth the trip to watch this free event.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is an engineering marvel. The capsules are so large and spacious. The view of Spore from different levels is awesome. A must visit attraction.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Tourist spot, but fun for a couple of hours
REVIEW_BODY: This is definitely a tourist spot, specializing in shopping for souvenirs and food. Prices are inexpensive and it was a fun way to spend a couple of hours. The architecture in the area is very colonial, and I enjoyed seeing it - it's lovely. This is a spot on the hop-on, hop-off tour. I would recommend a stop here.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Best place to visit. You will really invite your friends to see the place. Food there also excellent. No doubt is a charming place in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very Good but slightly expensive @ 33 SGD pp. Nice to watch in the night only as you will find fully coloured singapore city.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great tour, learnt more about Singapore in WWII
REVIEW_BODY: We learnt more about the fall of Singapore. The tour was very well presented by Jing Jing, she was very knowledgable and her personality kept us listening intently.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the places to go shopping in Singapore. The souvenirs are mostly the same as other places, but how do you find that special thing if you don't look? Perhaps it's here. It has the only Michelin- star street food stall, which we didn't try as we'd just had our lunch! Will try it next time we go. The temple is worth a look, too.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This Ferris wheel is a great way to see Singapore from above. There are great photo opportunities to be had, would definitely recommend.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's big, the views are outstanding but allow a couple of hours for the whole experience, camera, binoculars & water are all necessary
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great area to explore. The Sky Walk is a must between the supertrees. Easy access by lift with outstanding views of Marina Bay
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Breakfast with the orangutans did not meet my expectations. I was so looking forward to this but was disappointed. I was expecting more than just a five second photo with the orang-utans in the background. If you are fortunate enough to be able to eat right up close to the animals, you are very lucky because you actually get a view of them. Whereas, our table was a good 10 metres away with a stone pillar in the way._x000D_
_x000D_
You can't touch or feed them, which I understand, but just be aware, don't expect to get to spend much time with them either. If you sit close to the action, I'm sure that your experience will be more enjoyable. There was a good variety of food choices which were all very tasty._x000D_
_x000D_
NB be speedy to get your seat up close to the animal display, or you could find yourself, like me in a seat a long way away and facing the wrong direction.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: took my family to ride on the Singapore flyer. We were put in to a totally over crowded cabin full of screaming kids. There was no space to st and had to stand right through out the ride in a cabin full of screaming kids.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Mostly stuff you would not want to take home
REVIEW_BODY: Compared to Chinatown in Sydney, the Chinatown in Singapore is not as nice. The prices are cheap, but what you get is mostly junk. I advise strolling through here just to see it, but don't budget too much time for it.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is a must.. there are zoos all over the world...but no other attraction does it the way Singapore does. I've never seen such animals in this type of habit / enclosure. skip the tram ride if you must but the trails are mind blowing. a must for every visitor .. money well spent..and avoid the gift shops if you got kids...the soft toys are irresistible !
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's a great afternoon activity with friends or family. The garden is spacious with areas for picnic. There are a lot of exotic orchids in the garden that I haven't seen before!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its a free attraction apart from entering the domes.. its an amazing experience a must see. The urban trees are fantastic especially when lit up.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well this is the place where you can get to see the massive Panda .. This is the highlight of the river safari .. do not miss it at any cost .. It is a decent affair .. you also get a chance to sit in a cruise and have a river sruise .. you see some animals while on the cruise .. The only problem is they are in very small enclosures for their liking .. woul like to see them move around more freely .. Tha amazon boat ride is a highlight
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Pleased that we went and had another look. The gardens are well maintained and look great. Well worth visiting.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Buddha Tooth Relic Temple is a remarkable four-storey temple. When entering the gate, youâ€™ll immediately notice the stunning main hall with its high ceiling. It is located at 288 South Bridge St. It opens at 7am and closes at 7pm and is free of charge. The bell tower and drum tower are on the same floor. However, the main focus for most visitors is the solid gold two-metre stupa on the fourth floor which is the place where the sacred relic is kept. Continuing up to the roof, there is a pagoda that has a large prayer wheel. A mandala is a spiritual and ritual symbol in Hinduism and Buddhism, representing the universe and the temple is built based on this symbol. Tours are available and take about 1 hour. There is a little teahouse located on the second floor which is a nice place to relax after the tour. Tea and some vegetarian cuisine is served. The temple holds ceremonies on a daily basis; visitors are allowed to take photos, even during services. Avoid off-the-shoulder T-shirts, shorts and mini-skirts as dress with respectful attire is required when visiting the temple.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit for animal lovers
REVIEW_BODY: No doubt Singapore Zoo (along with Night Safari, River Safari & Jurong Bird Park) is one of the most famous Zoo on this planet. With a lot of endangered/exotic animal exhibits it's worth a visit with family (specially children).
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens were wonderful and the light show was great. Not sure I would go again. Definitely recommended for every to see once.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Do go - amazing views day or night time. Just wander around & admire the stunning skyline & waterfront.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
You can purchase vouchers 48hrs on line before your intended visit (to make sure you get up there on the day you've chosen) print them off and exchange them at main reception in tower no1 for your tickets to accsess the elevator whic is located at tower no3. Just ask for directions to the elevator when you collect tickets it's about a 10min stroll no problem._x000D_
There is a fantastic view of the city and surrounding area when you get up there ,well worth a visit in my opinion. If you want to see the light show properly i would suggest you view from down below from around where the lion water feature is located opposite the Marina Bay Hotel because you can't see very much of the light show from the viewing deck. We went up at dusk to have enough light to take some pics before the sun went down and then capture the city skyline and the laser show when it got dark. You don't see very much of the laser show as it is mostly consentrated on the M B S Hotel._x000D_
I think it was $23(SP)pp for a ticket to the top.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Flower Dome is a part of Garden by the Bay. it is amazing place, near metro (MRT) station. if you are with kids, better to have a pram or use shuttle. it is very very beautiful place with great technology
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really nice orchid gardens, well worth the $5 entry fee. Many types and vibrant colours as well as an area that is air conditioned... The gift shop is not a typical tacky souvenir shop but actually stocks high quality stuff - we would have liked to have bought a lot more things but were sticking to a budget (did buy some orchid earrings).
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the bay is a must do experience while in Singapore . Such a lovely way to spend an afternoon .
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I strongly recommend to go at night but I'm sure it's also great by day_x000D_
Well run as is everything in Singapore_x000D_
We pre purchased the tickets on website to avid Q's but on the night in question that we visited there were no Q's_x000D_
Stunning views in a safe environment
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I signed up using the ASTC passport program. It is nice to enter for free. Or else pay $12 per adult. A very educational place. There are many exhibitions and plenty to explore. You will need at least 3 hours to explore. Kids can get wet at the waterworks. There is also other facilities like snow world nearby. Jurong east mrt is 10 minutes away.
ADDRESS: 15 Science Centre Road Singapore Science Centre, Singapore 609081, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Chinatown is a great place to bag a bargain or find somewhere to eat. The CD shops are also very special. Loved this place.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Had a private of the Orchid garden which is stunning! Quiet and peaceful after hustle and bustle of the city! Beautiful orchids and laid out really well! Loved the gold orchids for sale! Well worth a visit for an hour or so.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I always enjoy visiting this Dome, along with the Cloud Dome, when I'm in Singapore. This time the theme was "Cherry Blossom time in Japan" and unless I get to visit Japan when the cherry trees are in bloom, it will possibly be the only display of cherry blossoms that I get to see._x000D_
_x000D_
It was lovely to see a lot of Japanese people, many of them elderly with younger family members assisting them, enjoying the sight of the blooms. I can imagine that it would have been a very nostalgic experience for them.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: In my opinion, its a over hyped place. View from top is just fine. Its not one of the finest, I have seen before
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: a fabulous experience - a lovely collection of many different orchids beautifully displayed part of the botanic gardens which is a must
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I went with my husband and teenage daughter. It came highly recommended by a friend who lives in Singapore. We loved the shows and the animals were cool. Don't miss the Bat House!_x000D_
It's a bit out of the way and we found the best way for us to get there and back was by taxi which added to the price. Also it's not cheap so I would recommend getting there when they open to get your money's worth.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When it gets dark at 7pm each evening there's one place which you simply must visit at least once and that is the night safari at Singapore zoo. Walking around at night seeing the nocturnal animals running around is a wonderful sight and one which i will rememver for a very long time
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Admission is free but you have to pay to enter the Orchid gardens. Well worth it. Pleasant gardens, an hour will suffice but you could spend much longer there.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The moment you walk into cloud forest you'll be greeted by a man made giant waterfall and that will take your breath away. You will then ascend to the top of a man-made structure and then walk down slowly while enjoying the different type of plants and flowers along the way. Exciting!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very modern location in there. Hotel, casino, mall, river view, boat. One of best view tourist attraction.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
One of the best gardens I ever seen_x000D_
_x000D_
1- Flower Dome with 30,000 plants from: (olive grove, mediterranean garden, California garden, south american garden, south african garden, Australian garden, the baobabs, succulent garden and the flower field)._x000D_
_x000D_
2- Cloud Forest with 60,000 plants: (lost world, cloud walk, waterfall view, the cavern, the falls, crystal mountain, secret garden, treetop walk, earth check and + 5 degrees)._x000D_
_x000D_
You could spend 2 hours easily in each dome._x000D_
_x000D_
Cost is 28 $
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Our hotel, Singapore Hilton was on this road. It was very convenient to get on the double decker bus, catch a taxi, & just walk & shop. We could not BELIEVE there was 3 levels of shopping underground. My wife was in Heaven...
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's wonderful, including Asian Painting from Singapore, Malaysia, Philippines, Vietnam, Indonesia & etc. also British empire exhibition is attending these days. In Level 2 you can see two most popular masterpiece painting that printed on back of 50 SD note.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Singapore Zoo is amazing. I visited during day and night. Just don't think the night experience adds much. There's a very long (~1 hour) wait for the tram. And though the ride is nice, not worth all the hassle to get there and back._x000D_
I much prefer the day visit.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Kranji War Memorial is a place that once visited will never be forgotten. I visited the Memorial during my National Service. Least we forget those that made the ultimate sacrifice.
ADDRESS: 9 Woodlands Road, Singapore 738656, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must do for orchid enthusiasts
REVIEW_BODY:
On a hot steamy morning, taking a leisurely walk through these gardens cooled the brow and stilled the spirits - featuring beautifully designed floral beds, metaculously manicured lawns, ancient tree specimens signposting Singapore's history... all leading to the stunning orchid garden._x000D_
The orchid garden is the only part of the garden that you'll need to pay to get into and is well worth S$5- entry._x000D_
The range of orchids on display is the widest available in Asia and was memorable._x000D_
You'll need half a day to enjoy all the gardens have to offer._x000D_
Like all of Singapore's attractions that we visited, the gardens were superbly well maintained with all amenities that a visitor would want._x000D_
Recommended.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was truly something to see. Itâ€™s one thing to see during the day, but in order to get the full affect you need to see at night. Unbelievable.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There are 2 light and sound shows every weeknight at 8pm and 9pm respectively. Many people come early to get a good sitting spot as it gets crowded around show time.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Very big garden, you can spend the whole day here to relax
REVIEW_BODY: The garden is very big, you can spend the whole day there to relax. The entrance is free, one small part of the garden is 5$. Be sure to have 2 or 3 hours available to visit it.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Enjoyed the air conditioned green houses with numerous wild flowers, plants, and trees. Surprisingly cold in the Cloud Forest; you may want to bring a light jacket! Many seasonal displays focusing on holidays; overall a very enjoyable experience.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Anyone visiting Singapore should make time to visit this place at night as the light show is fantastic and all for free.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If I was teaching engineering, I would use this bridge. Great place to go for pictures of the harbor. If you are riding a bike, take the exit before the mall so you can go down the ramp -- otherwise you are going to have to carry your bike down stairs.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: In the midst of hot humid Singapore, this wonder is a must visit. I only had time to see the cloud forest, it is a spectacular vertical garden, about 6 stories high and air conditioned so it's a great relief just to walk inside and feel that cool humid air. It's quite expensive (16sd for visiting 1 exhibit, less for locals), but well worth it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The botanical garden is very huge and a nice place to relax amidst the busy tourist visit. But, recommended only if there is spare time unless you are a nature lover. But, prepared to walk about 2 kms from the nearest MRT.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We stayed two nights at the Marina Bay Sands and had a view these amazing gardens and the nightly light show. We were only able to spend a couple of hours one afternoon in the gardens, but I can't recommend it enough. Really magical with the towers. I would like to return and watch the light show from garden ground level.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was our 3rd and 4th Visit in as many as 3 years. I didn't think the kids would still love going there as much but they did and the biggest reason is the Penguins they love the Penguins Enclosure and the Penguin Feeding makes it unique and memorable for the kids. The park will be moving soon to Join the rest of the Wildlife Reserves but for now it's in Jurong, unfortunately there is no way to get here direct with the MRT but you can get a bus from the MRT we went from Boon Lay. The park is amazing clean well maintained the Birds are well looked after there is also a small Water Play area which the Kids loved. They also have some great shows The High Flyers club is a really fun show. If it's your first time visiting Singapore this is a must visit place.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place to sit and relax
REVIEW_BODY:
Hi I had visited this with my daughter and wife in the evening_x000D_
It got really beautiful once it gets dark_x000D_
There is nothing much to see other than the iconic Merlion and the bay sands behind._x000D_
The view at night is really beautiful_x000D_
You can spend upto 1-2 hours here not more according to me.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the Gardens by the Bay one afternoon. We went inside both the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome. The Cloud Forest had a ceiling to floor waterfall which you could go right to the top to see. (lifts available). The Flower Dome had a Sunflower Theme so there were hundreds of sunflowers. In the evening there is a light show from the 'trees'. The light show is accompanied by music and lasted about 15 mins. This show is on twice a night. On the way back to the MRT we saw the 'Baby' sculpture by Mark Quinn. This baby weighs 7 ton and appears to be floating.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A nice cool reprieve on a hot day. Amazing plants and exhibits. The waterfall is stunning. Well worth seeing
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Well worth visiting but it's not walking distance from the MRT (cloest stations are Changi airport or Pasir Ris) so will need to bus or drive/taxi there. For a small museum there is lots on display and many of the detailed stories and pictures are very moving so expect to wipe away a tear or two as you read them. Probably need a good 2 hours to really take in everything on display. Some of the guided tours that visit Changi museum take in Johore battery and Changi beach which means less time at the museum - but visiting these places adds another dimension to your museum experience if combined together._x000D_
_x000D_
A very sombre and reflective place remembering Singapore's darkest days during WWII and those who paid the ultimate sacrifice. Definitely recommended.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Outstanding New Museum and Historical Building
REVIEW_BODY: Get here early when they open since there are long lines for tickets. This is museum is brand new and excellent in every respect. The galleries showcase outstanding Asian art and this historical building is fascinating.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud Forest is much the better of the two conservatories. The first thing you see is an enormous waterfall, before taking a lift to the very top, and walking back down. There are great views of Singapore, the vegetation is amazing, and the films and exhibits on climate change interesting and thought-provoking.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is just an extension of the zoo at night. Nothing exciting and surely cannot be called a safari. Do not expect anything remotely close to africa.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The temple is very huge and conveniently located on the main road. Recently refurbished, it is very well-maintained. Must visit for those who wish to get a glimpse of the Indian culture and religious practises in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 141 Serangoon Road, Singapore 218042, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A beautiful place to visit. The waterfall is a feature along with the variety. Really impressive set up in every respect.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful views of Singapore: the green city in action
REVIEW_BODY:
I went to Gardens by the Bay via the subway station in front of Marina Bay Sands Hotel, and only encountered the 'real' entrance later in my visit: thank goodness, as part of the attraction for me lay in the openness, the 'walk-in' feel of the park, and the absence of formality. You literally just walk into the site past the Dragonfly Pond - and keep walking in whatever direction you want, via the myriad paths and grassed areas. The flora and fauna is fascinating (though largely unsigned, so lacking a bit of information) and the people watching is just as interesting, especially in the more central open spaces. DO take the sky-walk - relatively cheap, no stairs involved and BRILLIANT views back to the city, and across Singapore Bay. Not for the faint-hearted though, or those with any fear of heights! I did not, on this occasion, go in the geodomes. I cannot imagine how hot it would be inside the rain-forest biosphere...The great thing outside is the proximity of so many shaded areas, plenty of seating, little footfall, and so the ability to take as much time as you want, resting, taking on water and enjoying the vistas._x000D_
The food court was a bit of a let-down, being rather overcrowded and impersonal; but I suspect they get through a massive amount of visitors, for moderately priced, mass produced fare.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We did a lot of walking and enjoying the sights of Marina Bay. We travelled on the river boat to see the beautiful light display. Well worth the money.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun park for family with kids!
REVIEW_BODY:
Went to Wild Wild Wet on Saturday, Christmas long weekend. I was expecting huge crowd but was pleasantly surprised that it was not as bad._x000D_
_x000D_
Entrance to the park has changed from our last time. We took locker. It is 10 dollar from small and if holding annual pass, 9 dollar._x000D_
_x000D_
We started with Kids slides and then Slide up! Slide up was thrill, it is like a free fall, seating in double tube, from a height forming a U. Feels as if you will go all the way and fall from other side. Good slide!_x000D_
_x000D_
Then we jumped into lazy river. Moved to Kids area. Then we did bigger slides. Torpedo was among the most thrilling. It took time to make my mind. 5.4..3..2..1.. the time inside the chamber builds up the fun._x000D_
_x000D_
We took break for snacking. We were 14 people including kids and headed to wave pool. We spent almost 40 mins and thoroughly enjoyed it. It is not big but whatever it is, is enjoyable with family and friends._x000D_
_x000D_
It rained heavily towards the evening and the park was closed, we were done by then but check the weather when you are going there to avoid disappointment._x000D_
_x000D_
Showers and changing area was clean and big enough. Overall we enjoyed, had a good time. Just one suggestion which we felt that, park can have one more wash-room area. Currently it is near locker room and with kids, you may have to walk a lot many times._x000D_
_x000D_
Recommended for locals. For tourists, it is not a very big park. If you love water parks and have sufficient time, you can plan for a half day; not a much though.
ADDRESS: 1 Pasir Ris Close E!Hub@Downtown East, Singapore 519599, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was in awe at this venue -one of the amazing engineering feats Iâ€™ve seen. To build this venue with its iconic building green garden surrounds - very relaxing
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the Best Zoo experience, very carefully planned and maintained. Easy for Senior Citizens and small children. Have all types of wild animal species from Hot and Cold climate, kept in their natural environment. Food is available inside and have good varieties. One can visit by Cabs or regular bus shuttles also available from nearby metro station - Ang KI Mio MRT station. Tickets are slightly expensive but the visit makes it worth.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Especially the flower dome and cloud forest are worth seeing as well as the super tree grove! Absolutely stunning! Must visit when in Singapore!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Not a huge area - only the very end. Tickets are expensive, although the view is spectacular. No seating or shade up there so it was very hot and humid. Photos are expensive, $30.00 for 1 print and $65.00 for a set. Small kiosk up there for snacks and drinks or the bar/restaurant (expensive).
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What an exquisite experience! The plantings were amazing and all the sculptures were absolutely brilliant!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lots of Food, nick naks and locals. Just watch the steps and uneven footpaths, i had a bad fall here.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: You need the whole day here
REVIEW_BODY: This is a fantastic place to get lost in. I went first thing in the morning then rested at one of the cafes to return around again. The displays are amazing and the design is unique . It is on my list to return to when I return to Singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: All ticket booths were closed..must buy on line
REVIEW_BODY: I was very disappointed, walked there from our hotel in the heat and humidity, to find no ticket booths open. Asked for help and the attendants sent us to another closed ticket booth...we could see that the flyer had people on it but many of the shuttles were empty..not happy at all
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazed at the quality of works by Singapore artists
REVIEW_BODY: My friends and I found out that Singaporeans and Permanent Residents enjoy free entry to the Singapore National Gallery's permanent exhibits recently when we brought an overseas friend to visit it. It was a first visit for all of us and we were pleasantly surprised at what we found. The friendly staff recommended a tour starting from Level 2 so we took the lift and made a beeline for it. We spent about 2 hours admiring the beautiful oil paintings that reflected a wide range of styles from realist to abstract. Some of the sculptures were also quite interesting. There were water fountains and baby care rooms which were very visitor friendly. Some paintings had commentaries that gave deeper insight into the political context or historical background on the work. Best of all, photography without flash was allowed and thus we could bring back memories of our favourite paintings and sculptures. The map provided a quick guide to where Not To Be Missed paintings were located so it made navigation a breeze.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Yet another high quality, extremely well presented attraction in SIngapore. Dovetails in very well with a vist to the Botanic Gardens and the adjacent Flower Dome.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A short visit to Science Centre
REVIEW_BODY:
Last weekend we visited the science centre for a short visit but ended up the whole day there. There are so many interesting activities at the Kids Stop, Snow City and the Omni Theatre. Most of the activities are interactive and educational especially for the children._x000D_
The Science Centre open daily but closed on Monday except school and public holidays. There are upcoming events like "one kind of science musical" at the end of Sept 2018, with fun and educational activities. Good for the whole family to enjoy real snow at Snow City. Enjoy and have fun, we did.
ADDRESS: 15 Science Centre Road Singapore Science Centre, Singapore 609081, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: okay to see but super crowded and not enough time
REVIEW_BODY: Booked the transfer and tickets through Duck Hippo and first bus out to zoo was at 6pm and then time go there was just crowded. First went to the creatures of the night and a bit disappointed as only saw a few animals, then went to the tram but very long queues and quite dark, not able to see that well. Last time here went to zoo in day and 100% so much better, more to see. If was going to choose the day Singapore Zoo is far superior, beautiful to walk around, allow 1/2 day, just so much better than the night safari, didnt need to queue through the day park is so spacious.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great architecture. Biggest man made catarract. Nice flowers. Stroller friendly. Pricey for what it is.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are very large with a wide range of exhibits, particularly enjoyed the lake areas and the orchids. Also some fantastic heritage trees. The weather can get very hot and humid on some days, if so I would recommend a walk around the Evolution and Healing gardens where you can get some shade. Very popular with locals particularly for early morning exercise, when you might even encounter one of the Monitor Lizards. Has its own MRT stop
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A peaceful getaway place to escape from the tourists and the crowds. More suited for locals, not recommended at all for tourists who would like to cover and its other attractions in the limited time.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You definitely have to visit the gardens by the bay. Go during the day time and also visit it at night time.. you don't have to pay anything unless you decide to go on the garden bridge and its only $8.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Supertree grove is massive by day and amazing by night. For those of us interested in vertical gardens this is tops and a real inspiration wanting to give it a go.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We love ArtScience Museum, especially the Future World Exhibition. We have been here countless times. Itâ€™s just such a great place for young children to play, to draw, to be surprised, easily to spend 1-2 hours here in an afternoon. Future World Exhibition is interactive, is fun, children love it. Museum made effort to update the content from time to time to keep it more attractive to regular visitors like us.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Great museum for kids, teenagers but also adults, they learn here a lot about nature, physics, history, human body, medicine, etc. Many exhibits are interactive, there are also regular shows and other activities. However, as this centre was opened quite some time ago, some exhibitions could be renewed._x000D_
With kids plan at least one full day.
ADDRESS: 15 Science Centre Road Singapore Science Centre, Singapore 609081, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I do recommend a visit to the Botanic gardens! Many informative signs along the track we walked, which I really appreciated.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lively bars and restaurants at night
REVIEW_BODY: We visited Clark Quay on a weekday evening on the recommendation of a tour guide, and we were glad we stopped by. Clark Quay is an outdoor mall filled with restaurants, bars, shopping, and entertainment. At night, there are lively crowds ready to eat, drink, and party. There are neon lights everywhere and live music can be heard at different restaurants and bars, either a live singer or music over a loudspeaker. There is also the option of taking a river cruise or riding some carnival-type rides by the water. It is definitely a fun place to explore. It seems like there is happy hour before 9pm and clubs that open as the night progresses. Enjoy!
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Light show at 9 pm is a treat to your eyes.
REVIEW_BODY: Light show at 9 pm is a treat to your eyes. It's a video show projected on water fountain with lovely music play in background.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's great grandeur. Any way because of too crowded on Saturday afternoon, It's make me rather upset.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The ground floor is mainly Chinese pottery. I personally didn't find it very appealing. The second floor exhibit of Asian religious art (sculpture, mainly) was nice and interesting, albeit not very large, and had good descriptive signposting. We didn't have the extra tickets to the Christianity exhibit, so we didn't see that. The downstairs restaurant was spectacular though.
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Yup. A must for many travelers from different parts of the globe who may never have the privilege to go to China, or taste so many ethnic Chinese foods in one or 2 streets. Aside from the mandatory souvenir shops, culture places and temples are all within walking interspersed with food courts, hawker centers, and a Michelin rated noodle joint -- don't laugh until you see the length of the line people are queuing and waiting to get their share.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Went with my family and I think this place is overhyped. Both Flower Dome and Cloud Forest were not that great. Me and my wife were very much disappointed and thought we wasted our money. We visited Singapore Botanical Garden in the morning and later in the day we visited this place and it is nothing in front of Botanical Garden and would suggest people not to waste time and money here instead directly enter Botanical Garden and National Orchid Garden. Entering Botanical Garden is free and S$5 for National Orchid Garden._x000D_
_x000D_
The best thing which we enjoyed here was the night show at Supertree grove. A must visit and I don't think you have to pay anything for that. Its just outside Flower Dome and Cloud Forest entrance.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Just like if you where in a clousd forest far away from here! It's magical, just magical as it shows us so much beauty. Defenetly worth the detour.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore Zoo holds so many exciting things to do. My favourite of then has to be the Night Safari. In the quiet and dark of night, take a face to face ride with the animals in the wild, uncaged and being themselves. This 30 minute adventure is absolutely awe inspiring.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A pristine (like everything in Singapore!) museum in an incredibly beautiful building. The museum was so large we only visited the history of Singapore exhibit, which was detail oriented, engaging, colorful, and very informative. We joined a group tour and the guide was excellent, though the exhibits are easily marked and you could pass through them on your own and still learn a lot. We were very impressed.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Typical cookie cutter mall with lots of designer brands which are over priced. Doesn't give a good insight into Singaporean culture at all. Nothing is really decorated or artistic to look at. Consumerism at it's worst.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Another fascinating place to visit if you are in Singapore. Stunning views of the city and just to experience the sheer size and structure of the Marina Bay Sands. A modern day wonder.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Yeah, it's just a garden, and you've seen hundreds before. But this one's very much worth seeing!_x000D_
_x000D_
Bring your walking shoes, and be prepared for lots of people! Gardens by the Bay is much bigger than it looks, so you'll be doing a lot of walking. It is, however, air conditioned in the covered areas, so at least you'll have a break from the heat._x000D_
_x000D_
You absolutely have to stay for the light show, but plan on leaving a few minutes early--there are so many people and getting out of there is insane.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When go in museum, can see many history of country , coins and place , from time to time got what changes , the most important is better bring along kids , this will get them know about everything's . Have air-con and they will felt comfortable .
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was a nice attraction and quick to visit. Definitely good to tick of the views from the top are lovely.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My Fiance and I went to this attraction, because he has been there before and was amazed. The small birds had heaps of space which was great to see. However, the bigger birds including the owls, and the ostriches (which lost most of their feathers due to stress i assume) have small spaces. I am usually opposed Zoo's as it is often a miserable view on animals in too small spaces. I wouldn't go again, as besides the small birds, the other birds barely have any room.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you like great shopping this is a must and inside the malls there is great food courts to eat really great. And lots of walking and things to see. At night on the street there is sometimes some live performances. I highly recommend
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Itâ€™s not really a cruise on the River. But it is an amazing walking aquarium.
REVIEW_BODY: We visited this park first since it is outdoors but covered walkways. Lots of amazing aquatic life. Manatees, huge fish of a variety of locations. Colorful and explanations were clear and in English. Highly recommend for children
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A Unique Experience Tucked in the Streets of Joo Chiat
REVIEW_BODY: It was a detailed and enjoyable tour held by Alvin who was very well-spoken and engaging in the way he told his stories and experiences regarding the Peranakan culture. The tour was set in a very cosy and down-to-earth setting and Alvin was very welcoming when it came to friendly discussions and questions by the guests. The food and drinks were palatable and a pleasant surprise too! Overall, I did learn a lot from this tour and felt that it was an authentic experience for me. Plus points for the energising spirit and engagement from Alvin!
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Really enjoyed going to Gardens by the Bay. Beautiful scenery and lots of information._x000D_
_x000D_
Was lucky enough to see the light show and it was amazing. Knew I would like it, but didnâ€™t realise how much I would find it so chilled even though there was so many people about just watching the show and enjoying._x000D_
_x000D_
Going back to Singapore this year and already planned to see it again.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Now gazetted as Singapore's first UNESCO World Heritage site, the Botanic Gardens epitomises the vision of both Singapore's founder Sir Stamford Raffles and founding prime minister Lee Kuan Yew. Not many know that Raffles himself was a keen naturalist, and he developed the first â€˜Botanical and Experimental Gardenâ€™ at Fort Canning. In 1859, all his efforts culminated in the founding of the Gardens at its present site. The Botanic Gardens is als connected with Lond's Kew Gardens because Kew-trained botanists had a hand in its development in its early days. As the main place from which the harvesting of the rubber tree was researched, it also played a pivotal role in the early economy of Malaysia._x000D_
_x000D_
This attraction is a well-maintained assortment of gardens worth taking a stroll through - and which will cost you nothing! There is a large pond with swans in it, and back in those days when I was schooling, monkeys also used to roam the place!_x000D_
_x000D_
When I was a boy my parents - like many other parents - used to brings us kids here to have picnics or to appreciate the greenery and the flowers. Because it is nice - and free. Among the places which left a tinge of nostalgia for me as a kid was the Sun Clock, the animal-sculptured plants and the Pavillion._x000D_
_x000D_
Performances and concerts are held here from time to time, and for food lovers, there is also a food court, resturants, cafes and other eateries. And you can shop at Gardens Shop after eating._x000D_
_x000D_
This place is ideal for cycling or running. And running can be done either within the gardens, or outside along the road acting as its perimeter, as the gardens is bordered by Holland Road, Evans Road and Bukit Timah._x000D_
_x000D_
There is also a herbarium, a lab and a library which may be of interest to botanists or enthusiasts._x000D_
_x000D_
Personally, I like to take walks through the Rain Forest in the Central Core and along the Swan Lake, as I find these walks stress-busting and recuperative._x000D_
_x000D_
The good thing about this place is that its accessibility. It is within walking distance from Orchard, and one of its exits is served by Botanic Gardens MRT station.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was a good experience watching animals in night time while chillaxing in the tram. One time watch!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A beautiful zoo with lots of great exhibits
REVIEW_BODY: Love the open plan orangutan exhibit, along with the white tigers, African wildlife and the polar bear. There is a lot of shade and beautiful landscaping/greenery. Lots of food and drink outlets and clean facilities as well. We ended up catching a taxi from our hotel on Orchard Road and it was only an $18 ride. There was a long line for taxis at the end of our visit (3.30pm) but as always, this moved pretty quickly and we waited no longer than 15 minutes. Highly recommend and look forward to doing the Night Safari next time we visit.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The views are great, the greenery is welcome and the engineering is interesting. This was a nice way to spend an hour, although the walk in the canopy was only 15 minutes or so of course.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: AMAZING - and the light show is free
REVIEW_BODY:
You really need to set aside quite a few hours here. We were advised to go late afternoon, so that we were there for the lights. I'm pleased we went a little earlier and spent nearly 5 hours there. It's definitley worth buying tickets for the FLOWER DOME & CLOUD FOREST. Buy these on line in advance and they are cheaper. Give yourself plenty of time as there is so much to see- and it was one of the best places we visited during our week there._x000D_
I'd suggest taking a picnic if you can as there is plenty of open space and places to picnic. The restaurants there were not great - and prices were not overly expensive but I didn't feel they were value for money. You must stay for the light show at the SUPERTREE GROVE.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautifully maintained and very peaceful. Worth visiting to just stop and reflect. Humbled by the fact that I was the first from my family who had the opportunity to pay respects to a great-uncle.
ADDRESS: 9 Woodlands Road, Singapore 738656, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited Chinatown 3 times and it was amazing. Great rows of shops and restaurants though it does pay to shop around for the bargains. Some restaurants were a bit pricey but most have menus outside so prices can be checked.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Decorations were still up from Chinese New Year, colorful. Lots of eateries, markets, etc. Like Chinatown in most cities
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This bridge is a piece of artwork that one walks upon. The helix bridge is a map of DNA, and portions of it contain information as such
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is tremendous that the City Hall and the Supreme Court have been conserved in this fashion. The buildings look fabulous, outside and in. Indeed, you can wander for hours admiring the buildings and the conversion without seeing much art at all! There is so much to do here for the Singaporean, with events and activities, school programmes, and educators programmes, with free General Admission. However, for "Non-Singaporeans", admission is $20, and admission including Artist And Empire was $30. To see this exhibition alone cost $25 for Non-Singaporeans ($15 for locals). Hence my "very good" designation, rather than "excellent". That said, if you are aware of the cost, and have the time to spend, a day here would be time and money well spent. The Artist And Empire exhibition was indeed excellent. And if you spend the day at the Gallery, there are plenty of food options, with the Owl Cafe being an excellent option.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lots and Lots of gift shops
REVIEW_BODY: If I had a choice between China Town and Little India I would chose Little India every time, China Town seems more designed for tourists with hundreds of tacky shops elling gifts. There are some beautiful buildings but often behind modern structures ruin8ngntheir charm. The food is OK but again, better to be had elsewhere
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the first full day weâ€™re in Singapore and had walked here from our hotel in Clarke quay via the river, so through the financial district and over the helix bridge (that is a beautiful bridge and a sight to see and wonder at). It was mid afternoon when we arrived, and if we had our time there again we would have gone much earlier, only because there is so much to see. We bought tickets for both the floral dome and the cloud dome and both were spectacular! Although the cloud dome was our personal favourite! Once outside the snack stall was surprisingly cheap for a tourist destination. We then walked through into the gardens to see the super trees, we decided to do the skywalk between them and couldnâ€™t have time it better as it was sunset whilst we were up there (7pm in May) we then discovered that the light show was on at 8pm so we sat with everyone else on the floor and awaited and fun and lively light and music show set around the super trees, it was free and fun to watch and sing along with. We then walked back to our hotel ( at this point I think we were mad on jet lag, given how far we had already walked ) we wish we had had more time so we could explore the gardens around the super trees as even in the dark these looked beautiful and with plenty of interest. We lived Singapore and are intending to visit again - we will definitely be coming back to the gardens!!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to walk about and chill out with family and friends. Excellent scenery with people of all walks of life just buzzing about their adventure.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is no Petroscience Museum in Kuala Lumpur. Far, far away from it, unfortunately._x000D_
Confusing at the ticket counter - you have 1 general admission, but then there are several exhibits for which you have to pay more to have access to._x000D_
Science centre - messy. No clear path. It's easy to enter an exhibit the wrong way. Again, no Petroscience Museum, unfortunately._x000D_
Movie - the dome is of course impressive. Unfortunately, herds of yelling-irrespectful-bad-behaved students ''monitored'' by ''teachers'' with their noses stuck on their smartphones (cannot live without Instagram or Facebook, right?) completely ruined more than half of the movie, until I heavily complained with one of the ''teachers''. Management not only let these groups (around 150 kids) in the theater while the movie had already started (while the other spectators HAD TO BE there 10 minutes before the beginning), disrupting it, it didn't monitor the session at all. There was so much yelling and laughing that it was impossible to follow the narrator. And nobody cared. Horrible, horrible experience. Complete waste of time and money._x000D_
Butterfly exhibit - maybe the biggest one in Singapore, indoor. But absolutely miserable compared to the simple exhibit in the Singapore zoo. Also complete waste of time and money._x000D_
Coffee Bee - avoid this place at all costs. Any simple food stall in any simple food court anywhere in Singapore will serve food that is 10.000 better._x000D_
My kids and I completely wasted our day._x000D_
Avoid it at all cost.
ADDRESS: 15 Science Centre Road Singapore Science Centre, Singapore 609081, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
3rd time and it always feels like the first time. A must!!_x000D_
But please don't touch the plants or flowers, and control your kids._x000D_
Crazy that they still have to hire extra staff during the Sakura bloom to tell people and kids not to touch the flowers and plants. I myself had to tell 3 different people and not all mainlander Chinese even Europeans.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We booked 7.15pm entry tickets online on the same day .I would advice to see all 3 shows first and then go for the tram ride coz show times are specific and tram rides are available at any time. Taxi availability is less as compared to other places. So go early and return early May be by 9.30pm .
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Arrive at the time of gates opening and spend atleast till 3-4 pm. Keep the leaflet or the map of the park while entering the park. Note down the show/event timings and accordingly arrive at the place 10-15 mins early. Sit right in the middle of the stage. Best for kids aged 8 and above. Lot of walking is required. Do not bother to try the tram, you cannot see the park in detail.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited on a Sunday afternoon with two kids. Families with kids should take the tram otherwise it is a long walk. You can see a lot of different species. There are shows- do not miss them. Nice cafes inside and clean toilets. Overall recommend.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Located in the middle of the Botanic Gardens, this is definitely a place to visit if you love flowers. It houses the worldâ€™s largest variety of orchids. Itâ€™s truly an amazing experience and you get to see orchids in multiple colors, combinations, etc. There is an entrance fee of SGD5 but itâ€™s totally worth it!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bay is an absolute beauty, Singapore did a wonderful job on maintaining the place and keeping it family friendly._x000D_
_x000D_
It is a huge space, that you will be able to enjoy it still even on peak season. It also is very nice for practicing your photography skills as this place is very picturesque._x000D_
_x000D_
