So, if you have time. Check his place and be as amazed as I am.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A sobering change from the glitz of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Battlebox is an underground bunker used by senior officers of the British army in WW2, and was the place where the decision was taken to surrender to the Japanese. Our guide Jerome was very informative and enthusiastic about the subject. For my husband, it was the highlight of our visit to Singapore, and for me it was a few moments to remember the thousands of people who were killed and suffered in the conflict only a few decades ago.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It lasts about 30 min. to finish it. Sure the view is nice from the top, but it is so, so, so slow to get back down after you have seen the view.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I visited Gardens by the Bay a few time. It was a good place to chill with friends, relax and enjoy the music.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This was the biggest disappointment of our two week anniversary trip between Singapore, Bali and Taipei._x000D_
_x000D_
My first activity I wanted to experience and share our special moment was with Singapore Flyer, and that never took place. Two weeks before our trip I received an automated e-mail stating due to technical difficulties the Flyer was not operational. We were given the option to immediately cancel or wait. As this was once in a lifetime trip, I was hopeful and waited. Three days later a second e-mail informing me the Flyer would likely not be operational and they would process a refund. IF YOU BOOK IN ADVANCE, YOU PAY AT TIME OF BOOKING. I have no issue with that to secure special events such as dinner or slings on board. When they cancel, you are informed refunds take 6 to 8 WEEKS. Unacceptable. Airlines refund quicker than this and they are notorious for cancellations._x000D_
_x000D_
When we arrived in Singapore we learned more about the technical difficulties from locals. We also were informed management has changed in recent years and more "technical difficulties" have occurred where the Flyer is not operational. Two different tour operators told us they have recommended against bookings as this has become more recent with financial issues. Initially I would have thought "that's just tour operators steering visitors to other things." Then we visited the Singapore Flyer grounds. It was deserted, on a weekend afternoon less than 10 people we saw around the sprawling area of the Flyer. There has to be some validity if everyone is keeping away, and it's a shame. I always thought of the Flyer as an icon of Singapore. Yes, it's still lit at night and that's beautiful (hence 2 star and not 1). There is no timeline to get the Flyer operational, instead the same message is repeated on technical difficulties. If that's the case, be transparent and don't process refunds in 6 to 8 weeks. If guests are required to pay up front for bookings, finances should be in order to reimburse._x000D_
_x000D_
Overall, extremely disappointed.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We've been there twice now, the first time was a bit rushed but we allowed the whole day for the last visit and it was just so worthwhile. We ate at the only place there which was surprisingly very good, though looked a bit tacky. So many animals, etc, to see and the Zoo is so well laid out and easy to find your way around. It was a week-end so was super busy with all the locals out enjoying the day and the sunshine with their children who were the best behaved we have ever come across ever. Not a peep out of any of them !!!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Place To Walk For Two Hours
REVIEW_BODY: I went to Singapore on business in June 2016 for two weeks. I visited the Singapore Botanic Gardens twice. It is a great place to walk. Full of paths, lakes, plants and gardens, a very nice visitor center. It is near the MRT which is convenient. The only challenge is the hot weather in Singapore. I was soaking wet from perspiration. But this place is a must see. I can also share from a past business trip that in December they had a special exhibit of Christmas tree ornaments from around the world.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the most interesting attractions I have been to. Really something worth seeing. A definite must for all families.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful architecture, plant collections and relief from humidity
REVIEW_BODY: The park is free entry. The two domes - Cloud Forest and Flower Dome ($28 for all day entry to both) are cool and climate controlled as well as wonderful to wander within for 1-2 hours. The Giant Tree walk way is NOT included and costs a seperate $8. The walk is worth the price day or night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Stunning - day and night! Do both !!
REVIEW_BODY: Really great to see - day or night. Don't miss the bar at the top, especially at night. Set in beautiful grounds this really is a must see of Singapore!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Get there early to avoid the selfie brigade
REVIEW_BODY: You'll spend a lot of time admiring the splendour of this place. You'll also spend a lot of time dodging people taking selfies and close-up photographs of flower buds. Get their early to avoid the crowds and enjoy the natural serenity of the dome.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a yearly event for charity, to support those people who are needed more care and poorer family with special needs children. Marina Bay is the central area which is easy for all peoples to reached and all the company which is to support this event had lighted up purple's lighting in the evening, when you passed by the purple's lighting building, will feel so delighted and touched by their supportive, and supporters also purchased the purple's tee shirt and put on, when looked at the crowd just liked the purple's sea. Is so touched to see so many peoples had recognised this event, hope that every one can share with this events and support them.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very interesting afternoon in Fort Canning park and at the Battlebox. Guide was very knowledgeable and the tour was excellent. Tour my be longer than one hour.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is an excellent zoo .I really hope all zoos are made and operated like the one here .th animals look happy and healthy . Visitors have lot of activities from educational to just fun stuff happening all over .
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The orchid gardens were a highlight, and be prepared to walk quite a bit if you arrive from the botanic gardens MRT station!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This zoo is an outstanding experience due to a mass of animals, exceptional landscaping, and the surprising absence of cages
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the bay is full of a variety of flora. With changing exhibitions in the flower dome and the amazing cloud forest there is so much to see. The best part is the Super Tree Grove. The lights are superb and the Garden Rhapsody is a must see. You could also go on the Skyway (with a separate ticket) and enjoy views of Singapore city._x000D_
Exhibits change frequently so there is always something new to see.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is a great sightseeing stop for anyone with an who likes to wander around & enjoy the beauty of amazing plants, flowers & trees. It is a sight to be marvelled at & come night time when everything is lit up, it is truly beautiful
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion was once the symbol of Singapore, and my recollection of it from a visit in 1983 is that it was on the limits of the city. No more! But it is still an interesting place to visit with the white lion and the jet of water issuing from its mouth. Also the crowds of tourists! Eats and toilet facilities are nearby.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice bay, with its shores loaded with Singaporeâ€™s top attractions
REVIEW_BODY: With most of the major sightseeing attractions located within minutes of its shores, the bay area attracts most sightseers. It looks very different (Likely over 95% different) than my first visit to Singapore 37 years ago. The many attractions include watching the nightly light show from the opposite shores of Marina Bay, the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and its world-leading amazing architecture, SkyPark, Infinity Pool and other features, Gardens by the Bay, ArtScience Museum, Singapore Flyer, and much more.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Spectacular gardens, but it's difficult to breathe
REVIEW_BODY: I loved this place, it's miraculous. However, there is no way you can walk after spending some time there, the overdose of oxygen is incredible mixed with the humidity.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Botanical garden inside the glass dome is well maintained and has beautiful flowers. The cloud with waterfall was interesting had ramp and lift easy to walk around. The children loved it we were four adults with six kids(10years - 21 years) . Worth the visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Los of colourful shops, selling much the same merchandise - lots of souvenirs - so that is the place to buy such items. Plenty of restaurants and bars in the area. Easy to get to on the MRT line.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The most convinience place to get some delicious chinese food. Some of them actually won the michelin award. I like the ambience. It is bigger then Alor street even tough its smaller then dottonbury but i find this place have a unique ambience. And dont forget that u can always find some good quality and cheap souvenirs in this place. I have a chance to visit 2 of the mall this time. The peoples market has a casino in it and other stuff relates to that._x000D_
Good food, not so expensive and a good ambience of chinatown. Not the mention a good sunset view on summer.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: amzing and nice to complete in a day with help of tram service opted simply by walk is very difficult in a day with kids
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice park offering a lot of diversity...
REVIEW_BODY: In this Park you can spend minimum one day as it offers a lot of nice and interesting places. Started by the metallic trees, flowers dome
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: same concept as the hippo enclosure from the singapore zoo except that for river safari the concept applies throughout. it is just an attraction masked to house an expensive home for the donated pandas.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Finally made it to Gardens by The Bay. It is definitely worth a visit whether during the day or night. There is an entrance fee of Sing 28 per adult with a lower price for Singaporeans. Getting there is a breeze by MRT._x000D_
_x000D_
We spent a morning at the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest wandering around some well planned exhibits. To our surprise, the garden domes were air conditioned! There is plenty to enjoy for everyone including the sheer pleasure of walking amongst flowers and plants. The Flower Dome had an Xmas display when we visited and I suspect that thee are themed displays the year round to coincide with cultural festivals and celebrations._x000D_
_x000D_
We were heading towards Satay by the Bay for lunch and ended up at the food court which we assumed was Satay by the Bay. Not many stalls were open but this could have been because it was the Xmas period. I would recommend going elsewhere for lunch if visiting._x000D_
_x000D_
We didn't make it to the Supertree Grove so one more thing to do next visit to Singapore!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Jurong Bird Park was both interesting and different although I've got to say that this was not the best bird park I have visited._x000D_
The "bird show" itself was directed towards families with young children, which is certainly a good thing but perhaps not quite so captivating for those of us who were older._x000D_
I'm sure that the bird park would be excellent for those intent on recording their experiences through their cameras._x000D_
Well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It is interesting and yes you do get a good view of what I'd around Singapore. The brochure indicated that you could see Johore on a good day but we didn't manage to do that as it was rather cloudy when we went._x000D_
I am not sure you need to do skypark as well as the flyer as they are close by and you see a similar view._x000D_
My opinion is that you only need to go to one or the other for the views but then again some might want to do the visitor thing and go to both.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Magnificent view of Singapore and Gardens on the Bay from the 57th floor. Go up to the bar also and check out the view from another angle.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A gardeners paradise, with lots of exotic plants and fantastic sculptures spread throughout the gardens. There are plenty of things to keep your interest.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic views but take an umbrella if it's sunny!
REVIEW_BODY: Despite living in Singapore for more than 5 years, I had never walked on this bridge. My bad - the views from the Helix are breathtaking! The only potential downside: it can be incredibly hot as the Helix metal reflects the sun. So you might want to wear sunscreen or take an umbrella foe protection. Also, if you go around 6 pm, the sun is in a beautiful location for some interesting photos.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good way to spend a few hours indoors and air conditioned. If you live in a country with vast green areas you probably wouldn't appreciate the two domes. The Cloud Forest has a lovely evaluated walking track and a rain forest feel.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Walk in the Footsteps of Heroes!
REVIEW_BODY: The trail and reservoir was an area held by the British when the Japanese invaded Singapore in 1942 and was hard fought over ground. Know doubt unknown heroes still lie in their silent space around this area.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Stunning and beautiful- would definitely recommend. This place is amazing - great value for money - would recommend booking tickets online as they are cheaper.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A wonderful place to hike or cycle or even escooter .. beautiful view n feel of a forest and wonderful Reservoir view.. A excellent place to spend morning if you do not to do regular touristy stuff..
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
What is with metropolises thinking this is a good idea? "The city as a playground" maybe? "Did it for the skyline" perhaps?_x000D_
_x000D_
It is so mediocre. London did it. Vienna did. Vegas did it. Tianjin did it. Even Niagra Canada did it._x000D_
_x000D_
It's the most cheap and basic accessory a city can add, and personally feels desperate._x000D_
_x000D_
That said, this is the 2nd biggest in the world. So if you are a ferris wheel kinda guy, hey!_x000D_
_x000D_
Meh.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A wheelchair access review: All great but avoid Cloud Dome
REVIEW_BODY:
I had friends visiting from the US, but had broken my ankle so we decided to do this with me in a wheelchair. We visited the Flower Dome, Cloud Dome and had dinner at Satay by the Bay._x000D_
_x000D_
For someone in a wheelchair, the air conditioned domes are a wonderful respite from the Singapore heat. The Flower Dome has great access - the slopes are gentle and you can pretty much see everything from the wheelchair. There was a portion accessible only by a flight of stairs, and there was a nifty looking machine to bring you up if I wanted. Needless to say, the kids really wanted me to try it._x000D_
_x000D_
What surprised me was the Cloud Dome. I only found 1 lift to negotiate the different levels. The suspended walkways are broad enough for the wheelchair, but there were many levels that required traveling on the escalators. Given that the 1 lift was used by parents with prams, and wheelchairs like mine, it took so long for me to get anywhere, I eventually gave up and decided to wait for my friends at the ground level. To my horror, the final lift down to the ground floor brought me OUT of the Dome, and I had to backtrack to meet my friends before coming back out again. Let's just say it was not ideal, especially compared to how wheelchair friendly the rest of the Gardens was. If you have someone in your party in a wheelchair, you might want to think twice about going to the Cloud Dome.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There is no doubt that this is the pinnacle of orchid gardens. There are so many varieties that you can't keep track of. The actual area is not large and is part of the Botanic garden but every inch of it was filled with orchids of every size and colour. Definitely worth a visit unless you hate plants.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We saw this at night and saw the 8 o'clock show. Its lovely how the trees light up with music. It was part of the night tour bus trip
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The two kids love it. The cool environment and different types of vegetation as you walk up the forest is simply amazing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I visited Macritchie reservoir with my husband last Sunday. We were there to try out the nature trail, prunus trail, lornie trail and chemperai trail. It was a good walk for us, about 5+km in total, as we took our time to enjoy the greenery around us, it took us about 2.5 hours._x000D_
_x000D_
Do note there are a handful of joggers along the trails and sometimes there are marathon events scheduled there._x000D_
_x000D_
What we enjoyed most was walking along the wooden boardwalk along the reservoir, a precious feeling living in this city but yet having nature close beside you._x000D_
_x000D_
There is also a bistro and mushroom cafe eatery at the reservoir, do be prepared for a queue especially on weekends. The good thing is that if you need a can of 100 plus to keep you going, it only costs $1.40 per can from the cafe.
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great view of the river and City..
REVIEW_BODY: From here you can get a great view of the Singapore and also enjoy a small boat ride which is really nice and relaxing. The place also offers some great dining opportunities and fast food cafe's which has some great food to offer.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: enjoy a walk around this heritage area
REVIEW_BODY: had trouble getting directions coming out of the MRt but was just close buy as long as you go in the right direction. Worth a walk around, some nice places for food also.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited Flower Dome, Cloud Forest and the OCBC Skyway, spent around 5-6 hours there. Everything was beautiful and well maintained, plenty to see and take photos. Also a very good place to sit and relax because itâ€™s really cool inside compare to outside temperature in Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
We went up to the Skyway around sunset so the view and the sky was spectacular. We also stay up there till itâ€™s fully dark to capture photos of the light trees when theyâ€™re on._x000D_
_x000D_
The light show starts at 7:45pm and 8:45pm if I remembered correctly. This to me is the highlight of the whole visit to the Gardens. Do bring a picnic blanket so you could spread it on the ground and lie down to fully enjoy the light show._x000D_
_x000D_
All in all highly recommend you guys to give Gardens by the Bay a visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A cut above the average theme park
REVIEW_BODY: Even non-gardeners will not fail to be impressed by Gardens by the Bay. While the outdoor gardens and the Children's Garden are free, the two pay-in giant conservatories are spectacular and, by the way, deliciously cool after the humid Singapore climate. The Cloud Forest was possibly the stand-out hit with its indoor waterfall and misty heights. We ate at Satay by the Bay, an outdoor food court within the project. It's practically impossible to see all of Gardens by the Bay on one visit -- too tiring, but it's always good to leave something for next time!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A very clean and well maintained place.
REVIEW_BODY: It will take about 8 - 9 hours so plan your day accordingly and do not miss the shows. giant turtle, white tiger and Polar bear, marine Aquarium and Sea cow are top attractions.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful setting, Family friendly, Cool climate
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful setting for pictures and nice cool welcome break from the SG heat/humidity. Family (stroller, baby) friendly. Takes about 2hrs to do at leisurely pace.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The small Merlion was available the larger one was closed. I had heard so much about it I was expecting more. However the architecture around the area was AMAZING!!
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Iconic bridge spanning the Singapore river
REVIEW_BODY: This beautiful bridge completes the Marina Bay circuit a 5k walking/running track that circles the Marina Bay. The bridge itself gives great views of the Artscience museum (shaped like a Lotus flower. Most of the locals take pictures from the 1st platform, you can even pose so that it looks like the Lotus flower is sitting in your hand.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This space has plants from every continent but Antartica. Its climate controlled, but the amount of people got in the way of really enjoying the space.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Everything and all of it is here
REVIEW_BODY: high end and retail in the middle range as well. Orchard is a great place to browse. 2 km long with plenty to see and do.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a nice tourist place with good views of the bay in Singapore A nice little amble round in the afternoon was good.Lots of waterfalls and flowers.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You must visit this amazing gardens especially the cloud dom it something special and amazing gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Henderson Bridge is an architectural wonder. The best time is to visit during sunset. Once illuminated the bridge looks even more beautiful. Also a good place to walk around
ADDRESS: 221 Henderson Road Henderson Building, Singapore 159557, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was still pumpkin time and they were fantastic, and all real, unbelievable, they were setting up Christmas, , seem so many different plant s from all over the world, the pointsetia's fantastic so red and all kind of colours even pink!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: me and friends went to the zoo on a sunny day, the place is so cool, inside an eco-friendly forest, with all the trees saved for next generation, inside the zoo there's a river safari, its awesome, also the aquarium is fantastic with fabulous creatures from the sea.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is pretty good zoo. It's one of the few zoos around where animals have relatively more freedom than the caged ones we usually see. You can see the behavior of many of the animals is very similar to what is expected of them in the wild. Also the number of animals is much more than I anticipated (there's even polar bear and penguins). You may need an entire day to explore it completely. There are proper sheds over walkways, so you don't have to worry about cover if it rains and you didn't bring an umbrella. Special events are also organised for some of the animals where they do some stunts and other stuff (don't worry, it's perfectly safe for the animals). One of the other highlights was "Zoorasic park"- as they call it, where they have robotic dinosaurs, it's pretty cool as they look pretty realistic. You have choice on how you want to explore the zoo- on foot or open mini bus type vehicles (don't remember the exact name). The zoo is really big and I recommend taking the mini bus as it is less tiring and time saving. It's definitely worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The skypark has a spectacular view of Singapore. There is a infinity pool where you can swim and relax. There is a pool side bar. There is a restarants at the sky lark selling international food. Good experience and a fun day on top of Singapore
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
MacRitchie nature reserve is a nice day out. But it requires a day, or close to it._x000D_
_x000D_
A google search for the entrance to the treetop walk took us to the lower carpark. Until we arrived I didn't realise this was just the entry to the park. The tree top walk was a further 4km up the hill._x000D_
_x000D_
There is plenty of signage, but it is terribly inaccurate. For example, we passed a sign that said "treetop walk 1200m" then a few minutes later a sign that said "treetop walk 1500m". From the carpark it is supposedly a 6km round trip. My GPS recorded 9.8km total and we never left the marked trails._x000D_
_x000D_
Hold onto backpacks and don't consume food near the treetop walk or ranger station as this is where most of the monkeys hang out ready to grab food and other items. There's no water or toilets along the track except at the ranger station so take a day pack, water and mosquito repellant._x000D_
_x000D_
The squirrel trail is good for children and squirrel are easy to find. There's also fish in the stream and children will enjoy feeding them bread. The view from the treetop walk was nice and the overall park is very pleasant._x000D_
_x000D_
It's very pretty but be sure to allow enough time.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited for the day, and our young man was in awe in the Cloud Forest and Flower dome..... And then he discovered the children's play area._x000D_
_x000D_
Come prepared- bring a towel, swimmers and a hat, but great fun playing under the big water sprays and sprinklers and waiting for the buckets of water to tip._x000D_
_x000D_
Topping this off was a shaded playground and a very reasonably priced cafe for kids to keep them refuelled. Made for a great break from the heat and a whole tonne of fun!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Don't miss this while in Singapore. The experience is worth it. 30 mins on top of the world. Go in evening before it gets dark.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Garden by the Bay Domes are very different. One covers cacti and desert plants. The other is an amazing tropical forest experience with waterfall. Worth paying for the tickets. To save money on Singapore attractions get the Singapore pass from Viator before leaving the US. Another incredible attraction in the park are Supertrees. Don't miss OCBC Skyway walk and Lights and Sound show in the evening.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This was a great place to have a few drinks if your into nightlife._x000D_
The drinks werenâ€™t cheap- about $15 a cocktail and the same for a beer. $45 for 5 tiger beers which is pretty steep._x000D_
I would recommend a snack and one drink if your on a budget just for the atmosphere. The lights and the river boats create a really nice vibe.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The size of the malls and shops on orchard road is absolutely amazing! While there are plenty of designer malls, there are also plenty of shops like cotton on, H&M etc and we found they had better specials then the outlet mall we went to. Don't go too early tho or you may find not everything is open.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Manmade attraction that delights the visual senses.
REVIEW_BODY: It's a nice stop for a one-time experience (day/night) but especially at night for the musical lights show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was the first time that I attended some temple wirh Indian culture. I liked colors a lot. It was possible to see different people worshiping the god differently, which was interesting for me. Worth of seing if you haven't had a change to experience something like that before.
ADDRESS: 141 Serangoon Road, Singapore 218042, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fabulous Gardens by the Bay Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This place is heaven for flower lovers! My aunt was so happy exploring the place, taking photos of all the orchids around the area. Its such awesome to know that Gardens by the bay changed theme from time to time. We enjoyed going rounds and taking photos of the lovely flowers and plants inside the dome! Truly must visit if you are here in Singapore!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visiting the museum gave us knowledge on how the Chinese evolved in Singapore and showed us how they lived in the early times. The audio and visual guide/gadget brought the museum's elements to life with their re-enactments and information.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you need it you can probably find it here. Shopping is the name of the game on Orchard Road. From high end stores on the ground floor to a full range of stores 3 floors the ground level you can shop for hours. Computerized screens can give you your location and directions to various stores in shopping malls._x000D_
Have fun.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the night Zoo which was good atmosphere and interesting in the sense that you are able to go in the dark by foot or cart to see a lot of nocturnal animals with no fences that separates you from them but there was also a lot of queuing up which took a lot of time. Half the time spent in the zoo was queuing up and waiting.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: lovely to walk around by day or night
REVIEW_BODY: Lots to see or just sit and watch the world go by in one of the many cafes/restaurants along the way. Sitting by the river after dark allows to you take in the nightlife and be amazed with all the lights. Pop in and out of the shops for a look as you walk, or just to get a blast of air conditioning before you continue your walk in the heat of Singapore.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Visited 'Gardens by the bay' and wanted to do the bridge walk between the super trees, however, it was under maintenance._x000D_
We found out that maintenance was carried out every Monday._x000D_
We did not know that, neither did other visitors._x000D_
Decided to visit the only 'Indochine' restaurant/bar on a super tree._x000D_
Entry price is S$20 for alcohol first drink and S$12 for non-alcohol first drink._x000D_
We arrived slightly past 6pm, it was not crowded._x000D_
Managed to grab a seat, however, as time goes by, it gets busier._x000D_
If you are looking for a drink with a view on a budget, I highly recommend this place.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Although we hesitated as it's a tourist attraction, we really enjoyed the time we spent. Very relaxing, amazing view. Good recommendation
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Lovely indoor gardens. Huge variety of plants and more. Short on time, we only did inside the huge glass domes and the beautiful super trees as darkness fell. But much more to see. Iâ€™m sure a whole day could be spent there._x000D_
_x000D_
Well with a visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Take the time & take the walk.
REVIEW_BODY:
A wonderful leisurely walk through these Gardens is a must when in Singapore.._x000D_
Make sure you visit the National Orchid Garden... especially the VIP Orchid area..._x000D_
There sre plenty of Toilets thriught the gardens .. and several Cafes where you can rest ... eat and drink..
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The night view was very nice, but due to too many tourists at the Cloud Forest queuing for the lifts, is a bit of wasted visiting time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wide variety of birds, informative and nicely maintained. You have to walk a lot, there is tram available but it is recommended to walk through park to not miss anything. Best place for kids. Check timings of shows and plan accordingly. Visit park as early as possible.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This needs to be visited by everyone !!! A beautiful Centre, How chinese were living in Singapore until 1950. Proper representation of shops, family rooms, day to day live. Comments provided by Audio are also great!!!!
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Poorly managed - all hype, not worth it
REVIEW_BODY:
With so many years of experience of running Night Safari, we were quite let down by the way it was managed - quite chaotic. It is surprising that they are not using their experience to improve the experience for the visitors._x000D_
_x000D_
It starts right at the entrance - preference is given to those who have group bookings - they don't wait in the Q but walk in at their convenience. We bought our tickets directly and had to stand in the Q for almost 45 minutes. The management should understand that non-group booking people also contribute to their profits._x000D_
_x000D_
There is one Q for checking the tickets. As you are going in, you are made to wait another 30 minutes. And there is no seating - you are just standing there in multiple lines, while watching the Group booking people stroll in. And finally, there is another wait in Q for scanning your tickets and entering the area. Once you are in, there is another long Q for the tram ride. And it is frustrating as all those group booking people are again ahead of you in the tram Q. We realised that the staff there is more interested in keeping tour operators happy rather than those who come directly / do their own planning._x000D_
_x000D_
We went to see Creatures of the Night - a pathetic show put on by the staff. Please don't waste you time on it._x000D_
_x000D_
Please factor in another 30 minutes wait before you can board the tram. It was again poorly managed as we saw many trams leaving with empty seats - surprising as there was a long Q. And in many seats, we saw just a couple sitting where as the capacity of a row is 4 people - they could easily fit in 2 couples each and clear the Q faster._x000D_
_x000D_
After the tram ride, we did the walk around. We could hardly see any additional animals on the walk around - we saw most of them on the tram ride._x000D_
_x000D_
There are 4 walks - sequential - Fishing Cat Trail; Leopard Trail; East Lodge Trail and Wallaby Trail. At the end of the the Leopard Trail, you have the option to board a Tram and return to the starting point.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is my first time entering Cloud Forest, on my second time to Garden by The Bay. Cloud Forrest is better than the other one. The Indoor waterfall is amazing. Lot of photo spot here. Better you enter here when sunset, when the lights on, very beautiful and maybe romantic. Great value.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We did the cloud forest & flower dome and enjoyed both. A wonderful way to see plants & flowers close up. It was also a welcome reprieve from the heat.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Firstly it is expensive. Secondly, the view isnâ€™t the great and you can only walk around about half of top of Tower 3. The other areas are restricted to hotel guests._x000D_
_x000D_
Better scenery to just walk around the marina or garden by the bay._x000D_
_x000D_
Really wish we hadnâ€™t gone.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I always wanted to go Japan or other countries to admire cherry blossom. At Gardens by the bay, there are many different types Sakura with different colours. There are beautiful. It was a good experience without having to travel far away.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These huge man made trees tower above the Gardens themselves and become the centre piece of the Gardens and allows you to use them as reference points in the large area. The central grouping are connected by walkways that allow you to see the entire area from a perfect vantage point.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved the opportunity to get a different view of the super trees and other areas of the Marina Bay. This is well run and not overcrowded so you donâ€™t have to wait ages to get some good photos.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's as close to the real ones as it get and located conveniently. Much easier access than in the nature.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: this is very high and the glass bottoms can be a little bit of a fright for the most hardy of travellers. worth a visit as long as your very very ok with hights
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A walk around Marina Bay will give you the opportunity to see the Singapore skyline and the amazing Marina Bay Sands hotel. As part of your walk, cross the Helix Bridge, which will give you great views of Marina Bay itself. Highly recommended particulary for the photo opportunities.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We almost found this accidentally- it turned out to be one of the highlights of a very busy day. And the Flight of the Dragonfly was spectacular!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Saw lots of butterflies and was a beautiful walk
REVIEW_BODY:
On a Saturday morning we walking Fort Canning Park for almost two hours to get a bit of exercise, read more history of Singapore, and take a scenic way to get from our hotel to Clark Quay for lunch. We are glad we did._x000D_
_x000D_
If one takes the time to read about the headstones on the wall, all of the signs in the park, and to view of all of the artifacts, one gets a better understanding of the history of this country. Sections of the park are divided into centuries with information about that time period. It's a fascinating walk through history._x000D_
_x000D_
Benches are stationed around Fort Canning if you need a break from walking or to relax in a bit of shade. We saw dozens of butterflies in this park and one bi-colored lizard.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: slice of nature in a busy city
REVIEW_BODY: its a lovely escape within the heart of the city. great views all over, lovely old growth trees and a nice trail system for waliing, running or just sitting a few benches and looking at the water/ sunsets
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful building. Did not stay in hotel or visit casino but loved walking around and admiring the architecture. Great views. Great skyline. Great light show.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Was quite expensive as just get a lift up to top but views were brilliant. No access to bar at top (residents only,). Small shop for drinks, souvenirs only.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: fun in the rain on all the rides
REVIEW_BODY: take time and get off to explore all the stops this is a great way to see this area of Singapore, don't forget to stop off at the beach
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A very small fee to visit the beautiful displays is well worth it - we particularly enjoyed the display of plants named after various dignitaries - Prime Ministers, members of Royal Families etc.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of a kind...a must visit..do not miss out on the light and sound show called garden rhapsody....
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a must-see in Singapore, even if you are not a garden person, just go. The views over the Marina Bay hotel and surrounding areas are amazing. I highly recommend going around 6pm or so to have enough time to visit everything and catch the first lights show at 7.30.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a really cool exhibit as an entry and exit it makes a statement and shows the depth of Singapore's art culture
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It's nice place to visit if you have time in Singapore the green tree everywhere with nice weather and the sea view from the TOP at one spot_x000D_
You will enjoy walking around having nice photo also you can ride the cable car with 29S$ one way_x000D_
My advice once you are at the Faber Peak enjoy_x000D_
1-walking around then ride the cable car_x000D_
2-take one way to Sentosa unless you bring your car or don't come back it will be very difficult to find taxi in case you have kids or older one
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak | Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: beautiful orchid garden. surrounded by the tropical plants and trees. plant in nature. it does not look artificial. we stayed much longer than we planned. fully recommended.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited Orchard Road two days before Christmas and it was great to see the decor and the hustle and bustle of shoppers. The street is home to many upmarket designer stores which are quite pricy._x000D_
_x000D_
We tried to cross roads by using the underground crossing and found a whole world of more affordable shopping below ground level!!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great garden in Singapore, shows what the city is all about: impressive stuff. Be sure to enjoy the sound & light show every night, it is truly impressive.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This attraction is not to be missed. Give yourself atleast 3-4 hours to explore everything. Unfortunately, our tour agent just gave us 2 hours to see and it was not enough. We had to rush through everywhere without enjoying the sights. Key attractions include Flower Dome, Cloud Forest, OCBC Sky Walk, Sun Pavilion, Children's Garden, Satay by the Sea.This would be ideal for an half-day trip.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went during the Singapore Garden Festival and can understand why it's the most popular spot in Gardens by the Bay as the air-conditioning is a relief to the hot sun outside. The orchids are by far the most impressive in its variety and unique hybrids. Most displays were thoroughly imaginative, from the local and Peranakan theme to the Mediterranean, Australian and African plots refurbished with a delightful Alice in Wonderland theme complete with White Rabbit, Cheshire Cat and Caterpillar with the Hookah. My only grouse is the difficulty of finding the exit as we ended up going round in circles before locating it, leading to the gift shop. There's an interesting eatery, Pollen, on the premises, bit pricey especially the cakes as cheaper food outlets an be found outside the Dome.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Like the Maldives on a roof!
REVIEW_BODY:
Beautiful place. If you are a hotel guest access is free. There is a nightclub terrace bar on Tower 3 and a large Italian bar and grill on top of tower 1 in between them there is a giant infinity pool. There are loads of seats and beds in a variety of options, there are jacuzzi pools and observation seats. The pool is huge and split into family zone and adults only. There is an abundance of staff bringing drinks and food to you. In the main concourse area there is a large bar and diner by Wolfgang Puck and you can sit and dine in the main area or the bar anytime._x000D_
Above all (excuse the pun!)_x000D_
To swim to the waters edge and look down 55 stores to the marina below is an experience not to missed. H a cocktail in hand and look down on the forest and gardens behind the hotel is just wonderful._x000D_
As with everywhere you go in this hotel, the staff are great. Lots of friendly people more than happy to go the extra mile to make you happy and comfortable_x000D_
A great place - a must see on your visit to Singapore
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worst places i have ever visited .
REVIEW_BODY: Being recommended by lot of friends we went there but it was a total waste of time . comparing with chimelong zoo in guangzhou and safari world in Bangkok night safari stand nowhere . we entered night safari at 8pm when it usually starts . but we were shocked they have a total of 3 shows and out of those 2 of them runs together . the shows were really pathetic . 90% Animals in the zoo are indian animal and i was shocked to see 90% indian were there to see them. i have no clue why my friends and forced us to visit this place. AVOID THIS PLACE
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Surprised to see this is not ranked higher on the top things to do list in Singapore. Thought the museum was excellent as it took you from ancient to modern times of life in Singapore and the Straits Settlements.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The views are spectacular, but there is virtually no shade to take cover in. We managed about 10 minutes in the searing heat of the Skypark, just enough to take a few photos. They need to supply a cafe, some shade and something to drink.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you want to feel stupid then buy the dinner option! It is expensive not worth a penny! Buy the cheapest ticket and do the cable tour and then go have dinner somewhere else and have a good bite. Do not believe anyone rhat this is an amazing experience because it is not. You do certainly not need to turn round over same place for 1h30 and have a meal that is inflated to the maximum with no taste to write the least
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Buddha tooth relic temple is a place of peace and calm... I think when you feel tired or started to questioning the meaning of your life, this is a good place to meditate. Go to the uppermost floor, where they provided space for visitors' meditation. The hall was kept in total silence, so you can have a good self meditation here.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Must visit for tourists. The place fascinates me each time I cross it. Provides a good scenic view of the city - including the river, Fullerton Hotel and the towering Marina Bay Sands hotel
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We took our toddler to the nighttime light/music show at the main tree grove. â€˜Garden Rhapsodyâ€™ on that night was a mixture of popular songs from the 70s & 80s._x000D_
_x000D_
Thousands of people gathered to sit around the trees (some were standing on the walkways between the trees). Locals and tourists alike came to enjoy together._x000D_
_x000D_
Iâ€™ve never had an experience quite like this one. Do not miss it if you come to Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
-Free!_x000D_
-Only 15 minutes long_x000D_
-fun for all ages_x000D_
-easy to find a good seat because the show is the entire grove_x000D_
_x000D_
*If you are leaving by taxi, it is best to walk through the park towards the Marina Bay Sands Hotel to catch your cab, otherwise the taxi queue at Gardens by the Bay entrance could take up to an hour (for only a 15 minute show)*
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited here as we were in Marina Bay, and also went to the Marvel exhibition held here. Building is very interesting itself and is distinctive on the waterfront. Signage inside the building needs improvement!
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion Park is nice during the daytime but spectacular at night. To get here just take a taxi or Grab car to 1, Fullerton and walk down to the waterfront and head left. The Park is actually quite small and there are several restaurants here as well as a Starbucks Coffee. You can also make your way to parts of Singapore River too._x000D_
_x000D_
The Merlion has been the most iconic symbol of Singapore for decades, perhaps now taken over by the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. However, it is still extremely popular and in the evening time very crowded with both tourists and locals who come here to wander around the Marina Bay area._x000D_
_x000D_
Just beside the Merlion you can join boat rides in the bay and into Singapore River. Also at night time you can get the most spectacular views from Merlion Park of the tall skyscrapers of the financial district and across the Bay towards Marina Bay Sands._x000D_
_x000D_
So when visiting the Marina Bay area then Merlion Park is a good place to start.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Park by the bay, must see Singapore attraction.
REVIEW_BODY: Perfect walk for a hot day, convenient location next to major attractions. Recommended to families and couples.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Catch the lift to the top and walk down the ramp and take in the views outside as well as the lovely waterfalls and orchids inside.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: IT WOULD BE REMISS OF YOU NOT TO VISIT, WHEN IN SINGAPORE
REVIEW_BODY: Amazing building and beautifully curated world class museum. The story of Singapore is extremely interesting and emotive. It will appeal to all ages. Need to spend a couple of hours here. It isn't surprising that this beautiful country has evolved to what it is today, when you understand the struggles and the commitment of Singapore's incredible leaders.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the conservatories of Garden by bay. A spectacular green house with a 35m high artificial mountain with man made water fall showcases plant life from tropical highlands up to 2,000 meters above sea level. It's better to visit before sunset.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Very pretty but so difficult to get into attractions
REVIEW_BODY:
Its hard to buy tickets to get into most things. Was told to buy online and when i did i didnt receive the e ticket so it was a hassle trying to get in. The cloud dome was ok. The other one wasnt at all impressive. The towerlike things were impossible to get to._x000D_
Really pretty place but the experience overall wasnt as pleasant as it shouldve been.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Right in the heart of the city
REVIEW_BODY: We had already been to the botanic gardens and by comparison this doesn't seem to offer that much. We didn't go in the domes, which maybe would have held our attention more, but these have an entrance fee. We did pay to do the Skywalk and we all enjoyed this. The cafes tend to be very busy - they offer much needed air conditioning and drinks. Because of its central location its worth visiting to wander round but in our opinion it not a "must see".
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Between the two domes at Gardens by the bay I prefer the Cloud Forest.. It is one of its kind and love the way it is constructed.. Best to visit in the evening to be able to catch the lighting show at super trees (outside the dome)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice walk from Grand Copthorne hotel following the river. Passing lots of bars and restaurants en route. Historic points picked out on signs. Best done at night when a tad cooler. Lots of fish and even turtles seen. Had not realized part of giant reservoir. Towards Marina Sands the promenade becomes a mass of activity and noise. A must walk
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A fun family activity, enriching experience for kids
REVIEW_BODY: The first thing that deserve commendation is the layout. The two routes available both covers all attraction and at the same time disperse human traffic. The routes are sheltered all the way, which is perfect for both hot and rainy weather.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: ok la. good place to relax. see greenery. near to orchard road. good eatery in that area. recommend to have breakfast in the morning to enjoy the morning scene. try avoid hot afternoon which has 50% chance of rain to accompany. Cheers, and enjoy
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We did the evening laser show and thought it was tremendous. We also enjoyed the night time view from the Sky Park.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth a wander but a long street of mostly expensive shops into which you can go when the skies open. Take a brolly if you don't wish to be tempted and visit the National Museum when you're done.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Best approached by Metro. Many eateries all serving excellent Chinese fare made Singapore style. If you are a Book lover, do not miss the Tin Tin shop and buy some memorabilia and take pictures including selfies. As usual all kinds of everything and needs about half a day to really make the trip worthwhile.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the brutal reality, despite the hype and the alluring photos, is that you are constrained to one small section of the skypark, not allowed near the infinity pool, subject to hard sell from the souvenir photographers and charged a large amount of cash for what is quite a good view but no where near what you are lead to expect. Tower three is the cheap room tower, the check in is horrible and the skypark tourists are the lowest of the low, the lift is quick but the end result is very disappointing. What is worse is many of the hotel residents like to wander into the viewing area and flaunt thier status by wearing their bathrobes before heading back to the hotel only section past the guards who rigorously enforce the residents only rule. Overall its a good view but don;t expect the 360 view and walk around the whole roof area, it ain't going to happen!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the best place to do your shopping to bring home a few gifts a lot of the shops and market stalls all have the same kind of stuff.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Relaxing at the top..Fort Canning Park
REVIEW_BODY: Fort Canning Park, an iconic hilltop landmark has witnessed many of Singaporeâ€™s historical milestones. The hill once sited the palaces of 14th century Kings and served as the Headquarters of the Far East Command Centre and British Army Barracks. The decision to surrender Singapore to the Japanese on 15 February 1942 was also made on the hill, in the Underground Far East Command Centre, commonly known as Battle Box.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Excellent choice of garden related activities including the Cloud Dome and Flower Dome. Great light show at night. Worth a visit and stay on for the lights at 6:45 or 7:45pm. It is a nightmare trying to get a taxi after the show so be warned. The prices for the Dome's were reasonable and the lightship is free. really enjoyed our time here.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I was on my way to the Merlion Park and came across this beautiful cathedral. Unfortunately a service was in session so I was not allowed to visit the inside. From the outside, it is majestic! Good for pictures in a sunny day!_x000D_
_x000D_
Recommend time to spend - 10-15 minutes for a quick visit and prayer!
ADDRESS: 11 St. Andrew's Road St. Andrew's Cathedral, Singapore 178959, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Geared towards both adults and children, this museum is well done. It is located in a beautiful building at a convenient location near MRT stations. There is a nice variety of exhibits. They should provide benches for weary tourists.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: For a free attraction, it's well worth the visit. If you walked the whole lot it would take quite some time. It's not as tranquil as I'd have thought due to the sheer volume of people!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were awestruck by the sound and light show at the Supertree Grove. This happens everyday from 7.45-8pm so ensure you donâ€™t miss it. The other cool things were the Cloud Forest (with the tallest indoor waterfall in the world) and the Flower Dome (biggest greenhouse in the world). We went at night but I felt that these 2 places would be more beautiful in the day time. There are many more things like kids play area which we couldnâ€™t see due to lack of time. Definitely a must visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Dropped in here on a wet afternoon - it was decorated for Chinese New year, all very festive. Free access.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely to walk around and see the night life - however the food generally was overpriced and we got better value for money and better food at the local markets, shopping centres and in the city. But pleasant enough and the night boat trips in the harbour area is worth it - especially around 8pm to see light show!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the cleanest city anywhere and a beautiful skyline with shinny skyscrapers one after another. The 8 pm show on the river at Marina Bay Resort is a wonderful laser, light, water & music spectacular event which is a no miss event.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Singapore's pride and joy? I would say, The Gardens by the Bay! Situated in the Marina Bay area iit is one of the newer attractions envisioned by the Government to bring in the much needed visitors. Singapore has no natual resources and require tourist arrivals to bring in revenue._x000D_
_x000D_
The Gardens have several features of interest. We went to two of them, the Cloud Forest and Skyway. Besides these two popular sections are the Supertrees and Flower Dome._x000D_
_x000D_
The SuperTree Grove was stunning. The trees were 164 feet tall and covered with greenery. A Very lovely and refreshing site. They are right at the entrance and showcase a modern Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
The Cloud Forest is equally stunning with its huge climate controlled glass dome housing several varities of green plants. The Flower Dome, which we didn't visit, is said to be a burst of colour with flowers from several countries. We also enjoyed the cool sprays from the artificial waterfall and walking along the 3km long pathway along the Bay._x000D_
_x000D_
We were rushed for time and so could not wait for the light display at 7.45 pm. Do not miss that as I am reliably informed that it is nothing but spectacular!_x000D_
_x000D_
We were a bit disappointed that the Cloud Forest and SuperTrees were almost monochrome, green. I wish they had some colourful flowers here as well._x000D_
_x000D_
For those of you who have knee problems, be warned that there is a lot of walking to do. However, there is wheel chair access throughout for those who need it._x000D_
_x000D_
Tickets can be bought either directly from the Gardens or at a discount from online agents --We paid 20% less. But some offer even lower rates, less 25% or lower. We were not too sure how reliable these agents were and decided to go by an agent whose address and contact nos were given. This agent turned out fine as I had to call her several times regarding mode of payment, etc to which the woman answered patiently. These tickets were accepted at the Entrance!_x000D_
_x000D_
One could easily spend about three hours at the Gardens. There are some food outlets and other facilities to make the visitors comfortable._x000D_
The best months to visit are November to March when the open garden areas are so breezy. However, it is the rainy season too and it is advisable to carry an umbrella._x000D_
_x000D_
In general, the Gardens are well worth a visit. It is a jewel in the crown of modern Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Gearing up for Chinese New Year
REVIEW_BODY: Visited on a weekend morning. Stalls are being refurbished which make it looks much neater, more spaces and well sheltered. Worth taking a stroll at night.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went here on our last night in Singapore. The gardens are well worth the visit. I am not a garden enthusiast but thoroughly enjoyed walking through the big garden and seeing the world gardens
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A very popular focal point of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: We passed by (and stopped to take photos) a few times while in Singapore. It's certainly very popular for selfies, and photos generally, and especially so as nightfall approaches. Can get quite crowded, but there's plenty of vantage points.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Clarke Quay is very interesting. I went on a guided tour and learned alot about the history of Singapore including "Raffles" , Reseviours, Trading Routes etc.... Shopping and Restauraunts are abundant from the Quay
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The hardest part is getting here walking, quite steep from any direction, but rewards the effort. Probably best when combined with a visit to the Battlebox, but still a great way to pass a couple hours. Lots of history. Plaques highlight significant places and events over the last 700 years.The main lawn in front of the big building was a graveyard. The "contents" were removed, many of the headstones line the walls around it, and give a sombre reminder of the abbeviated life expectancy for Western during the 19th century.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the best $38 Singapore Dollars ever spent! The 1.5 hours we spent with our guide, Sharul, was both very informative and an enlightening way to understand what happened in 1942 with the surrender of Singapore to the Japanese. This has to be one of those hidden treasures that is a must whilst visiting this fabulous city. Well done to those involved in the restoration.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I kinda curious about this garden and so I stop by. well...first thing is...it was free for everyone. You can held a small party or just enjoying the view while work out. and also have much canteen so don't worry if feeling hungry or thirsty, and also alot of toilet. In the end of the road..was a MRT station. It was very integrated...excellent.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wow! What views! This has to go on the "must see" list. The only disappointment is that it would be great if there were a restaurant/barup there for non house guests so that it would be possible to spend more money and have a drink. Of course ther is a pool and restaurant but that is only for house guests.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the attractions we went with my children. They really enjoyed the birds and the view. Even though it was very far from our hotel, we still manage to go and enjoy.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the greatest botanic gardens I have seen so far
REVIEW_BODY:
We really enjoyed this botanic garden and we spend here half a day and could have stayed longer._x000D_
_x000D_
The main area is for free and even the orchid garden admission fee is very cheap with a price of 5 SGD._x000D_
_x000D_
You can explore many different gardens and the overall landscapes are beautiful. We will come back next time we are in town.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I have visited the orchid garden on numerous occasions and I always enjoy it. It is beautifully laid with so many different types of orchids to see. It's a great place for a relaxing afternoon walk away from the madness of the city.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The best orchid collection I have ever seen
REVIEW_BODY: Not to be missed. Totally worth the 5Spd entry price (only 1 if you ar over 60). I have visited lots of botanic gardens and orchid collections and this is the best Iâ€™ve ever seen, spend some time in the hybridization area.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Pleasantly surprised with GBTB, they had cutesy light and sound show which we stayed for. Nice to go to say youâ€™ve done it. Unfortunately was getting dark when we went so only got to do that. Was free though!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
As with the other reviews that i write on TripAdvisor, i will add a Caveat that this is review is totally Subjective and based on my experience (and perception)._x000D_
_x000D_
My review may appear contrary to what people are 'expecting' about Night Safari._x000D_
_x000D_
Being an Animal/Nature Lover, the word Safari, for me, is filled with a lot of sight-seeing and excitement and lots of animals in their wild best! The Night Safari at Singapore Zoo did not invoke any of those feelings. It turned out to be a Damp squib._x000D_
_x000D_
It was more Drama and less Reality. There is nothing unique that was showcased at this event._x000D_
_x000D_
The long Queues to get into the Tram made it worse._x000D_
_x000D_
There is nothing worthwhile to remember about this Safari._x000D_
_x000D_
Its Just another way for the Zoo to earn a little more money by giving a "night safari" tag to an extremely boring Tram ride._x000D_
_x000D_
There was a Fire show/stunt at the Entrance of Night Safari, which was good, but it is a totally "disconnected" event and i am wondering why it needs to be there at the Night Safari._x000D_
_x000D_
And then there was an Animal Show, where a few nocturnal animals were "displayed"._x000D_
_x000D_
This show was high on Drama (and Rhetoric) and low on Animals/birds or their activities. Its a total waste of time. The Presenter of this Show was the only Saving grace and the only thing good to talk about this show. Nothing else is good about this animal show._x000D_
_x000D_
I have seen extremely engaging animal shows at other Zoos that almost captivate you and make you look forward for an another show!_x000D_
_x000D_
I must add here that the experience at the Day Zoo was just the Opposite, it was an extremely awesome experience. I highly recommend you to visit the Zoo during the day instead._x000D_
_x000D_
And here is my review about it -_x000D_
https://www.tripadvisor.in/ShowUserReviews-g294265-d324542-r590047506-Singapore_Zoo-Singapore.html_x000D_
_x000D_
My Verdict : You are perfectly OK to SKIP the Night Safari as you are not going to lose any great stuff/experience.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: In the heart of modern, buzzing Singapore lies a sobering memorial to the darkest days in Singapore's history. Beautifully presented and preserved by the Commonwealth WarGraves Commission, Kanji War Memorial contains row after row of the graves of those British, Australian, NZ, Indian, Malay and Singaporeans who fell in her defence during the Second World War. With informative plaques, this is a beautiful spot for remembrance and reflection. The wWall of the Missing is especially moving. Can be visited by yourself, or with a guide.
ADDRESS: 9 Woodlands Road, Singapore 738656, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The sky park is situated on the 100th floor, and the view from atop is amazing. There is also a pool above the floor which is an infinity pool and its a must place to visit. The views are stunning. I preferred it at night when everything is lit and comes alive.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: No sure what the fuss is all about ?? --> Artifical tress with some lights and music ?
REVIEW_BODY: Lots of low end noisy Asian tourists dumped by the truck load (well... Gardens by the bay is free after all). Crazy heat / humidity (no fans / ventilation). Day time is of low interest, best time to come is for the 7.45PM "show". The light is good for pictures. The show is impressive for the first 30s but then the remaining 14 minutes is just same: poorly picked classical music mixed with a light show on the fake trees. If you have kids they will like it. I did not. If you are well-traveled around the world, you will have seen a lot better shows / set-ups elsewhere. It seems targeted to regional tourists who leave their country for the first time. Come for a pic and leave before everyone else rushes out. MAD taxi lines to leave the place so walk to Marina Bay Sands to increase your taxi chances. 8' walk.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One more beautiful than the other
REVIEW_BODY: All of us enjoyed our morning at the botanical gardens - including my 20 year old son! It is more like a walk/hike through different scenarios - and the orchid garden is a must!! There is also a very nice restaurant inside if you want to stop for a snack
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went there both during day time and night time and the site was amazing. The night view was also spectacular with the lights atop the trees changing different colors. Walking on the sky bridge was also a must do in this beautiful park.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A compulsory visit for any people discovering Singapore for the first time ! It shows you the evolution of the city, its development, its urbanism. A lot of interactive activities for the kids who always enjoy that place.
ADDRESS: 45 Maxwell Road The Ura Centre | The URA Centre, Level 2, Singapore 069118, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A definite must see place to visit. We stayed to enjoy the light show in the evening. Fantastic experience all around. A lot of walking so wear comfortable shoes. Places to stop to refill water bottles and toilets are very clean.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: great food and shops for souvenirs close to everything, decorations where amazing very friendly shop keepers
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
After a decade, I came to Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
I have not know that Singapore developed such a place like Gardens by the sea._x000D_
_x000D_
It is a fantastic place where anyone regardless ages, can enjoy on their own ways._x000D_
_x000D_
Lots of green, space and some splash of waters.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to spend a few hours
REVIEW_BODY: Plenty to see and do here, the highlight for me was the light and sound show in the artificial forest that takes place twice a night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We spent only a few hpurs here but we did look at the main attractions, a whole day could be pent here by people keen on gardening and plants. It is spectacular at night or dusk as the gardens are well lit with diplays of colour. A definate stop on a visit to Singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Bold and simple garden is what i called
REVIEW_BODY:
This Botanical garden is only good for peoples who wants to stroll around in the nature in Singapore. It is so empty and not much to offer compared to others around the world. Peoples normally come here to exercise and stroll in nature only, not for its uniqueness or whatsoever._x000D_
_x000D_
Spend time on others before considering this.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: To ride on the cable car was our main reason for visiting Sentosa Island. It didn't disappoint. We did also visit the Aquarium which was wonderful.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: one of the best china town in the world
REVIEW_BODY: Luckily we came here last january, close to Lunar New Year. We saw a big rooster in the junction, red decoration in every corner. everything were very reasonable price, especially we enjoy our dinner, very nice and cheap
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A very pleasant walk that can be long or short. so many restaurants to choose from, many varieties. Lots of public restrooms if necessary and all very clean.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The best Zoo i have had the pleasure of visiting on all my travels so far!!
REVIEW_BODY:
We absolutely loved our day out at the Zoo - the sweltering heat and humidity made us take it slow (with a toddler and pram) but it was genuinely the most amazing zoo i have had the pleasure of visiting (far superior to ours here in Australia)._x000D_
_x000D_
The best parts - the interaction level of how close you could get to some animals, their beautiful habitats and oh my goodness....the little critters roaming free! Never seen anything cuter than the tiny monkey species._x000D_
The kids water zone was also amazing and we spent a great afternoon playing and cooling down with out little one._x000D_
_x000D_
Tips - alot of walking so be prepared in the heat or take the train that does laps around the park for an extra fee. Keep hydrated. Take the time to see everything and look everywhere...we could not believe just how much there was to see and do!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely garden within the Marina Bay area
REVIEW_BODY: This is my 3rd visit to Gardens by the Bay. And this time it is because of the Singapore Garden Festival 2016. Despite the drizzle, many ppl came to the Gardens to enjoy the orchids and the Show Gardens. Many orchids were on display and ppl were busy taking selfies and photos. Be patient if you are interested in selfies as there may be a queue at the popular displays.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a visit. Quite a queue for the tram ride, but goes quick and worth it. Also took a stroll around after the tram, more of a close up experience for some of the smaller animals.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore
