REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful place for the family and especially those who love flowers. Full of surprises at every corner with different habitat and informative. Great for the couples and family!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There is a such a great variety of plants,flowers,trees & sculptures on display here.The sculptures are of great detail
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Enjoyable day at garden by the bay. Can be quite hot on sunny days. Flowers dome is not that good. But waterfall dome is worth the visit. Lighting show at night is good as well. Taxi can be long wait. Get an Uber or MRT back hotel is recommended
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
An excellent way to spend a few or several hours and get out of the heat. The two domes ("conservatories") are nice and cool. The Cloud Forest dome was spectacular - better than the Flower Dome in my opinion so plan to do that one if you only have a short time._x000D_
Stay for the light show (7.45pm is the first, second one an hour later) if you can - unlike anything I've seen._x000D_
We pre-purchased our tickets online from Voyagin.com an hour or so before we went - saved 25% and hassle-free. Note that you can use the PDF ticket on your phone to get into the conservatories but need to redeem your tickets for the Skyway at the main ticket office.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When you step into the dome the waterfall is in front of you, falling some 35m. You can then meander upwards and enjoy the lush vegetation on the man-made mountain. The dome replicates a cool moist tropical region and features orchids, ferns and many more plants from South East Asia, Africa and America. Enjoy the Lost World, Crystal Mountain, Cloud and Treetop Walks, Cavern and the Secret Garden; see the view from behind the Waterfall. It may be man-made but there are many wonders within.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fabulous gardens -watch out for the Lizards :)
REVIEW_BODY: Breathtaking gardens beautifully arranged and so much to see. Allow yourself several hours so you can take it all in. Do be aware of the rather large monitor water lizards--one surprised me on one of the walk ways --and that scuffling you hear in the woods are lizards NOT squirrels :P
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The floors, the artwork, the special celebration displays (October means Halloween) It's a must go, you'll regret it if you don't. Allow 2-3 hours , you won't regret it!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: ... thanks to annual pass, SG Zoo will be one of the first things, my kids will miss after moving away from SG. We have spent so many nice days here and definitely would rate it one if the best zoos in the world and a must do for anyone visiting SG.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Iâ€™ve visited Cloud Forest before on my first visit to Singapore and decided to visit it again. Iâ€™m glad I did, but I wonâ€™t be back. Why? Once is enough to see it._x000D_
_x000D_
There was a long queue to get into the Cloud Forest, and then once you got inside there was another really long queue to get to the lift to take you to the top of the Cloud Forest. I would have happily taken stairs instead of waiting for over 30 minutes inside the Cloud Forest to get the lift to the top, but they ushered you into the queue and there was no option to walk up._x000D_
_x000D_
There was little to no crowd control / queue management either - lots of people cutting queues and no-one in site to manage the queues._x000D_
_x000D_
This time, I was in and out pretty quickly, mainly as Iâ€™d seen it before and Iâ€™d visited the Botanic Gardens the day before where there was so much more to see - and itâ€™s free at the Botanic Gardens. Even Mount Faber was nice._x000D_
_x000D_
The Cloud Forest is a bucket list item for most people visiting Singapore and I do recommend visiting. Then visit the Botanic Gardens for comparison.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Famed for its thriving textile market.
REVIEW_BODY: There is hardly any Arab influence seen in this area, except for some Turkish and Lebanese food restaurants which thrive more at night rather than in daytime. The quality of food is perhaps, to be charitable, at best suspect. But the shopping experience is much better as you walk past the shops selling mostly textiles with a fabulous lamp shop too. Most of the shops are owned by people of Indian origin, but tailoring facilities are available on the top floors of these shops where Singaporean seamstresses, do everything from measurement, cutting and sewing for prices ranging anything above 80 SGD depending upon the work involved.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing place with plenty of stuff to do. Make sure to check: cloud forest, flowers dome and skywalk.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Iam visiting the ZOO almost for ten years there no much change in it same as previous, recently the number of animals reducing we are only seeing more monkeys than any other animals in the zoo.better to name it is monkey zoo, need to add shelters along the walkways so that people donâ€™t get wet during rain
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a great place with a lot of flowers and nice art. Peaceful and quiet before the crowds come, Supertree Grove, Singapore Flower Dome and Misty Forrest. Good place to go when you are tired of shopping :)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good experience. Since I had been to London Eye already, I didn't find it too exciting though. The entry to board the flyer is done nicely, unlike London eye. Nice view of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Although close to the center of Singapore, this series of indoor and outdoor gardens is amazing. A great place to spend 1-2 hours wondering through the gardens/spaces and discovering new plants, water features, etc. A great "take a break" destination.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's another must in Singapore. Take the lift to 57th floor and admire amazing view. Drinks are also great!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the place where you can find cheap things,cheap food with great taste.There are so many food stall that you can choose.One of them had Michelinâ€™s review.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its a place where you can find great stores to shop and eat. You can also sit along the benches and eat the delicious ice cream sandwich while watching the doves.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a great way to get to the most beautiful island in Singapore. For a few dollars more you get to travel above the island ,North ,South ,East and West. Great way to travel if you find it too hot/ far to walk.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: it is at least 3 degree cooler than outside! the minute you goes in, you can feel it! there are many types of orchards along the walks . do go in again in the evenings as lights will be on and you can see sunset thru the windows
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful by day AMAZING by night
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful gardens by day and absolutely spectacular by night with the lights and show on at 7.45pm and 8.45pm (same show). Pay the $8 to do the SuperTree Grove top walk the views from above are lovely. Watching the light show at night was beautiful, there are alot of people but enough places to sit and enjoy the show. Kids as well as adults will love this experience.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Both the flyer high show and Kings of the Skies show are impressive!
REVIEW_BODY: Both the flyer high show and Kings of the Skies show are impressive! These were the first time our family have ever seen in our life. Good work. Good trainers! Keep on the hard work. And protect the birds. Thank you.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The second dome in the Marina Bay Gardens, we purchased a package entry along with Cloud Mountain. Totally different to Cloud Mountain, it had exhibits of typical gardens from regions around the world. Each region contained very impressive samples of the native plants and trees. There were many school children visiting while we were there, it would be a great learning environment for them.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nature and conservation is one thing I am passionate about so the work done at Singapore zoo really touches my heart. I went in the night safari with my group from Ghana, we also went to watch the animal shows. If you visit Singapore, the zoo should be on your itinerary
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Go in the daytime & revisit in the nightime
REVIEW_BODY:
Nice place during the day & absolutely awesome in the night! We did the day trip to get a general idea about the layout and see different plants but the sun can be quite strong, so wear plenty of sunscreen & take an umbrella with you. Also, the little buggies go around the whole place, so you can first take the trip around and then walk to parts that interested you._x000D_
_x000D_
In the evening or night, the place becomes like from a fairy tale. Highly recommended. Be prepared that the buggies only go from near the crossing from Marina Sands Hotel to the center of the park (& Back, but going back you will face a long wait time), so the $5/person charge for the short trip (both ways) is way too high. Better to walk that 300-400 meters._x000D_
_x000D_
There are a number of restaurants but charges are higher than elsewhere. Just a 350 ml small bottle of water sets you back over $2 (think of charges you expect in the airport) - not a downtown park where goods can be easily delivered. Remember to bring a large bottle of water with you, especially during daytime hours._x000D_
_x000D_
There a couple of attractions there: two domes which portray flowers and rainforest respectively. Charge is mid twenties range for both. There is also a skywalk for $5 per person to see._x000D_
_x000D_
In all, Botanical Gardens and Gardens by the Bay should definitely be on the top of your list when you are visiting Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard Road comprises a series of amazing shopping malls where you can find from the most expensive brands to the accessible shops. If you like shopping it's a must but if you don't it's still worth to explore this area as you can see some very well designed retail buildings, facades, public realm.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Photos opportunities ,very nice experience ,love this coconut gelato they selling by the waterfront walkway
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not the biggest or best China town
REVIEW_BODY: Thought it would be big but very small. Difficult to judge in a country that is mainly Chinese anyway with so much going on
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: They have so many beautiful trees from all over the world.. You gonna amaze to see how they collect them all... There's a trail so you can walk upstairs to see the forest from above... Must visit..
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Haven't been here in ages and was pleasantly surprise with the upgraded look. Gone is the stark museum of yesteryear and in its place, themed galleries of different eras. I like the one with images and things of my childhood, brings back great memories; the one with Japanese occupation is great too as its images remind us the importance of national defense._x000D_
_x000D_
Well done with the upgrading.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you only had one day in Singapore, this would be a must!_x000D_
Go and enjoy a drink from the roof! Words canâ€™t describe it so just do it! Even better at night with the lights. We had pre dinner drinks there then caught an Uber/taxi to a beautiful restaurant.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The walkway was closed when we visited so sadly we didn't get to do this but the supertrees are a wonderful sight all lit up as darkness falls and the scale of them is awe-inspiring. They were a good place to sit and have a coffee and watch night fall and do some people watching. if we ever get a chance to return I'll make sure that we get a chance to experience the walkway.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Chapel was awesome.The relics of the prisoners fascinating to see and very moving.Not the easiest place to get to but well worth the visit.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This gorgeous Indian temple is in the middle ChinaTown. It's beautiful and colorful and worth visit. Remember to remove your shoes as it's not allowed.
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Wow!..Just wow! This was the most interactive museum space I have ever seen. I wish I would have taken my son. You could literally spend hours in this place and still not experience it all. It is on the Marina Bay Sands campus so its really close._x000D_
Favorite parts:_x000D_
Wave and waterfall rooms_x000D_
Crystal light tunnel_x000D_
Aquarium room_x000D_
The aquarium was probably the most interesting room to me. You make a drawing of a sea creature and insert it into a machine which scans the image and animates it onto a screen that looks like an aquarium. As you get close to the animated drawing it swims away from you. It blew my mind and I'm sure this description does not do it justice. There was also a graffiti art show here with the original Sheppard Fairy Obama screen print as well as his Obey posters and a plethora of other artists. there was even a wall you could tag on or put stickers on. I was not expecting this type of experience walking in the door. I'd definitely recommend this._x000D_
_x000D_
Not so humbly submitted,_x000D_
Michael C.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: My primary reason for visiting Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay was my primary reason visiting Singapore. Ever since it opened I waned to visit it, and I was not disappointed. Flower Dome and Cloud Dome were good. I liked Cloud Dome especially. And Supertrees at night were beautiful and its nightly light show was fun.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Though it need a little bit of touching up here and there, it stil is an impressive building. Not something I owuld especially go to mind you. I had ot be there for work.
ADDRESS: 100 Victoria Street National Library Building, Singapore 188064, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This temple is located at china town in singapore. the temple is a beautiful one, in typical buddhist style. it is reported to have the buddha's tooth as a relic. the inside of the temple is very beautiful, fully decorated and red colour. lot of buddhists are seen praying.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a fantastic interactive centre, must first of all to mention Hansel at ticketing who provided guidance to my multi national family, a credit to MBS. The centre is great for kids and adult, I thought it was going to be boring but at the end was engaging and fun time with the kids. Highly recommend the art centre and open your mind.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited here twice during our short stay, once during the day and once for the spectacular light show...NOT TO BE MISSED. You could spend days here and not see everything! Fantastic amount of plants and information, we didnâ€™t have time for either of the domes but the night time show was awe inspiring, moving and something I feel really privileged to have seen, this and walking around the gardens is all free.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Unlike the rest of the Zoo the River Safari was a disappointment. The 15 min boat ride is a joke. The safety briefing and commentary could not be heard ( all it needed was a microphone). There are very few animal sights and they were all on the port side which made it difficult to take photos from the other side. I don't often write negative reviews but if Singapore Zoo gets a few of these it might improve this experience as it is currently missing an opportunity.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This green heart/lung int he center of Singapore deserves a visit. On a busy Sunday you can join a Tai Chi practice, stroll through the grounds and around Swan Lake, have a private celebration, tour the National Orchid Garden, shap at the orchid gift shop, enjoy a Sunday brunch, take a run/long walk, or just relax under a cool, shady tree. The choice is yours, but don't wait to enjoy this park in the heart of Singapore. any day of the week. And admission to the park itself is free; there's a small admission fee to the National Orchid Garden (but seniors of any nationality are exempt). The signage is good throughout the park, and a well-stocked gift shop awaits you at the National Orchid Garden (small entry fee but the shop is free).
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great for photographers, but worth it for others, too
REVIEW_BODY: The orchid is Singapore's national flower, and you'll be hard pressed to find more of them in one place than here. The garden is very well kept-up, with constant attention by what appears to be a large staff. This garden is best seen on off-hours when hordes of tourists might be eating or elsewhere. Even so, it's large enough to accommodate many people. They also have a climate-controlled zone with special orchids and other unusual plants. It's about a 15-min walk from the main botanic-garden entrance to this garden, but the path is interesting in itself. The orchid garden is yet another nicely done attraction in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are a good place to go during the very hot midday as other tourist places are outdoors while gardens by the bay are air conditioned.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A brilliant concept in the fab Gardens by the Bay, fast becoming an iconic image of Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY: These steel structures should be seen by day and again at night, when they are spectacularly illuminated in a sound and light show. The tallest tree has a restaurant and treetop bar and although you have to pay about Â£10 to go up in the lift, the price includes a drink and is worth every penny for the views of the city and the sea. There is also an aerial walkway between several of the trees...again you have to pay extra for this but it's worth it unless you are nervous of heights! The sound and light show is free and a good place to view is the viewing platform across the walkway from Shoppes/MBS
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Chinatown in Singpore is amazing...but even more so during the Chinese New Year's festivities. The decorations are amazing and there is a good maket.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud Forest has the world's largest indoor waterfall. The vertical gardens are lush and the variety of plants spectacular.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place and good food too!
REVIEW_BODY: Great Wall art from local st painters. The old settlement area of the Muslims. Many middle eastern shops and restaurants, also Indonesia cuisine mainly at Kandahar st. Great place to visit with family and just walk the area.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you're looking for a thrilling adventure, then you should visit this place. The Night Safari is the world's first nocturnal zoo and is one of the most popular tourist attractions in Singapore. It is divided into seven geographical zones, which can be explored either on foot via four walking trails, or by tram._x000D_
_x000D_
THE GOOD PART:_x000D_
Up close and personal with the wild animals like lions, we actually saw giraffes, monkeys, zebras, and tigers almost a 100 meters away from our tram. But we are not allowed to touch or be near them even if the other animals come near us._x000D_
_x000D_
THE BAD PART:_x000D_
Before we rode the tram we were told not to do flash photography or make inappropriate noise. The wild animals might be disturbed if they hear us if we make some noise, and prowl unto us. I was so scared and nervous the whole time during the ride, because the other guests inside the tram doesn't follow what the instructor told us to do.They were talking so loud and calling the animals by whistle._x000D_
It was a fright night for me, an unforgettable experience Indeed!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Check out the river safari. Great aquariums with lots is different fish. Panda and polar bear great to see and cool down in as well.Don't bother waiting in line for the boat cruise at the bottom of park. Waste of time. Just saw water and bushes, no animals, only 15 mins.also the other ride that you line up for was just ok. Nothing special.we did this park with the zoo and night safari in one day.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Very scenic, with numerous bars and eateries!
REVIEW_BODY: This is an area we always visit, offering good views day or night. Of course any of these quays are much quieter in the daytime, and really come alive after dark. Bum boat trips can be taken from a number of ticket places and certainly a worthwhile experience.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: like everything in Singapore, its done right. presentation, information,service, feel, calmness, clean,
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful Japan Cherry Blossom Display - Free Admission if you dine at the Pollent
REVIEW_BODY: Flower Dome is an amazing addition to the Gardens by the Bay. If you dine at the Pollens, the restaurant attached to the Flower Dome, you ge free admission to that part of "Garden by the Bay". The current Japanese Cherry Blossom Display was amazing and I highly recommend it. However you need to bring a light jacket because they keep to keep the temperature down for the Flower display. I will let my photos speak for itself!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Donâ€™t be put off if you are afraid of heights. Iâ€™m not but did feel a bit jittery standing near the edges of our viewing carriage. You will be fine if you remain seated and may even venture towards the windows._x000D_
_x000D_
Amazing view which gave us a totally different perspective of the bay areas and marina. We took some amazing photos._x000D_
_x000D_
Very well organised. Would recommmend.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Interesting to visit, day or night
REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore River is a really interesting attraction. Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay and Boat Quay on the banks of the river teem with life and on weekends especially, you can really feel the vibes of these very happening spots, which are filled with restaurants, cafes, bars and crowds. There are also other attractions such as the Asian Civilisations Museum, The Arts House and the Victoria Theatre & Concert Hall etc located near the river bank, plus many interesting sculptures near the mouth of the river.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went to night safari and had great time with family. There was an anchor who welcomed everyone in audience in various languages, specially she conversed very well in hindi. It was followed by acts by various animals. They even brought a very long python and allowed some people to touch it. At last there was photo session with owl and others. It was followed by a ride in mini train to the jungle safari where one can see the animals without any fencing and some seems to be at an arm distance. Very nice adventure
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing zoo; wide variety of animals and you can get really up close to the animals. You can also pay to feed the animals and enjoy a breakfast with the orangutans. I suggest booking the breakfast well in advance. Great experience but donâ€™t expect good food- thatâ€™s really not why youâ€™re here anyway. Go to the zoo early, whether you are having breakfast there or not and then by early to mid afternoon head next door to the River Safari. Thus missing the crowds at both attractions.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place for take dinner and drink
REVIEW_BODY: I'm in the hotel infront of ... only nees to cross the street to reach this building, nice garden inside in the middle of the high buildings. The food nothing to much special but the place and comodoty near hotel ia wonderfool
ADDRESS: 30 Victoria Street Chijmes, Singapore 187996, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great shopping with all and every designer label as well as more down to earth products
REVIEW_BODY: Exciting shopping area - malls and shops that have everything from Jimmy Shu shoes to Street food on sticks. Lots of places to eat, drink and browse...
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you want a decent place to hike with a lot of nature, this is the best place to go on Singapore. Monkeys, lizards, and turtles!
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is again one of the top attraction of Singapore and is arguably one of the best Zoo's in the world. There are not just animals from all parts of the world but its the way they have presented all the things and arrangements that they have done for tourists in order to make trip hassle free and full of enjoyment that makes this Zoo worth the visit. Note that there is also the Night Safari option in same area and experience there is quite different but equally awesome. We did that last time so decided to try out Zoo this time around. The animal habitats were pretty close to each other and when far there was tram option to move from one area to other (Tram ticket is separate one that you can buy at entry and gives you access to unlimited rides). My both kids just loved looking at so many animals. Highlights were Elephant Show, monkeys, Tree Kangaroos and big cats._x000D_
For folks visiting with young kids I would say this is a must visit attraction.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing views in the evening. You can get a good look at the city from above. It doesn't disappoint. Worth every cent - and for a few bucks more - try getting a solo capsule for you and your partner - quite romantic...
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good if you know where to go, look up often
REVIEW_BODY:
Hungry for good Chinese food? Then you've come to the right area. But look up to see the signboards overhead, so you know where you are headed. There are plenty of hidden gems such as the Smith St hawker centre (under USD5 meals) or classics like Yum Cha (on 2nd floor) that you won't find easily. Google is your friend and so is Tripadvisor._x000D_
_x000D_
Dress in comfy clothes and avoid peak hours such as weekday lunches (1200-1400) and festivals such as the prelude to Chinese New Year.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When you have seen the Gardens by the Bay, you have seen more than you would have expected in the also wonderful Botanical Gardens. Excellent exhibits!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent ambience to visit at night
REVIEW_BODY: This attraction is best visited post 5pm, with the sun close to setting. Easily accessed by mrt or a walk over the bridge from Marina Bay Sands, Gardens By The Bay is one of the nicest modern attractions in Singapore. The various gardens are worth a walk through, the wet playground for kids is fun and the light show offered twice every night is a must see - all of these are free of charge. The two domes are pricey to enter, and of value if there is a special exhibition on. Else, the rest of the gardens have enough to keep a visitor happy without the price tag of the dome tickets. Give yourself at least 2 hours here and add on about 45 minutes each for the domes.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This park is very good for cycling. Its 21km sketch gives you a complete view of the singapore while cycling along the beach and its very refreshing.
ADDRESS: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road, Singapore 455486, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are a must see, they are breathtaking and both domes were exceptional. My favourite was the flower dome, so much colour and plant variety and I understand they are always changing the theme. We walked from Bayfront MRT through the gardens to the domes, but shuttle buses are available for a small fee. The walk offers great views of the flier, Marina Bay Sands hotel and of course the super trees. It is also worth paying a little extra for the skyway. We returned on another evening to see the super tree light and music show, so glad we did, it was fantastic.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It's amazing place in Singapore. A lot of mall and activities around there's. The length of the road around three kilometers you can walking to shopping with a lot of brands shop and another_x000D_
_x000D_
Also a lot of restaurants and coffee shop located there_x000D_
_x000D_
I think it's one of the important road in the Singapore
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very interesting place. Our tour guide was excellent and it was wonderful to hear some of the history of Singapore. Highly recommend this hidden gem.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We spent a night around that area. We then sat in a cafe and talked about life. It is a nice place to hang out with friends.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Engage all the senses! So much to see, hear and smell here. The striking red building may or may not house Buddha's tooth, but it's worth visiting to smell the incense and hear tiny coins tinkle as visitors deposit them into metal bowls. There's a restroom available for visitor; ask one of the attendants for the location.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This has to be one of the most stunning displays of horticulture I have seen. Visit early in the evening then stay for the light show you won't be disappointed.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The cloud forest is worth every minute! Located in the Gardens by the Bay area, it is the worlds largest indoor waterfall with very impressive greenery and design. It made me feel like I was in a scene from the movie Avatar. I would recommend going in the evening or early morning to beat the crowds, also so that you can snag a better picture ;).
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Some terrible (old) staff who are arrogant and rude, Horrible direction signs
REVIEW_BODY:
It is a nice gallery with lots of quality paintings in a nicely renovated building. 5 Star for that._x000D_
It seems over staffed in the gallery where literally every 5 meter will be one standing old staff. Worst of all many of them are rude and arrogant. Especially an old (50,60's) guy at Wu Guanzhong gallery & an old lady at Singtel gallery, both of them have ruined my day with their arrogance and rudeness. Thanks to them, I ended my tour early. There needs to be better education or employing of the right quality._x000D_
Also commonly, visitors are confused with directions as there are little or none direction provided in the building or it's just too few/little._x000D_
What a shame for such a nicely built gallery that needs more improvements in quality. Two thumbs down.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Does not matter what part of Orchard Road you are in there is sure to be either an underground shopping experience or a building full of shops & cafes!! Wear good shoes & enjoy the experience!!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: FIRST ACTIVITY IN SINAPORE TO HAVE AN OVERVIEW OF THE THINGS TO COME
REVIEW_BODY:
A big round wheel that moves at slow speed with a number of cabins._x000D_
get ticket from the window and prooceed._x000D_
during this 1/2 hour round of the wheel you will have a distant view of Garden by the Bay, cruises in the warer below, Marian bay sands and other multistoried 5* hotels._x000D_
all around the compound is well maintained._x000D_
from here you can walk to , as we did, ArtScince Museum. but be beware it is 1 km walk.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is located inside the Gardens by the bay and is strictly for those who understand and appreciate trees and plantations. Else, it may be worth missing it._x000D_
_x000D_
We enjoyed the architecture but you wont miss much if you decide to miss it._x000D_
_x000D_
There is an artificial waterfall at the entrance and then there are many trees/ plantations etc that possibly are not well understood by a common tourist._x000D_
_x000D_
We were a common tourist so just enjoyed clicking pictures without necessarily understanding the essence of it._x000D_
_x000D_
So if you are at Gardens by the bay and have lots of time OR if you are tree/ plantations enthusiast then you could visit it else you could consider avoiding it as its not for a normal tourist
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Supertree grove is beautiful and it is actually huge. It's a great place to take a walk in the city, during the day or at night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A great stroll on anew Years day
REVIEW_BODY: Amazing walk in the tree tops, with fantastic views of Marina Bsy Sands hotel. Light show in the evening is brilliant.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Air-conditioned gardens, enjoy the man-made nature in a country that destroyed it for development and rebuild it for recreational purpose.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can see the cityscape from Singapore Flyer and it is both romantic and pleasant sight from sky above. A must go during night time!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We had the chance to discover the night safari 5 years ago. It was expensive but pretty good. Now it's more expensive and the train is going faster so that it's difficult to see animals properly. Sounds like they are trying to make more money in less time. So, if you really wanna see something, either do it om foot, either go to the tamman negara in Malaysia.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best place to view Singapore Skyline
REVIEW_BODY: The place is amazing at first sight, have a park, swimming pool, Bar, restaurant, Night club on roof top (57th Floor). Unbelievable view of Singapore skyline. A visit worth while in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A beautiful place to stroll around especially in the evening when the sun is just setting. There's a beautiful glow in the sky and also subtle lighting in that area makes it a perfect setting for photographs! Amazing modern architecture as well.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great photos only need a little time to visit
REVIEW_BODY: You don't need very long here. Lovely views and the water is peaceful also. great for a walk around not to far from things
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Experience a sudden drop in temperature and a spectacular view. The world's tallest indoor waterfall is a stunning view. Suggest visiting this at Sunset, at the Lost Land and catch a beautiful view of the city.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Doesnâ€™t cost a great deal and is an amazing experience would be a shame to go to the gardens and not do this.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The bay is a fabulous place to be in foot or a foot scooter. You can walk around the bay, plenty of places to sit, eat, take boat trips, plenty of photo opportunities._x000D_
_x000D_
When the heat gets too much pop into one of the shopping malls for the welcome air con or a cold drink._x000D_
_x000D_
Light show in the evening well worth going too.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the most enchanting places in singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
I visit Gardens by The Bay for a relaxing and stimulating walk. Cool and pleasant I have learnt so much about flowers and admired different species of flowers , some in Colours I have never seen ; very educational for both adults and young._x000D_
After you leave the flower dome take a leisurely walk in the waterfall dome , I saw species of orchids I had never seen before . Don't miss the trolley ride that takes you around the gardens with a guided recording. Enjoy
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is such a breathtaking sight. You just want to stand and take everything in. The lights are stunning.... marina bay hotel in the background. Wow. There is a part where there are free concerts. The night we were heading back from dining we heard drums.... yes went to investigate and it was the tyco drummers from Japan. What a performance. It was amazing to watch. It just an awesome sight......
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: it's not nearby other attractions, if you'd like to walk here from the esplanade, do expect 20-30 mins. Not much to see up in the sky in Singapore too, as you could imagine. A nice place to have a chat by the sea, with a drink, to relax and to release.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A thing of beauty is a joy forever
REVIEW_BODY:
The Gardens By The Bay are indeed a thing of beauty. There is no charge to get into the main gardens, and you could spend many hours just walking around the pathways that take you past beautiful artworks in the middle of artificial lakes, florals displays that take your breath away and the most beautiful of butterflies that clearly know a good thing when they find it, and have made these gardens their home._x000D_
_x000D_
If you would like to go into either of the domes, there is a small charge for each and if you have time, it is well worth the nominal cost. The displays therein are breathtaking and the work that goes into preparing and maintaining these areas is worth every cent that you pay to enter._x000D_
_x000D_
Around the gardens are places to eat, to drink, to 'freshen up', and to sit and relax and just take in the scene around you._x000D_
_x000D_
I would put this as one of the top things to do in Singapore. It's beauty is a joy you will have in your memory forever.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: On a hot day a lovely way to refresh your senses. We spent 2.5 hours enjoying a massive variety of interesting different landscapes.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Chinatwon Heritage Centre is a history lesson that tells you the story of how the early Chinese settlers came to Singapore and put their stamp on creating Chinatwon._x000D_
_x000D_
It is located on Pagoda Street. The building is beautiful and the facade is spread across three shop fronts. Inside, you can see how the early settlers lived._x000D_
_x000D_
Admission is SGD 15 - but I think it is worth the fee. You get a sense of how the early settlers struggled to live and make their fortune in very small living quarters. They had come away from poor conditions in China to make a new life in Singapore._x000D_
There is an audio guided tour.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Plenty of variety that are not so common outside Singapore. We enjoyed it and took quite a few photos. It's quite hot and humid inside though. A must for plant lovers.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The moment you enter the dome is you see a man made natural water fall the best ever surrounded by different plants flowers and in top you get into lost world where you see flowers made of Lego and small pond then each floor you get to see different things crystal mountain waterfall deck and many more it best place I ever visited definitely hard work pays well maintained plants must say it challenging to keep it maintain they have done it
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to unwind and enjoy all the lush greenery
REVIEW_BODY: This is a fantastic garden - to wander, to jog and just to unwind after a busy day. Entrance is free! There are swans you can feed in the lake, lots of trails, a special children's section and even a bandstand where they have concerts! If you have time, check out the orchid garden (you need to purchase tickets for this part) which is really worth a visit if you haven't seen it yet.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Oh, these gardens are so beautiful. Relaxing, plenty of space to be peaceful and so much to see. The orchid collection costs $1 to go in if you are over 60. Beautiful beautiful collection. Could have taken 100 photos. Highlight of our stay.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Marvellous wonders of natures best gifted plants
REVIEW_BODY: Excellent collection of plants landscaped with brilliant heights surrounding the dome of heights, cloud seeding was a wonderous sight
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is very nice park.A good place to walk about.This Chinese garden layout is very good.A good place for a family outing and to know Chinese style garden.
ADDRESS: 1 Chinese Garden Road Chinese Garden, Singapore 619795, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orang Utan swinging through the trees above you - you can even have breakfast with them. Wonderful. All the animals are so well looked after. If you have children/ grandchildren this is a great place to take them to. Take your time as it's a big campus. Half a day at least, may be a whole day.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I coud perfectly understand and appreciate why Singapore had to spent billions of dollars to create this massive park on expensive reclaimed land. It could be really educational to those who care. A respite from the busy city, a sight to beholdooking at flowers and plants from many corners of the earth. I was excited to visit knowing it was Singapore's no.1 tourist attraction and the fact that the avatar lookalike, giant trees had been sort of calling me to pay them a visit since I first saw the gardens being constructed a few years' ago. I went on a 2.5 hour visit which was definitely not enough for some but enough for me from the very beginning when I entered the gardens to feel that although the displays were amazing and beautiful, they were just mere showcases. Alive but artificial. I prefer the Botanical gardens anytime. But at least I have been there. Then I know. For tourists, this place is great to see what Singapore is capable of replicating. Totally impressive.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
My partner & I had a tour of the Battlebox in Singapore this afternoon. I highly recommend it. It was both emotionally moving & informative. Our guide was fantastic. He is excellent in his professionalism & his knowledge of military history._x000D_
Please consider doing the tour._x000D_
I have a personal connection to the history as one of my Grandfathers was a Australian soldier on Singapore when it fell to the Japanese in WWII._x000D_
But I highly recommend any one visit the Battlebox._x000D_
Desleigh Dutton
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A beauty that transforms in the evening to awesome
REVIEW_BODY: A wonderful and wondrous place by day which transforms into a gorgeous light show in the evening - well worth the visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very well maintained zoo, the night safari is a must visit. One advise would be to buy the tickets online, its around 10$ cheaper than the entrance. It's a must visit if travelling with children.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Our group was nervous going into the night with all the poor reviews- we were honestly thinking of missing it and I am so glad we didn't. We purchased the park hopper ticket (without the tram rides) so we didn't do the tram ride on the night. We booked for 7.15pm entrance. We went in about 7.30 after reading reviews to wait a little longer. That made such a difference as the lines started building at 6.30. We walked straight in at 7.30. We found the tracks easy to do at night and got to see the lions and tigers being fed. The zoo has an excellent range of nocturnal animals who were all on the move when we visited. We will be back!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: we loved walking around this area with all the very old interesting buildings and the history mixed with the new. clarke quay is well preserved with lots of places to eat and drink with many places having live entertainment at night. ken
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must see. Especially the taller dome with the cloud forest and also make sure you do the sky walk. Very very disappointed to not see a new zealand garden in the flower dome given the uniqueness and variety of new zealand flora which is a lot more amazing than some of the other locations catered for.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wow even if you are not an avid gardener this is worth the visit for sure. Beautiful orchids, set out and displayed in such a lovely manner. We thoroughly enjoyed our day in the gardens of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the best Zoos i have been to. It had it all. I strongly recomend everyone thats in Singapore to take the trip. There is alot to see and do, so i would have sett of a whole day just for this. Enjoy!!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Te Zoo is quite along way out of the city so we took the HOHO bus. We opted for the River Safari first. It was very disappointing. We ahve been to the aquarium the day before and a lot of this was more of the same - fish is glass cages swimming around. The walk through aquarium was empty - except for a seal who didn't want to go in the water. The cruise - ten minutes long - where you get to see the giraffes and nothing else. it is a very long walk - far too long if you have elderly people or people with mobility issues. They should warn people how long and far it is as we saw many older individuals who could not make the distance.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A Bit Hard to See the Animals
REVIEW_BODY: We went on the Night Safari and it was a bit difficult to see the animals in the dim lights. We did enjoy the animal show that they had with some animals we were unfamiliar with.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Singapore Zoo is second to none. The sprawling enclosure feels like a stroll through a wildlife park rather than through sets of enclosures._x000D_
_x000D_
Lakes, streams and forests break up the cement walkways. Thereâ€™s a team you can ride (for a fee if you arenâ€™t an annual member), but the best way is just to grab a map and explore on foot._x000D_
_x000D_
The feeding sessions are a must do. The Splash sea lion show is fun for everyone and the Elephants are also put to work just next door in an educational performance._x000D_
There are many rest stop areas to cool off, some indoor with air conditioning._x000D_
_x000D_
There are motorised scooters for the physically challenged to rent at the main entrance as well as strollers and carts. Toilets are located throughout._x000D_
_x000D_
There are restaurants both at the entrance and inside the park. Many days we take a picnic and eat at the designated spaces. Ben & Jerryâ€™s ice cream and JFC have locations inside next to the water play space. A fun area for the kids (and grownups) and cool off. There are lockers and full changing rooms and showers there. If you need swim clothing, towels, swim diapers or sunscreen, the Zoo shop next to the water area has everything._x000D_
_x000D_
Expect to stay a minimum of 4 hours. Get there at park opening to take advantage of the cooler temperatures. Shows begin around 10am. Ample parking, regular buses and easy taxi services._x000D_
_x000D_
The Night Safari, the worlds only one, is located a 2 minute walk from the main entrance and opens at 7pm when the sun goes down. So you could stay all day at the zoo and until 11pm at the Night Safari!_x000D_
_x000D_
Enjoy!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are a haven from the crowds and the bustle of Singapore. Just wandering around the beautifully manicured gardens makes your blood pressure drop! Yet the orchids are so exciting. The camera was working overtime with all the stunning orchids. The orchids themselves are eyedroppingly gorgeous but the was they are organized and presented is a compliment to the staff and management. Must visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Its a bit of a walk away from other attractions so a short taxi ride brings you to the entrance_x000D_
There are a few restaurants here the tkt booth is just ahead to the right_x000D_
The walk upto the 2nd floor is interesting and once passed the check in you have a display of facts to keep you busy as you walk around in the queue_x000D_
We were lucky we had a short queue and it wasn't crowded in the capsule_x000D_
It goes round very very slowly so you cant tell its moving_x000D_
The views are amazing well worth a visit_x000D_
You can book a pod for a private meal
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: An absolute Must Do when in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
The Gardens By The Bay are a rather new attraction in Singapore. It is a must and should plan a whole day for the visit. The place is just amazing!_x000D_
The flower dome and cloud forest are the most impressive. For both you will have to pay an admission fee but it's worth it. The "Super trees" are very amazing even though they are still growing. Don't miss the light and sound show in the evening.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: While I rate the Botanic Garden very highly, Im not sure I would recommend the rather highly priced Orchid Garden quite so highly. Worth visiting but not great value for money, but older (65+) visitors can qualify for a significant discount.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
dont understand ............_x000D_
the concept of this "museum". some parts seem to be suitable for young kids, some parts for adults. for us the best was the werner herzog movie about the internet. free entrance. entrance fee's are much too high for what is offered._x000D_
_x000D_
would not recommend this place.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Looking at the reviews,people have had mixed reactions to Chinatown but we loved it.The atmosphere is great,yes,you do have to know the price of things to know if youâ€™re getting a bargain.We were offered items at â€œ cheap pricesâ€ that in actual fact we could buy in Brisbane.Having said that,we still got some nice souvenirs and good buys ,visited the temple ...which was amazing ..and ate a nice meal.Yes,the food hall was crowed and no frills but we wanted to eat where the locals went ,not at a restaurant._x000D_
All in all ,a really enjoyable ,but hot,so hot day.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The amazing display from the waterfall to the different discussion rooms and exhibits was impressive. A pity about the large crowd which made movement and proper viewing and enjoyment difficult.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is an amazing place with all the food places. You can buy just about anything, especially souvenirs.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard Road is known for its shopping. Lots of high end stores. Easy access from the MRT and busses. Fun at night to see the buildings lit up. Food courts are available for cheaper eats.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's one of those things to put on your itinerary if you want to avoid expensive attractions. It's definitely not world class but somewhere to go for exercise.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very good and worthwhile,,,, exceeded expectation,,, recommended ,,, tried to book online on the day but not possible said not available but concierge booked at hotel
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful view of Singapore from there. And amazing building. It is best to go in the sunset, to see without lights and with lights. Great experience!!! I recommend to everyone!!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great technology of bringing an artificial garden
REVIEW_BODY: Cultivating and maintaining a garden artificially inside domes is very difficult and they do the job very well.But wat is missing is the real nature in it. Pls have gud walking shoes as it will also be cold inside and u also have to walk a lot.. one time experience it cud be..
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The temple has a tooth of Gautam Buddha kept on the 4th floor of the building. The golden pagoda, statue and cravings and decorations on the wall create a glistering effect. No photography is allowed on the 4th floor.The temple is ideally maintained to provide calm but well lit environment suitable for meditation. On the ground floor there is a statue of Lord Buddha and provision to offer incense sticks. The overall atmosphere is very religious and relaxing.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful and great for the kids
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful gardens, easily accessible by MRT. Big area to walk around in. Loved the childrens playground and water area.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Spectacular views over the harbour, especially in the evening._x000D_
You can book tickets online which saves you the waiting cue._x000D_
Only downside is that some people â€œclaimâ€ a spot at the viewsites by sitting down or placing children buggies. This should be discouraged by the Hotel.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing shopping in this string of massive malls. Lots of designer goods and multi-floor levels of shops that can be hard to escape
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited this as part of a Singapore night tour with my wife and enjoyed it. Staff were friendly and was a short wait to get to the top floor. Views were great, however food on top floor was too expensive
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Thereâ€™s a reason this is Number 1
REVIEW_BODY: Just amazing! Beautifully decorated and kept. Great views from the bridges. Also a great message about the environment and sustainability afterwards. Definitely my number 1 from Singapore. If you had to chose only 1 dome this is the one to chose.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: This is the reason why you visit Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
Prior to our visit to Singapore, everyone kept telling us about this wonderful place called "Gardens by the Bay". When we got there, we were mesmerized. The huge "towers" were reminiscent of the movie "Avatar". The Gardens is HUGE--you can easily spend an entire day wandering through it and not see everything. Unfortunately for us, we arrived late and were pretty exhausted, but we did spend a couple of hours walking around._x000D_
_x000D_
The most pleasant surprise was that there is no admission fee to enter the Gardens! But I'm told there is a charge if you want to walk along the elevated pathways connecting the towers. (We didn't get a chance to try that out.) And if you can stay late enough, the towers light up in a dazzling light show!_x000D_
_x000D_
The Gardens is right next to the equally fabulous Marina Sands Hotel, so we wandered over there to check out the hotel and its glitzy shopping mall._x000D_
_x000D_
Plan a couple of days for the Gardens by the Bay to get the full experience. Highly recommended.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely views around the harbour, pretty hot in the blazing sun with little shade so suggest you go in the evening
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was mostly too dark and it was impossible to see some of the animals. Most of them were probably in hiding or asleep. But overall was an okay experience.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: November is really wet and rain season so it would bea good idea to tuck in an umbrella or raincoat. Still this iconic Singaporean symbol is the place to go, with which includes a spectacular 360 view of Marina bay. The attractions around are pretty much interconnected and mostly free.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Been there 3 times, usually with overseas visitors - always great and very creative in the displays, especially the tulipmania.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing to be at the zoo
REVIEW_BODY: The zoo is amazing with new attractions being added. Most attractions are within walking of each other
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful scenery with a full bay view of Singapore. Lots of tourists, place must go when visit Singapore
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Entry fee is waived for Singaporeans and Permanent Residents. Bring your identity card. Free guided tours are provided. Interesting visit!
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Its hard to explain what you will see in this Garden with fake trees but go there and watch the light show 7.45 pm, itâ€™s amazing, itâ€™s spectacular and cool. Walked around for about an hour before, sat down and waited for the show. The walk is nice even though itâ€™s crowded, if you want to be on the bridge when the light show starts, be on time, if you want to sit down when you watch the show, be on time._x000D_
But itâ€™s well worth the waiting.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Really Fantastic Could Not Recommend Enough
REVIEW_BODY: This just a fantastic area of Singapore to visit with the highlight the rainforest and flower domes which really are quite stunning. Yes it gets busy and yes there are lots of people taking pictures but once you get over this frenzy there is so much to see and the surrounding gardens equally amazing spaces.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
My girlfriend and I visited here on a Friday evening around 9pm. It was very busy and bustling with a self generated atmosphere, no need for music or neon here._x000D_
We sought out stalls 7 & 8 which came highly recommended. They had no space for us outside their stall but led us up a small staircase to a table in front of the beer stall (happy days!). We placed our food order and then sat with our jug of beer soaking up the atmosphere. I don't know if it was a case of out of sight out of mind but our food did not turn up. Initially we did not query it because we were unsure on waiting times but finally it became obvious there was a problem. I went back to the stall and they had clearly forgotten about us, we then had to wait a while longer for our food._x000D_
The food itself was tasty. (Top tip, don't dismiss the lady who approaches your table selling wet wipes. No napkins and eating with your fingers - why didn't I just pay the lady that dollar!!)_x000D_
All in all well worth a visit but try to keep in the line of sight of your chosen stall holder.
ADDRESS: Boon Tat St | Lau Pa Sat, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great temple with lots to see inside. Several levels with unique exhibits at each level. Quite peaceful despite the tourists. The top level is absolutely stunning.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We did a nighttime zoo train ride. The lighting is about 3 times as bright as a full moon night, but the animals still perceive it as night, so they are fully active & visible as you glide by. There are good concessions, including everything from gelato & snacks to full buffet meals.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Enjoyed the Cloud Forest, the Flower dome â€“ not so much
REVIEW_BODY:
One of the features of the Singapore skyline, the Gardens by the Bay super trees are a notable element of the Gardens by the Bay. There are public gardens, a multi-storey Cloud forest (easily accessible via lifts, escalators, etc.) and a large low-level flower dome. There is a light show (not amazing) in the evening._x000D_
_x000D_
The Cloud Forest features a large waterfall and an ambling walk around the perimeter of lush tropics, green gardens. There are some interesting stalactite's and stalagmites on display (wonder how they were removed from their original sports and transported!), and interest sculptures fashioned from polished and worked timber._x000D_
_x000D_
We were perhaps unlucky with the timing of our visit to the Flower dome as they were readying it for what promised to be a very busy cherry blossom festival and we were left with displays being reworked and some pretty dreary and uninteresting displays._x000D_
_x000D_
There was also a big function on in the function room which is part of the Flower Dome and the high-tech presentations taking place didn't add to the atmosphere. Also the skywalk wasn't operating._x000D_
_x000D_
It's an expensive visit and while it was worth seeing it wouldn't be on the "see-again" list unless there was a very significant special exhibition taking place. Plenty of shops, a few restaurants and afterwards we decided to follow the signs to the satay club which turned out to be an excellent food complex with a range of eating places, but certainly a much further walk than the signs suggested.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Part of the Singapore Botanic Gardens, this is a must see. One of the worlds most beautiful flowers shown off better than I have seen anywhere. A couple of pounds to go in does not break the bank either!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The two domes and gardens here provide enough interest for at least a half day visit. The variety of plants and the extent of the site together with the innovative displays make this a really interesting site.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A good view of the City.
REVIEW_BODY: This is preferable to the Singapore Flyer as both THE SAME VIEW. In the MBS Skypark, though, on could have a leisurely walk around for at least an hour and have panoramic view of the city; it is also a better option for photo shoots.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The place is stunning and a tribute to Singapore where space is a premium. Whilst I thoroughly enjoyed my time in the Gardens i have to give massive thank you to the staff at the main gate. I lost my phone but within a very short period it was back in my hands. Singapore; you are the best!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Spoilt for choice when looking for,somewhere to dine
REVIEW_BODY: There are endless Chinese restaurants to choose from, but be aware that some do add a service charge to your bill. Lots of Chinese Souvenir, clothes or medicinal shops to choose from.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place if youh have time
REVIEW_BODY: Good place to enjoy clouds if you have time. One can enjoy the tropical environment with lot of clouds and greenery.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved it but actually preferred the Flower Dome. The walkway was great though - great views. Worth a visit and nice and cool.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The price may be steep, but the view is worth it. Marvel at the city of the future from 60 stories, the angles from all sides provide very different and breathtaking photos.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I always travel down to have authentic chinese food, especially sichuan food. If you find a good restaurant, it was affordable and nice. Really...my favorite part of Chinatown is food, food, food..._x000D_
_x000D_
of course you can buy some small items with Chinese culture. cheap and interesting too._x000D_
_x000D_
The best is either mid-automn festival season or.Chinese new year period. LOTS OF fabulous decorations. to see and take photo!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The View is fantastic from here... You can nearly see what they are eating in Batam Indonesia. The Ambience is lovely. One of the best Man made view in the world. You are nearly eye to eye with the pilots in the passing Airplanes but they don't have a Swimming pool on board.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Always amazed by this great walk
REVIEW_BODY:
This is a must for anyone spending some time in Singapore. It is a beautiful walk that includes parks, bridges, walkways, and amazing views._x000D_
_x000D_
The telok blangah section is very nice as you get to walk on top of the trees, but the definite highlight is the Henderson waves and mount faber. We take all the visitors we get at least to that portion._x000D_
_x000D_
Once at the top of faber, make sure you cross through the restaurant on the second floor of the jewel box and see the nice walkway full of bells (all tied to a fence)._x000D_
_x000D_
It's really worth it!
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: While not as many exhibits as the Zoo, still worth the visit
REVIEW_BODY: Quite a nice thematic experience of the many rivers of the world such as the Nile, Yangtze, Mekong, Mississippi and Ganges. The touch pool was a bit small and had a long queue but other exhibits were well designed. I love the flooded Amazon the best. We skipped the included cruise because it merely went around the reservoir. The amazon rainforest ride was more interesting but to charge an additional fee was a bit too much. I would have rated this 5 stars if it was included in the ticket. The rainforest ride was nice, especially for children. Overall a good experience. There is a lot of walking though but the Panda enclosure is quite well situated considering you'll need some form of air conditioning by the time you reach it!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The supertree are most beautiful after sunset. Very calming and enjoyable experience. Daytime is quiet but the night time lighting really brings the supertree grove to life.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Singapore zoo is truth world class, built around a natural rainforest with clever man made bits added within the zoo compounds._x000D_
Animals are kept in enclosures allowing them to roam and I believe there is an active breeding program in the zoo_x000D_
There are a number of eateries inside and at the entrance, however food looks to be a little overpriced. This is on top of the entrance fees you already paid_x000D_
The icing on the cake are the daily animal shows. My personal favourite is the elephant show, but try not to miss the rainforest show as well_x000D_
There are also feeding sessions for various animals like the Tigers, polar bears and many more_x000D_
Overall, you could spend a full day out here and if it isn't too hot, you'll have a great time with the whole family.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Supertrees look nice, especially with the lighting at night; but nothing extraordinary._x000D_
Best thing about cloud forest was the cool inside, which was much needed thing after walking in hot humid singapore weather! but it was more of a cloud garden than forest!!_x000D_
flower dome was a disappointment; overall I din't find it worth paying 28$ for these..
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a MUST visit. So amazing. Going back in a few weeks so cant wait as missed the light show last time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There are many animals from different origins, divided into several zones, called Australasia to Frozen Turndra. There are also some shows like elephant feeding that you can enjoy for free.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We followed on our day after the botanical gardens and marine park. We had the chance to go and listen to Christmas songs with the lights off and on in unison. We also walked the skyline walk which gave the most beautiful night time views. It was a very warm night and sitting under the lights and listening to the Xmas songs was really very nice.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Had a walk round mid to late morning and it certainly is a must see place. Had lunch at one of the restaurants and have to say, it was one of the best I have had - shame I can't remember it's name, but it was on a corner and had 2 massive framed sharks fins on the wall..... sorry!!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Air conditioned glass dome, home to a glorious display of plants from around the globe. Perfume permeates, colourful displays surround to delight visitors. The blooms are graced with some fabulous statuary & metalwork, the art as glorious as the blooms ! Entering from the heat of outside, the cool is welcome, but what awaits the eyes is truly a vision not to be missed. Whilst tulips stole the show with their mass planting & colours, there was so much more to see. If your time is limited, then this should be your top choice, it's heaven Singapore style !
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: First day fun at a spectacular site
REVIEW_BODY: Exquisite site with exotic species full of information and great shop. All free so very worth a visit
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a famous mosque .it is very crowded on Fridays .specially in afternoon . It is near the Arab street .
ADDRESS: 3 Muscat Street Masjid Sultan, Singapore 198833, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: "Nice"... kind of a bland word, hey?! Singapore may be applauded for its conservation and sustainability efforts. Yet, somehow this experience has left me thinking that I should definitely visit the Botanical Gardens. I'm more of an actual "natural nature" person methinks. The flower dome was good - particularly liked the baobabs and the variety of tulips. The cloud dome was okay. Again... I like "natural" waterfalls :) I didn't stay for the sound and light show (which would be beginning around exactly now, as I write this review)...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A man made forest to showcase to the world
REVIEW_BODY:
We had been told that we needed to visit Gardens by the Bay, it was absolutely worth it! How right were all the suggestions. It was wonderful to be able to stroll around, take in the sights and sounds, enjoy the experiences and just be._x000D_
_x000D_
Well worth the effort of visiting.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Okay, I'll start by admitting that we never made it up to the top of Marina Bay Sands. So, if you want to swim in the infinity pool which overlooks the city, that's probably a better option._x000D_
_x000D_
HOWEVER, for a (cheaper) and just as spectacular view of Singapore, the Singapore Flyer would be my choice. This is especially true if you're a family (once you're all locked inside the pod, even parents can relax and and enjoy the sights, as there isn't anywhere for people to run off to!). Plus, the view continues to change during the 30min rotation - starting with views of the harbour and Marina Bay, and then ending with views over the city._x000D_
_x000D_
For the romantics, also check out the dining option. Two rotations (i.e. one hour) with a sit-down four course meal!_x000D_
_x000D_
And, after the flight, make your way to ground level to check out the Koi Pond. There are also great on-ground photo opportunities with Marina Bay in the background, or in front of the "Singapore Flyer" sign (tip for iPhone users, the panorama feature is handy!).
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Easily caught the train to the front door step of the unusual Haw Par Villa, free admittance into this odd amusement park of Chinese culture. Some dioramas need a new touch of paint but it only adds to the kookiness of the place. I thoroughly enjoyed my trip and highly recommend this to anyone travelling Singapore
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard Rd offers shopping and eating in numerous ways - hugely expensive to affordable. Easy to commute, clean, easy to get disorientated as there are so many levels to most stores! Down into basement levels and many stories up. A great way to spend days!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: beautiful flowering plants on vertial huge wall with waterfall. mesmerizing. worth visiting with young kids to show them nature.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: It's still a good place to visit
REVIEW_BODY: Catch the train then bus out to the bird park , it's worth the trip , plus the line goes above ground for a while so there's something to look at . The park itself is very well maintained and the birds are very well looked after , the highlight for my 8 year old ( possibly for the whole trip not just the bird park) was the parrikeet enclosure with all the birds landing on him so they could be fed . The eagle and anaconda show was good as well though clearly tried and tested by all participants ( humans and birds ) . With kids you need to allocate a few hours to get around. Very well worth it .
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went in daytime . Was veeyquiet just us and another couple in capsule . Great commentary throughout and great views of f1 track
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore
