REVIEW_BODY: This is an amazing artificial garden and its so huge that is itself a wonder. The place is fully air conditioned and the whole garden is natural. The special attraction are the huge trees in the entrance which is generating electricity for everything. Really wonder how they made all this possible.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An amazing view of the city, of the bay and the gardens too, a 360Â° view at 200 meters above the sea level. Even more amazing in the night!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Cool chill place. Very relaxing and scenic. Spend the day. Will revisit. Perfect way to spend the day
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A Serene Place to Pay Respects, Contemplate and Hope for Peaceful Future Worldwide.
REVIEW_BODY:
The Kranji War Memorial is a hillside cemetery that is quite beautiful in its serenity once you find it, private transport or taxi /GRAB is the way to go. It is definitely worth the visit if you are into war time nostalgia._x000D_
Regardless, honouring the dead who fought for their country is a wonderful thing to do, when you look at the young ages of the soldiers, you have a sense of great loss for the communities they came from._x000D_
The memorial honours the men and women from Britain, Australia, Canada, Sri Lanka, India, Malaya, the Netherlands and New Zealand who died in the line of duty during World War II._x000D_
There are more than 4,400 white gravestones lined up in rows on the cemeteryâ€™s gentle slope. Significantly the Chinese Memorial in plot 44 marks a mass grave for 69 Chinese servicemen who fought for Singapore._x000D_
There is nothing Glamorous about this site, only human compassion and gratitude.
ADDRESS: 9 Woodlands Road, Singapore 738656, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great example of a local temple
REVIEW_BODY: Really interesting to wander through this temple, seeing all the statues and people praying. Also the area around it is interesting to people watch too.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: ...from a National Museum. Actually it kind of started out on a bit of a (I'm really struggling for a word here) unexpected note. After purchasing my ticket, I was directed to an escalator that took me to the the top of the building's rotonda where you wind your way back down viewing a digital display of a forest (which I guess is Singapore back in the day). It was certainly colorful, visually pleasing, and the kids running back and forth seemed to love it. I guess for me, when I go to a museum (especially a national one), I'm expecting to see realia as opposed to basically digital animation. Then again, it's a nice wow factor for the kids. That didn't last long as you find yourself on the bottom floor in the main historical gallery of the museum covering the breadth of Singapore's history. Here is where I found the great displays and information panels I wanted. Too much to go into about what is displayed, but my visit to the museum today left me a question in my mind. A big part of the main historical gallery covers both the British colonial period as well as the Japanese occupation during WWII. There is even a separate display about the Japanese occupation; I believe it was on the second floor of the museum. What I found interesting was that these displays on the Japanese occupation really bring to life the horror that occurred during this period. Yet for the most part, the British colonial is sort of viewed through rose-colored glasses. Yes there are disturbing displays about things such as how the colonial British "encouraged" opium addiction, but I would think colonial occupation to be just as horrific, maybe even more debilitating, and certainly more insidious then a much shorter period of wartime occupation. I am certainly not trying to minimize the responsibility of the Japanese for their war crimes, it's just that I left the museum wondering why the scope of the British colonial period is not viewed in a similar manner.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: During my last vising in Singapore, they were still constructing the area and all I could see was the huge tree like constructions in there. Now, I was very happy to visit this place. Not just that the place was well conceptualized, but it reminds me that there are people who still care for nature. I salute Singapore for taking care of the environment and proving that people can develop a place without destroying mother earth. Will be back again.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is an example of efficient, cleanliess and beauty. For 8 dolars you can take a lift and walk between the iconic threes. There are also some places to buy snacks in there and there are also clean toilets .
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Try to visit on weekday and on the evening. It will be much comfortable. It can be accessed free of charge, but you have to buy tickets for the attractions. Beautiful at night too.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful Oasis in the heart of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: You need at least 3 hours in this place and its always best to avoid the midday sun. I recommend going early evening and then you can see the light show at 7.45 or 8.45. Some excellent views and the supertrees are amazing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Cloud forest is by far the best in Gardens by the Bay. Tree walk and water falls is amazing. Must visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Usual China town in any city. Selling a lot of tourist tat. The street food on sale is cheap and tasty.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What an experience... really nice .. the day we visited Singapore we visited for night safari and seeing animals in the night is another great experience.. they have beautiful facilities of transportation.. when we went there we took metro then took bus & reached there after coming out around 10pm we found that Lots of private buses and cars are there and in very nominal charge they are giving facilities.. amazed ... inside first we saw a dance with fire & then a show with animals conducted by a little smart girl which was excellent and after that the tram journey mind blowing... just love it
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A lot of PRCS. Really feel like in China.
REVIEW_BODY: A lot of foreign workers from China like to go there. A lot of Chinese type of food. Therefore food safety is a concern. Feel like the food is the for a long time. Not sure whether it is fresh or not.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Ita a great place to see singapore... its so beautiful and clean. Not polluted at all._x000D_
Here you will have the chance to see the city in a 360 degrees, from_x000D_
gardens by the bay to the highrise buildings. In order to avoid queu, we went there by 10:00. It is already open by 9:30. But there are no queus and also small number visits the place thats why youll have a greater chance to take several instagrammable photos. I booked my ticket at klook.com which comes also with a free unlimited ride on a hop on/off bus.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not as good as safari world Bangkok
REVIEW_BODY: I have been to Safari world Bankok and it has much more to offer than Singapore zoo. Singapore zoo was more of a regular zoo we see in India. Safari world in Bangkok has Dolphin shows, orangutan show, see lion shows, Birds sitting on your head and shoulders and much more. This all we missed in Singapore. Even the collection of wildlife is not that great.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The place is easy to find, you can arrived here by metro station and get off at Marina Sand. There are many shopping mall, architecture building tower. In the night, the place is more wonderful with light shows.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I loved this park. Really well set out. Birds are beautiful and unique. If I was time poor, I would choose this park over the zoo.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a scenic area that is fascinating to view at night. We took a leisurely stroll along the bay.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I visit the Singapore Zoo with relatives from Penang. Great place for families with young children. The children enjoys interacting with the animals and watching the shows. A good place to relax with children.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place to hang and rest
REVIEW_BODY: This is a good place to rest, relax or hang around with friends. With the bay, Marina Sands, mall and the buildings of Singapore as your background, it was pretty relaxing. They even have a show at night where people filled-up the stairs just to watch and relax.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When space is at such a premium in Singapore it takes a huge devotion to the natural world to dedicate such a large area to the best botanic gardens we've ever seen. Even if you only have one day in Singapore, spend half of it here.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Never got hassled by the shop/stall owners, lovely souvenirs and artwork. Food looks delicious and lots of it.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The entry is something not to be described but felt. You are greeted by a waterfall and the walk to the top passing various plant displays and coming back through the interior. Top stuff
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing. Plan your trip around this
REVIEW_BODY:
Go see the night show!!!_x000D_
_x000D_
My husband and I stopped by here on our last day just to see what it was all about, had I have known how amazing the night show was and I would have seen it more than once._x000D_
_x000D_
The cloud forest dome is amazing, even if you are scared of heights like my husband... the flower dome is worth seeing if you are doing the cloud dome. Do the flower dome first, then wait until the sun goes down to go the the night show and the cloud dome once it is all lit up. Trust me._x000D_
_x000D_
Will do this again 100%
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: excellent views of Singapore but expensive. There is a bar on the top as well if you want to hang out for a bit. Also a bit pricey though.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is truly a place you must visit but don't be in a rush. In the park there are two conservatories, the Cloud Forest and the Flower Dome. Make sure to see both. An appropriate time to visit would be at about 3:00 in the afternoon so you can also get photos during sunset.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the most beautiful gardens I have ever seen. The Orchid Garden is not to be missed. Easy to get to - and well worth the cab fare.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nicely kept and well maintained old time Singapore building, you will pass and visit if on Singapore bus tour. Well worth visit to learn Singapore's history.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A lot of effort has gone into these fantastic and extensive gardens by the bay._x000D_
They cover a very large area of landscaped grounds with many water features and statues._x000D_
It's free to wander round the gardens, but there is an entry fee for the two spectacular enclosed structures at one end of them. It's definitely worth the investment to see the beautiful garden exhibits inside.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful experience great animals and stylish night out . Every thing at the zoo is brilliant . Five star .
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit when you come to Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
Came here with my wife and my parents during Chinese New Year period. This was a must-visit place in Singapore and very impressed by it._x000D_
_x000D_
Cost of entry - $5 which is a bargain considering what we can see in this place._x000D_
_x000D_
The shop was well filled with orchid-related souvenirs and some really beautiful post-cards which we ended up buying._x000D_
_x000D_
With regards to the garden itself, the orchids were really well maintained and were colourful (can't really describe it). There were lots of different colours and types of orchids displayed along walks or in well-controlled green house. There's also the very English-like building with the "VIP" orchids (orchids named after monarchies/head of states who visited here)._x000D_
_x000D_
Overall - Amazing place to visit and such a wonderfully well maintained place.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: My Gardens by the bay review Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the bay is 1 of the most popular sites in Singapore! I rate Gardens by the bay 10/10 it is a great Garden! It is one of the most popular and best gardens in the world! It is very famous after seen it on my favourite movie #crazyrichasians it is great to go at night beaucse they have a great light show every single night of the year even public holidays! Thanks for reading hope you enjoy Gardens by the bay!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very nice gardens , especially the VIP garden showing hybrid orchids for heads if state, royalty etc. we got taxi from Marina Bay to the gardens and the fare was cheap, can be difficult getting a taxi back, but the hop on , hop off busses stop there also. Suggest wearing sun screen that has insect repellent in it.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Singapore is a beautiful place and this attraction is well worth a visit. The displays are spectacular. You have to pay extra to go on the little trolley car around the exterior gardens. The view is spectacular from the top._x000D_
Takes quite a while to see the whole place so give yourselves_x000D_
plenty of time. We were there for several hours. If you book a tour they will pick you up from your hotel about 8.am or so after breakfast and take you there. Have to make your own way back though. We got a taxi from the gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Air conditioned, Oasis in man-made eden
REVIEW_BODY:
Fantastic gardens set in two huge air conditioned green houses, a lovely breath of cold air in the middle of 30Â°C feels like 37... Haha._x000D_
Many dollars (billions i was told) spent on these engineering marvels, the gardens are so well created and kept and a treat for gardening enthusiasts and children alike. The tree top walk and waterfall is really good and well worth the price._x000D_
All in all, a good hour or two in a cool environment, with the marina bay hotel sitting beautifully in the backdrop._x000D_
5 star
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is one of the better places to spend your money in Singapore. It is very well managed and the experience of flying in a glass capsule with a mesmerizing view around is breath taking. Since I have been in London Eye which is exactly same concept, so it was not that exciting but I would strongly recommend it to those who haven't been in one before.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: U can see whole of sentosa
REVIEW_BODY: A must must ride for entering Sentosa - this is the longest and highest cable Car I have ever experienced. The view from the top most point is wonderful and enjoyable.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Take this ride for the view as other than that it's nothing special. Seems safe enough although for Singapore it was surprisingly dirty with trash on the grounds.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: very very nice place. Bring your children for making them love the world. It is very good for making them aware how we are destroying the nature and changing the climate.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The outside it was very hot when we visited this place and we feel chilled inside. The distance from the Marina Bay MRT access to the main attraction is not so far. We recommend to buy the 2 exhibitions package . We think the 2 main domes are awesome. the kind of tulip i have seen it was never spell with words and the inside view.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing to see the nature especially on ocasions
REVIEW_BODY: It's one of the best attraction lately opened in singapore. It has many attarctions such: - Flower Dome - Cloud Forest - OCBC Skyway - Supertree Grove etc.... Admission for Two Conservatories 28 S$ Per Adult 15 S$ Per Child
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well this place is for anyone wishing to shop for anything at all. Shops. Shops and more shops. Branded shops. Designer shops. Unique shops. Food shops. Jewellery great prices. Good quality. A place where you will get lost in shopping malls linked and lead to the MRT (trains)
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Clean, well designed, interesting and beautiful. Lots of lovely flowers and plants. This and the Cloud is a great visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Located in-house in a building in the Garden of the bay in Singapore. A 40 m high mountain inside-covered with trees,bushes and flowers. There is also a waterfall covering the mountain. Absolutely worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must visit place in Singapore. A perfect place to take pic of Marina Bay Sands. Take a rest, read a book and have coffee. It was quite crowded and full of tourists taking pic. It is very hard to find a good spot as everyone occupied every corner. I suggest everyone to go in the early morning, 8-9am.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The humidity didn't stop us from exploring the grandeur of this garden. It's next to marina bay and it was very accessible. My family and I had so much great memories of Sg. And stepping on this garden made it more memorable
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Not to be missed atraction._x000D_
Many flowers and trees combined with lovely sculpted figures - very unique variation. The garden divided into regions according to origion (south america, Japan etc.)_x000D_
You can pass and look, but my advise is to stop read and learn. Take a profound scholarly look. Pay attension to spectacular variations of the plants._x000D_
Temporarily ( until 8th april), you can visit Japanese life style experience at Sakura Pavilion.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice and memorable trip where we got to meet Inuka for one last time too! Heartwarming outing with loved ones.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What an idea to make a tourism attraction like this . Garden by the bay reminds me of avatar movie. The sound and light show is worth watching and the trees look outstanding with lights . It is very good place to visit in the evening
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Like art? Like architecture? Like exploring Southeast Asian culture?!
REVIEW_BODY:
If the answer to any of the above is, "Yes", then you should definitely consider visiting the National Gallery of Singapore. It's easy to get to. Several MRT stations are nearby but City Hall is closest - and that is probably because half of the Gallery is housed within the old City Hall. The other half of the Gallery is in the adjacent Supreme Court Building. From the outside both buildings demonstrate their colonial majesty admirably (and are designated national monuments) but were converted into a terrific, flexible art and culture space in 2015. The interiors itself is worth the admission fee alone!_x000D_
_x000D_
But, of course, art is the real draw. The Gallery hosts the world's largest public collection of Singaporean and Southeast Asian art. Spanning many different eras, styles, media and ethnic origin, the collection is rich and, to be honest, my wife and I failed to get round everything in our first trip. We will be back though!_x000D_
_x000D_
If you are in Singapore for only a short time and only have a couple of hours to visit I would recommend one of the free guided tours. These are mostly delivered by highly knowledgeable docents and appear to run on the hour (late morning into the afternoon), covering different exhibits. We attended one tour and it was a great way to dive into some the Gallery's highlight works._x000D_
_x000D_
Nice cafe facilities and restaurants are on site if you need to recharge and rest your feet. The Gallery shop is also worth a browse!
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You have to visit China town when you are in Singapore. Loads of stalls, shops..... wow.... loved it. You are approached to have clothes made but I didn't...... perhaps next time. My husband and son were bored after the umpteenth shop..... so went back twice in my own for a good old rummage and came away with lots of items and gifts to take home.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Clarke Quay is a great area for either lunch or a night out. Lots of restaurants and bars in a pedestrianised area alongside the Singapore River
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Everything you need will be found here! plenty of upmarket brands and department stores as well as small stalls along the many tunnels connecting big shopping centres. you will need a full day or two to see them all, and bring plenty of $$$!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I'm not often a fan of zoos because it's hard to look at beautiful wild animals behind bars. The Singapore Zoo has a different approach and many of the animal enclosures allow for safe viewing that does not appear to be a cage. There are timed feedings of all the animals throughout the day so that you can watch that or even participate in some cases! There are educational placards and programmes all over the zoo and the focus is on educating visitors about the animals and how to sustain them in their natural habitat. While it expensive, it's well worth the money.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I trans ended the Maria Bay Sands and traveled to the top floor_x000D_
for the view. It was costly but awesome view of the city. Massive hotel with infinity pool for guests. I was not impressed by the casino. Too much security and too much smoke.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As long as you are not a environmentalist this place is a decent 1 time visit with decent Music show in evening.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There are many wonderful sites around the world, but only a very few stand out above 'First Class'. Such a place is the Cloud Forest in the Gardens By The Bay in Singapore. The City has done an amazing job with so many attractions, however the Cloud Forest literally took our breathe away for sheer beauty and astonishing contrast to every other nearby feature. By themselves, the Flower Dome, Sky Park and other places are first rate, but to walk into the Cloud Forest and be overwhelmed by that magnificent waterfall and treetop walk is - literally - 'beyond first class'.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: If you like gardens this is a must
REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are set in acres of natural land, although they are set out for the public you get the feel of natural landscapes that have eve olive drab over the the years, this is a must and such good value for money ant only a few pound each entrance
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice visit in this huge park...We were very impressed by the orchids...if you pay attention you can see some birds of prey flying and carps in the ponds.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: By way of disclosure I should admit at the beginning that I adore orangutans. For a few years I have been supporting charities caring for them in Borneo & Sumatra. I don't believe that such animals should be in zoos but, unfortunately I'm no longer able to trek through forests due to age & health. So the Singapore Zoo seemed the best & most humane option. It's a long way out of town. We took a taxi. Between two it was not too expensive. Then there's the zoo admission & the breakfast charge. So for a family quite an investment. If you'd like a souvenir photo with the orangs that another $25. No obligation to buy though. The breakfast looked to be quite substantial, but as we'd had breakfast at our hotel we just picked at a few items. By a stroke of luck we were seated in the front row so had a perfect view. And the orangutans? Such beautiful sentient creatures. The decline in their numbers due to palm oil cultivation is an absolute tragedy. Seeing them in the flesh was a dream come true. So dignified & calm. Don't miss this experience.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: THE ZOO IN A JUNGLE SETTING
REVIEW_BODY:
My latest visit to SINGAPORE ZOO was a fantastic experience & EVERYONE, 9 - 90 needs to visit. There are trams running around the entire extensive area (additional cost of $5 to the entry cost of ticket) of the zoo which you just get off at each station look around at the animals on display, then get on to the next tram, hoping off at next drop off to see next section of featured animals. The enclosures for the animals are so large & clean with plenty to keep the animals happy._x000D_
So much information is displayed to inform you of the particular species etc._x000D_
MUST see the Siberian White Lions. Wow. Majestic to say the least._x000D_
All exhibits have you close up & able to see the animals perfectly._x000D_
All this in beautifully maintained jungle setting with paths well maintained. Easy steps to climb. In fact me at 68 & awful knees found my visit to the Zoo relatively easy due to the tram ride. Zoo is very large & lots of walking if walking is the way you choose to see the sights._x000D_
Nothing but admiration for the way this zoo is kept. Clean & beautiful & so much to see
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's a surprisingly unique concept,Very refreshing concept.We used to seeing this for museums but applied it on Trees and executing it perfectly.Its overwhelming. indoor fountain and the walk down from the top in hanging bridge makes a adventurous experience.Dont leave Singapore without visiting Cloud forest.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great Buildings encompass the Art from a number of countries. The beautiful old Supreme Court and City Hall buildings have been encased in modern splendour. Views on the 6th floor of the Marina and the City are worth the entry fee,
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went to this attraction without not much expectation, and turns out to be ok. Night Safari opens at nights, so it is better to have the dinner early before to get there. The ticket includes a bus ride to take you around the park (around 45 mins duration), which we have seen some animals (you have to keep the eyes open because it is dark. Make sure you attend the show after you finish the bus ride.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Making the most of the Skypark
REVIEW_BODY: My tip is to plan on getting to the Skypark around 6.30pm. Take a leisurely walk around, taking in the magnificent view (don't waste your money on the Flyer, this is so much better) and then buy yourself a drink and watch the sunset at 6.50. Watch as the lights come on all over the city and the view changes completely. At 7.45 make sure you are on the Gardens by the Bay side to have pole position for the light show at Supertree Grove. This goes for 15 minutes, cross over to the other side of the Skypark and watch the light show at the front of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Kill 3 birds with 1 stone all for the cost of the Skypark admission.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited here often when I had the annual pass. Recently visited here since the cost of this ticket with Flower Dome is more value for money. Nice waterfall, and "trekking" comfortably in the aircon. Very well-trained and organized staffing at elevators to guide visitors. Great for kids, nice skybridge.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
My wife and I had wanted to see this Safari but had some doubts about what to expect after reading some reviews. If your time allows then you can make the most of it quite easily._x000D_
With no time constraints or children in tow we booked on line for the two of us for a Tuesday, 9.15pm tram via WeekendGoWhere. Tickets were $32 each saving $26 before weâ€™d arrived._x000D_
To get there we took a bus from Beach Road, needing one change for around $7. It was the end of rush hour so pick your timing carefully. The 2nd bus went straight to the entrance._x000D_
We arrived around 8.45, in time to see the fire show, then walked straight onto a tram, less than half full, with no queue. The 40min tour was good, nearly all the animals were visible and moving - not always a given from our experience. After the tram we walked round,m the 4 trails, again, not many people, and lots to see at our own pace. The Flying Fox was the highlight._x000D_
Only thing we missed, being midweek, there was no 1030 show (only Friday and Saturday)._x000D_
For the return to Beach Road, as it was 1145pm we took an Uber for $12.50._x000D_
Enjoy it!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Really interesting. Worth taking the time to see
REVIEW_BODY: The battle box displays the history behind the British surrender of Singapore during world war 2. The circumstances in the lead up and what happened afterwards. Our guide through the display was very good and the crowd was a mix of all ages. Certainly suitable for kids and adults
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent even with two year old
REVIEW_BODY: Was a really good day out, children's area was really good, everything was as advertised, would have preferred to go letter in the evening as the lights are supposed to be pretty nice.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A great garden to be in
REVIEW_BODY: A fantastic collection of flora from all parts of the world. Rhododendron collections are awesome. It has a great collection of orchids and bonsai too.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Street filled with high end designer goods and name brand items. Modern and new. Two MRt stations along road.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: this place reminded me of the area around dubai mall. it is cool for a one time visit. make it at night
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Entered through the Rotunda down Story of the Forest to History of Singapore. Fascinating exhibitions, could have spent all day there. Also had tasty light lunch in the cafeteria. Will go back to see more.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: So huge dome to nestled tons types of flower & plant. In air-cond. atmosfere make your visit so much cozy no matter what outside weather would be. Worth place to visit...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent several hours in the gardens with my partner. We really enjoyed it. The highlight being the Orchid Gardens which only costs $5 for adults to enter otherwise the rest of the gardens are feee. Plenty of trees for shade and some cafes to buy food or cold drinks however bringing your own food is a good option too for a picnic. Some wildlife could be seen such as beautiful birds, squirrel and even a giant lizard wondering through the garden! Apparently monkeys come in too occasionally.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A special beautiful and amazing places i been visited. Feel fresh enviroment during walking inside the garden. Will more recommend to friends and family members.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
What an amazing place! The gardens are beautifully kept & it was great to see the wildlife & watch the joggers, dog walkers & locals doing their martial arts. We spent 3 hours here but could have stayed longer._x000D_
Our favourite part was the orchid garden, quite stunning!_x000D_
Iâ€™m so glad our friends recommended we visited - this is a must if visiting Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: To our mindvthis is not one of the best botanical gardens. The most interesting is the orchid dep, but you have to pay extra entrance fee. You must really dig these flowers otherwise you feel slightlybdisappointed. Can be very hotbin sunny days as well. Bring plenty of water
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved orchard road!! A long stretch of malls.. all connected to each other via the metro and you can walk all the way through each mall. Each mall has multiple food courts with a variety of cuisines.. weekends is very busy.. best to go on a weekday!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The cloud & forest dome are amazing. Temperature are keep at cool temperature suitable for all the different types of plants & flowers. The whole garden is running on green energy. It could get a little bit crowded during weekends.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A beautiful place to escape the buzz of the city and immerse yourself in stunning gardens and nature
REVIEW_BODY: Excellent way to spend a morning strolling around the lush gardens, paying $5 to enjoy the beautiful orchid gardens and just relax in stunning gardens.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: An absolute Must. Do not miss!!
REVIEW_BODY: Part of the botanical garden, we toured the orchid portion and were overwhelmed. The most beautiful sight every!!! Didnâ€™t have time to do any of the other sections, although I imagine that they are beautiful as well. The grounds are impeccably Maintained. The emphasis is on the beauty of the orchids, gathered in clusters, rather then the science.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We werenâ€™t sure what to expect but thoroughly enjoyed the Battlebox. Very interesting and well informed guide. Well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: As far as the eye can see (of Singapore)
REVIEW_BODY:
Going here is definitely on your bucket list if you visit Singapore. I really like the view (and I bet it would look even more amazing at night, but I have yet to witness this), but you really have to take a lot of pictures and take your time so that you can make the most of the 29SGD you have to pay for to get to the viewing deck._x000D_
_x000D_
There's no shade, and the stuff they offer there are overpriced, so be prepared to get some sun if you're going in the morning until the afternoon. We were there at a time where there weren't many people (Monday), but I also went there another time when it was the peak. Once or twice is enough, and maybe a third time if I get to see the view at night.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Picture spots with nature and history and a six inch gun
REVIEW_BODY:
Colleagues brought me here to scout a filming location, and this was a hot favorite in our list. The Labrador Jetty is a picture-perfect spot if you get the subjects on the jetty and your camera on the park side to take a shot against the shipping docks behind the jetty._x000D_
_x000D_
Another draw is the Pasir Panjang Battery and the remains of the fortress that once operated on this spot. It's quite a walk to get to these locations, so I had to give those a miss. However, the 'six inch gun' was near the car park and we could have had a peek if it was not about to rain._x000D_
_x000D_
There is some fauna in the area as well, as I ran across some local jungle fowl and a peacock.
ADDRESS: Labrador Villa Road Tanjong Berlayer Park, Singapore 119187, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A friend of mine had a grandad in the war who visited Raffles,I said I would visit there, when I got there it was closed for refurbishment, we then heard about Chijmes the old convent later a girls school now in the business district it attracts the disposable cash types - very trendy relaxed atmosphere - when we went the World Cup was on - amazing big screen where everybody can see - great place to watch the footie and have a Schooner of beer whilst a cheeky little history lesson on the way!
ADDRESS: 30 Victoria Street Chijmes, Singapore 187996, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Chinatown is predominantly Chinese, however it has other races and religion that has established its footings in Chinatown with one of the earliest Hindu temple and Muslim mosque located there. The area will give you a glimpse into early Singapore.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: With 20 people in one pod made it was a little difficult to see the view and there was a lot of standing. Queues to get inside took more than 45 minutes. Best to go outside school holidays.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Seriously, this place is only for kids
REVIEW_BODY:
You can't think of this place as an art exhibition space, rather as a venue designed for hosting children's parties and school excursions. As two 30 year olds without kids expecting a series of cutting-edge light installations, we felt horribly out-of-place at the ArtScience museum._x000D_
_x000D_
We were finished in 10 minutes: the interactive light installations used in all the publicity are simplistic and very small in reality. In between these two photogenic spaces are countless activities just for children, including a small slide, crayon drawing stations and a ball pit. Even though they were all in gleeful use by a large school group, it was hard to ascribe any of these activities with the artistic or scientific merit suggested by the museum's name. Considering how expensive admission is, it was a major let-down due to the huge disparity between reality and museum's marketing.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Somewhat disappointing memorial to an event that shattered so many lives.
REVIEW_BODY: There are few tangible artefacts in the museum, and lots of reproductions or facsimilies. The museum serves a purpose for later generations who may not fully appreciate the events that led to the incarceration of so many men in such appalling conditions, but those looking for a more personal insight into the horrors that occurred there may be better advised to red survivors accounts in the various books available. I'm sure that the good people of Singapore will never allow these events to be forgotten, but equally, I understand that they do not want to be defined forever by them.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
if you enjoy queuing you will love it. The queues are terrible. I arrived at 6pm, had dinner then queued until 8:40pm to get on the tram. I didn't actually get on the tram. I gave up because my child was beyond frustrated and fell asleep. A waste of time._x000D_
_x000D_
And yes I booked in advance online. It didn't help at all._x000D_
_x000D_
It is also surprisingly family unfriendly. For example no handy nappy change facilities.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Being my 3rd visit to the Gardens it was surprising to see just how much things have grown. A good exhibition in both Domes and the signature Super Grove climbers are nearing the top._x000D_
Made even better as the Xmas exhibition was starting to take place. Always a relaxing place to visit. Did not stay for the evening light show due bad weather.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent Art, Special exhibit and building
REVIEW_BODY: We visited to see the Impressionist Exhibit, but greatly enjoyed the free one-hour tour to see some of the highlights in the permanent collection. The tour helped a lot, as we certainly would never have understood the back-story and significance to the art otherwise. In addition, the tour talked about the history of the building and some of the features, which was very interesting. The temporary Impressionist exhibit was excellent.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: While on our City tour we bought tickets for the Singapore Flyer and the Bum boat ride on the Marina Bay. I have never had a similar experience before. Hence when I boarded the flyer I assumed the experience will be similar to watching the Cityscape from any other multi-storied building. However, I was wrong. The Flyer takes you for a 30-40 minute ride at a very slow pace. You are to view the Marina Bay, F1 track, the Financial Districts and the Surrounding Area. It is an amazing place to soak the view and to take lots of photographs. The Capsules are made up Sea through Reinforced Material. It is very steady and hence very safe.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Loved it. Really informative and fun and very cleaver my done with the small / distinct separate river system exhibits from all around the world._x000D_
_x000D_
Heavy emphasis on conservation & sustainability._x000D_
_x000D_
Panda exhibit was amazing. We saw both out & about. Really special._x000D_
_x000D_
Free boat trip is a bit crap, to be honest: 10 minutes around the reservoir._x000D_
_x000D_
Additional Amazon experience is worth the money._x000D_
_x000D_
Best of the lot...the dugongs! Massive aquarium holding these majestic creatures. Could have watched for hours.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is where night life begins in Singapore and it ends there...It's a vibrant place which will bring your party mood uplift...So many bars and restaurant...gigs around you..loud music ..Makes this place a must visit in Singapore..
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you plan to go shopping in this place.. I will have to disappoint you cause apart from souvenirs you cannot get any thing much. But on the whole i give 5 stars because it's a place which is quiet and a place you can go for good walks.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you like a lush setting with the an amazing array of very colorful flowers, be sure to visit the Singapore National Orchid Garden. We're not passionate flower lovers, but the variety and colors of these flowers was fascinating. The setting is very peaceful - makes for a lovely walk.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This place is spectacular at night. It is full of cheap tacky stuff but was fun. We ended up shopping for a couple of hours and found some good food too._x000D_
Probably one of the cheaper places for a cold beer too._x000D_
Worth the visit for anyone happy to slowly wander and just take in the site.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I did not enjoy the place much as I hate to see birds in cages. That said, this place is sure to delight children who can have a close encounter with birds. It does have a very large variety of birds in capitivty there.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This a worth seeing, it is not stare gardens, they are truely beautiful. The waterfall is surprising.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited here while on a day tour of the city. Certainly a "must do" while in this city of orchids!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: if you like music, food and drinks go to Clarke Quay
REVIEW_BODY: the area is full of restaurants, bars and music. Full of happy people, enjoying the night life. There is a very nice atmosphere, despite the alcohol level. the restaurants we tryed served nice food. you feel safe when you walk around, even with kids ( 2, 12, 14).
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Itâ€™s beautiful show and music ðŸŽ¶ too and free at every night show !!! I love it watch it everyday when I am here!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth a visit based on its uniqueness alone. It's also free. Make sure you go into the early evening for an after dark visit when the sound and light show provide an xtra highlight.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The museum has a variety of displays explaining the history of the island from its first settlement, through the Japanese occupation to the modern day multi-cultural nation that exists today. Other exhibitions change on a regular basis so there is always something new to explore.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We did the tour and the Bay of Gardens was included, the evening light show was superb. Lights dancing to Xmas music. We later went back and visited both the Domes, fantastic and we'll worth a visit
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very interesting experience for the whole family. Adults can have as much fun sa kids. Staff was very friendly and helpful.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: really nice park you can walk to, it has a childrenâ€™s corner as well and it looks a bit like a mini waterpark. Thereâ€™s the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome which both display trees/flowers from around the world. I thought the cloud forest was nicer but that's just my opinion. Best part is that itâ€™s with AC! 28$ entrance.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There is a reason why it is right at the top of charts and it truly deserves it.. A must go even if one does not have a lot of time so can be visited for a quick round.. The whole place in itself can take more than half a day to explore.. The domes should be visited during the day time.. Entry to the park is open till late at night and free of cost.. The conservatories have to be paid for and also the skywalk, which is around 5$ Singaporean and should not be given a miss at any cost.. The skyline of Singapore can be beautifully viewed from here and the breeze is amazingly cool.. Overall not to be missed.. One can also try their restaurant which charges a certain fee for access
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard Road is for splurging and hefty bills. It gives great options to shop and to eat but don't go expecting steal deals and bargaining. The street and shops tend to be much busier on the weekend.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you visit the super tree grove then you must go up the sky way. It's a wonderful experience. The view is spectacular from up there. However, they won't let you stay up for very long. Do not miss this experience
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The flower dom is nice if you are not European,the flowers they show are mainly our gardens flowers or some thing you see in our free parks every where
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We loved the openness of the zoo however, we went there to have 'Breakfast with the Orangutans' (that was the selling point). Firstly I found the cost for breakfast overpriced, then to be honest you are not really having breakfast with them, also you cannot touch nor feed them. So we paid for this overpriced breakfast so that we could take pictures with the orangotans then as we walked around the zoo we discovered that later anybody could take pictures with them for free (we didn't have to pay for breakfast) that annoyed me! They also charged $25 per picture, again over priced. I did get to hold a snake which I really nice but overall we spent way too much money. I left there disappointed.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Expensive but worth doing once while in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
On a clear day, the view is magnificent. It is not cheap but I have done it once and it makes for a nice memento of my visit to Singapore. Worth a visit (you can even do it at night)._x000D_
There are some restaurants in the complex itself, and nearby, you will find the Suntec Mall with lots of shops, restaurants and even a movie theatre.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice spot to roll, bike, walk, run, and watch kites !
REVIEW_BODY: Here is a cool and "fresh" (!) spot in Singapore with a nice view on the city. Lots of joggers, bikers, even hoverboarders (!) in the weekends, and last but not least, kites on both banks of the barrage - a genuine Singaporean hobby ! very nice to see and enjoy :))
ADDRESS: 8 Marina Gardens Drive Marina Barrage, Singapore 018951, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Absolutely Amazing -- Not to be missed!
REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful panoramic city views: the architecture, Marina Bay / ocean, Gardens by the Bay, and evening light and water show. This is a great photo opportunity! And, if staying at the hotel it's complimentary.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I enjoyed going around Chinatown. Everything is so lively and vibrant. There's tons of stores for affordable finds and awesome street food as well. If you're on a budget, Chinatown is one of the most affordable places in Singapore.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Loved to walk and stop by at little shops in this area of the city. A lasting cultural experience. My wife enjoyed finding little gifts for family back home, and meanwhile even young children find things that grab their attention, so it is absolutely okay with kids, if u want to add this programme to your visit in Singapore._x000D_
A family father
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you want some piece and quiet then this is where you can find some. There is plenty to see as you walk around taking in the many different plants and vegetation. You can also visit the orchid garden for a small price.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You could spend hours strolling through this precinct. Wonderful shops and restaurants and hotels. Absolutely loved it.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must to visit when in China Town
REVIEW_BODY: It is not an old building but it is well worth the time. You will need to cover shoulders and not wear short skirt. The ground floor is only a small part of this building. All floors are worth visiting and take time to find the garden at the very top with the prayer wheel.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Breath taking View which shouldn't be missed by anyone. the Amazing garden architecture is extremely beautiful.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Cloud Forest was great, I had originally planned for 1 day in the MANILA Bay area, with Cloud Forest and other attractions, but ended up calling back that night._x000D_
_x000D_
Great place for a walk, see plants, get ideas for the garden. Would recommend a visit._x000D_
_x000D_
Tip: Try and visit early in the day. Then when leaving get your hand stamped so that you can re-enter later in the night if you wanted to look round again later.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Not my scene at all. Lots of clothing and homewares that are available in my home city. So big and exhausting to walk around. I guess if you know what you want and where to get it then at least it's a one-stop-shop but I just felt tired after spending time here.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This museum tells the story of Singapore. The collection is worth your time. Don't miss this cultural place.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Everyone should experience cable car to Sentosa Islands, its beautiful, the only cable car in the world which crosses across Cruise station. Its amazing.......
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a lovely park, with stunning displays of flowers. Although it's fairly small, entry is really cheap and there are various sections which you can wander through.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best collection of orchids in the world.
REVIEW_BODY: We paid a morning visit to the garden. We were really amazed by the collection of so many fantastic orchids in the garden. The famous people orchid garden is a must. They have orchid named after Princess Diana, Margaret Thatcher and even one for David Cameron.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: If you can stay one day here!!
REVIEW_BODY: Believe the hype and everything they say about this hotel it is amazing, we stayed all day at the infinity pool and then had a reasonably priced meal at Gordon Ramsey's Restaurant in the mall attached to the hotel. If you are visiting Singapore try and book one night here and spend the day relaxing in the hotel.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
At many points during my visit, I lost touch with reality and felt myself trapped in a Changi war cell. I strongly believe there is no better complement for a war museum._x000D_
Please spend 2-3 hrs and go over all the exhibits and displays. Highly recommend! Only negative is rip-off pricing at the bark cafÃ©.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely place on the grounds of Gardens by the Bay. Take your time and enjoy endless beauty of flora and waterfalls ....lovely atmosphere and vistas. Rainforest feature attractions are certainly beautifully presented and I recommend this as a must see whilst in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Did not stay at this place but had to visit this amazing hotel and see the infinity pool on the rooftop_x000D_
Went to the Spargo bar on floor 57 and sampled their amazing cocktails whilst taking in the panoramic views of Singapore_x000D_
If you decide to visit the Observation deck on the next floor above their is a charge and not sure the view is any better_x000D_
Oh and the pool is amazing
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you have any interest in orchids or mother nature, this is a must stop. The beauty of the gardens really is a must stop for any visitor to Singapore
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard road is filled with shopping centers for people that want to splash out. Many places to buy most things, including jewelry. I found Taka on Orchard street excellent for good quality diamonds
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Close to the Center of downtown
REVIEW_BODY: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Hotel Orchard Downtown and it was very close to everything. Across the street from the hotel are shops and restaurants and bus stations. And since it was December all the shops and the streets were decorated with Christmas lights and Christmas displays. We walked at night and enjoyed the Christmas exhibits.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Main zoo was amazing. Very hot and humid. Must take water to drink. Great array of monkeys. Ability to walk in with the animals was great. The new butterfly enclosure needs further development.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Not worth the money. We had a better view from our 27th floor room at the Holiday Inn Atrium. Very few facilities were accessible to none residents.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice to walk around and snap some photos
REVIEW_BODY: We just enjoyed walking in this area, on a lovely day and enjoying Singapore. Just simple fun. I do not have anymore to say. It was just special to enjoy lovely Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The nature is fresh and nice. There are many strange flowers and plants. The orchid is wonderfulThe places is nice and clean
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The waterfront by the lion fountain is without a doubt the best place to see the water fountains and the pyrotechnic display from the hotel. Get there early and get a seat in one of the bars facing the hotel to really enjoy the show.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I love taking a slow walk through the Botanic Gardens, this really is a special place nestled close to the Singapore CBD. The array of flora is amazing and there are lots of interesting birds, butterflies and I even saw a very large monitor lizard!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The best tourist place of Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY: Amazing place, like nothing in the world. Worth the visit, especially the skywalk and the cloud forest. Go during the day and by night. No need to say that is a super safe city. Very organized and clean. English is a very common language.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is a must visit as a nature lover.......there are 2 fully covered AC halls in which a beautiful example of nature and greenary has been set up..........at night they look so bautiful with lights that u cant get your eye off from them......
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a DO NOT MISS if you go to Singapore. I don't particularly love gardens but this place is amazing. They have created an experience here and it is the most beautiful place with beautiful music as well and such a peaceful atmosphere. One of my favs on my ASia trip.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Truly a big wheel that can see the night city of Singapore. Recommended to those who has an hour to come.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the green space in singapore. Lot of flowers, plants and it is a very large space to discover. When i was there, i found a little chipmunk run across the trees. Very relaxing and peacefull
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: good views of the city and the bay
REVIEW_BODY: look down from the top over the wonderful Singapore, trace out the GP circuit and take millions of photos!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's an iconic place in Singapore very close to Gardens by the Bay. Have MRT access. The architecture is breath taking.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Stroll this road with my family when we stayed in Singapore and fun to stroll and tons of brands shops and malls.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Brilliant view of the City and the F1 Track. We got discounted tickets because we had F1 Tickets. We chose the Singapore Sling and they give you this as a cocktail when you board the flight.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I was gifted a surprise trip to this place, which I wasn't able to visit when I was a kid._x000D_
It was as amazing as I had hoped. The shows were educational as well as entertaining and the animals are simply beautiful. It's excellent to see these institutions breeding and helping improve wild populations of native endangered species._x000D_
I loved this place and would happily go back again.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I am happy when visiting this park, in addition to these gardens are beautifully clean and quiet. The place is also within easy reach, I stay in Geylang and near the MRT station, simply take the MRT station to the Chinese Garden. The garden is suitable for walkers and fresh air.
ADDRESS: 1 Chinese Garden Road Chinese Garden, Singapore 619795, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing structure, waterfall was spectacular, views were magnificent. The vertical plantings had me awestruck. It was easy to walk around the elevated platform and the lower level of the Secret Garden was very mystifying. The temperature inside the Cloud Dome was very pleasant.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It was not only interesting but well organised and the shows were great as you get really up close with the animals and then be given time at the end to interact with them. The boat ride was just a 15min break with not much to see and could do with improvement. The aquarium was really amazing and kids will be thrilled to be close to many species of fish._x000D_
_x000D_
Worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The museum is great, a beautiful building, but my experience was completely ruined by having to stand in line for 90 minutes on a weekend afternoon to buy a ticket. There was only one ticket counter open -- the museum should have been better staffed on a weekend, it's common sense -- for more than 200 people in line. So unlike other attractions I visited in Singapore which were efficient and lines moved quickly.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I've been here before, but am so happy I went again. This trip had a glorious tulip exhibit that I could not stop taking photos of. They also had a very cool Alice in Wonderland theme in the succulents area. Make sure you take trips through all the different gardens in the dome - Mediterranean, Australian, California + more.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Although it is a very traditional attraction in Singapore but you will never miss this signature of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The entry is free, esp from the Marina bay sands hotel side. The light & sound show at 7:40 pm is awesome!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: No personal touch on service and people are too cold. My kid had an accident at the pool and the lifeguard didnt care to do anything. The staff are always on guard like youre going to break the law or youre plotting to do terrorize them. Will never go back
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A visit here is a must, the gardens and especially the cloud and flower conservatories are outstanding. The whole area is amazing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Singapore Zoo never fails to deliver
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore Zoo never fails to give us an amazing experience, every time we visit it. There are tonnes of things to see and do. Also, there are limited time exhibitions and activities to take part in, especially for the kids. All in all, a wonderful place that you can visit again and again.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We made it in time for the last night show. It really is gorgeous. The tree topwalk was cool. A different view of the plabts and gardens that make up the "trees". We were disappointed we didnt have time to explore all of the gardens!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went here for a meal in the Italian restaurant had to book before we left UK gets very busy got greeted when we arrived the views were amazing staff were very professional food arrived pretty quick was not cheep but new before we booked it was well worth it terrace outside with bar and music service slow much better at night to get full view of city all lit up and seeing parts of the GP track would recommend and would go again next time in Singapore
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Catch beautiful sunset with awesome architecture
REVIEW_BODY: Brought my parents who's in their 60 when they visited Singapore. Beautiful place to walk around and enjoy sunset. Quite crowded during weekend.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Do not miss light show at 8 in the evening.
REVIEW_BODY: This is very nice place in Singapore to visit. You can take lot of good pictures. Also stay till end and watch sound and light show at 8 which is free.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The architectural bridge that offers the beauty of the city skyline
REVIEW_BODY: It is very interesting to visit this bridge at night, the scene of the city decorated with lights become one of its charms. Seeing this bridge burning among the darkness of the park also makes it an interesting photo object
ADDRESS: 221 Henderson Road Henderson Building, Singapore 159557, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I came across this lovely building and went i for a visit. I really enjoyed looking at the various Buddhas and what each represented. It's very serene.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Okay so we took this trip under a tour guide since it was offered as part of our stay in the hotel. What I love about this is that when you are under a tour guide, the queuing on the lines are relatively cut way shorter than visiting it on your own. We got fast tracked in all the lines that we need to queue, hence we were able to get to see all the attractions (except for the performance of the fire eaters coz it started raining), make sense right hahaha_x000D_
_x000D_
At first we did not enjoy the train ride safari, coz hey it was dark and the animals are really hard to see (you have to accustom your eyes to the darkness) but since we got more time in hands, we took another train ride and this time, since less people and now accustomed to the darkness we were able to enjoy the ride._x000D_
_x000D_
On the side note, if you have kids with you, make sure you have insect repellants with you.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Chinatown visit is always cheerful. The wandering eyes of tourist , young kids , colourful souvenirs shop. With antiques on display . Nice aroma of food with best coconut water with its cream available in China Town singapore. The Budhha Relic tooth temple is must visit site with nice ambience & peaceful environment inside .
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Probably The Most Famous Attraction In Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: If you made it to Singapore, go see the famous Merlion. Always busy with lots of people so just take the picture with everybody else. Situated on the bay also gives you a great view of the entire bay. If you are an adventurist, you can go seek out the other Merlions scattered in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Informative, mix of recreation & actual video from the time
REVIEW_BODY:
The combination of recreated scenes using realistic, life-like dummies and scene setting plus actual footage from the relevant times makes this tour incredibly interesting. The tour guide was knowledgable and presented the information well. Had a great time._x000D_
_x000D_
My only concern was the inability to take photos. Not sure why it is so, but I would have liked to have some memories of the tour.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Came up here at night and the view is absolutely stunning. There's 2 sides with one facing the Gardens by the Bay and the other the city and Raffles Place area. Most of the people in the infinity pool are not Swimming. Most are just here to enjoy the view and take selfies.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This trip have the Chinese New Year celebration feeling. Then most attractive are the beautiful flowers and decoration. Thank You!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bay is an amazing attraction, especially the 2 observatories - Flower Garden and Cloud Forest, with Cloud Forest the most attractive one. The man-made water fall and the misty forest is super cool! The music and light show in the evening in the SuperGrove tree section is also fantastic._x000D_
Any visit to Singapore is incomplete without a visit to Gardens by the Bay. Highly recommended for families.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Itâ€™s an amazing place to visit. Great walking trails, impressive lighting effects in the enclosures, awesome shows. Great place for young children and adults! Pride of Singapore!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I am not a garden person but both my son and I accompanied my wife to the gardens. We ended up having a fantastic afternoon both in the orchid garden and botanic gardens as a whole. They are very impressive and testament to the hard work put in to developing them. The diversity within the gardens is impressive, although this is only my opinion again not being a gardener, and a must see for any visit to Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Welcomed cool respite from the hot temperatures of Singapore .....beautiful gardens, waterfalls and all things tropically botanical contained under an impressive glass dome. Only negative is that having not purchased headphones we found that the printed information about specific exhibits was insufficient......would highly recommended
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We love the place for shopping with my Family and if you want the to watch movies try the Shaw House and if you feel hungry the Ion Food Opera and the Food Republic at Wisma Atria are highly recommended
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Can't see some of the animals, a bit disappointed. overall kids still enjoy themselves during the show.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's a zoo. They have animals in a cage... Otherwise no so easy to reach with public transport. $36 for an adult ticket. About $120 for a family of 4
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you like flowers and photography Orchid Garden is your place. These flowers are so amazing. There can visit easily many times because spieces bloom seassonaly. Ticket cost only 5$. The garden is my favorite place when I visit in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Those spectacular Supertrees are amazing. The are covert with beautiful flowers from around the world. Great concept!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You have not visit Singapore if you have not visit Merlion Park and take the picture in the Merlion Statue. This is very popular place. You can going here by bus, taxi, MRT or other transportation. By MRT you can turn down in Raflles interchange then walking. You can take a picture with some phoses mainstream either non mainstream. You can take picture as like drink from the water that come out from the merlion. Here, you can enjoy to walk and also sitting and enjoy eating because so many bar and restourant here with view singapore river and Marina bay sands.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very good, fun and great architecture. Good for families and kids! Take a few hours and go explore. Educational, beautiful and interesting.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Mostly are man-made structure. The most interesting amenity in this place is the cloud-forest dome, but entrance fee is very expensive. If you want to enjoy a free musical lighting show, come at night time around 6:30pm
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The animal wasn't as good, not worth the queue. The tram is ok for people that doesn't want to walk but if can, go for the walking trail, it's pretty good.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The enjoyable time for us is after 6pm, if you get clear weather no rain you could pay 8SGD per person to go to the sky bridge. Beautiful for photography but maybe a big problem for people who has the height-place-phobia.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Glimpse into the future & rainy day activity
REVIEW_BODY:
We didn't book this attraction and turned up on the day. It is quite a cool concept and while most of the plant life may be lost on some people for me I felt this was a glimpse into the future of how our kids would likely see flora "in the wild". Very well laid out with a mixture of flowers and plants and trees. Great to see boab trees up close._x000D_
_x000D_
The rainforest dome was also very cool._x000D_
_x000D_
Once you get up the walkway Take the stairs if you can handle them up to the very top as the lift line is quite long with people and their Prams._x000D_
_x000D_
Also be prepared to be smacked in the head with selfie sticks and generally people stopping in the middle of walkways for selfies.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is once the most prominent and famous shopping street in Singapore. It offers most luxury products and services within the reach of the outlets within the area of Orchard.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Impressive architecture at any time of the day...but at night the light show is fantastic entertainment. Gets very busy so be early if you want a seat, otherwise take a blanket and lie on the floor.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: highly recommend walking the ocbc skyway, i suggest coming at morning when it opens so there are less crowds and more peaceful
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went for the light show at night, was brilliant experience - the light show was choreographed with a best of Broadway music through a tannoy system. Brilliant experience, everybody sat or lying down looking up at the light show. Recommended.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This Merlion Park is where the iconic Merlion statue located._x000D_
Good location to take your pictures with you family or your selfies._x000D_
_x000D_
Its an ideal location to watch the sun goes down. It is a must visit location if you visited Singapore, albeit it's always crowded._x000D_
_x000D_
The location is within proximity to One Fullerton which has many dining option. Also you can start your Singapore Rivercruise from this area.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore
