REVIEW_BODY: We booked online for the 7.15 entry. It was mayhem when we arrived at 7.30pm. What seemed like thousands of noisy visitors with queue snaking everywhere. We queued for the 7.15 entry only to find that the queue had gone in and the queue was for 8.15 entry but the 7.15 sign was still being used. There were ushers shouting here and there to herd visitors into queues. We werenâ€™t given any programme or guide and was somehow led to an animal show. We queued and waited from 7.45 till 8.30 for the show to start. It was a 30 min show, interesting enough with various animals appearing briefly to do its stint. After the show, there was another queue for the tram to get around the park. When the tram ride ended, the park seemed to have emptied itself and we had a wonderful time wandering around on foot. My advice would be to show up after 9pm for a lovey time at a wonderful zoo which probably could not cope well with the deluge at 7.15pm.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: this is just a great spot to go visit. Lots of outdoor market areas, boutique stores, kischy souvenier stands and even an outdoor stage where they were doing country line dancing. This will be one of the first places to head to when we go back.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Magnificent from Garden Domes to Light Show
REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic and the Christmas Spectacular light show was magnificent. The mixture of every race , creed and religion enjoying the light show in tune to Christmas Carols certainly expressed the true meaning of Christmas
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Awesome display of botanicals. No chance to be bored. Mostly free except for orchid garden which was cheap enough.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We had a long Singapore stopover and decided to check out the future world exhibition. The lady at the reception was very helpful and told us that marina bay sands was doing a 2 for 1 promotion if we sign up to a free membership. Was fairly easy process and we ended up paying only $19 for the two of us._x000D_
_x000D_
The future world exhibition is very interactive and fun using lights and screens. There were a lot of children however we also enjoyed â€œplayingâ€._x000D_
_x000D_
Took some amazing photos. There is also an additional entrance to a interactive experience within marina bay sands shopping centre.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Tickets are easily purchased online._x000D_
I only had time for one exhibit and decided on the Future World ... When Art meets Science._x000D_
The high tech interactive exhibits were awesome! If you love taking photos, my advice is to go on a weekday when its less crowded. Highly recommend!
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nicely structured garden displays covering plants from most parts of the world. Many colorful flower displays and there were some very interesting wood carvings positioned around the dome. Parts of the dome have upper decks and plenty of spots to take a few good photos.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the nicest zoos I have seen
REVIEW_BODY: An impressive list of animals in a beautiful setting. The white tigers were my favorite. Animals from all over the world. I had pity with the polar bear - the tropics do not look like a good place to be. The zoo provides good guidance how to limit the damage done to nature by humans.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great and interesting location. Could have spend more time here. The climate makes the distances between things something to consider at this place when taking a toddler with you.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful visit, I highly recommend, beautiful forest and great air con!
REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful visit, I highly recommend, beautiful forest and great air con and waterfall. To include in your visits in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: we visited the main bar (by the infinity pool, not at the end of the building) and the cocktails were the best we had in Singapore (& much better than Raffles pop up bar which was more expensive!)
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went with my toddler and overseas friends to have an experience. All of us enjoyed the visit especially seeing the animals roaming just beside us..
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great Place for Family very nice and we enjoy very much our time spend at The Cloud Forest, nice and cozy , great if not on week end so you can have time to see and relax inside , they had also souvenir shop and restaurant .
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Came to just see the light show and had the most incredible experience. Truly stunning!!! We found a spot where we could see all the trees and Marina Bay Sands and just laid on our backs to enjoy the experience. A short stroll through the Sands hotel and we were there. Could this believe it was free as usually thin be as beautiful as this come at a price to experience. Loved it
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: For anyone who loves flowers and gardens, this orchid collection is simply stunning! Well worth the entrance fee to walk around at a leisurely pace and enjoy the wide variety of colourful orchids on display. It has a wheelchair-friendly route through the gardens and a refreshing cool house towards the end of the walk, finishing with the required gift shop before the exit! There are plenty of opportunities with seating provided for the weary but also for stunning photo opportunities. Indulge and enjoy!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: this a very short visit and would be good to go on your own terms the atmosphere was very up beat and food/drinks are available.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A Few Leisurely Hours of Edutainment
REVIEW_BODY: The River Safari is a fantastic venue of its own, situated right next to the Zoo.What was realy great was the simple to follow route that takes one through all the exhibits and enclosures, save for any optional cruises.Great display of animals and, near the end, the huge aquarium was a wonderful place to sit back and enjoy the animals. Wonderful excursion!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: All the Best Brands of Luxury items are available here on Orchard Road. 10-15 Malls can be visited here. Lots of Food joints and restaurants also located on Orchard Road.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A lovely garden within the Botanical gardens. The most beautiful orchids to see. It took around an hour to walk round but you could stay longer. The entry charge is very reasonable and there is no charge to just see the Botanical gardens. A lot of walking but worth it.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was a little skeptical, but was soon wowed by the beauty of the gardens. We visited both the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome both pretty amazing and well worth it. We went early about 9:30, no queues and no crowds. We took our time and then walked over to the Marina Sands complex for lunch and some shopping.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
An amazing oasis of calm in the midst of a bustling city. Arriving by the MRT, a spotless, on time metro we immediately entered another world as we went onto the gardens. The air is pure, the flowers are fragrant, the noise of the city is muffled to non-existent. My favorites were the orchid garden, a true wonder, and the cool house. This building houses plants that only grow in the colder temperatures of the mountains and upon entering on a hot day one is transported to such a mountain top. The wonder of this is truly outstanding._x000D_
This is a must see.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not so stunning & expensive for a tourist
REVIEW_BODY:
The price quite expensive, and we need to purchase EXTRA $3 for just a shuttle. which i thought the shuttle will drop at several places, but itâ€™s not. itâ€™s only from the ticketing office to somewhere nearby the MRT. should just get a free shuttle for those kind of price range._x000D_
garden by the bay more like statue by the bay when i visited last week (july) quite disappointed.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A beautiful day wandering beautiful gardens
REVIEW_BODY: I decided to spend a morning wandering the beautiful Singapore botanical gardens and what a lovely peaceful morning I watched a Tai chi class under the big trees that just looked perfect. The orchid display was wonderful this is their best flowering time so it was quite beautiful there are lots of photo opps throughout the gardens. If you want a little down time to relax and enjoy beautiful surroundings then make the botanical gardens a must see
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very interesting range of orchids worth visiting and very nice to take photos. People of all ages can visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: BEAUTY LOCATED INSIDE GARDEN BY THE BAY.
REVIEW_BODY: You can easily spend 1-2 hrs here.A water fall. 1st look from ground level. Then go upto 5th/6th floor and then come down one by one. climate controlled domes has so much to please you.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
My wife and I came here at about 11am and it took us about 10 mins in the line to buy a ticket - which wasn't bad considering how long the line was. It is S$35 entry for just the zoo, but if you have time for all 4 it is S$78._x000D_
_x000D_
So we walked in and straight saw 2 little white faced monkeys (not sure entirely of their actual name) running around freely putting a show on for everyone. After this we followed the boardwalk and saw a larger black face tamarind (I think) as it started to rain. This fella was running for cover and it was incredible to see._x000D_
_x000D_
We mainly came here for the orangutans as we spent 2 months in Borneo with them and we fell in love with them. Such beautiful animals and so smart and similar to us. They are free ranging (minus the electric wires stopping them climbing down and coming in contact with the public) and it brought back many memories._x000D_
_x000D_
We strolled around and saw many other animals - too many to name on here, but it amazing to see them all. Although some animals looked like they didn't have enough room or wanted to get out (elephants, pygmy hippopotamus, turtle and a few others) it was still quite a well kept and maintained zoo._x000D_
_x000D_
It was quite sticky/muggy so make sure you wear cool clothes, and also if you are catching a cab there and back, be weary of the taxi rank. It cost us $15 from great world city and on the way back they wanted to charge a flat rate of $50 which was a big stitch up. If you're lucky enough, go down to the drop off zone and jump in someone else's cab as they get out._x000D_
_x000D_
Great zoo and highly recommend a visit.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Had our special Valentine's Day dinner onboard the Singapore Flyer! Went a total of 3 times round and its was fun watching the waiters and waitresses rushing in and out! Not enough time to dine and enjoy the scenery plus take photos of both!! Not much of a scenery too except at that height, sun set can look amazing!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Our friends took us to a very popular restaurant in the bay and it was delightful. Huge place though crowded at places. Lovely place to pass the time of the day and enjoy water front.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Every orchid was breathtakingly beautiful - an easy walk through the garden. Plenty of benches - and the senior rate was 1 SD - 73 cents American. Walking through, around every curve of the path, another glorious sight. The garden is meticulously maintained. Every visitor to Singapore who loves flowers - a must see.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well, the enclosed gardens are cool. A welcome respite and very worth seeing. We walked from the Merlion Plaza - it's a bit of a hike in the heat; you might consider a cab, particularly if you want to spend any time in the outside gardens. I only regret we did not spend time here at night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
came alone with little food along with me and only one bottle drinks, without fully studying in advance,even that only one bottle of drink was rubbed by a monkey before I started my activity. so I did not drink one drop of water during the whole day travel._x000D_
its a good activity if not considering the water problem(there is none shops to buy anything inside the park, so do please prepare your food and drinks enough, and put them well in your bags not stolen by the moneys.:)
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: very well planned and gives us a glimpse of all the birds of these region, and natural habitate is provided and all the information is well displayed, the tram provides good access to all the areas
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A paradise for orchids lovers. Lots of different types of variety of orchids are grow here. Many colors and breed. It cost $5 per adult. Worth your time walking here. Spend some time at botanical garden.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore zoo is nice and shows many different animals. They have often quite some space, sometimes it seems a bit small.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Not nearly as impressive as the cloud forest but if you buy a combo ticket then worth having a look. If buying tickets separately then maybe give this one a miss, it's not that special
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Botanical Gardens the best in the world
REVIEW_BODY: Using the "Hop on hop off"bus we visited these magnificent gardens which are some of the best I have seen in the world. So clean and tidy with beautifully laid out lawns, lakes and plants. A day could be spent wandering around though we could only afford ourselves a couple of hours before continuing our bus tour of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is a must see in Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
Located at fort canning park._x000D_
_x000D_
$20 per adult goes for 1hour 15 minutes with a guide._x000D_
_x000D_
It tell the story of the last few days of ww2 and the fall of Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
Only down part you can take pics inside.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It is Singapore's icon, the Merlion! Usually if you bring someone that never been in Singapore this is a place that they must visit to make the visit complete._x000D_
_x000D_
When I brought friends last February the Merlion was underworked , but they prepared the smaller Merlion on the other side._x000D_
_x000D_
But in general, from this place you can take all iconic pictures of Singapore like the Singapore national museum which is pretty elegant , the Fullerton hotel building, Art Science museum, OCBC center, Marina Sands hotel, etc. Because this is a huge open spaces that you can take every angle of iconic buildings in Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
So if you are rush, come to this place and take all of Singapore iconic buildings !
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you are in Paris as a tourist, walking around Eiffel tower, you have to climb it. The same applies to Supertree Grove if you are strolling in Gardens by the Bay._x000D_
_x000D_
It is a short bridge, but quite interesting. It can be funny looking at some people afraid of heights (unless you are one of them)._x000D_
_x000D_
The visit is not a must, but why not if you are already there? Pay the ticket just next to the tree and take the lift up. Otherwise you will regret afterwards when you tell your friends that you have pictures of the tree only from below._x000D_
_x000D_
Ok, you flew half the world to Singapore. Next, go and buy tickets to the domes.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth to visit after visiting other attractions.. The weather was not cooperative though but it's worth it..
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is just a spot by the water with a merlion statue. I have no idea what the merlion represents but it must be significant to some as many were having photos taken there. If you want to see tourists behaving weirdly it's a good spot. I walked past it on the way to the botanic gardens/marina bay sands area.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very interesting, & well well worth a visit. So much to see and guide very knowledgeable. Would recommend it to all
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You must visit there when you go to SG. Itâ€™s free for entrance. But u should buy ticket to visit Flower Dome, Cloud Forest. Those are air-conditioned gardens. And u donâ€™t miss light show in the evening. You can pay for OCBC Skyway (ab 6$SG) to take a stroll through this area.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
After 5 years, we went there again, this time with a toddler. Booked tickets online, got there really fast, no crowd, all went well._x000D_
The experience this time was even better as we were pretty much alone and had a chance to take time admiring every single animal._x000D_
Best visit after 4 previous visits!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Amongst a whole lot of beautiful animals they have at the zoo, the Pandas took our breath way. These gentle giants are located at the cornest side of the zoo towards the end actually._x000D_
_x000D_
You can easily spend a whole day in the zoo. The kids have a special area with a wonderful waterpark._x000D_
_x000D_
Went during a weekend. Therefore, had to endure some long ques at eateries, rides and washrooms._x000D_
_x000D_
The eateries near the kids play areas tend to be ultra crowded so avoid those. You can find some small shops along the way (I remember seeing a pizza place as soon as you pass the lions) so if you can have your meals there you can a avoid the que. Not joking because I stayed at the mc Donald's que for almost half an hour + just to be served._x000D_
_x000D_
The walkways are mostly shady. Try to catch their animal shows if time permits._x000D_
_x000D_
I did not find the river cruise to be interesting. Would definitely recommend the zoo minus the cruise.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The food was amazing, everyone was able to have a photo with the orangutans and they even brought a snake for people to have a photo with and touch. A fantastic adventure which was very reasonably priced. LOVED IT!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful natural wonder with amazing engineering!
REVIEW_BODY: During our 10 day business trip from Houston to Singapore, we had one weekend to visit some of the Singapore landmarks. This one is definitely worth the visit. The Cloud Forest dome is part of the Gardens on the Bay attraction. We bought one combined ticket which allowed us to see both domes - which are indoors which helps with the tricky Singapore weather. Of the two, we preferred the Cloud Forest dome which includes an indoor waterfall, but the Flower Dome was also quite beautiful as well. My favorite was the unique "sculptures". Be sure to see both domes.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Went to the top and had a some coffee as watched sunset, this place is incredible, if I am not mistaken it's on the 81st floor..the lifts are extremely fast...but you got to pay to get to the top._x000D_
The swimming pool is awesome and you feel at the top of the world._x000D_
You can literally see the entire Singapore from the top._x000D_
Jabir.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Covering a largish area with many market stalls selling anything and everything at reasonable prices plus lots of eateries.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a must see if in Singapore. The scale and attention to detail is superb. Even if you're not into flora and fauna you will enjoy this.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A really well planned tour! Informative and enjoyable. Well worth the visit but be sure to book it ahead as it sells out quickly.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was a bit disappointed. I thought there would be more walk through and more hands on. Most are in cages and the shows are their attraction. On entry you can have your picture taken but not with the macaws. As I own a macaw(12mths old) I wanted a pic with the red or blue but that was a no go! Extremely disappointed.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: While the views are nice, the price is steep
REVIEW_BODY: The views are definitely nice, but at over $30 per person, I can't say the money was worth it and only having 3 elevators makes for some ridiculously long wait times to get up and down. We left 5 minutes before the end of the light show and were lucky we did as we only had to wait 15 minutes to get back down, but the line up behind us was massive within 5 minutes. I'd be surprised if it was less than an hour wait. And the light show is much better when watched from ground level.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very interesting worth a look ðŸ‘€ busy busy busy , markets close by they were very good too , we had our 2 girls they found it all pretty amazing lots of different things too see
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun to visit a huge, world known shopping area
REVIEW_BODY: This easily accessible, giant shopping area has something for everyone. I had a wonderful dinner in a department store. I wanted to see this well known shopping area, and it was enjoyable - for a few hours. I'm not a shop-a-holic, but fthis wa fun to see, especially just before Christmas - many colorful decorations. It may not be fun for everyone, but a person could easily move on to other attractions in Singapore.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to take in the city's ambience, best in the evening.
REVIEW_BODY:
Take a walk down to the waterfront promenade and be thrilled by the views of the Marina Bay Sands, the Merlion, the Fullerton hotel and the general buzz of the marina. Walking is the best way to see all the sights._x000D_
The night is the best time to go as there is a laser light show at the Marina Bay Sands at 8pm and another at 9pm. There is often other entertainment along the promenade including dragons and dancing when we were there. And many of the buildings are lit up to enhance the experience._x000D_
Great to people watch and relax as you take in the views. Wear good, comfortable walking shoes.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
-this is an absolutely stunning garden, but be prepared to walk._x000D_
-its very hot and humid so be prepared ensure you have a sun hat gasses, umbrella and water._x000D_
- its a 1.5km walk from Orchard station_x000D_
-beautiful spot to take flowers._x000D_
-go when its over cast
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Full of shops and that's it. Nothing really special but I'm not a shopper either. In the evening full of hookers next to orchard towers
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was our first visit to the Jurong Bird Park. It is everything that we expected. It is easy to get to by taxi. So much fun for the kids and so much information for everyone.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Another venue that almost blows you away because of its size and the flora on display. Great photo opportunities and an amazing structure.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: ANOTHER FANTASTIC MUST VISIT IN SINGAPORE PLACE. HOW THEY HAVE CREATED THIS WONDERFUL PLACE IS is beyond words to explain. fantastic idea well incorporated. i must visit it whenever i go to Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing views from the top floor which also has an infinity pool. Very good place to see sunset. Can easily spend a few hours there.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun, but probably better at night...
REVIEW_BODY:
Had some time to kill on a recent business trip to Singapore, so I walked down to the Marina and went on the Singapore Flyer. It was a Saturday, so it was pretty busy all around._x000D_
_x000D_
Boarding the cabin should be a fairly easy task, but there was a large group of people from either India or Bangladesh, possibly Malaysia, that couldn't follow instructions. The ferris wheel doesn't stop, so you have to keep moving to board the cabin. The workers were telling them to board, board, please move forward and get on, but they all wanted to be in the same cabin, and were messing up the boarding process for everyone else._x000D_
The cabins hold around 20 people I think. Anyway, they eventually figured out that they had to just get on and their party would be split. The ride takes about 30 minutes. Views were nice, but it was cloudy and rainy the day I went, so it wasn't the best. I can imagine that it would be beautiful on a clear night._x000D_
_x000D_
It was fun to do it once. If I go back, I may do it again at night, but wouldn't do it again in the daytime.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited this place three different times. It is just interesting to walk around and see all the options they offer, from food to souvenirs. I think you have to go there at least once. It is easy to reach by public transport (there is a metro station).
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Seeing the same animals at night, while you are sitting in a tram/cart - if that excites you, then go for it. It didn't amuse me that much. The fact that the place is super-crowded all the time (although the management of crowd is done very well), and one has to wait in queues, makes it even less attractive.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Though a bit tiring for elderly couple, but Orchard road is very vibrant and full of activities. All good trendy malls are located in this street. It is connected with SMRTs. Easy access for all. Covered with big trees. If it rains, one can take shelter in the malls. Lots of street food shops. One can buy according to one's pocket.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful garden in a vast area. Many kind of plantations here. Any types of transportation can take you there; buses, mrt, taxies, and cars. You can visit this garden for free except for Cloud Forest, Flower Dome, and OCBC Skywalk.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The rainforest is big but animal getting less.
REVIEW_BODY: I remember the first time I visited Zoo is on 2003. That time is not so well organize but yet i able to see many animal while walking around. Now is getting less or maybe animal and human is getting far of each other.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: one of the most beautiful places we have ever seen. The flowers & orchids are phenomenal . The layout is wonderful with the pathways through the gardens. It is located in the center of Singapore & easy to get to. We were on a tour of the city.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: My teenagers did not enjoy the visit here
REVIEW_BODY: We visited on a public holiday and extremely warm day. We walked through a popular food venue which was crowded and stifling hot and then walked around the streets. My teenagers did not enjoy visiting Little India at all. They found it to be smelly and dirty and didn't like feeling like tourists. They preferred ChinaTown and Haji Lane.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This museum really brings home to you the horrors of the events of WW2, and the terrible inhumanities suffered by the prisoners of war, both at the prison and on the Burma Railway. Terrible stories in this now peaceful setting. Lest we forget.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited this place in the evening. There were lots of different goods to buy, but I think we have seen markets like this a hundred times before. We had a nice walk here, but did not buy anything._x000D_
_x000D_
Unfortunately we missed most of the interesting building architecture. The area we visited was very dark. But try the areas between Pickering Street/Church Street, Telok Ayer Street/Anson Road, Cantonment Road or New Bridge Road._x000D_
_x000D_
Look for more reviews by MulleEllum.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic view of Singapore sky Line and worth it just for the pictures. I would probably opt for this rather than the wheel as you are not time limited and have more room and angles for photos.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Enjoined and stunning with a landscape and city view of Singapore, one of landmark thatâ€™s recommended donâ€™t miss, food was great too.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to Visit, the day we went it rained but it did not spoil anything very well spread out and staff very friendly
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A lovely afternoon in the gardens
REVIEW_BODY:
The Gardens by the Bay and the Cloud Forest really caught us by surprise and we enjoyed it a lot more than we expected. The architecture of the buildings is amazing and the gardens themselves were both interesting and relaxing. The climate control is a pleasant escape from the steaminess of Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
We had a lovely afternoon and would definitely recommend it to friends and family.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We used the cable cars all day. We went to Sentosa beach and back up towards Changi. Great views of this amazing city.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went there for the first time and I was surprise how tourist friendly it is. Clothing was being prepared for those who wear mini skirt or shorts. Impressive.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Took the kids back here today for the trip from Mt Faber across to Sentosa. Easy to park the car at Mt Faber and then just take the cable car across, provided you can leverage the annual pass. The views over the ships in the harbour are good as are the views over the attractions around Sentosa. Although the cable cars on this route are older than the other line (across Sentosa only) they at least have fans in them which can really help on a hot day.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wander around the streets and you will miss india. Has the finest south indian food chain komlas here. Mustafa is a giant shopping place where you can shop for just any and everything.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Super first class garden experience!_x000D_
Highly recommended for all ages, from young to old. The greenery and flowers here are breathtakingly spectacular._x000D_
Hats off to Singaporeans for creating this majestic masterpiece. You can enjoy flora and fauna and also learn about sustaining the environment._x000D_
_x000D_
The Flower Dome showcases different flowers from around the world while the Cloud Forest showcases an indoor waterfall with hanging walkways which makes you feel as if you are walking in the clouds._x000D_
_x000D_
Will definitely return for a second trip.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A fresh awaking scene the moments you walked in. Great experience with fully aircon especially night view. I enjoyed very much with family.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We took our daughter there in 2012 and took wedding photos of her. It's an awesome background for a beautiful bride to be. We will treasure these photos forever. We are from Baton Rouge, Louisiana.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was amazing to see all the animals up close. The tram was great for tired legs and the splash park very appropriate at the end of the day. We took our own lunch but did notice that the food seemed reasonably cheap.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Make sure you be there when they start the misting. You will get a lot of good photos that are looking like screenshots from the Jurassic Park
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the best view to see during nighttime with lights displayed changes by the minute and the surrounding buildings and structures magnificent human wonders
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must for lover's of flowers
REVIEW_BODY:
We have visited the Botanical Gardens previously. The Orchid Garden is just wonderful._x000D_
So many beautiful flowers, it's such a pleasure to visit._x000D_
While we were in the gardens a huge thunderstorms hit and having a gabezo to shelter in was great. The restuarant in the gardens is also very good.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful remedy for stress and city smog
REVIEW_BODY:
Suitable for groups of all sizes and people of all ages, I found the garden to be surprisingly therapeutic to the stress and smog of the city. Singapore always finds a way to balance out the bustling banker filled city with greenery, and this man-made collection of the vegetable kingdom is quite impressive._x000D_
_x000D_
Your lungs and stress-levels will thank you after a good amount of time spent here.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Orchids are located in the Botanical Gardens. By far, this is the best part to see....especially if you are on a time budget.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Brillliant walk through luxury for a sunsetting evening
REVIEW_BODY: More you walk through close, more brilliance of architecture intertwined with natural surroundings. Horizon reflecting through the river and the cruise floatings
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
As soon as you enter you see a huge man-made waterfall amidst a lot of forest-ey plants. Pleasing to your eyes, enormous variety of plants and flowers. Highly educational and a delightful experience._x000D_
_x000D_
Advisable to go all the way up (on the lift maybe) and climb down the hill; all the way down, admiring the different plants with the view of the waterfall from different sides.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lined up for 45 mins to get in the gate then there was another line for the tram!! They are obviously selling way too many tickets for each session which is causing over crowding and a huge queues!! The 915 session was about to start and the 815 session hadnâ€™t seen anything yet!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These are the first supertrees we ever saw! We visited in Nov weekday so it was elss crowded. We also went into the flower dome and cloud dome. Amazing that they are in the middle of the busy part of the city state.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The best view in Singapore ... if you can afford it
REVIEW_BODY: This is -singularly- the most over-priced attraction I've seen anywhere on planet. To go the top, just for the view and to have a drink is literally almost $100USD per couple. Actually, our tab was closer to $150USD ... we got french fries and a couple of fried mushrooms. And even after that craziness, you are restricted to the tiny bar area. We felt cheated and ripped off as there was no notice of that when you were paying. That aside, the view from the only one side you are allowed to look from is wonderful. They treat you like the "great unwashed" when you attempt to walk around and actually see more of the top. We sincerely felt like they were saying "give us your money and just GET OUT!!" The attitude of the hotel was so unlike anything else we've ever experienced in Singapore. Borderlining on nastiness. Unapologetically, they let you know where you stand in their eyes. Needless to say, we won't be back. We surmise that the rooftop pool next to the bar, is probably unheated from the grimacing faces and yells when they entered the water.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A haven is a wonderfully frenetic City.
REVIEW_BODY: A beautiful place to stop and stare. Gorgeous orchids ! Gd eateries with helpful staff and promot service. Shops were well staffed lots of gifts to entice you to spend. Red hop on hop off bus best way to get there.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Would have never of thought to visit here
REVIEW_BODY:
We visited here on our Chinatown walking tour and were really surprised when we went inside._x000D_
_x000D_
The have a scale model of all of Singapore showing current and future developments._x000D_
_x000D_
There is also a informative display about the development of Singapore upstairs._x000D_
_x000D_
If you are in the area spend 30 minutes of so and have a look around. We found it very interesting.
ADDRESS: 45 Maxwell Road The Ura Centre | The URA Centre, Level 2, Singapore 069118, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited this place for the first time. This place is so beautiful. Many kinds of flowers and plants. Flower dome is so interesting. We spent several hours there with hundreds of pictures.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the top 10 inland(Closed ac garden) garden in the world
REVIEW_BODY: This is awesome .We have very great time here with my family.You will have a look of different varieties of plants and flowers which is not possible to get in one place.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Family outings during the Chinese New Year.
REVIEW_BODY: One of two attractions that need entrance fee at Garden by the Bay (Singapore). Educational and magnificent architecture and design. Worth a visit for both the locals and tourists.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very good museum, there are tour guides on the hour that last an hour. Our guide was excellent taking us through the history of Singapore from its beginnings until present day. Fascinating and very informative especially the Second World War period with the Japanese invasion and the struggle for independence. Well worth a vusit
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: wonderful way to spend a relaxed sunday afternoon....
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful gardens for chllining out - Eatery choices to relax in or kiosk options. An oasis of green including optional Orchid Garden.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Stunning display of lights. It's lovely to just walk around at any time of day or night and enjoy the views. It's a very child friendly area.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We wandered over to Smith Street a few times during our 4 night stay in Chinatown in April. The first time my lady saw some Black Pepper Beef that looked good at one of the hawkers. We ordered it, but unfortunately, it wasn't quite as good as it looked. pics included
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is a magical place either in the daylight or after dark. Itâ€™s a combination of amazing architecture, engineering, horticulture and magical entertainment.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Place for Kids and Family
REVIEW_BODY: Worth visiting and enjoy the Gardens. Very well kept and maintained. They have several different gardens such as Asian garden with Asian theme. Would take a few hours to spend time if you are into botany.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We love this garden. Trees have planted very well in the garden. Very clean and pleasure to walk in this.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Do not come here if you are an alternative or Japanese person
REVIEW_BODY:
Despite being more polite and quieter than other visitors. We were told that they could tell that we follow a "Japanese" culture and were not welcome here by the security, one of our goth friends was told that he looked like the "devil" and was not allowed to come in._x000D_
_x000D_
However there was a very friendly staff member in the gallery whom explained the meanings and origins of the paintings to us, she was really nice and understanding, it improved the visit a lot for us. :)
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Iven if you don't stay in the area, spend half a day and look at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel where Crazy Rich Asians was partly filmed, go to the cloud forest and the garden.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Totally a different experience to see animals at night Everything is planned so perfectly that u feel real time forest feel with security My children enjoyed it
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore Botanic Gardens is a loooooong stretch of nature park and gardens. You got to bring comfortable shoes and extra shirt. Sometimes it is humid so you may like to bring a fan or portable electric fan :-) What's also good is that there is no entrance fee! You just ride a taxi to the place. The place is so long there are 2 main gates so you have to decide where you want to go first. Inside it are variety of gardens and the National Orchid Garden. This one has an entrance fee (around SGD5 during my visit).
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the gardens for a few hours, the flower dome and the rainforest dome is wonderfull, a lot to see there. Very crowded and very cold inside the domes, very hot outside. The light show is nice.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely bay area walk and lights
REVIEW_BODY:
We walked the 3,5km walk on our first day which was lovely in the day time with gorgeous views across the bay and plenty of places to stop for a drink._x000D_
We then returned at night to see the Illumi display of lights which was beautiful._x000D_
Visit at both times to enjoy a different feel. It's free to walk around and watch the light show.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The place is as beautiful as i've imagine. Cooling and wonderful scenery. Under the hot weather in singapore, its nice to feel an air condition room.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Look, we went to see the light show with every other person possible. I didn't care that I was hot or that it was crowded or that it was even a little cheesy. I loved it. My older kid enjoyed it. The four yr old had just been fed some rubbish that came with a free toy and she was more engrossed with that then the show._x000D_
We actually cannot wait to go back to the entire Gardens in the bay to explore everything. So much to see and do around there.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited the Gardens by the bay during the day and at night to see the light show._x000D_
_x000D_
The day we visited was poor weather but we stilled enjoyed a walk round the super trees and we then spent a good few hours in the cloud forest and flower dome. Both were definitely worth paying for._x000D_
_x000D_
The light show was very busy, i would recommend getting there early to get a good spot. It is on daily at 745pm and 845pm.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Watch the tourist boats glide along.
REVIEW_BODY:
Last night (Thursday, 16 Jun 16) I enjoyed watching all the tourist boats gliding on the river while sat on the Boat Quay side opposite Clarke Quay._x000D_
_x000D_
People run, jog or walk along the boardwalks enjoying the cool of the evening._x000D_
_x000D_
A nice place to relax...maybe next time I'll take a boat ride...it looked like fun.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its good but not that good if u go to the singapore zoo dont go night safari and if u didnt go then night safari is good but its not like what i thought and i like the zoo more
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Around $33 for a 30 minute circuit on the wheel - well worth it. Higher than the London Eye and on a good day can see for miles and miles. Beautiful at might to see the light show at Gardens by the Bay. Smooth slow ride.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the most amazing Bridge in the World!
REVIEW_BODY: It's 280 meters long, made of a special stainless steel, was lovingly assembled with great precision! Like a giant DNA Structure! We went there at night, say 10 PM. No one is there! Perfect for photo shoot!
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I suggest you to go there in the morning to avoid too many tourists taking photos. This is the landmark of Singapore, if Merlion park was not included in your itinerary, you've never been to Singapore ðŸ˜Š
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful and an easy way to spend an afternoon
REVIEW_BODY:
I am astounded that such beautiful and well maintained gardens are free to the public, but they are, so we should enjoy them!_x000D_
On my first trip, the skywalk was closed due to storms, but I was able to go up on the second go, and it was a fun walk with a lovely view._x000D_
The rest of the park is just wonderful for wandering around and thinking.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited Garden by the Bay on a Saturday morning and it was packed with tourist. Still, with the perfect outlay of the gardens you never felt squashed. The Cloud Dome was absolutely magnificent and breathtakingly beautiful. The Flower Dome took my breath away with all the thousands of flower species which are cleverly spread in a beautiful display._x000D_
I can definitely recommend this as an outing for old or young. Time well spent ...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Only through local friends I was able to know this amazing piece of nature in Singapore ,,very nice for walking, hiking or mountain biking,known by the locals but not at all by tourist! Perfect getaway to enjoy locals nature, monkeys, birds etc,,
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We've just returned from a visit to Singapore and the excellent Changi Museum and Chapel. It is well set out with lots of information about WWII organised in such a way that your attention is captured from the start to the end of your visit. The audio guide is informative and interesting and the personal stories that are included bring the exhibits to life. The staff are extremely helpful and we would strongly recommend that you add this to your 'must do' list!
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Classy revamp, not so classy showers
REVIEW_BODY: Lots of attention paid to slides and attractions, but the smooth and sleek experience ends at the shower facilities, which is quite a necessary stop for most visitors except for those who stay at the resort attached.
ADDRESS: 1 Pasir Ris Close E!Hub@Downtown East, Singapore 519599, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A view of to be admired
REVIEW_BODY: My journey on the Flyer was during the day so that I could take in the sights. The journey took 30 minutes from the time of boarding the gondola to exiting after one rotation. The gondola is climate controlled and is very stable to enable you to walk around during its travel to get the best view. There are bench seats available if you prefer to take a more relaxed view.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Cloudy cool weather for enjoying the gardens
REVIEW_BODY: We spent about 2 hrs walking around these grounds. A lot of plants not in bloom but still very lush and beautiful! The sky walk was closed today
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I love Chinatown I can't believe I didn't visit last time, i live in china so last time i thought it was ridiculous to visit Chinatown and of course i was wrong, The food there is great,there's a great variety of everything, shops,you can basically find anything you want.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is an outstanding garden. Most of it is free entry and offers pleasant walks with a variety of gardens and other features. The sound and light show in the evening is a highlight. There are 3 features for which there is a charge. It is worthwhile doing some forward planning and buying discounted tickets from booking agents in Singapore. The Flower Dome is interesting but I enjoyed the Cloud Forest more. The Sky Walk is definitely worth the cost but you may have to queue for a while. As well as an entry ticket, you need to collect a time entry card from the ticket booth.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are big and beautiful and only costs if you'd like to enter the domes. There is a lot of garden to see aside from the domes, however. You can pay to see one of the domes or both. We paid to enter both and even though one contained plants we were used to see in the UK, the way the plants were arranged was truly stunning and we felt it was worth the money. We also liked how the domes were air conditioned. There were plenty of places to eat in the gardens for a range of prices and tastes.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited this place as part of group tour. It is better to visit during day as we can very well see buildings bay of garden and sea and cruises from the capsule. It's built on the basis of LONDON EYE. Almost similar structure. It takes 45 minutes for one round. Amazing views from all sides. The management is also good that not too many people are stuffed inside. Worth visit!! Beautiful garden with fishes inside as the bottom of this place. Good restaurants also around this place serving true Indian cuisines.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic and not to be missed if in Singapore. Expect will improve with time as plants grow and mature. Singapore now has more than shopping and food to offer.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
What a stunning environment that is a real credit to Singapore. Best of all, its free._x000D_
_x000D_
The gardens are extensive, beautifully presented and manicured. I could have easily spent a day just wondering around._x000D_
_x000D_
The Botanical gardens also offer a great opportunity to do a 'double date' with the National Orchid Garden which is next to it._x000D_
_x000D_
Great day.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: We are in the future guys...
REVIEW_BODY: What lovely creations by the people of Singapore. You feel that you are in future. And they have to be seen in evenings only - the lights, the musical show. Take woolens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its a perfect place to spend the day in Singapore. There a large variety of birds to see (variety of Horn Bills is especially impressive) and very informative especially for the kids. You get a taste of little bit of wilderness and its difficult to believe that you are smack in centre of a bustling city. There are shows all day round, its recommended that you pick and choose which one you want to see and plan accordingly. There is tram to roam around in the park. Tram is more like a fun ride rather than a means to move around in the park since the area of park is not too large to walk. Tram ride is recommended and our ticket that we got from Klook.com included the tram ride. Bird show at 'Pools Amphitheatre' is must see, plan your activity around this. We could also see 'Horn bill' show which was very informative and the lady giving the information was too good. Reserve at least 4-5 hours for this attraction but you can easily spend a day here if you have time. Facilities inside Park are very good including toilets, drinking water and also food.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Went for the breakfast with the Orangutans
REVIEW_BODY: Was a great experience with great food. The animals looked healthy. There were no bars to keep them in and a good variety. The only downfalls were more little shops selling drinks or maybe water fountains for the young or elderly. good they have a tram to travel around. Some more seats around the zoo is also needed. the commentary about the Orangutans should be completed after breakfast, so you could hear it instead of going to get food from the buffet. Wonderful to see monkeys traveling over head in the trees
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Magical and beautiful place! Must visit while you are in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This place was amazing and for me the best in Singapore! If you are staying in Singapore make sure you're gonna visit this place.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My two daughters and I were pleasantly surprised to see as well as the normal flowers and plants, a Cherry Blossom display which was absolutely beautiful. There were even young Japanese girls in traditional costume walking around which was an added bonus. Even took photos with them and they were very obliging. It is certainly a must to visit when visiting Singapore and is all set under a huge glass air-conditioned dome...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Flower Dome and Cloud Forest can be seen together. The display and the arrangements are great - great colours, arrangements - good place to have a few brilliant pictures :-)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Cultural heritage centre is a must
REVIEW_BODY: Initially disappointed with the cliche market style of Chinatown but happened upon the heritage centre which us a must see. About $15 to get in, the first part required listening to an audio guide while you walked your way through a replica of a business and housing of yesteryear. The next part of building had some really interesting and interactive diaplays.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very enjoyable and interesting tour.....Joanne our tour guide really knew her stuff and was very knowledgeable and informative ......Many thanks.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Shaby but Lots of Good Food Joints
REVIEW_BODY:
The First Sight of Little India was a Bit Shaby, But as you get going, you try to soak in. The Place is famous not only for Mustafa Shopping Center, but also for some Authentic Indian Food Joints. Lots to Roam and Watch. Good Spot to pick up some Sovereigns to take back Home. Bars where in you could find some cheap drinks ( Expensive ones Also are available). Also famous for Mobiles and Gadgets at Cheaper prices_x000D_
Out of the Lot One POint which I would try to Highlight is at any point if time you will not fel Insecure or intimidated. ( Off Course it is Singapore)!!!!!
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Interesting place and good to try If they have more animals it would be nice F&b is quite expensive and food not good at all
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
You can everything here with all the roads near the tooth relic temple which is the oldest one in Singapore._x000D_
The lanes are full with tailors to get a jacket or suit made up. You can buy buddhas cups and lots of tourist stuff so keep looking and barter as they do come down in price._x000D_
There are many restaurants to choose from so go between 5pm and 9pm and enjoy
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went there to have drinks and honestly, the alcohol is very overpriced and most bars seemed overly fancy. Many young people were sitting on the bridge and drinking beer bought at the corner store. We finally found a spot on the bridge and it was honestly WAY more fun than sitting at any bar. Who knew a few cans of beer and sitting on the side of a bridge could turn out so fun!
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Have not been here for more than 10years. So vast differences with many sheltered walkways. Easy for those on wheelchairs and parents with kids on strollers. Exhibits are well maintained. We can see that with the monkeys climbing all over the zookeeper while he was feeding them. This shows their happiness of being cared for. Many restaurants available inside the zoo. Good show with the elephants and seal. Worth to come here and enjoy the greeneries as well.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Go in the even to watch the light show! We went in December and it was Christmas themed with Christmas markets. Lovely evening
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Went here with my Mrs and 1 year old baby! In fact i took this cable for 5 times in my lifespan. Great aerial view, personal fav when coming in to Sentosa, get to see the whole of Resort World and its stunning._x000D_
_x000D_
Youâ€™ll get a discount if youâ€™re citizen._x000D_
The only downside is that it can be very stuffy in there and the hot weather definitely wont help but worth a ride though!
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are being bored by the city life and would like to opt for something more cultural and human, the National Museum of Singapore is one of the options. It displays how this island country is shaped up throughout the years. There's an entrance fee for foreigners though I found it worthwhile.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
As everyone has said, this is a very nice place to walk. The views are beautiful. There are many restaurants and other places to stop along the way. It can get hot in the middle of the day and there isn't much shade, so this is better done in the morning or early evening._x000D_
_x000D_
If you happen to be there when they are setting up for the Formula 1 race, some parts might be blocked, so beware.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Travel Diary: Singapore 2019_x000D_
_x000D_
Merlion Park : Singapore landmark, a major tourist attraction and a super hit picture on almost all the magnets and souvenirs found in Singapore is Merlion Park. It depicts a mythical creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish. Itâ€™s wide courtyard just like the Manhattanâ€™s courtyard near the river where almost everyone including me get their picture clicked with there hands folded, begging for the water to fall from its wide open mouth on once hand is really a nice place to be when you are in Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
#travelblogger #singapore @travelseewrite @travelandleisure #singaporelove #traveltips #travelphotography #travelbloggers #ilovetravelling #travelaroundtheworld
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I took a walk along the park on one of the evenings that I was in Singapore. Though not technically breathtaking, this place still has its' charm and it is indeed mesmerising enough to want to attract you in just being there. The StarWars theme song was playing and showcasing on one of those nights and I was in for a treat to be amazed and awed by the play of lights on one of those two main trees. Park is so clean you could literally see tourists lying down on the streets and just look up at the fascinating creation. This is definitely another tick off the bucket list, at least for me.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great way to unwind after a relaxing meal in the vincinity...the panoramic night view did not disappoint
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Jurong has the most amazing collection of birds I have ever seen. Tucans Hornbills Pelicans Cranes, you name it. My kid thoroughly enjoyed the Penguin feeding. The High flyers and Kings of the Skyes shows are must sees and should not be missed. The park also has a water play area for the kids but remember to pack your swimwear for that. The water fall aviary is equally amazing. There is tram availble too but the park is best seen by foot.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely and well constructed indoor garden exhibit giving us a much-needed respite from Singapore's heat! We missed the misting session earlier though but could still see the aftereffects. It was a beautiful sight even in the evening and we wandered around for longer than we had planned. Would have been much better if foreigners were not so overcharged though.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Words fail me how wonderful this man made garden is. Easy to get to and definitely a must do activity whilst in Singapore. Do this and follow up with a visit to the natural Singapore Botanic Gardens. You will enjoy both.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited Cloud Forest and Flower Dome and then had a meal at the Bayfront food market, waiting for dark. The lights come on punctually and the display lasts for about 10-15 minutes. It's really lovely and worth waiting for. Transport is great around Singapore and there are plenty of options, but a bit of walking involved.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Peranakans are native-born people of mixed local and foreign ancestry. Peranakan culture is described as a blend of two cultures where the people are ethnic Chinese but culture and language are predominantly Malay-influenced. The Peranakan Museum is worthwhile to visit, if one wishes to learn about the local people who make up a good proportion of Singapore. There were interactive exhibits when I was there which involved locating a dozen different symbols (such as dragon, phoenix, floral designs, etc.) matched to exhibits, then embossing the symbol on a color wheel on paper provided by the museum docents. It was fun as well as educational. Learning about famous Peranakans and seeing some of their handiwork was interesting. The museum is three stories, but there's an elevator (or lift) available for those with mobility issues or young children in strollers.
ADDRESS: 39 Armenian Street Peranakan Museum, Singapore 179941, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was one of my favourite experience in Singapore, and in all of SE Asia. We went at night for the light show and were blown away. It was simply amazing. We have never experienced anything like it. Cannot recommend highly enough.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is one of the must visit in Singapore. The orchid trees light show is a must see item, The light show of the orchid trees will lasted for 10 minutes with songs in the backgrounds. You are commanded to visit it around later afternoon and the weather will then not so hot.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is my second visit to the Jurong Bird Park and it did not disappoint. Although we got caught in a thunderstorm, I am so glad that I got to visit this park again. Lovely collection of birds from around the world. It is well presented, clean and it's obvious that the birds are well cared for.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful stroll around the gardens and associated light show. Recommend heading just before sunset to see the best of both sides of the gardens
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Must Must visit the light / music show
REVIEW_BODY: I would surely recommend going for the light/music show which starts at 8 pm. After which you should not miss the laser show at Marina Bay, which is connected to Gardens by the Bay, approximately 10 minute walk via a footbridge. It is just fantastic!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Wow! What a place! Don't ever miss this destination. It is a must see place in your Singapore itinerary_x000D_
The way it is done amazing. Just to see the 2 gardens you need half day and if you want to go around the Gardens by the bay (it is 250 Acres) you will need one full day. Great!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Too beautiful,especially if you like flowers and vegetation in all hues and forms!
REVIEW_BODY: An amalgamation of all types of vegetate that you may find anywhere in the world.Really colorful and interactive with a lot of information
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Pleasant area to relax a bit, away from the bustle. It's a bit distant from where you're likely to be, so does require a trip there specifically for the gardens. Worth while.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I only walked through the gardens, I did not go into the paid exhibitions. I found it a very pleasant walk and liked the displays and explanations they had for different types of flora. They also do a good job weaving in the cultural history of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to bring kids. Great shows, lots of shades and i interesting. Truly enjoy with my family.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best place to have Middle east food.
REVIEW_BODY: One of the best place to have Middle east food. best place for dinner and night hang out. quiet a number of restaurants, little pricey but worth it.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you love to shop this is the place to go. But be warned a lots of the things are cheaper in the UK, so do your homework first. My partner took me to Tiffany's to get me something for my birthday, the sliver ring was over Â£50.00 cheaper in London due to the exchange rate._x000D_
_x000D_
But its a good place to people watch
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A walk through the Singapore Botanic Gardens
REVIEW_BODY:
Tropical flora, mysterious trees, beautiful vines a just a hint of what you will see walking thru the gardens. It cannot be seen in one day because if you do you will miss so much._x000D_
This is a wonderful development of such important Singapore heritage every different corner has a different story that you will want to experience slowly. So do not rush._x000D_
The entire garden is broken down into smaller gardens based on themes. The foliage is magnificent as you walk into each garden._x000D_
After all the hustle and bustle of the busy city it is nice to have quiet and appreciate all the beauty._x000D_
Even the walk to the Botanical Garden is interesting; you get to walk by different country embassies, lots of different architectural apartment buildings._x000D_
Again on taking your time, take a couple of days to really enjoy this beautiful area.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to take pictures wven if you're not much a fan of flowers. Place is literally filled with different kinds of flowers with different colors, shapes and sizes. Bring a jacket! It's very cold inside the dome. There's lots of sitting areas and you can stay longer if you like. There's also toilet inside the dome and drinking fountains! Great place for dates and relaxation.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore best attraction by far and should not be missed. Part of the gardens by the bay. This and Flower dome are a mus tsee
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place, but do they really need to charge for it?
REVIEW_BODY: Nice space full to overloading with orchids, but you have to pay to get in. Given that the botanic gardens are free and truly wonderful, it's a bit sad to have to pay for this.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great place to spend some time and marvel in the wonders of this creation. Would reccomend going at sunset to get the best value.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful garden, at 7:45 and 8:45 there is a light show, don't miss it! It's free. You only need to pay for Flower Garden and Cloud Garden (26 dollars).
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Walking along the Southern ridges is a pleasant change from the urban environment. Crossing the Henderson wave gives some good photo opportunities. Can get hot so take water. We caught the cable car from Sentosa to Faber Mountain and then walked around.
ADDRESS: 221 Henderson Road Henderson Building, Singapore 159557, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Modern Wonder which you should not miss
REVIEW_BODY: It is amazing how Singapore has created this modern day wonder. Do not miss this. You will love this place.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can purchase anything hereon orchard road. It has all the high end shops and souvenir shops, plus some amazing eating places and restaurants. A must see while in singapore.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I loved visiting these gardens and to see the huge variety of plants there. From around the world. It is a nice walk and a great place to take tons of pictures.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Glance to beautiful neuter in a glance
REVIEW_BODY:
I was looking to kill half a day on Singapore after business trip before flight,_x000D_
It was easy to get there by cab, but I saw bus stop when I arrived. I went to the south Garden._x000D_
Heavy rain and tiring moist set my direct to bay tickets to the dooms 28$ for adult._x000D_
When i entered the flowers doom, the refreshing cool air and sweet flowers small welcomed my entrance to the doom, I had fun to sit view the flowers and enjoy the music - fun to all age. Great brick from outside weather_x000D_
The cloud doom is dramatic starting with a worth taking picture weather fall. I recommend taking elevator to the 6 floor claim the 7 floor and start to go Downstairs , the rood is breathtaking, hang in the air you walk from the cloud down_x000D_
In the end I walked in the gardens to marina bey hotel_x000D_
Claimed to the 57 floor to the Club to see it all from the top - must must go - enjoy
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited on 16/11/16 with friend. Watched the 7:30pm show. Is interesting,fun and educating. The show presenter is language talented as she greet n passed the important message to us in Japanese,Korean,Mandarin,Tamil of do not use flash when taking photos.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Astonishing ropical paradise in a world class city
REVIEW_BODY: One of the best things about Macritchie is the number of people who enjoy it. I went on a Sunday morning. I must admit that I started late - 9:30 - and the heat was punishing.The beauty of the place and the atmosphere of all the people walking more than made up for my discomfort. People of every type, runners, families, business men, young couples, old people all taking time to appreciate nature. Many of the paths are rough and rustic while others are smooth and easy. Lots of snippets of information about things you can see and things you can't - like the nocturnal animals that live there. There is nothing manicured about the virgin jungle that you walk through however. Trees are only cut if they look like they will fall across paths.I did the canopy walk and went up the Jelutong tower to get a birds eye view. A real highlight of my time in Singapore.One tip - TAKE WATER - there is water provided at ranger stations but you may have to walk kilometres to get it.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful scenery and a fun light show
REVIEW_BODY: This place is fascinating and well worth a visit. We spent an afternoon in the two domes and on the sky walkway around the "tall trees". Overall the pricing is reasonable and we enjoyed the conservatories as a break from the afternoon sun. In the evening are the light shows at 7.45 and 8.45. They are fantastic and as a free attraction would recommend everyone sees one.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Although there is a lot of building work on the approach to the Botanical Gardens it is well worth the effort. The National Orchid Garden is definitely worth allowing some time for. It is possibly the best orchid display anywhere in the World. The lake with the stage in the centre is worth enjoying particularly if a concert is taking place. It can take a good 2 hours to explore. For the inner person there are restaurants and cafes to be enjoyed.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Even for no botanic friends a really great event you should visit (it takes just 30-40 min. to go round).
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Pool at skypark had lots of people enjoying the city view and taking pictures at 57 level. Pool mostly full in afternoon, need to go in the morning.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Such a beautiful place, offering a break from the heat. The waterfall is lovely. A great place to visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful Hanging Gardens By The Bay
REVIEW_BODY:
It's well sculptured, looks natural and very pretty. It also has conservatories and restaurants so a good outing with the family or a place to bring your friends visiting from abroad._x000D_
_x000D_
It has a musical light show in the evenings but you need to check the timing. Go on the canopy walk around sunset and you get a great view of Marina Bay Sands, The Singapore Flyer and the area._x000D_
_x000D_
There is usually also some themed exhibition or fare - flowers and art - you will have to check its website for specific dates and events.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is an easy and fun activity, although it can get very hot as the dock is uncovered and it gets really crowded. After taking your obligatory picture with the Merlion venture under the bridge and cool off with some $10 ice treats.
