The taxi stand is back up the stairs then down the walkway a bit until you see a Starbucks. It's hard to find but it's the fastest way to get out of there!
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: a huge hotel, all the high end stores you may imagined and the most amazing infinity pool.........a miracle view and the most romantic dive after 10 pm
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun if you like crowds and touristy stuff
REVIEW_BODY:
As a local, this myth was probably due to poor eyesight. Lions and fish don't breed well, so maybe this was a lionfish? Anyway, it just spits water and tour buses come here so it's crowded most days._x000D_
_x000D_
Personally, I'd avoid unless you're visiting the casino, Esplanade theatre or Fullerton Hotel anyway. Don't go out of your way, the biggest version is on Sentosa Island.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A great place to be at with little kids and family in terms of educational value, hygiene etc. However, tickets are too pricey and transport drop off points located too far away from the main attractions. Makes it unfriendly for those who are handicapped or immobile._x000D_
_x000D_
Foodwise, lack of options for those with restricted diets ie vegetarians and vegans etc.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must see and more importantly get there early before the busses arrive. The monkeys were our favorites Orangutans were friendly. Great for photos.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited the zoo with my kids. The main thing is that animals are kept in very humane condition. We loved elephants show , bird show and the feedings . Good visiting with kids .
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth seeing at day and night
REVIEW_BODY: We went there at night and it looked truly magical- just like a scene from Avatar. There is also a bar with a pretty good view overlooking Marina Bay Sands. During the day you can get a lift to the viewing platform/ path and see the colors much better. Definitely worth seeing
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was fun visiting singapore flyer. You may think that you have got a great view if you have visited MBS Rooftop or 1 Altitude, but SG Flyer definitely is still worth visiting as the view is really good. best time to visit is around subset, so that you can see sunset as well as the city lights.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: An Oasis in the Middle of a Thriving City
REVIEW_BODY: Lush, green, and bursting with colour, Gardens by the Bay is a vibrant haven that rises majestically from the urban hues of the surrounding city. Many of the gardens, complete with sculptures and other attractions, are free to admire, making for a fantastic day out even for the most budget-conscious. Cloud Mountain, Flower Dome, and the Skywalk are, however, well worth their entrance fees, presenting some unique insights into the richness and diversity of the plants that support the ecosystems that make all life on earth possible. With Gardens by the Bay, Singapore reveals itself to be at the forefront of sustainability, and the result is very welcoming indeed! If you can only do one thing in Singapore, make it this!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Superb collection of orchids all displayed in fantastic gardens. Very thoughtfully laid out. Not enough information displayed about each plant.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Arab street is full of very unique and hip boutiques as well as a beautiful mosque. Spend time here to get a sense of the art and culture that exists in Singapore.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We enjoyed walking along the river edge, in through the shopping centre then out onto the Helix Bridge ending at the Singapore Flyer. Great spot to take some photos and enjoy the scenery.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must list and on the list of 5 things you must see in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Just a lovely park with themed areas. Spend a morning or afternoon here you won't regret it. I make it a point to visit each time and the park itself is free.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must vist one time..from Mount Faber peak to Sentosa Island...the views are totally amazing and you would get some amazing birds eye views of the city around you.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Got all sorts of souvenir from China town. Key chains, bags, mugs, mirrors and scarves. Make sure you explore the market once before buying to get the best deal :)
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was a fascinating visit, and very much brought to life for us the surrender of Singapore to the Japanese. The guide, whose own parents lived through the occupation ,was well informed and interesting. It was acknowledged that although there was ultimately little choice, the decision makers, symbolised by chillingly life- like models seated round the table in earnest discussion, had the burden of this on their shoulders for the rest of their lives. It was inconceivable to imagine so many soldiers cramped together in the dank, poorly ventilated accommodation. The rooms and labrynthine passages inside the carefully concealed building had thick walls to protect the accommodation from an assault but there were few toilet facilities and comforts . Probably one of the most realistic and evocative wartime museums I have experienced.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I love shopping at CK Tangs , wheel lock , Metro , Mark Spencer's ,Toys R Us. Orchard is the best place for shopping.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We come here every month, just to visit Future World and occasionally some other seasonal exhibitions like NASA Space. It's easily to kill 2/3 hours at Future World alone. Every element is our Favourite! Tip, book online to avoid the long ticketing queue. It's easy Abd its worry free!
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A truly magical place that never fail to draw in both the local and foreign crowds. But Gardens-By-The-Bay is more than its famed indoor attractions (ie Flower Dome and Cloud Forest). It has a huge outdoor space that boasts of SuperTrees, Web of Life, Chinese Gardens, Colonial Gardens etc. I use the LocoMole app to navigate and explore the various points of interests in this delightful place. Try visiting at night for an unforgettable experience!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth a visit every season with its rotation of flowers and exhibits. Recommend to purchase food from local supermarkets as food can be quite pricy there.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This experience will melt your fear of heights and lets you enjoy the beautiful view of the sentosa areas and the surrounding bay and sea
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's my 2nd trip to Night safari. I did not enjoy much as the 1st trip which was 8 years back. Back then I felt,they had more rare animals to show compared to this year. Maybe they have any schedule that I am not aware off,or it's just me getting older. Lol. But I thoroughly enjoyed the show featuring animals,not sure bout the name of the show though. That's the best part of the trip. Do not miss the show.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Absolutely stunning views of Harbourfront and Sentosa! :)
REVIEW_BODY:
I spent an hour and a half taking pictures and hiking from Mount Faber to Hort Park after getting off the cable car at Mount Faber station. The view at the top of Faber Point, the highest point of the park, was simply stunning and offered a wonderfully picturesque view of Harbourfront and Sentosa._x000D_
_x000D_
There is plenty of gorgeous greenery and wildlife such as monkeys to explore along the way (I managed to get a good photo of a cute squirrel). Do make sure to bring some mosquito spray with you as unfortunately they are part of the wildlife as well! Drinking fountains are available along the hiking trail if you want to fill up your water bottle or you forgot to bring one in the first place and need to quench your thirst._x000D_
_x000D_
On my walk, I passed through the artistic Henderson Waves bridge, which is the highest pedestrian bridge in Singapore (274m in length and 36m above ground). There were plenty of benches here to relax and rest my feet for a while. Further along, there is an awesome forest walk where you can admire the lush green scenery below and around you. Alexandra Arch, located just before Hort Park, has an interesting shape just like an open leaf. I definitely recommend the journey from Mount Faber to Hort Park for nature lovers! :)
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak | Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The helix bridge is cool to walk over to get to Marina Sands, and offers great views of the city. End of the day it's just a pedestrian bridge though, but still a good one at that.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Pretty, but not worth the price if you're from Aus
REVIEW_BODY: While it was beautiful and we loved the wooden sculptures, many of the plants can be seen in Australia, which made the experience less spectacular. We also thought the Christmas display was a little tacky, though it may have made the experience more enjoyable for those with children. In our view, save your money and just go to the Cloud Dome - that was truly spectacular!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its an indoor marvel! We saw tulips this time and it was amazing. Not to mention the wooden carved structures all across. Lots of walking to do and lots of selfies to be taken!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is a really impressive area and good to look at, but what disappointed me, given itâ€™s pitched as a temple of sustainability and ecological awareness, was the total lack of thought given to food and drink packaging._x000D_
_x000D_
Everything is made of or wrapped in plastic, including straws and cutlery, and much of it non recyclable. As you leave one of the big dome things you watch a video thatâ€™s meant to inspire you to save the planet, then you step outside and all you can buy to eat or drink anywhere is the most unsustainably packaged, rubbish food you can imagine. At best itâ€™s a massively thoughtless missed opportunity, and at worst itâ€™s wilful hypocrisy.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice atmosphere lots of eateries. Bars etc light show is worth a view. It's free. You sit on steps outside designer shop mall and it's free lasting about 20 mins. We did this then went to the skylark on roof (shaped like a boat) for a drink after to take in the view
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is free entry except for modest charge to orchid garden. If you want to walk around it all allow lots of day. We spent most of our time in the orchid garden and this alone worth the visit and definitely the high point of the park.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A place to appreciate flowers and greeneries
REVIEW_BODY: Cloud Forest is located in Gardens By The Bay and it is one of the cooled conservatories. It requires admission tickets to enter. You will see the worldâ€™s tallest indoor waterfall in the Cloud Forest and appreciate rare plants in it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Fact : Billion SGD $ to create this Gardens by the Bay! â¤ï¸_x000D_
_x000D_
MY HONEST REVIEW : 99% / 100%_x000D_
Probably the best garden ive seen in my life_x000D_
_x000D_
Free Public Entrance on most part of the garden so no need to pay for anything unless you wanna go up to cloud forest or skywalk._x000D_
_x000D_
For me its all worth it to walk with you friends and eat afterwards._x000D_
_x000D_
Best sunset view would be at Marina Barrage - Its like 1KM walk from Marina Bay Sands down to Gardens by the Bay_x000D_
_x000D_
Super nice sunset ! Grab some satay too_x000D_
while walking._x000D_
_x000D_
Pictures to follow as im having difficulty uploading coz i have 50,000 photos on my phone !_x000D_
_x000D_
again worth to visit_x000D_
Bravo Singapore !
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a great place to visit with kids. The design is equivalent to a real cloud forest. Good to visit for experiencing this amazing view, waterfalls and walk around
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A trip to Singapore would not be complete without visiting Gardens by the Bay - especially the evening light show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Must visit . Located at Botanica Gdn and is good deal. Cant remember the tix price. ( Is great value )
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely walk along the waterfront to the free gardens.
REVIEW_BODY: The walk along the waterfront to get to the outdoor gardens before the domes (Flower/Cloud Forest) is lovely. Very well landscaped and easy walking paths. They do offer a shuttle from the subway stop to the Domes entrance for 3 SD each if you are coming straight from the subway. We walked right from our hotel all along the waterfront to the gardens. Very peaceful and the flower tree structures are unique to see day or night. We went at night to see the music/lighted trees display, well worth it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Be prepared for the Zoo! This is a huge park with a lot of animal shows and things to see! You can spend your whole day easily without noticing! You can see a lot of animals in a very authentic environment! There are also free roaming animals on the trees some even come close to you! Try to plan you route and have a map! It is very easy to miss the places because the animals are not next to the main road but on small trails and the direction boards are not very informative if there are any. For the same reason I don't recommend the little train in the park, because you'll miss out the 90 percent of the exhibits! Even though there are a lot of people, the place is so big it is never crowded. Only negative thing is why a polar bear should be kept on a tropical climate?
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you get the opportunity go on the free guided tour. A great way to learn about the history of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Visit at night, as at night it lights us brilliantly. There are the outside gardens which are free to access, the charge is only for the two "globes"_x000D_
_x000D_
Both globes are very interesting and real eye-openers showing different planes from all over the world - include the cloud zone where there really are "clouds"!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the oldest Hindu temple in Singapore recently. It was built in 1827 and is located in Singaporeâ€™s Chinatown. Sir Mariamman Temple, dedicated to the goddess who cures illnesses and diseases, was built by India immigrants. The first thing you will notice is the light colored boundary wall with sacred cows laying on top of the wall as well as the brightly painted domes and statues. The tall tower covered with sculptures of deities, mythological beasts, and other beings caught my eye. It was fascinating to look at the intricacy of these sculptures. Two wooden doors covered with bells mark the entrance. Worshippers ring these bells for good luck or to be sure the gods answer their prayers. Shoes must be removed before entering. Throughout the temple, there is much decorative detailing throughout. There are a series of small altars where you would find people worshipping. I walked into an area where many Hindus were in a serving line receiving platters of food. I realized this was also a social gathering place for worshippers and their families. Very interesting and worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful little gem with a rich heritage
REVIEW_BODY:
The Intan is a beautiful museum of all things Peranakan and I'd highly recommend it to all to visit this place. If you're Peranakan, it's a great place to learn about your heritage and history which is fast losing its grip in today's society. Even if you're not, it's a great place to learn about the Peranakan culture. I shall not attempt to elaborate on the Peranakans - better to leave that to the experienced volunteer guides there! Alvin our host made us feel right at home and it was definitely an interesting afternoon._x000D_
_x000D_
Definitely two thumbs up!
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a visit. Very well presented. A whole world inside a massive greenhouse! And on a hot Singapore day it's so cool and refreshing. Don't forget your camera. Top tip. Don't pay for over priced meals here. Follow the well signed "satay by the bay" signs for a vast choice of good quality well priced meals
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There are so many eateries around this srea that you will be spoilt for choice. Every turn is an opportunity for a snack or a meal.
ADDRESS: East Coast Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: LOVE THE NIGHT TIME, EVEN BETTER IF THERE WERE ANIMALS TO SEE!
REVIEW_BODY:
The Night Safari tour overall was a bit of a bust for me. With all the hyped about this being one of the top zoos in the world I was set for a world class experience. The concept is brilliant, the atmosphere at night is amazing but getting to see the animals,, i.e. the reason one goes to a zoo, was pretty weak._x000D_
The tram ride was horrible. You get schooled over and over about the importance of not using flash photography, both for the animals and fellow visitorsâ€™ experience, and to not make any noises that might startle the animals. We get on the tram and get blinded right away as the staff are going around taking flash photos of you sitting there so they can get more money out of your pocket. Then the tram we were on squealed like a banshee every time our non-attentive driver hit the brakes. You could not hear yourself think as the noise of the brakes was so loud. Additionally, if our driver had of spent 25% as much time focusing on his job of driving instead of flirting with the female staff member he would have been more effective at slowing down so we could actually see a few of the animals that were out. Glad I did it but v pressed to say I would go again, this coming from a true zoo aficionado.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic hotel! Amazing place and the best view ever!!!!
REVIEW_BODY:
We were impressed and my hands were shaking when we went up there first time!_x000D_
_x000D_
It's unbelievable impressions and memories which we will never forget._x000D_
I wish everyone will come and will see it._x000D_
This view on Singapore is super wonderful!_x000D_
It was my dream to go to this crazy and magnetic roof since they just opened Marina Bay Sands._x000D_
_x000D_
I can't describe my feelings, it's something what I will always remember and wish to come again and again. For sure I wish to live on this floor and look at the city center from the sky park :)))_x000D_
_x000D_
Ticket costs 23 S$ (17$) but it worth it, it Worth it!!!! Not so much money and you will fall in love with such an amazing and special view._x000D_
_x000D_
From this roof you will see marleon park, beautiful skyscrapers, the biggest wheel, gardens by the bay and even Indonesian islands._x000D_
We went there at the afternoon, weather was great and we took very nice photos. You can come a little bit later and will stay there until evening and enjoy evening view as well._x000D_
_x000D_
Good luck;) Enjoy Singapore
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful cloud forest and flower dome... a bit expensive though...
REVIEW_BODY:
Singapore is this interesting place that can be quite appealing to some people and boring to others. In our case, we are undecided if we belong to the second group or to a group in the middle. Nevertheless, keep this in mind whilst reading my review._x000D_
_x000D_
Now... I need to give you a second warning. My reviews tend to be a tad long, so I am going to give you a way out a very short version of the review:_x000D_
_x000D_
The Gardens have a lot of things: parks (quite pretty, well worth walking most of it even though the heat might challenge your mood), the supertree grove (weird concrete trees) host lots of plants but in reality are super smart/advance cooling towers for a power plant, finally you have the domes, both of them are interesting on their own; one has waterfalls and a sort of rainforest and the other one a huge amount of flowers (lots of orchids as well and plants from South America). Each dome has a price to get in and there are combined tickets making visiting the gardens a tad cheaper. That's the short review... next, a pretty long one. You can stop reading if you got enough information._x000D_
_x000D_
I see... you continued reading regardless of the warning at the top... so begin by saying:_x000D_
_x000D_
Gardens by the Bay is a lot more than the cloud forest and the flower dome. It is a pretty big area covering parks, the power plant (or those weird tree shapes called Supertree groves) fueled by plant material that gets burnt, captured and returned to the environment, the two massive domes (glasshouses), a river (sort of) that goes through it from which you will get gorgeous photos of the Marina Bay Sands and flowers._x000D_
_x000D_
The Supertree Grove has a restaurant and a series of bridges connecting some of the trees (all of it has an entry fee) but it also has informative plates around telling you what is what and its functionality. I recommend you to look for it, is super cool for engineers, environmentalists and might be good for kids as well. In general, the info panels explain that Singapore can generate a lot of biomass that can be burnt to generate power... making this activity carbon neutral as you would be using the dead matter that captured carbon initially. Some of the newly produced CO2 is pumped into the domes to promote the growth of the forest, capture some of the moisture from the air before releasing it once more to the environment. Going back to the restaurant, the view from up there might be amazing, we did not go there as we had spent quite some money before coming here and wanted to reduce some of the expenses. Though, if you have $12 you might be able to go up and visit the skywalk (a series of bridges between the supertrees). Again, we did not go up the skywalk, mainly because my missus is afraid of heights, which is irrational as the bridges look pretty solid to me. In any case, I think a visit to the supertrees can be quite interesting and can be economical as there is plenty to see without paying the tickets to these attractions I have described above._x000D_
_x000D_
From the Supertrees, you could go towards the domes OR you can go towards the heritage gardens and the dragonfly (and something) river/lakes. We decided to walk towards these other gardens before going to the domes (as we thought it was going to be easier to go to public transport from the domes... this is not the case, so I will recommend you to visit the domes FIRST, AND come back to these other ones as the gardens are beautiful. Lots of statues and art disseminated around giving you the impression of being in one of the stories of Alice in Wonderland (even when you find the gigantic metallic dragonflies on the lake). Walking around these parts is super easy although it can be confusing as the winding path and the multiple construction sites (expanding the parks?) can leave you disorientated for a bit. Getting out of here is not too difficult, just walk towards the hotel and eventually you will find pointers telling you where to go._x000D_
_x000D_
I can not stress enough that these parts of the Gardens are
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful setup, was in construction last time I was in town. We did the Skywalk and the Cloud Forest add on. overall a beautiful park and nicely done, a must for flower lovers!

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Historical Window Into Old Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: I was born in Singapore in 1958, the son of a British Royal Airforce Engineer. I went to school here until I was 11. It was a very different place then and I loved it. Back in Europe I never forgot it or stopped longing for it. Although I am proud of what Singapore has achieved and that it is a more modern and successful place now, I miss the old kampong-style city. This museum brought the old Singapore back to me for a day. I am very grateful and will come back next time I visit the city.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing why they can do these days
REVIEW_BODY:
Absolutely loved our visit here apart from some of the walkways that you had to take to get back down that you could see through as I hate heights. Other than that, it was amazing inside with the massive waterfall and rainforest plants._x000D_

REVIEW_BODY:
Stunning views of the city from the flyer. My suggestion would be to decide whether you would like to see the Singapore in day or night setting - I won't rate one above the other. Both have their own feels. Since we had already converted the night view from other places at height, we decided to go around 6.30 PM to get a feel of both day and night._x000D_
For someone who wants to enjoy both day and night, try to start your flight (that's what one circle of the flyer is called) at around 6.45-7PM. You'll get a good view of day and night setting.

REVIEW_TITLE: Very nice view to take a picture :)
REVIEW_BODY: we walked along the garden by the bay and watching the laser wonderfull on the edge of the marina bay sands
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was there at the Singapore Night Safari last night 07 September 2019 at 11pm and boarded the last tram at 11.20pm. The driver of the tram, (Livanesh) was speeding throughout the whole trip. I was starting to feel uncomfortable about it as we could smell a burnt clutch smell all the way, always jam emergency break whenever he stopped at attraction points, and what made it worse was towards the end as we were along the stretch of road approaching the stop, in order to avoid collision with a parked tram on the side, he swerved the steering wheel abruptly at a fast speed and there happened to be a hump which caused the last two carriages of the tram to sway left and right tremendously as the wheels were lifted from the ground. I am utterly disappointed by how the driver drove as I nearly fell out from the tram if not for my friend holding on to me. Even though there were not many passengers, this is not the right way to drive as there were still kids and a woman carrying a toddler onboard. Such a dangerous act should be condemned. I hope the management will take this very seriously and not wait till passengers really fall out from the tram. Even the other staff (Ervina) onboard the tram agreed that the driver was speeding.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a small museum set out in a fairly simple manner with interesting exhibits showing aspects of life (and death) in Singapore during the Japanese occupation in WW2. Visiting this museum I found to be quite a moving experience.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It's a bit of a jaunt by public transport involving bus or busses as well as MRT, but well worth the effort._x000D_
_x000D_
The museum is free and features many pictures of the WW2 occupation and survivor quotes. It is impossible not to be moved. There isn't much on what happened after liberation, but there is a good little video on what happened before the surrender._x000D_
_x000D_
There is a nice gift shop, quite a few books for sale as well as some lovely batik bags._x000D_
_x000D_
There is also a restaurant with good food, although somewhat pricey._x000D_
_x000D_
On the bus, you get a good view of the current Changing prison complex which is huge.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I came by from Marang Trail (Harbourfront MRT) around 6AM and climb up to Mount Faber. Rewarded by the beautiful sunrise like a full egg yolk._x000D_
_x000D_
Henderson bridge is a very artistic bridge, after a long walk visitor can take rest at the wooden bench. Dont forget to take some pictures coz its very Instagram-able
ADDRESS: 221 Henderson Road Henderson Building, Singapore 159557, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Pays to know what you are looking for before heading onto Orchard Road. Having not been to Singapore for 3 years, felt the quality in some of the large stores not up to the standard it was. Found other branches of same stores elsewhere in Singapore had much better quality. Pays to shop around
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

Go on the tram first then decide where you wish to go. Check feeding times for animals, photographer taking photos.Plenty of cafes for all tastes.

REVIEW_TITLE: International Flower Show 2016 at Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY:
I planned that trip specially for the International Flower show and i was not disappointed by all the great display. Must not miss the special Orchids display at the Flower Dome. Do visit it first if you have seniors in the group and they will be tired after doing all the outdoor display. However, you can opt to pay S$3.00 for a buggy to take you there._x000D_
Start from 23 July and will end on 31 July 2016. Be prepared with your hats as you may be walking in the hot sun. And all your camera battery fully charge to take plenty of great pictures.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Famous country/city monuments are touristy & crowded, how can you not visit Singapore and not have that all important selfie with the Merlion - at least once. It was extremely crowded & overcast & we get that photo.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Flower Dome and Cloud Forest are worth visiting. I would give a 5 star rating for both. The 15 minute free tour of the tulip garden by the friendly staff was very informative. Will surely visit again. Keep it up, Singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My husband had a very expensive beer at the Skypark but wasn't allowed to view the pool as he wasn't a guest. The view over Singapore, the Gardens by the Bay, the Marina and harbour was excellent.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was absolutely brilliant, there are two domes, a flower dome and the cloud dome. The cloud forest dome is the better of the two but they were both good. We were really impressed by it and thoroughly enjoyed the visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I wasnâ€™t WOWed by Merlion Park but I am glad I saw it. It was very overcrowded with little regard for the masses of people trying to take photos and get a good view. However, the view is quite lovely. The restaurants nearby look great, but Clarke Quay has much more variety and a better atmosphere if youâ€™re looking for a place to eat near the water. Only need 10 minutes at this place!
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A great vantage point for photographers at night
REVIEW_BODY: Although it is busy at night the Skypark provides a great platform for photographers to shoot some amazing views over the city.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The look of the building from far is majestic. Once on the top of building, the view of the City is thrilling. For those who are visiting Singapore this place is a must see.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Please don't miss the Gardens by the bay cloud forest while visiting SG. One of its kind experience. Technology meets nature. Refer my other review for GBB
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the museum is an excellent example of how old buildings can be conserved and given relevance to the current needs of a city.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited gardens by the bay twice during our time in Singapore, and were blown away both times. We visited at night, and were in awe of the phenomenal 'Supertrees' lit up. We also visited during the day, and went for a walk along the OCDC skyway (a must do), ate in a stunning restaurant serving local food and went to explore the gardens, one of the highlights being us running into an otter. Could have spent a whole day there, on eof the most amazing places in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I got there very early. Got some lovely photos before you get the coach parties of school children and coach parties.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Definitely a must do when visiting Singapore especially the Garden Rhapsody- one of the best light shows I have ever seen. It gets fairly busy so get their with half an hour to spare. We recommend doing the gardens in the morning when the crowds are less then return in the evening for the light & sound show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: good for foto spot , but they have some construction nearby , move to parking lot to take a good pic .
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I have been here twice and this has to be my best experience in Singapore. The moment you enter the door , you are in another world.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This ""grove" of tree shaped structures provides a unique sight in the Gardens by the Bay. The growth of plants up the structures has nearly covered all the framework and the effect is stunnig.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A lovely way to round off a day in the gardens. We purchased a ticket ($23) up to the Cest la Vie bar that included a drink and access to 2 areas in the sky park but not direct Access to walk the sky park._x000D_
I donâ€™t think we missed out on a lot not walking the park itself. Stunning views and nice food to purchase.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Enjoyed the Gardens.. Good work by the government to promote such infrastructure. I wish we had the same in India also.
REVIEW_BODY: Enjoyed every bit of the tour to the Gardens by the Bay.. However I think I missed out on the cloud show at cloud forest as I was not aware about the timings. Will visit again if I come back to Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Well organised birds eye view of Singapore and its neighbours !!
REVIEW_BODY:
One of the highlights of our Family Holiday was being atop the 165 meter giant ferrous wheel called the Singapore Flyer !! My entire family enjoyed the same. The whole breath-taking ride took us exactly 30 minutes. We could see the whole of Singapore which covered beautiful sites like the F1 Track, the Marina Bay Sands Hotel, The Gardens by the Bay and more. The slow and yet safe observatory wheel was as smooth as silk as it went one complete round. The Wheel encourages a great ambiance - from a romantic dinner especially on Valentines day to a memorable family experience right through the year. The safety and security anywhere in Singapore is simply impeccable and very encouraging especially for new travelers to the Island nation. The various packages which includes either a meal on the ride, a champagne bottle or just memories with family & friends!!_x000D_
So be there to experience life with a 360 degree view !!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We caught a taxi from Bugis Street , but there are buses.The Cloud forest and Flower dome are spectacular. The super tree grove is awe inspiring . There are shops for souvenirs and cafes_x000D_
Remember to buy your tickets on line to save money and queueing .We were there in the daytime ,but the light show in the evening is supposed to be wonderful
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can find Everything around the Bay High End Shopping Good High End Food to Local fine Seafood. Nice to take the Water Taxi to Quay.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is a must do, part of the famous Botanic Gardens, now our first UNESCO Heritage Site._x000D_
Just a joy to walk around & don't miss the VIP section, all heads of state & other important people have an orchid dedicated to them when visiting Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was just a highlight for me as I love shopping ! The whole marina bay is just beautiful, everywhere they should have a marina bay! The food hall also has great food . A must for everyone to visit.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Realy nice place for stroll6for a few hours. Well laid out and lots to see. Realy nice park. Saw a few monitor lizards and jungle fowl in the under growth as well. Must see also orchid gardens.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lights up at night in red, and a marvel of design. Anything can be built in Singapore. You will not miss if walking around bay
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderfully designed zoo - Great Tourist Spot!
REVIEW_BODY:
Singapore Zoo and the adjoining Night Safari are two of my favorite places to visit in Singapore. Both zoos have most enclosures with hidden separations so you don't see so many "cages" which are just plain ugly for both visitors and animals._x000D_
_x000D_
Be sure and go into the "Flying Squirrel and Bat" enclosures for an up-close experience! Do support these zoos, they're truly great and I'm from Southern California and use to the San Diego Zoo which is also a top notch zoo.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you have ever felt Singapore city lacks a certain cultural soul, a visit to Chinatown will put that to rest._x000D_
Colourful, vibrant and crowded even on weekday. Plenty of places to eat (although choose the stalls which are crowded, they are crowded for a reason), and great ships to buy souviniers.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Generally good as the whole park was sheltered. However, disappointing as my son is not able to take the boat ride as he is not tall enough. Are you able to let kids in with parent supervision?
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: All the modern buildings surrounding the marina, but some old British architecture maintained. It was very pleasant and full of tourists with plenty of places for refreshments. Had a unique experience of tasting Vanilla Ice cream with bread from a mobile seller.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Fabulous. .just do it!_x000D_
_x000D_
This Zoo has the reputation for being one of the best.. if not THE best zoo in the world._x000D_
This reputation is valid..I'm not going to say any more here other than to suggest that you visit the zoo when you are in Singapore._x000D_
It's excellent.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I visited this museum at 6PM cause by then they have discounted ticket. I would be lying if I said the place itself emitted creepy aura. I was scared the most by a painting of a woman in the top floor._x000D_
_x000D_
The horror aside, the museum itself was organized really well. The directions of the rooms exhibitions were informative. There were some information tablets all around the museum to guide you around.
ADDRESS: 39 Armenian Street Peranakan Museum, Singapore 179941, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
You cannot help but be impressed with the vibrancy of Chinatown and the generally relaxed atmosphere, despite the place being very busy when we visited, due to the forthcoming festivities for The Year of the Dog._x000D_
_x000D_
Great architecture, numerous and varied shops and street stalls, plus ample food choices for all budgets. This is why Chinatown is alive and kicking.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the Hertiage centre and learnt so much about China town's history. Quite a few steps to climb. Well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went to the zoo for the orangutan breakfast and it was very nice. They provided a nice buffet while the orangutan's came down to a platform where you could have your picture taken in front of them. This only takes about 45 minutes and we had a couple of hours left on our tour so we independently strolled the rest of the zoo. One area was closed for renovation and we were able to see what was open in our available time. We were able to get close to many of the animals as the exhibits were done very nicely.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I have been to Gardens by the Bay before but this time we went there for the mooncake festival display and the light show at night. Again it was a very awesome experience and I highly recommend it to anyone. You must at least visit there once because it has lots to offer and is an awesome place to visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: For those who want to remember
REVIEW_BODY: So beautifully done. Such a serene place to remember the sacrifices of those who have given us our current lifestyle.
ADDRESS: 9 Woodlands Road, Singapore 738656, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very impressive gardens and architecture! The flowerdome is amazing and nice and cool! The evening light show is amazing
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Could have spent hours in here. Itâ€™s hard not to want to touch everything though - the plants are Devine. Kids enjoyed it as well but probably could have taken slot longer walking through without them._x000D_
_x000D_
The List City at the top of the Cloud Dome was also in incredible._x000D_
_x000D_
Finish your night at Satay On The Bay. Everything we tried was tasty and the Tiger Beer icy cold.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's amazing to see how this dome is created and well maintained... It hosts varieties of flowers... It looks as if you have entered the wonderland.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Architectural heritage combined with souvenir shops
REVIEW_BODY: Loved the architecture, potter round the back roads to see real gems of colonial buildings and feel the history. Shops typical Chinatown tat I am afraid!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I live here and would have never have visited the Domes had it not been for guests from Mauritius. Beautiful Flowers in the Flower Dome. I was truly surprised how well looked after and planned the Domes were overall. I especially loved the Flower Dome. It is kept very cool for the flowers to have their maximum life span. The Second Dome was more on the flora and fauna found in Singapore. Again in a climate control environment a pleasant walk about for tourists.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Try the eve view around 7 pm so you can see half day and half night view as the flyer goes around. Also try to go on a weekday so you dont get much crowd in your capsule.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Go visit the Merlion Park at night and you will not be disappointed! You will be in awe not only at the majestic Merlion statue but also at the dazzling shimmer of the Singapore River and skyline at night. Donâ€™t miss the laser lights show starting at 8pm!
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is free for all to enjoy. This place is away from the city and has nice walking trail as well as a tree TOP walk too. Suitable for kids as well and there's eateries on site. Esp. Nearer to the entrance.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A fun stop in China town
REVIEW_BODY: This is a fun place, but really very small and even if you go through the museum itâ€™s a pretty quick stop, but definitely worth a visit.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Came here as part of a tour and our group were given about 30 minutes to roam about, certainyl not enough time. I had no idea there were so many varietys of orchids and each one is so different from the next, if youre really into gardens then you need to have a stop here.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visiting this beautiful temple on a holy day. It was extremely busy but this added to the whole experience. If you visit don't forget to go to the top of the builing, there is a lift or you can walk the stairs. It is worth it as it is so peaceful with water feature and plants.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were so amazed on how they manage to build and maintain these gardens, it is an amazing place to go, we unfortunately missed the night light show, however we recommend to go early to have more space and time to wonder in the beautiful gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Marina Bay is surrounded by the main sites of Singapore. The Sands Hotel and Casino, the Marina Bay Shops, across from the Gardens, the Helix, the Arts Museum, the Merlion and the Merlion Park. We were lucky enough to be there for the first illuminate event where the whole Bay area was lit and had many additional things to do - a fair of sorts.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Hard not to like the orchid gardens
REVIEW_BODY: Lovely stroll through the botanic gardens (free) to the orchid gardens (paid entry). It's all very beautiful and tranquil. Manageable with the stroller if you follow the paths with accessible symbols. It's very hot and humid though so hats and hydration are a must.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A great location for shopping, relaxed dining and catching a boat ride during the day. The area comes alive during the evening with a huge range of dining, bars and club options._x000D_
_x000D_
Itâ€™s lively and noisy within the covered street area but quieter spots are available by the river._x000D_
_x000D_
Most bars / restaurants run happy hours during the early evening with a pint / bottle of lager / glass of wine / selected spirits running at about $10 each, miss the discounted time and youâ€™ll get no change from $15 per drink. Dining options are huge but prices similar; most main courses between $15 - $30 each._x000D_
_x000D_
MRT service runs straight into Clarke Quay Central Shopping area.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Unfortunately it rained most of our visit but that didn't ruin our day. Ponchos available at the gift shop. Plenty of places to eat. Unfortunately the River Safari was under maintenance and not running during our visit. We loved being able to feed the giraffes. If you have any photos taken, buy the package. Love the elephants the best!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice way to see the city
REVIEW_BODY: This would probably have been a more amazing experience if i hadn't yet seen the views from marina bay sands. Definitely a good way to see the city from above, but doesn't really differenciate from the sights you see from the marina bay sands rooftop, so i'd choose between these two instead of doing them both. A nice ride can't deny that.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Gardens by the Bay are spectacular. These gardens are truly well worth a visit. The size and beauty is amazing. They are very easy to get to and find your way around. The Domes are well worth the money for their displays, size and beauty. We really enjoyed our day visit we returned in the evening to see the Light Show. Even though Singapore has a high population and large numbers of tourists, the size of these gardens ensured you had plenty of room to view it all.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We went to the cloud forest first and then walked through the flower dome... I would probably recommend doing it in the reverse order as I found the flower dome to be much less impressive._x000D_
It's very pretty and well put together and we went during Chinese New Year so they had an extra display which had great decorations, but I just found it underwhelming._x000D_
If you're super into flowers then I'm sure you'll love it, but there are much better things to see if you don't want to fork out the money for entry.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: An interesting and detailed history of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Allow yourself time and donâ€™t be impatient. The narration is long but worth walking and listening through. Approximately an hour and half. We really enjoyed it very much.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is my first time visiting Night Safari & it was amazing! The tram ride was the most enjoyable moment where I can see animals this close. But a bit disappointed not being able to see any giraffe and zebra..
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Many different species of orchids..a must visit for flowers lovers
REVIEW_BODY: The place is very well-maintained and name of each orchid is clearly labelled... the place even has photo-points to help make your pictures look even nicer...
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Too many ways to travel to the sentosa island and we decided to take cable car, more expensive than other, but...worth it!...Amazing views from up there accross the sea to Sentosa island. Although rainy and cloudy but we can enjoy the trip.. Start Harbour Frount St -Mount Faber St - Sentosa St. and we change cable car Imbiah Look St heading to Siloso Beach . We recomended you to buy ticket via online than on the spot..
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We eventually found the area to obtain access to the lift that takes you up to the top._x000D_
You pay your money ($23sgd), get your photo taken before you step into the lift, then once you get up to the top you are shown the finished result, a cardboard framed photo with you amongst the Marina Bay Sands. They do a good job of the photo, however $65S is a bit rich._x000D_
The views from the top are fabulous. When we got to to the top it was raining, so we had a drink to pass the time until the rain passed._x000D_
The sun came out and then we took a lot of photos._x000D_
It was a great way to see Singapore.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great stroll around a tropical oasis. 15 mins to wander round and enjoy. A must on your visit to Singapore
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really cool! Some of these artificial trees have vines growing over hem, which makes them even more interesting
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The carefully thought up place. Very nice and comfortable with lots of bars and restaurants, ice cream shops and drinks.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I understand that the Singapore Botanical Gardens are the only botanical gardens to be listed on the UNESCO World Heritage register._x000D_
_x000D_
They are vast and always stunning. Lots of different gardens within the overall site so you can do a section per visit of try to do it all at once. There are also a number of food and beverage options from casual cafe style to fine dining._x000D_
_x000D_
The MRT will take you right to the gardens via the appropriately named Botanic Gardens station.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good enough to spend full wild day
REVIEW_BODY: With two children we spent a full day all around the park simply walking and smiling to the animals. It was raining but doesn't stop us to move around.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great for a relax walk with family and friends.
REVIEW_BODY: Cooling place for a small walk in and hot and humid Singapore. With man made waterfall and plants all around, really made people happy. Wheel chair accessible too
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: If there is only one thing you visit in Singapore...........
REVIEW_BODY: By all measures, the vision and engineering in this ambitious project is world class. No so, the service, nor knowledge of staff. While you can freely walk through the outdoor gardens, admission to both the flower and cloud domes is by ticket only; if you love it and want to walk through a second time, you also have the option of receiving a re-enter stamp. If you only have time for one dome, then you must visit the cloud dome. This installation seems to be permanent and expansive. As well as being educational, the floral displays are beautiful and the cloud walk through the mist is essential. Although access in the last section is via stairs, the elderly and disabled can also enjoy the full experience through a special lift access that must be requested from one of the staff. In my opinion, the flower dome seemed to feature a lot of dismantable space that was more geared to events. This dome also features a lovely little cafe tucked away in the corner near the Mediterranean garden. Beware, it is expensive and the coffees, small. Elsewhere food options are limited, particulary if you are looking for lunch after 3pm.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We've been shopping on Orchard Road for years. Prices are reasonable and something for every price range. A few street vendors selling ice cream and occasionally buskers too . Beautiful at night particularly during holidays. All the name brand shops in the malls or along the road. Food courts and bookstores. On rainy days, head to the underground shops along the West side of Orchard from Ion to Taka. MRT lines operate along the route so you can get just about anywhere on the island without going outside.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic area with the expansive Gardens.
REVIEW_BODY: You can access the Gardens By the Bay by taking the MRT to Promanade MRT station. It is a short walk to the Singapore Flyer and then on to the Gardens. The Marina Bay Sands Complex is also close by. Make sure you do the elevated walk amongst the big tress for about $8. The Pavillions are absolutely fantastic and not to be missed. Return just before dusk at night to see the Sound and Light show. The Singapore Flyer is about $24 but is worth the money.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: the feel of arab land within Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: With TUrkish, lebanes and other Arab cuisine on offer this palce is for those who get bored from the usual stuff.. the decor of the place has been done according to their ethnic taste.. there are multiple options out here and one will not fall short of them
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Singapore is always amazing with so much to see
REVIEW_BODY:
Visit the top of The Marina Sands Bay Hotel for amazing views._x000D_
Go through the Hotel to The Gardens on The Bay._x000D_
Visit The Lucky Plaza for Great bargains._x000D_
Chinatown for its Atmosphere._x000D_
The Zoo is one of the best I have been to._x000D_
The hopper buses are great value If you are there for a few days you can buy all the 4 routes plus extras for an unbelievable price.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: you can take the cable car to visit stations in santosa only or out the island as well, it is great to take it to see the view from the top as you can visit the highest peak in Singapore personally I would rather I used the time to visit other places but if you have the time its good to go.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Awesome! Definitely don't miss out on this one! One of the most beautiful places I've ever seen, especially the flower houses are awesome + the Chinese gardens!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are a person that loves to shop a lot then I insist that you go to orchard because there are tons of places to shop around... Great View Public Transportation to Orchard Road is there
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: An amazing garden well worth seeing.
REVIEW_BODY: We went to the Gardens and were very impressed with the beauty of this attraction. I jts wish we could have gone there at night, as we were told it is even more stunning at night. I would definitely recommend this site.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The best things in life are free !
REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic day wondering and exploring... definitely recommend this is on your to do list ! Enjoy we did !
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was where I had my first touring around in Singapore. It was like you are watching the cinematic view of alluring nature plus the man-made beautiful sceneries.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best way to enjoy the Gardens
REVIEW_BODY:
If you are taking the train to Bayfront MRT, take a shuttle service ($3 unlimited rides - to and from Bayfront Plaza and Conservatories) from Bayfront plaza. You can buy your conservatories tickets there as well ($28 gets you to both Flower Dome and Cloud Forest). For OCBC Skyway, you need to get the tickets at the Skyway itself (This is because if its rains, the Skyway will be temporary suspended)_x000D_
_x000D_
If you are going to the the conservatories and the skyway, go to the skyway first and then cool yourself at the domes (Singapore can be hot and humid). After you are done, you take that shuttle service back to Bayfront Plaza._x000D_
_x000D_
If you would like to go around the garden with less walking, take the Audio Tour ($8 for Adults and $3 for Child 3-12 years old) at the Arrival (Golden Garden). Its a 20 minutes NON-Stop ride and it ends at the Canopy where the 2 domes are (Flower Dome & Cloud Forest._x000D_
_x000D_
At the Cloud Forest, there will be mist every 2 hours to mimic the wet cool environment._x000D_
_x000D_
The Flower Dome is a Cool Dry environment. Its hold plants and trees from the Mediterranean, and all the continents except Antarctica. Its display changes every season. depending on which season you visit._x000D_
_x000D_
And there is a Children Garden with Water plays and Tree-houses playground. Opens everyday except on every Monday for maintenance. Its free entry_x000D_
_x000D_
Always check the website before you visit to avoid visiting during the dome closures due to maintenance. And to check what display is on at the Flower Dome._x000D_
_x000D_
The whole garden is free access to public without tickets except for the Domes and the skyway._x000D_
_x000D_
Enjoy!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore Flyer was included in our city tour ,first we thought it would be a waste of time but as we entered it we felt we would had lost if we skipped it .our flyer trip was over very soon as we just clicked a lot of photos we able to view the whole Singapore from it .
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic garden and exposure of flowers and nature
REVIEW_BODY: a place of peace and quietness surrounded by flowers and plants. A place to recharge your batteries. The arrangement of plants is really fantastic. The 2 halls with plants you have to experience the atmosphere there. Great architecture of the park.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great but we got rained out!
REVIEW_BODY: We booked breakfast with the Orangutans and it was definitely an unforgettable experience...the orangutans are brought right up to the seating area and you can get so close but no touching of course. Breakfast was delicious. The zoo itself is impressive unfortunately we we're rained out by a sudden storm, and there weren't too many covered spots to walk around but we managed a tram ride which was undercover and we got to see around the whole zoo. We'd definitely return to visit night safari.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a visit - the light show is great fun - have your camera ready. Everyone departs at the same time so it can get a bit hectic.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Went there yesterday and thoroughly enjoyed it. The Zoo is very well maintained and the animals appeared to be well looked after._x000D_
_x000D_
The Food and drink prices were a bit on the high side, but certainly comparable or cheaper compared to other theme parks across asia._x000D_
_x000D_
Overall, well deserve a 4 hour visit.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This conservation park is very similar to the world-class Singapore Zoo except that of course it specializes with Birds of unimaginable kinds. Definitely you will find some species that will be a first for you to see making your experience more memorable. Enjoy the hike, just be sure to wear comfortable shoes and clothes as this bird park is huge. And here you will also wonder why some birds don't fly when you know that they actually can. Hmmm? And weather in SG is unoredictable, it usually rains in the afternoon even if it's very hot during the day so better bring an umbrella, it will be very useful. Enjoy the birds!
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Gardens, Best Orchids Display in the World?
REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely marvelous gardens and park setting. One could spend hours wondering this beautiful area. Unfortunately I had only 2-3 hours at the end of a long day, but the impression the gardens left me will stay forever. The orchids portion of the park was splendid, with hundreds of varietals of all sizes and colors. And while the entire park was worth the visit, this area was the best in my book... And I would be surprised if any location around the world had a better orchids display. Can't wait to go back.... Not sure when, but I will...
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Though rebuilt some 30+ years ago, Chinatown still has the original Singapore feel to it with small stalls to find and haggle bargains. Easy access by SMRT, great food court.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: I place I keep coming back to!
REVIEW_BODY: Recently took family for the first time and they were amazed. TOP class attraction with great facilities.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing zoo that becomes better over the years
REVIEW_BODY: Amazing zoo that becomes better over the years. Went there for a business event. Turned out that it became much better than people in terms of environment, service quality, and varieties of eateries.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Kids friendly. Scenic n enjoyable!! TrAnsport is great as well with the mrt right at the hotel. Overall highly recommend.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's free; it's fantastic. Few Singaporeans visit it these days and it's their loss. While it has seen better days it is still a must see attraction. Absolutely unique and totally worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Took our young (2 year old) to the children's garden and splashed around in the water park, what a brilliant way to cool down. We all had a lovely time and then had lunch at one of the many eating places._x000D_
Would certainly recommend this place. It has two areas one for kids up to 5 and one area for the older child and parent.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Went to SB wetland reserve for the first time. I wanted my 2yr & 6yr old kids to experience nature and some wildlife (i.e Birds, insects, Fish)._x000D_
_x000D_
First 1 hour was a pleasant walk as it was cooler but it started getting hotter around midday (Seemed to be the hottest weekend in a while). Kids started to get irritated and worst part was we were not able to see any wildlife like we had thought before the trip._x000D_
_x000D_
Its a good spot to visit for half a day. Its different from your usual outing in Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
Will i go there again? Yes but will chk the weather first and might go early morning or late afternoon._x000D_
_x000D_
NOTE: getting taxi is tough so recommend booking taxi advance if you are not driving. Bus i think runs only on Sundays._x000D_
_x000D_
Also check out kranji countryside website if you are planning a visit to Sungei. You can visit nearby vegetable/frog/crocodile farm
ADDRESS: 301 Neo Tiew Crescent Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve, Singapore 718925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Have been to this zoo on a number of occasions and every time it has been amazing. Great range of animal attractions and open air enclosures. We had breakfast with the Orangutans which was very cute and well worth the early start. Definitely a must when staying in Singapore
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Like a piece of heaven. Very quite and relaxing place. A must in Singapore, especially after the sunset when the lights are On.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is a great place for a challenging uphill walk jog or run..._x000D_
The steep incline makes you work hard - however there are places to rest stop of it gets to much._x000D_
The first incline is a wide road and then there are further trails up higher with many stairs._x000D_
A great workout and definitely worth doing to overlook the areas and get some good exercise and fresh air.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing structure however once inside you don't really feel the shape of the outside of the building. So much better from outside. Spend your time relaxing sitting around the lily ponds below the structure admiring the building and all around it. We took the lift to the top floor hoping there would be some sort of view of the building or a viewing platform but nothing. The box office and galleries are mostly on the lower levels as you enter. It is very expensive to enter any of the exhibitions so we did not bother at all. There was a free wildlife trail using hand held virtual reality screens that was fantastic. It is from WWF Singapore and was a great little wander around. There are so many more fun and interesting places to visit in Singapore than are just as good or better and definitely less expensive. Check what exhibitions are on before you go and how much it is to enter and then you can decide.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
No matter how many times I visited, this area is still my most favorite spot._x000D_
Great for first timer, yet be lovely even for veteran visitors. Best access through Raffles Place MRT for view of the river, or Bayfront MRT for view from the Marina Bay Sands (opposites of Merlion).
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely loved this park! Bring an umbrella, bug spray and water! Expect to spend 3 hours. Had never seen such a variety of Hornbills and Pheasants/Doves in one place.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice to walk along at night
REVIEW_BODY: Nice to walk along the Quay area at night with many bars and restaurants. Also the Waterfront Promenade with Marina Bay Sands and nightly light and water show.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Didn't quite make it to the Skypark as it was very very busy and the cost of the lift up to the top was too expensive. I know they have to cover their costs however we thought it was one $ too far.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Make sure you go for the Penguin feeding
REVIEW_BODY: For a bird park, Jurong Bird Park is pretty good. A little far out, but nothing is really too far in Singapore. We arrived in time for the Penguin feeding, and were able to feed the penguins some fish ourselves. It was a great experience.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must visit location on Singapore trip.....The view from the flyer is good..... It takes approx. 30 minutes for one rotation.... and you can get different views of the city during the 30 min rotation of the flyer.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We spent a day there - and only covered half of it. A fantastic place to visit. So many different things to see, photo and learn from. Worth taking 10 minutes before you start to decide what is important. Itâ€™s free to visit too so you can spend some money in the various cafes to help keep this fabulous place going
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Definitely worth going if you are in Singapore. Its an indoor forest with waterfall. If you dont want to stay outdoors due to humid weather this is the place to take the family.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are undeniably spectacular, especially the indoor waterfall in the cloud forest dome and the sky-walk among the super-trees. However, the information boards don't tell you much about the plants. OK so I did not take the audio tour which doubtless provides more, but you should not have to do this to understand what you are seeing. Much of the information on the boards and the videos was generic platitudes on climate change rather than anything that enabled you to understand the plants you are looking at and the ecosystems in which they thrive. The whole feel of the place is more like a theme park rather than somewhere you can actually learn something. As a themepark or simply somewhere to amuse the kids its great. As a botanical gardens its a disaster.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must for visitors to Singapore, ensure you visit day time and then return for the evening light show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Eye opening visit to The Intan that housed numerous Peranakan Treasures. Place is extremely clean and comfortable. Host also shared many interesting facts with us on the culture and was extremely hospitable!
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun place to hang out with Middle east touch.
REVIEW_BODY: An interesting place to hang out with friends, very colorful area as the building painted in bright and cheerful colors. Many bars and restaurant that serves mostly middle east food and shisha of course. Beside, there's also variant shops that sell Arabian clothing and belly dance costume, also some souvenir and antique. The price for the food mostly are affordable. Will be best to go there at 6 pm ish where all the shops completely open with the street lighting make it more life.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Put off by the commercialization of this Hindu temple---first thing upon entry you are asked for donations and if you want to take photos inside they ask that you pay for the privilege!_x000D_
That aside the exterior of the temple is ornate and colorful. If you plan on going in bring socks and wear long pants or below the knee dresses.
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were delighted by this museum and learned so much about the culture. We arrived just after a guided tour started. The guide was wonderful. The signage in the museum is superb; we visited some exhibits without the guide and found it all very well presented. The artifacts are beautiful and I'm so pleased we had the opportunity to learn about this group of Singaporeans.
ADDRESS: 39 Armenian Street Peranakan Museum, Singapore 179941, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: definitely worth a stop really helps with understanding both the colonial history of Singapore as well as its post-colonial transformation and where it is likely going. paradise for planners!
ADDRESS: 45 Maxwell Road The Ura Centre | The URA Centre, Level 2, Singapore 069118, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The National Orchid garden is within the Singapore Botanic Garden. The layout of the Orchid garden is superb and we noted that it is continuing to be refined and developed. The orchids are truly beautiful and range in size from very very small to large flowers. Time and time again you turn a corner and are rewarded with a new vista of (different) orchids. While the garden is not large it should be covered at a gentle pace so that you capture all of the carefully designed views. There are lots of excellent photo opportunities._x000D_
We also spent time in the wider botanic garden in areas such as the swan lake. There is a Hop on Hop off bus stop quite near the Orchid gardens so access is easy.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place was the best part of our sightseeing in Singapore. It was freezing so wished I had something to throw on like a light raincoat or jacket. The variety of plants and flowers was amazing. We had a great coffee at one of the coffee places near the Olive trees and loved the muffins. There are 2 domes which are equally amazing but very different. Once we had explored both domes we took a shuttle to Marina Bay Sands, which is near the MRT. We walked over the bridge and got tickets to the cafe area for lunch.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went to a Thailand for our honeymoon and on the way back our stop over at Singapore airport was 10 hours. So we decided to have a tour of the city which is free and runs every hour or so from and to the airport and you will have a guide that takes you through the city. Singapore river and marina was really nice. Everyone should plan at least once a visit to Singapore.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Always a great day out when family and friends visit
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is like no other. Acres and acres of beautifully landscaped gardens, well-labelled trees and plants, plenty of shady areas to stay out of the sun, a fun water park area for the little ones to run around, get soaked and cool down, 2 amazing domes filled with trees and plantations from all over the world and even a waterfall in one, extremely wheelchair friendly, eating options from the local style hawker to the posh restaurant atop one of the giant trees. And twice every night at 745pm and 845pm, free captivating themed light shows with accompanying music entertains the crowd. A definite must see as it's quite uniquely Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely place for a stroll in all the greenery to see all the different birds. Just wish the cages/avaries were bigger for better flight for the birds, after all, that's what they do.
