However, they are obviously well looked after. Enjoyed the shows and not crowded. I believe it is closing and moving to the Singapore Zoo.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Quiet, well air conditioned and comfortable. I used this library to get further information for my travels. They had a substantial number of books including lonely Planet for many countries. The personnele helpfull.
ADDRESS: 100 Victoria Street National Library Building, Singapore 188064, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a must see in Singapore. Everything was built on reclaimed land and they created such breathtaking experiences there. I recommend staying for the light show during night time with views of marina bay sands
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: great views of the hotel and bay area
REVIEW_BODY: no views of the infinity pool but worth seeing just for the sheer shininess. The walk is great but do it early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a must visit place for all who go to Singapore. Really an educational tour for the children. You can get a good sense of jungle in the dark while you go through the tram ride. The night show by the creatures are also impressive.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I toured by myself while my daughter was here on business. I enjoyed every minute. Lots to see, lunch near the orchid center was good and had time to visit with fellow travelers at a couple of stops and take turns taking pictures. Well labeled specimens and a comfortable walk for most of a day.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic views â€“ but do your homework
REVIEW_BODY: For non-hotel guests, there appear to be at least a couple of options, so do your homework. Apparently you can get to a particular bar at the top, or as we did, take the level 3 lift to the large cantilevered open deck area. It seems you canâ€™t go from the open deck to the bar area without going back down and buying a separate ticket. (Seems a bit silly). We didnâ€™t pre-purchase tickets on-line â€“ just turned up during a weekday, when there were fewer people. The views are truly amazing. Because we lingered here for a long while to take it all in (and to take lots of photos) weâ€™re glad we chose to do this instead of the Flyer. Be aware that the area is completely open ie there is no shelter from rain or the intense sun. No seating either. Were it not for being corralled into a seemingly obligatory photo shoot at the level 3 lift, then being pounced upon to buy a particularly expensive photo pack when alighting from the lift at the top (polite staff simply doing their job), we would have given this attraction an â€œExcellentâ€ rating.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went last night. I really enjoyed. The weather was perfect for it. If you're into nature and animals this is definitely for you. Love it being pitch black out with the light spotlighted on where each animal exhibit is. Has a spooky aura to it. A great variety of animals can be seen on your left and right. The only downside if it can be a downside is no pics can be taken due to the tram always moving and it being so dark out. I understand the flash can't be used to trigger the animals. It's something you gotta take in and enjoy and put your phone/camera away. Tram ride is about 15-20 minutes I'll say. Plenty of places to eat and gift shops to enjoy. They take your pic upon entering the park and when you hop on the tran which is cool too.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: To understand the word Peranakan you need to come see how the two cultures became one. The traditions both shared were very well married into the people that we now use one word to describe. The dress, furniture, and lifestyle are visible and each has a fantastic explanation of why things are the way we now see. The beliefs system and values carried the traditions that help us understand the culture. If you love history this is a place for you.
ADDRESS: 39 Armenian Street Peranakan Museum, Singapore 179941, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: ä¸€my personal fav place in singapore with awesome views and grt atmosphere can spend as.much time u.want
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Found a lot of flowers is not fresh and withered. Cannot found tulip flowers which is my favorite, but definitely will back again when tulip is there.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you want to experience Islamic Culture in Singapore, this is the place.There are lot of restaurant and bar especially Mediterranean and Turkish. Other than that there are shop house and cafe too.
ADDRESS: Kampong Glam, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
On my first trip to Singapore...the Singapore Flyer is one of the Country's iconic attractions._x000D_
However, if you are able to access any hotel with a restaurant or bar on the 65+ floor...I feel you will get the same panoramic view and experience as in the Flyer._x000D_
Plus, at the restaurant or bar, you can enjoy a nice drink...while in the Flyer, you have to sit and wait for the Flyer to make one full rotation before you can depart.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Cloud Forest is very interesting, but unless you are a generic flower nut, skip the Flower Dome._x000D_
The flowers were nice but it isn't awe-inspiring. We have a teenager (15 years old) and we were unimpressed with the Flower Dome. Also, we have terrible allergies and as soon as we stepped in we were congested and our eyes started watering.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As a WWII buff, I enjoyed my visit to Fort Canning Hill, one of Singapore's most important historic sites. Occupied by the British during the early days of WWII, Fort Canning Hill came under Japanese occupation after the British surrendered Singapore in 1942. Expect to spend half a day at this historic site. You don't need a guide to visit this place. WWII historians will enjoy the museum with its well-documented story of the Surrender of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you get chance definitely spend some time here. You only have to pay if you go into the domes or use the aerial walkway the rest is free and there is plenty to see. Also worth going down at night to see parts of it lit up. A really lovely attraction and the toilets like all those in Singapore were super clean.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth the visit for the views
REVIEW_BODY: Don't expect much when you are up the top as there isn't much there but the views are great and you see a lot of Singapore from here!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lots of delicious food stalls and shops to be found here as well as beautiful architecture and historical monuments.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: So much to see, do and eat here all in one small area. Try some local food, itâ€™s all good! The shops are good too.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: 3 of us had our own capsule so was a great adventure. Excellent view of Singapore and surrounds and would definitely do once
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is a wonderful experience. We visited the two domes and the night show. The flower dome was beautiful. They were in the middle of changing the flowers from different Lilly's to Orchids. The cloud dome was amazing. The night show is for free and lasts for 15 minutes. There are two shows 7.45 & 8.45 each night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This temple has a buddha tooth and some more relics, there is inside hundreds of different buddhas all over the place in the first floor, also you can see a ceremony when it take place. In the upper levels, you will feel some kind of mystique place, some scultures and stuff about buddism. Also, outside there are a place where everybody is playing game of checkers, it was a unique experience for me that around one game could be more than 10 viewers. (December 2013)
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you wish to amuse yourself by the way Singapore takes care of its flora and fauna then you must sit under this supertree grove
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I love it here. The smell, the beauty of the place.. so good.. dont forget to bring mineral water cuz its gonna one hell of a walk ðŸ˜‚
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Superb experience across the zoo.Its well maintained including F&B.You find animals very close to your view with proper safety at all places.Amazon river quest is one of the best experience of river safari.A must place to visit. Food is marginally high but good choice and varieties.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These people have recreated nature only thing is it bringing all the very best of the nature from across the world and creating artificial mist, waterfall just wonderful
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great View over Gardens by the bay
REVIEW_BODY:
This is a really great viepoint if you visit Gardens by the bay ! Price of S$ 8 per person is worth it._x000D_
_x000D_
But take care: It's a one way walking way, you go down the other tower and they take care that nobody walks around several times.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing experience, maybe we got lucky?!
REVIEW_BODY:
Booked this trip through Viator and paid about Â£90 for 2 people. For this we got priority boarding (10 minute queue vs 90 minute queue), transfers to and from the zoo, buffet meal and expert guide advice from the amazing Joyce._x000D_
_x000D_
Read a lot of mixed reviews on here, but if you pay the extra money it takes away so much of the pain and was an excellent experience. Maybe we got lucky, but we saw every animal pretty much barring giraffes (my favourite!), but we saw 2 lions play fighting, a tiger 3 yards away and 3 hippos very close by moving around, amongst so many others._x000D_
_x000D_
Genuinely is one of the best trips out we have ever had.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was really nice to walk around and they have a light show at night which is nice to watch. You can pay to go into two of the sections and pay to have a buggy ride between areas as itâ€™s so big.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was nervous to say the least, but once inside and on the way, this was a tremendous experience and the views over Singapore are stunning. I went up in the daytime, very nice and again in the evening with all the beautiful colours of the lights reflecting on the Singapore River and from the buildings. Well worth the effort.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: I hate zoos but this is great.
REVIEW_BODY:
really good fun. The animals are awake unlike day zoos. You can hear the lions roaring which is fun. We skipped the shows and walked around and in some parts you can feel quite remote._x000D_
_x000D_
My tip would be go as late as you can and it won't be so busy. And do get off the team and walk around its very atmospheric.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Firstly, DON'T try to do this and the main zoo all in one day! It's a whole separate zoo not just the main zoo in the dark. You can take the tram ride but you need to walk too to see all the animals, so wear good shoes and insect repellent._x000D_
The animals are seen in a totally different way and that's what makes this so interesting. It's very hard to photograph them so there aren't so many people trying to get selfies all the time, but it is VERY BUSY. All the tour groups have this on their itinerary, and it's Must See so be prepared. At opening time (7.15pm) the queues for the tram are huge, so walk one or two of the trails and get the tram later from one of the other stops._x000D_
Highlight was the prowling tiger.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens are luxurious very well maintained . There are different spaces , some with water activities for children that comes very pleasant with the heat!! Very impressive indoor gardens as well. There are nice art sculptures along the walks.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Truly this place is a Shopping haven! All the brands you dream of seeing are here not to mention the Sale Sale Sale!!!!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The restaurants along the river come alive at night with music and people. The boat rides can be boarded at Clarke Quay for a quick tour of the city. Shopping is also available.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A futuristic garden in the bay area of Singapore.Itâ€™s a good place to spend with your children.The price is somewhat expensive.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You have to visit as the view of Singapore and part of the F1 track is spectacular however be warned it is quite expensive. We were fortunate and being a first of the hotel we had free admission but it is one of those things you have to do in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We spend the morning learning about Singapore history. I love the way they have organised the rooms by years and the way they show their history! very entertaining!
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is an evidence that Singapore is a power house even is tiny. Banking, whatever judgement you have, is making it super rich!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's a nice place to chill and enjoy the garden city with a mix of modern and traditional. Great views of the marina bay too.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Whenever you feel lonely or blue or you don't know what to do, you can go to Marina Bay. It's about 15-30 minutes walk from downtown (around Bugis, Bras Basah, Dhoby Ghaut). The skyscrapers by the bay will guide you there even during the night. There are one of the Merlion sculptures and casinos, Singapore Art and Science Museum, Gardens by the Bay and Singapore Flyer.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Breathtaking little garden full of orchids! You can see different types in every color and pattern! Though it is a tiny place compared to the Botanic Garden it is in, but so many flowers to see you can easily spend hours here! There is a little house called the Moist Garden which holds rare and unique orchids. Just here we spent at least half hour as we wandered around every flower! Don't miss this place because it is truly a unique place!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: After eating all the great food around Singapore all day, I really enjoyed Orchard Road to walk off some calories and wind down. It was very clean and I felt very safe. The number of people out and about even on weeknights surprised me, but I assume everyone was out enjoying the cooler temperatures. The underground passages across the street were handy, were full of shopping opportunities and were significantly cooler than ground level if you need to get away from the heat. Lastly, the chirping birds in the trees were nice to hear and it was interesting how they all got excited and significantly louder every time there was a horn honk from traffic.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Bustling historic street and area full of culture, middle eastern food and artisan cafes. Gorgeous shops selling beautiful textiles, pretty Turkish lights, perfume and more. Expect plenty of patterns, colours, and delicious eats. Just love this area, itâ€™s vibrant, interesting and happening.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited during the daytime and again at night , fabulous, loved this place , beautifully laid out and so tranquil , amazing , saw from the flyer too which gives another beautiful perspective
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: if you dont have a whole day to walk around the garden just go to the ocbc skywalk and go around 6.3-8.00pm..there is a musical light show at the side...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you don't want entrance to Flower Dome or Cloud Forest, you can moving around and it is nice also for take a photo. So many spot outside for your best picture. Recommended..
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A golden piece of Singapore History
REVIEW_BODY: One of the more prominent icon in the Jalan Sultan Area surrounded by the rustic Sultan Art Village and the Malay Heritage Centre also known as the Istana Kampong Gelam.
ADDRESS: 3 Muscat Street Masjid Sultan, Singapore 198833, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What can I say the paragon Centre 6 floors of shopping take your money I did my research on things I wanted .
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are fun! The flower dome is worth the investment to give yourself a cooler hour - many European flowers and plants here so helps make 'home' feel a little closer. Lots to do, plenty of places for food and drink. You can even cycle of you want to.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Go see the Animals at the zoo
REVIEW_BODY: You should not miss going to the zoo in Singapore. They have so many different animals, birds etc. It is quite an extensive tour and you can either walk it or go on the tram. I walked it with my eldest daughter and she pushed her dad in a wheelchair to see the sights.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Poured all day long but we had tickets for the Night Safari. Luckily I had read previous reviews of the queues so we decided to arrive an hour earlier at 6pm even though we had booked online. No queues at ticket machines- but staff unhelpful as to where to queue to board the tram. Lines quickly built up but phew we were eventually directed to the front of a line. Rain still falling heavily but on board we were ok. Lots of animals to see which were almost â€˜stagedâ€™. At one point we were driving through a river of rain water. After we were told that the amazing animal show was cancelled and as that was â€˜complimentaryâ€™ we couldnâ€™t come back!! We decided to follow the trails in torrential rain. Animals were being fed which added to our excitement. All in all I would recommend but preferred the day zoo!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: You better visited the much better Botanic Garden
REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the bay feels artificial, roads wide for electric cars, a pointless audio tour is SGD8 which is only worth SGD3-4._x000D_
_x000D_
Fees to enter a tropical dome is outrages at SGD28._x000D_
It also costs extra money to visit the super trees._x000D_
You easily end up at almost SGD 100 per person to visit trees and plants._x000D_
_x000D_
Is this normal?_x000D_
_x000D_
We did not enjoy Gardens By The Bay which is purely a cash cow and commercial. The media pushed up our expectations which could not be met at all._x000D_
_x000D_
The original Botanic Garden with the National Orchid Garden is much better and complimentary. Gardens there are more than 150 years old and roads are much more narrow yet offer enough space for everyone.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We walked to China town from our hotel early in the evening and was amazed at all the stalls and lights that we saw - it was a hub of activity that was fantastic to see. The shopping was fantastic and the ambience was brilliant,. We ended up coming back twice as once was not enough :-)
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The place is huge and still can cover the entire in couple of hours thanks to the zoo bus ._x000D_
The animals are not kept In a cage . They free and safe ._x000D_
Good day spent with my 4 year old . He really liked it.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The best collections of flowers around the world
REVIEW_BODY: It is one of its kind, that you cannot see such a huge collection of flowers any where else. Fortunately we went on Tulip festival and mesmerized to such a high collection of tulips. Overall a wonderful place for flower lovers
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lots of walking trails and group exercise opportunities in the morning!
REVIEW_BODY: A place to unwind and enjoy the morning Breeze with opportunities to engage in different group exercises. There are a variety of walking trails and whether solo or with friends, there will be something that fits your exercise preferences!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Flower Dome surpassed by Cloud Forest
REVIEW_BODY: We thought the Flower Dome was gorgeous, the flowers, the Cactii, the Bonsai, sculptures and the dome. But the Cloud Forest was even more wonderful. It was amusing watching the gardeners at work in climbing harnesses! Could have spent hours in there.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: After reading the reviews we decided not to go in to the museum, however the architecture of the building is amazing and striking.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the bay is a breathtaking botanical garden with some incredible flowers and tropical plants._x000D_
There are 2 parts and you can pay $28 per person for both which is definitely worth the money!_x000D_
Itâ€™s a must see if youâ€™re in Singapore for even a day!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is a MUST when visiting Singapore !_x000D_
Incredible experience and you can see EVERYTHING !!_x000D_
It really is an amazing experience._x000D_
There is also an interactive tablet inside the pod so when you are going around you can pick different locations on the tablet and it gives you some information on the things you can see around you, I thought this was a nice touch so you can identify everything and get some history/ facts._x000D_
The Singapore Grand Prix race track is right under this. So you can also visit this once you have had a ride on the flyer._x000D_
_x000D_
I have included some photos from inside the pod.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is definitely a "must experience" attraction. Even if you don't have a head for heights you can sit in the middle of a capsule and still admire the view without getting close to a window. If you go at dusk you can still admire the views and watching the city light up is a great experience.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one place I fully recommend my friends to go when they some time. Get there after tea about 3 plus, you can have tea at the Marina Bay Sands shopping mall or food court and stroll via the bridge across. Bring a hat though cuz the sun is pretty strong. Get your tickets and into the cool domes. Wait till 7 plus for the outside lights show and itâ€™s so amazing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I really enjoyed this "flight" and thought it well worth the visit. The area that it is situated means that it gives a great view over the different parts of the city and out to the Indonesian islands. I'd advise to go just as the night sky draws in to get the full benefit of the night skyline and the light display.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: we visited this place on the day when we landed in SG..... Amazing scene....the authority has maintained the place very welll!!!!! My parents loved it a lot.....
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is so much different to Chinatown in Melbourne. It's effectively a small suburb with quite a history, as I found out at the Heritage Centre. Shops and restaurants abound. Expect to be invited in to shops to buy clothes or camera gear from friendly, but pushy, salespeople. Be polite and be firm. It can be fun once you are used to it!. Immense choices for food! Beer is much cheaper than in Melbourne cafes. Bonus!_x000D_
_x000D_
Do visit the Buddha Tooth Relic Buddhist temple and the Sri Mariammam Hindu temple. Great contrasts!_x000D_
_x000D_
For the less adventurous, there are some shopping malls full of Chinese and other Asain cuisines. A bit "safer" but still very good.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore is truely a manmade delight and this includes it extensive Botanical gardens. The entire area is very beautifully laid out with quiet nooks and corners where you can sit and soak in the nature. Must visit both in the day as well as in the night as the ambiance changes completely fro mday to night and each is worth the trouble.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the Gardens by the Bay twice during our recent visit to Singapore. The domes were breathtaking - especially the cloud dome. The children's park was absolutely amazing with a water park and a play area for kids. The garden on the whole was very well maintained and easily accessible by public transport. Highly recommended for family with kids
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely walk with riverboat trip, gets very busy as the day goes by especially at the weekend, quite pricey for what's there but Singapore is expensive, loads of food outlets and easy parking
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We expected the night safari to be more of a hit-or-miss, given that nocturnal animals could be sleeping it off or hiding in the bushes, but nope! More than 90% of the animals were actually visible, and we got to see rare species like the endangered slow loris, or a majestic Bengal tiger strolling only 2-3 feet in front of us, separated by a perfectly clear glass wall._x000D_
_x000D_
The safari consists of four walking trails and one tram ride. They are all mostly separate - what you see from the tram ride, you won't be able to see from the trails._x000D_
_x000D_
Tips:_x000D_
_x000D_
1. There is a fire show before you enter the venue, but given the huge crowds, you probably won't be able to see it. If you've seen a Polynesian fire show in Hawaii, it's pretty much the same._x000D_
_x000D_
2. Arrive 30-45 minutes before your admission showtime, to get a front seat at the "Creatures of the Night" show. The show is aimed at kids, and good but not amazing. We saw bear cats, otters, owls, a serval cat, and a huge snake._x000D_
_x000D_
3. Take the walking trails first, THEN do the tram ride at the end, when it's far less crowded, and you'll be tired from walking._x000D_
_x000D_
Food closes early (10pm?) except for an ice cream shop.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: beautiful flowers that smell so good!
REVIEW_BODY: Greeted by cool air and lovely scent from the colourful orchids that are currently on display til end August, the flower dome is decorated with beautiful flowers all over. nice place to stop by and smell the flowers as life gets hectic on us!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Breath taking views of the city
REVIEW_BODY: Well worth the $33 to get some great pictures of the city. Pods are very clean and spacious so you get 360 degree views in the 30 minute ride
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The entirety of the Gardena were cool and interesting, but the cloud forest will take your breath away. Totally worth the price of admission. Also cloud forest and the other dome are air conditioned!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a lovely place to go for a walk. It can be a long walk and you can get lost, but its easy to get back on track. Take a picnic and enjoy eating around the reservoir.
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Singapore Night Life with a Difference
REVIEW_BODY:
Before you enter the Night Safari, enjoy a fiery welcome at the park entrance. Yes, witness a thrilling fire show (fire-twirling and flame-throwing to jungle drumbeats) by "jungle warriors" to start your evening adventure. The first show is at 7pm (I think it is performed hourly, the last at 10pm)._x000D_
_x000D_
My wife and I chose to head right away to join the queue for the "Creatures of the Night" Show upon entering the park. We were rewarded with good seats in the middle section (free seating on first-come-first-served basis) and were treated to an entertaining show that featured various noctural animals... there was also the staged commotion in the audience arena... (Oops! Too much said...visit and see for yourselves!)._x000D_
_x000D_
After the show, we have the option to take a walk through the various trails/tracks or the night tram. We chose the latter for compliemntary guided tram ride, complete with audio commentary in English on the various noctural animals. Fortunately for us, the queue moved pretty quickly (we were told by friends later that we could pay S$10 for express boarding, i.e. queue cutting)._x000D_
_x000D_
The tram ride was comfortable and gave ample chance to spot the night creatures. It was great viewing the animals from a comfortable distance although we could have taken a walk through the well-planned trails/tracks and spend more time with the night creatures but we didn't have time that evening._x000D_
_x000D_
As a resident in Singapore, I have signed up for the "Friends of Wildlife" card and can have unlimited visits to all 4 parks for a year (zoo, river safari, night safari and bird park). So perhaps, in my next visit, I will take a walk..._x000D_
_x000D_
The Night Safari is highly recommended (especially if you love wildlife in the night). Make sure you are dressed comfortably, and wear some insect repellant in case (or you can cover your arms and legs). I had writen a review of the Zoo already, and will do so for the other 2 parks after my next visits...
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Pick a clear day and the views are great. We had a family of 9 and we got our own pod and all had a great time. We took binoculars to see more into the distance but didn't really need them we could see a long way out. Next time would love to go at night time for a different perspective.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit - great for all ages!
REVIEW_BODY:
The iconic Night Safari is a must visit when in Singapore. It opens at 7pm and can get crowded on weekends. The tram ride is fantastic but the trails are where the action is! Catch nocturnal animals including huge predators here. I especially loved the fishing cats - they were a treat to watch!_x000D_
The entire attraction takes 2-4 hours to complete.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Daytime visit will be better because we could hardly see or admire the flowers in the dark during night time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent the whole day here, we could not fault a thing. Very pleased it was designed and built by an Australian. This is a must see venue
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the place that you can get close to the iconic Merlion Statue & another background you have the Marina Bay Sands hotel
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This area really has all the iconic sights in one location- the Singapore Flyer, the Sands casino, the Helix Bridge,the Gardens by the Bay. Beautiful spot and so many photo opportunities
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Excellent day spent in River Safari. Very impressive! I bought tickets beforehand, it was cheaper and no lines.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went there with a tour guide the view was amazing it was rainy day but we enjoyed our time then there was a water show it was one of the best shows I ever see it
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: I loved seeing the famous Merlion!
REVIEW_BODY: It was so fun seeing this iconic sculpture while in Singapore! And since I am an Artist/Sculptor by trade, it made it even more special for me. We recommend going!!!
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great gardens well designed and great entry price. Loved this place. Excellent variety of orchids and garden displays.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good place for expensive shopping at singapore. Most crowded place in singapore i think. Also the night life area for Singapore.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to visit both day and night. The bay gardens are delight to see and I also visited cloud forest which is great value
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful experince to walk in this dome, ticket cost approx S$30 , but u can get discount with singapore airlines boarding pass. Buggy costing s$3 is available to commute till the dome.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Wide choice of restaurants there (Asian and western cuisines), many bars or pubs, but definitely too crowded and above all noisy. Music is set at full blast almost everywhere, even inside, so it really spoils your moments there as you cannot talk much._x000D_
Most of the people are youngsters having drinks and looking for company maybe, so we did not enjoy it that much._x000D_
Having said that, it is woh the walk along the river and for whomeever wants, there is also possibilty to dine on the river.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Dont miss this while at Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The flyer is one of the best things that I liked among the attractions at Singapore. It gives a good view of the entire city on a slow moving wheel. The wheel cabin is enclosed and has air conditioning making your experience even more pleasurable.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Definitely a must see in Singapore. Very crowded at times so try for a midweek visit. Garden itself is free just have to pay for domes and skywalk If thatâ€™s your thing. Obviously it comes alive at night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A little bit of the old Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This takes you back to the old days of Singapore. Cheap shops, tailors, lots of color and entertainment. This area is full of character and great restaurants.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great experience for anyone visiting Singapore for the first time. Wonderful views of pretty much the entire city and all the major landmarks. Best time to visit is at night when the city is lit up and there are light shows in neighboring attractions like Gardens by the bay adding to the mix of colors
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A museum within a building that at one time housed a very large number of Chinese immigrants. Fascinating to learn how they slept, worked and brought up families in such small spaces. We were guided by a young man whose knowledge and passion shone through. Well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is all it's cracked up to be. Build it Singapore..."and they will come". The variety of plants, flowers,trees, cacti, displays, greenhouses, tree top walks, waterfalls are plentiful, varied and sometimes spectacular.. 5.5 hours and still haven't done the light show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We spent a whole morning here, and could have spent the day, with so many different things for everyone in the group we were travelling with. The Super Trees were impressive views from the bridge between the trees. There was a dinosaur display on while we visited and my 5 yr old loved it, although his fav was the water park, which was a good way to cool down on a hot day.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Do not underestimate Chinatown it is huge it is a very big place to walk around! There are plenty of places to eat and lots of shops I mean tons of different little stores to buy souvenirs from China and from elsewhere. I would recommend going to different shops and see what prices there are cuz you can get a keychain that is the same and one store that's more money than another store so I always compare prices because sometimes it is cheaper at a different place. Nearby Chinatown there's a famous Buddha Relic Temple which is a must-see as well.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best Garden experience
REVIEW_BODY: Not saying this cos I'm a Singaporean but I'm proud of how much work Has gone into making this Gardens By The Bay an unique experience for any visitors.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Part of garden by the bay. It starts with some orchid display then to many regions of the world garden and finally has lots and lots of flowers especially Orchids !

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore is a walking city and following the Quays is a good way to see it at its best.very relaxing and a good way to absorb the history
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place for an evening or night stroll
REVIEW_BODY: An attractive place to have a leisurely stroll, the water in background of buildings look good in the evening and even better in the night with all the lights.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
There is an incredible array of orchids on display in this garden. I didn't realize that this was a major breeding ground for hybrid orchids. They are amazing and beautiful!_x000D_
The grounds are very well maintained and the paths are excellent. You will need to use the local map since you can easily get turned around and miss some areas and varieties._x000D_
The Cool House was a pleasure to walk through on a very hot day!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: More chaotic than the downtown area
REVIEW_BODY: The people are quite friendly and it feels safe. Great food on the food street. Interesting shopping and easy to get around .
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is amazing! So beautiful and well kept. The waterfall is man made but really cool. The Cloud Forrest is right next to the Flower Dome are right next to each other and you can buy a combined ticket. There is free WiFi here. Would definitely visit again.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We took the stretch from Merlion station to the Imbiah Outlook station at sunset and loved it. Kids were happy with the views and the excitement of getting onto a moving cable car!
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic day experience. A bit spoiled by rain causing the shut down of one area but the gardens are simply amazing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Incredible what planning can do for tourism. A magnificent indoor garden with gorgeous displays and waterf eatures to cool you down from the humidity outside - refreshing!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You will need your plastic here....so many bargains (or not - but must haves) so leave plenty of room in your luagage
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can see the whole city from here. Its a nice place to visit after sunset - so you can see the city totally lit up. But if you go during the day, you can identify the different spots and its fun to keep guessing :-)
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: BEEN TWICE AND WOULD GO AGAIN
REVIEW_BODY: This is a lovely relaxing place. And while you are there you can have a good time studying some of the most stunningly beautiful or interesting birds on the plant. I love the lorikeet enclosure. You can forget you are in a managed facility in there as the birds fly near by or play in the trees. Its a great place for kids especially if you are trying to get them to be interested in and respect nature. But there are plenty of elderly people in there too enjoying the birds. And the 'train' that ferries you around means the walking isn't onerous for the elderly.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
There is a big choice of shops, if Iâ€™m not wrong, there is every shop posible, there is 2.5 km of shops and restaurants._x000D_
Acces to location very easy, there is 3 or 4 metro stations, and there is a big choice of restaurants so you can spend all day
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the most amazing places experienced
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore is an absolute amazing vibrant city. This place is so fascinating, stimulating and a fest for your eyes! It's so beautiful! Definitely: it's a must to experience: to see, to touch, toe ear, to smell, to live! A.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place to visit and take good pictures!
REVIEW_BODY: We visited on Monday September 24th 2018. We were there in the late afternoon so we got to take good pictures of Singapore during daytime and more pictures of Singapore in the evening. Evening pictures looks better with all the lights!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the bay å…§å¤§æ¦‚ä¸»è¦åˆ†ç‚º4éƒ¨ä»½ï¼Œæ”¶è²»çš„ Flower Dome, Cloud Forest and Skywalk åŠå…è²»çš„ Supertree Groveã€‚æˆ‘è¦ºå¾—åˆ°æ–°åŠ å¡éŠè¦½ï¼Œå¦‚æžœæœªèƒ½åˆ°æ­¤ä¸€éŠï¼Œå¿…å®šæœƒæ„Ÿåˆ°éžå¸¸å¯æƒœã€‚

REVIEW_BODY: If your not a guest you donâ€™t get a look in at going to the outside of the sky bar to see the light show for example, you take from the backside of the park down to the Gardens by the Bay, donâ€™t get me wrong, it is a great view but the city and light show is what everybody likes to see and photograph. REVIEW_BODY: A part of Garden by The Bay, full of flowers from 5 continents of the earth. Chilled inside and very good for family time spending. You can enjoy good view of Merina Bay from there.

The Gardens by the Bay that compliments the global icon Marina Bay Sands Hotel alone is a 2 day affair before stepping inside the humongous shopping complex comprising of nearly all top brand names boutiques from the world. With the ever-so-easy to use SMRT having a terminal right to the front door, the Marina can easily vacuum up all the travelers to Singapore.

REVIEW_BODY: Today I had the chance for a round trip on the cable car.. my kids enjoyed a lot .. they really wanted to go again .. the joyful I saw in them .. can not be expressed in pages and pages .. wish u all the best

REVIEW_BODY: Around $16 each way in a taxi, There are some great walk through aviaries which are huge, one of them you can buy a small cup of bird food for $3 and as your walking round the Lori will come down & feed from you which was really nice. Some of the other enclosures were small but the park is moving (next year I think) to where the Zoo, River Safari & Night Safari are so hopefully they will build more of the huge walk in aviaries.

REVIEW_BODY: The pool area is alwAys packed so be prepared for a packed pool view. Eating places is nice place to chill and the guest card access is limited to 1 guest card per entry. to control the crowd but tends to be really troublesome when you have larger family members, will need to take turn to access the pool and skypark.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This garden within the Singapore Botanic Gardens (free) is absolutely worth the $5. The orchid displays are absolutely amazing and incredibly beautiful. Go earlier in the morning before the crowds.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Been in many many times._x000D_
In most of the occasions just passing by, while I was running. Good spot to do my afternoon run, very nice._x000D_
_x000D_
The foods, are also good. many many many restaurants and bars. many kinds, many alternatives. My favorite, still hOOters, hahahahah
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is something not to be missed. It is an experience to remember for rest of your life. We all loved it. Please check this out.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Enjoyed both the Flower and the Cloud Dome as part of our day exploring the gardens. Make sure to also check out the supertrees and to leave enough time to do it at a leisurly pace.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I am not really a bird person like other members of my family but this bird park was exceptional with so many unusual species I had never seen before. The park is open every day of the year and about 20 minutes from Marina Bay. We took a grab (like uber) and it was under $10USD. A favorite area was the Wings of Asia where a person can observe the birds in their natural habitat up close. In the park make sure to see the unusual: Edwardâ€™s pheasant, Philippine eagle and the Mindanao bleeding heart. A person of any age could easily spend a day here with bird shows, feeding the birds and wildlife tours.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I am living in Singapore and had not ride the cable car since I was a little kid. Took my 6 year old on his cable car ride as he insisted._x000D_
_x000D_
It was nice to see familiar scenes from above like the Adventure Cove waterpark._x000D_
_x000D_
I bought the Mount Faber and Sentosa line package. We got down at every single station and walk around. Nice way to spend an afternoon. Located different places to visit when I next drive into Sentosa.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Initially, i was in dilemma to visit or not , but it is very good and nice experience specially the show hi flyer at auditorium at 3 pm was really good. waterfall view again nice
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is good for a stroll. There are different kinds of flowers everywhere. The structures are also tall that too much look up might strain your neck. It's a good spot to take photos of Marina Bay Sands. Also, make sure to watch the lights show at night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: æˆ‘åƒåŠ äº†Hippo Bus Tourçš„å·´å£«æ—…éŠ"Moonlight Adventure"ã€‚é€™æ¬¡æ—…è¡ŒåŒ…å«äº†"Garden by the bay"é …ç›®ã€‚ æ­£å¥½åˆ°é”äº†å·´å£«é…åˆå…‰å’ŒéŸ³æ¨‚çš„è¡¨æ¼”é–‹å§‹æ™‚é–“ã€‚é‚£å€‹å¾ˆå¤¢å¹»ã€‚æˆ‘è¦šå¾—å¥½åƒç§‘å¹»é›»å½±ã€‚ é›–ç„¶æœ‰å¾ˆå¤šäºº,ä½†"Garden by the bay"éžå¸¸å¯¬ã€‚æ‰€ä»¥æˆ‘å€‘èˆ’æœåœ°åº¦éŽäº†ã€‚
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Singapore Zoo is set in a wooded area of the island that forms a major part of its water catchment._x000D_
_x000D_
The Zoo has quite widely separated animal displays, usually separated by a mixture of planted and more original tropical forest. The displays are very varied, providing environments that are suited to their inhabitants. Highlights include the white tigers, one of whom at least didn't appear too happy to be in captivity, the polar bear, where you could view the large pond through glass walls to get a great view of the bear swimming, and the various apes and monkeys swinging through the ropes and branches. The elephant enclosure was surrounded on one quarter by stands from which to view regular exhibitions._x000D_
_x000D_
The grounds are very well serviced by toilets, drink outlets and restaurants, and all the paths are pram friendly. Road trains can be used around the site if you get sick of walking. The shops on the site have lots of cuddly soft animal toys-- avoid them if you want to limit the kids cost!_x000D_
_x000D_
All up, a very nice way to spend a few hours. Taxi to Orchard Road is about $15, or you can go by MRT to Maseling and from there by either bus or taxi. Entry to just the Zoo is $33 per adult, and their are combined tickets for the Water Safari plus other attractions
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very well organized the way of Disney park but very impressive, the walk through this nature museum, the view around of the city , don't miss the stop (20$SG per person) at the Indochine rooftop bar, this place is really unique experience.!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I did it in the morning and I really liked that. It was awesome. It moves so slowly that you don't feel it. You can see a beautiful view of Singapore,take great pics and enjoy._x000D_
The price is 33 SGD._x000D_
The nearest MRT station is 'Promenade' take exit A and walk there for 5 mins.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Itâ€™s so serene and the flowers are amazing. I saw some of the most amazing orchids and the gardens are pristine here. Definitely a must see spot if you visit Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth a visit and plenty of photos can be had here .It can get very busy and hot you can do tours and by your self .
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore converted this icon court house of history to a national gallery. So it is a very new place. It was converted in style. Perfect for couples, tourist and families with young children. There were so many exhibitions for kids. My kids favorite is the glowing light, walking on glass and sticky polka dots room. So much fun for adults and kids. So creative indeed. A must to stop by if visiting singapore. Singaporean are free, visitors are charge Sgd 20 per adult and Sgd 15 for children 7 to 12 years old. Accessible by bus or to city hall mrt station.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to learn a little history. You won't be swamped with a lot of artifacts or items here. For the price I expected more but it was still interesting.
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great way to get a different view of Singapore! Great for the kids. Maybe go later in the day when the sun isn't so hot.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The buildind itself is impressive from the outside and its inside. One can get nice views from the South part of Singapore, and they get better at night!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The most beautiful orchids...every colour of the rainbow
REVIEW_BODY: It is only a $5 Singapore admission to enter the National Orchid Gardens which is well worth it considering how well the staff maintain these magnificent flowers.There are orchids of every colour & size where ever you look. You can easily spend a couple of hours walking through & taking photos to show those back at home A truly unique experience.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We first visited in 2000, so with happy memories decided to return June 10th 2017. It was a complete shambles. Rude, ineffective staff. Hours and hours of queuing -they pack people in without the resources to manage them. I was shoved; and trodden on. The bull elephant was showing clear signs of distress. It was awful and nothing like our experience 17 years ago. Save your money!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
My family been here this morning after 45mins uber ride from Geylang to the zoo for only 19.10Sgd. The entrance ticket for adult is 33sgd and sgd22 for kids. As we arrived in the place the zoo ranger from the entrance gave us a map and without a tourist guide you can go around to see your favorite animals, reptiles, and crops. Lakes is also good for relaxations, tram is available in the place to those who can hardly go over the whole place sgd5.00 to adults and sgd3.00 for kids. Fast foods and restaurants are available and souvenir shops too. At the kids world there is a nice pool for kids, so donâ€™t forget to bring swim suits ! The highlight in our visit is the polar bear 10:20am is the schedule of interactions followed by another 2 schedules onwards where the bear roams and swims around while you can take pictures._x000D_
The Animal Kids Show was fun.. my fist born got a chance to participate_x000D_
in one of their segments!_x000D_
No need for umbrella, the place is cool because of the trees around the place. Expect some animals just walk around the area.. like baboons._x000D_
Truly this place is a environment- friendly place for everyone. Where adults, kids and old ones will enjoy!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you haven't been to orchard, you can't say that you have been to Singapore. It's vibrant and crowded . Shopping is not the priority . However if you enjoy shopping, it is a good place for 8.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A highlight of a round the world trip
REVIEW_BODY: A moving experience highlighted by finding the name of a relative amongst the thousands of names in books at the conclusion of the tour. Easy to get to by public transport and a good cafe available for lunch. Audio tour well worth the cost.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We paid the $20 per person to go up to the top of the marina bay sands which I know sounds expensive. But you then get that money back in a voucher to use in the ce la vie restaurant at the top. It's such a great idea as you can have drinks up there using this voucher and you can enjoy the views for miles. Your $20 won't get you very far but one drink at least! The only problem is unless you are staying at the hotel you can't use the amazing infinity pool up there! We wish we had known about this amazing place before we had gone as we would have paid the insane privilege with fantastic views.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A beautiful relaxing place to sit and relax. Sometimes you will be lucky to catch live musical performances. Also at night there is an amazing laser and water show. You can watch it from a distance or up close outside the Marina Bay Sands shopping mall.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Took the Guided Buggy Tour of this outstanding Zoo. One of the best Zoo experiences I have had with the expert commentary from the guides and the extensive variety of well cared for animals within this huge facility. A great way to maximize the number of animals visited and without foot fatigue.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Small shops, large shops, boutiques, designer shops, department stores, restaurants, Orchard Road has them all.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I went there by a friend's recommendation and I wasn't disappointed at all. I was awestruck by the entire set up, one of the world's tallest artificial indoor waterfall, flora-fauna and the cloud walk. The theatre show cases a short film and crystal formations are must visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Even if you aren't a flower person it's still worth a visit on a if you have some spare time. There was some construction (but I couldn't see or hear it) that was going on and by the looks of the picture of what the renovated area will look like it's going the be very nice indeed. I believe construction is scheduled to be completed in a year, but go anyway as it's still very nice.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great view, but that is it.
REVIEW_BODY: This is definitely something to do at least once in Singapore. It provides a great view, and I think this just refers to the tourist deck, which is otherwise barren, with some fast food. If it include the hotel's pool area, it is interesting to walk through, but not much else you can do there.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Donâ€™t miss-great buzz, lots of shops, restaurants, tailors for made to measure clothes, shirts, suits, etc. Not easy to get taxi from here in rush hour. MRT Station best option.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We managed to fly onto this flyer. One thing good, there is a place for prayer. As a Muslim. Beautiful night view. Smooth movement and beautiful nite view of Singapore city
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing place to come over and over again
REVIEW_BODY: I must say this is the pride of Singapore with great efforts to exhibit the love for nature and to blend nature with modernity. This is a must visit place whenever my friends comes to Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Outside of the food courts, restaurants and shopping - there is lots to see and do around here. Visit some of the many temples - they are always interesting to see.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The hike to the "tree top walk" (pictured) is not easy, and yes, Singapore is hot and humid about 365 days a year. But is it ever worth it. At the one-way bridge (the "tree top" part), you will likely be greeted by several monkeys -- we had never seen that before, and it was truly amazing to see monkeys outside of a zoo environment. As for the walk, you need to be in SOME sort of reasonable shape, but it really isn't bad -- the shade provided by the forest canopy helps a lot. Overall, this was the highlight of our Singapore visit. I wouldn't trade this experience for a dozen art museums -- get out and enjoy Singapore's best effort to preserve part of nature.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a best place for souvenirs shopping in Singapore. You can buy any 3items like key chains, bags, merlion miniature, etc for 5sgd
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good for families with young kids
REVIEW_BODY: Tips Visit at 9.30 in morning. There are two shows.. Hawk show and Bird show (11 am). Shows are really nice. Take tram ride at the end. It's very long walk. Kids May feel tired.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I was initially not sure of visiting just what i thought was a garden till i saw this place. Gardens by the Bay has to be seen to be believed. Its beautiful to experience flora and fauna of so many kinds and the domes in which they are made make the experience grand, definitely worth the visit_x000D_
Backdrop of the Marina Bay sands makes for amazing pics as well :)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful place and highly recommend you include on your visit to Singapore. The Orchid exhibit is spectacular.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you love gardens and a walk, somyourself a favour and head through before leaving Singapore. We only visited because we had time but were so relieved not to have missed out. It's free and contains a beautiful display of orchids and rare plants. The Orchid Garden is contained within, also a must see but costs to enter.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: For travelers like me who have poor eyesight won't really appreciate the night safari. If I knew, I would have opt for the day trip.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are in Singapore, a visit to this Merlion is a must. You will get to know and see to believe. A walk along this long stretch by the Singapore Riverside and a boat ride costing around &12/- or $15/- to take in the sights in the evening will be nice (half hour ride). The financial city is thereabout including the Marina Bay areas will be good and food and transportation are easily available. Along the Riverside of this Merlion are eateries & restaurants. Lots of choices. Gourmet selection to suit your taste.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: spend the day taking in all the different malls and shops, prices are reasonable but shop around as they can differ from shop to shop, good for luxury brands, but not for souvenirs.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Everyone should take time out in Singapore to visit the National Orchid Garden. There are so many different and beautiful plants in a display that has appeal for all ages
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is amazing, it's part of the Gardens by the Bay development and you would be robbing yourself if you did not take the time to look through it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was great at night. Someday i'd like to try at day time. The queue was long, and don't get happy, when we arrived, they took us a photo, it wasn't free, you neet to pay to get the results.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely walk and so amazing gardens
REVIEW_BODY: We were a little hesitant abut paying to go into the flower dome and cloud forest, but it was worth it and we really enjoyed them. They are "cooled" so have a jacket if you get cold easily. They are fun and have really cool sculptures around too. Even if you don't want to pay, the free parts of the garden are nice to walk through and we loved the free light show at night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was a beautiful way to spend a day in Singapore! The gardens are so lush and glorious! So many varieties, it was impossible to pick favourites. We were so fortunate to see them by day and by night! The light show was a highlight of our visit to Singapore! A must see for every visitor.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Magnificent skyline of Singapore by the Waters
REVIEW_BODY: Best way to take a glimpse of the magnificent skyline of Singapore by the Waters!!! Enjoy the fascinating architecture against the backdrop of the open waters at Marina Bay! Catch a glimpse of the romantic aura at night!!! It's a beauty - day & night!!!
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Supertrees are a bit Avatar and a bit futuristic, but the light show set to music was fantastic. We went at night, which I highly recommend as I don't think you would get the whole impact during the day. The orchids and greenery growing through the trees gave them another dimension in the different coloured lights. Lots of people were lying on their backs gazing up to get the whole effect. There is also a Visitor's Centre, toilets and places for snacks and drinks nearby.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A long tiring walk but worth it
REVIEW_BODY: My family and I brought some of our foreign guest here. It was a personalised tour for them and they enjoyed the sights and picture taking. The walk was definitely long and tiring but it was all worth it. The domes are very beautiful and worth the picture taking.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A quirky and fairly small attraction. Those with an understanding of Chinese folk stories will get more out of it. Not hugely recommended for younger kids (our 6 y.o. was fairly bored and only really enjoyed feeding the terrapins)._x000D_
_x000D_
- right next to the MRT station so fairly convenient_x000D_
- there are some juice vending machines outside but not much to get by way of food_x000D_
- bring a few $1 coins to buy food for the terrapins - these are scattered throughout the park_x000D_
- you can probably see most of the park in 1-1.5 hours. Donâ€™t plan on spending a whole day here.
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing flowers, views, and best of all, air conditioning! Ticket prices are affordable and we even caught a couple taking pretty wedding shots! We told ourselves we will come back one day to do our photoshoot there too!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited as a family of four and had a great tour of the battle box. The tour is really good because you get a good overview of the history of Singapore as well as an understanding of the forces that were at play in South East Asia during WW2. But don't think this tour is for history buffs; it is for anyone who wants to get an understanding of the history of Singapore including the decline of the British Empire in the Far East. Perhaps the strongest element was the way the guide brought to life the narrative of the people who worked in the Battle Box, those affected by the Japanese invasion and the terrible dilemma with which Percival and Simmons wrestled. If you want to understand Singapore you could do worse than first understand the history and heritage of the Battlebox._x000D_
_x000D_
Highly recommended.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great suite, fantastic places to eat. Well worth the cost. Ideal to have the MRT station at the lower ground level.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens By the Bay-- by Travel Z 2000 Tours
REVIEW_BODY: Excellent and courteous pickup right at our door was much appreciated. The Cloud Forest exhibit is just amazing not to mention cooling on a hot day. The Flower Dome houses many beautiful flowers, bushes, and trees arranged by geographic locale. The Supertree Grove light show, only fifteen minutes, was quite pretty to watch. There are elevators and escalators for those unable to navigate flights of stairs.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice zoo vast in size but easy to get around. Animals are treated and cared for very well. Clean and tidy Good location and nice to be in this environment.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the most recognisable buildings in the world and has become an iconic part of the Singapore skyline. I suggest a walk through the huge ground floor lobby and walkway. The sheer scale of this building is amazing. There is a great restaurant at the very top called Ce La Vi. If you phone to reserve a table it gives you quick access and you then don't have to pay to get to the top viewing area. The large casino is in the hotel building and the huge Marina Bay shopping centre is right next to the hotel. Entrance to the casino is free for tourists but you must produce your passport.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Architecturally and culturally one of the most important places within Chinatown, beautiful inside and very tranquil.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A unique experience, whether you like it or not!
REVIEW_BODY: The Gardens by the Bay are an extraordinary technical achievement that turned an amazing futuristic sci-fi-like dream of talented architects and ingenious engineers into reality. The collection of plants and trees presented inside is very valuable and interesting as well and the effort to maintain them is admirable indeed. The specimens of olive trees on display are centuries old, the largest I have ever seen -- and I have seen old olive trees in many Mediterranean countries. There are trees from Australia and Africa, all beautiful and in best health. After you tour the display, at all its various levels, you can watch a short enlightening documentary about the effects of global warming on the biosphere just before exiting the cupola. One cannot help wandering though if the Gardens by the Bay do not contribute to global warming themselves? They are such a huge climate-controlled space in the midst of hot and humid Singapore -- and that costs huge amounts of energy. Let's hope our natural gardens will last a long time and this one will be a just successful reminder of what it would take to preserve specimens of our present-day natural world inside glass cupolas.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Even for those with a phobia about heights(like my father), this is a must do. He thoroughly enjoyed this experience
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Excellent exhibition n acts to share how singapore arrives till now. Book tickets now, ending in september. Great!!
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great local food, better prices than in the centre of Singapore. Easy access through the underground. Its busy but fun!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple on Serangoon Road in Little India is an awesome temple._x000D_
_x000D_
The temple was quite busy with worshippers at the time of my visit. i was amazed by the ornate sculptures on display. There was a strong smell of burning incense._x000D_
_x000D_
This is a place of worship, and you need to take your shoes off when you enter the temple._x000D_
_x000D_
It is reputed to be one of the oldest temples in Singapore. It is beautifully decorated with statues of Hindu Gods. I guess most had a coating of gold coloured paint._x000D_
_x000D_
The priests were saying prayers and then sprinkling the worshippers with holy water._x000D_
_x000D_
This temple is worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 141 Serangoon Road, Singapore 218042, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Eat at Spago for the same View and Much more special than Skypark entrance
REVIEW_BODY:
Marina Bay Sands Hotel is a VERY busy place. It is very hard to escape the crowds up on the rooftop level. The hotel pool is crowded with everyone taking selfies. This is not an enjoyable experience._x000D_
_x000D_
Instead of paying for the Skypark entrance there are other options at Spago Restaurant and/or bar. This restaurant has an informal bar/food area which enjoys the same view or as we did, we ate at the more special Spago restaurant and LOVED IT.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The building itself is incredible but the shopping mall is also out of this world. Top shops (and prices) everywhere. A canal with boats on the first floor. A MRT station below and a bridge that crosses the road to Supertree Grove. Watch the laser display in front of the Marina Bay Hotel and then go across to the supertrees for a light show there too.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We only paid a short visit as part of City Tour and would love to go back and wander through the gardens.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Emz Was amazing great service and lovely afternoon, thank you. Fantastic value cost you ride up in lift but that gave you a free drink. Lovely relaxing music and the view, amazing!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a nice looking, convenient pedestrian bridge. It looks particularly cool lit up at night as well. Itâ€™s ver convenient for crossing Marina Bay.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This temple is huge and we were allowed to enter, take photos, and enjoy the beauty of this religious site. What amazed us is that this building was constructed without using even one nail.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion is very cute and an icon of Singapore, but I haven't seen such pushy and deep crowds since I was at the Mona Lisa in the Louvre! There is a good view across all of Marina Bay and over towards the Esplanade theatres as well.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A long hot climb led us to the Battle Box. The 2.45 tour was late leaving so we were in luck. A very well presented tour full of, for us, some new information regarding the surrender of Singapore._x000D_
Surprised that they didn't know the abbreviation AA&QMG, they do now._x000D_
A must for any visitor to Singapore.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We love it here and have been here twice on different stays in Singapore. You get an incredible view of essentially the whole country. Would definitely recommend you do it at night as you get less crowds and get to see Singapore at night, watch the light show at the gardens, see the lights of the city reflecting on the water and see the hustle bustle of Singapore at night.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Help Chinatown Social Enterprise Light Up The Lives of The Needy Elderly
REVIEW_BODY:
It is remarkable how Chinatown welcomes Spring in Singapore - which is not favored with 4 changing seasons._x000D_
_x000D_
Neverthelss, the celebratory spirit overwhelms all and everything._x000D_
_x000D_
Vendors marketing apparell, decorations, edibles, festive goodies, drinks, toys are all out in full force. The 'bak kwa' traders boasts their long queues of customers aiming to get their hands on this traditional chinese pork jerky._x000D_
_x000D_
I want to steer away from the mercantile gleam and glitter that is Chinatown at Chinese New Year. Instead, I focus on charitable organsizations at work at Chinatown's Social Enterprise located at The Majestic (next to Yue Hwa Chinese Product Store._x000D_
_x000D_
Open Monday to Sat from 10am to 7pm, on Sundays from 10am to 4pm & closed on Public Holidays._x000D_
_x000D_
The venture is set up with the aim of helping the needy and the elderly provide for themselves through its community outreach initiatives. Offering Samsui bags, passport holders, handphone holders, Samsui Dolls, Five Stones etc... for locals to stock up._x000D_
_x000D_
For foreigners, attractive replicas of Sultan Mosque (S$35), Victoria Memoria Hall (S$59), the iconic Central Fire Station (S$55) and Ngee Ann City (S$15) are up for grabs. You won't find them elsewhere._x000D_
_x000D_
The heart of shopping - experience it.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Huge varieties of animals. One can checkout Pengiuns too here. Bird shows were simply marvelous. Spent 5 hours.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: we planned it well, the morning we went it started to rain and was very hot. But inside here it was cool and dry. Magical place my kids enjoyed looking around and walking through and down the walkway.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore flyer is a must do while during your visit. Gorgeous views and informative video playing as well. We were lucky enough to arrive while there was no line. Definitely worth doing.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice little tourist spot on the edge of marina Bay and Clarke quay. I would recommend the river cruise that gives you a bit more insight into the history of the bay
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: From the moment you step onto the bridge you can see and experience a bridge structure which can only be described as amazing. You have to experience this bridge which is certainly an icon of perfection.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore
