REVIEW_BODY: I visited Singapore Zoo many times quite a few years back. But during this year visit to send my relative there, I am quite disappointed. We found many attractions are closed, and animal shows are lower standard compared to old times. Show Venue are also don't improve with enough ventilation. When other attractions in Singapore are upgraded and new, I think Singapore Zoo really need to do the catch up game to gather more local & tourists.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Just do it you won't be sorry
REVIEW_BODY:
Let's face it Singapore is a picture postcard from most angles._x000D_
But for the ultimate vista it's an amazing experience to take a ride on the flyer._x000D_
30 minutes from start to finish great views comfortable cabin._x000D_
Good value attraction._x000D_
Some great food places around the attraction and it's location is easy to reach and link up to the marina.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I don't think that Little India is authentic - I experienced Indian cities to be very different! It's not like in real India, so if you've ever been there, not need to visit Little India.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The place is nice for hangout especially with kids. Easy to go and have various type of birds species.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The best zoo i have ever visited. Fortunatelly animals are not inside cages but they are free in their jungle. there are some physical limitation for the animals made by moats so they cannot reach people. A big variety of animals like tigers, leopard, leon, zebras, monkeys, elephants etc
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Temple is a must see in the Chinese quarter. Free to get in but charity boxes are available for donations. The decorations are exceptional with gold Buddhas and ornate carvings and paintings. Take the time to read into the culture and context before and during visiting. Wraps and scarves are available to women who are not dressed correctly at no cost.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went to the zoo to have breakfast with the orangutans. Make sure you book for this before you go, though. It was a fantastic experience and highly recommended. The breakfast itself was wonderful with an excellent variety of foods to be selected. The orangutans were so lovely and we enjoyed watching the mum and her baby. We then went on to stroll through the amazing zoo. The 'hop on train' was a good choice too. Make sure that you take an umbrella! Rain and storms can eventuate quickly and can be unbelievably saturating. Plastic raincoats can be bought there if you need one.This zoo is beautifully maintained and highly recommended.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My visit to The Intan was very exciting and informative. Alvin, the curator, was very hands-on and forthcoming with his knowledge of authentic Peranakan heritage, being a Peranakan himself. His extensive collection is enough to wow a crowd for a period of time. I look forward to coming back sometime soon.
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens by the Bay - what a treat
REVIEW_BODY: Truly magnificent gardens in every way with beautiful gardens and exquisite structures to view and walk on! Wonderful views from ground level and also the Marina Bay Sands Hotel observation deck. Wonderful to behold at night time as all the tree like structures light up and change colour constantly. Just incredible to see so take your video camera with you!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's a must see when visiting Singapore. The collection is varied and the best part is the temperature in there. With Singapore being a hot and humid place, it just makes walking around a more pleasant place with definite revisits.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful experience and the orchids are amazing. Visited with elderly parents but was able to stay in the shade and stay cool. Highly recommend.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We had been to Singapore Zoo before and thought it was brilliant during the day time. But doing the Night Safari is even better for many reasons. Firstly, it's much cooler and no mosquitoes. Secondly, the animals are more active. We booked on line for first available time slot of 7:15pm (our kids are 6yo & 8 yo) so it wouldn't be too late a night. We caught a taxi early so we could eat there before hand. Suggest you go straight into the Creatures of the Night show first as the show is only every hour, so as more people come in later it is more difficult to get a seat. Being from Australia we decided to skip the Wallaby Trail, and walked through the Fishing Cat Trail and the Leopard Trail. You see a lot more walking these ones and the walk at night is really nice. We then caught the Tram from Station 3 as animals on East Lodge Trail are easier to see, plus you can't see Elephants, Rhinos, Wolf unless you go by tram. Whole thing was a really great experience. Easier to get a taxi to & from Clarke Quay than any other transport option. Only $30 each way. Only down side is that you MUST not use your flash on your camera in the park or it can harm the animals, so your photos end up pretty dark. But better for animals.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An amazing collection of flower plants from around the world. Great place to photograph. Water fall at the cloud forest is very nice. Can book the entry ticket on Klook for a discount price.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice enjoyable walk with plenty of great photo opportunities and views. Wear a hat if its a very hot day though.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to chill out at no cost
REVIEW_BODY: This is a huge garden, exceptionally presented with its manicured lawns & well kept arrangements. Fish, Turtles & Swans can be easily seen on Swan Lake. From the Frangipani garden with its many swings for all to enjoy to the Sun Dial garden or the Bonsai garden up to the Gingers on our way to the Orchid Garden, the only paying part of the garden & 2 restaurants to choose from there. About 7 throughout the park. The amphitheatre looked magnificent surrounded by water & plants.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a wonderful place for those how like to be in touch with nature in a controlled enviroment. Besides, there is a wonderful liht show. For some parts of the park you will have to pay a fee. But for others, the acess is free. REally worth going.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The flower dome is a closure of native flora from different nations. Depending on the time of year different flora is in bloom.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Neat and beautifully maintained garden. Dont miss the bonsai collections nearby. U can see both and exit at the orchard road.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A new defination of the Garden City
REVIEW_BODY: Everywhere one looks at in Singapore, greens and floral won't be too difficult to be seen, but Gardens by the Bay is the mother of Gardens, which even a none green advocate like me would appreciate.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Many good shops are situated in this road. Smoking is prohibited by law. So you can walk anytime carefree.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Astonishing experience of colorful environment ðŸ˜²
REVIEW_BODY: You can spend a whole day in this paradise of colors and green. Itâ€™s not for nothing that they have added this beauty to the world heritage. We warmly recommend to take time to admire this amazing place ðŸ˜²!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Extremely kid and elderly friendly attraction
REVIEW_BODY:
River Safari is a much younger entity under the Singapore Zoo, and it was definitely well-planned with the young and old in mind. We intentionally chose this place to visit because it is almost entirely covered in shade, and extremely easy to navigate. There is just one route and you just follow that route, which will bring you to at least five themes of river e.g. Amazon River (America), Ganges River (India), Yangtze River (China), Mekong River (Vietnam), etc etc etc, The animal exhibits were were curated and well taken care of._x000D_
_x000D_
We even rented two scooters from the front counter, at about sgd20 per scooter for about two hours. The elderly in our family had a great time even though they couldn't walk much. And the little ones enjoyed being in the prams with no bumpy roads, just smooth rides all along. Great family bonding between the very young and old._x000D_
_x000D_
The first highlight was definitely the pandas conservatory, as we were able to literally walk into it, on a bridge hanging in the air above their home on the ground. Tip: they are most active at 9am, during breakfast time. Miss that golden timing and you may not be able to catch them at all!_x000D_
_x000D_
The second highlight were the River Safari boat rides. However, even though the family caught the ride at around 11am, most animals were already hiding and sleeping as it was hot out there. Tough luck. Probably better to come at a not-so-hot timing in Singapore (which is tough too considering Singapore is famous for being hot all year round). Well at least the ride itself was leisurely and enjoyable. Those who are not able to ride the boats (i.e. children below 1 metre) can actually enjoy meeting some animals at the mini stage set up right beside the river boat's ticketing booth. The little ones managed to feed some wombats and pelicans and that was awesome._x000D_
_x000D_
The third highlight, and possibly one of the coolest, was their Amazon River aquarium. How very cool to depict the flooded Amazonian Rivers with its seasonal aquatic animals entering and living in the forest, when it's flooded. You can view the manatees both from the aquarium point of view, as well as from above the aquarium. It's true that it's not a full aquarium like the SEAquarium at Sentosa, but hey, it's pretty good enough considering it's only ONE of the many other interesting spots within this River Safari._x000D_
_x000D_
There ain't many eateries, but several small ones which were good enough:_x000D_
- mama panda cafe right after the panda exhibit, great first point of rest for your tired feet with strong air-conditioning_x000D_
- several "stores" all housed in the big tent at the main entrance/exit to this park. They sell local foods, desserts, western and Italian foods, ice-cream, and of course Chinese foods too. No A/C here._x000D_
- if all else fails, they still have some small cafes and KFC (with A/C)!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great guide, tonnes of information and a real insight into the invasion of Singapore. Would recommend even to those who aren't into history.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely building, fantastic items, great historical detail & a lovely restaurant where we had a tea break during our visit and dinner at the end. Well worthy of your time.
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well, I wasn't sure about visiting here but I'm so glad we did. We were entranced by so many of the beautiful works, most modern, all very well explained in English both on the walls and by the very friendly staff. Loved our visit from start to finish. The roof gardens were peaceful and with great views, the history of the buildings themselves and the court room, holding cells etc in the court building adjoining were fascinating too, don't miss walking over the atrium from one to the other as there's much to learn and enjoy in both buildings.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We also enjoyed the orangutan breakfast and got up up close to 3 Orangs for feeding time. Informative chat from the zookeepers. After spent a few hours strolling around the zoo. Well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If there's one place you should go in Singapore, Gardens by the Bay is it. It's no wonder this spectacular place is featured in the Guinness Book of Records. So many breathtaking sights make the place. What an incredible man-made feat. The Supertree Grove is amazing and we absolutely love the Cloud dome. What made it easy for us was that everywhere was pray friendly and kid friendly. Even a small child will appreciate the wonders it presents.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited as part of city tour. This was the best bit the orchids are amazing, the number and different varieties are outstanding, around every corner you are struck by something new to see.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is not in every country that a place of worship is converted to an eatery. Chijmes is one such. A 132 year old catholic convent and chapel has been restored and upscaled to become a commercial centre of dining and shopping. The place has small boutique eateries and bars that are in sync with the atmosphere and definitely a to do for an evening well spent.
ADDRESS: 30 Victoria Street Chijmes, Singapore 187996, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore's very own famous bird park. This has evolved over the years and is a great visit for kids and the old alike. Lots of interaction with the birds in different ways - feeding, shows etc.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Been to Singapore so many times but it was our first time to go to Arab street. This is a place I'd recommend even for those looking for affordable Singapore souvenirs. It is not as crowded as Chinatown and the good are of the same price or even cheaper! There are also a lot of good restaurants in the area featuring Turkish and mediterranean cuisine. Heard that these restaurants are converted to pubs at night where one can relax and drink with friends. Definitely, a place to add to our must-go places if only for the Turkish food!
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is a nature reserve with surprisingly well defined trails. Interesting blinds and towers to see the wildlife. We spotted lots of lizards, fish, bird, monkeys, and even a crocodile (though from far away)._x000D_
_x000D_
Unlike other trails in Singapore, people there tend to be more interested in nature and act appropriately in the park (no food, littering, or being loud)._x000D_
_x000D_
Go early to avoid the large bus tours._x000D_
_x000D_
There is some sort of shuttle bus that goes to Kranji - $3 roundtrip, but we did not use it.
ADDRESS: 301 Neo Tiew Crescent Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve, Singapore 718925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I bought the ticket online but I chose wrong admission date. When come to the entrance the volunteer help me to settle this issue.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: very nice and Relaxing especially at night when everything is lit up. Can be quite hot during the day
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Still a lot of great shopping - but pretty badly over-developed
REVIEW_BODY: It had been 17 years since I last visited Orchard Road, and it has most certainly changed. Some of the malls are still there (Paragon, Plaza Singapura, etc.), but it's really been overdeveloped, and feels more like an expensive tourist trap. It's still easily accessible via bus and MRT - and makes for a very nice stroll.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I have visited this place before and this time it was not that special. Too many people because of the Chinice New Year- but I still love the buildings and the architechture of this place. Points would be 4/5 if there would been less people...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful well kept gardens. MTR takes you to the North of the gardens so it is a bit of a walk to the orchid gardens and rainforest but well worth it. Even better it is free but you have to pay for the orchid garden but of you are a senior it is only $1. Bargain. A great place to wander to escape the heat and humidity.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Loved the vibrant night seen at Boat Quay
REVIEW_BODY: A short Grab ride from our hotel on Middle Rd, we had dinner along Boat Quay. There are many restaurants to choose from including Italian, Mexican, Singaporean and Western cuisines. There was both indoor and outdoor seating, we chose to sit outdoors as it had cooled off and was quite pleasant outside. We had a view of the Fullerton Hotel in the distance with the river in the foreground.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's our 2nd time in Singapore and we was suggested this place for hiking! The place is beautiful and breathtaking! The hike is a good one, not too challenging. Love the tree top walk especially!
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It cost 25 dollars. I did it during the night. So the weather was nice and the pictures i took amazing. About 1 hour in the river.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A half hour of the highest order!
REVIEW_BODY: We had vouchers for the Singapore Flyer as part of our package, but having done it, we would happily have paid extra for it. Great views of Marina Bay, Gardens by the Bay and the amazing Marina Bay Sands. It's right on the hop on hop off bus route so really easy to get to as well.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very nice place, a lot of history there. Chinese heritage stories and tales, lots of art, statues, water pool with tortillas and kamoto dragons.
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Stunning at night amazing on day !
REVIEW_BODY: Stunning at night amazing on day ! Yes in did, if you like to walk or a photographer addicted than prepare yourself as day is amazing but night is stunning ! Highly recommended once you are in Singapore !
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Highly recommended. Views are amazing and you get an understanding of the geography of Singapore - the boats and tankers waiting to offload at the port, the HDB'S, the Bay etc.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful flowers and plants from around the world
REVIEW_BODY: Personally, this was my favorite part of gardens by the bay, much more than the cloud forest. Your admission ticket does include both though, so definitely see both of them if you have time. The flower dome has plants from all over the world â€“ we saw cacti, succulents, a huge display of tulips from Holland, and so much more. Itâ€™s wonderful to cool off in the air conditioning and take your time to leisurely walk around the paths. We also enjoyed getting a drink from Pollen, the little cafÃ© inside. Donâ€™t miss this while in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We'd heard of Orchard Road before we left home. Allow lots of time to explore everything from up-market shopping to a multi-level indoor market crammed with everything one can imagine.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The flyer continuously rotates at a very slow speed, so you have to hop on while it's moving. Maybe not recommended if you have walking difficulties. All up it takes about 30 minutes. The capsule is very sturdy and feels safe. It has quite a bit of room in the capsule. We hopped on at sunset, unfortunately it was overcast so we didn't see the sun set. We just saw an overcast Singapore as we came up, and nighttime Singapore as we went down. Not sure what a sunny Singapore would look like, but nighttime Singapore looks amazing in the flyer.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really beautiful good balance of pretty foliage and education about ecosystems. Be wary of taking lift to level 6 if you have vertigo but there are different species of flowers and the best are at the top of the waterfall. The windy path was great as you can view all the different types of plants and flowers as you descend to lower levels. The flow of traffic is good allowing many photo opportunities even in peak tourist times.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As a solo traveller, you can give Santosa Island a miss if you are not fond of theme parks. If like me you like a quick bird's eye view of the city you are visiting, a ride on the Singapore Cable Car certainly provides that.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Animals shown in the safari are common like tiger, lion, elephants, jackals, deers, bison, etc. The tram ride takes long waiting time & one has to stand in Q for 30-45 min to get the tram. Live show of animals in an open amphitheatre is worth visiting. Live show may be cancelled if it rains which is unpredictable in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Just to walk inside the lobby and go up to the sky park is amazing, the view up there is amazing, my suggestion is that you go there at sunset, stay and watch the lights take over the city. It's calm, it's peaceful, it's amazing!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: So much more than I expected
REVIEW_BODY: This is an amazing place. I am no gardener and just about manage to keep my house plants alive but Gardens by the Bay thrilled me with the plants, flowers and architecture. Time well spent.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: a real getaway that one forgets it's part of a highly urbanised setting.
REVIEW_BODY: go early before the sun comes up.you'll bump into solitary joggers ,couples walking together and any number of exercise freaks almost daily . great spot to bring children there too.and it's so peaceful and quiet. splendid place.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The views from the cars on this wheel are excellent of the city, Gardens by the Bay, etc. It takes about 30 minutes to make the full circle. The cars are air conditioned so it is comfortable. Easy access from hotels in the area.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely views of singapore and lovely gardens to walk in. Great little swimming area for children too. If it wasn't so hot we would have stayed and relaxed in the gardens for longer. Would definitely return again (when it is less hot!)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If we you have been to the London eye, then this is something similar. Try going in the evening time to enjoy the day light as well as the night lights. I would avoid this if you are short on time.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the best botanical garden I have been. Very educational! Loved the roses garden and the medicinal garden. Easy to walk around eventhough it is a big property. Free entrance is a plus! Fee to be applied for the roses garden.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Awesome Fun for the whole family!
REVIEW_BODY:
We have traveled quite extensively and visited zoo's all over the world. Although in the last twenty years the zoo business has gotten more and more competitive and most zoo's have all spruced up their game, the Singapore Zoo and Night Safari is a shining example of "how it's done right"! It's really a stroll through a tropical garden with fantastic lake views filled with animals that are housed as close as possible to their natural habitat (it's still a zoo though). Great directional signage, fun playgrounds for small children, enough restaurants and small snack outlets to keep peckish little and big customers quite happy!_x000D_
Make sure you note the showtimes and feeding times!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: All the best and expensive brands at one street.
REVIEW_BODY: You can find the world best and expensive and fashionable brands here in abundance. Nothing is cheap here.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Not much of flowers to be seen. I had a better experience of watching so many types of flowers in Darjeeling and this was disappointing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you want to indulge to nature while in the midst of the city, go visit this place. Find exotic plants and flowers. Best place to relax and engage in a friendly conversation (if you're travelling in groups) or with other tourists who relax just like you while you sit and eat in the restaurant, or sit on a bench under the trees. Birds are all around, not really afraid to people. Time is slow in this place. Souvenir and gift shops is also available._x000D_
Note: careful with some snakes, and other animals, or insects the forest is really dense.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I think the Singapore government spends a lot of effort in making it's city look magnificent. This is one of the places. The wood structure as a bridge merges with the city landscape nicely. It connects with the Mount Faber Park and is designed beautifully. It overlook the city and is close to Sentosa and Universal Studios. Although I got off at the wrong stop, there is a bus station at the bottom of the bridge. It is very easy to get to if you have a car. There are parking right next to the bridge._x000D_
There are a lot of shaded sitting area, I think I could spend a whole afternoon pinicing and relaxing here. I see a variety of visitors, including families, couples, students, tourists...It is a place that I would come again to if I come to Singapore again.
ADDRESS: 221 Henderson Road Henderson Building, Singapore 159557, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful gardens and a great place to cool off!
REVIEW_BODY: Makes you feel that you have walked into a tropical paradise. The mountain of plants looks like they have been there forever and the waterfalls complete the picture.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its stunning...a must visit place..so colourful n beautiful...free entry!!even outside food is allowed..
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A big place, give enogh time to see and rest
REVIEW_BODY: After walking around garden by the bay, i was totally exhausted. So it may not be fair to give a review for this garden. But parts of pay gardens(Sï¼„5) was closed & the orchid garden that i was so keen to see was not as impressive as i thought it would be. Wear a hat, sunglasses and sunscreen. There are cafes & benches. Give yourself time to rest a lot.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Average, average and one more average
REVIEW_BODY:
Just would repeat that ad nauseam. Anything remotely related to Gardens by the Bay and would give only that rating. Similar to the cloud forest, only there are different kinds of flowers and pumpkins (am not too sure they were real) here. Some from California, India, China and what not._x000D_
The place is awfully cold, perhaps the air-con is on testosterone. Be sure to carry something warm, especially for children and elderly.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good. place to walk around in the evening Although every area in Singapore itself is worth visiting but yes If not Msrina Bay Sand nothing in Singapore Go and enjoy the evening
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Had a great evening catching the light show and Star Wars run at the Super tree grove._x000D_
Beautiful evening and it was fun seeing the light show accompanied by music from the Star Wars movie._x000D_
Not to crowded, we caught the last slot 9.45pm so pretty quiet.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Part of the Botanical Gardens and worth the 5SGD
REVIEW_BODY: Lovely extra part of the Botanical Gardens focused more on flowers. It's a little bit of a maze but with signs everywhere so so won't get lost if you want to see everything, it's a nice activity. The fountains and Cool House in particular are nice to see.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the best shopping districts in the world - more than a mile of well-known brands plus restaurants and fast-food outlets. No high-end bargains, but it's always fun to look.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Spend the extra for a Singapore Sling flight
REVIEW_BODY: Really enjoyed the flight as it was just me and another couple. Worth the extra money to enjoy a delicious Sling with the views of Marina Bay and surrounds.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth the visit for the light show but the music seems oddly chosen. The light show is iImpressive from the garden but it must be great to see it from the Marina Bay Sands at the top - if you are booked in there it would be free!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to be one with nature
REVIEW_BODY: Be careful with the monkeys, they could easily grab anything from you so make sure to hold on to your belongings. Best time to come here is early morning or late afternoon so the weather is not too hot.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bay might be our newer, more exciting attraction with regards to botany, but the Botanic Gardens remains the OG in Singapore. It might not have air-conditioned amenities galore like Gardens by the Bay, but it promises a great way to spend time with your loved ones, strolling through a sprawling park of different types of plants._x000D_
I used to come to the Botanic Gardens really often as a child, and these visits were always fun and educational for me. During the weekends, you'll see lots of people having picnics in the fields near Symphony Lake - if you're into classical music as well, do keep an ear (ha, pun!) out for events that are held there too._x000D_
I highly recommend bringing water though - it's a park and there are water points for you to drink from, but in Singapore's heat it's always nice to have water on hand. Bring insect repellent, too - it'll come in handy especially since mosquitoes do love our humidity!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The two airconditioned domes and waterpark are great in the day, and the gardens,giant trees with light show, and eateries are fun in the evening.Enterance is about $20 per person._x000D_
For $20 you can sit in a cafe at the top of the giant tree and sip a glass of wine while enjoying the cool breeze and beautiful views._x000D_
You can take the MRT to the gardens, and if you dont want to walk, segways and motorized scooters are available._x000D_
I have visited both domes multiple times and the exhibits in the flowerdome reflect the season and festivals._x000D_
There is a wide variety of eating places, from mcdonalds to an upscale restaurant with great food on top of the giant tree. A cheaper option is to use the rooftop cafe/bar._x000D_
All in all, a must visit when in singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the history of Singapore is very interesting and cover many different cultures and centuries, a visit will give you a better understand of the country
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The premium night safari was a fantastic experience. Our private guide Nur was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. The extra money for the premium safari is definitely worth it!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An attraction not to be missed no matter how many times you have been in Singapore.Always seems to be changing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing experience to walk from tree to tree
REVIEW_BODY: The tree walk, albeit a bit expensive was such a joy. The authorities have done a wonderful job creating and maintaining this green space right in the center of the city. Do not miss the laser show that happens each night at the Supertree Grove. Watch the trees come to life !
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I love tempels like this, I love the smell of the incense, the chants they are singing, .. There was one thing my friends and I thought was strange: that tooth is HUGE!!! :-)))
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Our teenagers had a blast at the science museum. We were here for 4-5 hours my daughter thinks it's one of the best we've been to in our travels. Even the big kids enjoyed it.
ADDRESS: 15 Science Centre Road Singapore Science Centre, Singapore 609081, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Man made mountain with cantilevered bridges.
REVIEW_BODY: Being an architect this building always fascinated me. I visited this Cloud forest dome just to see the building from inside. Without much to expect about ''forest or clouds''. Apparently all the photographs of the place shows cloud formation at topmost level. I was not lucky enough to see or feel that. It's a 5-6 storey Mountain completely Man-Made clad with greens all around and water spouts throwing down the water falls from all the levels. as you enter you witness giant water fall. after you enter inside the mountain you have lifts and escalators to go up, with each level has cantilevered projections to see around the giant glass dome. One may visit this just to see, How far man can create/copy the nature.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Could not believe the total beauty of the flower Dome especially the tulips they are beyond words with their colour
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful place to spend with your best friends!
REVIEW_BODY: It is not the first time that we go to Gardens by the bay and every time that we go, we loved it more and more. I really appreciate that they are putting special events every quarter and worth it to spend an evening walking by yourself, with friends, family and see the many different types of trees and flowers around the world.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice way to spend an hour or two
REVIEW_BODY: Stepped off the Hop-on-hop-off bus at Chinatown. There are several streets with lots of street food outlets and souvenir stalls.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I live in Singapore and so we get a lot of visitors, for most tourist attractions i will send my friends off to enjoy them but not the light show at the Super tree grove. It is awesone the whole area lights up and the sho is changed quite regularly. Also if you are staying at Marina Bay Sands on the Garden side you can watch it from above.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great time at gardens by the bay, flower dome and cloud forest worth going. All air conditioning. Roughly 2 hours for the visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A nice way to chill out
REVIEW_BODY: The gardens by the bay are well worth a visit, and its fairly central so easy to get to by taxi (which are cheap). There are acres of tropical gardens and lakes to wander round and fantastic sculpture as well;and its FREE . If you go into the Eco domes you have to pay but its worth going in. We expected the domes to be warm inside as they contain a lot of tropical trees and plants, but the air con was freezing; so its worth taking a jumper or shawl/ There is a free light show in the main garden at 7.45 each evening which is free and a must see. Just go up the steps where the taxi drop off is and walk up to the huge metal sculpture trees are, and that's were it happens. If you get there early there are several inexpensive eateries at hand where you can get a quick meal. The show lasts about 30 minutes, and then you can walk towards the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and over a small bridge to the hotel. Here get a ticket (you have to pay) and go up by lift to the Observation desk to see the fantastic 360 degree view of Singapore by hight. Then go down into the mall next door and down to ground level.Then go out onto the inner bay shore decking where there is a Free laser and sound show at 9.3 pm and 11.pm. But don't sit near the front or you may get wet!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was by far our best day in Singapore. We spent about 5 hours at the zoo and it was the best. We had breakfast with the orangutans which was awesome, highly recommend it and the food was nice also. We will definitely be back!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not to be missed if ur in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: One of the many attractions in Singapore which cannot missed.... Plz make sure you dont miss the evening light and sound show which hqppens at around 7:45pm
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you've ever visited the Eden Project in UK you'll love this oriental version. It's a real treat for younger and more mature visitors alike._x000D_
The gardens are free to roam with the option of paying to enter the climate controlled areas._x000D_
Lots of eateries and areas to relax and picnic. As will all of Singapore this venue is clean, tidy and well organised. Well worth a visit whether you are on business as we were or on holiday.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: You will go from one huge shopping mall to another huge shopping mall and they don't end
REVIEW_BODY:
People say this is the shopping area and that is definitely true!_x000D_
Huge shopping malls are pretty much built next to each other and you can leave one and enter a second one without even realizing. They have stores for anyone at any budget range. When you are hungry Food Republic and other large food courts are on the top floor or basement of different shopping malls._x000D_
If you are someone who wants to shop then defiantly check Orchard Road out and free up a whole day for this and Shop away!! :3
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We arrived about 9.50 and setting in the Colonial self guided tour (downloaded the pdf). It said 45 mins but we spent 2 hrs wandering around ... it was great. Then we walked on down to the Raffles shopping centre and had lunch at the food court - $21 for 4 lunches!
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: 3 parksin one day is to much,did the river safari just to see pandas and followed up by the evening safari which was really good but was very busy, glad we booked a tour so that we did not have to que for tram ride which is a must do if you do the night safari
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: beautiful especially when lit up at night and if you stay at marina bay sands its easy access well worth a visit
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Botany around the world in one place
REVIEW_BODY:
The entrance tickets are reasonably priced and the place is crowded during the weekends. It is also easily accessible from the carpark if you drive; and if you take Grab it stops smack almost at the entrance where the ticket booths are within sight._x000D_
I chose to go to the flower show and upon entrance was cactuses, from different countries and all types of species that are beautifully planted as well as laid out for aesthetic viewing. There are lots of seats when you are tired from walking. The gardens are well- organized and the varieties of flowers are exhaustive._x000D_
The only comment I have is the toilets are few and far between and it is particularly difficult for the elderly who are not on wheelchairs. You need to pay for rental of wheelchairs.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: My Faber and Sentosa Cable Car Routes
REVIEW_BODY: We bought the round trip on the cable cars. It was a good deal to buy both roteâ€™s and even better price wise to buy through the Klook site. We started at Harbourfront and went up to Mount Faber where we alighted. We walked to the Henderson Bridge and onto the forest walk. Then returned to Mount Faber to continue our journey to Sentosa. It was the middle of the day and rather hot in the cars. The Mt Faber cable cats have fans, but the Sentosa cable cars didnâ€™t, so donâ€™t forget a fan to cool yourself. The views were magnificent!
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic ! A Must if in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
Never seen anything like this anywhere in the world ! So cleverly done and very informative about the world's climate and challenges !_x000D_
Stunning plants and views for every age group. There is a garden even made from Lego ! Two different domes guide you through the different plants and climates of the world brilliantly !_x000D_
Absolutely unmissable !!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This bridge is quite unique in style, it curves across the bay from Marina Bay Sands, it has excellent views for both sides of the bay and is exceptional at night.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to learn about birds
REVIEW_BODY: Very good bird park and very well kept. The trainers have done an excellent work with the birds!! Must go if you are in singapore
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: In my office in Washington DC, I have one lone orchid plant that "had" one lone flower. I was so proud of it.....until I came here. I saw so many different kinds of orchids, different colors, shapes, and all were spectacular. I always though orchids did not like heat, but apparently, they love humid, hot weather as this garden is outdoors. What a great place to visit. Highly recommend it.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited here a couple of times whilst on our stay...Hawker food stalls are plentiful and the food is generally good. Lots of market stalls selling an array of gifts...interesting place. Great atmosphere. Most stalls are shutting down by 10pm
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Not to be missed. Clean well kept must not be missed. Went at night and saw the laser shoe just by the gardens. Beautiful
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Better come early in the morning. U can take the tram with $4 but ticket also can be bought include the tram, its cheaper to buy online, expired dated is more than a month. Don't forget to bring clothes, etc if ur children wanna enjoy wet play in the kidzworld. Free water in nursing room. The animals inside fewer than before. Its worth if go there with children. They enjoy wet play rather than the animals. Long queue for taxi. Prepare more time for waiting if u have other attraction after visiting the zoo. It takes 20-30 minutes to town by taxi. But takes more than 30 minutes queue.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We would probably have stayed longer but we were just so cold and couldnÂ´t wait to get back out to the heat. The experience is amazing, however: the highest indoor waterfall and all. There are not as much informative tables inside as I expected therefore I would recommend getting an audio guide. There is a ton of people so you have to be patient with taking pictures. Definitely worth the money and one of the must dos in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A really nice setting, especially in the evenings when you have a panoramic view of Singapore's nighttime glitter. Lots of good restaurants and cocktail lounges nearby. The Merlion sculpture is fun to see as well. Accessible to several other attractions and close to the MRT (subway).
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Gardens by the Bay is a â€œmust visitâ€ destination in Singapore. There is a night light show (twice a night) that is FREE and is stunning. The light and sound compliment each other and makes the â€œtreesâ€ a delight. Three things to note however. The Gardens are a bit out of the way although you are near the iconic Marina Bay Hotel (the one with the â€œboatâ€ on the roof!), so there is a bit is a hike to get there. The MRT makes a bit of a meal of getting to the nearest station and lastly there is the mass of humanity to deal with. Maybe I am getting old but good manners seems to be sadly lacking. But donâ€™t let that put you off a great FREE (I said that before i think) experience and it will likely pull you back to see the rest of the gardens by day.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Best picture os across the water, from the stage. You c capture all the skycrappers together with the merlion
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Cool architecture meets convenience. Linking the bay with the Marina Bay Sands complex, this cool bridge is hard to resist taking a few photos on and of.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Jerome, our Battle Box guide, was brilliant. This tour was so interesting, Everyone should do it to gain an understanding of a big part of the history of World War Two.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was such a nice place to walk around and learn about the nature. There were a lot of different kinds of fauna and flora from all around the world. We loved the baobap from Africa and the Californian garden which was beautiful to us. There were also many nice spots to take pictures.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lots of colourful buildings. Lots of choices of places to eat. Most are good, but be wary of those who try to lure you in. We found some of the best were at the top of the market. Not trendy but good food cheap.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: With the fading daylight, the trees started to illuminate, changing colors all the time and the music added to this great experience. A completely new kind of happening. Some had brought pillows and laid down to enjoy the event.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We decided to go to the bar for a drink, but wasn't dressed appropriately (we had thongs and shorts on) so we paid the fee to go the the top and look at the view. It was worth it. We went at night and wasn't disappointed. Amazing!!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great structure at the city having Singapore's famous attractions as your background. Cool place with waterfalls fronting the entrance. You will also have a chance to go up and have a good look at the view.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Perfect for a Sunday afternoon relaxing on the lawn, reading a book or just listening to the outdoor opera. Beautiful turtles, swans & other wildlife. Or if feeling energetic, perfect for a morning run!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion is a must visit when in Singapore and is at its best at night. The white lion statues (don't forget the baby one!) are pristine. They are on the Marina Bay and look beautiful surrounded by the tall CBD skyscrapers and hotels._x000D_
Close to the Merlion are lots of bars and restaurants so you can enjoy a drink or dinner in the location.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth visiting if you're in Sing, brilliant views and well worth the money - definite top atrtaction
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The reservoir is a lovely spot when quiet - you may even spot an otter which unfortunately we did not. A number of short walks, plus the longer walks to the treetop walk or even Bukit Timah Nature reserve.
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Love Orchard Road, hundreds of shops in multi story shopping centres.Lots of high fashion shops, Tailors, electrical , jewellery......shopping paradise but found items to be similar price to Australia. ._x000D_
Orchard Road is so clean with beautiful gardens throughout ._x000D_
Singapore is certainly a beautiful city to visit..
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Unbelievable horticultural bounty, and well worth a leisurely wander. Just beautiful and fascinating. Great restaurant (Halia) next door for refreshment if required too.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This dome is full of trees, plants & flowers available round the world. It's amazing how they are able to make them grow in an indoor environment. This dome has so much to see & observe. It's really entertaining & educating for children. One can spend 30-45 minutes here without getting bored. We saw it evening so I will recommend that but I'm sure it will be equally entertaining in day time as well.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bay is such a lovely place! We visited several times over Christmas and it was a sight to see all lit up with Christmas lights. It even snowed!! (Foam snow â˜ºï¸). It was quite surreal in 35 degree heat listening to Michael Buble while it snowed!_x000D_
_x000D_
The super tree grove is amazing and you can take a lift to the top of them and enjoy the skywalk. The views are excellent from up there!_x000D_
_x000D_
The bio domes are also good, especially the cool conservatory which was a welcome break from the heat!_x000D_
_x000D_
If you go to Singapore this is a must! It is candy for the eyes
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its huge with something for everyone. Food outlets such as cafe fast food restaurant for varying budget Trail choices such as aircon domes open space gardens lakes
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Been on this safari twice. Both the times, felt that its not worth the money. Instead I prefer Singapore Zoo in day time.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were disappointed that we couldn't go up on the Skyway because you need to buy the tickets way before the light show as they quickly run out.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its a great location and must watch.. As stores are mostly branded so its very expensive. we also enjoyed the walk
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This place are hectic with tourists! It a free attraction with a nice walk around near the water. Just take your time, when you get a chance to visit then go for it but be ready with it being busy with everyone wanting to take photos of the Lion._x000D_
_x000D_
Remember to wear a hat/ bring an umbrella and wear sunscreen as it is hard to walk on a sunny day.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I would recommend to go at night when the lights are on. We were so lucky because when we got to the top show started. Itâ€™s magical experience. We waited then to watch another show from the bottom, and I have to say I preferred to watch it this way. You can lay down on the ground, listen to music and watch the show. Must do!!!_x000D_
Queues could be ridiculously long, itâ€™s not really worth to wait an hour, since you have spectacular views from the bottom anyway.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nothing much to say but the symbol of Singapore. Take your time out to click photos as the background buildings are very nice. Gets very crowded though.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Hi we had a truly wonderful experience whilst visiting the 'Skypark' on the 56th floor. It was quiet so even better for moving around & taking all those photos. The 360 views are fantastic of Singapore. We enjoyed the open air restaurant still overlooking with fantastic views whilst enjoying spicy fried squid with sauce & local beers. All at a reasonable price. Couldn't think of any where better to have a meal & relax._x000D_
This may not be the highest view that you can get of the city, but sitting atop of such a famous hotel with the double view of the skyscrapers downtown and the boats below is well worth the trip up. Recommended without a doubt.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is definitely must visit Temple, the Buddha statues are awesome, they also have cards to tell you your fortune.It is also very busy here.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: If u can make 1, choose Zoo
REVIEW_BODY: Among the Zoo, Night Safari and River Safari, the Zoo is the best. Singapore Zoo did a good job in this aspect. It is extremely good at arranging and deciding the contact between human and animals, esp with the various kind of monkeys, bats and birds. They will fly over your head among trees. Even in heavy rains, you can have yourself sheltered under some exhibit areas like in huts everywhere. Not just fun for kids but for adults, teens, seniors as well.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Tremendous views over Singapores marina bay and lucky enough to see the grand prix starting grid being set up. We did the Singapore sling ride and had a whole pod to ourselves, do it and you won't be disappointed. A must thing to do as the ride lasts well over 30 minutes. Take note London Eye, this is how it should be done!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is full with all branded items . Prices are bit high but they have a selection which you can not find elsewhere.There is a MRT entrance straight to to a shopping maul. This is the best shoppers attraction in Singapore
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely beautiful! I thoroughly enjoyed walking around and taking pictures. I also went to the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest which were also incredible!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Really great if you are into flowers and plants.
REVIEW_BODY: The experience is great but I am not a green finger. The complex is amazing and would definitely attract plant lovers.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I would recommend to visit gardens in the evening, looks much better. Have to say itâ€™s unique place and a must!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was so cool to get the feeling you are in another world. It was very smart , genius and refreshing Great way to spend your mornings.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best conservatories anywhere
REVIEW_BODY: Modern, very spacious inside, varied. Beautiful species on exhibit; lots of room to wander around. I thought the ethnic art was kind of kitschy ... but a small complaint. Well worth the visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We last visited the gardens in October 2 years ago, when we were blown away._x000D_
This. Is it coincided with a major orchid exhibition and competition._x000D_
The presentation were a step above previous delights. But so were the crowds!_x000D_
Note to self (and others) Sunday is the only day off for many Singaporeans, so locations like the gardens & lucky plaza can be manic!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is very beautiful from outside especially at night! It is like 3-4 large shining flowers. From the inside I found it to be just okay. But would surely recommend this place if you are not short of time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Cost SGD30 or so per person. Definitely worth doing once. Brilliant views of Singapore on a nice day.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: From check in to check out this is a special hotel. Great infinity pool overlooking Singapore at altitude. Great food served at the pool area and drinks.rooms were fabulous ours overlooked the gardens at the bay.Even got a room upgrade as I wanted that view foc.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The main commercial street of Singapore. Malls, shops, accessible by two metro stations, cafes and restaurants. Also some of the perpendicular roads are interesting. Not a cultural walk since you encounter no museums or temples but that of a metropolis that has to offer clothing, electronics, apparels and other capitalistic goods._x000D_
Also lots of businesses and social events are housed in the vicinity. The main strip of interest is about a km in length.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Trekked on foot from our hotel. About a 40 minute walk-in the heat and what a letdown._x000D_
_x000D_
Rundown, grotty and old. Half of the shops were closed. If you are looking for fabric or haberdashery or if you enjoy temples this could be your place. But for me, sorry I couldnâ€™t wait to get out of there.
ADDRESS: Kampong Glam, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was a fun zoo to visit, I'd recommend it if you're in town for a few days. My wife loved the lemma!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Clarke Quay is a myst see if you are going to Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
It was created initially as a group of 1950s chop houses but now it is colourful and cosmopolitan and us a dream to see from a boat during the evening._x000D_
_x000D_
You can walk around the shop front with say and night stopping for a drink or something to eat. There is something for everyone._x000D_
_x000D_
At 8pm you will see the fountain abd light show in the water ..... don't miss it. It's free and is set to music. Put it on your bucket list.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Don't waste your money on Dinner
REVIEW_BODY:
The view is fine, but the food was cafeteria quality. Also. the wine and champagne was extraordinarily over priced. We paid &150.00 for a bottle of Veuve Clicquot which you can buy at Binnys for under $60.00. They did not provide you with napkins for dinner. I had to use pocket tissue._x000D_
Also, to add insult to injury, the rotation was too short for dinner. You were rushed to finish dinner before the rotation was completed. This was by far the worst expensive dinning experience that I have ever had.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We dined here every day during our stay as the food was of a high quality & much cheaper. The area is vibrant & bustling mainly with tourists as opposed to locals, (they are in the stores or behind the counters)! You can grab some bargains if youâ€™re looking for souvenirs, but there is some cheap garbage & donâ€™t be afraid to haggle, great place to visit & lots of options if looking to eat or drink.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The grove show at the night time is amazing. With the light, anthem and stars in the sky. It made me a wonderful night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can find almost anything in Chinatown. From shops selling you the most diverse merchandise to food places, and temples of significance all within the same area. The metro has one stop right there in the middle of Chinatown providing easy access to and from anywhere in Singapore. The place is clean and well organized. A pleasure to stroll bargain hunting.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The staff here are justifiably proud of their "open concept" zoo and the work that is going on to preserve some endangered species like Siberian tiger is to be commended. But, why, then, are two Pumas in a cage that is like something out of the Victorian concept of zoos, in poor contrast to the enclosures for tigers, lions and cheetahs?
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: To reach this neighborhood the nearest station is bugis mart station.It's a colorful neighborhood with beautiful mosque with golden dome. Go to walk around.my advise is to go at daytime because locals look strange the tourists.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best Botanical Gardens I've been to
REVIEW_BODY:
Sure, Kew Gardens and a few other icons of botany are grea, but Singapore does this so well, it's hard to fault. Such a variety of tropical plants and some that are maybe not so tropical. The layout is brilliant and the whole thing so well maintained._x000D_
Orchards are beautiful and the small charge to enter the orchard area is well worthwhile. A great walk for a couple of hours when you're in this lovely city.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a visit and we were lucky as such a warm sunny day. Its quite far to walk around so wear sensible shoes. Orchid garden a must and it's kept so clean and beautiful. A must go to!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The orchid extravaganza was on display and this was just so perfect. Orchids of all colours and varieties, there are also themed areas , like the Australian zone featuring Aussie plants and flowers. A must in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: what an awesome hotel , no matter how much they charge , but do check in in this hotel , to experience the infinity pool , on top floor , mind blowing , u will not come out of the swimming pool , i was there in the pool for 11 hrs , only came out for food , superb view , hotel tariff high , but should not miss to not check in
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We got to see the beautiful gardens on a partly cloudy day with some steady drizzle when we went up top. I would recommend spending the money to walk the bridge for the views. Also, if you arenâ€™t staying at the Marina Bay Sands - find your way to the walkway they have connecting them. There is a wonderful view of the entire garden from there (as seen in my photos)! Itâ€™s lit up at night and we got to see a beautiful light show from our balcony.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This road is the place to go if you want to go shopping as the whole street is filled with shopping malls and stores. Some are cheaper than others but you can pretty much find what you need in one of these stores. Its quite a long street so there are lots of stores to browse. In terms of food, the food courts of each mall are quite standardised in terms of types of fare to be offered and the standards are not bad. Decent places to eat and its very clean (as expected)._x000D_
_x000D_
There are other better places to shop around the world but in Singapore this would be the place to go to.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the Tekka market, upstairs were beautiful garments and downstairs is the food Hawker market. Authentic Indian spicy curries both Veg and non vegetarians. Biryanis were tasty and Very cheap. Try fresh coconuts to cool the spice and chilli. Few nice Indian restaurants on the Main Street Banana leaf, and Komla villas have excellent choice of meals.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: An Oasis in a Busy City
REVIEW_BODY: Really enjoyed our walk around the National Orchid Gardens, at every turn there are photo opportunities and some splendid souvenirs in the shop at the exit. We took a taxis there as we werenâ€™t sure as to how far the nearest MRT was, well worth it.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must see. We came twice. At night and then in the day. Better in the day time. A remarkable experience. I would go again next time in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great display of plants, well put together with a beautiful waterfall and lots of things from caves (don't touch!!!). Was a bit crowded, you have to wait maybe 15 minutes to take elevator to top. Great stop before going to see the light show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: All this contains are overpriced restaurants and bars which are not very good. Anything that can be found here can be found better and cheaper elsewhere. Also it's hard to find a taxi from here. The view of Boat Quay from outside is OK, and if you look carefully you can see a huge black statue of a bird (near to Raffles Place side, by the river). The rear end of this bird is allegedly positioned as an insult from one bank to another. That's quite funny but not worth visiting for.
ADDRESS: 1 Bonham Street Uob Building, Singapore 049782, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Interesting and pretty temple, During a visit a ceremony of praying atarted, with trance singing and playing on drums and other instruments.
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An amazing place to visit with family. Beautiful flowers and different gardens. Go at night it should be so nice.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: China town has many good dining areas and good shopping markets. It is a must to visit whilst in Singapore.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went here during Chinese New Year so it was very packed. Even with all the people it was still beautiful. We went at night so we could see it all lit up and it was amazing! So glad we fit this into our trip!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place to visit but be aware of dirty toilets
REVIEW_BODY: Its a very nice location to visit, I was quite dissappointed by dirty toilets at this location, also food options are very limited especially in a restaurant located near by there are hardly any good food options to choose from, also the service in the restaurant was poor. Over for a touristic place like this basic amenities like public toilets must be kept clean, also better restaurants must be introduced.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens of beauty, green and all flowers. It is the most beautiful place I ever seen arranged and designed by professionals. Awesome place of nature. The place where photographers should visit and enjoy taken thousands of beautiful shots. It is the place where you see roses, flowers and green that make you value its beauty. Don't miss it, thrust me!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The most beautiful building in Singapore. The construction is amazing and the view from top is breathtaking.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An excellent tourist attraction. Well worth a visit. Light and music show twice each evening. A 'must do' if you are ever visiting Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardena by he bay is surreal ! You can spend as much time as you want. There are two incredible domes one that imitates a rain forest and the other the desert. Also the humongous fake trees have a walking bridge whee you can have a fabulous view of the city. Day or night time is perfect to go, to jot, to eat , sightseeing , etc. Put it in the top of musts in Singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to take a walk
REVIEW_BODY:
But you have got to mind the weather and the temperature else you'd be sweaty all day.. but this is a great place to enjoy a walk holding hands or sit down at the banks and have cup of coffee while you indulge in never ending chats with your loved ones.._x000D_
_x000D_
Great place.. must visit.. spend an entire evening..
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you want to buy some souvenirs for your friends, family, or colleagues, you can visit China Town. The price is OK, but I think Bugis Street is cheaper than this place.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A relaxing, very well looked after botanical gardens, situated on the edge of the city. Easy to get to by bus, we took the hop on hop off bus option, with fabulous shop and spectacular orchid collection, well worth the visit
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: What A View to see Singapore Downtown
REVIEW_BODY: If you are in Singapore for the first time, I will head over to Singapore Flyer. It will give you a 360 degrees view of the city. From there, you can plan where you want to go around the city. It is a nice ride and the scenery is beautiful.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Impressive light show to music. There were numerous gardens that were free to wander through. The lighting at dragonfly lake was impressive in the evening. Despite lots of people the queues for the paid attractions were well managed and so not too long. This is a great attraction for those who enjoy flowers and those with children.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is just a river near clarke quay (and another quays). The place of expensive cafes. Go here if you have a lot of money to spend.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Go during the late afternoon so you can stay until the sun sets. Wonderful displays in the Fantasy Flower exhibit with a fun 4D simulation at the end. The light shows are phenomenal as is the high walkway...if you have the head for it. Fantastic backdrops will blow you away. An absolute must even for those not terribly interested in flowers or nature. Spot lizards and birds going about their daily business... and take your time. Easy to spend a day in the area....and pop into Marina Bay Sands Hotel too.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well its far, but its quite good! Do not miss the Bird shows they are quite interesting. Carry your umbrella along as it gets hot during afternoon!
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens by the bay are certainly worth a visit. It's a large spot of green in the middle of a large, buzzing city. Remember to visit one of the city's skybars to take a view of the park from abobe as well.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were there in the evening, to catch the lanterns for the mid autumn festival. It was crowded, but not to the point where you were immovable. The super trees were lit up, complete with dragon fly lanterns. It was like walking into an enchanted forest. Other parts of the garden, such as the ponds, also had various lantern displays. Quite a magical experience really.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This town is one of the cultural variations that only Singapore has. Colour, old buildings from 19 centuries, and different people. There are lots of different aroma too, from their different meat in curry. Must have curry from one of the stalls.. there are taps to wash your hands too. There is a big department store called Mostafa, and you will see all types of food and goods that are popular in Singapore (other than food, stuff is not cheap though, most likely Australian price)
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really enjoyed breakfast with the orangutangs, sea lion and elephant show. Puma and cats cages could have been bigger...new insect house very interesting.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went here to see nice and rare flowers but the Christmas decorations were far too much and took over the experience of the Flower Dome. The Cloud Forest was therefore much better.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The visit to the flower dome was lovely with spectacular gardens representing various regions on Earth. Well worth the visit if you enjoy plants and gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Plenty of choice for drinks, dining, shopping, everything within walking distance and really pleasant for strolls.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is just a piece of heaven, all the flowers, plants, arrangements and so on, you just cannot believe what you encounter. Highly recommended for every one who come in Singapore!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very nice place to visit every time Iâ€™m in SG, the lights at night are amazing. A lot of walking there so wear comfortable shoes!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the city state giant dam constructed to create a huge reservoir for Singapore to collect water from its rivers. It thus transform the water body into bay for water sport activities
ADDRESS: 8 Marina Gardens Drive Marina Barrage, Singapore 018951, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Now is the season of the tulips and it's really beautiful. Photographers will have a good time taking photos here. Anyone would enjoy seeing the different flowers that are so rare and not grown in this part of the world.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Thus was a fascinating place to visit. We even saw people worshipping inside. They have a security guard to ensure respect is shown to Buddha.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the various level of the building represent different height inside a tropical rain forest, the result showing is truly wonderful. can't expect a greenhouse can be so attractive
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Though we were tired and sweaty after walking for four hours, it was more than worth it! A huge, beautifully designed garden(s) full of variety and gorgeous plants and wildlife. We're very glad we had this experience.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Was amazing seeing the waterfall, climbing to the top of the mountain and then making our way down, look out for all the dragons hidden in the gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent Sunday afternoon at the Gardens by the Bay. Toured the Cloud Forest and Flower Garden Conservatories and did the Skywalk. Wonderful place! Canâ€™t recommend it highly enough. Definitely do the Skywalk! Had to wait a bit as it closes when there is absolutely any chance of lightening but it was well worth it!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Garden by the Bay is a must when going to Singapore. Its really enchanting and also amazing. Overall, its excellent experienced.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went on an organised trip with Tour East, well worth it, with an excellent commentry from Woo, giving the full history of Singapore during and since the war.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: After a long day of exploring, relaxing in the man made grass to watch the light show after sunset was such a wonderful feeling!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore
