REVIEW_BODY: I didnâ€™t spend a lot of time here, as it was very hot, but I did visit the Chinese Heritage museum and the Temple of the Buddhaâ€™s tooth, which were both so interesting. There is a large Chinese presence in Singapore and the street are full of the bustle you would expect. There seemed to be some good restaurants, but I am vegan so I ate in the veggie canteen in the basement of the Tooth Temple, which was great fun, as I think I was the only Westerner there. Great food.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went for lunch, loads of restaurants but mostly designed for evening so many were shut as were bars etc, Not designed for lunch really so go back in evening when its buzzing ...
ADDRESS: 1 Bonham Street Uob Building, Singapore 049782, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Excellent museum, they do free guided tours, good idea to get one of these first and explore independently afterwards
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Located in Gardens by the Bay, the Cloud Forest is a nice, albeit rather high priced, attraction. The A/C is most certainly welcome. The views are wonderful. The exhibits as you wend your way down from the top are quite nice. Along with the Flower Dome, the Cloud Garden is a nice way to spend some time in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must see place if you visit Singapore. Very vibrant, some good restaurants and stalls. Good to wander and spend a few hours.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I have visited many China towns in many countries. This one is the small though small. There are many restaurants, handicrafts and clothing shops. Reasonable price.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It gets interesting during the ascend and at the peak. During the descend, may get a bit down-going.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore zoo tickets can be purchased at a mall (sun city?) and buses going to the location is also in the same spot. The zoo was clean and provided maps. On the maps, there are a list of what animals can be fed and on what time which made me watch over not to miss the ones I would really like to get up close. The food for feeding are to be bought. While feeding a photographer will take photos of you which you can access with a card that they will give you. Me and my partner enjoyed feeding the elephants. The zoo is very organized just that the items are pricey.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Go up to the super trees, its an amazing experience. Its like being inside a movie. Amazing views, amazing information, a pleasure to visit!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: For a Quiet Stroll in the evening
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore is a safe place for quiet strolls in the evening. Sometimes people gather for Tai-Chi or meet for fun.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The street for some serious shopping. You can literally go from shopping mall to shopping mall, with just a few steps on the hot streets. Most shopping malls looks very similar to each other with the usual luxury shops and pretty much a Uniqlo in each mall. This is also where the streetwear shops, like Bape and Offwhite are located.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: a wide-ranging zoo where wild beasts are free to roam and we surround them. the place is very wide and crowded, especially when the night. if not bring a vehicle can board a bus that provides.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This old fort has been transformed to a centre for lots of activity. Its great to see the people of Singapore enjoying this place as well as tourists. Great exhibition and talk on Orchids and a display the way development is working.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: All about the look of it, money driven, superficial
REVIEW_BODY: Consumerism gone mad. Expensive, crowded, many of the shops underground beneath Orchard Rd itself, so you have a separate sort of underground city to navigate. You can't just cross Orchard Rd, you have to under it via subway, or above it via overpass. But the best idea is, unless shopping for overpriced goods with the masses in a sterile environment truly lights your flame, go somewhere else. (Although the above review pretty much sums up Singapore for me, so finding a different somewhere else could be a challenge).
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must see in Singapore, the flowers dome and cloud dome are both definitely interesting and well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I took my 82year old mom for a day tour on our stopover to Singapore. It was a typical humid day and I worried that I will struggle to show mom around, she in her slow gait and this wide expanse of beautiful space._x000D_
_x000D_
And I was wrong. As expected a wheelchair was available no-charge just leave an ID and your hotel contact details and off we went. Tired as I was of pushing the wheelchair around, my mom was a happy tourist. It was her very first visit to Singapore and her very first tour destination. Thank you Singapore Tourism board for ensuring lifetime experiences like this happen. â¤ï¸
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely beautiful. Take plenty of water, though and take your time. A credit to Singapore. Pay the extra $5 donation and visit the National Orchid Gardens, worth every cent.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This facility was not open when we were last in Singapore. We came in the evening for a walk around and then came back the next day for the paid gardens. Gorgeous and well maintained. Must have cost a fortune to build and maintain and a pleasant way to avoid exercising the credit card in the shops.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its a very crowded tourist spot. It has easy access, just a 5mins walk from the nearest MRT station. Do use your sunscreen, wear hats / bring an umbrella, its really hot here, there are lots of shops nearby selling drinks and ice cream.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We have visited the Night Safari in March. This is an amazing experience. You should visit it if you like animals. You can have a close look of them. There are two ways to visit the park. You can take the train or walk along the tracks. If you are going with kids, you may need to be careful with the bats. There are some bats flying around. Besides, you can see the tigers, lions, zebra, elephants, etc.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The garden is always changing landscape and you never gets bored or tired visiting again and again. There is so much space to move around and even though it may be crowded, you can still admire the flowers, the plants and take photos without any photo-bomb. The cooling air around the plants is so pleasant.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great free light show at 7:45 and 8:45pm
REVIEW_BODY: We went to the free lightshow..times are 7:45pm and 8:45pm.Only went for approx 15 minutes..but it was fantastic
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Some of the spaces were great but things like the Occupation exhibition felt very superficial. Too little information.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: every store imaginable on this long road full of shopping malls with eateries galore an experence in itself just to walk and expereince the singaporens day to day lives shopping and socialising
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Place to soak up the atmosphere
REVIEW_BODY:
Lots of pubs and restaurant. If you don't mind the price, this is the place to bring out of town guests._x000D_
_x000D_
I was here the morning of the Suprbowl and lots of pubs have big screen inside and outside even though it was 7.30 am._x000D_
_x000D_
I come here at least once a week in the morning, lots of joggers, people sitting around reading the morning newspaper and once a while there will be one or two taking a short nap before work._x000D_
_x000D_
It is connected to Fullerton Hotel, Cavenagh Bridge, Asian Civilization Museum and Elgin Bridge.
ADDRESS: 1 Bonham Street Uob Building, Singapore 049782, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My kids love Zoos. We've visited Singapore Zoo and River Safari 3 yrs ago. We repeated River Safari recently because years ago the river cruises weren't opened yet. I have to say this time around it seems rather boring. No new displays/animals or activities were on at 11am+ when we arrived. The Amazon Quest boat ride was the most enjoyable and that was the peak of our visit. The standard river cruise (bigboat) is super boring (sorry) and I don't see the point of having it at all though the serene view and gentle breeze allows one to relax for a bit. Glad we saw the manatees again as their habitat tank is the most mesmerizing
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singaporeans must love their shopping and food. There are many shopping malls and food places along Orchard Road. We stayed at the Orchard Redenzvous Hotel towards one end of Orchard Road. I love the underground pedestrian walkways (under the big malls)...it made walking several blocks comfortable since they are air-conditioned. just make sure you follow the signs so you know when to "pop" back up to street level. Lots of high end shops all along the Orchard Street area!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: This is a great museum, with some fantastic displays
REVIEW_BODY:
I've been to this museum twice, and I really rate it!! It doesn't look much from the outside, and even the first few rooms you visit are ok, but once past those it really take off._x000D_
It explains the history of Singapore very well over time._x000D_
Make the time to visit!!!
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We had heard how wonderful this place was. We were disappointed. Too much concrete, expensive to enter conservatories. Some nice gardens in the precinct but there is much more to Singapore than this. Have a look but we found it underwhelming and overrated.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I thought this would be a quick trip through this museum - boy was I wrong! I found the exhibits fascinating and a real insight into the Peranakan people. Well worth the time spent there and I will be going back to see what I missed the first time
ADDRESS: 39 Armenian Street Peranakan Museum, Singapore 179941, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Easy to walk around, great for families and the two enclosures are truly wonderful. The skywalk gives you a wonderful view of the harbour and surrounds.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: must seen in Singapore, especially in the evening with the light show. you also should vÄ±sÄ±t bar on top of one of supertrees with fantastic view of marina Sands Bay Hotel.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There are lots of interesting small shops and stalls to explore... lots of food options too. Do come in comfortable walking shoes and stay hydrated as there is quite a bit of outdoor walking.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The riverside Clarke Quay and Boat Quay districts is a buzzy area full of restos and discos where locals and expats intertwine. The live music scene is noteworthy with multitude of disco-bars starting by Clarke Quayâ€™s Crazy Elephant bar and continuing with Cuba Libre CafÃ© & Bar if you like Latin music._x000D_
There is room for sports enthusiasts (Boomarang Bistro & Bar and Heroâ€™s), romantic couples and occasional goers who like rooftop bars
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This has to be my favourite street in Singapore. Always buzzing with people and the malls and the cafes. I love it.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The park is located on floor 56 which provides unobstructed view of the city and the tallest towers. Tourists are allowed only on the deck (pool entry is restricted to Hotel guests). Relaxing. Costs SGD 23.0
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: beautiful garden in d heart of singapore!
REVIEW_BODY: Visited the cloud forest and flower dome, where the orchid show is currently happening til end August. greeted by a nice waterfal, followed by huge array of plants and flowers from different species that lined the whole place. love the skywalk and bridges in particular as the elevated height provides a great view of the whole place. A must go if u have time to spare in Singapore and are interested in the fauna and flora it has to offer.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely way to spend time with children
REVIEW_BODY:
Friendly to family with strollers. If you love birds, a place to go with family especially when you have children. The place is educational for the children. There are penguins, emu, stork, vultures, macaws and many more._x000D_
_x000D_
If you don wan to walk too much, you can also opt for tram ride. There are different shows too, do refer to the brochure, they are worth stopping over to watch and hear the explanation by the park staff._x000D_
_x000D_
With stopping to take pictures and rest stop for the legs, it takes about 2-3 hour slow leisure to complete the visit._x000D_
_x000D_
Do have a good pair of walking shoes and bring water bottle with you to stay hydrated. There is no shelter in most of the exhibits so if you come during a rainy season, you may want to bring an umbrella
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Be prepared to allow four hours for this west of Singapore attraction. Served by buses (connecting to the Nearby MRT) and taxis._x000D_
_x000D_
Greeted on entry by penguins right and left. You can tour clockwise (most people go this way and so does the transport for those who find walking in 30 degrees celcius and 90% humidity)._x000D_
_x000D_
There are many highlights- 3 or four shows. Feeding the birds (penguins and Loris are recommended). Walking inside the huge aviary is a good way to get up close and personal. Check out the characters in pink (flamingos)._x000D_
_x000D_
There is a good variety of food and beverages near the entrance after the shop.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Alvin was a superb story teller and an excellent tour guide. His knowledge and personal experience in Peranakan culture certainly left us wanting more. He welcomed us into his house and showed us his treasures._x000D_
_x000D_
We were on a tour with about 13 people and it was very crowded and hard to see things in the upper room of the house. Alvin allowed us to stay longer to view the items after others had left which we appreciated._x000D_
_x000D_
The tour was just over an hour long and it cost $120 for my 15 year old son and I (for that price we received a small but delicious hot drink and a Peranakan desert/snack). We have been on 7 walking/bus tours during our stay and they cost around SGD20/hour (Jane's Tours, and The Original Singapore Tours) as well as museum all day entrance +tours which also cost about SGD20 (National Singapore Museum) I would have given Alvin 5 stars and recommended this tour to all my friends had it been closer to SGD30. It's a great tour/museum but very expensive for just an hours visit.
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These are vast gardens. We have visited Botanics in many countries, but few have come close. So much to see, it really need two visits to do it justice.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a busy place and pricey. Luckily for me it was straight to Abercombie and then we got out of the hustle and bustle of the place. Great for shopping.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic. We get to see plants from the other side of the world. The environment is cool because it's fully air condition. A cafe and restaurant is within walking distance and food they serve is good.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Less lively and more expensive nowadays
REVIEW_BODY: Less lively and more expensive nowadays. Used to have interesting things to shop and eateries were not so expensive.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A place for all the bird lovers !_x000D_
Beautiful, huge variety of birds including vultures and penguins. Children can also go including the ones on pram. All age groups. But it gets too hot and it demands walking. Although there is tram which has 4 stops and there were kind of vehicles which you could hire ( but not sure about that )_x000D_
There are eating options as well . There is an indian restaurant also. Pizza hut was also seen._x000D_
Best part was the Amphitheater show.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is an absolute must if you are in Singapore. Great gardens with fabulous garden domes....so much to explore. The light show on the super trees is absolutely stunning. Whole city just amasing
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This zoo is truly amazing! There are plenty of different animals, you can see them for close and even participate in some of the feeding sessions. Wear good shoes!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Natural escape in the heart of the city
REVIEW_BODY:
MacRitchie is a lovely place to escape urban life without having to travel far. As soon as you step onto the walking trail, the city seems a world away! There are monkeys and monitor lizards everywhere - wild and beautiful._x000D_
_x000D_
Make sure you bring water as it is incredibly humid in the forest and there is only one place (that I saw) to fill your bottle. Apparently there is a cafe on site but it has never been open when I've visited._x000D_
_x000D_
Also worth noting that once you embark on your walk there are no shortcuts or side exits so you are committed. Where comfortable shoes!
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very good. Different animals. Kids will love this. But for elders better to get wheelchair. It's available on rent.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun to see and good shopping
REVIEW_BODY: I was a little hesitant to visit the Arab section in today's political climate. However the reviews were all very positive so we decided to go. There are many restaurants and nice shops, with Turkish and middle eastern wares. Beautiful lights and glass, carpets, textiles, ceramics. We picked up some nice things to take home. People were very friendly and welcoming. I would definitely recommend an hour or two in this area.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Always enjoy visiting here and the Orchid Garden. Updates taking place to Dell area restricted some access but so easy to get around. be prepared for lots of time and walking.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's very nice place with lots of knowledge. Try to get a visit during spring season... More happening. During summer it's so hot that can't decide should enjoy or should focus on heat
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went expecting to spend a couple of hours here but could happily have been there all day but torrential rain all afternoon made us retreat. Will be our first priority if we go back to Singapore. Mixture of relaxing walking through various habitats and well presented and interesting information boards. The sculptures dotted around were also good.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is consists of two glass domes .. one has a forest inside and the other has a garden.. both are excellent and worth a visit..
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This review is based on the night time light show. People and kids gather around each tree and lie down looking up for the kids light show. Made for young children's. Nothing special.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Scenic night view at the Marina Bay
REVIEW_BODY: Marina Bay is an ideal place to hang out for a relaxing evening stroll for its beautiful and exciting lightings. The atmosphere is wonderful being surrounding by facinating city lighting and the waterfront and spacious walkway for visitors and patrons. It is safe, clean and grand. The place is just wonderful if you are city lovers.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The statue is bright white and very well lighted. This spot is one of the highlights of Singapore and definitely worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best to be there at the time of worship
REVIEW_BODY: To fully experience it, you need to be there when the priests lead a chanting service, together with worshipers from the public. The museum on the 5th floor is also very interesting. There is a free book explaining Buddhism available too.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Having arrived early in Singapore early in the day before our hotel room was ready we left our bags with the concierge and went off to explore the surrounding area._x000D_
_x000D_
Only a short distance from the hotel we came across St. Andrews Cathedral._x000D_
_x000D_
It is a beautifully maintained building that provides a focal point for many who not only visit as tourists but locals who clearly make full use of the Cathedral and all of its facilities._x000D_
_x000D_
Take a look at the stained glass windows and if a sunny day as when we visited look at the patterns projected as the sun shines through._x000D_
_x000D_
The open windows provide a great view across the grounds to the cricket ground just a short distance away from where from time to time you can hear the sound of willow striking the ball._x000D_
_x000D_
The collection of hymn and prayer books is as impressive as any I've see anywhere reflecting the diversity of those who attend._x000D_
_x000D_
The grounds are immaculately kept and well used.
ADDRESS: 11 St. Andrew's Road St. Andrew's Cathedral, Singapore 178959, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A relaxing park for 2-3 hrs walking and sweat out. The surrounding with lots of green and clean. The show are interactive. Bring along swimming suit for kids as the wet & dry playground is a good place for them to beat the heat.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Uplifting and absorbing for any age.
REVIEW_BODY: Probably best to go an hour or so before dark so you have time to wander around the 2 large enclosed gardens then as the night comes and the lights come on it is magical.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Enjoy a walk through these gardens
REVIEW_BODY: We caught the MRT to these gardens and enjoyed the walk through them. Keep an eye out for the wildlife both in the foliage and on the ground. It didn't rain the day we were there but take and umbrella because shelter is limited.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A must to go take photo if you are first time in Singapore. Take with the Merlion and your backdrop will be the iconic Marina Bay Sand Casino.... If evening time, bring a good camera... Sometime you will see beautiful firework or laser show from MBS._x000D_
_x000D_
Lots and lots of pubs and restaurants... Spend your tire day there with your friends. After dinner, go drinking... No need to waste time hop around...
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The bay is very well maintained as a tourist attraction. Lots of boat rides are available from the Merlion statue. Good place to hang out in the evenings and the night. Can catch a glimpse of the laser show if you are lucky.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the perfect place for the Muslim community to visit. It's cultural and there are lots of preserved heritage buildings worth the experience. There are plenty of shops, cafes and restaurants for you to choose from and chill out. It is constantly very busy with both locals and foreigners alike. Just love the vibrancy of the place.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Simply stunning, just a world away from the metropolis of Singapore. We went on a guided tour so with a whole group it was a lot of fun. Visited a Chinese medicine shop, then took a rickshaw ride through the markets and down to the port for a boat ride down the Singapore River, absolutely beautiful a night. We absolutely loved everything about this tour "Chinatown Night Tour" through Viator.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must visit when you are in Singapore. This garden has a fantastic array of orchids display and it has been awarded as an UNESCO heritage site
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I've spend almost three hours in there, without paying to see the dooms._x000D_
It is soooo pretty and amazing to walk around and see plants._x000D_
I'm a big fan of the teaching perspective at the sky trees. Take the elevator up walk around and see the city from another view.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Skywalk was very good. Cloud walk there were massive queues. Lovely place to visit. Only 50 people allowed to walk on the walkway at any one time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Budget for at least 3 days (for a non-shopper like me) to discover & explore the malls @ Orchard road. And yes, there are a couple of tourist spots too on the way including the President's residence.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: For walkers and country lovers,this is a treat
REVIEW_BODY: This is a well constructed route with some metal path ways in the trees and spectacular foot bridges. Great views , of course
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very nice place to visit!! Worth yr money cause you can view the Singapore city from the top. Best to visit during the sunny day! Highly recommended!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The views from the top were absolutely brilliant. Having visited the Gardens By the Bay and looking down on what we had visited earlier in the week gave some great perspective to what we had seen. It tends to be a bit hazy so a day when there is a slight wind blowing would be best for viewing. An experience not to be missed.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place to spend an evening
REVIEW_BODY: We had a couple of beers and a meal. Enjoyed the vibe down by the river. It's a cool, if expensive, place to hang out. We loved the live local young rock band playing on the riverfront. Excellent!
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Zoo is Average. Though there are variety but counts are less. all animals seems very lazy, specially the lions (may be the weather is too hot). Its very painful to see the polar bear in such a hot weather under sun, trying to cool itself heavily. Only exception is Cheetah. they seems very angry and agitated. In my opinion should have been more open for the animals. I guess the river safari is better,
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited as part of a trip to Gardens by the Bay. We were initially unsure whether to pay the domes entrance fees but very glad we did. The emphasis in the Cloud Forest is on what can be done with a mass of plants to truly stunning effect (unlike the Flower Dome which focuses on the variety of different plants). The dome is misty so expect it to be quite cool. Overall it's hard to describe - it is simply a plant wall, but the effect is breathtaking and not to be missed.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: SOmething one shouldnt miss while in SIngapore Zoo
REVIEW_BODY: This is no doubt a lifetime expereince one can experience seeing the animals in night being on tram. Yes it takes you once again inside zoo , but u will find different animals to see in their nocturnal activities. Must visit
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: doable during daytime; night show a must
REVIEW_BODY: The skyway is located at the site of the gardens by the bay! The evening light n sound show is good else daytime a may be doable thing
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Loved the nature walk, right in the middle of the city!
REVIEW_BODY:
We were in Singapore with our 5 yr old so wanted to do a small trek. Started the trail from Venus car park, went all the way to treetop walk. After the treetop, we went to the Jelutong tower and then walked back to the Venus car park area. The total trek was around 8km and we finished it leisurely in around 3 hours. The view from suspended bridge and jelulong tower was worth all the effort. And fresh air was added advantage! Carry enough water and keep the bottle inside your bag. There is a water dispenser/ toilet at the ranger station; which is still a good walk from the venus car park. There are monkeys looking to snatch bottles/ plastic._x000D_
_x000D_
Check out the trails before you plan to do the trek. There are various entry points and some can be long for non-trekkers._x000D_
_x000D_
Venus car park can be reached by bus from Little India. The bus stop is around a km walk from the car park though. We went by taxi to keep ourselves fresh for trek,but came back by bus. Early mornings are better; treetop walk closes by 4:30pm and it can get extremely hot in the afternoon.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Gardens by the Bay is the essential place to visit when in Singapore. My wife and I spent approximately 4 hours during the day going through both domes and walking through the outdoor gardens area. They are magnificent, even if you are not a gardener, you will enjoy how it has all been put together._x000D_
It is also great spectacle to visit the Gardens at night to watch the light show and especially if you have children. It is fee to enter the Gardens to view the light show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My visit to the Jurong Bird Park of Singapore was one of the top highlights of my trip. The park has a wide collection of bird species from around the world and many shows throughout the day that highlight some of the birds. There is a tram, for a small extra fee, which makes loops around the somewhat large park, which is helpful. The most impressive area of the park to me was the waterfall aviary, which is the second-largest walk-in aviary in the world. The "lory loft" is a popular area, which allows an interaction with many lorikeets through feeding (small cups of sugar water can be purchased). The Jurong bird park is delightful and absoloutely one of the best aviary experiences I've ever had. I only had 4 hours in the park and wished I had longer, but I LOVE birds. Other people may be fine with less time. Such a special place!!
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good place to go during the day or night. They had lanterns and shows when we went there. Just looked very festive and lively. So many options for food that would recommend you to go there empty stomach. Veg options too.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Do spend the time to hire the audio guide it makes it very interesting, otherwise all the reading can get tortuous. But it is fascinating and opens your eyes. We came away very saddened!
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Such an epic place to walk around! All the garden is beautiful and the super trees add some modern architecture to the greenery but it all blends in so well._x000D_
_x000D_
Get the MRT to Bayfront and you can walk around for a few hours and get lost in here._x000D_
_x000D_
Go at night to see them lit up which is better I thought!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can't miss this place if you are in Singapore; I would recommend to visit it even if you spend only one day in this beautiful city. The park is amazing and has lots of facilities(toilets, cafe').
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Many famous landmarks of Singapore are here.The shopping is for the rich and famous many of the exclusive designer shops are located here.It is a good place to window shop!_x000D_
There is an excellent choice of restaurants and coffee shops._x000D_
The light show on the bay is fabulous and represents Singapore and its culture.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must visit place. It will never disappoint you once you. Natureâ€™s been preserved, well take care. Salute to those people who works on that place. You can see different species of flowers. Every corner have its own unique spots to stop and take photos. Really love it so much.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Yes this is an air-con environment. On a hot sunny afternoon, this is the place to be._x000D_
Full of history and knowledge, exhibits in this museum are all laid out in the spacious indoors. See, read, learn, and most important of all, enjoy the cool air within the walls of this iconic historical building._x000D_
Bring your children, your friends and family. Make it a meaningful outing.
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This gave us an aerial view of Singapore in about 35 minutes. The commentary was informative. We had a nice experience.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I have traveled extensively and can guarantee this is the best zoo I have ever seen. The animal accommodations are as ideal as possible and met the needs of each specific animal family. The signage is in English and thoroughly explains the habitats of various species. I would love to go again!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: great views of the ship on top of the towers from here great through the day and night , walk along the docks its great walk loads going on
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What they have done here is awesome. This is a must see when visiting Singapore. The way they have created the waterfall and cloud mist is fantastic.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A Saturday evening in August, decided to drive to Botanic Garden with my dog._x000D_
_x000D_
Walked through the 2 ponds, spotted a swan swimming. Passing the orchid santuary, not much flowers in bloom. Huge heliconia hanging downwards. Stopped by the world clock in the heart of the garden, a place where many families gathered to build relationship. Squirrels ran and dashed through the roofs. Lots of trees, ferns, shrubs, flowering and non-flowering plants made up this garden. An the sound of falling dripping water at the main entrance which I always feel that it's a form of water therapy, peacefully calmed the mind._x000D_
_x000D_
Placed my dog in my bag wanted to use the washroom but there was this Chinese old cleaner demanded me to leave her outside before entering. How very rude of him. (Knowing that pet are prohibited in the washroom but I did the needful to place it inside my bag. I supposed this man needs to use some initiative.)_x000D_
_x000D_
The walk in this garden is always great but the service staff can be more helpful and understanding to provide a better experience.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My adult son wanted to visit after viewing a documentary on TV about it. I must say that it was a beautiful place to visit and admire nature and the setup of how its been presented. Plenty of attractions to see which requires a full day at an easy pace. Enjoyed the views at the restaurant with a refreshing drink. A good father son time together.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You must go up here. It is in the 57th floor of the hotel. We went to concierge and we arranged to have lunch at Spago on this floor. I think you have to pay a fee if you are not having lunch up here. The views are amazing. There is an infinity pool up there as well. You can only use it , if you are a guest of the hotel. But a whole park like setting in top of the building all in the shape of a boat.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful animals roaming happily in a well simulated natural habitat. The shows were lovely and well organized especially the elephant show and the water world show. The ride around the zoo with the several stops was also an asset; you can hop off and hop back anytime with the same ticket. The feeding times were a highlight for the kids but some were not punctual. One star off as we couldn't find a prayer room in that massive place. We had to exit to the adjacent River Safari where we were offered the first aid emergency room to pray and were interrupted several times within a period of 4 minutes.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Comfortable walk on a relatively short street with lots of fabric and clothes vendors, more fabric choices here than I saw in NYC in the fabric district, and more exotic as well
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Do not miss this area for a short visit. Great food, many, many small shops selling anything you can imagine. A couple of temples, several hundred years old can be found here as well.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Should not be missed went there as part of 4in1 park hopper plus ticket on a Saturday. Will advise taking the tram and then walking the enclosures. TIP- Get at last stop and walk downhill at last stop and take the tram back from station 3 to the gate. Shows not to be missed.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The bridge was opened in 2010 and links the Marina Centre with the Marina South. Its designed as a series of spirals with canopies made of fritted-glass and perforated steel mesh providing shade for pedestrians. There are four viewing platforms included in the design. Great views. Pass by after dark and it is transformed by the lighting that is incorporated in the structure.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I could have spent millions! Orchard Road is definitely for the wealthy. (Especially if you're a woman). There are things for men if you're fashion conscious. Lovely and clean, modern and Oh So busy! Amy trip you Singapore, this is a must see! Easily accessible
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Went to the zoo with my 3 year old son._x000D_
We had a great day and enjoyed the different animals and the beautiful nature at the zoo._x000D_
The showes were a bit short and did not live up to my expectations._x000D_
At the end of the day we went to the waterplayground to cool of. Our son really loved it, but it became very hot because there were not much shade._x000D_
And expect a very long waiting time in the KFC at the playground. We waited more than 40 minutes, but there was no other option around the playground.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Postcard perfect! Must see of course!
REVIEW_BODY: We started our walk from the end of Marina Blvd toward the Art Science Museum through Shoppe at Marina Bay Sand and around the Helix Bridge to Merlion park. The view is just breathtaking. It has a great level of sophistication, mixture of CBD amazing architectural buildings , great hotels both old and new, shopping, tourist attractions, food court and Museum. It was very hot and not much shades around so be prepare. You have to go there to experience it yourself, photo won't do a justice!
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is so breathtaking beautiful, visiting here is a must. There is so much to see and do in the cloud and flower domes so would advise to spend the day there. Plenty of places to eat and drink all no the way also. The evening light show is not to be missed!! Absolutely stunning!! For a small fee you can go up in the lift to access the flower walkway where you will get some of the best views in Singapore!!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My wife and I both found this attraction very informative. The guide was excellent and the Battlebox itself very interesting. We learnt a lot. My wife actually won the prize for answering the end question. My only comment would be to allow the taking of photographs (without flash). It would add to the memories, and I'm sure when those photographs were shown to friends would encourage them to visit too.NB. We also visited Fort Siloso on Sentosa - also excellent, and were allowed to take non-flash photographs there.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Sacred Kali Ma temple in Little India. Heartbeat of Indian community in Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY:
This is one of the older Indian temples in Little India area. A huge temple complex area consisting of main temple, seperate area for conducting marriage and rituals, dining area etc._x000D_
After having darshan, one can take the free prasad consisting of Kesari Sheera and puliogere rice.
ADDRESS: 141 Serangoon Road, Singapore 218042, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can walk all around the Marina Bay via linked walkways and bridges and it offers some beautiful photography opportunities along the way - which may I add are worth returning for at night as it looks completely different when all lit up.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A really interesting tour, are guide was very informative, if you love history, you will love this....
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A MUST DO - TAKE YOUR CAMERA
REVIEW_BODY: We loved Gardens By the Bay! With limited time in Singapore we visited the domes during an afternoon, and then returned the next evening to enjoy the Christmas light show. The surrounding gardens would be a lovely place to picnic.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really original and beautiful city attraction, worth a walk around especially at dusk so you can get the gardens in light and dark
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We spent a whole day at the marina Bay Area and the garden was one item on our list to visit. It was absolutely beautiful and huge. Very well displayed of various plants from all over the world. We highly recommend the shuttle car from the entry as it is abit of a walk and is not pleasant with Singapore hot and humid weather and we ride on it all day multiple times. Inside the domes are all air conditioned , so it was very pleasant contrast to outside weather. Our kids also had a great time at the children water park which is also free to enter. Overall a highly recommended place to visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a Must Visit Tourist Attraction in Singapore and worth spending at least half an hour to Merilion, Hotels, Shopping etc.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If there is one place I wouldn't mind returning to, it's the botanical gardens. Take a picnic, go early to avoid the humidity. Plenty of shady spots. Orchids garden was a hit. Tons of expansive green spaces for kids to run through.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Not a bad way to view the entire city if you're a tourist. If you fly SIA, you are eligible to receive discounts off the total amount. A bit slow at some points and depending on the cable car glass, you may not get very clear shots of the cityscape through the windows.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very unique old town. We like to stroll around looking at the foods stalls, souvenirs by the street. Every late afternoon you can visit the chinatown food center where they block whole streets and turn it into chairs and tables. Worth visiting.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: In a very hot and sultry day it was difficult to stand in que for almost an hour to just get in. A better and more humane way should be looked into. Most Indian animals seen in almost all Indian zoos are here packaged and shown to credulous tourist. Ruth and creatures of the night show was the only saving grace.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: this is a huge wheel with big cabinswith glass view . it is built in the primearea of singapore from wher we can see the city coastal line and the sea . it is beautifully lighted . best time is dusk .
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Felt like in wonderland seeing the multicolored lights dancing with the music. A real treat for those of us seeing it and hearing the show for the very first time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went on the "Breakfast with the Orang Utans" trip. It was everything we expected. The buffet style breakfast was good. The experience itself was more than expected, to be so close was amazing. We then had free time to see the rest of the Zoo which could be by tram or foot. Some animals were free to roam eg ring tailed lemurs and small monkeys. Would have liked to spent all day there but as we were only in Singapore a few days we had something else booked in the afternoon.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Go into botanic garden for free and be amazed - but remember to give yourself the experience of the orchid garden- even more amazing- just do it.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was probably my favorite place I visited in Singapore! We went on a Friday afternoon around 3:30 / 4pm and it was not very crowded. The path is covered and not very far of a walk to cover the whole place. Definitely pay the fee to ride the Amazon River Quest. Itâ€™s 5 singapore dollars and you can ride as many times as you want. It went by the animals pretty quickly so we rode it twice. The otters and pandas were probably my favorite animals to see. You can walk under the otter exhibit and see them from below.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Must see place . One of the unique restaurant situated at the top of the three building . Must see place
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful piece of nature in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Whether you go at high tide or low tide, there is always something different to see in the wonderful mangrove area. It's quite far from the city center but definitely worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 301 Neo Tiew Crescent Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve, Singapore 718925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: I did not rate it Excellent!!!
REVIEW_BODY:
Note: I clicked in as "good" but the screen automatically jumped to "Excellent".... I couldn't figure out how to redo and rectify my actual rating...._x000D_
Anyway, looking at neighbouring countries, I have to say, although many could be done by local or government authority to make Singapore Chinatown even more distinctive, but overall, quite a fair amount of effort has been sank in....notably by decorating the main street according to Chinese festivals and tradition._x000D_
For Tourists.... if you really have time, spending 2-5 hours walking around the Chinatown streets is not a bad idea. Although not too many of the old-days Singapore street scene found in the Chinatown, still, you may be able to enjoy seeing some of the old architecture, enjoying local Singapore Chinese Hawker or restaurant food, and do a bit of shopping on averagely priced goods. Evening visit is more recommended.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place of culture to visit. Managed to see a part of Singapore I've yet to see. Simply an eye opener
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The large Golden Domeof this Mosque is impressive and draws you to it. We enjoyed viewing the architecture and felt that it's precence really lent importance to the Arab street area.
ADDRESS: 3 Muscat Street Masjid Sultan, Singapore 198833, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A small version of flower dome. Very beautifully decorated with orchids and many flowers._x000D_
Many photographic spots._x000D_
Has a 4D show in the end before exit which showed the gardens by the baton a different perspective of a dragon fly - my kids and we too enjoyed well._x000D_
Make sure you enjoy the floral displays well before you enter 4D show, since after 4D we need to exit the floral fantasy.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is not an African safari but still worthwhile. We booked a private tram and tour guide. This is highly recommended. But whether you go in the larger tram with the pre recorded information or on a private tour with Guide Extraordinaire Zelda, you will see the same animals. You are very close to the animals yet far enough away that you need not be scared. You get to see animals that you wouldnâ€™t ordinarily see at a day time zoo and have the chance of seeing them active. The negative is that this place is a huge tourist attraction and the hordes of people can be overwhelming. Most of the gimmicky parts would work well for little ones. For adults not interested in the trickery, do go on your chosen tour and then escape!!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great and cheap place to eat
REVIEW_BODY: We ended up visiting Chinatown quite a few times as close to our hotel. Always something new to see everytime.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: MacRitchie Reservoir is a great place for the whole family. There are loads of walking paths, a restaurant and possibility to go kayaking. It really doesn't feel like you are in the middle of the city!
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The mall itself is an eyeopener..the escalators are a trip in that they are so high..the views are amazing both sides..loooking at the marinabay sands is awesome and the gardens on the other side are equally stunning recommended this as a must see.views of the city beautiful
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovey place to walk within the city
REVIEW_BODY: A lovely place to walk and see beautiful plants and trees. Plenty of history about. The lighthouse area is interesting to see and imagine what Singapore was before all the development. The bunker is interesting if you like to know more about the war.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I've only been to Gardens by the Bay 3 times and all my 3 visits was just superb. I remember visiting it during the Christmas season and my grandson was so fascinated by the decorations, lights and the whole surroundings.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: An Experience for the Urban Hiker
REVIEW_BODY:
This is an experience for the Urban Hiker (usually the Singaporeans and the 1st world country people). Everything is made comfortable with easy access and lots of amenities (especially toilets with flush)._x000D_
_x000D_
Of course, in a real garden or rainforest or waterfall, we can't expect such conveniences and the climb to the forest is nothing like what you experience here. I am talking about the real hikers and botanist who go great lengths to study them._x000D_
_x000D_
This is probably great for a study tour to get an overview of what the vegetation are around the world. You want details. Go travel and hike and do the real things!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you like walking with some added difference then this is it. Beautiful tree shaded trail. Remember to wear good hiking boots / shoes and carry bottled water to hydrate. Sunny days can get tough. Choose a cloudy / overcast day and hope it does not rain.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are amazing. The Australian garden was of interest to us and to see the variety there and growing inside was amazing. Excellent day out.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I will be honest, I could not ride on it as there were some technical issues today. But the view of this from other attractions is awesome. I am sure once aboard, it would give a nice view of city.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Over rated just plain satay which took ages to arrive
REVIEW_BODY:
We went to stall 7 and 8 as my wife had researched this and itâ€™s meant to be the best. We ordered a set and after 40 minutes it had still not arrived. We then chased it and the lab arrive and then we had to wait and then chase for the chicken and prawns. When they all finally arrived they were disappointing. They are just plain satay not particularly juicy and the sauce was not special either._x000D_
_x000D_
I have had much better satay elsewhere and wonâ€™t be returning.
ADDRESS: Boon Tat St | Lau Pa Sat, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is just in downtown and easy to go there. No entrance fee. It is originally the old Supreme court and now renovated as the National Gallery. So, the building itself already take time to appreciate. The exhibits are attractive and definitely takes time to appreciate one by one. Other than than, must visit its roof to look out the amazing scene around it.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Put walking shoes on because you can walk miles you can easy get lost if you are just wanting to cross the road we spent 2 hours trying to cross the road and came out of an exit 100 meters away on the same side lol lol ........very expensive shops even in the great sale
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are hell bent on shopping, this probably isn't something you'll notice. An old street of colourful and restred houses, some now housing small businesses. Good ohoto stop but I wouldn't go out of the way to get there.
ADDRESS: Off Orchard Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Don't be mislead you can walk down to this Public park it has nice exhibits, but then you have to pay for them, the evening light show is worth watching, and the satay area restaurants near the barrage are fantastic value,
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Skydeck gives you great views of the city. It is a bit expensive especially if you are with more people.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went there and was sooooo bored. It takes a lifetime for it to make one revolution. One can have a meal there but I cannot imagine doing that. The first and only attraction here we did not like/appreciate, but then there was a line so many people obviously do.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was a nice experience but not much animals to see as the sky was too dark.Itâ€™s better to walk than sit inside the tram.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What wonderful imagination the designers of this display exhibited. A very busy but well organised display. They show that anything is possible and one of the highlights of our trip to Singapore in the Gardens by the Bay. You need to allow at least 2 hours to view and some of sculptures inside are amazing. Suggest going mid week when there are fewer crowds and toilets are located on the ground level
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: You better like F1 because this is the highlight of the year Megga Experiance
REVIEW_BODY:
Well our family is F1 fans and I splashed out on air tickets and turn two seats was I disaponted hell No it was probably the best spent money ._x000D_
The track is said to be on par with the big ones and it didn't disappoint as a night race it adds the experience we got to see drivers close ,up we got disappointed hamilton was going to come probably 5th we got exited it went to pot and the race changed or transformed the experience the crowd was electric cheering alive its hard to describe the orange army for vestapen cheering and adding to experience until he crashed . so this is a unmissable item the big wheel was free the entertainment is imense the acts cost a bomb to see are all free , if you get a pit walk take it , sum that up as unforgettable. this is a short one or I write pages because I loved it so much , buy your ticket early research the best seats and you will love it if your budgets small go for walk round access loads good places to stand not busy but dont miss the end track access to podium you need rite gate to get in also the drivers walk in at gate at certain times to get autographs or pictures , so Hello Singapore F1 2018 ,
ADDRESS: Marina Bay Street Circuit, Singapore 038975, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We bought tickets in advance to go up to the skypark at night. View is amazing, especially after the Gardens by the bay is all lit up and all of the other beautiful buildings. You can go to the bar while there, but can't go BACK out on the skypark deck onoce you are in the bar. This does not include any access to the infinity pool either since it is for guests of the hotel. Definitely worth going for the lovely view at night!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Beautiful place worth the admission. Plus when it's hot and muggy outside, what better place to spend your time amongst amazing flora._x000D_
Tip: 1. Cloud forest is a separate charge. You can buy 1 ticket for both._x000D_
2. There is a restaurant inside. Very classy._x000D_
3. Take your time here.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
You have to book a tour of the Battle Box, it is not open for people to wonder round. This is great as the tour was absolutely fascinating. Excellent tour guides and other staff. The command centre has been excellently preserved/recreated. A must for anyone who wants to understand history. which is everyone. And a great tribute to the under resourced garrison.._x000D_
The park is beautiful and calm.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's big and pretty but nothing to write home about. But probably good for families who are on vacation. It's also too hot to walk around for a long time for.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We enjoyed Breakfast with the Orangutans, the food was excellent and a lot to choose from, Turkey Bacon, omeletts, Scrambled Eggs, Sausages, Asian Food and Pastries, nice selectons of juices, Coffee and Tea,The Orangutans were nice to see while they were eating, the mother and baby were so cute. The Zoo it self was nice, lots of animals to see. It is worth buying the tram ride as you can hop on and of were you want all day.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth the early morning wake -up call
REVIEW_BODY: A great place for semi easy walk with uphill , downhill steps and great views. Start at the Marang trail and do a full loop for a good sweat... But stop to take in the panoramic views! Best to start your trail at 7 so that by the time you finish the sun is just heating up... You can stop by at Seah Inn food court for a delicious and refreshing green apple and celery juice. About 10,000 steps and 300+ calories burnt. A great start to a weekend. Enjoy!
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its one of the best things to see in the garden. I havent come across something so grand in any gardens that I have visited till date. Its grand and very well maintained.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We spent all day looking up at the Marina Bay Sands, there was no way we weren't going to go up to the viewing deck._x000D_
_x000D_
What we loved:_x000D_
â€¢ the view of the city was unparalleled, we saw out to the shipping lanes and past then Singaporean border_x000D_
â€¢ a birds eye view of some of the spectacular Singaporean architecture_x000D_
â€¢ helpful directional signage that told you what you were looking at and photographing_x000D_
â€¢ amazing iced coffee, frozen drinks and 15$S frozen Singapore Slings_x000D_
_x000D_
What we didn't love:_x000D_
â€¢ the excruciatingly overpriced fake tourist photos - look, I love the tacky tourist photo more than most... but $90S for two photos that were taken in front of a green screen...?_x000D_
â€¢ nowhere to sit and no shade... Singapore is hot, right? So on a really exposed activity like this you would expect some seating to enjoy your drink or enjoy the view... there is no seating and no shade UNLESS you go to the extremely overpriced bar and restaurant which had a dress code and you need a reservation for_x000D_
â€¢ the ticket says valid till 11pm but... it's one entry only, so we left thinking "we'll come back later tonight to wavy the Super Tree lazer lights..." we got to the gate and we're told "valid for one entry only" this needs to be made clear at ticketing as many places allow repeat entry, and with tickets worded like that...._x000D_
â€¢ NO access to the pools, bar or restaurant. There is no ticket or pass that gets you into the pools - it's for guests only. I get it, but if they had more inclusive entry at a higher rate that had access to a pool and pool bar, I would have done that in a heart beat. The bar and restaurant require a reservation and have a dress code. Tickets to the Skydeck DO NOT get you into them automatically_x000D_
_x000D_
I would still recommend this activity it's just really important to be aware of all the pitfalls.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I spent about 4 hours exploring the two domes and was pleasantly surprised by how interesting and pleasant the experience was. I didn't think looking at flowers would really be that interesting. I really have never seen anything quite like it. I would highly recommend spending a few hours exploring the two domes, particularly right now as the flower conservatory is set up for the Chinese New Year, with a fantastic display.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great location to spend some time. Very nicely laid out garden. Heaps of orchids. Worthwhile the money.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is amazing 20 dollars each to get to the top off sky park, Well worth the trip the views are amazing,and the shopping is amazing.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were blown away by the Gardens, they are just beautiful and the fact that they are free is even more amazing! They are easy to access by MRT, so there's no excuse not to visit on your trip to Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Nice place to locate food . variety of food especially China food getting more and more shop and stall for steamboat mala. Is a crowded place. Chinatown shopping centre nowadays very crowded especially when have event on._x000D_
Old folk likes to gathering in food court and variety of dessert can find at people's park shopping centre . like the place for hunting food .
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It was the only touristy place I visited in Singapore and it was an amazing place. I love the fact that they put AC in the garden due to the boiling wheather, but use green energy (I didn't expect the supertree to be a solar-cell power as well). Ask for the Cloud Forest ticket only ($16), as I heard the Flower Dome was just a big greenhouse (unless you're into that)._x000D_
_x000D_
If you came in the evening to wait for the Supertree light show, expect the long, long queue to exit the place. Leave before the show finishes (I saw a lot of people do this) if you want to go home more conveniently.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful building with excellent history of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The museum is separated into many different zones to showcase different eras of Singapore's fascinating history. A mix of old and modern, it contains many mini-stories that you need to understand before you can appreciate the Singapore that has developed today.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best Part of Gardens By the Bay
REVIEW_BODY:
The Flower Dome is the best part of Gardens by the Bay. Each month they change the middle part to fit a theme from around the world. When we visited we could get to see the Cherry Blossoms and next up were the Tulips. It is nicely air conditioned so you get respite from the heat. Anyone going to Gardens by the Bay should visit the flower dome as that is the main attraction._x000D_
It can get crowded so be patient and take your time before clicking the beauties.Not too much to walk as well so old people and young children in pram too can visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Botanic Gardens have been around for decades and over time there have been new additions to facilities so the facilities are in good condition._x000D_
_x000D_
However the landscaping and maintenance could do with some improvement, and enhancements to its natural beauty could be added. After all, the plants are the reason why we go there!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I always expect to pay to see things but I am not so sure why, when we were there, so many people thought they should head on up for free. It is worth the small entrance fee to walk among the treetops
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great views that shouldn't be missed!
REVIEW_BODY: Go up to the observation deck just before it gets dark so you can enjoy the views in daylight and after dark. Yes it costs $23.00 but when are you going to be 56 floors in the sky in Singapore again!? It's worth it, trust me. I could have sat up there all evening.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This place was worth every cent we paid for and every minute we spent._x000D_
_x000D_
Allow at least three hours to really enjoying your visit and plan you visit to end at the Supertree Grove musical light show at 7:45 pm sharp. There are several restaurants next to the Supertree Grove area code and need to allocate at least 30mns for dinner._x000D_
_x000D_
The best spot for the amazing musical light show is to lie down under the big super tree.so bring a small pillow or soft cloth to comfort your neck. Otherwise you will need to find the way to make yourself comfortable for 15mns. Make sure to secure you spot early as the good space can quickly occupy by other visitors!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I love this place, well maintain, so much greens and peaceful. It's a different side of Singapore, you can hear birds chirping. The atmosphere is soo calming
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I came here briefly. Its was not so expensive and I found my visit to be educational and entertaining
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: High end shopping malls on Orchard road
REVIEW_BODY: Lot of high end shopping malls on Orchard road. In the evening noticed interesting feature on the trees, lot of birds chirping. But very busy road, looked very clean and beautiful.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The atmosphere of that place is great, you can rent a bike, run ou Just walk watching the beautiful of the place. Take a sit on the end of day and relac
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
How we looked forward to visit Gardens by the Bay after seeing photos posted in social media by friends! And we were not disappointed. Such beautiful gardens and attractions in the cosmopolitan hub of Singapore. Heads off to the Singapore government and citizens for their visions and hospitality. The Flower Dome and Cloud Forest are magical. We would like to come back again with our granddaughter when she is a bit older._x000D_
_x000D_
Total 101 hectares of garden and green space all from reclaimed land. Truly an heritage for everyone to enjoy and cherish for years and years to come.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very little animals & the free boat ride was not very interesting. Only the quest ride wasnâ€™t too bad.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: They say you can see both domes in 90 minutes. We spent 90- mins in the Cloud Forest dome alone (which was our favourite). A superb combination of clever architecture, excellent education and amazing plants.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A Tranquil Oasis in the City
REVIEW_BODY: We visited the Singapore Botanic Gardens in January 2016. We were so pleased we took the time to visit the Gardens; they stretch over 2.5km from North to South and contain so many species of beautiful flora and fauna to please every visitor.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The cost to travel up the elevator to the top on the 57th floor seemed a bit steep. However, the entire admission price went towards a full creit on the purchase of food or drinks once you got to the top. Then you are free to enjoy spectacular views of almost all that Singapore has to offer.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The water park itself was very clean and looked brand new._x000D_
The rides were very ok and semi thrilling. I will say the rides are probably not meant for a +200lbs 6ft American._x000D_
The Freefall water slide was probably the only slide i didnâ€™t feel like I was getting slammed on, also for a â€œdropâ€ slide it was very smooth._x000D_
_x000D_
The real downer for my was the no watches on the rides, you canâ€™t even have them in your pocket or hold them on the ride.
ADDRESS: 1 Pasir Ris Close E!Hub@Downtown East, Singapore 519599, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This a must see whilst in Singapore. The variety of birds are great and the walk thru bird aviarys are well done. There is a fabulous water park for young children to swim and play at also.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
By the time we entered the park we were exhausted. Do not do the Singapore Zoo, River Safari and the Night Zoo all in one day._x000D_
We had pre bought tickets but had to wait over 30 minutes to enter the park. The lines to get in were crazy. We went on a week night thinking there would be less people._x000D_
The animal show was worth watching. It was interesting and informative. A great place to take kids._x000D_
We were only centimetres away from a tiger. Only the glass saving is from being eaton. The animals were in natural like settings. It meant that they were happy._x000D_
.The only let down was the food. Eat before going to the Zoo. The Zebra cafe was only selling drinks as the machines had broken down. The lines for the other food vendors were long. It was a good Zoo to visit.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Enjoy the Zoo on the train & on foot
REVIEW_BODY:
The night zoo was lots of fun and a welcome relief from a hot day._x000D_
We got there early so we could do the first train tour because we have a young child. You take a train ride around the park which takes around 45 minutes then you're free to walk around yourself on the walking tracks. I'd recommend doing the walk as well as it's a nice walk and you can stop and observe the animals for as long as you like. We also were lucky enough to come across a couple of zoo keepers and enjoyed asking them lots of questions about the animals. We particularly enjoyed the otters and were offered some pallets from the zoo keeper to feed to them. My son thought this was the highlight as they're funny creatures and very noisy._x000D_
In regards to the trains - what we did notice however is when we saw later trains, around 8pm, there was hardly anyone on them. So if you have older children, or none at all, then I'd say come a little later to avoid the hordes of people and queues._x000D_
We took public transport to get out there which was simple and inexpensive however it will take around 1.5 hours to get there on the train & bus (from Marina Bay Sands). By taxi it takes 30 minutes and costs around $30._x000D_
I noted that another reviewer said a potential problem was that you were committed to the date and time when you bought the tickets. I found that to be true of most online providers except one. VOYAGIN. I bought my tickets on the day from an online reseller called VOYAGIN. The ticket didn't offer a hard date or time. We arrived early just in case we couldn't get into the first train ride but there was no problem at all. The tickets were valide for around 3 months I think and for any of the time slots. I recommend this company as their prices were competitive and as i said, offered a choice of day & time._x000D_
Oh, don't bother trying to take pictures, they generally won't work. The only ones that worked were of the flamingoes. I was using my iPhone._x000D_
All in all a good fun experience and worth the journey to get to it.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The light show is awesome and free with Marina Bay Sands in the background. However from 29/11 it comes alive with additional Xmas lights. Then you need to pay a stall eg$5 cover charge. But it turns into a tropical Xmas markets Singa style. You wonâ€™t find any mulled wine here!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful greenery and a nice walk. The walk is quite easy and looks further on the map than it actually is! Very comfortable trails. Beautiful bridges and boardwalks. Quite far out of the city centre. Donâ€™t expect anything particularly spectacular - just a beautiful, relaxing, scenic walk
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud forest was a great, interesting place to walk through. Be prepared to get a little wet as you walk past the waterfalls.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Have been here many times and am always bowled over by how fabulous they are. Best attraction in Singapore
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Check out the tooth relic of Buddha!
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful temple. Itâ€™s free, except for the top floor where the Buddha Tooth Relic resides surrounded by gold flooring. There are also sarongs to borrow to go inside. In one room, there are over 100 Buddhaâ€™s, all done by individual artists and in different poses.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Views and experience to keep young and old engaged. The views during daylight as well as night time ie dark hours are varied and worth it. Highly recommend to take a to and fro pass to santosa Island.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved the plants and the whole experience. The designers, architects and gardeners who planned and built the domes were incredibly talented. A great experience
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We enjoyed the Singapore Flyer, but it certainly wasn't the highlight of our trip. It provides great views of the Marina Bay area and the surrounding harbor.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore
