REVIEW_BODY: To have a nice view of Singapore this place is an excellent option. The restaurants there offer great cuisine. 57th floor provide a fantastic view.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The place provides a great view of the surrounding Marina bay region. Besides, there is a light and sound show in the evening which is a treat.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was there over the weekend and it was super crowded. Please don't go if you want some quiet moments. However, I loved the whole idea of promoting the green land which Singapore always do! Good to have a look
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to walk and see the beautiful foliage. The separate Orchid garden is nice . Also good eateries
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
River animals big and small,_x000D_
you will not miss any, you will find them all._x000D_
If you are tired, take a boat._x000D_
it is for everyone, young and old._x000D_
The duration is neither long or short_x000D_
but it is of a perfect sort._x000D_
The land trip is definitely wheelchair friendly,_x000D_
so give the workers smiles if you see them and give them plenty._x000D_
The pandas are adorable when they lie about,_x000D_
so make sure you do not leave them out.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice and entertaining for the kids.
REVIEW_BODY:
Went as a family with young children. The kids love seeing the animals and the shows were interesting._x000D_
Only minor setback was the queue time for buying entrance tickets. Took more than 30 minutes._x000D_
A little reminder to all who olan to visit, bring more water as shops are always with long queues and toilets are scarce especially long queues for the ladies washroom._x000D_
Overall, it's fun and educational.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really worth to see Garden city ;) You are expecting to have some green areas but not that much! It was great! Singapore really takes care of the surroundings! Alba
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We went to Singapore with an escorted tour, but we all visited the gardens at least twice ones in the day and once at night as it comes to life of a night. It is a wonderful garden o_x000D_
Through the day and is transformed into a vibrant place at night with two light shows that enhances the gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
You need to allocate at least 2.5 to 3 hours to enjoy this place better. Both the conservatories are great. Would propose to visit around 4pm so that one can see the cloud forest in day light as well as evening with lighting._x000D_
_x000D_
Once you come out of "Marina Bay" metro station, you could walk through the Gardens by the Bay or go in a vehicle (SGD 3 per person) to Conservatories (Cloud Forest and Flower Dome).
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Brunch at Midday at Marina Bay Sands Skypark
REVIEW_BODY: Enjoyed Brunch with family and friends. Clean with an exceptional view of the bay. Food delicious and nicely served. Hospitality staff very courteous.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore Night Safari was one of the highlights of our recent trip here in Singapore. The queue can be very slow as they clear the crowd through which was one of the annoying part. Highlight was the entrance to African Savannah when you approach giraffe, oryx and zebra enclosure. The lake was breathtaking. The tram service is another low point as we waited 40 mins while multiple trams came by without room to pick us up.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Mount Faber is located close to the Vivo City mall and one can take the cable car ride from here to Sentosa island. It is preferable to take a cab to Mount Faber as there is no bus service to the top. The views from atop the peak are good and offer great background for good photos.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak | Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very good views from flyer ,really one must visit this attraction , went for night view , was very nice
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We saw this when we visited the Singapore botanic gardens.If you like Orchids this is the place for you
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent a couple of hours walking around this area in the evening, nice to see the lights also, the views are just great, plenty of photo snaps taken, just have to soak it all in, places to eat/drink near by too
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The East Coast Park stretches along Singaporeâ€™s shores roughly between the centre and the airport. Itâ€™s a very nice and mostly well kept park, but some plastics and litter werenâ€™t cleaned at the time we were in the park._x000D_
ECP offers lots of activities. Among others, one can do biking, walking, camping, barbecueing, swimming, jet-skiing, and of course eating. There are food courts and good restaurants._x000D_
Access by car is easy as there are many car parks. Public transport - weâ€™ll, there is a commuter bus line or one takes a walk to get to the park.
ADDRESS: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road, Singapore 455486, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Paranakan Museum is small but full of fascinating stories and exhibits detailing the beginnings of this old culture - the result of blending one race with another, many times over. Three floors of rooms given over to aspects such as language, weddings and food paint a harmonious and gentle picture.
ADDRESS: 39 Armenian Street Peranakan Museum, Singapore 179941, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Every kind of flower and tree! Wonderful! It's a great place to visit in the afternoon when it is hot! Block out plenty of time, to stroll through. A very peaceful place.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We went here on a slightly rainy afternoon, and it was practically deserted._x000D_
A wonderful green respite from urban Singapore._x000D_
The kids loved it and a particular highlight was the rain forest walk - we saw lot of insects and animals and some of the heritage trees are amazing._x000D_
If we had more time we would have come back with a picnic.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Take the lift to the Skypark at a small fee it is worth the view of Marina Bay, Gardens of the bay and all the lights and skyscrapers of Singapore at night, also an infinity pool at the top.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is probably the best tourist attraction in Singapore. Recommended for all first time visitors to Singapore.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I am less impressed with this dome like I does with the Clouds Forest so next time visit the flower dome first then visit the Cloud Forest before go to the Garden by the Bay. It is all in one ticket and location and accessible by walking. Though I still impressed how the Singapore manage to build such thing in their limited land. The flower dome is best visit when they held and event like the tulip festival or during Christmas. The extra decorate the dome into some fairly land. Most of the plant is a cactus but it still can be the one to visit while in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Have been here several times and always enjoyed it. Had lunch at KFC which is inside the Zoo. Use the shuttle as much as possible because this is a big site. Easy to get to by Taxi or MRT and Bus. Great for kids.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Chinatown in Singapore is the same as any Chinatown in any other city. Plenty of shops, plenty of places for food.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Living in Singapore once in a while I take a walk though Gardens by the bay. Really relaxing place. Easy to reach and close to MBS. Has some food options inside as well. Couple restaurants and a food court.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Many many brave men buried or commemorated here including seventeen of the Rimau commandos (see wiki). Also the alleged Japanese spy Patrick Stanley Vaughan Hernan._x000D_
_x000D_
You can get here on the transit which is short walk up the road. If you go you may want to have a look at the causeway which played such an important part in the battle for Singapore.
ADDRESS: 9 Woodlands Road, Singapore 738656, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We spent a couple of hours at the Cloud Forst when we visited Gardens by the Bay. This is an awesome place if you are into plants. There are two skywalks and it was great to see the plants on top as well. There is a good exhibit at the end explaining the threats on flora and fauna as well. We went on a Saturday afternoon which was quite busy so maybe better to go during the week but it might be so popular that is always busy anyway.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A walk in the reserve is indeed a lesson to see and learn about the wildlife in their natural habitat. There are a no. of trails within the reserve, each showcases the different wildlife. To cover all the trails will take some 3+ hours. There are also hides for watching these wildlife. The paths could be better maintained and improved but the new cemented paths are not ideal as they can be slippery in heavy rains and affect the natural environment. Interesting & a must visit for all!
ADDRESS: 301 Neo Tiew Crescent Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve, Singapore 718925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What an amazing place. Great to come for a walk, and I would recommend to visit both during the day and at night. We didn't pay for any of the attractions but still had a great time wandering around. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Singapore !
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When visiting the Botanic Gardens, for a modest fee, a walk around the Orchid Garden will astound you with the variety and beauty of Singaporeâ€™s national flowers.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fascinating attraction. The guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. Her English was excellent. Well worth the entrance fee.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This road is fantastic!! Reminds me America! Malls everywhere! Can be a shopper's paradise!! Modern and clean!! Balanced, busy enough but not too much traffic!! In fact this is Singapore itself!! :)
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Found Best Of Both World At The Intan!
REVIEW_BODY: A Peranakan Home to live and love & A Peranakan Museum to treasure with pleasure! A unique combination of both world!
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Did not eat in China town but it's brilliant just walking round taking it all in, shops bars fast food stalls it's all there will definitely eat there when we go back, you could spend days there looking around
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Adjacent to Orchard Road near the Centrepoint Shopping Mall... Nice place to see old peranakan houses and to catch a drinks along the way.
ADDRESS: Off Orchard Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was visiting during the Holiday Season and the light display was phenomenal. It turned the Gardens is to a magical place. The views of the Wheel, the water, the trees was breathtaking. Highly recommend doing the tree walk.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wow just wow what an amazing place and when you consider itâ€™s free you canâ€™t beat spending a day in an Oasis with peace and quiet and open space for the kids to run around. This is definitely a must visit place for first timers we spent a whole day there many cafes and restaurants within the Gardens and a special area dedicated to children also free. As for being tourists friendly we got stuck in the Childrenâ€™s garden as it started to rain very heavily we only had one umbrella we took shelter under a small shed very beautiful by the way. There staff members make rounds when it rains to see if anyone needs help a lovely lady came to us with umbrellas and helped us to the main entrance of the childrenâ€™s garden talk about great service.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Marina Bay Sands Park have no comparation with other architectural expresions. It's simple, amazing and beautiful from base to top. A human scale realization that combines refinement, sensibility and awesome scale.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We did the night safari in February 2017 with our young daughter. We booked through a tour company which provided transport to and from our hotel on Sentosa and allowed us to jump the queues._x000D_
_x000D_
The Good. As with all Singapore attractions it's very well packaged and polished. Good food selections, a good vibe and neat and tidy. There's enough to do to keep you interested for an hour or two. You will (may) see some animals within 4 - 5 metres or so. Staff, for the most part, are friendly and helpful._x000D_
_x000D_
The Bad. It's dark. Ok so there are special lights that allow you to see... well kind of... but it's not like seeing animals during sunlight hours at your own pace. Just about every animal on the tour you can see just fine in most other zoos during the day. As with all Tourist traps like this, you are simply a number hearded like cattle through the attractions... and exit past the gift shops. The tram whizzes by every enclosure so that only a glimpse is possible and thus no real time to have a good look._x000D_
_x000D_
It's worth mentioning that the zoo is about 30min in a charter bus or taxi from the city area._x000D_
_x000D_
We saw one male lion and some Elephants at close range, but many others were elusive. You may see some deer, a bear or two, a peek at a tiger, some cattle, hyenas, rhinos, flamingos and the seemingly obligatory zebra / giraffe enclosure. It's rushed, rather dull and... err... dark._x000D_
_x000D_
It's a tourist trap... pure and simple. For those who love animals, or really enjoy the packaged, "off the shelf" type tour may find some value here. I did not. Even my young animal loving daughter thought it was just ok._x000D_
_x000D_
On the whole very disappointing.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
in the midst of Chinatown is the temple which gas free entrance. Neither Mrs Vicar or I are culture vultures but it's very interesting to see the philosophies from other parts of the world._x000D_
_x000D_
There was a service taking place downstairs, very noisy as it was amplified. Photos are allowed everywhere except at the top floor where the gold dragon tooth is kept surrounded by various meditation areas. Visitors must have their shoulders covered and shorts should reach below the knee but large scarfs and sarongs are provided for free at the entrance so this isn't a problem._x000D_
_x000D_
There are a number of rooms and floors, most if the walls are covered in little Buddhas._x000D_
_x000D_
Even if you only spend 10 to 15 minutes there it's well worth it.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really interesting and well set up museum and a lot of interesting artefacts and rich history. Guides will accompany you at certain times and are brilliant.
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The view is spectacular. If you are planning on taking photos visit on a day with a bit of blue sky..
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I really enjoyed a long stroll through the Singapore Gardens by the Bay. Gardens is an understatement, itâ€™s gardens, monuments, unique trees, rein forest under a dome and much more. The artificial flower towers are amazing. I really enjoyed the huge Rain Forest and Flower Dome museums. Not sure if museum is the right word to describe them. The Cloud (rain) forest is a real rain forest under a huge dome. Inside, 6 or more floors high, you enjoy a walk thru a huge variety of rain forest vegetation including amazing flowers, trees, greens and moss. The orchid garden is amazing and orchids and a variety of other unique and beautiful flowers are everywhere. In the flower dome, one can see every type of cactus and baobab tree imaginable and flower and greens gardens from every corner of the world. I really enjoyed the cactus and baobab collections. Never seen anything like this in any botanical garden around the world.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You have to go here if you love the outdoors. most exciting spot in singapore, which is otherwise a pretty safe (leaning on boring) place.
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful but could be scary if you are afraid of heights.
REVIEW_BODY: We were lucky enough to be there when they had the orchid extravaganza this month. Orchids to die for! We went later in the afternoon so that we could do the cloud walk in the daylight. It was very challenging for me as I am very scared of heights and with the large crowds it can be a little uncomfortable making your way through the high paths. In saying that though it was well worth it. Once the sun goes down they do a light show in the tree structures which is amazing. Loved it and would go again.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Go in the late afternoon until night for the light show.
REVIEW_BODY: This place is to visit in the late afternoon when the sun is no longer too high up. Long walking needed make sure to wear your most comfortable footwear. Bring a jacket if you are visiting cloud forest. There is a misting schedule so visit cloud forest during those hours so you wouldn't ask "Where's the clouds in cloud forest?" Great for those who love plants you'll get to see carnivorous plants and educational videos regarding global warming. At 7:30, there's a lights and sounds show in the super tree grove. Bring food and have a picnic while you watch.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Must-see and iconic, but too crowded
REVIEW_BODY:
You should expect a lot of people/other tourists if you plan to see the Merlion. It will also be difficult to queue up for good spots to take photos._x000D_
_x000D_
The restaurants around offer expensive food and drinks. You might as well bring your own snacks if you plan to stay a bit longer to wait for the sunset.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Was a bit underwhelmed with this place
REVIEW_BODY:
Agree with most comments about the souvenirs available here with the night markets, however we thought the food would be amazing. There is plenty of food stalls, it a bit of pressure will be bought to bear by the ladies trying to sell alcohol. Apparently they operate on commission. We had a couple of different dishes which were nice, but not spectacular! The prices we later found out were not that spectacular either!_x000D_
Certainly worth having a look and walk around, but we found a fantastic meal selection at the main shopping area called â€œSuntekâ€. The prices were cheaper and probably better sanitary conditions too!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really enjoyed this beautiful garden. Extra ordinary.. Love everything about it.. the cold temperature inside is a bonus after a sweaty walk outside of the garden . The indoor waterfall is really nice as well as the bridge.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited solo as something to kill time. Ended up staying 3hrs and enjoyed every minute of it. Definitely plan to visit during a "misting" as the view from any angle is honestly breath taking. I'm a trained scientist and personally enjoy all things outdoors and of this nature so needless to say I had a ball. The crowds are kept at bay by only allowing a few tickets to be sold for each time slot. Take your time walking through the layers both inside of the "mountain" and out. The waterfall at the bottom is phenomenal and made for excellent pictures. Plus, from the upper levels, you can see out to the marina on a clear day.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Must see but it is what it is
REVIEW_BODY: In singapore, it a bit of a must see since it is so iconic. However because of this, it is quite overpriced to go up there. I think there is a cheaper way to get up via one of the restaurants/bars but I had no time to research. It is a great view up there, you can sortof see the pool too.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Quote expensive for the short ride, and alright-views
REVIEW_BODY: The views are something you can get in even if you walk down towards sentosa. The Cable car itself is a supposedly a part of the public transport system, and costs 35$ for a single journey!
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really enjoyable visit, we went at night and during the day, easy access and you can walk across from marina bay sands. Domes are ok and the super trees are magnificent at night all lit up, the buggy ride around the park is also good value as it explains about all the different areas
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We just saw this building when we attended the mass at St. Joseph's Cathedral, which is just across the library. I was amazed on how big their national library is. So we agreed to check it out. I think it has 13 floors? We only visited the public library section which is in the basement._x000D_
No need to register or anything. You can read any book in this section. But you have to read it inside the library. I love this section because they have different collection of books, from business, technical, fiction, etc. They have computers if you want to hear or watch media files._x000D_
Love, love this library!
ADDRESS: 100 Victoria Street National Library Building, Singapore 188064, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Itâ€™s one of the only Zoos i have been to where the animals look content. All 3 zooâ€™s are next to each other. Easy to access all of the park. Night Safari is a must see.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place just ooses with beauty everywhere u turn love the view its an extremely beautiful attraction and a must see when in singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Only if you are really interested in wild animals
REVIEW_BODY:
A one of kind zoo, to watch animals in nocturnal environment. The lighting is simulated moon light, so that the nocturnal habits of the animals are unaltered. The number of animals and their variety is good._x000D_
Children can't enjoy much, as it is difficult to spot animals in low lit (moon) light. It takes an extra effort to detect animals. Flash photography is not permitted. Not the place, to get great animal photos or selfies.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A street long showcase of some of the best brands. It's best to know which brands you would like to shop and then visit the stores as there are multiple outlets along the road. Takashimaya, Orchard Central and 313@Somerset are my personal favourites.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Take an umbrella on a sunny day
REVIEW_BODY: This is a big area in which you can get lost. There are no bike riders allows in the gardens, which is a shame as distances stretch out and it seems almost to far to see it all by foot. Used to do Yoga at Eco Lake and we had turtles and chickens crossing our yoga mats at the rare occasion. To my disappointment the air conditioned orchid house is closed as this was the major attraction. You still have to pay $5 the get into the orchid garden though just to be outdoors. There are also restaurants and snackbars for refreshments. Make sure to wear mozzy protective spray and a hat or umbrella as most areas are uncovered.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great attraction which can give some amazing views of the city, however it is a little on the pricier side, which most things in Singapore are. If you are trying to save money, I would say skip it, but if you can afford it, then it's definitely worth it
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is awesome. From plants to carvings to hidden gems if you look closely. Well worth the cost. Suggest taking the trolley shuttle from the end of the MRT exit to the domes as it is quite a walk. Cost was S$3 in Dec '16. Best time to go is around 5pm. Satay by the Bay is very tasty fare but also a fair walk in the heat. All well signposted. The sound & light show in the evening is great.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Very crowded, week before Chinese New Year
REVIEW_BODY: Used to own a shop near Trengganu Street, it is very crowded week before CNY as many Singaporean will visit Chinatown to buy their CNY goodies. Normal time there is shop selling gifts, tailor shop and restaurant etc.Tourist always visit old Chinatown for the conserve building.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing experience well worth the visit. The grounds are fantastic with multiple themed gardens featuring flora from around the world. The cloud greenhouse is even better. Don't leave Singapore without seeing it!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: First visited Orchard Rd in 1982 and didn't return until 2018 .... unrecognisable! A very different place now but absolutely fabulous.. wide vistas allow for a leisurely stroll up and down the strip. Gorgeous tropical gardens and trees canopy over head. We didn't do much shopping due to price point but there is plenty to see and do besides shopping. Designer brand heaven for those who care to dabble... food options abound and the coffee is excellent ... I love it here, it feels safe and is very relaxing.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went during the day to see the trees and the cloud forest and returned at night at 1950 for the light show. It is beautiful. Really busy but easy to get a good shot and video. Only about 15 min long and close to the mrt I loved it! Was magical!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Worth spending time at the National Orchid Garden._x000D_
_x000D_
If you like nature, it is a place that you must visit._x000D_
_x000D_
A beautiful garden within the city and beside National Orchid Garden, there are many restaurants within the Botanic Garden that you can go. Halia Restaurant is one restaurant nearer to National Orchid Garden that can be explored._x000D_
_x000D_
Noting the weather in Singapore, good to visit the garden in early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's an ok excursion but far too expensive for the value. There was three of us and it cost about $120. You are encouraged to purchase the express team at $10 per person. The pre show was done very well.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful gardens and both the domes. Worth a visit.there is entry fees for the attractions. Two domes are there and the flower garden is very nice. The outside garden is huge and good. On a rainy day the outside garden will be difficult to see.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Ideal place for Instagram worthy pics. Families with young kids would reap the maximum out of this museum. Good way to spend an hour or maybe two maximum.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We went to Gardens by the bay as we have never visited it before, as per recommendation we went at 6:30pm when the lights of the trees have been turned on. We had tickets to both the Cloud forest and the Flower Dome but opted to just visit the Flower Dome to make more time for shopping at Marina Bay Sands Shoppes._x000D_
_x000D_
Upon arrival there wasn't much of a line in getting to the flower dome but it was a long walk from the entrance and we had to pay extra to ride the shuttle service. I think it was at 6$SGD per person but it was unlimited._x000D_
_x000D_
when we got to the Flower Dome, I was surprised to feel cold as the dome was airconditioned, a far cry from the warm weather outside the dome (it was summer after all). We were treated to different kinds of flowers and plants from all over the world. It was a bonus to see the cherry blossoms blooming without going to Japan. I think that area was the crowded area as everyone was gushing over it._x000D_
_x000D_
There was also a wedding being held inside the flower dome, they had a function room inside and it was beautiful wedding venue with the view of flowers all around you._x000D_
_x000D_
when youe xit however you'll be taken to the souvenir shop and on the other side of the flower dome. We didn't know how to get back to the shuttle area so we walked back to the mall. which was a long walk. I wish they had clear directions because we paid $6 for the shuttle and didn't like the long walk._x000D_
_x000D_
I think our payment would have been worth it if we had seen the rest of the garden but i realize you're gonna need more than an hour to explore the place so i think I may be coming back to experience it again as a whole.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth visiting the Sky Deck for fantastic views over Singapore. You can only visit one end of the deck as the rest is reserved for visitors to the bar and restaurant and the hotel guests where there is a swimming pool as well!!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Arrived there early as it was springing to life. Celebrations, decorations, food, bargains and fun people all over the place.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Itâ€™s a wonderful view of the city. If youâ€™ve been to other tall towers in other cities, then this one is pretty much the same. The service up and down was fast.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wow I'm not into gardening what so ever but this place is worth a visit. Incredible display of plants and the waterfall is awesome.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I am a plant lover anyway; but this was really impressive. I have heard talk of making it One of the New Wonders of the World. I could support that in reference to the whole package of greenhouses, outer area, supertrees, walkways, and show. I was in amazement of the developers of this attraction. Really worth your time. It is amazing._x000D_
Loved it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If in Singapore and loves to watch greenery and connects to nature then this place is definitely your cup of tea._x000D_
I am overwhelmed with the beauty of this place. The lakes, the orchid garden, the pair of black swans, the waterfall._x000D_
There is do much to admire._x000D_
It is among one of the finest gardens I have ever visited._x000D_
The place consists of cafes and gifts shop._x000D_
Connectivity is easy either by bus or mrt._x000D_
The heritage part is an added bonus to the visitors._x000D_
Conclusion..... beautiful place to spend quality time with kids and family._x000D_
Heaven for natue lovers and fitness freak's.....a must visit place.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Definitely worth doing for the views... I highly recommend it. The cubes are very comfortable and if you do it in the night you can even see the city lit up beautifully.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I do not understand why for Singapore, this is considered as a tourist spot. There is hardly much to "like" about Merlion Park, anyways tourists do come here in hundreds !
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you're in Singapore you must see these gardens to get an idea of the lushness of the tropical vegetation test must once have covered this whole island. The National Orchid garden is here and is classified as a World Heritage site. Walk here early in the morning before it's too hot and see huge mahogany trees, orchids and other spectacular tropical flowers whose perfumes waft through the air.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: a peaceful oasis in the middle of the city
REVIEW_BODY: Fort Canning is like a breath of fresh air after the hustle and bustle of every day life. Located in the middle of the city, this park is like an oasis filled with lush greenery. It is better to come here early in the morning before the heat of the day makes it unbearable, and be sure to wear comfortable foot wear and bring drinking water. There are several historical and educational markers as well, which details the history of Fort Canning and describes some of the plants seen here. This is another side of Singapore and it's worth a visit!
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: You can get equally good views from a rooftop bar, for much less money
REVIEW_BODY: Whilst the views are spectacular on a clear day, for the cost of the ticket, you can get equally good views from the many rooftop bars in Singapore and get to enjoy a drink at the same time. A favourite is Altitude bar at 1 Raffles Place, but you will need to ensure you meet the dress code. No shorts, singlets or thongs/flip flops. Entrance fee covers your first drink, and it is better to get there earlier as it is very crowded later in the evening.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The first time I was in SG I'm with my husband and the next thing comes to my mind was , I will bring here soon my daughter and I did twice and more times after that with other friends and family ant then I really got to bring my Mother._x000D_
_x000D_
Every experience we had here in SG is AMAZING AND BEAUTIFUL because the place is very clean,very eas to go with and awesome transport by a train it's WOW and SG is Very Very Safe to go around night and day and Most of ALL Its free to see this AMAZING GARDEN!! What you want to ask for?? Thank you #SG #SG@5YEAR
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We usually do safari in the morning, but it was one unique experience to see animals in their habitat during the night. According to the guide, all animals were trained to be nocturnal. The guided tours are really worth experiencing. The live shows are also great. Do visit, you wont be disappointed.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: It's like being in the high jungle clouds
REVIEW_BODY: This is the most spectacular greenhouse we have ever visited. Attention to detail is fantastic and the number of species to view at many altitudes is tremendous. The low entry price ($14 pp, I think) is extremely good value - you could easily pass half a day in this facility, being both delighted and educated.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Battle box was visited by my husband and me in fort canning park
REVIEW_BODY: It is place which tells you about the surrender of British army.We were amazed the way the guide explained to us ,her knowledge about the subject was great not a minute during our tour into battle box we felt bored. Well conducted and knowledgeable.Very well kept. Kudos to the people who are maintaining the place.A must visit for locals and tourists.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Quite place in the midst of the chaotic Chinatown area
REVIEW_BODY: Nice place to visit when you are near Chinatown area, try to be there before 6pm, as they close the place.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I bow to the person whose only machination this is. It's a beautiful site and a must visit while in Singapore. There are 2 domes. You should visit at least the one, if you can't visit both.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great attraction. We walked there from the Marina Bay Sands hotel and explored around the "trees" before heading to the Flower Dome followed by the Cloud Forest dome. They are both amazing but definitely do the Flower Dome first because the WOW factor when entering the Cloud dome is memorable. Top tip - go early afternoon (it is hot) & buy the ticket for the sky walk amongst the metal trees first (you can use them later that day & it saves you queing up for the tickets later). Then go to the Flower Dome, then the Cloud dome (they have the misting at 18:00) then do the sky walk at sunset, then find somewhere to sit with a clear view of the central tree & wait until 19:45 for the epic sound & light show !!! There is another show at 20:45.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Oasis in the centre of a metropolis
REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bay is truely satisfying experience and something worth doing when in Singapore._x000D_
This garden oasis is an easy walk from downtown, MRT or buses._x000D_
There is a shutttle that takes you from the main entry point to the main features (S$3) there are a couple of paid entry experiences - the flower dome and the flower walk (S$28) - we took the shuttle, which is unlimited rides (between the pick up point and the cloud dome, but didn't do the other paid attractions ( could see a 100m waterfall inside one ) there is plenty to see outside, magnificently carved massive tree roots, and lots of triba masks and other carved animals, walk for hours in the gardens. In summary - you could spend six hours here, be aware of the weather and you don't have to spent a cent. A must for anyone who has any appreciation of gardens (note this is not the botanical,gardens) and Singapores ability to create the most amazing structures
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Take a lift and be on top of the world, to have a birds eye view of the gardens and these incredible Supertrees. You can only stay up there for 15 minutes so make the most of it. p
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I thoroughly enjoyed this adventure. we arrived in time for a small taste of their buffet breakfast fare before long we were joined by several orangutan's who came in from the trees. photo time was a smooth process and we did not feel at all rushed. the Orangutans were not behind any kind of fence but we were not to initiate contact. If they touched us that was ok. Next time I will be spraying Banana juice on my hair in the hope of getting a cuddle.! LOL. the zoo provides golf buggy like trains around to all of the enclosures so if you are not fit or have an injury you can still experience the animals and their exhibit's. I would go again, be prepared with lots of sun screen & large hats a great day out.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The museum does a good job with the cultural history of Singapore. Don't expect much on natural history. Could be better on the pre-British eras, but definitely worth the time.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: After seeing David Attenborough here at the end of Life on Earth I was determined to come here. Happily they lived up to expectations both in the light and especially at night. Come for the 7.45/8.45 light and music show but perhaps avoid weekends and public holidays as too many people can make it frustrating to move around. We visited during the lunar new year period and really enjoyed the Lion dance too. We visited several times and I would still come back! Easy to get to on MRT.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I think this is best seen in the evening... might be a good idea to go late afternoon and then hang around for the light show in the evening
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautifully constructed and maintained horticultural complex. A lift takes the visitor up to the top and then it is a casual walk down through the tropical forest
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must for first time visitors
REVIEW_BODY: Best you take the smooth elevator towards sunset and stay until after dark. Considering the splendid views and the free entry the slightly higher price for the drinks are a bargain.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent collection of gardens, flowers and lighting
REVIEW_BODY: Its an amazing combination of orchids, plants, waterfalls, vertical gardens, super trees ( tall metal trees with numerous plants and flowers adorning them) - some of them light up beautifully in the night - a must see . Need at least 3-4 hours , a bit more to cover the light and sound show in the night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great way to view the city
REVIEW_BODY: The family took this boat trip as part of a Singapore Airline stopover. We really enjoyed traveling up the river and listening to the commentary. Viewing the city from the river gives a new perspective. Well worth it.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must see in Singapore. Beautiful experience, a trip within a trip. In my opinion much better than the Flowers Garden.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best in the world
REVIEW_BODY: It's always a treat to visit the Singapore Zoo. I appreciate seeing the wide variety of animals in their large-enough and as-close-as-possible-to-their-original-habitat enclosures. I enjoyed the clean and open environs, sheltered walkways, and entertaining and meaningful shows. I enjoyed the zoo so much that I signed up for the "Friend of Wildlife" season pass which enables me unlimited entries to the 4 wildlife parks (including the Zoo, River Safari, Night Safari and Bird Park which are all great to visit)! Highly recommended!!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Brilliant by night and awesome by day
REVIEW_BODY: This is a must experience for any traveller we experienced the light show and the carnival - just delightful
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Been to 1, been to them all!!!
REVIEW_BODY: Chinatown has hundreds of stalls to choose from. Many of them selling the same goods. Negotiation / bartering was limited because if you didn't buy it, someone else would.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: too nice place to visit. great experience, beautiful birds, great place to spend 2 - 3 hours at least.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun place and a must see
REVIEW_BODY: Went here with some friends. It was very neat to see. Not sure itâ€™s worth the money but I would say definitely go at night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: This is a must see if any interest in gardens at all
REVIEW_BODY: I rarely snap photos on my cell phone or digital camera preferring instead to simply enjoy whatever I am doing without the intrusion of the camera. However, I must have taken around 30 or 40 photos of the magnificent arrangements of the plants here. Whomever the gardener/designer is Ta is a master. (The languages here are English, Mandarin and Tamil) The transient portion of the exhibits are less than 100% but still worthy. There is a cafe inside which if you can get a reservation and table is a wonderful spot for afternoon tea in the English tradition.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a place! Nature at it's prettiest, with bot a leaf gone wrong. And that's both the beauty and the strange thing about it. This is a parc where everything is perfectly layed out and organize. Both domes (mist forest and flower) are of a stunning perfection and have cool views of the town and the singapore landscape.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see if you have time while in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is a huge park with tons of trees, shrubs, streams, lot's of bench's to sit on and a wonderful Orchid garden, another must see!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth the effort to see. High above the city. $33 less discounts (check out the fish spa at same location)
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not a gardener but lovely to see
REVIEW_BODY: Im not a gardener or a fan it was lovely to see however if you're on a budget and not a garden fan give it a miss and walk around the free botanical gardens instead including children's free playground with water fountains to play and cool down in.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard has always been vibrant and colorful. It seems the area does not sleep. I particularly liked that this is linked to the MRT, so going around is convenient, away from the warm streets. But is can also be fun and exciting to walk the whole length of ORchard Road especially at night. Lights, sounds and people having fun merge in one delightful experience.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We loved Gardens by the Bay. We were staying at Marina Bay Sands and had a birds eye view of the night time light show. We did pay to go into the domes and they were amazing! We were lucky enough to be walking on the Skywalk when one of the light shows were on which was really special. Just a warning that if you have bought your tickets for the domes on line and they include the skywalk, you still have to go to the ticket office to get a time to go up. We didn't and had to argue our case for this. Luckily we got to go up
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We waited an hour to get in the 8:15 time slot then there was another half hour queue for trams, so we decided to do a walking tour. The animals looked scared and are tied down so they can't move much at all, I felt sorry for them. Big disappointment, wish I knew this before I went!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: WOW!! The light show here is so amazing. This really is a must do. Unbelievably it is absolutely free. One of the wonders of the modern world. Just go - you won't regret it!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went on guided tour from the Marina Mandarin Hotel to the Zoo. This took about 30 mins. The Zoo was quite an experience to see some of the nocturnal animalsas opposed to the daylight viewing. To get the best experience it is best to see both
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was nice place to visit and i was so happy because when i visited the tulip was blossom and it beautiful view ever
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The route covers a distance of 1.65km from Mount Faber to Sentosa Island passing though a high rise building at Harbour Front Station, and takes 15 minutes. The cost is S$29.90 for the return trip but pay S$35.00 and the fee includes the Sentosa Line. Pricey, but not something that you do everyday and you do get some great views. We were lucky to have a gondola to ourselves for each leg so managed to get some great photos without having to worry about other passengers. Staff are very helpful and the rides were an enjoyable experience.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see in Singapore, the orchids are amazing
REVIEW_BODY: I visited the botanic gardens one afternoon. They are quite large and we surely did not see everything! The orchid exhibit is amazing, there is a reasonable fee to see the Orchids, but it is worth every penny.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: After a bumpy organisation through a hotel concierge the staff at the river safari looked after us incredible well to resolve ticketing issues - front counter staff member Balqis was especially helpful! Many thanks.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must visit while in Singapore, so many restaurants, souvenir shoppes, Temples, and clothing, electronic and gold shoppes. Haggling is welcome so feel free to do so, you can get some great deals in any of the above shoppes, a very busy place and a very different contrast to the rest of Singapore, so lively and so many different cultures here. A great place to check out for a day or more, Our favorite place to visit is Little India.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is amazing to go at least once and check out the flowers and please do not miss the light show at the end. It definitely worth it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best wildlife experience you can have in Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY:
I had just one full day available in Singapore and war really keen on getting to see some nature and wildlife. I've read about Sungei Buloh Wetland reserve and asked around how to get there. I was advised it's pretty complicated to get there but it's worth it. It was actually quite easy but it took about an hour to get there from the city center. I used the subway til Kranji station and from there I took a taxi because I didn't want to loose much time waiting for the bus. Coming back I used the bus+subway -so there are public transportation options. Once you get there you can follow several trails with plenty of birdlife: storks, herons&egrets, waders, orioles and a few passerines. I got there at low tide and got to see a huge estuarine crocodile, plenty of mudskippers and lizards but missed the horseshoe crabs. The cicadas were unbelievably loud but very enjoyable!_x000D_
The trails have info panels along them and are nicely marked and even if you are not a passionate birdwatcher you can still enjoy a nice walk in the nature. I stayed there more than 4 hours and only met about 5 other visitors. The staff at the info center at the entry was friendly and helpful.
ADDRESS: 301 Neo Tiew Crescent Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve, Singapore 718925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must see. Great to go at night and see the light show we did the night tour by bus . They picked us up from the hotel and dropped us off again
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It made me see impossibilities as possibilities ,nothing is hard to achieve with the human mind.Singaporeans are very creative , they make use of whtais available no wonder they are ahed in terms of development.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is my son's favorite hangout, the cool air (can be chilling for some, like me, so pls bring along a cardigan or thin windbreaker if you don't like the wind or the water splashing on you) that greet us on e you enter, the water droplets splashing from the men make water fall, it really doesn't matter what's the temperature outside . The Cloud Forest has seven levels and two overhanging bridges that allows you to walk around the outside and have a good look at the all ferns and florals that grew out from the 'cliff'. Beware! The bridges/walkway are see through type so for the faint heart, don't look down..._x000D_
_x000D_
Compare to the flower dorm that exhibit flowers in different seasons and changes their themes, cloud forest doesn't change that much, but for those who love seeing plants/vegetation or even flowers that grow from their 'natural habitat', this is the place to visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good for grown ups not so much for the kids. Best to do outdoors first before it gets too hot, then head to the domes for some air con. Their was a wizard of oz display kids enjoyed as well as the waterfall. Beautifully done, refreshing and serene.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Took a ride on the Singapore Flyer in the late afternoon and have a great view of the city and surrounding areas. A nice way to end a busy day.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We had visited the Botanic a number of times, but we were never on time to visit the NOG. this time we were lucky and got in there!_x000D_
very well laid out, clean and breath takingly beautiful, with extremely nice arrangements and beautifully flowing pathways that take you to the different sections._x000D_
we bought some nice souvenirs from the shop at the entrance._x000D_
_x000D_
I highly recommend this place for relaxation and for plant lovers._x000D_
_x000D_
I had visited the Gardens By The Bay, but this place has more charm. I could visit this place over and over!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Orchard Road of course has all big names in the way of shopping - not everyone can afford to shop in these high end stores. But it does not stop you from doing the inevitable â€˜window shoppingâ€™ excursion!_x000D_
_x000D_
Itâ€™s well worth a wander down one side of Orchard Rd and back up the other._x000D_
_x000D_
Or, grab the MRT at one end and walk back on one side and the next day do the opposite. There are also underground walkways if it gets too warm to walk outside._x000D_
_x000D_
Stop and enjoy one of the delicious ice creams from any of the single person vendors. He is there to put his kids thru school_x000D_
_x000D_
Go downstairs at any of the centers to experience more shopping but also some coolness._x000D_
_x000D_
But December is really the best time of the year where you also get to experience a fabulous Singapore Christmas! So many people if all religions out there enjoying the colours, the lights and the music._x000D_
_x000D_
Get out there and explore!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must if you have children, but just enjoyable for any age. So well planned and the elephant show is a delight. Typical fast food style of dining.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you need a coffee and a light lunch the cafe at the library will do. Nothing to flash and menu not huge but food is reasonless price and quality wise. A great place to people watch.
ADDRESS: 100 Victoria Street National Library Building, Singapore 188064, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: opens from 5 a.m. to 12 midnight every day More than 10,000 species of flora is spread over its 82-hectares areaâ€¦ it is worth the visit with whole familyâ€¦.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Top 10 tourists Attractive Place in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: If this is your first time to visit Singapore, don't miss this place. Nice view and good experience. Let's tryðŸ˜„ðŸ‘ðŸ¼
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
SINGAPORE GRAND PRIX_x000D_
If you like fast cars and Formula 1, then a trip to see the Singapore Grand Prix is what you need to do. Great food and local culture, mixed with the fast pace and glitz of Grand Prix racing weekend. I got a ticket that gave me free entry to the Singapore Fyer, a huge ferris wheel located above the race track. I was able to spend the days sightseeing Singapore, and afternoons and evenings taking in the thrills and spills of the races. I managed to get up and close with Fernando Alonso, and had trackside location at the end of the start finish straight which was an amazing experience.
ADDRESS: Marina Bay Street Circuit, Singapore 038975, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I love the history of the war so set out and had a pleasant walk to the destination. It is set amongst lovely grounds. I was disappointed to be told it would take 1 1/2 to 2 hours for the tour. I hadn't left enough time as I wasn't aware I had to book a tour.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If I were strapped for time and had to pick between the Cloud dome and the Flower one, I think the cloud dome was my favourite._x000D_
_x000D_
Make sure you find out when the mist timings are and try to be there when it happens. Its absolutely worth it._x000D_
_x000D_
Can get a little chilly. If you have a low tolerance for the cold carry a thin jacket with you._x000D_
_x000D_
The way the entire thing is arranged is like a mini history/botany lesson on plants, and is absolutely beautiful. Make sure you go all the way to the top and take your time coming down.The view inside and outside the dome makes it worth it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Cloud forest is a vital part of the whole Gardens by the bay complex. It is so in usual because you take the elevator which brings you up quite high in the sky, get a breathtaking views of Singapore, and then go down surrounded by amasing plants... Unforgettable, a must see if you are lucky enough to visit Singapore...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the evening light show was synchronized with beautiful music, it is worth the visit that's for sure.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place was buzzing with people and activity over Chinese New Year. Feels a very safe place to be as zero crime. Very colourful and fun, especially in the evening.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lots of colour and stupendous food
REVIEW_BODY: Chinatown deserves at least a day, if done properly. Start with the excellent Chinatown Heritage Centre - at least two hours - and then have a snack somewhere before heading for the Buddha Tooth Museum. Many people simply slide through the bottom and out the other side because the way to the upper floors is not especially well signposted. It is worth the climb but expect to be told to wear complimentary sarong and shawl if legs are exposed(shorts) or shoulders bare. Check out the many health stores for good remedies and maybe look at the better souvenir shops. These, I hasten to add, are not the stall down the same street at the Heritage Museum. Those stalls are full of cheap tat you'd get home and wonder what overcame you. The Hindu temple is also worth a visit as is the old mosque. Check out down side alleys for some amazing historical murals. After dark, there are some good bars and the place is very lively. Good transport connections with its own MRT station.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the bay is an incredible place. The structure is amazing! A lot of different environments, with huge variety of flowers, plants and beautys. This is a really beautiful place. There are some jokes in the gardens too.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A massive Bay Area oozing in opulence - a playground for the rich as well as the mere mortals like me! Like a bigger Monaco or Hong Kong but with more of a modern feel and spotlessly clean and safe even late at night._x000D_
_x000D_
The mega shopping centre is one of the grandest I have ever seen and although it has a lot of shops for those who have fat wallets it does have stores we are all familiar with plus an abundance of restaurants and cafes for all tastes and budgets. It is also a great place to escape the heat for a while too._x000D_
_x000D_
Outside you can walk all the way around the bay and pass by some jaw dropping hotels that are definitely for those on a few dollars more than me! Gorgeous and stunning doesnâ€™t do them justice. The Marina Bay Sands is a spectacle but the Fullerton around the other side looks breathtaking too. Checkout the lobby. Wow!_x000D_
_x000D_
The business sector skyline looks great at night alongside the Sands hotel and the whole area is a place where you can take so many pictures - night or day. The bay also has museums, boat trips and the light and water shows add to the atmosphere. Add the F1 event and the buzz is off the scale._x000D_
_x000D_
A great area to wander about, people watch, eat, drink, take 100s of the same pictures, keep fit and suck in the views!
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These gardens are magical. If you love orchids, you will be amazed. There is a great variety of plants in every imaginable colour. The gardens are immaculate as you would expect in Singapore! Entry fee is $5.00 which seems excellent value.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the highlights of our trip to Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: We did a tour through Buffalo Tours and glad we did as we got priority seating on the trams instead of having to line up with the public. Fantastic experience sitting in the tram with animals walking beside the road. We had a buffet dinner at one of the eateries and it was lovely food. We went walking along the trails after the tram ride instead of going to one of the live animal shows and that was really good to get up close with the animals.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The Domes Are Amazing (If Into Plants)
REVIEW_BODY: If you are a keen gardener or just into plants, the two domes are horticultural nirvana! We spent over an hour in each, looking at all the plants and enjoying the spectacle. Definitely worth the admission price if into such things. However, if not, while they are great to see, you may feel it is overpriced.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: best race and city to watch race
REVIEW_BODY: still cant believe that a city like singapore can shut down major areas and roads and hold the best race of the year,its a credit to organisers and the people of singapore,we always go for the 3 day pass in zone 4,plenty of things to see,do,eat,drink,some great spots to view race,went to first one in 08 and things have just got bigger and better every year,hope this race stays forever.SINGAPORE F1 IS A++++++++++++ ,we thank you for always putting on the best event on the F1 calander.
ADDRESS: Marina Bay Street Circuit, Singapore 038975, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
So we went there as Singapore trip is not complete without it .. but trust me it can be.._x000D_
_x000D_
It was so crowded there was no space and as seen everywhere in Singapore there was no planning or crowd management. They were giving tickets to any number of people creating a fish market and as per review and research it's the case most of times._x000D_
_x000D_
Would suggest to book a table at CAfe la ve, you don't have to take the entry ticket of 32 SGD and can actually eat/drink something for that money._x000D_
_x000D_
Also such a waste of paper with printing everyone's pic and trying to sell it with no luck, obviously MBS will throw all the pics which were not sold. Again a very bad practice seen all over singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
Really bad practice from a country/orgs preaching so much about environment at every step.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A place that you shouldn't miss if you visit Singapore. Went there around late noon, just the right time for visiting both flower dome and cloud forest as it's still slightly hot out there. Came out from there and go around the supertree grove for a superb night view.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing piece of engineering. Free water and light show at night. Roof deck scene is amazing - bars, clubs, infinity pool and good food. Certainly a must see in Singapore
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a place of imagination. How LKY translated Singapore from a swamp to this is truely remarkable. The light show at nights is very impressive also
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The battle box, an underground facility used by the British during WW2 has been upgraded and is visited as part of a guided tour. Well worth doing! Can be accessed from Dohby Ghaut MRT. A short walk up the hill to Fort Canning. Singapore has a history and this is one location you can get an insight to it. Our guide, Shaun was knowledgeable and informative and answer all our questions Unfortunately no photos are allowed inside the Battle Box. Combine this with a walk around Fort Canning for an interesting couple of hours
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good to kill time, nice views but not really worth doing. Might be best to visit at night time...during the day it's a little boring.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Diverse garden with something for everyone
REVIEW_BODY: If you love to walk, this is a great place especially the forest walk ... lots of trees and shade. The path is well maintained and easy to walk. There are also open areas for picnics and nice restaurants for dining with nature. Great way to spend a morning.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely nature walk in thetree canopy
REVIEW_BODY: We picked up the walk by clibming the stairs opposite the Hort Park and then we zig-zagged in the tree canopy towards the Henderson Wave bridge and up to the peak. A really lovely walk with kids and dog - enjoyed by all. Definitely recommend but go early so as to avoid the heat at midday.
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Takes you back in time to early Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: It was certainly worth the visit. This â€˜museumâ€™ takes you back in time of the early Chinatown settlers with the three level shophouse being restored. In it, you will get a sense of what it was like living there back in the 50s. To my surprise the building used to house many families (including a family of 8 in a small cubicle-type or partitioned room. You will also see furnishings and artifacts from the era .... the abacus, charcoal type iron, sewing machines ... the entrance fee is S$15 for adults and S$11 for children. There are guided tours, or you can just wonder on your own. After all, the tickets do come with an audio device with earphones. Took my 10 year old boy there and he enjoyed it. There is also wheelchair access.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Have visited the gardens on a previous visit which to me were mind blowing.This year we returned in the evening to see the light and music show which was Highlight for me. quality of the music was excellent and the atmosphere was electric,not to be missed
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful Place that you can take more and more picture
REVIEW_BODY: Many views that you can take many and many picture from this place, Merlion is the best one that you must not miss to rake the photo with because of it's the landmark of Singapore and everyone must come to this place for take the photo, just recommend to visit during 5 - 7 pm then you will received the best view!
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was a return visit after a few years. The gardens have grown and look lush and inviting. The Flower Dome again was themed - Orchids. Crowds and lines are now an inevitable result of the gardens success and peak as the cool of the late afternoon and evening. No visitor to Singapore should miss this iconic attraction.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I visited this place while the Tulip Mania was on. Amazing collection of tulips on display along with miniature gardens from each continent. Felt like bliss to be walking among the beautiful flowers. It takes around 3-4 hours to explore the complete dome at a leisurely place. Plenty of photo-ops here. They have free guided tours. Do take advantage of them to know more about the flowers and how they are cultivated. Best time to visit is early in the morning as crowds swell towards the afternoon.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must see visit. The orchids are just beautiful and so very well presented, for all to see ! Cost is only $5SGD to visit and excellent gift shop.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The garden is very nice but the light show by the Supertree Grove is a must. There is no admittance fee and it's not too far from the city center. There is MRT station very close by so transport is not a problem. Be sure to check their homepage for the timing of the light show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Brought the kids here. A beautifully designed zoo with many open areas where the (non threatening) animals are free roaming. The predators are also really close, with just a small moat as seperation. I assume the zookeepers have done their research_x000D_
_x000D_
We booked a Discoverer private tour that took us "behind the scenes". Got to have creepy crawlies on our hands, feed monkeys outside feeding times, feed angler fish etc. The guide was really chatty, which was good_x000D_
_x000D_
Nice day out
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This was my third visit since the Gardens have opened and every time i visit, the flower done is different. My first visit was near Easter and the flower dome was filled with Easter bunnies and Easter eggs. This time the theme was the garden festival with a Pernakan architecture feel with masses of orchids in every possible colour._x000D_
_x000D_
The domes are both attractions on the Singapore Explorer Pass. on 2 occasions I have walked across the lobby of the MBS Hotel and roadway to enter the gardens. It is well signposted._x000D_
_x000D_
The plants in the Cloud Dome have grown and were more colourful than I previously have seen. Walking down from the waterfall provides great photo opportunities both inside and outside._x000D_
_x000D_
On previous visits, there has been little train to take you around the rest of the Gardens to see the sculptures. I always liked this. Perhaps it was not operating due to the Garden Festival? We did catch the train from the MBS walkway to the dome area._x000D_
_x000D_
The trees have certainly grown from its inception- you could see this very clearly from the Singapore Flyer and the MBS Skyparks._x000D_
_x000D_
Always worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a highly recommended experience. Several different areas to visit. Don't rush it as there is a lot to see and will take several hours.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A very popular attraction for Asian visitors to Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is selfie stick central! Very crowded on the sunny morning we visited - not so crowded on a wet day!
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Very pricey but a bit of old Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: There are shops as far as the eye can see on Orchard Road, most of which are expensive designer shops, if your time is limited you could see most of these shops in other shopping centres,
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was just a short last minute taxi ride from the cruise ship we were on. Went to the Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest both worth the visit. Watched the light display from under the trees which was good but would also like to watch them again from further away to take it all in. Give yourself plenty of time to stroll around.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was one of the absolute highlights of our recent visit to Singapore. Our history loving son had recommended it to us and as it was close to our hotel decided to go. Thank goodness we did. It was absolutely riveting and gave us such an in depth understanding of one part of the fall of Singapore. The guide was highly intelligent and totally interested in her topic. She was able to answer all of the questions asked whether relevant or not. I loved it.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Came in day and night and wow! The green and flowers in day and at night, the music show and light shows- wow!_x000D_
Truly loved it and canâ€™t wait to come back and spend more time in the gardens by the bay and super tree grove! Will check out the super tree restaurant next time!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You really have to go here if you visit Singapore. The lights are fantastic. I was on a tour and we had a great view of it. Definitely recommended.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I caught the bum boat out to the island, and walked to the wetland reserve. It was quite a long way, 10km return. The sounds of the tropical forest were gorgeous. All the way there I had the road to myself except for a couple of cyclists. I managed to leave my camera at one of the shelters, but on my way back, the friendly walking group that was sheltering there from the downpour, had found it and returned it to me with great kindness. Wow. All in all, it was a great trip. Definitely a very different experience to the whole Singapore city thing. I would say that this was one of the best things I have done in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 301 Neo Tiew Crescent Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve, Singapore 718925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the world's largest observation wheel which moves slowly enough to take great photos of the fantastic harbor/river/buildings lit up at night.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's one of Singapore signature. If you have never visited Garden by the bay, it means you haven't come Singapore yet. You should enter inside at night (8:45pm) to enjoy the special lighting show with music at the super tree, it's really impressive.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Located within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, the Orchid Garden is not to be missed. There is a charge to enter; however, it is worth it. These are the most beautiful gardens I have ever seen anywhere in the world, and the whimsical touches and high level of care make them a joy to visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens by the Bay - tourist trap
REVIEW_BODY:
OK so they are interesting. But really they are a tourist trap too._x000D_
Flower Dome was what you might expect with throngs of people and all the usual suspects as far as plants go. The Cloud Dome was closed the day we visited. Walking around is easy and mildly interesting.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: suggest to go at morning or evening time because it is very hot you can take the picture at the bridge
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice views. Didnâ€™t pay the expenses be entrance fee
REVIEW_BODY: We came here but opted not to pay the $28 pp for entrance to the flower dome and cloud forest as we just left beautiful Bali. The gardens are gorgeous and itâ€™s worth a walk about. Huge lizards in the underbrush! The childrenâ€™s water playground looked like fun but our kids are too old. Ate lunch at satay on the bay which was great. Very clean restrooms st the Garden.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Chinese New Year preparations were in full force!
REVIEW_BODY: Busy, hot ,lots to see and smell- good place to eat if you aren't too fussy and A grade hygiene- lots of stuff you wouldn't see in western countries. Quite touristy but some good bargains to be had and some lovely school children doing a tourism survey who seemed surprised it was our 5th visit
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Soul of Spirituality, Steeped in Tradition
REVIEW_BODY: Sri Mariamman Temple offers the Finest in Inner Peace & Strength derived from Ancient Hindu Prayers & Traditions. The Temple is maintained Spotlessly Clean.
