Hindu Vedic Prayers & Ancient Traditions are Scrupulously practised, giving the devotees a matchless spiritual experience. Sri Mariamman Temple is a Must-Visit for all Hindu Devotees.
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Just visited the Art Science Museum and loved the exhibition of the Future World. Many activities for adults and children. Family friendly, interesting art technologies with a vision and good for 1 hour.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I accompanied other tourists and our tour guide to the Merlion Park where we had a brief photo session. I took photos of the giant white Merlion and bought a sourvenior of the Merlion in the tour bus. I love the song playing in the sourvenior which captures the spirit and beauty of Singapore city.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: this is a great zoo there is a bus that goes round which is a must due to the heat. There is various stops to spend time looking at you favour animal. The elephant display is a must.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: No. 1 best place in the Gardens by theBay
REVIEW_BODY: If i was to choose which dome I would visit I would choose this one over Cloud Forest Dome. I love the flowers, the plant art and I can just see myself just sitting and staring all day :)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Nice to visit in the evening when you want to go out for some food and a drink._x000D_
_x000D_
But be aware, this id's not the real Singapore! This is a place to go out for tourists. Very crowed and expensive with a lot of noise / music...
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I travel because I like to experience different cultures, flavors, sounds and colors. This is all what Chinatown is about. Simply interesting and a must visit when in Singapore. The food street is exotic and full of excellent but inexpensive dining options.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Overall, it was good and we love the unlimited rides at Amazon river cruise.The only thing that needs to improve will be the food at the panda cafe as the noodle soups tasted below average.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Had a few days in Singapore and spent a big chunk of one day here. Obviously the trees are the highlight but the gardens are well kept and signed. Also saw the large resident lizards (which the kids didnâ€™t believe from one of my prior visits)!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Aside from the hot and rainy weather, the visit to the zoo was very pleasant. Great for family outings.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A great experience even though I had been before
REVIEW_BODY: I had been on the flyer before, so - when visitors wanted to go again - I was wondering if I would enjoy it. I definitely did! We went on a day when there were very few people, so our group (four of us) got an entire capsule by ourselves. The only downside vs. the last time I was on the Flyer: There were no maps inside the capsule to explain the various sites. Fortunately, we know Singapore well enough to explain it to our visitors, but if you didn't know the city, it would have been frustrating.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Visited the night safari with my husband and kids. It was a wonderful experience. Probably we went in the peak season so there was wait in each attraction but was well organized by the staff. Lots of restaurants, cafes , souvenir shops so you really canâ€™t get bored here. This place has so much to offer._x000D_
_x000D_
I was very excited about the show but it was nothing amazing! Can be a lot better! I mean make it worth the wait for people._x000D_
_x000D_
The tramp ride was awesome and a lifetime experience for every age group. The place is so well maintained and you get to see the animals in their own natural habitat for good 45 minutes._x000D_
_x000D_
If you are in Singapore this place is a must visit with your kids, parents and even grand parents.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The view from here is amazing. We walked around the top taking photos. Unless you have a good camera there are so many bright lights your photos donâ€™t come out ver clear. This is well worth a visit. Go at night so you can see all the lights.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wow what a place to visit
REVIEW_BODY: This place was so relaxing and calm. A really enjoyable morning at the Buddha Tooth temple, very interesting reading and the roof top orchids were pretty.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are an orchid lover, run, do not walk to visit the National Orchid Garden. We visited in January but still there were many plants in full bloom. Many rare plants, not seen anywhere else.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens and flower domes provide a spectacular array of flowers and plants from all around the world. We particularly enjoyed the Floral Fantasy special exhibit as the colours were amazing. The 4D ride at the end was fun and gave us an idea of what to expect in the rest of the park.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: This Place is Out of This World!
REVIEW_BODY: Who thought of these giant trees, covered with foliage? The garden is huge and offers a wide variety of different settings. We bought tickets to the sky walk and loved seeing the overview of the layout. The tram tour is good to get your bearings. We also paid to go into the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome and loved them both. The Garden itself is free and will give you plenty of opportunity to walk to your hearts content.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Cloud forest.. give it a try..live it love it...
REVIEW_BODY: We had been to cloud forest on 6th march 2016.. people must visit place of gardens by the bay.. artificial biggest waterfall on floor 7.. continues water falling out.. a broadway walk as well lift and stair case available for tourist and senior citizens .. all types of greenery available on this place.. looked very beautiful.. sun rays makes little rainbows all the time. We can see the pic in our dreams..or seems like a fairy tell... such a beutiful place.. people took hundreds of pics... we enjoyed the place.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved the place ... lots of guddies you can shop for yourself and love ones. A lot of deals and your hands would be full of bags. Cant resist and stick to one shop... one is better than the other.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best man-made architecture on earth
REVIEW_BODY: The place is perfect for couples, groups, or families. There are a lot of activities that could be done. I visited the gardens and the biggest indoor waterfall in the world. The place is closed and well-conditioned which you don't really have to suffer the humidity outside. In terms of prices, entry fee is just very decent and reasonable for such a place. One point worth mentioning is that the majority area of this place is open for public for free.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A garden of Eden in the city
REVIEW_BODY: I love waking here in the early morning. The orchid garden was amazing. Such a joy to have this place in the middle of the city.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Probably all been said before but.....
REVIEW_BODY: ........ what a wonderful experience and it all runs so smoothly, even on the busy days. The 2 glassed-domed pavilions - Flower Dome and Cloud Forest - are a credit to the gardeners and landscapers/builders who constructed them - for instance I have never seen so many varied and healthy orchids in the one place. There are ideas in there for the avid gardener interspersed with sculptures, wood carvings etc. Things have come a very long way from the early tacky days of the Haw Par Villa (its still there though!) Get to these gardens - even if wet outside the domes are dry (except for the misting sessions at the Cloud Forest which really add to the atmosphere of the place)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: only the pass thru visit is sufficient, Nothing much to offer.. There are man china town buy the way..
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved this place and great opportunity to see animals active in a zoo setting. If you are making your own way via public transport go for earlier ticket as last shuttle back to MRT station is 10.40.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the two domes at the Gardens by the Bay. It's really pretty at the top level. Nearing sunset is the best time. Get to the top level nearing sunset :)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I always stay on Orchard Rd. The multi level underground shopping caters to all. Shoe shopes are especially good in SG
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are split into 3. Cloud dome, flower dome and outside gardens. The cloud dome is definitely the best, with an enchanting walk through many rainforest habitats, and as usual in Singapore, everything is clean, safe and well organised. If you are lost for something to do, this would be my choice.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A quaint street with vibrantly painted shops amidst some cool murals. From food to pastry, desserts, clothing, souvenirs, artwork, colourful antique chandeliers etc. the stuff are actually fairly priced. As it an open aired shopping street for browsing leisurely you could possibly spend a couple of hours here so for those who perspire or burn easily, Iâ€™d say dress really light and donâ€™t forget a sun hat._x000D_
Just for heads up ...ladies would appreciate this more as its kind of our thing popping in/out cute shops regardless if we decide to buy stuff but the dudes in my group ...just walked straight to the end of the street for ice-cream
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When we hear the name singapore, the first thing come to mind is merlion park.the place is more for taking pictures.nothing else to do there.i visited in afternoon.it was so hot and sunny.better time to visit might be after 5.30pm
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This garden is not as big as the botanic garden. It is appreciated that they managed the garden well by subdividing the places to place different kinds of orchids, such as cool zone and a zone with many special kinds of orchids. They even have some photo spots for travellers to take stunning photos with the scenery. This is a good place for a relaxing flowery walk._x000D_
As it is now school holiday, they offer free entry for Singaporean students and residents. Do prepare your working permit if you would like to visit these few weeks.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A beautiful experience with amazing views. Great photo opportunities all around. There is a small charge to walk across here but well worth it as the views over he marina and looking onto Marina Bay Sands is great
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its worth looking at best time around dinner time and then stay for a meal . some shops and good for photos and drinks and a meal
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Zoo is easily reached by public transport from the city about 50 minutes in total._x000D_
Arrived at zoo around 11.00am and did a daytime tour of the zzoo - there are food outlets to suit most tastes and diets when we had finished we did the night tour which was when most of the animals were more active - recommend booking the first tour of the night as can be a long wait with long lines of people later on. definitely a world class zoo with a large number of displays
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great view of Singapore from 56th floor
REVIEW_BODY: The view was very good from the top and its refreshing. Having a drink at the counter and cool wind is just awesome. Definitely I have a strong memory with the place. Its 23 SGD just for the view, everything else needs to be paid separately.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the service provided by you is very , but one small suggestion ,the rental rates for strollers are really costly ,kindly have a look in to the same to reduce the cost that makes still more good.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited on Sunday 21st July 2019. We were just wondering the grand idea, effort and skill required to create the massive and mammoth structures, gardens, walkways etc for this Cloud Forest Complex. This is excellent and an out-of-the-world experience to be here.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A masterpiece of design and construction, best viewed at night.
REVIEW_BODY:
This bridge is built in a double helix (it used to be called Double Helix Bridge), and was inspired by the DNA chain. It curves round as well as making it possible to walk around the complete marina. The curve is most obvious at night, when it lights up beautifully._x000D_
This is the route to the Singapore Flyer from the Marina Bay pedestrian area.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing and very pretty from afar. At night when we watch it from the sky lounge of the peninsula excelsior hotel the lit super grove trees were immensely beautiful.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We arrived there in the beginning of June and there was a warning about the Chinese and Japanese gardens being closed for the next two years. If you're planning to visiting the rest of the park, please use the Lakeside MRT station. The Chinese Gardens station leads to a dead end.
ADDRESS: 1 Chinese Garden Road Chinese Garden, Singapore 619795, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The zoo itself is very good but the time allocated by the tour operators is not enough. After breakfast we had about 1.5 hours to explore the zoo which is by far not enough.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There are the best trees in the world. An unbeliever experiencia. Very nice and very lighting. You will enjoy it a lot.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved the trees, learned so much about their construction. Next visit we have to see them at night. I went on the walkaway, very cool.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: JiaJia & KaiKai were the reason I wanted to visit River Safari. They did not disappoint as both of them were so cute! The red panda was so cute too!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The climate in Singapore is hot and humid and like being in the hot house in Kew Gardens, but outside. As a result the world heritage site Botanic Gardens have a wonderful display of flowering plants that is probably unrivalled elsewhere. There is no other advice except to make the visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a little out of the way but it can be reached by MRT or taxi which is not too expensive, our driver waited whilst we had a walk around. This is a place that all visitors to Singapore should visit at some time.
ADDRESS: 9 Woodlands Road, Singapore 738656, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Took the lift to the sky viewing deck and were were blown away by the breathtaking views of the Singapore skyline 365 degrees . A wonderful sight at night time . The bar up there does a frozen Singapore sling which we also enjoyed . No one should miss the view from up there
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The show with various animals is just outstanding and the ride in the tram so close to the open air animal enclosures makes you feel quite exhilarated because you are in proximity to the animals and not watching them through a cage.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well put together museum! The Peranakan Museum celebrates the lives of Peranakans, or Chinese immigrants to the Malay Peninsula (including Singapore). You get to hear their stories, getting a closer glimpse of their lives after they chose to immigrate.
ADDRESS: 39 Armenian Street Peranakan Museum, Singapore 179941, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Hot day at mid Singapore and option to see so much nice flowers. Quiet, nice place makes your day different.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The park is easily accessible by car or the MRT. It has a wonderful Children's Park with obstacles, slides as well as water play. There are adequate facilities to wash up after playing. It is better to visit either in the morning or late afternoons so it's not too hot to stroll through the various sections of the Park. The beautiful musical light display in the evening is excellent.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: View the city from this place
REVIEW_BODY: Marina Bay Sands Sky Park offers great view of the City of Singapore from above. This is a large wooden decked area on top of Marina Bay Sands hotel. This hotel is located at the edge of the cityâ€™s harbor. A 360-degree panorama view is stunning. Marina Bay Sands SkyPark is one of the most popular attractions in Singapore. Entrance for adults is S$23. A preferred destination for any traveler.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: nothing much to see except buildings and green dirty water. u can see more stuffs by actually walking around the rive.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was one of my favourite things about our trip. The hotel itself is absolutely bewildering in size and grandeur. You will never see any other hotel like this.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Reservoir - Nice Place for a walk or run
REVIEW_BODY: Review by Dr Sim. Reservoir. Nice Place for a walk or run in the early morning or the early evening. Cooler. Do not be there too late at night. Tourists can take a walk if they have time. Regards DrSim001
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This has to be the best botanical garden ever. The orchid exhibition area is probably the biggest and most spectacular in the world.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Very informative. We used the tram rather than walking as we did the zoo the same day and were wrecked._x000D_
_x000D_
Unfortunately the tram doeant come to a complete halt for photos, meaning most photos come out blurry due to the lack of light, even on decent gear._x000D_
_x000D_
Saw many animals, and am very glad we waited around d to get it done. Get their early, as the crowds are huge, but they do get you through very quickly, and provide entertainment while you are lined up._x000D_
_x000D_
Food and beverages in the area looked excellent.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice to learn how different types of plants can be blended to form a huge tree like shape, which can be the lungs of a large city.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: a lively area to visit after a hard day. Literally and food choice you could want. many bars with live entertainment, A constant flow of people can make it a bit challenging, but interesting at the same time. Only flaw is that the Toilets are scarce and not well kept for the amount of people it services.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The biggest Orchid garden in the world
REVIEW_BODY: If you like Orchids then this place is simply stunning--we have never seen so many of these flowers growing wild and the surrounding area of the Botanical Gardens is amazing with all the tropical plants and trees
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Everyone goes here, but its boring.
REVIEW_BODY: Its got a great view of the bay and downtown, but a sculpture spitting out water is a bit boring. nonetheless, go see, you won't feel you have been here otherwise.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent the day traveling solo. Took taxi to this site and found it to be a very enjoyable, informative, beautiful site with lots of walking and pictures and viewing of SE Asia flowers, trees, plants. The gift shop is excellent in books and items.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is always so peaceful to visit Buddhist temples. One must spend time and understand the concept behind each element of the temple. There is so much to learn and understand.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Waowwww place with lights and christmas decoration
REVIEW_BODY: What a place to be...you have 3marvels to check out there...the cloud forest,the flower dome and the super grove tree...a wonderful conception.you can spend hours and hours admiring the nature in the domes.A plus for those wanting to be here...guys do it in christmas period...you gonna like all little bit of it.check...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A must do by all travellers to Singapore!_x000D_
The Gardens by the Bay is a constant beauty of the country no matter what part you travel too. From the large lakes, from the silver garden to the Super tree grove, a walk through the gardens is a must! Take a seat by the lakes or in the gardens and watch the sun set through the trees overlooking Marina Bay. A beauty for all to see!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Full on shopping street,if you want it it's there,cheap to top range goods,if your in Singapore it's must visit.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: UNBELIEVABLE VIEW ON SINGAPORE FROM THE 57TH FLOOR OF MARINA BAY SANDS HOTEL.
REVIEW_BODY:
During a 8 nights stay in Singapore, I slept 6 nights in Marina Bay Sands Hotel and 2 nights in Mandarin Oriental Hotel. As hotel guest, I had full access to the Skypark and I did not hesitate to visit it ! The view is of course awesome on Singapore and should not be missed for any reason once in Singapore, even if you are not client inside the hotel. It's like to be in the front of a huge boat, flying into the sky..._x000D_
I will soon add some photos to my review, for you to see what I'm talking about as 1 photo worths 1'000 words !_x000D_
_x000D_
otterboris
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We took the fabulous mrt to visit the_x000D_
Gardens._x000D_
_x000D_
A great well kept park. We found it extremely hot so try and go in the morning._x000D_
_x000D_
Also, there was a big cruise ship and lots of people due to this fact which made it crowded to see_x000D_
Some of_x000D_
Th gardens.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was a hot afternoon, but enjoyed the river boat tour along Marina Bay. Passing through the Singapore Skyline, taking closer photos of the Merlion spitting out water, and the famous landmark of Singapore; the Sky Park Hotel. Just beautiful!
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Just felt like I was taking a stroll in Sikkim during their main rainy season. Variety of trees and flower.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
First things first... it's spring in here... there is a nip in the air so take a wrap or a cardigan._x000D_
_x000D_
The whole place is thoughtfully designed and interesting to look at. The information is well presented and we had a lovely time exploring it all._x000D_
_x000D_
The only downside was the "market" area where "food" was available at a price. It was clearly designed to fleece $$ rather than add to the overall experience. This venue would do well with an afternoon tea shop in it rather than this market nonsense.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: From start to finish this was a very entertaining evening.Lots of animals to see on the night safari train about 45 mins ride.Plenty of places to eat and drink.Tbe fire show was vey good also the show before the ride.Great for kids.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic place to visit. Superb selection of birds in well cared for enclosures. Very tidy and clean. Well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We made the visit to Gardens on the bay in the evening and the views were amazing.Highly recommend for families and couples ,
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to visit. Well thought out for visitors' convenience
REVIEW_BODY: Slightly expensive and far from the city but worth a visit if you have young children. Facilities are well thought out and placed for visitor's convenience (such as strollers/trolleys for kids). Recommend to pre-purchase tickets as queues are long. With e-tickets, no hassle.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As stated in the orchid review, this place is a must to visit, gardens are lovely, easy place to walk around for all age groups.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Big wheel with good views of city
REVIEW_BODY: I have been on a few of these around the wall and this was similar to others providing spectacular views of the city and surrounding areas. You can even have dinner within one of the cabins. It's worth a trip if you have time, but there are so many other beautiful things to see in Singapore that I would prefer in priority
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We enjoyed the smells, the Chinese food, the market stands and the atmosphere. It's really a must to walk through Chinatown.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a beautiful sight. I suggest to come around the time the fountain show takes place near Marina Bay Sand area.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Met a great Iranian guy and bought a carpet and 2 cushion covers from him. Great man to talk to. Bought a lamp from next door which is beautiful (both the lamps and the store) from an Indian man...bought small perfume bottles from a nice couple of workers who explained to me about the women and religion in the area (why they wore head dresses)...overall great experience. Mosque is really pretty, great ice cream on a corner, but can't remember the name......many nice people....nice! I'll go back.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to shop as you get high street brands and top end designer brands all at the same location. Lovely food courts to indulge in Singaporean meals and cafes to enjoy a coffee while people watching.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the major attractions at the Gardens by the Bay. Dome is air-conditioned so you can go here any day even with the searing temperature of Singapore. We were lucky to get a glimpse of the remnants of the recent Tulip Festival. Fantastic blooms all around and interesting flora and all sorts of plants/trees. I hope they can bring in more interesting varieties.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I have been to these gardens 4 time over the past 15 years and am never disappointed and there is always something new. It rained for most of this trip, but there are lots of shelters. Have umbrella and go, after all it is warm and refreshing. This trip even had a new SMRT station opened, but the bus is just as great. The highlight is the National Orchid garden, worth the special small $5.00 entrance fee. Last entry is 6.00pm. Stunning
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must place to visit! The sky bar is amazing, never been anywhere like it before. Beware there is a $50 min spend, easy done with two senior Singapore Slings!!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a superb photogenic place. Amazing variety of never seen plants and flowers. Must visit for families.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the best ways to explore the skylines of Singapore. I would suggest to go for it at evening to see city lights. Don't forget to take a DSLR with 18-200mm lens. It would give you extraordinary results.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We had an arranged tour, the dinning area was very nice, with a huge selection of food. At the end of the restaurant is the Orangutan enclosure, you can stand very close to the animals and have your photo taken. Afterwards we got on the hop on - hop off bus and enjoyed the rest of the zoo. Well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Friend recommended this so we got tickets through Klook last minute and were very happy we did!_x000D_
_x000D_
Booked the 815 PM time and got in a fairly long line to ride the Night Safari Trolley. Cool experience on the ride. Seemed a bit unreal that we were this close to these nocturnal animals that didn't seem bothered at all by our presence. Trolley ride lasted about 45 minutes and well worth it._x000D_
_x000D_
Spent the rest of our time on foot doing three different walking trails where we were able to see other animals._x000D_
_x000D_
Great evening spent there and would highly recommend!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We really enjoyed our tour of the Battle Box. It was very informative and interesting. The site is located in a beautiful park that is adjacent to the Singapore National Museum. We enjoyed a few hours immersing ourselves in the history of the island.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This a good place to buy a souvenir for your family and friends, it's a good deal, a good condition of the goods.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Within the Singapore Botanical Gardens. Paid admission. A huge amount of orchids to see. Exhibits to show how orchids are grown. Also a special section of orchids named after famous people.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing place to experience, most of the area is free to view, great place to wander around for hours. Make sure you visit at night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: another of the numerous attractions the city has to offer, decent enough to get a look at if you're interested
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really love it there. Visiting it occasionally in a long while still always feels like the first time of visit. Fascination and awe.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Ok everything was great. Mostly sheltered area, good for the desert weather. Surprised to find the panda here, all along thought they were in the zoo. Ok why 3 stars? I thought after we paid the entrance everything should be free? The main ride that always feature on tv, all your ad, etc we need to buy the tickets again? Common you can do better then that. Is the main attraction, you put that river tour beside. At first I thought that was the ride after I hop on is just river nothing. So I get back on land ask around and saw the â€œticket bootâ€ o man thought after we buy the man ticket everything should be included. The Chinese restaurant beside the panda taste good gonna give it a try.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very nice tropical zoo A lot of animals to see The pygme hyppos are so cute A shuttle transit in the Zoo Of course the super Stars are the Elephants and the Orang Utang Count 38 Singapourian Dollar per Adult
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I first saw this stunning building in the taxi from the way to the airport; the views it offers of Singapore from the top are unparalleled._x000D_
_x000D_
Take the lift from the base of the Marina Bay Hotel up more than 50 floors. Step out into the fresh air and take in the panoramic views of Singapore. It's rather breathtaking! It's also a fantastic way to see the city from a unique vantage point. Be prepared with your camera._x000D_
_x000D_
When you arrive, before you take the lift, your photo is taken in front of a green screen. later, you can collect the picture, which has the nighttime background digitally added. Perhaps it is a bit of a twee souvenir, but we bought ours!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: In my opinion it is not worth the fee as the area that visitors to this Sky-park can access is very restricted. Only a very small section of the Roof area is open to general visitors and Guards are on hand to ensure you cannot go to other areas of the roof. Good views (was raining and foggy day we visited) but so many other attractions that are much better for view and value
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I am not a plant person but I really enjoyed my time in the garden. Many unique twists and turns! Although it was humid, we were not unbearably hot. The area is so large that we never felt crowded or pushed to hurry up. We spent several hours walking, exploring and immersing ourselves in this wonderful outdoor space.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you love shopping this is Singapore equivalent to Rodeo Drive or 5th Ave. they have all the designers you know and some you may not, but they are in all the malls. It's so clean you would never know you were outside, flowers everywhere. Make sure to take plenty of money, they will, help you spend it!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Cloud Forest, Unimpressed with Flower Dome
REVIEW_BODY: I visited Gardens by the Bay on 2 March 2017 with a friend. This place is one of main tourist attractions in Singapore so I had to go. First, I went to Flower Dome. It is said that at the time we visited, was the time when the flowers bloom. However, there weren't lots of flowers that were blooming, I found several flowers that are dying. I didn't see tulips at all. There weren't a lot of beautiful flowers to be photographed then we went to Cloud Forest. The place was breathtaking since we could feel the forest vibes in the dome. I fell in love with the giant waterfall inside the dome. Then the next day, we watched the Garden Rhapsody for free at night. It was amusing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Excellent view of the surrender of Singapore during WW2 by reliving the invasion by the Japanese. Spending time in the bunker is a unique experience
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
To travel to Santos, you can either take train (Santosa express) or cable car._x000D_
We took the cable car (both ways ticket)_x000D_
Its great view, especially in the morning to watch the view of the bay & top view of Santos island (Universal studio, SEA aquarium) from the top._x000D_
While coming back, the night view was not that much fun
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited this place as we were already in the botanic garden, and the entrance fee was only 5 sgd per person. It was such a beautiful place! Different types of orchids to look.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its like a huge entertainment district. Bars, restaurants and even some fast food places. Can be very loud due to live music. The good thing is that its covered with a roof- handy in a city where it rains a lot.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I'll always bring my overseas friends to the Singapore Zoo as it is a very well liked place of interest. The variety of animals are a lot and are educational with the explanations for each type of animals. All my overseas friends give Singapore Zoo a thumb up
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: At the centre of the colonial area
REVIEW_BODY:
A pleasant oasis very much in the heart of the colonial district. Quite plain inside but functional for the climate, and full of interesting artefacts and memorials._x000D_
_x000D_
Adjacent to numerous bus routes on North Bridge Road so easy to hop on a bus when your visit is over.
ADDRESS: 11 St. Andrew's Road St. Andrew's Cathedral, Singapore 178959, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Night safari is really good , all kinds of Animals from different parts of the world are present in the zoo ._x000D_
_x000D_
We are taken into the zoo in a train and explained about the animals by Safari Team_x000D_
_x000D_
There is an entertainment performance by Animals as well , do not miss it ._x000D_
_x000D_
Thanks_x000D_
Sonam & Varun
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The place is very cozy from the entrance. Located near an MRT station and shopping arcade, the National Library is a haven for readers or people who need some personal time with books. The library has a massive collection of books, people can read wherever they want, be it on the floor or on the table. One can just hang out there without reading books and enjoy the time with their friends.
ADDRESS: 100 Victoria Street National Library Building, Singapore 188064, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The view from the skydeck is the clearest most beautiful view you could imagine at night.. i think it was a little expensive to go up ($80SG family) but in saying that it's a view that needs to be experienced when visiting Singapore. The lazer light show was not worth seeing from the top but the city skyline definetly was!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: To know what the Chinese practices are, this is the place to come. You may come to have a simple prayer.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Kuan Yin Thong Hood Cho Temple
ADDRESS: 178 Waterloo Street Kwan im Temple, Singapore 187964, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was an incredible experience. Make sure you book a tour as most of them were sold out the day I visited. Allow 1 1/2 hours for the short tour. The guides are extrememly knowledgeable and you will get to experience life in the underground bunker.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The best time to visit the sky park is during evening time whereby weather is not as hot and get to see the night lights of Singapore skyscrapers and Garden by the bay lightnings. However the entrance Photo shot is too pricey. More expensive than the entrance fee. End up not many people buying the photo. But the view is worth it. Do sit on the floor like everyone else and enjoy the view . Nice :)
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic access to all the different levels at this lovely temple. Immaculately maintained and very photogenic, with a beautiful orchid roof garden. You need to see this if youâ€™re in Chinatown.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Flower Dome beautiful but loved the Cloud Forest even though suffer from vertigo and had to be lead by my husband in a few points. Most impressive
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud Forest is a must see in Singapore. It is magnificent. The displays are fascinating and well worth a visit by all ages. Breathtaking. Even air conditioned!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: to full and seen one mall have seen all
REVIEW_BODY: very crowdy and watching one mall after each other with the same shops repeating. Go into one if you need to buy something and spend your time more usefull later by going somewhere else
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Such a fun place to wander around
REVIEW_BODY: We spent almost a whole day here - wandering the gardens and seeing the sculptures. We visited the Flower and Cloud Domes which were wonderful.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: So so beautiful and well worth a visit! Easily accessed via public transport. Free to visit but some sections there is an admission cost which is quite expensive
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We spent an afternoon in the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest. It was a lovely afternoon (and we got to escape the heat). Afterwards we headed to the children's playground which was worth a stop. Unfortunately we didn't bring swimmers for the kids for the Water Playground but wish that we did. Then had dinner at Satay by the Bay which was really yummy. Really recommend the juice store and in particular the Dragon Fruit and Soursop drink. We got back just in time to see the light show at the Supertree Grove at 7.45pm. We got stuck at the edges as people generally blocked the main steps and passage ways. But there's actually a lot of room right under the "trees" so don't be shy and walk around people to get to the middle. The light show was amazing._x000D_
_x000D_
After the light show there is usually a large pilgrimage of tourists heading back to the MRT. If you can wait - wait a bit. Otherwise, if you head back towards Marina Bay Sands...you can then catch the 9pm laser show there. It's not as good as the Gardens by the Bay show...but might as well since it's so close =)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We loved our visit here. It is a must - both domes and the Skywalk. Hubby isnâ€™t into gardening and he said he would love to go back!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Reachable via public transport. Be there early in the morning, most of the people are there around 10-11.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: For those who have a few free hours, you might want to visit Singapore Zoo. There are concerts convenient place for walking, prices are reasonable and the restaurant instead of offering a variety of food
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Be there and get submerged into several vibrant activities flowing into the surrounds of this area. Just be there on Weekend evening without any formal planning. Just be there to experience the flow of vibrance. And you shall return happy.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wish we had something like this in Auckland, New Zealand. Absolutely amazing environment and couldn't believe how good air conditioning was.... relief from the 30+ heat
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went on the eye just as the sun had gone down. The views were amazing with the lights of the city. It took about half and hour to go round so had plenty of time for a good look. Would recommend if you would like an overall view of the city.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I visited Arab St with my mom today as we are in Singapore on holidays. I found it to be pretty average although we did end up buying some beautiful cushion covers. We had dinner at a Turkish restaurant - lots of cute restaurants and cafes (many halal options, if not all), as well as the Sultan mosque. Worth a visit but you will be done in about 2 hours or less.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
As part of a visit to the Botanic Gardens, we went to the National Orchid Garden._x000D_
_x000D_
This is a beautifully laid out garden with a diversity of orchid that is unimaginable. Every colour, combination, size etc is represented in beautifully presented gardens. From the outside of the display, you can't realise how big this actually is so make sure you allow enough time._x000D_
_x000D_
Also, if you have teenage students with you, make sure you bring their student card as even if they are obviously young teens, they will make you pay an adult fare if you can't produce student identification which does make the entry price less.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The bridge was beautiful, especially at night, when the lights were turned on. Also, it connected the Marina Bay's shores, so it was convenient for tourists to walk from Merlion Park to Marina Bay Sands and Gardens by the Bay.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: not bad, but nothing much to explore
REVIEW_BODY: not bad, but nothing much to explore. It's just another normal street(s), with some tiny handmade gifts ideas for sale, etc. Not a must to visit.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited in late May 2015. It was pretty humid - but the Flower Dome and Cloud Forrest are both air conditioned so there is a break._x000D_
Absolutely stunning - could easily spead a few hours wondering around. We are heading back to Singapore in late Aug and will visit the Gardens again - this time we will make sure we stay until after dark to see the amzing lights.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I must say Singapore do there attraction so well. The waterfall as you walk in, is so cool. Great plants. And some really good viewing platforms. This is great for everyone.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: THE shopping street of Singapore. All the posh brands are here - interesting for its architecture, not so much the stores...same as everywhere else. Sundays are very crowded (all the helpers are off on Sundays) but also the most interesting day to watch people and enjoy the whole scenario.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If there's one thing you will definitely notice is that the Singapore River is very clean. Amazing for such a body of water adjacent to a busy city, you would expect it to reek of sewage and filth, but amazingly it is clean. It is nice to take time out to walk along the river along the restaurant row and you will end up at the Merlion monument. This is a definitely tourist destination that shouldn't be missed.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a magnificent ecopark in the middle of a bustling city A memorable experience with much to see and learn
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Shops galore (a lot selling the same things) but great taking in all the atmosphere. Food stores galore all looked clean and enormous selections.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Little India felt like home. Lot of Indian restaurants to choose. Avoid going on Sundays as the place gets very crowded.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Like NY Central Park but better
REVIEW_BODY: Huge park where you can just walk around or example have a pick nick. Like New York Central Park but just much better!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a definite must-stop in Singapore, the park is relatively big and filled with lakes/ponds, there are pathways everywhere, big green spaces which are ideal to go with children but also places which are great to spend time with your other half. We went to the orchid garden which was splendid. This botanical park is the perfect getaway from the city!!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is an architectural marvel in modern Singapore, definitely worth a visit. The gardens are beautiful and well taken care of, with an amazing variety of horticulture. Be prepared to spend at least 3 hours in the domes. Highly recommended!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
In my week-long stay in Singapore, I was billeted first at a hostel in the red light district, then moved to a hotel in Changi._x000D_
_x000D_
Roaming around and meeting fellow tourists, I found out that I should've just stayed in Chinatown, for every thing I could possibly crave/long for is there - coffee shops, cheap meals, Instagram-worthy places._x000D_
_x000D_
I was also able to go to a gay bar called Tantric, and really had fun with the people there. They offered me cigarettes and drinks, and we just danced the night away._x000D_
_x000D_
Overall, a 4/5 for me. Would most likely stay there for when I come back sometime in the future.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Cloud forest is a great place to visit in Singapore. A really nice concept to demonstrate how living near to nature can help in sustainable development
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Different experience to the usual zoos. The Creatures of the Night show is a must. If you can, walk the trails. We skipped due to rain.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited the National Orchid Garden as part of the Singapore Botanic Gardens and after a quick subway ride I found it an easy to get to destination. The highlight is the Orchids and many are on display. It is very relaxing to wander the paths and look at all the beautiful flowers. Visiting in July does mean hot & humid temperatures, so come prepared with plenty of water.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I am from the United States but I can say that this is one of the most impressive sites I have been to. It's much more beautiful at night as you can see all of the lights. Make sure you do not go to Singapore and miss this.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I booked advance tickets for this Safari as I did not want to miss, as my kid loves to see animals. Since this was famous, I was sure that there will be something 'good' about it._x000D_
_x000D_
Unfortunately, my expectations were too high. First of all we had to wait for 45 minutes for our turn as there was a huge crowd in an'1-hour slot' window. Although crew members were doing their best to manage the crowd, but that was not sufficient. There were 5-6 stations to catch the Safari Tram, but people did not know that and all rushed to number 1-2. There were very less number of Fans put up in that hot temperature. This becomes difficult to manage with infants/toddlers._x000D_
_x000D_
At last, in a 25-30 minute safari, it was very difficult to 'notice' the creatures, as it was too dark or sometimes animals were too far. I could not understand the reason for showing those in 'night' as most of them can be easily seen in daytime. I did not find anything special about it !
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We had a fantastic day at the zoo. So open plan the animals hardly looked to be in enclosures. They must have thought they were in heaven with lush vegetation to eat !!_x000D_
We only watched one show , the elephant show but it was great._x000D_
Weâ€™ll be going back!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: While I have walked around and photographed Gardens by the Bay on other occasions this was the first time I had ventured inside the domes. Tulips galore inside the Flower Dome as a special attraction, really stunning. The Cloud Forest was spectacular.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I am not that big into flowers, and having walked for hours already before getting here, my feet were already aching, but even so, I found this to be beautiful. Not quite as spectacular as the Cloud Forest, but worth seeing. And if you are even remotely a flower buff, then you will enjoy it immensely.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a part of gardens by the bay .There is amazing collection of plants from different geographical regions.The layout is good and one can easily spend an hour or so here.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Am amaze by the arrangement of River Safari. You have all in one, so you could skip the zoo :P. Lots of species fishes and animals.You will enjoy :)
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely gardens, filled with locals and visitors alike. All display a deep respect for nature. There is a lovely area in the middle where people have picnics, play with their kids. Great atmosphere
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was a great and very interesting place to visit. The indoor waterfall and the water cycle created here is extraordinary. However, we did find it to be a little bit expensive.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens By The Bay are just totally different Gardens and yet the most beautiful ones to visit, the place changed my perception about Gardens how!ðŸ‘ŒðŸŒ¸ðŸŒ·
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth at least 1 visit, free to walk round, the domes are a bit pricey in my opinion although the flower dome is really well done. The skywalk is definitely worth the $12 charge though. They seem to limit the number of people up there at any one time and it makes for a really calm experience! Also worth visiting the garden for the evening light show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We went to see exhibition as one of the must!, My son is a big fan of the artist since 2 year olds, i played video clip of this art instead of cartoon, then it was bless to know this exhibition is held in south east asia, we fly to see this exhibition without hesitate!_x000D_
_x000D_
The exhibition was good as it's standard, fit the place perfect esp. the main high-light hall._x000D_
_x000D_
But the worst thing happened when my son was stopped from a staff when he was carefully moving the beast (experiment zone) as he is too small and can't move 'her' smoothly, and again when the small group lecture come (only 2 people with booking?), then we need to leave as we run out of time to the airport._x000D_
_x000D_
I was admired the place as it's part of shopping mall, great ideal to connect people with art as apart of life but now this art seems to unreachable like it was before or still in some developing country..._x000D_
_x000D_
My son seems to lost his interest on the main highlight but still making his own beast by lego (he is 7 year olds) Luckily when staff said 'No, you can't do it!' doesn't haunting him.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went here as part of our night tour. It was awful. Lights were substandard and music terrible. My husband didn't even realise show had started. Only had time for the light show then had to move on. If I go to S Singapore again I would go in the day time and stay a lot longer to explore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I would say definitely its one time worthy visiting the skypark at Marine Bay Sands. The entry fee at around 20 SGD is steep. Getting a photo clicked is another 35 SGD. You can definitely get a 360 degree view of Singapore, but you are out of luck if you want to get a view of the Infinity Pool. That part is only accessible to hotel renters._x000D_
_x000D_
Nice for a romantic date maybe.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you like zoos you will love this one. The animals have plenty of space and are clearly very well cared for and loved. The zoo is well sign posted and there are excellent facilities for travellers who donâ€™t want to walk everywhere. Itâ€™s easy to access by public transport and there are zoo shuttle buses to the subway.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Full of amazing designer shopping malls, some Disney theme statues that you can take photos of as you go along
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great experience to see Singapore but in as much as the view from the top, the marvel of how the Flyer wheel moves is an experience in itself. Dont miss the opportunity to see the artifacts about the Flyer which are done nicely while getting to Flyer. If you are lucky depending on the crowd you can get an entire cabin for yourself. Takes about half and hour. Great views of the Harbour and coast as well as Singapore city itself.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good for inexpensive trinkets shopping and absorbing some of the Chinese culture. The Chinese Heritage Centre is worth a trip too. Plenty of eateries. Adverts for beauticians and alternative oriental medicines. Safe environment. Easy to get to by ATM.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very nice place to go. I think it is one of the must do activity while being in Singapore. Daytime or night time, both worth it
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Incredible exhibits let you get an up close look at many, many unusual animals. Free ranging Orangutans! That exhibit and the Lemur exhibit are highlights of some of the best designed zoo exhibits you'll findy anywhere in the world. If you're planning on going to Sinagore, add an extra day so you don't miss out on this incredible experience.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the bay is super awesome! You can see the beautiful of nature park there and that's worth it to get inside in flowers dome
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Oh my God what a beautiful place
REVIEW_BODY: What an extrodinary place ! So beautiful! We were there with our friends from Singapur who took us to this garden! Just brilliant! so many flowers, co clean and tidy! if every botanical garden was run like this!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth the visit and the light show at night was an experience that should not be missed.Gardens were beautiful.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A ride one shouldn't miss. worth the experience plus you get to see the whole of Singapore in thirty minutes or so...
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: First of all you need atleast half a day to enjoy this place. We landed there to see the anaconda being fed a chicken which was totally cool to watch. The amazon river quest is a boat ride and a number of animals can be seen on both sides of the river. The stingrays in the aquarium are magnificent. There are huge hippo kind of mammals is huge aquariums. We went there at their feeding time and it was awesome to watch them. They let you touch starfish and crabs under supervision. There are two pandas enjoying their naps in the safari.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As soon as you enter the are, you feel like you have entered an Indian market. The shopping malls, the food joints, the restaurants all make you feel that you have entered India.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went to Gardens by the Bay.. Solo. It's easily accessible by bus or MRT I chose the bus route. Start by going for the cloud walk it's a 8 dollar ticket but totally worth it. Followed by a walk around the garden and the water pond. Very scenic u can click loads of pictures. Don't miss the cloud walk. It's got a ticket but again once u see it's the money will not matter. You can also pre book it. There is a garden for kids and water park. Satay by the bay has good food too. You can spend a day there enjoying the views and food. Very helpful staff and pleasant environment.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: a source of so much joy
REVIEW_BODY: i used to visit the botanics in the early 2000s when my daughter was a toddler. then i forgot all about the gardens i.e. i would drive past but not venture in to partake of their delights. of late i've been entering from a different gate each time and walking in the botanic gardens. they are so beautiful and serene and i'm grateful to the powers that be for having created such a resort-like space in the middle of the city. the water features, lush plants, open verdant spaces all add up to magic.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: I would call it Tree Dome
REVIEW_BODY:
I was a little surprised that there were not that many flowres. Big and interesting collection of trees from around the world. Very nicely done. Make sure to look for beautiful wooden sculptures with big dragon the best of all of them ( but I liked all of them)._x000D_
If you are not fun of Christmas displays you may not like the one that takes central space in the dome now - big attraction for small kids .
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Smooth ride, well maintained, good direction displays, staff helping, good ambience. Really liked by whole family.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore has many beautiful sights and the best place to see the fantastic skyline is from Merlion Park. The Merlion is the icon that represents Singapore; it has to be seen close-up as it rises from the water overseeing the vast bay and the fantastic architecture of the surrounding buildings.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not bad, try if it is new to you
REVIEW_BODY: We booked our tickets through the Concierge and did not have to wait in line. We chose not to do any walking as there is a baby in the group but just took the train. Lucky enough to be able to see all the wild animals including tigers, lions, elephants, hyenas....and more. There may be more areas that we haven't explored yet. Overall, would say this place is still worth visiting unless you have done something similar before.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We're on the last leg of a grand tour of Australasia, and this is our third botanic garden, and by far the best. Itâ€™s a UNESCO World Heritage Sight for good reason- itâ€™s extensive, lush, beautifully maintained and free! We did add on a visit to the Orchid gardens, which were fantastic, and the cost was a very reasonable S$5.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We arrived early afternoon and booked for the 4pm guided tour. Joanne , our guide was very informative and made the tour memorable. Would highly recommend a visit if you have time in Singapore. Thank you.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's a beautifully curated space and I was wowed by Mr Alvin Yapp's passion for promoting the culture. The session was cosy and his mum prepared some kueh and tea for us too. I learnt some new things and also saw some things from a marketing and hospitality perspective. Glad I had the chance to visit today!
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went there in the afternoon, view is beautiful specially watching the sunset and lights of garden by the bay or marina bay
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful part of a beautiful city
REVIEW_BODY: Huge garden with many, many differnt species of plants and trees. So much to see and experience. Bring a blanket and lunch basket and enjoy the peace and quiet. What a treat
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As you can imagine the view is fantastic up there. We were staying in the hotel so if you don't it's worth doing this.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Dome building with aircon. You can see many plant from other world. Very beautiful at night. A must visit plan in singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited the Flower Dome when Orchid Extravaganza was on display - it was a riot of colors and shapes. The guide explained the Orchids and the exhibits. There are regular displays on a rotationalbasis. Other areas were California, Mediterranean, and Soth American. The upper level has Cactus and arid plants. A good break from the city and the dome is cooled, so helps to beat the july heat.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best way to spend your time in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Must do activity when in Singapore. Amazing interaction with the animals, we saw every single animal on the map even though it was raining You can get up close and personal to 90% of the animals MUST DO
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Thousands of flowers of all known colours bloomed all around, take some lovely photos, though a little crowded but dont miss.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The domes are absolutely stunning and a must do when visiting Singapore. Cloud dome in particular is even more futuristic than anything science fiction could even imagine. A steep entrance fee but absolutely worth it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Huge and beautiful gardens. We spent half a day here and were exhausted at the end. Took star off for rather limited information about various plants.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Flood your senses with the beauty of orchids
REVIEW_BODY: Enjoy viewing a vast collection of orchids. Walk through winding paved paths flanked by the most exotic varieties of orchids.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: best orchid display i have seen in the world
REVIEW_BODY: best orchid display i have seen in the world. Set in the botanic gardens, it costs to enter but is well worth the price - a huge range of beautiful orchids as well as explanations of them.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the cable car which takes you to Sentosa island, which is a theme park island, with an aquarium, water parks & a beach. We bought an unlimited cable car ticket, so we could visit both cable car lines as many times as we wanted! The views from the cable car are amazing of Sentosa. The tickets are moderately priced
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Trip to Chinese and Japanese garden
REVIEW_BODY: Beatiful place for those who loves nature and gardens . Chinese and japanese gardens can be reached via MRT . Nearest startion is Chinese garden station or lake side station . From bouna vista MRT east west line connects chinese gardens . 7 storied pagoda, twin pagoda , turtle museum ,bonsai gardens , japanese gardens are few main attractions here . Entry to turtle museum and bonsai gardens closes by 5:00 pm .Its worth spending half day of your trip here .
ADDRESS: 1 Chinese Garden Road Chinese Garden, Singapore 619795, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Eat, play, drink, walk and window shop.
REVIEW_BODY:
It is also a shopping paradise._x000D_
But you can also eat, play, drink and window shop if not just take a walk and feast your eyes. And if the heat gets you, just go down to the basement and walk from one mall to the other. That is what I like the most about this place. In Hong Kong CBD, the buildings are interconnected by bridges spanning above the roads, whereas in Singapore, it is the long shopping tunnels.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This month is the celebrating of mooncake festival. During this period, you see the decorations of lanterns and many stalls selling mooncakes.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Nice view of the sunset behind Marina Bay Sands. Get to see the city come to life and light up, the Flyer, Supertree Grove, Marina Bay._x000D_
_x000D_
For some reason everyone flies their kites up there during the sunset, you can buy your own down at a shop under the grassy hill, not too sure how expensive they are though._x000D_
_x000D_
Lots of people take picnics and there's loads of kids with ball games and toys up there so watch out for flying footballs
ADDRESS: 8 Marina Gardens Drive Marina Barrage, Singapore 018951, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Walking through the garden is relaxing. The highlight of the night is the light show. Though I have been twice but every time I am still attracted and enjoyed it
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful place. We brought tickets for the both domes. All I can say is you will thoroughly enjoy both domes. Plants from all over the world and they are so celebrating Christmas. The cloud dome has an amazing waterfall in It. We saw the gardeners abseiling down to plant plants and do weeding. Orchids were beautiful and so well kept.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Gardens by the Bay are easily accessible by the subway from most anywhere in Singapore. Itâ€™s the Bayfront stop on the yellow MRT line. There is an elevated walkway from the Sands hotel that takes you right to the Supertrees. (See photo) The Supertrees are 25-50 meters tall, and one of the trees is as high as a 16 story building. The tops of some of the trees contain photovoltaic cells, which collect energy from the sun. The Supertrees are actually vertical gardens, with climbing plants from all over the world growing up the sides. There are diagrams and information on how the trees collect, store and distribute energy and some act as air exhausts. (See photo) Visiting the gardens and the Supertrees from the ground is free._x000D_
_x000D_
There is also an ariel walkway 22 meters off the ground (OCBC Skyway) which winds around between several of the trees. (See photos) The cost to access the Skyway is 8 Singapore dollars per adult. We went during the day, and it was not crowded. But there was a queue line set up, so I imagine it gets very crowded at night when the Supertrees are all lit up._x000D_
_x000D_
If you are going to walk around the gardens, be aware that it is hot! Be sure to wear a hat or take an umbrella and plenty of water. We faded from the heat before we got to the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest. You can take a cab directly to the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest to avoid walking as much outside.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Breathe taking view and simply elevating. Provides a wonderful joyful ambience that is still very much unbeatable and very much worth the entrance fee collected.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A great break from the crazy of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
I love this park. When the hustle of Singapore gets a bit much, take a stroll through Fort Canning. It is amazingly calm and quiet compared to what is just outside the walls._x000D_
There are lots of little pockets of information and history located all the way around, mixed with some beautiful plants and flowers._x000D_
I would advise going in late afternoon, when the heat has died down a bit, and make sure you wear bug spray, not for mosquitoes but for other little insects that bite.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to spend some time. As you enter you are greeted with a waterfall. You wander on round the ground floor following the path till you come to some lifts. Take them to the top floor and then work your way down level by level. along suspended footpaths and escalators. It is very well layed out and quite cooling on a hot day.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: 4 adults and 2 children under 7 visited the river safari. Great activity especially the Amazon river quest. Great value at SGD5 per adult ( this is in addition to normal entry fee) and go round as often as you want ! We saw different animals on our 2 trips. Suggest give yourself at least 2 - 3 hours. Quite a lot of walking.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to take the kids on weekends
REVIEW_BODY: We come here quite often, although it has probably been a few months since the last visit. Starting at the main entrance and walking around 3km to the exit at the Botanic Gardens mrt makes for an entertaining morning for the children, with stops to feed the fish along the way.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you grabbing for food with nice environment. This is one of the best area to hang out with friends. This colonel white building will brings you back to 1841. I went there evening time, I feel quiet and peaceful in this busy city. Definitely will go back again.
ADDRESS: 30 Victoria Street Chijmes, Singapore 187996, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are in doubt what to do Orchard Road is always a good place to go to in Singapore, from huge shopping malls to cinemas to restaurants to food courts to libraries you can always find something to do here
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the area in Gardens by the bay is really beautiful at night, those super tree grow , cloud forest and flower dome are the main attractions in there. You can reach there by Bay Front MRT station. we went flower dome and cloud forest in the morning and we were amazed by the variety of plants there. In the evening those two sections were closed so better to visit them in the morning and have a walk in supertree grow in the evening.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Please please do not miss the music/ laser show at the Solar Trees that starts at 9:00 pm.... That is the main attraction of this place ! It will just blow you away !!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Just do it. Take the $8 bus tour first to get your bearings, then the skywalk is another $8, and if I recall correctly $28 to enter the domes. All well worth it, and I'm not a "garden lover". Well done Singapore what a great feature.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very good attraction and my guests all love the Cloud Forest dome. Itâ€™s always an enjoyable trip, especially for young kids.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Had a few days in Singapore went on the Flyer which gave great views of Singapore. It was not busy as midweek, we bought our ticket when we turned up. If you show your Singapore Airline boarding pass get 10% discount. Lovely garden and fish ponds underneath the Flyer.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We grabbed a drink and overlooked MBS as the sun went down. It was a lovely way to spend a few hours. Check out our Singapore page on thewelltravelledman.com for more information and more photos!
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to escape this busy Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY: Tucked away in the center of Singapore, this is a great place to observe little wild life (birds, tortoise, insects?). Treetop walks are amazing, and trekking is easy. For the dragon-boating enthusiast, there is options for you to do that as well.
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was the first place we visited after setting foot in Singapore. It's nice and worth one visit. It was my first impression.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore
