REVIEW_BODY: We went to the Botanica Gardens one day and didn't have time to properly view the Orchids so we went back a second time and we were rewarded. Stunningly planned and maintained with masses of stunning orchids. A true national treasures.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I felt as if I was in a space laboratory Very sci-fi feeling. This may be the future someday. Plus I liked the feeling of defending down and seeing various levels of the flora system. Well done!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Well worth a visit - goose bump moments when you go to the evening light show - even enjoyed by my 8 and 13 year olds._x000D_
_x000D_
Great photo opportunity with the Marina Bay Sands in the background._x000D_
_x000D_
Tip- be prepared to queue for taxis afterwards it takes a while!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The place is huge and with so many birds to see of different species...is amazing. I believe they have the largest collection of Toucans and hornbills in the world. Please keep some spare time for the visit. .because the place is big and worth visit every corner. The shows which are held at scheduled timings are a must see. Ensure you see all of them.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It was our second day at sentosa islands and during sunset we decided to take a ride from merlin station to Faber peak._x000D_
We are rewarded with beautiful viewing._x000D_
The trolley was at the highest point during the ride. The single cabin could accommodate six to eight people._x000D_
The ride was comfortable although my better half was afraid of the heights.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We got to see the Gardens by the Bay light and music show in the evening. It was fantastic. So pleased we were able to see it. So much to do and see in Singapore - we couldn't fit it in during the day. This is a must see and will look forward to going back one day to see it during the day time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These days after Opening of garden of the battery few people visit botanical garden.but if u r a nature lover you must visit this place.a very good collection of orchids with in a very peaceful place.this must be your stop in your Singapore visit
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A Good Panorama of Singapore on a Clear Day
REVIEW_BODY: We starWe started our first sightseeing day of Singapore with a trip on the flyer. We arrived about 9:30am on Saturday morning and didn't have very much of a line. From the time we bought our ticket until we walked into on the the Flyer's pods, was less than 10 minutes. I hear that it can be very busy with long waits and crowded pods later in the day. There was only three other people in our pod while we made the single revolution of the wheel, which lasted around 30 minutes. It was great to be able to see the city laid before us, and I took many pictures of the places we would later visit during the day. You can stand up next to the window or sit down on the central benches in the pod. The views are stunning. The biggest downside is the cost for a ticket. And our experience would not have been so good if the pod was over crowded, since I walked around a bit to take pictures.ted our signtseeing day
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: WOW the best zoo I've ever been to. The animals have so much space and lots are free to roam. So much to see and do we spent hours there and could of stayed longer. It is very during the day but quieter as the day went on.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must visit attraction in Singapore. Brilliant day out superbly presented and accessible for all ages.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Crazy, weird, totally different - The Tiger Balm Gardens
REVIEW_BODY:
Not sure where to start with this one! My Grandfather who was stationed with the Royal Navy out in Singapore in the 50's or 60's and used to talk about this place. Then it seemed to fall out of favour and tourists were warned off going there. Well now it's back! but still a work in progress._x000D_
It has it's own MRT station (Haw Par) and is easy to get to. There are spots set aside for catering outlets and shops but so far none are taken so you can't get any food inside apart from an ice-cream or cold drink at the very small visitor centre._x000D_
It's not a Garden even though that's what it's commonly known as. It a park full off garish, crazy statues telling Chinese myths and stories. It's fun, kitsch, surprising and startling. The statues are being repainted and restored, obviously after many years of neglect, so some are bright and shiny while others are faded and cracked._x000D_
There is a covered separate area which houses the 10 Courts of Hell tableau's, which are gruesome models of crime and punishment according to Chinese myths. The models are so kitsch that most children have probably seen worse on the internet but it's worth being cautious with sensitive children._x000D_
I'm glad I visited but probably once would be enough!
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I almost didnâ€™t bother with this as I am not an orchid lover but we were in the botanical gardens and as the orchid_x000D_
Is the national flower of Singapore I thought I ought to pop in! There was a very small charge to go in but it was so worth it! I have never seen so many orchids of such beautiful colours and the scent of some was incredible! It was a place of absolute beauty. Well set out, clean and tidy and obviously well tended._x000D_
My 15 year old daughter loved it so suitable for all._x000D_
I am very glad I didnâ€™t miss it.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I finally saw the city of my dreams. Very clean place and a lot of things to do. The building with nice structure. I wish ive been in the pool in the top of the marina bay hotel . But i cabt ;(
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard Road, provides all the shopping opportunities you could ever imagine, including expensive up-market shopping from world wide brands, to the economy shopping, such as Lucky Markets. Though the traffic is busy in the street, the pedestrians are fenced off everywhere but the marked crossings, regulated mostly by traffic lights. There are trees and other greenery around, and plenty of places to stop for a meal or coffee.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Always a relaxing place to visit!
REVIEW_BODY: Even if I'm travelling alone I try to visit the Botanical Gardens and National Orchid Garden. Peace and tranquility away from the hustle and bustle of Singapore!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The attraction, like burj kalifa, has restricted accessibility for outsiders! Wonâ€™t take you to topmost level, the beautiful pictures of infinity pool canâ€™t be taken as cant be accessed
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Within the Botanic Gardens, this has a collection of stunning orchids to fascinate anyone! Amazing colours, shapes and displays.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We had about 6 hours available whilst in transit through Singapore and decided to go to the gardens by the Bay - it was absolutely amazing and we found not too expensive. Tickets was 28 Singapore Dollar per person and we spent about 3 hours at the place. There is some restaurants and curio shops as well. A taxi to and from the airport is easily available and cost around 20 Singapore Dollar each way for normal size car. Definitely a must see if you have some time in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Overall a good trip, one can take the tram to go around.One can pre-book through klook which was bit cheaper than over the counter.The park is well maintained, you have to be early at 8.30 as the park closes at 5.30.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great views and a nice way to relax after a hectic day of sightseeing. I would recommend riding the flyer just prior to sunset.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the first time that I have seen multiple Hermes, Tiffany, Rolex, Cartier etc stores in less then 1 mile. As expected the shops are quiet expensive at least for us using UK pounds.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Given all the great things I had heard about Singapore, I had high expectations from the Zoo._x000D_
_x000D_
However, my family and myself were a lil disappointed. The shows and locations of the exhibits could have been better organized. There was no one to guide us in proper direction._x000D_
_x000D_
I cant help but compare our visit to Bali Zoo which was so well organized and the shows were great too.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It felt like a very exclusive experience, hidden away along a quietly gorgeous street of incredibly well-maintained old double-storied shophouses._x000D_
The collection at The Intan was amazing. Alvin was the real MVP here, exhibiting himself almost as if he were one of the items on display. His warmth, charisma and genuinely engaging nature struck us as quintessentially Peranakan._x000D_
_x000D_
You are welcomed into the beautifully-furnished living room, and offered a cup of warming tea (a specially chosen blend). Alvin takes some time to get to know each guest and their interests before introducing himself, the house, and his collection. He invites personal questions about his culture as he carefully and meticulously explains intricacies in the melding traditions of his proud heritage._x000D_
After a tour of the house, Alvin offers some traditional kueh as a light snack with more tea, over which he lightheartedly answers more of our questions about his amazing collection and his plans for the future._x000D_
_x000D_
As a child of mixed heritage myself, having grew up in a nearby neighbourhood, I was fascinated by Alvin's story and his curiosity and perspective. When we met I mentioned that I had recently moved to Sweden and that my mum was excited to visit Abba The Museum in Stockholm._x000D_
Before we left, Alvin excitedly sat us down in the living room and played us Abba's Dancing Queen on the piano. It was a lovely gesture, my mum and I were entranced in nostalgia._x000D_
_x000D_
Thank you for a wonderful afternoon, Alvin. All the best for the future (:
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The botanical gardens were wonderful and the orchid Garden well worth a visit. There is a fairly decent walk, so wear comfy shoes and take some water.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A little bit boring for a solo traveller
REVIEW_BODY:
I was originally visiting with a friend but plans changed so I ventured alone._x000D_
Being a solo visitor I was directed to take the walk and not access the vehicle that drives around the zoo. This means there is an area thatâ€™s not accessible._x000D_
Although the walk was pleasant and not so crowded. Many of the viewing areas were too dark to see the animals._x000D_
I would recommend to families as lots of children there seemed to be loving it.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Science Center is a nice place to visit with the kids, as there are several really cool things to do here, both indoor and outdoor.
ADDRESS: 15 Science Centre Road Singapore Science Centre, Singapore 609081, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fine collection of South East Asian civilisations artifacts.
REVIEW_BODY: Well curated and displayed exhibits of artifacts from South East Asian civilisations. The permanent displays of Chinese porcelains and also artifacts from a sunken Tang era ship discovered in Indonesian waters, plus others are already worth the visit. There are also featured exhibits which are seasonal, please do visit their website for more information. For those with young children, there are activity areas for young hands and eyes to work off their extra energy.
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was the only really crowded place I experienced in July. Tons of people were there taking their photos.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A reason for Garden lovers to go to Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the bay is a destination not just an attraction. It is worth going to Singapore just to go to the gardens. Although the big enclosed domes are the highlight the surrounding, mostly tropical, gardens show the diversity of trees, palms and plants in a magnificent setting._x000D_
The flower dome has a huge array of plants, mostly in flower, from all over the world and is set out in countries and regions. The cloud rain forest dome is a little more specific as most of the plants are from higher altitude, cooler tropical area and has numerous more "indoor" types of plants. A large diverse array of orchards adds much of the colour in there along with gesneriads and other exotica._x000D_
There are flash more expensive places to eat but my preference is the food market area near the children's playground - satay is great._x000D_
If your love plants, plan on seeing this over two days._x000D_
A must see in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited here as part of an organised tour which took in the light show at night and we returned on another day to view the Cloud Forest Dome and the Flower Dome as well as walk through the gardens and admire them during the dat. Truly magnificent and worth the time and effort. The whole experience is worth a full day to really appreciate the amazing horticultural, engineering, climate friendly and energy saving strategies thAt are demonstrated here. It is really worth doing the organised tour because it saves money and also because the guides do give a great and important perspective on what there is to know about this amazing project that is located entirely on reclaimed land. A tribute to the ingenuity of the Singaporean people.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens By The Bay is absolutely amazing!! Itâ€™s near the Bayfront stop on the MRT. Gardens By The Bay includes 3 in my opinion the most outstanding Singapore attractions, 1) Flower Dome 2) Cloud Forest and 3) Supertree Grove. You will be amazed. Highly recommend!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Passes the time in a lack lustre Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY: Plenty of walking. Good place to get some fresh air and exercise away from the air conditioning and restuarants.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard St. is a one-way big road. Major shopping centers where there are famous world wide brand shops stand along this street. And there are MRT stations and Bus stops along to this street. Around here is clean and safe place, and is very helpful place for moving and shopping.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Chinatown is a great way to experience some of the Chinese culture. Mostly lots of shopping and food. Definitely barter prices down here. If you don't like the deal you'll find plenty of other places selling the same stuff. Nice way to spend a little extra time.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Awesome visit especially if you love flowers
REVIEW_BODY:
Brought our Japanese visitor in late November when the Christmas decorations were up._x000D_
_x000D_
It was beautiful, with colourful flowers everywhere you turn. Plus the Christmas decorations made it all the more festive._x000D_
_x000D_
The Flower Dome, one of the two conservatories in Gardens by the Bay, is a great place to visit especially if you love nature, parks and gardens, especially flowers._x000D_
_x000D_
Lots of picture opportunities for the shutterbugs._x000D_
_x000D_
There is also a food and beverage outlet inside the Flower Dome if you wish to spend more time inside.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Christmas 2016 light up was amazing, with the Luminaries absolutely fantastic. The Christmas themed display at 7:45 (and 8:45)pm were great, although I expect the standard year round ones are probably pretty good too.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Unfortunately was quite short on time, so didn't have the opportunity to look inside the conservatories. The Supertree Grove is good to see, it started raining during our trip which meant the high walkway was closed.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the top 10 things to do in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
A very colorful area (Kampong Glam) of Singapore which reflects the Arab / Middle Eastern heritage of the Island. It is on the red bus red tour and has a stop round the corner. Arab street and the surrounding area is full of cafes, shops and restaurants. The highlight of the area is the Sultan Mosque which has an interesting story going back to the original ruling Sultan of the region and Stamford Raffles period._x000D_
If you are shopping for a real good quality silk scarf try Dilip on 74 Arab street._x000D_
Also visit Haji lane next door which has interesting boutique shops.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Flyer was part of the city tour and we fully enjoyed it. What an amazing view of Singapore ! Large capsules with a capacity to occupy 20+ folks is an ultra large merry-go-round at a slow pace. Takes about 30+ minutes for the full circle._x000D_
_x000D_
You can do it once, worth the visits and the grand view of the sea and the city.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard road is one the most famous road for shopping in Singapore. Best of the showrooms are plenty of 5 star staying option are available.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It was great, but since we didn't see the Lion and Australian outback, cause of the upgrading - can't give it a 5 star._x000D_
_x000D_
The place was clean and nice. Whoever designed the place did a good job. It's clearly thought through where and what is located. Everything is on the way and it is easily walkable if you take your time and enjoy the zoo._x000D_
_x000D_
Thank you for this experience!_x000D_
_x000D_
P.S. We spent total 5+ hours there!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice peaceful place to get away from the hussle and bustle of the city. There are a couple of cafes to get some food and drinks, both are fairly expensive though.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great weather-neutral attraction but can be quite crowded at times
REVIEW_BODY:
We finally made it to the Flower Dome last weekend. Although we tried to go early on the Sunday morning to avoid the crowds, we saw many tour groups who thought the same too._x000D_
_x000D_
The flowers were nice and I appreciated having the mini write-ups that were easy on the eyes. The air-conditioning was great, especially since we spend a large part of the year enjoying 30+degrees heat._x000D_
_x000D_
I'm not sure about the crowds though so I'm going to say if you prefer to visit places that are not overcrowded, the Flower Dome is not for you._x000D_
_x000D_
However the air-conditioning and shelter is a plus point since you can visit the place regardless of how hot or how wet it is outside. We took a taxi in and it was sheltered all the way from the drop off point until the Flower Dome itself._x000D_
_x000D_
If you only have time for one attraction, the Cloud Forest would be a better use of your time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: At night, the light game is delightful. Allows you to feel as if you were on another planet. A pleasant walk both day and night
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: $8 tickets for a skywalk between the towers. Best to do it in the evening/night and not the daytime as you will get nuked by the sun and be all hot and sweaty!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As it was out of town it was a 25 min journey direct on central line from nichol highway . Well worth the trip
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Very crowded don't expect to stop and smell the roses
REVIEW_BODY:
Really disappointed to be honest. Ticket pricing is complicated but I recommend you get the "bus" return ticket included as well as entry to the flower dome, sky walk and rainforest. Staff were very grumpy and not helpful. It was extremely crowded (dangerously so) so you could not stop to take many photos or see the exhibits. All very rushed as you need to follow the crowds (there seems to be one way to walk around it's like Ikea on a weekend...hellish)_x000D_
Would not return as I say maybe it's incredible when it's quiet but staff told us it never is quiet so don't waste your money. Take photos from outside it's just as impressive
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful zoo with so much to see. The biggest highlight are the baby orangutans. they are adorable. We walked majority of it but you can take the tram to get to other stations. i recommend that you leave more than 4 hours if you want to see it all. Remember it is out in the open as we saw a snake out on one of the paths as it dropped out of the tree after a mouse. I dont do snakes so lets just say i screamed very loudly
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Perfect place to view laser light show
REVIEW_BODY: Your can really enjoy laser light show from here, its free show runs everyday, there is plenty of space to watch
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful thing to do if your in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: It was lovely to visit the gardens and the flower dome which is air conditioned and a great way to escape the heat. The gardens are beautiful and inspiring with many sculptures incorporated into the gardens. Loved it!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: So well-maintained and surprises around every corner. Beautiful diversity. Well worth the cost and able to accommodate crowds easily.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Very Excellent..i enjoyed every second.. beautiful animals &sea life.. very enjoyable
REVIEW_BODY: River safari is worth visiting.. it is a truly a fun way to realize that sealife is so beautiful & unique..River safari maintains the beautiful aquariums ,which i treasure in my hearts.. Go there with a positive mindset & you will receive those great happy vibrations! Thats how i fwlt
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Brought my two boys aged 8 and 3 1/2 years old to the zoo yesterday morning. We didn't explore the entire zoo the last time we were there in December so this time, we made an effort to visit those places we missed such as Reptopia and the Kidzworld zone and managed to catch the Animal Friends Show this time round. My boys had fun petting the rabbits and feeding the goats. We'll definitely be back again during the June school holidays.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Outstanding Museum Building and Innovative Presentations
REVIEW_BODY: The architecture is outstanding -- combining 2 historical buildings to create this museum was extremely well done! The collection of art from many Asian countries is superb. This is a must-see destination in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fabulous for anyone interested in orchids
REVIEW_BODY: This garden is not free to entre (S$5) so not at all expensive. Do take water with you as most of the orchids are outside.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A word of advice - wear comfortable shoes as the park is huge and will take you all day to get through it. There are numerous different bird species. A lot of these birds, you'd only ever see, when you watch "David Attenborough's Nature Shows"!! If you love colourful birds and exotic birds, this is a place to go.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful and Amazing place is a Must
REVIEW_BODY: The gardens by the bay was excellent and good for families. We came here when the Christmas decorations were up and it was very well done and interesting to look at. And the indoor waterfall was amazing. The walk took you along high above the ground around the waterfall and you got some great views inside and out. Great place to come and is definitely a must for all.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Grest View from a fantastic building
REVIEW_BODY: Amazing views across the city, something you must do when visiting Singapore. Perhaps good to visit just before the sun sets to see the view in daylight and also the city lit up at night
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Go here if you have not much else better to do. Or if you're an outright botany loving person. It's pretty and well made but there's nothing particularly unique about it.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Although the views are amazing, the fact that there is no shade, nowhere to sit and limited space we were very disappointed. We understand that you need to encourage people to get through quickly and donâ€™t want them hanging around too long it was not worth the money.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of our favourite places to visit every time we come to Singapore. There is always a new theme in the Flower Dome each time we come. There are many beautiful plants, trees and flowers and even fruit trees from all around the world. A must see!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice gardens next to several other sights near Marina Bay complex, Worth the time to take a stroll. Lovely gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great fun and a amazing place!
REVIEW_BODY: We visited with our family of 5 adults and 6 kids! This place is truly a place Singaporeans can be proud of!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We stumbled onto this beautiful temple in Chinatown. It is clean and well maintained both inside and out. We enjoyed visiting this temple because it is located merely a block from the Chinatown complex
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is indoors and air conditioned. It is flowers, shrubbery, and trees._x000D_
_x000D_
Most flora is from the Eastern and Southern Hemisphere, with a few Western Hempishere offerings._x000D_
_x000D_
The Hydrangeas are impressive._x000D_
_x000D_
There's nothing all that wrong with the gardens, just the tourists taking selfies every minute and blocking the beauty of the flowers and scenery made this a bit annoying. I also found it a bit too air conditioned for my liking._x000D_
_x000D_
If you were short on time and had to decide what to do, I would opt for the cloud forest, the super trees and walking around the gardens. Having said that, if you have not seen a wide variety of flowers from the southern or eastern hemisphere, it is worth visiting as everything is conveniently located under one roof...from proteas to hibiscus and various ficus trees._x000D_
_x000D_
You can purchase a ticket to do the flower dome and cloud forest._x000D_
_x000D_
I also found that it was a bit too manicured and disney-ish for my liking. Out of all the exhibits, this might be the most kid friendly as there is a lot of sensory overload.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its refreshing place,tidy place. Not a fan with garden view but this is great place to waste your time at singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Free 12 minutes light show at 8 pm and every night. Two bars are along side. If you have time and you want relax at night, this place suits for you. MRT is just 2 mins walkable distance.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It would be easy to spend 3 days in the gardens. There is so much to see. Truly a wonder of the world and worth visiting.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a must visit if you like Gardens. Very extraordinary and breathtakingly. Remember to bring a jacket or sweater as it can be cold inside.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If youâ€™re not lucky enough to stay at this hotel - do the next best thing and go to the top and look across Singaporeâ€™s amazing skyline. You can see much from up there - itâ€™s worth the money.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Definitely visit but check maintenance dated
REVIEW_BODY: Various parts of the Gardens are closed for maintenance one day a month. Check the website. You don't want to miss the skywalk. The Gardens themselves are free but the conservatories have an entry fee. There is a restaurant and bar at the top of the tallest supertree. The view from the bar at sunset is worth seeing but you can't see the light show from up there and you don't want to miss that. Do make sure you're back on the ground at show time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you are in Singapore, this is a must visit. As the symbol of the city state, it attracts a lot of tourists all around the day. There's some "competition" to get a position for good photo shots; some of the tourists are quite pushy._x000D_
_x000D_
I am actually quite fond of the smaller Merlion in the park. It's a cute statute, just about the human size._x000D_
_x000D_
The Fullerton Hotel, a former central post office, gives a nice touch to the area. There are some nice sculptures by the hotel that you see on the way from the Raffles Place MRT station.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We watched the light show at night and stayed at the promenade walking around till late. Singapore is a very safe place to roam around at night, and you can catch the last train or bus home around 11:30ish.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Cloude forest to see in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Very beautifull park in the gardens by the bay. A nice waterfall and a lot of plants and flowers. A recommondation to see.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is nearly 9 foot tall structure with head of lion and body of fish. Located in Bay Area, close to Fullerton hotel. Provides good view of Marina Bay, Financial district and Singapore Flyer. Nice place to click pictures. Can get bit crowded but a fun place overall!
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This bay area is a nice place to see, especially at night with all the lights around the bay! Go to the bay and have satay at the local hawker stalls!
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: After a lovely meal at the marina it was lovely to finish the evening of with a nice walk around the Bay.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Had a fantastic time with the kids. The shows are wonderful. They also had a special dragons and Beast exhibition and the kids collected badges and pins, coloring sheets and craft pages, what a bonus! Great day out for all!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We decided to go to Gardens by the Bay for their Light Show last weekend. We caught the MRT to Bayfront and walked the short distance to the Gardens. The first show was at 7.45pm and we arrived with five minutes to spare. It started right on time and went for 10 minutes. It was very pretty and the music was the Danube Waltz and other popular waltz's. The second show is at 8.45pm. It is free and well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: a boring ride but with nice view
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore skyline is certainly wonderful, especially at the sunset. The ride is however so slow that can become boring. Having 20 people per capsule also ruin the atmosphere. Suggest to board around 6.45/7 to catch the best of day and night
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The heritage of one of Singapore's dynamic culture, the Peranakan - fully encapsulated in this intimate museum also the private home of its owner. Be immersed with the unique blend of the Malay/Chinese culture, arts, music, cuisine, and warm hospitality of the owner!
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited china town to grab som light lanterns which they have a huge selection of and they are very cheap. We also had yum Cha with our local friends. It's very very cheap, traditional and tasty. Don't go to the fancy restaurants here. Eat at a small street stall, with plastic chairs and tables out front and not 4 or 5 star._x000D_
Experience their culture. It's great fun.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of famous tourist attraction which needs to be visited in Singapore definitely.ideally you should go around 6.30 in eveng so that you can click pics during day time as well as night.it looks amazing at night.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Enjoyed our time at Gardens by the Bay._x000D_
_x000D_
A very warm day so we sought refuge in the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest. Both beautiful and cool. Then a short walk to near McDonalds to the shuttle which for a small fee took us on an express ride around the outside gardens for 20 minutes._x000D_
_x000D_
You could spend the day here but for us a few hours was perfect in the heat._x000D_
_x000D_
Lovely gift shop too. I purchased a very nice tea towel as a momento._x000D_
_x000D_
My favourite was the cacti in the cloud dome. Awe-inspiring.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very unique - as its name suggests, it features not only art created with advanced technology but also using art to explain technology as well. Small venue, emphasis on special exhibitions. Fee adds up to see all special exhibitions. Came during Singapore Art Week that it joined National Gallery on Minimalism.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the most beautiful places to visit in Singapore. Not to mention all the amazing Mediterranean restaurants close to it. Would highly recommend!
ADDRESS: 3 Muscat Street Masjid Sultan, Singapore 198833, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Easy to get to by bus or MRT. Has one of the best Orchid collections in the world. Free entry into park but will cost $5 for the orchid garden if you are not a local. The walking is very pleasant with many shaded areas. Also there are both high end restaurant and cheap eateries inside the park, so no need to pack your KFC or sandwich. There is a large casual dinner next to the main carpark at the basement, but the food quality is average (very); also you may need to queue up for a long while just to place the order - there is just one cashier who takes order 1 dish at a time and when you have a line of 20 people queuing! I cannot think of a more inefficient set up. W
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you have the money ,this is the place to spend. Paragon, tang and takashimaya are the places to go. Many more malls on this road. you also have best places to stay with super cool hotels, st.regis, marriott, four seasons to name a few
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bay is a perfect day out with family and friends. For children and adults an immersion into the main topics that concern the human being nowadays: global warming, nature, energy among others._x000D_
I recommend the visit in the afternoon so you can finish the day watching the lights show in the evening.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: With Tamil an official language of Singapore, Little India and it's local population bring forth a realistic Indian experience
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is sort of a Museum and kind of historical place to show you the origin of Chinatown. This place shows you how Chinese people migrated from China to Singapore in hope for better lifestyle, their hardships here, their professions, their success stories and how they became the modern Singaporeans. This is must visit place if you are a History buff.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There at so beautiful and grateful! I will go to there again. It use solar energy for electricity of the garden, and recycle water. Itâ€™ So good!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
An enjoyable visit - taken in two parts on consecutive days._x000D_
_x000D_
The Two domes are full of interesting plants and displays. The super trees lit up well with beautiful music in the evening._x000D_
_x000D_
A great day._x000D_
_x000D_
To visit the super tree lights go a bit early and be prepared to sit on the ground. Tons of people as we visited in a Saturday night. There was some shuffling to get up the exit stairs but the numbers cleared soon._x000D_
_x000D_
On Saturday there were tons of kites flying at the marina. Satay by the bay did a roaring trade in good food.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This area includes Arab street and the area surrounding the Sultan Mosque. Great place to wonder through the shops looking for Middle Eastern products and trying ME retaurants.
ADDRESS: Kampong Glam, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice place to walk around and realax. We went into the temple with a guide. Its funny to hear about the first people who came here and buildt it. We saw pictures from the beginning and the se was close to the temple. Things changes, to the better, I`m not sure. Take a walk and explore Chinatown.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Birds eye view of the marina bay and gardens by the bay
REVIEW_BODY: Enjoyed a lovely sundown. Saw the Lights show of the gardens by the bay as well as the MBS. Good to chill out at the bar ce la vi. Though not the cheapest place for a visit but I feel itâ€™s worth it for a night out.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the helix bridge is an excellent and modern bridge building, very convenient to come from Marina Bay to the Sands Complex, modern Mall, Museum etc
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is amazing! You start the walk around a waterfalls - brilliantly done - one of the must-sees in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: great for whole family day ok and night better. very professionaljust see ticket office for best compbo tickets
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Definitely there are many places along the rive like Robertson Quay and Clarke Quay that have tons of restaurants and bars._x000D_
_x000D_
Great selection and choices for dining and drinking._x000D_
_x000D_
At night on the weekends both are packed._x000D_
_x000D_
There is a very nice walkway on the river.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Birds eye view of a truly beautiful city - from day to night
REVIEW_BODY:
Prior to going on the Singapore Flyer, the only other *big* wheel I'd been on was when they had one in Perth, WA a few years ago. A fear of heights has kept me off these things in the past. However, a helicopter flight over the 12 Apostles 3 years ago cured me of that [well up to a point]_x000D_
_x000D_
A fabulous taxi driver we had the previous day told us the best thing to do is try and go on the flyer a bit before sunset so you get to see the view in daylight hours, as the sun sets and then complete the ride as all of Singapore's CBD and the Marina and surrounds light up. Glad we took that advice because it is truly magical. The pods on the flyer can hold up to 30 people and are extremely sound when you are in them...no bumps or strange movements of any kind. We had a decent downpour of rain whilst on the flyer which simply added to the spectacle of it all [did make taking pics a bit ordinary once sun set was upon us and after but hey...should be looking with your eyes more than the lens anyway]
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: visited the zoo some years ago, it has improved...I love the way the animals can be seen with very few bars and grills, so you can get some great photos. We eat at the main restaurant, food was good quality and not a bad price, we got the special offer of group ticket of night safari, river and jurong bird park
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The tour by Bus was never going to be adequate to fully appreciate all the beauty on offer here. Only with half an hour to visit, much was achieved regardless. Stunning Orchids of every variety were on offer....
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Quite a small place. Plenty of photos to remind us of what our grandparents and parents had gone thru during the war. Quite scary how people were being tortured. I am so lucky I was not born in that era.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a great zoo, from the moment you step through the gates you have little cotton tail monkeys, jumping from branch to branch, beautiful gardens, and you must do the breakfast, and check out the toilets I know it's weird but they are great
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We have seen this garden from our balcony in Marina Bay Sands every morning. Once we went there. It's not free of charge but it's wonderful. Just wonderful. You have to see the gardens exactly by yourself
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited yesterday, and although not cheap it is definitely worth e money. Worth going early to avoid the queues.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The setting for this museum is spectacular in itself however unfortunately not enough of the building is on show. The museum is very well presented and provides a run down of the Malay Peninsular right through to independence for the Singapore state. There is very limited number of original artefacts to complement the displays - however there are numerous replicas and all is laid out in a very imaginative way. I spent around 2 hours here including a visit to the cafe. There are additional special exhibits which would take longer. I recommend if you are in the area and have some time to spare.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went after dinner to catch the best of the sunset and the Supergrove light show which was reviewed positively online by everyone. The metro trip was not far from our hotel and teh great Marina Bay Hotel is a wonder to view that led to the Gardens. A great light show(but totally a Mariah Carey Christmas spectacle) was worth the trip and it is best to find a place to sit on the sides of the Supergrove trees to view upwards. The Skywalk was nice if you can get up there as the queue was very long and people take their time on the walk which means waiting for 1 hour + to get up there!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Both day and night worth the visit
REVIEW_BODY:
Visited Gardens by the Bay both day and night. The night scene was magnificent. We walked from Marina Bay Sands Hotel via escalator to there. The night walk was leisurely and the weather was fantastic, not too hot and the breeze was lovely._x000D_
_x000D_
Went again during daytime to visit the Cloud Forrest and Flowers Dome. Entrance for adult is S$28 for both conservatories and is worth it with so many species of flowers and plants and vegetations. The stroll along the walk from the top of Cloud Forrest down to the basement was a wonderful experience. Even my 80 years old mother-in-law who was afraid of height enjoyed it so much!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a symbol of Singapore. It has its own history and so is worth a visit. Other than that it was just a photo shoot opportunity for tourists.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A nice tranquil place to relax in Singapore and get away from the humidity. The Gardens are well laid out, beautiful arrangements of the flowers, shrubs and trees
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There are so many things to do at the Marina Bay. From going through the Marina Bay Shoppes (and be in awe if you have a buck to spend), to going through the Marina Bay Sands hotel and having a view, to going to the Gardens by the Bay, or trying to casino, you will not be bored. Twice every night, there is a light show with lights, lasers, water fountains and music. Highly recommend to visit
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A Must Visit While In Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This zoo is amazing. All the animals are active and visible. There is a tram if you are unable to walk a lot which I enjoyed. The animals are well cared for and we enjoyed the shows.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely must visit with all.... It's wow..... Great for all age groups... Foliage is wow and the waterfall is truly magistrate n magical
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: If You can afford to Saturday here...
REVIEW_BODY: We couldnâ€™t afford to stay there this time but we went up t9 the observation deck and it was amazing, the restaurants look amazing, but itâ€™s bestto book in advance always seems to be full. Again the light show at 8Pm is awesome.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
There are many activities you can do here at east coast park- camping, cycling, pinic, skating and even enjoy the good food at the restaurants._x000D_
_x000D_
Great recreation for the young and the old. You can camp there without applying for a license. There are also bbq pits there.
ADDRESS: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road, Singapore 455486, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Supertree grove is something really different . It is lovely lit up at night . Especially viewing from Marina Bay Sands.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit to Garden by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: I had been to the Garden by Bay more than once but still a visit here is relaxing to the mind. Lying on the grass and watching the light and music show is totally captivating. It is relaxing to be in the open field to watch the show. Even if you do not want to watch it, you can lie down with your eyes closed and enjoy the music. There are quite a few restaurants offering good food. It definitely makes your day out enjoyable
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We took a ride on the flyer and were not disappointed. The views of the city are amazing. It wasnâ€™t particularly busy when we visited and so we had no wait, and an entire â€œpodâ€ to ourselves. It was a great way to orient ourselves on the first day in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its really beautiful human creation! You feel as you are in future. A lot og green, monuments and amazing way in the sky
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There are two parts to this activity - a ride that takes you round enclosures and then the opportunity to walk on paths taking you past other animals. If you can itâ€™s worth getting priority boarding for the tram ride as it lets you skip the queues which can be very long. The tram does not stop so you donâ€™t have the opportunity to stop and observe those animals and the continual movement makes any photography in dark conditions impractical. Having said that there is a fair chance of seeing some great animals like tapir fairly close up. Just ditch the camera for this part. More interesting are the paths where you can take your time and watch the animals. The high point for me was going into a large enclosure and seeing fruit bats just inches away - with no glass or barrier - eating and active. If you want to observe the animals at leisure the paths are less crowded and much more interesting than the â€œsafariâ€ ride.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice way to spend an hour
REVIEW_BODY: We live in Singapore, but went to the Gardens By the Bay for the first time when my parents visited recently from the US. We only went to the Flower Dome, which was a nice way to spend an hour on their first day in the city. I think we'll be back soon because my husband was quite impressed with all the trees procured from around the world.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: While I was on my trip to Singapore I tried out this attraction and I must was it was very nice to have a relaxing walk here
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very informative and interesting. Recommend doing with a tour. Is slightly more expensive but you skip all the queues. We went during peak time and it was well run. Good family outing.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: a very busy & happening place in Singapore. the best of malls are located here, you can shop for all branded items here.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It wasn't crowded on the day of visit. Exhibits are well maintained. Saw river rangers or keepers attending to unwell fish. Good job. Amazon river quest is fun. Mama Panda Restaurant food selection can be abit limited. Overall, had a great time!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good Place to Escape the City
REVIEW_BODY: There is no getting too far away from buildings in Singapore, but the huge and historic botanic gardens are one place you can get into the green and leafy areas while still quite central. So much to see, and plenty of places to wander. You are almost certainly bound to come across a great variety of wildlife too.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My husband has acquired a fear of heights, so I was very pleased that I went alone on this walk. One is able to take amazing photos from the various points around the walk. You get such a different perspective when up so high. the price was $8 pp
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Night Zoo Safari - a must visit in Singapore. One of the best in the world. Indeed a unique experience to see animals come alive at night.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: i have visited many zoos before, this is is one of the best, with many live shows, place is little far from main city but worth
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Outstanding tourist location must see and highly recommended
REVIEW_BODY:
Two paid scenic gardens that was sd $28 per person and worth every cent._x000D_
Exquisite gardens, cool rainforest environment with easy walk but bring comfortable walking shoes as location is huge._x000D_
Respect to Singapore planning and development to support creation of this eco friendly tourism venue. Itâ€™s a clear tourist winner which is good for the envrt and educational
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud Forest is an absolute must to see when in Singapore as it is so unique the way that it has been arranged.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The concept of a tropical forest set around a mountain with flowers, palms, tress, orchids and much more is an experience._x000D_
_x000D_
Take the lift to the top and gradually descend through the magical spaces looking down from meandering ramps._x000D_
_x000D_
Views through the dome to the bay are also spectacular._x000D_
_x000D_
When leaving the mountain the educational experience was a great surprise and continued the learning experience about how important the Forrestâ€™s are and how they contribute to the global eco system - the visit was a spectacular experience._x000D_
_x000D_
If you purchase the double ticket for the Bay Gardens Dome as well then I would recommend visiting the Forrest second which will be the icing on the cake._x000D_
_x000D_
A must do experience and you can still visit the Gardens free and see the Super Trees.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a very special place. It is simply beautiful. A few hours- a full day it is does not matter! Make the time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We set out early and got a taxi to the far end of the Southern Ridges. Then walked the length back to the finish near Sentosa Island. Great fun. Mixture of rain forest, bridges, walkways and great views. Go early to avoid the heat. It took about 4 hours at a leisurely pace and we enjoyed a cold beer at the end. But if you do not fancy the whole walk you could just do a section. They have a decent website which gives some suggestions. So go & do it rather than walking around yet another Singapore shopping mall!
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the flora and fauna is really eye catching. coupled with the fact that you can take long lazy strolls aroundthe gardden. the large trees are shady enough for a quier afternoon snooze and the restaurant out there is unbelievble in terms of food quality and design. The orchid garden is a peach. Well done singappore
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must for any lover of history
REVIEW_BODY: The ACM provides visitors with an insight to the cultures of the surrounding area. Packed with exhibits from all around Asia, the museum is a wonderful way to spend a few hours in an cool building enriching your Singapore exprience
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: If you like shopping in the high end stores, this is your place.
REVIEW_BODY: Well, really nice looking street with A LOT of high end stores. If you want to spend a lot of money, then you are at the right place.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Tip: Book an early tour to get a more personalised and intimate tour. We booked a tour at 9:30am, which left just our tour guide Jerome and the two of us._x000D_
_x000D_
My partner and I decided to take a tour of the historical Singapore Battlebox during our stay in the city November 2016. Whilst we were aware of the major points of Singapore history whilst under British Governance the Battlebox tour focuses on the fall of the city during World War 2._x000D_
_x000D_
With this in mind, I'd break my review up into two distinct parts; the Battlebox fortification itself and the company behind the tour Singapore History Consultants._x000D_
_x000D_
Firstly on the fort itself, this tour doesn't take you to a building that's survived the test of time expecting it to tell you a story on its own. The Battlebox doesn't do this as it has been preserved and repaired to such a state that modern day visitors can freely visit. To enchance this, each room with historical significance has been fleshed out with mannequins and furniture so that it's relevance will be understood when encountered. Small details like British and Japanese graffiti have been preserved too._x000D_
_x000D_
Moving onto the Tour Operators, I can only offer the highest praise to both the shop staff and the tour guide provided by Singapore History Consultants. The shop staff were welcoming and full of suggestions on things to do during our stay. Jerome our guide for the morning was a perfect dichotomy of manners, knowledge and charm. His sphere of knowledge wasn't just limited to the Singapore campaign but expanded to the entire Japanese theatre of war across the Pacific region. For those that might be doing their family research or know military participation in this part of the world, you'll gain a little bit more value._x000D_
_x000D_
Overall, the tour and all its various features are a great way to pass some time and learn more about the city if Singapore.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can spend days here and still can't visit all the shops. High fashion, restaurants, gadgets, and many more. The place is an attraction in itself
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Cool environment and focus on plants great. Has focal point seaonal as well as dedicated surroundings
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: if you love luxurious brands then this is the place for you, they've got almost every high end stores here. but dont buy your souvenirs here, its expensive. i had a friend here who bought keychains that i also bought at chinatown and it was 3x -4xcheaper
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We reluctantly did the trip up to the Skypark due to the expense - but as our youngest son (16) was very keen we relented. Although I still consider the expense ridiculously exorbitant it was a great experience. The views were amazing and we spent a good hour at the top.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A big contrast with the Orchard Road tourist area, the Botanic Garden is worth a 2 hour visit in the morning or late afternoon._x000D_
Beautifully maintained. Very green and clean. Very safe. Not particularly hot because of abundance of shade. Apart from paved road going round the garden, there are a few short trails through the tropical forest worth exploring. Map is available at the visitor centre. And within 15 minutes from most hotels by taxi. Also accessible by the MRT. Within the Botanic Garden is the Orchid Pavilion. Quality restaurants are found within the compound.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A nice little park in the business district. Walkable from esplanade MRT. A nice photo opportunity of marina bay Sands and of course 1 of the 7 Merlions placed around Singapore. Not am essential trip but a nice one if you have time.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Peaceful haven in a hectic city
REVIEW_BODY: Had a wonderful time here lovely and peaceful went to see the national orchids collection while we were there ,beautifully laid out lots of different plants to see and we even saw some lizards which seemed used to people being about
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Highly decorated, very calm and peaceful
REVIEW_BODY: This is a small temple in the heart of little India, the decorative interior is beautiful, highly ornate and I am guessing you would see something different every time you visited. Lovely peaceful vibe, if only this could be resonated all over the world eh?
ADDRESS: 141 Serangoon Road, Singapore 218042, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: With the river safari there is a boat safari to see animals it is totally worth the visit. Must visit the pandas. Atleast keep 5 hours for this visit. Very entertaining for children and adults. Must go !
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the things that will have me returning to Singapore is the gardens by the bay and the supertree grove. It is worth paying for access to to the suspended walkway between two of the larger structures - make sure you walk down via the outside stairs to see how the "trees" are constructed. Just be aware, if you are not good on heights, you may not like the walkway - it moves! However, it is worth it for the views.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: River view in night and city tour
REVIEW_BODY: You can have river cruise for 25SGD. They will tell you full history of singapore and have a tirp of river for 40 mins. This is also a amazing experience. But if you have visited Garden by bay , marina bay or singapore flyer then this is nothing against those.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The admission price is well worth it. It is a spectacular display. The variety of plants and the construction of the mountain to show them off with the huge indoor waterfall can not be missed.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a must visit area for all tourist. Best time would be from dusk till after the lazer light show 8.15 PM. If weather permits and feeling energetic suggest a walk / jog around the marina bay.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Pls don't miss this one. You will definitely get to see the view of Singapore from the flyer. Worth visiting.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were shuttled from a location 1 block from our hotel to a large hotel where numerous tours were to set off from. We arrived at the Zoo and were rushed to the buffet. Food was ok and lots of variety on offer. Next to the train ride. As an after dark tour to view nocturnal animals it was always going to be a hit and miss to actually see any animals. Forget getting any photos in low light with constant movement in the train. Then a choice to either see a "show" or walk back t0o view some of the animals. I chose the "show". I saw possibly 2/3 reds and left. Back to our transfer bus.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one attraction must visit. There are a lot of things to see. If you are bringing your children there remember bring an extra change so that they can play at the water park. They will really enjoy it. It's very easy to get there and you can spent a whole day. I really enjoyed my visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I love to visit and go around this bridge at night, so many beautiful lighting.. But it's so crowded.. maybe at that time there's marina i light show..
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went there after lunch. Rode the MRT to Bayfront. The place is awesome. At Lost World different plant species are seen. Beautiful! The cloud walk was thrilling. But it rained so hard we had to go back to Bayfront. Tree top Skyway was closed due to the bad weather.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of Singaporeâ€™s must visit destinations. The Cloud Dome and Flower Dome are just amazing. It is a huge area so allow plenty of time and wear comfortable shoes! Really enjoyed our experience and would highly recommend a visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You get the whole city view and it looks stunning at the night. can spend 30-45 mins there. It's a good alternate to the flyer.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great site to visit! Worth the extra cost to visit conservatories. The light show at the end of the day is worth the wait. So if you get there by 4:00 p.m., you will have enough time to visit the conservatories, get a bite to eat and then enjoy the light show!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: very beautiful. a must visit attraction for the whole family! cloud forest is the best. The staff very friendly
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Entered through the 7.15pm ticket (best to buy online beforehand) and immediately went for the Creatures of the Night show, where we learnt more about nocturnal animals. We also walked all the trails and took the tram. It was a fun and interactive environment where we learnt more about the animals at the Night Safari. We also encountered a few student volunteers at the crocodile enclosure who told us more about the crocodiles and their volunteering programme where they come to the Night Safari to talk to visitors to increase awareness on conservation on animals, which was a great takeaway for us. Had an enriching time!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the orchids garden as part of a island tour. The gardens were beautiful. Unfortunately we only had an hour and did not have the time to 're-visit. Would recommend a visit to everyone
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is an excellent place to take in the night views, the lighting is spectacular over Singapore. The staff were friendly enough but initially we were told by hotel staff that it was closed at 10pm, we got in before closing at 11pm. This was a great experience & well worth doing & cost approx $23.00 each. Only complaint would be that we were famished but couldn't eat at the restaurant because we weren't staying in the hotel, it would have topped the night off beautifully.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must do in Singapore! There's loads to see so wear comfy shoes! Stay for the light show only 20 minutes but well worth it!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was a great day out, undercover so any weather but great when the sunshines. Walkways above the canopy were unbelievable getting you right up amongst the canopy.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a pleasant walk from the SMRT station to the Orchid Garden. You will see plants that you donâ€™t see often or donâ€™t know they exist. If you like flowers donâ€™t miss the Orchid Garden though you have to pay $5 for entertaining. (The Botanic Garden is free). The VIP section showcases new varieties especially cultivated for important visitors to Singapore. You might not find them elsewhere in the world. A reminder: if you come here from a temperate region, do go there in the morning or evening.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very tranquil and relaxing place after the hustle and bustle of the city. The gardens are very well cared for and worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Our hotel Holiday Inn express was close proximity to the river. On the river banks there are many eateries where people gather in the evening. There are boat ride rides to Merilions from the Singapore river Marina.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An amazing experience. Thoroughly recommend this venue. All my party enjoyed this from young to old.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We came there in the evening and couldn't find the right entrance first but when you're up there, you may easily forget everything and just enjoy yourselves. The entrance fee is a bit pricey but it's worth it, the view is amazing.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The tour of this famous bomb proof underground command centre for the allied forces in Singapore during the the Malaysia campaign is well worth doing._x000D_
It is situated under Fort Canning easily accessed from the CBD by train or taxi._x000D_
The guided tour takes approximately an hour and a quarter._x000D_
The visitors centre is stocked with books and souvenirs relative to the tour._x000D_
Friendly staff and guides makes this a must do activity for anyone with an interest in history.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely compact Chinatown with lots of cheap shopping and places to eat. I stayed here and it was perfect, close to the MRT, close to downtown and many of the places you'd want to visit and inexpensive hotels everywhere. Great temples to explore also Buddist, Taoist (Chinese) and Hindu.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Light Show With Great Chance For A Lovely Picture
REVIEW_BODY: Waterfront Promenade is very well kept and maintained and it has a wonderful light show at night. It is definitely located in one of the prime areas in Singapore and this is definitely one of the best spots to take pictures and also a perfect place to stroll around. Just love it to the core.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The swimming pool is the highlight of this place. And hey, a platform that looks like an airplane connecting three hotels? Yeah, it's a great attraction!!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore is one amazing place and cloud forest i would say is one of Singapore's prime visiting place. the view is amazing cant believe its man made forest.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you have children make sure you visit the Children's park - and bring bathers/towel/change of clothes as you won't be able to keep them out of the water park!_x000D_
Stay for the night light show, which started about 7:30pm when we were there. Most things here are free, but you can pay to access the cloud forest dome and the flower dome as well as the walkway in the super tree grove._x000D_
We got to see some wild otters eating fish in the bay across from satay by the bay - definitely worth the walk down to sample some local delights.. This place is great for a relaxing walk or something more exciting.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A visit to the legends character world
REVIEW_BODY: We can walk around the park for an hour or two, there are many statues, Chinese legends and warrior characters to enjoy
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Make it part of your 'Gardens in the Bay' visit and take tour time as you enjoy the cool and wonderfully fresh air. Your kids will live you for taking them.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went here in the evening to see the light show. Unfortunately it was drizzling however it was still worth putting up with a bit of rain. Amazing show with accompanying music. Because of the risk of thunder/lightning the sky walk was closed which was disappointing. If you want a seat, you need to get there early. Also wear insect repellent as there are quite a few mosquitos about. The teenagers enjoyed it but weren't interested in walking round the gardens beforehand!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Totally mind blowing the range and quantity of plants in this complex. The fact that it is so cool in the air con makes for a wonderful place to explore. The age and size of some of the plants is amazing, must be worth soooo much
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent a very enjoyable couple of hours here wandering around the free bits. Paid the $8 to go up across the skywalk for wonderful views of the city and Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Even kept my 16 year old son interested. Lovely place to contrast with the hustle and bustle of the city's shopping streets.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was a very good experience. Did not go up to the hanging walkway as the queue was far too long. The show was amazing! Never seen anything so entertaining, but wish there was somewhere for my elderly mother to sit down and enjoy the show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Bit dissapointing cloud forest was closed. Heat does not help, some shadow roof over waiting lines would be really nice
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Especially in the hot summer months, walking in here is not only a cool relief, the waterfall spritzes you and you feel instantly refreshed. Definitely one of my faves.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: visited during my recent Singapore trip. The temple had Nice calming impact, with so many idols of Buddha one gets transformed into a different world
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A personal tour by Alvin Yapp and a wonderful discussion about cross-cultural heritage, influences and perspectives.
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful displays of gardens from around the world in one magnificent setting. Spectacular light show after dark.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited at night. Bustling with people. Families with children. Went up and got breathtaking views of skyscrapers, F1 racetrack, Straits of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The story of Singapore's surrender and the consequences - very moving
REVIEW_BODY: Not large a large museum but it captures the essence of the period a very moving experience; my wifeâ€™s step-grandfather was a prisoner. One leaves almost numbed by the brutality of the Japanese invaders, which the displays clearly show. If visiting by cab â€“ the museum will call a cab if you need one for your return journey.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing recreation of a rainforest. Must visit when in Singapore. There are multiple levels, each devoted to one aspect of what can be seen in a rainforest.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My wife is a very keen gardener, me not so much but this trip to Singapore was because I wanted to take her to the garden, I knew she would love it. We both loved it, absolutely beautiful. As well as an amazing feat of engineering. When they do something in Singapore they do it on a grand scale.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice way to end a day
REVIEW_BODY: You get the perfect sunset from the restaurant on the rooftop. Drinks and food is very nice. I cannot think of a better way to end a day.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the Gardens over Christmas. The place had lovely decorations and a Christmas market to boot. The plant variety was stunning and a visit to both the domes was truly worth it!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Besides lots of fabric stores and some restaurants selling food there isn't much around. I did enjoy eating at Zam Zam which is very closely by so check that out!
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: this is a mountain shape with greenery growing up it. it is way to pricey and done within 20min. spend ur money better at the singapore zoo
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: No one knows how to do zoos like Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY:
Cost: S33 adults, S22 kids_x000D_
Hours: 8:30am-5:30pm_x000D_
Duration: Hours_x000D_
_x000D_
No one knows how to do zoos like Singapore! There is so much to see, do and pet!_x000D_
They have swing monkeys around and peacocks in the parking lot. If you dont have a car they have a public bus going there, it's not accessible by public train.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore
