REVIEW_BODY: Just to walk through and see all the different plant and trees from different area of the world. Even no gardeners would be in 7th heaven
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Don't Miss the show and the View from a Super Tree
REVIEW_BODY:
Nice during night where the light show is at around 7.00 to 7.30 p.m. If you want to catch it, better arrive early since there is a queue._x000D_
Spend around 40SGD and get to the top of the Super Tree. The view is a unique experience where you can hav 1to 2 hours of relaxation.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: going for a stroll in the Garden by the Bay is quite an experience. Something anyone could really enjoy ~ except for the insects, mosquitoes! Take along some insect repellent sprays ~ anything at all.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful time at the Cloud forest
REVIEW_BODY: If you are going to the gardens by the bay you must seem the cloud forest, you have to pay $26 each to visit this and the flower garden but it is worth it just remember to check what time the fogging times are for the best pictures.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This used to be my green paradise when I was living in Singapore years ago. Not much has changed in this beautiful park and it always brings back wonderful memories of my life in this charming city I used to call home. A wonderful haven of peace and greenery, the best park ever to have picnics, a jog and fish feeding! Just be careful as the fish swarm straight towards your fingers and toes as soon as they spot a shadow in the water! I love this place and it's one of my favourites each time I'm home in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Th gallery has a wonderful collection and excellently curated. There was road construction for the Grand Prix during my visit and accessibility was a problem. However, this attraction must not be missed
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We bought the $28 pass which covered both the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest._x000D_
_x000D_
You can return after exit if you get a stamp upon exit for both._x000D_
_x000D_
It is worth going to both in daylight and after dark as the lighting changes everything._x000D_
_x000D_
If you cannot do this then go to the Flower Garden before the Cloud Forest as the spectacle and ambience are better in this order.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We had pre-booked Breakfast with the Orangutans and what a treat So well organized plenty of choice for breakfast before the Orangutans made their appearance. The Keepers and Oragutans were very generous with their time and the support staff were wonderful taking photo's for purchase as well as with the guests camera's and ensuring that the Oragutans were available to everyone._x000D_
_x000D_
The rest of the Zoo was as impressive, clean and very healthy animals._x000D_
_x000D_
Highly recommend this experience
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Perfect for families with younger children,up to 15ish. We enjoyed it, but you do it once. Really good organization and well worth staying up late for the kids. It is essential that the smaller children are prepared by there parents so they can be quiet and look and listen for the animals etc. Great fun.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Spectacular swath of beauty in urban Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This beautifully maintained garden has a huge variety of spots to enjoy Singapore's natural beauty. It's an easy trip from downtown -- about 12 minutes on MRT, which lets out right at the gate. There are lakes, gardens and patch of rainforest that evokes the Singapura of 200 years ago. The highlight is, of course the orchid garden, which was partially closed when I visited, but was, even so, worth the $5 price of admission. Other than the orchid garden, the park is free. You'll see yoga classes and elderly folks practicing Tai Chi. There are restaurants and snack bars throughout. There's also a children's park.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A mild, dry climate and features plants found in the Mediterranean and other semi-arid tropical regions. As a nature lover, we went there after the visit from Cloud Forest; and this place doesn't disappoints. It was good!.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Love Orchard Road for spend all day for shopping and eating, love the Boutiques,can find everything what ever we are looking for.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Definitely worth a visit. We had a lovely morning looking around and it wasn't busy so I would suggest going before lunchtime to avoid crowds and to get uninterrupted photos.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Should had been part of the Zoo
REVIEW_BODY:
To be honest, the exhibits are not all that bad. There is a good insight into the fresh water ecosystem and animals staying there. But the major problem here is the value: We had to pay extra to see things that should had been part of the Zoo anyway. Eg. The Pandas are part of River Safari instead of Zoo. The Boat rides are chargable too..._x000D_
_x000D_
So if someone wants to see ALL the animals, they will need to pay double for Zoo and River Safari._x000D_
_x000D_
Not recommended...
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Gives a good perspective on Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Whenever I tour friends around Singapore, I always make sure this little museum in the CBD is one of the first stop. It primarily tells how Singapore was planned and gives a good introduction to life in the Little Red Dot. From how Singapore gets its water, to how it disposes of its waste, how its communities are planned and the types of housing that has evolved over the years, this little gallery showcases all these.
ADDRESS: 45 Maxwell Road The Ura Centre | The URA Centre, Level 2, Singapore 069118, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Best place in Singapore to run, especially for one who loves running in trails. The treetop walk is also a highly popular place for families and couples especially.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went with 2 teenage kids. Was a bit sceptical but as it turned out we all had a great day. Very hot and humid and a bit of walking to do however the orchids on display were amazing and beautiful. Would highly recommend and would do it again.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The botanic garden is something unique. It is under Unesco patrimony. The orchids are more than wonderful and if you want to relax, there is a nice bar inside
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing gardens, the botanical gardens of the future, simply stunning. Amazing walkways, including great overhead access to view the gardens from above. The indoor facility is spectacular with waterfalls and high level views of plants and environments from all over the world. Singapore at its best.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Peace and quiet close to City
REVIEW_BODY: Loved the sky walk between towers. Storm came up and towers were closed for about 1/2 hour before opening again. Lovely afternoon out
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: So hard to get a full shape of the bridge.
REVIEW_BODY: Good place for exercise, fresh air, but it's so hot in the noon. You better come here early in the morning.
ADDRESS: 221 Henderson Road Henderson Building, Singapore 159557, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spend 2 hrs there! The audio guide explain well, It's really a must see if you want to know the history of china town in singapore
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Largest Air-conditioned Greenhouse Dome x 2; Diversity of Specimens
REVIEW_BODY:
There are 2 air-conditioned giant domes housing a great diversity flowers and plants from all over the world._x000D_
_x000D_
Now that I live in a country with a garden, I greatly appreciate the great amount work that goes into maintaining an enormous garden like these two domes._x000D_
An amateur gardener taking care of a house garden already have to contend with weeds that seem to grow faster than the flowering plants we want to grow or weeds surrounding our fruit trees._x000D_
Then there are continuous attacks of pests and diseases._x000D_
I am impressed that the plants in the dome garden are so healthy looking and flowers most of the time for visitors to view._x000D_
There is also a small glass room that was supposed to have butterflies._x000D_
But on the day I visited, the would be butterflies are still in their cocoon._x000D_
_x000D_
I am also amazed at some of the trees which must have been very old - like the ancient olive trees, which are said to be 100 of years old._x000D_
I can grow an olive tree now in the garden where I live, but I will never see it becoming like the specimens the Gardens By The Bay have._x000D_
_x000D_
I timed my visit closer to the late afternoon so that just before sunset, I can visit the Skywalk linking the Supertrees (artificial trees with solar cells)._x000D_
As the sun sets, and the multi-coloured lights are switched on, we can take very nice photos of the multi-coloured lighted Supertrees with the Boat Shaped Marina Bay Sands Hotel and the lighted Ferris Wheel in the background._x000D_
Also it is cooler in the evening to take this Skywalk
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: yes... i already in singapore... 2013 december
REVIEW_BODY: december 2013 year... i already visit singapore in place train mrt and lrt nice.. i like it singapore nice.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited this free attraction during the day and were amazed. We came again in the evening and were blown away by the impressive light show held twice each evening. The gardens are open through to the early hours of the morning.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Free attraction that is beautiful. Highly recommend taking the buggy tour for the information about all the history, gardens and environment. Very enjoyable day
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A good bird park with lot of birds and you can enjoy the nature. Its little bit far away from the city. However its very well connected through MRT and taxis are easily available.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Annual visit to Kranji to remember the war and pay respects. The memorial is very well kept and recommend a visit to.
ADDRESS: 9 Woodlands Road, Singapore 738656, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Everyone should make time to see theses beautiful gardens , and the whole area is just so worth seeing.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The National Museum of Singapore is one of the finest museums Iâ€™ve visited. Itâ€™s up-to-date, comprehensively filled with exhibits that are highly informative and logically laid out. You can spend a good half-day there at least and still want to go back for more!
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you are an avid shopper this is the place to be for the high end market. I am not a shopper but it is a must see for anyone visiting Singapore for the first time. Although their are now a lot of shopping centres around Singapore these days, Orchard Road_x000D_
has been there from virtually day one and is still an amazing place to visit whether you are a "buyer" or a "window shopper"
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This museum displays a chronicle of Singapore that is very intriguing, you are taken through the museum from the birth of Singapore to present day, many displays have audio commentary which is very helpful, small entry fee applies..
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent for an evening riverside stroll
REVIEW_BODY: Nearly every evening of my visit, I wandered for an hour or two along the Singapore Riverfront, watching the endlessly-varying crowds with that amazing Singapore skyline backlighting it all. The history I'd seen in the day faded back a bit, and instead it seemed as if I was walking live into some fantastic city of the future. And I was.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Broke visit over to days. Went to the skyway first which was not bad, probably be better at night. Domes worth a visit if you were to pick only one spot to go. Earlier in the morning is best for the domes too.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Make sure you allow yourself the time to wander this amazing park. entry into the two biospheres is a must they are simply amazing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This place is cold! Take a light shawl with you._x000D_
If you are not good with heights you might like to give the cloud walk a miss._x000D_
Otherwise well worth a visit. It's not cheap (S$28 for both domes) but at least some of the funds go to the upkeep of the extensive and free outside gardens. These gardens make for an enjoyable hour or so's walk in a quiet environment.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Must visit.. Awesome work and pleasure to visit.. We like Rainforest more.. Awesome.. Loved it.. In Singapore where ever you go, Need to walk.. Always wear comfortable shoes that support your ankle, Specifically for non walkers..
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Clean with a large choice of foods
REVIEW_BODY: China Town has been cleaned up alot since my last visit in 2014. There are the usual cheap flea market type of goods to purchase however we preferred to taste the various traditional types of cuisine. It was fantastic. Definately worth the visit.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens by the Bay- Light Show
REVIEW_BODY: The Gardens by the Bay are outstanding, the man made trees are a beauty. However, if you really want to see the beauty, go and visit the light show at night starting at 1945hrs daily, the trees come to life and lighting changes colours to the tune of classical music. It is a must see, no charge it is free.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Despite the heavy footfall, the gardens simply exude serenity. The only ones not to come under its spell are babies and frisky dogs. They've taken over Raffles hostel next day and introduced a food court for some variety to the F&B. Glad to see that it has kept its charm.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: ALL TYPES OF BIRDS IN THE WORLD
REVIEW_BODY: The best place to watch closely all the types of birds in the world and also some birds on the verge of extinction. Especially for bird lovers.Easiest way to travel is by MRT and than take a bus which drops you right at the doorstep of the park.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As we were visiting as part of a coach tour, we didnâ€™t get to spend as long here as we would have liked as we really enjoyed the parts we saw. The highlight for us was the VIP orchid garden (where new species have been named after foreign dignitaries), which was beautiful. It took us around half an hour to do that section, but the rest of the gardens were massive so Iâ€™m sure we would have spent much longer there.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Although it was only man made you could appreciate nature and strolling inside...we find it cool that it has waterfalls a lovely treat after walking under the heat of the sun outside.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Love the cloud dome the most. The first time I visited was during halloween and the deco was good! And I decided to buy th annual pass so that I can visit again for Xmas, CNY, Vday and Easter day deco.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Did the gardens at night when there were less people and it was slightly cooler. Just spectacular and well worth putting on your list to do, if you are travelling with kids especially.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Gorgeous colonial building and OK museum
REVIEW_BODY: We'd done most of the big attractions in Singapore, and thought this would be an interesting hot/rainy day activity......and it did score on that aspect. The exhibits were interesting for the most part, but it lacked a coherent "flow" and the animations were a tad garish and amateurish (especially in the forest exhibit). I would have liked more of a time-line to guide us through the history of Singapore. Maybe, I would have got more out of it if we'd been in time for the guided tour. We did visit most of the rooms, and we it was informative. Would recommend as a pleasant way to spend a couple of hours. $15 adults, $10 for seniors (over 60).
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Our group enjoyed the 45 minute cruise, time to coincide with the Marina Sands light show. It was an interesting cruise with a pre-recorded soundtrack explaining the history of Singapore. We stopped near Marina Sands and watched the laser light show, which I must say did not reach the heights I was anticipating. That said, it was worth viewing. Enjoy your time on the river as it provides a good insight to Singapore.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing place so many species of birds , different types of different birds , must visit if you are visiting with children's !
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wow at the first sight of waterfall and continue to wow at other area of the show. We love this place so much.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A glimpse of the Garden of Eden! ðŸ’•ðŸ’•ðŸ’•
REVIEW_BODY: Stepping into the Botanic Gardens is such a memorable experience especially the Orchid garden which I am a true blue singaporean is hopelessly proud of! It is worth the visit, but remember to have plenty of water in place for hydration and certainly mosquito repellent is a must!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The flower dome, combined with the cloud forest are both well worth visiting. They are in a controlled environment which is great for hot, humid or wet days (just about any day) and are well maintained. It is a nice snapshot of flora and fauna from around the world with displays representing five continents.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Spent the day starting with the Flyer, moving on to the Bay Sands SkyDeck, the Floral Dome and ended in the Cloud Forest._x000D_
_x000D_
From the moment of entering it truly has the wow factor. The path snakes up and around the simulated mountain structure with lifts for easy access if required. Everywhere you look there are plants and carvings to see. There are water falls and flowers galore and a very informative film show on the ground floor describing the potential impacts of +5 degrees warming on the planet._x000D_
_x000D_
Plenty of staff around if you need help, lots of rest rooms and very clean - no rubbish anywhere._x000D_
_x000D_
This is a 'must do' in our opinion. We paid S$28 per head entry which included both the Flower Dome and this Rain Forest attraction. We thought the Eden Project in the UK was good - this beats that in our opinion.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Part of the Marina Area Walk
REVIEW_BODY: This is a fantastic pedestrian bridge that crosses one end of the Marina. Within about an hour you can walk all the way around the Marina using this bridge and another pedestrian bridge across the bay. There are light shows nightly in the bay area and occasionally a fireworks show. The Helix Bridge is the perfect vantage point to watch.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Wow! These gardens are amazing. There are two huge, air conditioned domes full of plants from all over the world in a spectacular display. Really clever and quite artistic in their design. A small army of very talented staff must plant it all out and come in each night to maintain it._x000D_
Outside the domes are also lots of clever displays and these are lit up with a light show to music at night. It's really good. I think it only went for 15 minutes though so look up the times otherwise it's easy to miss._x000D_
It was all interesting enough for our teenage sons to enjoy it as well.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Beautiful gardens and very well maintained. They should allow bikes and hire out bikes for the whole gardens, and they should also have a buggy cart thing (don't know the name) for a tour of the gardens as the domes were tiring._x000D_
_x000D_
The coffee shop at the beginning 'cafe crema', had eggs benedict which was cold. Very disappointing. The coffee was nice though.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Almost in the middle of the city there is this amazing Botanic Garden with a huge rainforest and a fantastic orchid garden. The whole area is free except the orchid garden. From there you can easily walk to the Orchard Road or take the Hop on Hop off bus back. I have been there many times and always love it.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best zoo I have ever been too
REVIEW_BODY:
Lots to see and lots to do._x000D_
Cheapest way in is to mrt to khatib and take the shuttle from there to the zoo. The shuttle takes 15 minutes._x000D_
_x000D_
With a 4 year old, you need around 4 hours if you take your time._x000D_
_x000D_
Bring your own stroller as it makes it easier to navigate quickly._x000D_
_x000D_
Highlight was seeing the orangutans roaming around above our head and not caged.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: amazing collection of plants. even carnivore plants are there. the huge dome has unlimited variety of plants and flowers. must visit for a botanist.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A wonderous world of botany within the city
REVIEW_BODY:
Many people have already shared their experience of Gardens by the Bay (which I'll refer to as "Gardens" for the remainder of this review), so I'll add my perspective and tips from a photographer's point of view._x000D_
_x000D_
There are 3 main places worth visiting, starting with the Flower Dome, moving on to the Cloud Forest, then the tram ride which takes you to other parts of the Gardens._x000D_
_x000D_
The Flower Dome is massive, and the first thing I noticed was a lack of internal pillars - great for photography, since there was nothing to get in the way of a good shot. On entering, you'll find yourself best set up with a wide angle lens (I used a Leica Tri-Elmar shot at 16mm) to capture the inside of the dome._x000D_
_x000D_
Once inside, depending on the attractions on display, you'll enjoy a wide variety of flora - the main attraction when I visit was the Tulip Display, but I was told that a couple of months before, there were Cherry Blossoms!_x000D_
_x000D_
At this point in time, I didn't find a wide angle much use and switched to a macro lens for close-up photography. The images below were shot with the Leica 90mm f4 Elmar with the Macro-M Adapter with the EVF attached to a Leica M240. You're probably much better off with something like the Olympus OM-D E-M5 or similar with the 60mm f2.8 macro lens with good image stabilization and autofocus!_x000D_
_x000D_
I spent a good 90 minutes in the Flower Dome itself, and given the cool and dry air within the Dome, I could have spent 2 to 3 times that amount of time shooting flowers alone (and I know some people who do!). Try to do in the early morning when the light is muted and it's far less crowded. Watch out for tourists with selfie sticks once the crowd hits - many of them don't look where they go and are likely to bump into your tripod._x000D_
_x000D_
On the topic of tripods, I really wouldn't advise bringing a standard sized tripod, due to the fact that many of the flowers are quite low to the ground, and aforementioned tourists are likely to trip over the legs or bump into it. Instead, in the day, you'll do well with handheld shots._x000D_
_x000D_
Moving on to the Cloud Forest, which is the next dome, just 30 m away from the exit of the Flower Dome, watch out for the waterfall that greets you on entry. The spray from the waterfall is quite pronounced, so do mind not getting your lens and camera wet. I shot the waterfall with a 16mm lens at 1/15s shutter speed, which should give you an idea of what it would take to capture the scene in 1 shot. I noticed a couple of tourists with Nikon's 14-24mm lens, though the wonderful and practical 16-35mm would have done equally well. Moving on, the Forest offers mesmerizing wide angle views of the interior as well as close-up shots of the multitude of flora on display, so you'll be challenged to decide which lens to use!_x000D_
_x000D_
Watch for the Lego display - I won't ruin the surprise, but it's unlikely that you'll miss it, having to pass it when you take the elevator to the top of the Forest._x000D_
_x000D_
From the top, the view is rather pretty. Again, a wide angle lens is brilliant for the job, though you might want to keep the macro lens on standby since there are other interesting plants and flowers on the way down, along with a display area with stalactites and stalagmites._x000D_
_x000D_
Take the time to look down from the winding platform from time to time as there are interesting photo opportunities along the way._x000D_
_x000D_
Other than that, I didn't find much else to photograph until we got to the Visitor Center where we boarded a tram that took us to other parts of the Gardens. I strongly recommend sitting on the LEFT side of the tram since you will pass areas which offer a beautiful view of the Supertrees and the Singapore skyline, among other photo opportunities._x000D_
_x000D_
The tram ride takes around 20 minutes to complete, and you can make a mental note of which parts of the 'outside' Gardens you want to re-visit for other shots which couldn't have been shot from the tram. Keep in mind that Singapore weather is usually rather humid and warm, so dress appropriately and
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a nice garden / forest walk. You get to see some exotic trees and birds. Did not see any monkeys or giant lizzards. The whole park is probably more impressive to people living in the city who don't get to see forests that often.
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I've been to Singapore 4 times now and visited all the museums here but this tour is different. This gives you a detailed explanation of Fort Canning, it's use in Singapore's history and the role of Battlebox during WW11. The tour lasted an hour and half. There were approx 30 people on our Saturday tour of all ages. Young to old. Everyone was kept interested. Well worth a visit if you are interested in this sort of thing. The Battlebox is fully air conditioned and has no confined spaces in case you are worried. At one point in time the Battlebox held 500 men so a tour group of 30 is no challenge. Really enjoyed it!
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Felt that the dome prices seemed a bit expensive but when inside you can see the price is justified- lots of plants and information. Loads to see for free outside which we didn't see because our feet were hurting walking round the domes
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We are Friends of the Gardens and we bring our children to the Gardens often. Every visit still awe and inspire us. It is a gem of Singapore that we are really proud of._x000D_
Everything from the Cloud Forest to the Flower Dome to the Supertrees to the Children Garden are amazing._x000D_
_x000D_
Do not miss the Garden Rhapsody at the Supertrees. It is a charming and magical experience._x000D_
_x000D_
The display at the Flower Dome changes regularly according to the season/festivals. We have been there umpteenth time yet every visit still delights us.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very intresting and amazing place. Easy to go by metro to Marina Bay sands/ Harbourfront station and walk from there. Beautiful place also by evening.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Went to the evening light and music show one evening and visited the domes on other occasion. Both visits were truly memorable. Like the whole of Singapore, everywhere is spotlessly clean and very efficient. The Domes are good to visit on a hot day as the air con gives a lovely respite._x000D_
Access for limited mobility is good and directions easy to follow._x000D_
The admission price of 28 Singapore dollars is very good value.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Free to walk around. 4 floors including a roof garden. Lots to look at and read (if youâ€™re inclined).
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Indochine Restaurant at the Chijmes serves warm homely Thai fare!
REVIEW_BODY: After watching the Sound & Light display at the Marina Sands this Sunday evening, we decided to vist the unique setting of the Chijmes! What was formerly a church with a charming courtyard is now serving an excellent variety of food apart from being a much sought after marriage centre, one hears. We stumbled across the Indochine here and did they serve a warm homely Thai meal with attendant courtesy and style. The Green Curry vegetable we had was simply excellent! We also tried the Papaya Salad, Rice paper rolls, Tofu dish and plain white rice. The hostess was charming & courteous and with two hungry sleepy children in tow, we were mighty grateful for the homely ambience and care! We will return.
ADDRESS: 30 Victoria Street Chijmes, Singapore 187996, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is an authentic China Town given that it is in the heart of Singapore. It is frenetic to say the least. We visited just before Chinese new year so witnessed lots of fabulous displays going up. If you want to try local food this is the place to be although I have to say it wasn't for me!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The views are great but if you have a fear of heights do not go on it. The ride was smooth and enjoyable and a great place to take photos.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These gardens are amazing well worth a visit if you have the time to fit it in.These gardens are immaculate with stunning Orchids.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens by the Bay, Sky Walk, Flower Dome & Cloud Forest
REVIEW_BODY: Amazing creation of visual and sound experience of our beautiful nature. Bring a jacket or jumper as the temperature inside the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest is cold. A visit not to be missed. Vera D
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth the time spent here. The place is just beautiful, with such a serine feeling. And the size you will not believe how big the place is.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Skypark was easy to go up to the top. It had signs explaining and histories of every view points and buildings. Made the Bay Gardens, Trees & Skywalk, Flower Dome and Cloud Forest look small of which they are not..
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There are a lot of things to see here. I would recommend someone to see it if they are in the area and like nature. I saw several animals there: two Lizards, butterflies, chickens, and even a family of Otters - so cute-
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We've been in the Skypark twice. We went before lunch but the heavy rain poured out so we did not have the chance to explore the whole place in the daylight. We stayed for almost an hour before the staff informed us that they will be closing the skypark for a while to clean the area (Slippery!). They allowed to come back at night. After we went to Cloud forest we headed back to the Skypark. The view at night is better. From here, you can see the Merlion park, Gardens by the bay, Singapore Flyer, Helix bridge, and many more.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The National Orchid Garden is located within the Singapore Botanical Gardens itself. This garden is worth spending some time as I don't think that one can find these many varieties of orchids in one place. Overall an absolutely must see place to visit in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
You get a great touristy pic here and also nice pics of the surrounding buildings._x000D_
Unfortunately, it was a pic cloudy when we went there, but it was still beautiful._x000D_
It's full of tourists so it might take a few tries to get the perfect shot.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Recommend the V.I.P flyer package at night!
REVIEW_BODY:
Booked the V.I.P visit online on the flyer and this allowed us to wait in the V.I.P lounge, skip the queue for entry on to the flyer and we were given a luxury pod with nibbles and a singapore sling cocktail._x000D_
_x000D_
The views of the city from the flyer were stunning! Its a must when visiting Singapore.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The zoo is great but very large so use the bus provided and plan your day to conserve your energy. try to avoid dining at peak times as the queues are enormous. Sunscreen and hat are essential. First thing in the morning or late afternoon will see more activity from the animals. Don't forget your camera.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Two reasons to visit Gardens by the Bay. One is to go during the day, then for something spectacular number two, a night visit is a must, fantastic light show like nothing else. enjoy the walk through the gardens & witness the magnificent way the plants are held onto the structures.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: How many LV, Gucci , Prada etc etc stores does one need ? They dominate in almost every mall along Orchard Road . It is as a result a very generic and average shopping experience. Avoid the malls unless there are sales on.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Suggested Itinerary: There is a show at the entrance at 630 so be on time. 730 you can watch the creatures of the night show which is close to the entrance. After the show take a tram ride which is around half an hour but the queue of the tram is long (could be an hour as well). After the tram ride you can take one of the walking trails. The trails take you closer to the animals._x000D_
Make sure you are in the correct tram queue with English instructions as you pass by. There one queue for Chinese announcement as well.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful place to visit especially at the golden hour views were amazing loved it and would recommend having a drink up on the observation tower beautiful and great photos
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A very interactive Science Centre usually with add on exhibitions which you can pay additional fees to see. Good place to take the family.
ADDRESS: 15 Science Centre Road Singapore Science Centre, Singapore 609081, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great view of the city. See if you can buy tickets in advance and make sure to be on time. Take some water with you :)
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its worth visiting this place during late evening.... Its near Gardens of the bay around 10 mins walk. There is light show is beautiful...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore Zoo was fantastic and I highly recommend making your own arrangements to attend the breakfast with the Orangutans (rather than via a tour as we missed the beginning). The zoo is lush and such a good example of how to do a zoo the right way with many free range animals.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a great place to chill out and relax. Make sure yo take sunscreen and a hat though! We saw loads of turtles and fish, and even saw an eagle catch a fish.Gardens are very well maintained.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The price of the ticket do not match the attractions. Expectation is not align to my expectation. The ride that can see the animal in the park is excluded from the park ticket and need to pay extra 5 bucks
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Beautiful & pleasant environment; clean, no stinky smell. Animals are kept in cozy in their â€œhomeâ€ and have brief but detailed introduction of each of the different animal species._x000D_
There are also a variety of animals performances scheduled at different location and time. As you walk through the Zoo, you will catch a few of the show, though you may not catch all of them._x000D_
You can take the tram ride, go round the Zoo, then decide where you like to spend more of your time._x000D_
Enjoyable, especially for animals lovers and family with children.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great information and insights into Buddha. This is a new temple of reconstruction. Well worth a visit and itâ€™s free.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not many places like this in the world
REVIEW_BODY: Plenty of shops, small and big, high-end to low price... world class brands... always crowded, you feel like itâ€™s the center of the universe Window shopping highly recommend
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can't really visit Singapore without going to see the Merlion. Busy area with lots of tourists all doing thier selfie shots but still found a little spot to take mine. Also worth visiting the area for the great views
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit for a peaceful and relaxing few hours
REVIEW_BODY: If you love orchids then this is a great place to see them in all their colours and varieties. You only need a couple of hours here
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is very easy to see why this attraction has been awarded a certificate of excellence. From the moment you first walk in and see the waterfall to the highly important video at the end (really, you must sit and watch this short but necessary video.. it's message is aimed at us all), you will experience a masterpiece of engineering, education and breathtaking exhibits. It would be very easy to spend hours and hours in here if you have the time, but we still enjoyed it so much with only a couple of hours available to us. Stunning looking from the outside with the marvellous dome structures, it is equally stunning on the inside. We'll done Singapore!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Must see attraction in Singapore lot of colorful birds and lots of vegetation i the area and there are some eateries in the bird park. i think visitors must enter early as possible we enter to park at 8.30 on that time not crowded but when we exit it full of peoples so you enter morning u will relax and enjoy the bird park.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Some lovely night shots to take here. You can walk around in perfect safety, we were there around midnight and still quite a few people taking selfies with the sculpture in the background. Lovely views of Marina Bay as well. We were there days after the GP so the light framework was still in place adding to the atmosphere.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Atmospheric setting but views are limited unless you pay for expensive tickets
REVIEW_BODY:
How much you enjoy the Singapore GP will probably be dependent on how much money you have and ultimately how good a ticket you buy. I was on a basic ticket in the Bay Grandstand. The view wasnâ€™t very good. I felt like I was watching a tennis match. Instead of following the ball from right to left it was the cars passing by. Also, as this is a street track the track is surrounded by high fencing and the track is even lower down so cars following the racing line maybe obscured even further. I appreciate this is for safety but it doesnâ€™t really help for the viewing experience. I did go to the free viewing points at times and you could see the cars and drivers a bit closer but the view is nothing special. These points are better for the driverâ€™s parade though._x000D_
_x000D_
The positive side is the atmosphere and the glamorous and stunning area it is set in. It was a buzz to be there and for me great to see my favourite driver LH44 get an amazing pole and dominate and win. But in reality the best place to watch this sport is via TV. In fact most of the time that was all I was doing watching the screens opposite the track!_x000D_
_x000D_
The zone 3 and 4 my ticket allowed had some good restaurants and bars and there were a few concerts over the three days. As expected souvenirs and programme were quite expensive but you see that at every sporting event. I found the security and staff a mixed bunch. Some were friendly and helpful others just seemed they wanted you to leave the place as soon as the various sessions were over. A bit annoying when I wanted to buy a shirt from a shop after._x000D_
_x000D_
At the end of the race I noticed people walking the track but our stand and zone were not allowed. I assume the higher cost areas allowed this. Getting out and to the MRT station wasnâ€™t too bad considering the amount of people._x000D_
_x000D_
I loved the setting, loved the atmosphere at times and loved the result but I would not sit in the same area again. But I heard the zone 1 and 2 areas tickets are sold for $1000s. When I win the lotto Iâ€™ll come back and enjoy this event in style.
ADDRESS: Marina Bay Street Circuit, Singapore 038975, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Located in City Center and close to all major attractions in Singapore, this botanic garden gives you the best feel of SG being a place known for flowers and greenery.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Very touristy but the area buzzes with excitement
REVIEW_BODY: Having been during the day and evening, I think it's more dramatic going after dark. The whole waterfront area is alive with lights and people buzzing around. The Merlion statue is pretty impressive but honestly only takes a few minutes to see and appreciate before moving on to the next thing.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Flyer is a must-see. We went there at night to fully savour the night time view with marina bay fully lit. The prices are reasonable for such an attraction and no long queuing was needed._x000D_
_x000D_
We went up to the platform and entered the cabin - togehter with a hord of mainland chinese and their free-ranging kids. These people turned out to be souring the experience due to their incredible and excessive noise levels and their fully uncontrolled, respectless and hyperactive kids._x000D_
_x000D_
However, the movement of the wheel is slow and one has time to see who the views are developing._x000D_
_x000D_
While Keppel Harbour with this great number of ship is impressive - more than Singapores East Coast - the real views are Marina Bay and beyond._x000D_
_x000D_
Standing out were the Gardens on the Bay, The Marina Bay Sands and the Durian. The overall experience at night was great - many good photos opportunities._x000D_
_x000D_
We will come back - not at daytime though, again at night time._x000D_
_x000D_
The Flyer's podium is quite underwhelming and better design and more points of interest could have been added._x000D_
_x000D_
Formula One's Singapore Race due in two weeks one could see from here the preparations and parts of the track going on. Must be nice to revolve around here, dining and wining in the cabins - then with TV - and watching the race.....
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A brilliant link towards Marina Bay Sands Hotel. The design a highlight. Becomes even more impressive during nighttime.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Definitely worth a visit for extensive displays
REVIEW_BODY: 3rd visit to the Domes,, went this time especially for Christmas floral displays which were beautiful especially the arrangement of colours. All the usual displays were in place, good information on most exhibits with plenty of space and access for everyone. I love the wooden carvings made from reclaimed trees. The Cloud forest is a highlight. The only disappointment was the noise coming from a group which totally destroyed the peace and tranquillity that makes the Domes special.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was amazing feeling. Go there when the sun goes down. First show starts at 7:45 pm (Lights and classical music). This was amazing it brought tears in my eyes. Supertrees are free for public.We also went to Skyway (8SGD per person) and it wasworth it. Would recommend this to anyone. It is a must see when in Singapore, don't miss it!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Our docent was so knowledgeable and passionate. We learned so much - thought being an Aussie we knew a lot of Singapore's war history, but that was certainly not the case. Please visit this, you will learn so much.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We went there during our trip, had dinner in the biggest tree, and watch the second light show from a passerelle somewhere nearby. It is really impressive and big... even the panorama stand of the camera isn't big enough._x000D_
We didn't do the boardwalk, we found it quite expensive for what it is.. the view from the ground and some viewing spots around the garden and the marina are already good, and if you dine on top of the tree you can go for free on the terrace for some nice pics!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a must see in Singapore, I especially loved the view from the Marina Bay Sands and from the Sky Walk.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Once you been to gardens by the bay, you should visit here. Afternoon is good time. So that you get both day and evening view
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Was very excited to go here. Had an 815 time slot, however this meant we couldnâ€™t even enter the park until then (I thought this was just for the tram part of the park, that we could still look and wander the trails while waiting... but no). Spent majority of time waiting In numerous lines. No proper management at all. No decent public transport to this venue so make sure you have a way to get there! Especially as it finishes so late._x000D_
the actual creatures show and tram ride were good, however we had spent so long in lines we left promptly. Would not go again, especially with children; what a nightmare!!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As a regular visiter to the last remaining part of Singapore's past un -developed itcus aways rewards experience abd ny visit was no exception
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited the gardens recently and have to say itâ€™s a must see!_x000D_
Attention to detail, well maintained, super clean and just everything I wanted to see from beautiful plants to shrubs and trees that are so beautiful._x000D_
Loved every minute of exploring these stunning gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Brought my family there during weekend for morning walk followed by breakfast. My kids love running around the garden and chasing chickens! LOL
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Honestly I was imaging something different, something bigger. When I arrived on site I get little bit disappointed, I think Singapore have much better things to see
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great strip of shops to fulfil your retail desires. Lots of different types of shops from high end designer to general places. Clean, air conditioned, friendly service.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Is okay but I saw better china towns....
REVIEW_BODY: I went there to eat and you will find really nice small and larger places where you can get original chinese food.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: we had the chance to see the light show during the night. although we were not able to visit the dome itself the surrounding is very nice
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Zoo for Adults and Kids.
REVIEW_BODY: The place is great with good landscapes, views and different species of animal from around the world. They have Polar Bear and Dolphins also. I have visited there in Feb 2018. Book tickets in advance through there official website to avoid queues, also you will get discounted deals. Layout of the zoo was designed perfectly and it helps in easy to get around.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This museum is well worth a visit during a visit to Singapore. The audio guide (included in entry price) was very informative and detailed about the lives of the Chinese immigrants who went to Singapore.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An extremely beautiful garden. We visited the 2 domes and the place is amazing. Heard from our guide that this is the most popular attraction in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not a lot of WOW but a must visit.
REVIEW_BODY: A bit of a stroll to get into the gardens but is worth a visit. We used the MRT Do not waste your time going there at any other time than when the music and light show is happening.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very beautiful iconic structure well worth the visit it's surrounded by bars cafes and restaurants some small shops. Right next to it is the Malaysian heritage centre which is also nice lovely park too. If your going sight seeing definitely check it out.
ADDRESS: 3 Muscat Street Masjid Sultan, Singapore 198833, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
There are two good times to visit the Singapore Flyer, either in the morning when the light is great for a view across the Bay and Marina Bay, or in the early evening when the lights of the City are spectacular. Very much in a similar way to the London Millennium Wheel._x000D_
Definitely worth a visit when you are visiting Singapore
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Always visit this place when in town. The theme now is for Christmas- a must visit for people of all ages. Very easy to get around - although some older folk may find the air a little cool- take a coat.. The different varieties of plants from over the world with many different sculptures scattered around. But the best section now is the Christmas scene - the beautiful decorated trees - the lovely plants & the magical snow domes truly beautiful. Suitable for all ages - take your camera.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent the best part of a day walking the park - very well laid out, good views of the city and very interesting to read the history of the fort and see the fort gate (dates from the late C19th). Only disappointment was that there were many school tours and we didn't manage to see the Battle Box (an underground bunker system used in WW2) as the guide advised us it would be too crowded and noisy (school trip). We didn't have the time to come back later or on another day. Nevermind this will be on our itinerary for our next trip to Singapore all being well.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A large variety of plants from across the globe
REVIEW_BODY: A definite must-visit when in Singapore. They display a huge variety of flora that spans across the globe, all in an air-conditioned environment.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Walk into Nature - have a DSLR Camera ready
REVIEW_BODY: The Botanic Garden is a great place to spend the day. bring along a camera to capture the great variety of flora that exists. Bring the kids for a run, allowing them to appreciate the nature more in a garden city.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing day out - make sure you stop here
REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore Zoo was an amazing experience. Really interactive and you were able to get really close to some of the animals without either feeling uncomfortable. There's a lot to see so make sure you have the whole day. It was easily to use public transport to get there. There are also other animal parks in the area that I will look into next time.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
it's a second time i've visited Buddha Tooth Relic temple, this temple is very nice, location near chinatown complex ..._x000D_
you can see the museum and explanation of this temple and at 4 th floor they show the hall with gold plate , the architecture of this building is very interesting, many foreigener comes and take a photo there
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I visit the Botanic Gardens every time I go to Singapore. Probably been about 40 times over the last 50 years. Best to visit as a couple.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I loved the light show at the end it was sooo beautiful and the flower dome and waterfall dome were surprisingly AMAZING.you should definitely go there!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Flyer is great way to see Singapore with commentary inside each capsule. We did the Flyer on our first stop of the Hippo Hop On Hop Off Bus. Iâ€™d highly recommend going on it early in the morning just after opening time as youâ€™ll have a good chance of getting a capsule to yourself. We had five family members & had great access to all of the views to take photos of whatever we liked. It was also good to get an idea of where we wanted to stop on the Hippo Hop On Hop Off Bus & also what lines we needed to go on. It takes approximately 30 minutes for the Flyer to go around.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Our visit to the Gardens by the Bay was simply put, one of the highlights of our 10 day touring holiday of Malaysia and Singapore. The scale, vision and execution of these exceptional, world-class gardens is incredible. It is a 'Must-Visit' place on any trip to Singapore. Great value too.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We strolled the entire garden and absolutely enjoyed the visit._x000D_
_x000D_
We entered the park and were greeted by a team of staff who provided a map, overview of the park and were quite pleasant and humorous._x000D_
_x000D_
We started at the lake with the Black Swans. Were were probably too late in the day (it was hot and humid) and did not see the black swans. We did walk the entire park and visited the Orchid Garden, and concluded at the lake with the White Swans._x000D_
_x000D_
We saw the entire park in approximately 2 1/2 hours (including the Orchid Garden). You may see the park in a shorter time, we chose to take our time. At the end of the park, we exited with easy access to the bus system which returned us back to our hotel_x000D_
_x000D_
The park is full of many species of plants. I am deducting points for lack of signage. The park could improve the experience by placing more signs and placards providing explanation and education for patrons about the plant species.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Such an impressive array of orchids in this well-maintained garden. The largest collection in the world and the only UNESCO garden Heritage Site. 5S$ well spent. There is a metro station nearby.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The cloud forest was simply fabulous. The ecosystem was involved as well as beautiful. There is a cascading waterfall and plants make of legos. We take the elevator up to the top and walk down to view the entire structure.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to relax with some good views
REVIEW_BODY: After a long walk in the city, this was the best place where I was able to relax a bit. You can have a good view of the Marina Bay area and the place has many restaurants around for a good meal looking at the Merlion statue.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Cloud forest was probably my favourite out of the two Domes. The climb up and learning about the different plants was enjoyable. Always enjoyable being around a waterfall an opportunities for good photos
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The orchid garden was the most impressive of the areas we walked. Everything was beautifully maintained. Took quite some time to get a cab afterwards back to our hotel...the line was long.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The light show is free and is easy to access from Marina Bay Sands. For a place to sit come 30-40 minutes before the show as it gets pretty busy.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: So many people so much colour . Vendors out in force selling festival stuff and other Chinese delicacies. Just a little overwhelming. A little more research would have been a win.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Don't forget to stay for the Rhapsody free show at 19.45 or 20.45. You can get a super clear view of the show at the OCBC walk too.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The historical value is the main point in this bunker, as it was the base used by the british, when the decision to give up Singapore was taken. It is hard to understand why they prohibit taking photos down, thats one point minus from me.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is free for public. You can go for a picnic there and watch a night shows at the trees. The best time to go there is after 3pm and stay until night to see the show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchids are Singapore's national flower, but it is only in here that you get to see such a wide selection of orchids. I previously didn't know of so many orchid species, but my trip here really opened my eyes. Very informative, and very fascinating flowers.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must for any visit to Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: We first visited Gardens By The Bay one evening to see the light show. Despite being very busy, there was just enough space for everyone and exciting to see the Supertrees during the evening light show. The following day we revisited to see the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome and had a much calmer and more peaceful experience. Upon entering the Cloud Forest, the indoor waterfall is amazing and what a sight to first be greeted with! It is fabulous to slowly wind your way down the walkways, with an amazing variety of foliage to admire, plus some great views of the city and harbour. The Flower Dome is also beautiful and really interesting to explore the different plants from around the world. Thoroughly enjoyable and highly recommended for any visit to Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a stunning garden that has been around for over a hundred years. The entire environment is peaceful and beautiful. Lots of tropical plants, trees and flowers with a lake in the middle.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It could be a novelty for some people, but I honestly thought it to be pretty average and a bit expensive. Do try to catch the sunset views which amps up the experience. Recommended more for families with kids.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great place to see the bay from Above and it's gorgeous. Night time is the best time to go in this ride. Enjoyed it thoroughly and it's worth every buck to see Singapore from The flyer
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I'm not into shopping though, just went there with a friend who want to take a look at the main shopping street in Singapore. I don't feel like it's different.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful to watch the animals behave as they would in nature at night time. Cleaver subtle lights make it possible for us to see them. Alas the queues to get in do rather spoil the evening. It didn't help that it was also raining but I can't blame the zoo for that! May be going at a different time in the year would be better but I don't know when that might be.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great for walks and sight seeing
REVIEW_BODY: Nice to see all these greeneries and take a walk with your loved ones. Look out for certain seasonal changes.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This zoo is exceptional and should not be missed. touring through gives you the impression (and perhaps rightly so) that youâ€™re enclosed an visiting the environment of the zoo inhabitant. There are primates through a vine highway throughout and lots of bats nesting. We thoroughly enjoyed this zoo and would recommend it to anyone. Bring a packed lunch though - we werenâ€™t too impressed with the lunch offered. You can fill up your water-bottles throughout. The
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: MacRitchie nature trail is great, for both kids and adults... The trail itself is not challenging at all and you can get through it in under 2 hours... The best surprise comes at the end when you get to the boardwalk with hundreds of wild monkeys
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
On our first night we stumbled across the promenade as the night began and it just blew me away. To see all the lights from the skyscrapers, the bridge - its all so magical lit up at night._x000D_
Definitely walk around the whole area to appreciate the view from all angles - there is nowhere like it in the world for me._x000D_
There's a great light show too on every night, sometimes twice in a night done to music and great to see.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore Flyer is similar to the one in London, Las Vegas etc. The view is always worth it. You can see everything from up there, it's like flying in slow motion. Always a thrill!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth coming for the 7:45pm light show. Come at least 30 mins early to get a good spot under the trees to watch the show. On mondays the skywalk is closed so we missed out on this - i am sure it would have been amazing to experience the show on this.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Smaller than what you imagine. Visit after 10 am or later in the evening when it is cooler. Great architecture but there are more interesting things to go and see in Singapore if time is limited.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A wonderful place to spend half a day. The exhibition about the History of Singapore is especially eye-opening and excellently curated. Worth the price of the ticket alone. Also the section of Singapore's famous ladies through the ages. Not being from Asia we were not aware of all the details surrounding Lee Kuan Yew and what a truly incredible man he was and the amazing amount of good he did for Singapore. An absolutely fascinating story. The gift shop has a interesting mix of souvenirs, some of which were not seen elsewhere in Singapore. Beautiful building, well-maintained and all of the staff we encountered were well-mannered and very helpful.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great views of the city, expensive food and drinks. $34 per head for 1 drink and finger food, and stand up and eat. Not practical when you are all late 60's and early 70's.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Been in Singapore many times but this is the first time to the Gardens._x000D_
_x000D_
The layout is fantastic and easy to get around. Wonderful displays and the many wood carvings hidden all over are amazing...._x000D_
_x000D_
My only issue is the price of admission...could be a lot cheaper but then again...this is Singapore and I guess everything has to be expensive.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore Flyer was a great way to see views of Singapore. The rotation commentary and digital guide on board helped identify and give more information on prominent landmarks.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: it's really breathtaking up there! the wind was really blowing hard here and it was soooooo refreshing against singapore's humid and warm weather. you can just visit the skydeck (there's a fee though, i forgot how much cuz we visited last march 2017). you can stay as long as you want. there are many fancy restos up there but i think you need a reservation too. so if you plan to eat there, plan ahead and book in advance!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
As a local, this is one of my family's favourite place to visit. Every year, we will visit the zoo at least once and this year has been no different. The animal shows is a top draw and so does the feeding sessions. If you've a young family, don't forget to bring along their swimming gears. There is a waterplay area for kids. There is also a tram and boat rides, but of course, you need to pay for the rides. Most importantly, the zoo is not only family-friendly but also disabled friendly._x000D_
Enjoy!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud Forest Dome was the one we chose to visit. Cost $32 it was well worth the money and more besides. As soon as one enters, the Waterfall which is over 80 meters high can be seen, the spray dampens your skin and clothing as you walk past, and the sight of the orchids and other flowers is just a wonder. The strong message that comes over from this visit -where one can walk in the 'sky', is that of global warming and what will be the result in 2100 if we do nothing to halt the warming. We were overwhelmed by the effort that had gone into producing such an exhibit. Once you have navigated the swarms of people taking selfies and insuring that selfie sticks do not inflict damage to one's person, you will find this visit so warming. Enjoy!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spend some real time here..And you will really enjoy the Domes. Don't forget to watch the laser show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Please make sure that you go by evening otherwise you are surely get to get tired by the evening. The zoo is amazing with wide variety of animals. Though there is a tram service available for which u will have to pay extra but its nt worth taking a tram as you will still require to walk to see the animals.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent area for night and day entertainment and food
REVIEW_BODY: Packed with restaurants and bars that stretch over three main areas from Robertson Quay through Clarke Quay to Boat Quay. Ends at Marina Bay and the Esplanade
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bayâ€™s Flower Garden is a true wonderland. If youâ€™ve got any doubts then the Alice in Wonderland themed sculptures should put your mind to rest. If youâ€™re getting the impression that itâ€™s solely about Alice, the Hare, and the other characters, then I must say...Nay!_x000D_
Alice and the crew are just one of several themes. Singapore has done an amazing creative job of bringing a variety of examples of floral ecosystems from around the world all housed under an architectural master piece._x000D_
_x000D_
The Flower Gardens is huge! One could spend hours exploring and losing yourself in the organic fantasy sculptures. During the Christmas/New Year holiday season thereâ€™s an entire display dedicated to a secular celebration bathed in lights that will leave no doubts about the beauty and magic of the time of year._x000D_
_x000D_
Singapore has a reputation for being hot and humid but thatâ€™s not the case in the climate controlled air conditioning inside the Gardens building, a plus for those of us who are impacted by heat related medical issues. The exhibit space has very wide pathways that will easily accommodate people who rely on mobility aids such as wheelchairs. Singapore has created a place thatâ€™s accessible for all.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Iâ€™ve been to many zoos around the world and this was one experienced to be missed. It was promoted as a chance to see the nocturnal animals in their natural habitat but the few that were visible in the dim light could have been seen more easily during the day. It seemed to be more of an exercise in relieving you of your money.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Iâ€™m not a great fan of these sorts of places but I really enjoyed this one! I was surprised how interesting it was and the variety of displays. It was hot out, but a real pleasure to find something to see in air conditioning that was also entertaining! Definitely place to visit if youâ€™re trying to escape the heat but still get out and about!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Must visit in the evening. Must visit Flower dome and the Cloud forest and followed by the sound and light show at the supertree grove (2045Hrs local time)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A small natural history museum in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
The Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum (LKCNHM) opened in April 2015 and only today did I have the time to make a visit. Located within the campus ground of National University of Singapore (NUS), it is quite expensive (S$16 for Singaporean adult and S$21 for non-citizens) and is closed on Mondays, except when it is a Public Holiday._x000D_
Inside this building, there is a huge load of information but this small natural museum tries too much to show a lot of species of the biodiversity in this region. The new exhibits and the rows and rows of specimens, nicely arranged and/or in their preservation bottles, felt, well, very clinical._x000D_
Only a true blooded naturalist or those scientifically inclined, would enjoy a few hours in this museum._x000D_
The star of the museum is the 3 dinosaur skeletons that the museum had purchased. Though magnificent, I failed to see the relevance of the dinosaur bones to this museum as huge dinosaurs like these were probably not in this region during the age of the dinosaurs._x000D_
Lots of the exhibits were also from the collections from the National Museum of Singapore, especially the collections of the early British administrators of the colony of Singapore._x000D_
Overall, I would say that this museum is for those who can really appreciate natural history and I give this museum a star for an effort of educating the general masses like me.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum
ADDRESS: 2 Conservatory Drive | National University of Singapore, Singapore 117377, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens By The Bay was the highlight of our trip. Make sure this is on your travel itinerary for Singapore - it is truly magical. I feel the best time of the day to visit is late afternoon so you can see it in all glory. You will then be amazed seeing the gorgeous trees light up. Don't take my word for how beautiful and magical this place is - just go!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: During all of my past 7 visits to China town, I always had a good time. Something has changed in the past four years. It does not seem to be as vibrant as it was, the food hawkers have changed. To me some of the unique atmosphere has gone, I will not be back for another visit.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This has to be one of the best zoo's in the world if not the best. It's clean well maintained, well managed and just absolutely amazing there is so much for the kids to do here. Feeding the animals getting up close with them is a treat for the little ones. There are amazing shows, pony rides, a carousel, an amazing water play area there is also an obstacle course for kids but that you have to pay extra for it. The animals are looked after are seen happy they also have a small butterfly garden which is amazing. This trip we ended up going 3 times my kids had a blast unfortunately the Polar bear had passed recently which my boys were really looking forward to. Getting here can be a little tricky for first timers but the easiest way is to get a taxi. If your using public transport you have to get of a nearby MRT station and then take a bus. They also have shuttle service but it's only on weekends and public holidays.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Flower Dome is one of the attractions to see at Gardens by the Bay. Inside it was beautiful and cool as the entire Dome is airconditioned. The flora that was on offer was from all over the world, with great facts and information placed around them. The arrangements were very beautifully done and allowed for good views of all the flora. There are tons of good photo opportunities, and lots of learning to be done by little ones. A good way to get out of the heat of the day, and beautiful at night as well!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: If you are a tourist, then go for it !
REVIEW_BODY: Hey, why not ? Its the worlds highest and has great views . If you do go, take a taxi or get off at the right subway stop otherwise its a hike and a half if you get off at the Marina Sands Mall. (read: bring lots of water and very comfortable walking shoes)
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was a lifetime experience, magnificent views. We did it in the daytime but would have loved it even more at night
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best garden experiences in the world
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay, Singapore is one of my favourite places to visit. The amazing numbers of plants they have, immaculately cared for areas of the gardens and the sheer colours are breathtaking. In the Flower Dome during June/July is a display of thousands of roses such an amazing view.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Night light show is a must at 8:00 pm
REVIEW_BODY: Just go and experience the light show at 8:00 pm. It is a must go attraction in Singapore, then head for the bay light show
