ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The kids marveled at this attraction. It was their first time on a cable car. The were very excited and a little scared, at least at first anyway. A great way for the kids to go to Sentosa island. A must say it is expensive though.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Although Singapore has little India, this temple is in Chinatown! I do not know why it is built in chinatown but It was fun to witness an irony.
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the best place to experience the culture in Singapore. I especially love the colourful Peranakan shop-houses, the food street full of yummy local delights and watching groups of elderly residents sitting around playing games of Chinese chess.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: CAble car is one of the way to travel to Sentosa island from mainland Singapore (most expensive way also). Easier way is by Sentosa Express. Both (and even walk way) leave from Vivo City mall only.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a must see with multiple attractions, a garden lover's feast, and you need time to take it all in. The museum alongside it is stunning.The ingenuity amazing
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Night Safari is brilliant! For most of the animals you walk along well signposted, fenced-in paths through the woodland from enclosure to enclosure. The lighting is enough to see the animals but very subtle so it feels like very bright moonlight. The animals are active as it is cooler and a natural time of the day for them to be moving around. It is also possible to ride the â€œtrainâ€ around the safari with useful commentary on the animals you pass. Worth every penny, but a late night if you have very little ones.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
As a Moslem, it is a pleasure to have a chance to pray here. It is a historical masjid built in 1800s. This masjid is very clean and big. It is located near the popular area for travellers (Bugis Street and Arab Street). It also opens for tourist from 10.00 AM to 4.00 PM. Beyond the time, it still opens for praying only._x000D_
_x000D_
It also provides digital information about the history of this place. It is child-friendly as well. So, you may let your children to read by themselves.
ADDRESS: 3 Muscat Street Masjid Sultan, Singapore 198833, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A ten minute of awesome beauty.
REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the highlights when you go to Sentosa Island. I tried all , mono rail, cab and Cable car. I loved this one. Moreover between Sentosa stations you can take this as many times as you like ...
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely gardens. Must venture into the domes!
REVIEW_BODY:
We visited the gardens as a family to kill a few hours in Singapore. The domes were fantastic and worth the money. You can tell the gardens are maintained to an incredibly high standard. The Cloud dome was our favourite. Unfortunately there was a group of very poorly behaved school students in there with us, who were yelling and throwing rocks at exhibits. It was a shame that there were no staff members inside the dome to stop this (as the teacher didn't care!). The waterfall was magical and well worth a visit. You take a lift up the middle of the waterfall and leisurely walk down on suspended walkways._x000D_
The flower dome had a wide variety of flowers and there was a large tulip display when we were there. Many staff around tending to the plants._x000D_
Good food options around the park and nice shaded areas to escape the heat. It was definitely worth the time to stop and visit!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore is a lovely modern city, however it does not get going anywhere much before 10.30am each day and not before lunchtime on Sundays. Take care in the bars on the water front as they are very expensive.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Phenomenal experience and something that must be done if you are in Singapore. If you are there do pay for the two domes as they are well worth it (apart from escaping the humidity they are beautiful). My favourite was the cloud dome._x000D_
_x000D_
The whole garden and maintenance of it are energy neutral. Cleverly engineered systems merged with natural beauty really makes this place stand out among all others._x000D_
_x000D_
Probably come later in the afternoon and stay until the evening when the Garden Rhapsody starts. Well worth it to stay for the musical performance.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best Zoos visited
REVIEW_BODY: First of all, our family enjoys zoos and, as kids were growing up, we visited plenty in different States in US, and later in different countries. This one is by far the best we had. Besides being clean and well maintained, it offers a very wide variety of animals from different countries. This is definitely a place worth visiting.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Yearly The Intan embarks onto a give back programme to the community through their signature event title Project Intan._x000D_
_x000D_
This is an initiative where the Peranakan community and their friends gather together to give back to the needy within the community._x000D_
_x000D_
It is a night of singing, dancing and food galore. It delights all senses and it's also a meaningful event for all. Yearly I look forward to this charity event. Through which I also learn more of the Peranakan heritage and culture. Totally awesome!
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Perfect for an early morning jog. Nice to have your coffee or a few beers while enjoying the view of the bay.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Garden so beautiful with a nice mix of water, plants, trees, walking paths. Great for a stroll or a morning jog along the river!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: I've always loved the view here
REVIEW_BODY: This is the place I've always run through every week and I never get bored of it. Try running from Stadium mrt all the way to Gardens by the Bay and Marina Bay Sands, you'll be amazed!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Defiantly one to cross off the to do list. The flower dome was closed which was a shame....but the cloud dome was amazing. Not really for kids as they would get bored.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The temple was mobbed with busloads of tourists taking pictures and jostling for space which kind of put a damper on our visit. Setting that aside the temple is impressive with its many Buddhas and elaborate, colorful decor.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were fortunate to be in Singapore for the plum blossom extravaganza in the Flower Dome it was magnificent.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Overall was good, except there is no local food in the park. Should have promote local food as it is a tourist attraction.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice place to have some lunch and try chinese fast food. To have a walk and find some souvenirs from Singapore
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lots of ways to spend loads of money here! You could walk around for free but the beautiful domes are worth the visit. Take a jumper or cardigan as they are quite cool! So many tourists itâ€™s hard to dodge the photos. Satay by the bay was a really cool food place! Plenty of room and Asian variety! Difficult for vegetarians but there are a couple of veggie/noodle choices. I need to come back here as one day wasnâ€™t enough.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Although im a singaporean but i've never really been into the cloud dorm except walking around the outside area. Brought a friend from overseas for a visit. I must say the cloud dorm is really beautiful ~ Its so greeny and cooling ~ Tho the flowers are not as beautiful as the one in the flower dorm but the man made waterfall has its own attraction. As for the skytree, best to visit during evening till night time as the light lights up!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Went in because it started raining and what great decision it was._x000D_
We really enjoyed it, a botanical garden is not smth I do regularly._x000D_
An hour is enough to cover it, unless you decided to stop at the Pollen cafe inside for a great organic coffee and excellent deserts. They donâ€™t have lactose-free and gluten-free options btw.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great Place for Walking, talking and training when You want to leave the busy Life of the city or rather be outdoors in "the jungle" than inside the gym :)
ADDRESS: 177 Hindhede Drive Bukit Timah Vhf Station, Singapore 589333, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited sentosa on 3rd March.. We took cable car from vivo city mall station to sentosa.. I didnot find it too good for 29sgd per pax.. Instead I will recommend sky & luge... It was awesome ride of sentosa imbiah station.if you want to live the beauty of sentosa.. Skyride is must.. Even Singapore flyer is also a best option to view the city... Cable car is over rated.. In my opinion... Thanks..
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Bigger than we realised, you could spend all day here but due to this mornings heat we gave up only seeing 1/2 of it. The gardens are immaculate, plenty toilet and refreshment facilities. Orchid garden was $5 pp entry and well worth it.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud Forest bio-dome is an awesome space with skywalks wrapping around a vertical jungle, including with one of worlds tallest indoor waterfalls! This place is amazing! The entry fee was about Â£16, but this also included the adjacent Flower Dome! Worth every penny!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: everybody loves the zoo, I really enjoyable experience for everybody no matter how old you are, it is just a fun day out
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: good view and the merlion still not change. i hope at nite more have attractive light so more colourfull and pretty.. cheers..
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was an overall awesome experience. Remember to dress very down to keep yourself cool. And of course you have to remember to check out weather forecast for at least the next 4hrs(including travel time to RS) prior to visiting River Safari as MOST attractions including boat rides are outdoor. Booked my trip via KLOOK and entries were completely hassle free. Thanks KLOOK.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see if visiting the botanic gardens
REVIEW_BODY: Located within the.botanic gardens this is a must see. Wear comfortable shoes as it is a decent treck from the main entrance. See my review on the botanic gardens for more info
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great way to connect with Singapore history
REVIEW_BODY:
This lovely museum provide a wonderful overview of an important part of Singapore history, culture and ethnicity. The exhibits are comprehensive without being overwhelming with information. This is a museum that can be enjoyed by all ages._x000D_
On the 2nd Sunday of the month admission is free.
ADDRESS: 39 Armenian Street Peranakan Museum, Singapore 179941, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The lights on the bridge are just amazing, It a very good walk all the way to Merlion Statue. It is very good lit up
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: if you want to truly experience singapore, then you must come here. This place is alive and kicking with plenty shops, cafes, street art and also the big mosque. Plenty to do. We came here in the late afternoon and enjoyed being here and took many photos. Must visit.
ADDRESS: Kampong Glam, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The structures and gardens are a magnificent achievement by anyone's standards. The reclaimed land is lush with trees and shrubs, walking around you become filled with green and fecundity. You can ascend a pod structure and traverse the walkway or simply stroll and be absorbed
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: 360Âº views of Singapore from the 50th storey skybridge. For me, mandatory visit. It costs 6$. You can pay it with your EZ-Link card at MA Office at Blk 1G, Level 1. Open to the public from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily.
ADDRESS: 1 Cantonment Road The Pinnacle @ Duxton, Singapore 080001, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful unusual way to spend a couple of hours
REVIEW_BODY: On a Business trip that carried on over a weekend I had a few hours to spare. This had recently opened so I decided to spend a few hours walking round. It is both beautiful and unusual and I highly recommend a trip to see it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited for the first time yesterday and were totally blown away by the Flower Dome and in particular the Cloud Forest. We spent hours just marvelling at how it had been constructed and the amazing vegetation. Totally magnificent. Worth every cent we paid to get in. Singapore is so ahead of the game when it comes to something like this. I really appreciated the short film on global warming and its consequences. Also had a great lunch of satays in the gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Busy, colourful and vibrant area with lots of trinket stalls, tailors and a great food market. Well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Even if youâ€™re not into flowers and gardens this is a must see event. It has an exceptional wow factor about with the garden arrangements and garden settings. Youâ€™ll be amazed as to how it all come together to form one beautiful spectacular attraction.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We came to spend a few hours and had_x000D_
A great experience by seeing all the attractions. Everything is well set and arranged, super clean and also culinary offers are available. Maybe not for a short visit in Singapore but for sure to spend an extra day
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We spent a bit of time combing the streets and checking maps to make we were actually in Little India. It isnt as defined or structured as Chinatown and there didnt seem to be market stall eating like there is with the Asian cuisine. There are plenty of restaurants, but we were looking for more choice and vibrancy at market prices._x000D_
_x000D_
We had a well priced and tasty meal all the same._x000D_
_x000D_
Reasonable selection of indian nic naks if you are in to that stuff.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were unsure at first whether to visit the gardens due to their location (being out of the centre) but we are certainly glad we did. Entrance to the main gardens are free & â‚¬5pp for the orchid gardens which were beautiful. You are free to walk around at your own pace. The rainforest, swan lake and sky walk way (above ground) were the highlights. Would recommend a visit here to anyone interested in nature or anyone who wants a bit of calm oasis away from the main city buzz.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I feel the best time to come is before the sunrise or during sunset. This will avoid the hot weather of Singapore to make the walk more pleasant and soak in the serenity of the place.
ADDRESS: 9 Woodlands Road, Singapore 738656, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My 10 year old girl did not want to leave, so we had lunch in the museum's exceptional cafe and did the floors again. As a San Franciscan, I know Asian art. This eclectic collection is on stellar display. Lunch and artefacts from the depths of the sea through the sands of time! The best.
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lots of gold and decoration in this temple
REVIEW_BODY: Worth a brisk walk through, and do go up to the top floors where the actual tooth is kept, surrounded by loads of gold ornamentation.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice owners, enthusiastic facilitor with interesting discussion about Peranakan culture. Delicious Peranakan snacks and drink!
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: No sky diver at the Flyer
REVIEW_BODY: Great view of the Central Business District and of Singapore skyline in general makes the high price worth it. During the month of Singapore National Day, a promotion makes it a steal for senior locals in possession of a PAssion card, at just S$1.90 per ticket.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Singapore icon which always attract tourists
REVIEW_BODY: Every time my friends or my relatives came to singapore for the first time, they always asked me to bring them here. You can go by MRT and get off at esplanade if you want to go direct to merlion park. The view very great with singapore high buildings background, include MBS and esplanade. One that i always hate here is the weather. It is so hot at the afternoon, so i prefer go there after at least 15.00 p.m. It was great if it is the first time you visit singapore, but you won't interested visit this place many times.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A beautiful peaceful place in a big city
REVIEW_BODY: These gardens a a real experience where you can wonder and enjoy a range of beautiful plants and flowers. The orchard garden are something everyone should visit, so many different types of orchards in one place
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A automobile free stretch of close to 15 - 20 km along the sea is a rarity in this car infested world. East Coast park or ECP as it is called gives this and more. Great for a family outdoors experience with barbecue pits, camping grounds which need to be booked in advance. A great place for coup,es to tak that evening or a morning walk as the sun goes down or comes up._x000D_
_x000D_
Sundays during holidays tend to be crowded I patches but what the heck it just adds up to the atmosphere._x000D_
_x000D_
Worth a evening stroll or a ride.
ADDRESS: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road, Singapore 455486, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a good place to go for the first time visitor to Singapore because you can take time to get your bearings and marvel at the achievement of the Singaporeans. The entrance to the roof can be hard to find but follow the Skypark signs from the Marina Bay Shoppes or Hotel. Note:once on top you cannot use the infinity pool unless you are a hotel guest.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
One of the most striking and well maintained memorials of its kind. Fitting tribute to all who paid the ultimate price. The names on the wall are a sobering and sad reminder of the sacrifices made by so many._x000D_
Singapore can be proud of this memorial.
ADDRESS: 9 Woodlands Road, Singapore 738656, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the main reason for going to the gardens by the bay beautiful trees and an extraordinary light show well worth going to it
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Animals are difficult to locate, but still we were able to spot them. It was a different experience. In the night safari food court was there for refreshments
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore Zoo is located a fair way out of town. But it is worth the trip. The zoo has a wide variety of animals that roam in large open areas. . There are also opportunities to interact with the animals like feeding giraffes or sitting with an orangutan. There is also a kiddie park with entertainment, water park and pony rides. The downside is that there is quite a bit of walking required to see the zoo properly.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens By The Bay is always better then the last visit as they always have "special" display. The display this time around was Japan in Spring. The Plum and Cherry blossoms were in full bloom and the Azaleas provided a spectacular background contrast. The Cloud Dome as usual was captivating with all sizes and colours of orchids. Just the various leaves with their varying shapes, textures and colours was mesmerizing. At minimum 5 hrs to view the place, ramps for wheel chairs and strollers. We started at 3pm and left at 8.30 pm this allowed us to see trees in the day, have lovely satay for dinner and see the lighted trees as we left. Lovely sunset views of the river and Singapore Flier.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Exciting to see the Tulips and cherry blossoms
REVIEW_BODY:
When we were buying tickets to see the Tulips..I asked the lady at the ticket counter of the cherry.blossoms were still on display and she said No. I was dissapointed at the ticket counter but when we were inside we did see some cherry blossoms still there. So why are the staff not able to share this fact? Rather sad that the staff at the ticket counter are not aware if Cherry Blossoms are still on display!_x000D_
The Tulips were vibrant and so colourful..amazing experience._x000D_
Will definately return just to see the Flower Dome. The cloud forest doesn't change at all.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Just beautiful and what a view!
REVIEW_BODY:
We visited Marina Bay Sands Skypark on our last night in Singapore. And it was well worth it. We paid $20aud per person to go up to the Bar, Cest La Vie (no dress code) -each ticket can be used as credit towards purchases at the bar._x000D_
_x000D_
Upon arrival we managed to secure somewhere to sit, definitely do this first as it gets very busy and you might be left standing up for a while otherwise._x000D_
_x000D_
Look, it was very busy and filled with tourists of course but we had such a great time hanging out up on top of the city and got to have a few cocktails and snacks whilst watching the sun go down, the city go dark and the city lights slowly come on for the night. Very relaxing and a nice night our for us as a couple. Definitely recommend visiting if you go to Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
There was free wifi,available but there were too many people to actually be able to use it properly._x000D_
_x000D_
Next time we will aim to stay at Marina Bay Sands in order to be able to access the pool :P.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Easy and best way to see the Singapore from top
REVIEW_BODY:
It was my first experience in a Flyer like this. The cabins were air conditioned and spacious. Not much queue when we visited. The cabin was moving very slowly so you wont have any motion sickness. View from the cabin was beautiful and could see even the neighboring countries. View of the other high rise buildings, Harbor and the Ships in the harbor were also very nice._x000D_
_x000D_
A must experience attraction in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is one of the most iconic places in Singapore specially the Supertree Grove. The Cloud Forest and The Flower dome are also picture spots and there are other less touristy areas including a weird baby sculpture. The first three are the ones that are super popular. Take a stroll around in the buses inside the park so you can see everything. The are some great restaurants inside the complex too.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The tree structures are impressive enough and are currently decorated with fluorescent dragonflies, but come 7:45pm, they come alive with the night light show. Our presentation had a moon theme through the selected music. The lights are choreographed and everywhere is a good vantage point. We arrived early to secure a bench seat, though most people were happy to sit on the floor for the presentation. We did not go on the skywalk as by the end we were tuckered out.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Enjoyable stroll around well though out gardens
REVIEW_BODY: We did not have a lot of time so just walked around the outer gardens(which was free) It was well laid out and kept. Easy to see how you could spend a whole day here if your programme allowed.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Be Certain to Visit the Bathroom
REVIEW_BODY:
My friends told me I had to visit the bathrooms at the Mt Faber end of the cable cars. And I did._x000D_
_x000D_
I am not going to spoil it for you by telling you what I saw. Just go. They are on the ground floor in the building where you buy your tickets._x000D_
_x000D_
I'm sure everyone else who writes reviews about this cable experience will tell you it's terrific, because it is._x000D_
_x000D_
Go to the bathrooms!!!.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: An Absolute Bucket List Must Do
REVIEW_BODY: WOW! Just Wow. We loved this place. I can't believe anyone visits Singapore and doesn't make time to come here. For me, this was our Number 1 attraction and we spent 8 days in Singapore and did a lot. Hands down fabulous place. Flower Dome, Cloud Forest and the Superdome Trees with their suspension bridge and light show at night. Don't hesitate to visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the main attraction of Chinatown and very holy place for Buddist people. Although for people from different culture and different culture may not be able to understand much of the information, prayers here, this is where I would recommend a pre-read so that you can appreciate things here better. You can see various deities, avatars here and bit of info on them. You can also see monks perform various prayers here. Overall, you can find yourself at peace here.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice view during night time. Beautiful view and light. Cooling air. Advice not to go during noon time because is too hot.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Insight and an excellent guide !
REVIEW_BODY: The knowledge and excellent delivery of the stories and information by our guide Shar enhanced the already nostalgic feeling of being in the actual bunkers where these historical events took place...A must do for anyone visitng Singapore with a follow up to the Changi chapel also a must....
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: was good but nothing compared to the ones we have in india
REVIEW_BODY: Charged 5$ entry fee but there werent too many orchids or kinds of them that i could envy or love. Overall it was a good experience I also lost my phone here so was dissapointed.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Night safari with varieties of animal
REVIEW_BODY: Basically as it should be for night safari but the outstanding here is that there are many type and species of animal to observe. Both interesting for tram and walking. Not an idea on rainy day because most of the activities and shows are outdoor. Spend about an hour, more or less up to each person. Suitable for every age. Nearby the Singapore Zoo so you can put it into one day tour for both if you are not too tried lol.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fascinating tour encapsulates the wartime history of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This was a fascinating experience, bringing to life Singaporeâ€™s wartime history through the tour of the Fort Canning underground control centre and the excellent guide and short films. Highly recommend it.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Just spectacular and really well engineered to share the unique experience
REVIEW_BODY: These guys have perfectly simulated a realistic, elevated, thermal cloud forest within a DOME. The gardens and exquisite artworks woven into this spectacle is one of the most magnificent things I have ever seen. Well worth the money. Take a camera with Macro and Fish Eye lenses.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
To be honest not my type of thing, however if you are into Orchids, flower gardens and things then you will like this place._x000D_
Also very nice park, trees, etc._x000D_
Was very, very hot when we were there so take a hat or sunscreen as it's quite a walk.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great for a free day out
REVIEW_BODY: This is a massive gardens and would take a couple of days to really see everything and enjoy it. Most of it is free but there is a small charge for the orchid garden which is worth it. There are so many different, beautiful parts of this well maintained gardens that at times it feels as though you are in a national park. We went back a second day to the children's garden as it was closed on our first visit and we could have stayed there for a lot longer as there was plenty to do and the kids loved it. As well as the plants and the water there is lots of wildlife, as you can imagine, we saw several monitor lizards wandering around the paths and swimming as well as plenty of birds and butterflies, we even saw some turtles. I would recommend this as a great free day out, the only negative is that it got extremely hot in the middle of the day and there's not much shelter as you walk around so I would aim to go early in the day if you want to enjoy it
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: get to see the view of singapore. night view is nicer, can see the lightings around. short waiting time
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place just pring with u the water
REVIEW_BODY: The zoo is very nice. Very clean the animal verity is quit big. Me ND my family had great time just one thing to highlight the water in the zoo is quite expensive
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great aerial views of the Gardens By the Bay complex.
REVIEW_BODY: This a aerial walkway links some of the structures of Supertree Grove, and offer an elevated view of much of the Gardens By The Bay Area, especially a lot of the gardens and lakes and trees outside the Conservatories. Currently $8 to access by elevator, and well worth it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great to walk along, plenty of development with a large choice of bars and eating places. Very busy with locals all eating out.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of my favourite places in Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY: This is such a charming and wonderful place to spend quality time in Singapore. Indoor waterfall is amazing and it is the biggest indoor waterfall. It is very cold and misty inside the cloud forest. It is like we are in a real rain forest and you don't feel that this is situated inside a concrete jungle.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very fun to walk around. Lots of shops plus a very cool Buddha museum. I would spend a morning here!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Definitely one of the better old style zoo's,When you first enter even though you get a map take the "train" and stay on to get your bearings then choose your interest areas.The amphitheatre bird display is a must see so is the orangutans._x000D_
We suffered the afternoon downpour but that's Singapore.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's a spectacular place to visit with family & surely a great experience. Can do tour without the tourist bus though but it's a quite a walk.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was one of our favourite places in Singapore. Was much bigger than expected and is beautifully arranged and maintained. Would recommend this to all.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If taking the hop on hop off bus make sure you get green line otherwise you are let off at a stop on the street,it is a long walk in the heat
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to spend a half day. Take a stroll around the garden, see the super trees, visit the flower exhibitions. We had lunch at Satay by the Bay which was pretty good as well.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Among the best zoos I have visited
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore zoo is pretty awesome. Dont miss the polar bear and also the white tigers in the zoo. The tigers especially around the feeding time are a treat to watch.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Such a beautiful, awe inspiring attraction. Reminded me of the movie Avatar!
REVIEW_BODY: I visited Gardens by the Bay as I was staying at the Marina Bay Sand which is nearby. It was such a magical experience - I would recommend going in the evening when the lights come on and go to one of the restaurants at the top of the trees. I always tell people travelling to Singapore to see this!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is awesome and everyone must visit when in Singapore . The waterfall at the entrance is worth seeing . Various forests depicted and the flora grown inside the dome is a creation of the genius . Wooden carved dragons are worth watching. This is an awesome place to visit
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: just regular shopping street, better prices elsewhere. worth a brief visit but unless your on a mission to shop for something specific I would not bother
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: great concept and wonderful experience. it is quite incredible to see the animals after dark. i would recommend to anyone when in Singapore. You basically hop onto the tram and it takes you around - there are some additional paths to follow on foot
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must do is go the the Sywalk on top of Marina Bay Sands. Worth the entry fee. Amazing views. The whole Marina Bay Area is great. There is shops and great to walk around. They have a water and laser show every night. They have done the area up very well
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: For year round flowers and trees
REVIEW_BODY: Love the fact there is a different theme and flora and fauna at different times of the year. Kids found the Cloud Forest more interesting in comparison. The Flower Dome is nice to just view flowers, but not as much engaging activities.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The view was beautiful and it can be a great place for walking. My children enjoyed looking at the different types of trees , fruits and flowers. They were hoping to meet some monkeys but we didn't see come across any. I definitely recommend this place to people who like nature and walking, but bring your mosquito repellent
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A Thing of beauty is a joy forever
REVIEW_BODY: The national orchids garden is spectacular. Dazzling array with a large variety of Asian and foreign species. So beautiful that you will simply have to pause admire and simply drink a toast to Things of beauty are Joy's forever
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Delightful 40 minute rotation of the wheel with plenty of magnificent views. Nice way to escape the Singapore heat in a/c comfort.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We spent a lovely few hours there in and out of street markets and malls that had every thing. From a massage to a manicure or just a hair cut done for a cheap price also great food at an affordable price.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can take car to sentosa but this is more fantastic. The wiev is wonderful in cable car. There is some stops on it. You should lesrn where you go in sentosa before tou take cable car.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Whole lot of fun and educational
REVIEW_BODY: One of the best things about this attraction is that it's not very busy. Once you reach it won't be long before you actually ride the wheel. Before that you go through a display to show how it was built etc which was really interesting. Views were amazing. Many other small attractions near by and at the base to stay busy. Eateries available at and near the entrance and close by.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful tasty food for good prices in the hawker market but very spicy. Great market with lots of products for a good value. Worth a visit.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It's not often theses days that tourist attractions create genuine jaw dropping moments of wow for me. Gardens by the Bay with its amazing sculptures and architecture did that for me. The whole Marina Bay Area with the excellent Singapore Flyer and the impossible Marina Bay Sands justifies the visit to Singapore on its own._x000D_
_x000D_
Incredible!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Long walk with scenic views best done in the evenings when it is cooler. Restaurants and bars offer lots of dinning options. Visit converted warehouses and go-downs or take a relaxing boat cruise.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An excellent place to dine with friends or family in the evening. Nice restaurants and a surreal panoramic view of Singapore!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Excellent family outing! Went from early morning 9am till 5:30pm, spent a full day. Tired but great fun! Caught all 4 shows, kids enjoyed the elephant one the most! Fed the white rhino, giraffe and goats.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Part of gardens by the bay and enroute to marina bay sands. Quiter during the daytime and now the pictures are marred by the garish xmas stalls. As mentioned by other reviewers, the evening light and music show is special, but prepare for the crowds
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Only point of interest is amazon quest.the other boat ride felt like a very normal boat ride.one has to be real lucky to spot any animals .Wouldn't recommend it unless going for amazon quest for which we need to take extra ticket
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you've been on the Singapore flyer, there's not much more to see from the skypark. But it's still worth the visit to check out Marina Bay Sands and its subterranean glitzy shops and its fast lift.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must-do tour. Fascinating insight into a troubled period of the country. Incredibly knowledgeable guide. Thoroughly recommended.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was totally worth the cable ride. To experience such a beautiful park. The view from top is mesmerising.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Basically you can get anything you want in orchard road from food stall until branded shopping too! Definately my fave shopping road in singapore. Pram access are everywhere and you can walk through the road or inside the malls too
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There is nothing more to say than everybody should see it, it is part of history and very well presented.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful way to spend a day
REVIEW_BODY: I was worried that my 14 year old would find Gardens by the Bay boring, but she loved it as much as I did. Incredible architecture and plants in a controlled environment - so glad we visited.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Merlion statue is in a good location around the bay, you can see it from a distance and is easy to get to. Wasn't very busy when I visited so made for some great photo opportunities._x000D_
_x000D_
In Summary:_x000D_
When in Singapore, visit the Merlion statue!
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a must visit attraction in Singapore. It is an open zoo visit animals across the world. Very interesting concept! Although, since it's at night, the pictures don't come out well.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: First evening during our visit to singapore we directly went to merlion park to saw the attractions and captured some photos with my wife A night to rememberd
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Top of the list for me here, the front is very deceptive but take the audio tour and step back in time. Excellent setout and tour, made me view this time in history with very different eyes.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely tranquil exotic space in the middle of a city
REVIEW_BODY: A piece of paradise in a busy city. Beautifully maintained gardens with exotic species. There are places to eat and 2 gift shops
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud Forest was a truly special place to visit - felt totally surreal! The mist timings are listed on the Cloud Forest website - we visited at 8 pm and it was a bit challenging to take good photos because of the mist. On the other hand, not so many visitors at that time, which definitely added to the atmosphere.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went in the pouring rain and still had a fabulous time! So beautiful. Saw the trees light up for the night show from the roof bar at the top of Marina Bay Hotel
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Brighten up a rainy day. Interesting history of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Good museum. Well worth three hours or so. Lots of different media: videos, audio recordings, exhibition style as well as the usual exhibits. Everything from the early colonial days, to the birth of the nation and the growth to the power house of today. Plus changing exhibitions.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited zoo with our infant and opted for wild discovery tour. The experience was amazing. We got the chance to see Giraffe, Zebra,giant tortoise, orangutans, hippo from very near nd enjoy other lot of animals too ... I liked the fragile forest most where you can walk among beautiful butterflies and many beautiful small animals.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It provides a Good view but not great at all. Its a capsule which moves slowly. just for first time experience its good but dont expect some out of the world view.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I really think this is a must. They have revamped some of the areas in the last few years but the audio guided town tells the story of Singapore by understanding how people lived. It takes a bit too long if you listen to each recording but you can skip a bit here and there and adjust to your desired timing.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore Chinatown is a great place to shop for the usual cheap Chinese products, nock-off clothes, and souvenirs. The restaurant scene is fantastic and varied and includes the ever-present hawker courts for cheap, but delicious, eats. Easy access by bus or MRT and walkable if you'e staying downtown, on Clark Quay, etc. Great at night around Christmas or Chinese New Year.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud Forest is really beautiful! Lots of hidden wooden figures and beautiful flowers. But the Highlight was the walk from the top.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The flyer is located in a spot where the views of the downtown towers, the Marina and the ocean can all be seen at the same time. Not much of a line.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Do not miss this if you go to the zoo
REVIEW_BODY: This attraction is next to the zoo and so much quieter. We enjoyed the 15 minute ride along the river to see the wildlife. Then the canoe ride by the side of the animals. The best exhibit for me were the delightful giant pandas. It is fun to visit and quite a bit of shaded exhibits from the sun.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is an amazing, beautiful, informative experience. We spent almost the entire day visiting the various sections--_x000D_
The two most popular are Flower Power and Cloud Tower._x000D_
The beauty of Flower Power cannot be described--it showcases every kind of flower and plant that grows in different habitats. There is so much to learn, or you can just take it easy and enjoy the beauty. Cloud Tower is an experience where you start at the top of the exhibit and work your way down with each level showing the plants that grow at the various altitudes. I think an audio guide would have been good for this. You can visit other exhibits as well, although this is all we had time for so we chose the two most interesting ones. There are light shows, night activities and then you can walk to Marina Bay Sands Hotel for some great photos of that as well.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A fantastic experience, with an unbelievable range of orchids with all colours, shapes and sizes available to walk through and photograph.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Science Centre Singapore gives you ....a close encounter with the past prehistoric earth and flora fauna and habitat- dinasaurs, and next you can see the outer space in the planetarium...and have fun with talking robot, and so much more, go for rides to out space in a 3-d rooms, where one chairs moves, shakes....with the feeling that you travelling in space .....it was a awesome place highly recommened it !!!!!!!
ADDRESS: 15 Science Centre Road Singapore Science Centre, Singapore 609081, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Almost like in china! we got there just for the Chinese New Year! beautifully decorated streets, a lot of small shops, a lot of people and a generally interesting atmosphere! Try Tea!plus very interesting places with the kitchen
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: While visiting the Gardens by the Bay, I walked through the Supertree grove. After my visit to the gardens, I watched the light show, which was good for what it was. Lots of tourists and young families would love this.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful way to experience the zoo and escape the heat!
REVIEW_BODY: We took our 2 kids (6 and 9) to the 7pm session - it was wonderful and great to experience the zoo at night (and wonderful to be outside and it not be so hot!) The lines for the tram were very long so we decided to walk the entire circuit instead - it was fabulous and easily walkable. Unfortunately the Lion path was closed which was a shame as we could hear the Lion calling/roaring. Many rude other tourists pushed in front of our kids at some of the exhibits making it difficult to see some of the crowded ones (like the tiger) but this was not the fault of the zoo itself
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved this including the lift to the top, then walk down, great views and photo opportunities. Separate tickets for each of the 2 massive glass pods.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's not cheap (nothing in Singapore is) but there's a duck restaurant on the main food strip where the Beijing duck is gorgeous. I could eat there all day long until I exploded in a mess of that sauce.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We recommend coming here if only to appreciate the share scale of developement and how close/how many people can live together. It is really quite monumental and you only really feel it when there. Plenty of old shop house venues/restaurants nearby so this can be a trip add on. Be mindful that the Otram Park station is undergoing renovation so really check the exit to use otherwise you may end up walking in circles like us...
ADDRESS: 1 Cantonment Road The Pinnacle @ Duxton, Singapore 080001, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Book a package which includes hotel pick up and drop off afterwards. Its optional to include dinner at the Zoo. Strongly recommend this as hotel pickup is around 5/6pm and return to hotel about 10.30pm_x000D_
This is the largest hotel in Asia and seeing the animals at night in their natural habitat is a special experience. No bars just deep trenches to keep them back which are not readily evident in the evening dusk. We really enjoyed it.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is my fourth visit and Gardens by the Bay still fills me with amazement. I caught the MRT to Bayfront and then walked across to the shuttle bus which cost $3 to take me across the gardens to the Domes._x000D_
_x000D_
The Domes were as magnificent as ever and I had the pleasure of meeting a group of elderly residents from a Day Centre who were visiting the Flower Dome with their carers._x000D_
_x000D_
The Flower Dome was in the midst of being set up for a new exhibition, however it didn't spoil my sightseeing at all as it was being done very discreetly._x000D_
_x000D_
After visiting the two Domes I had lunch at Bakerzin. The food was really good and the service was fast and efficient. I usually visit Satay By The Bay for lunch, however I felt too hot and tired to walk over there this visit._x000D_
_x000D_
I didn't fancy making my way the long distance back to the MRT so I caught a taxi back to my hotel. The queue wasn't too long and I only had to wait about 5 minutes. The fare from the Gardens to my hotel in Orchard Road was $13.20._x000D_
_x000D_
Another enjoyable visit to GBTB.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are in Singapore for more than a couple of days, then the ticket for all 4 venues is worth the investment. We did the lot and loved them all. Breakfast with the orang utangs was an extra cost but was great and we stayed on in the zoo for the day. Spent 4 hours in the Bird Park. River cruise was good too. Only irritation was the queueing for the trams for the night safari - agreed well organised, but tedious. All in all good value and the adults enjoyed it too. Be warned, make sure you have insect repellent with you at all times.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place really good for who shopholic, in this place you can found many brand goods or if already sale day, you can found it many discounts, really like heaven.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I could have stayed here for hours. Well, I actually did! But I could have stayed even longer. Witnessing the actual praying by the monks was so cool! I loved the walls of ten thousand Buddhas, the tooth relic chamber upstairs where you can meditate, the prayer wheel on the roof, and then the extensive museum dedicated to Buddha with many artifacts and statues.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This area is full of shopping stores!!! Not only that, it's filled with of course tons of food stalls to go with it. Overall, it was good to see the area and also being able to enjoy some of the pop arts.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: best to visit after sunset. can take a walk by the 1 fullerton - Merlion - Jubilee walk - promenade open theatre. beautiful night lights and breezy. free performance at open theatre. water and light show is just opp at Marina.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens By the Bay have and excellent variety of flowers and plants The visit is well organize, Gardens are very clean.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This museum is in an old school, a very nice old building. There was an exhibition of Peranakan needle work, which was very interesting. This museum would be good if you are interested in social history, or in art / furniture. There is a very interesting reconstruction of a nyonya kitchen & dining room. Fair warning: part of the exhibition goes off on a tangent about local political notaries / families, not really interesting. Overall this was well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 39 Armenian Street Peranakan Museum, Singapore 179941, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: we went here for a drink, its quite nice but drinks are not that cheap as expected on any other thing in singapore. the cocktails are blended smoothly i recommend getting the berry bellini and the singapore slings, went here twice to get a good view of sg night time and in the arvo too bad though we were not allowed to go sit by the pool
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth the journey to the Botanic Gardens. Very large collection cultivated around a walking trail. The natural setting enhances the beauty and variety. Highly recommended. Restaurant next door is perfect for a romantic dinner.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Recommend going on a cloudy day, on a sunny day avoiding going between 12-4pm because the heat can become unbearable. There are drinking water fountains and washroom in the Orchid Garden. A highlight of this garden is the cool room - a special AC area with rare orchids and plants - a good cool off if you take a whole round of the garden._x000D_
_x000D_
It is around Singapore $5, and it is worth seeing the garden once. Plenty of pretty photos opps and perfect for selfies.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: 'Hidden' because it's in the University area, West Singapore, off the tourist grid. A beautifully curated museum. And quieter, we've never had to battle crowds or very small children. There's a variety of animal and plant displays carefully arranged, three dinosaurs, the skeleton of a sperm whale washed up here a few years back, tools of well known naturalists, and often a topical exhibit. You need about an hour and half to go through all the exhibits. Last admission is at 17:30h. Mondays closed.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum
ADDRESS: 2 Conservatory Drive | National University of Singapore, Singapore 117377, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth the money to see this incredible view of Singapore. You can get it a few $ cheaper too if you book through your hotel like I did. I did make a mistake though and put the wrong date when booking online, and didn't realise until we were lining up for entry, at first I was devastated thinking they won't let us change, but although they couldn't help me they gave me a number to call which then I had to email another place, I thought it was going to be a disaster. The lady was true to her word when she told me that they will answer straight away, as they did, took about 20 minutes to clear up. I don't think you would get that service anywhere else in the world
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great shopping and food restaurants many shops to go too.Need time to have a good look around very intersting place.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must see if in Singapore this is an amazing space so much in the space. You can spend an hour in this dome alone.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth a visit . We went late afternoon and carried on into the evening to see the light show . Greatly done and you will enjoy it
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is part of the Gardens by the Bay. It is spectacular the way it was created in that you actually feel as if you are in the jungle away from civilisation. Don't miss the huge waterfall. You can visit this attraction on it's own or buy a combo ticket that includes the Flower Dome. Not to be missed!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Walking on the beach, renting a bike, sitting by the pub .. and dogs are welcome most places! Lovely way to spend a day
ADDRESS: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road, Singapore 455486, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The boat ride was slightly disappointing as we did not get to see as much animals as we expected and there were quite a few enclosures that seemed to be empty and also the boat ride was a little fast along with the narration so it was a bit hard to catch on what was said.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great place especially the light show at 7:45pm, must do when visiting Singapore. Easy enough to get to with bus/taxi and reasonably priced.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to visit if you like flowers. I grow orchids so I particularly found this a wonderful experience. Easy to get to and worth the entrance fee.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited this place December 9 , 2017 we really feel relax at this place and enjoyed a lot and takes lots of pictures
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We spent 4 hours exploring this place and it was amazing!_x000D_
We started out by taking the 20 minute audio commentary shuttle around the gardens, this gave us a glimpse of the different gardens around the world with all with their beautiful unique plants. We then explored the 2 conservatories, then did the skywalk and sat down and had lunch at the Peach Garden. Loved every moment!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: All the flowers of the world in one place!
REVIEW_BODY: This place is a must visit. They have expansive flower exhibits and plenty of opportunities for your floral selfies!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: I was doubtful but it is a must
REVIEW_BODY: It is pretty and have stunning views of the the entire city. Try to go there around 5:30 - 6:00 so that you can stay around 2 hours and when ou get there you have the day view of the entire city and by the time you are leaving you have the night view.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is far from the city of SG. I used more than one hour to the zoo. The zoo is great with different types of animals. I love them all. I have watched the elephant show. My kid was happy of the show.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: With Singapore hot weather, it is a cooling and cosy place to browse through the large collection of books and definitely you can find a book or two which is to your liking.
ADDRESS: 100 Victoria Street National Library Building, Singapore 188064, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This spot is where you'll be able to snap your Singapore postcard photo. Also a nice place to hangout for a drink or lunch/dinner.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It has a spirit of old Singapore still. There are less and less such places. Unforunately for me. I still remember it from 20 years ago. I hope that all new modern buildings won't replace it.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth visiting!! Quite astonishing landscape with a vast array of trees shrubs etc. that simply relish the climate.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Take a tourist map to ensure you don't miss the important landmarks here. SMELL!! The fragrant spice flavour in the air that made this pace unique!
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was in absolute heaven. The garden are absolutely exquisite. Well maintained. The array of orchids was breathtaking. I could have walked around and around. Well the humidity is all one need to gorw these beauties
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Peaceful 30 minutes and a beautiful view of the city
REVIEW_BODY: We started out trip of the city with the flyer and were amazed by the 360 degree view of the entire city. We visited during the day time, but the I know that the evening time visit would also be as spectacular. It takes only 30 minutes for the ride so you can plan this visit along with many other attraction in this area on the same day. On the entrance they have a hall displaying various pieces of information about the flyer and its history. Tickets are available for purchase online.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: More than just the Flower Dome, Cloud Forest and Skyway
REVIEW_BODY:
There is more to Gardens by the Bay than the Flower Dome, Cloud Forest and Skyway which you have to pay to see._x000D_
_x000D_
There is also the gardens and Supertree Grove that you can wander around for free, many different sections and areas of the gardens to visit including the large baby and the koi fish._x000D_
_x000D_
Take a wander around separate to the paid tourist items, and youâ€™ll see there is lots to admire here.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A misty trail in the clouds
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful and splendid. A refreshing respite from the scorching heat and rambling noise of urban life. It makes me appreciate what the romantic poet Wordsworth said, "My heart leaps when I behold a rainbow in the sky."
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Finally we had time to roam the entire gardens including the orchid show which is just overwhelming. If you are interested in nature and flowers and do not have time spend outside the city, it is the perfect place on earth.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: you can have a good look of Singapore from the top of flyer round. At top point you can see Singapore-island of Malaysia & Indonesia. in the round you can see all top attractions of Singapore. if you like to spend a Romantic evening, book a dining car in night for two rounds. there are lots of others activities and dining places in the same premises. The other main attraction of Singapore are also near by.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Easy way to understand the (Chinese) cultural history of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The Chinese from southern China were earliest global travelers and settlers around the world. The Centre did a respectable job in presenting the history and evolution to where Singapore is today. Tip: best to visit this early morning before the nonstop crowd really picks up from lunch time onto night.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Turn to be an interesting place for eating and drinking, beautiful church and event space
REVIEW_BODY: Turn to be one of the famous place for locals and tourists for eating and drinking. Chill out place with many restaurants and cafes, and bar for sure. Beautiful church and surroundings for being an event space, one of the place for wedding party to be held here.
ADDRESS: 30 Victoria Street Chijmes, Singapore 187996, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A great place to spend a few hours with the kids
REVIEW_BODY: An amazing facility that showcases the future potential of cities. Great for the kids as well on a hot day with the water play area, which can be accessed for free if you don't fancy going in the (excellent) garden domes.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We took this as our way to get across to Sentosa. It was an amazing introduction to the beautiful beach island and a great way to build the excitement and anticipation among the family for what lied ahead. We took the all day trips. Very little extra cost and then we just knew we could ride all over Sentosa after that.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great view travelling to Sentosa Island
REVIEW_BODY:
Great way to see the sights while travelling across to Sentosa Island. The view of the entire Singapore area was spectacular._x000D_
We spent the whole day at Universal Studios and did not see any other part of the island as we ran out of time. We needed at least one more day to see it all.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth for all ages and you can do it on a sunny or rainy day. Check out my review on gardens by the bay to find out other things you can do while there.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Outdoor gardens are free at all times but well worth paying to visit the 2 huge conservatories - the tropical one is especially spectacular. Also worth noting you can get discounts at travel agencies around town rather than pay on site . Very helpful security at Esplanade MRT directed us to agent in that mall that saved us $3 each
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit place on your Singapore trip
REVIEW_BODY: You simply cannot miss this place. Walk and spend an entire half a day either shopping or by just window shopping. I visited during Christmas and enjoyed Christmas lighting and decorations. It was awesome.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Chinatown is amazing!!! Cheap souvenirs. Cheap and delicious food . Must see the HÄ°NDU temple and the Chinese temple.You will definitely enjoy your time here..
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Breath taking views of the bay and lights show
REVIEW_BODY: This place is so beautiful and dreamy. Its just exquisite. Like walking in real life 3D mode of some Disney animated cartoon. The lights the music, the views, everything is magical
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The flower dome very interesting and Very Very Very beautiful especially Tulip garden that's colorful. There are many kind of flowers too. Don't miss it if you are in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spectacular views of the city great photo opportunitys On a good day you can see Indonesia . You can have a drink in the bar their too
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went by boat from Clarke Quay along the Singapore River. This was a great way to see Singapore from a different angle. The Lion was one of many things to see.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well if you Like to spend Money and shop this is the right place to go in Singapore Nothing Real authentic about the place, the small authentic houses on a side Road was the Best
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really worth a visit. Be sure to check them out during the seasons - lilies, tulips, and of course Christmas.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A great place to see nature right in the heart of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: We visit MacRitchie everytime we come to Singapore. The city can wear you down a little bit with the pace and the crowds, but this park - even on a weekend with nice weather offers trails that are fairly peaceful. The treetop walk is the highlight and worth the 6 km round trip, but that trail can be crowded on the weekends. The long loop around the lake and golf course is never very crowded. Although there are runners that pass by, they usually don't make much noise so you can actually hear the forest. Do watch out for the macaques, they like to steal food if they see an opportunity.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A good place for high-end shopping as most popular top brands have chain shops around Orchard road area._x000D_
Lot of markets covering all major brands and retailers._x000D_
Price is standard to global pricing. Can't expect much of discount around._x000D_
Good place for 1 stop shopping experience; specially for Ladies._x000D_
Nice decorations around for family photo experiences and good multi cultural cuisines around for dining._x000D_
A must visit for 01st time travelers to Singapore, even for couple of hours._x000D_
Orchards Road area give the idea of modern Singapore.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: On a recent trip to Singapore my husband and I visited the Gardens twice in one day - it was fantastic. In the morning we walked through both conservatories (which are air conditioned) and saw a variety of flora and fauna from all over the globe and then at night, returned for the light show - both very worthwhile things to do, even if you have limited time in Singapore. I'd allocate at least 1.5 -2 hours to walk around both conservatories as there is a tonne to see and you don't want to miss anything! The one recommendation I have is for the evening, make sure you allot enough time to get to the gardens. Traffic at night is horrendous and there are hordes of tourists and locals going to watch so make sure you allow enough time to arrive before the show starts.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Number #2 place to visit in Singapore (the number one is the Garden by Sea). Beautiful interest garden with different and exotic flowers. Do not miss the Orchid garden. Just amazing !!!!! I've never seen such a variety of beautiful and different flowers.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Definitely worth a visit and here's a tip
REVIEW_BODY: The views are amazing. If you go up to the bar at the 'boat overhang' end of the building you have to pay S$22 each, however, this can be put towards a drink/food purchase (this is obviously to stop people taking advantage of free views). We inadvertently went to the bar/restaurant at the other end.....which has no charge (views still awesome). We bought our S$22 beers here anyway.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Stall type markets where you can pick up virtually anything. Wonderful for well priced souvenirs. Outdoors though so be prepared for the heat and humidity. Crowds can build up as the day goes on.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Place for all tourists to visit & enjoy the local chinese cuisine!
REVIEW_BODY:
This is an area that becomes especially busy during the Chinese New Year festivities. However, any given day, it has plenty to offer with many local things available. You can get tourist souveniors of Singapore here, lots of food, immerse in the chinese culture with some temples surrounding it._x000D_
_x000D_
There are a few notable good food in Chinatown - the famous soy sauce chicken that had a Michellin star - can be quite a long wait but the tender chicken awaits for those who have patience (the original stall is in the hawker center but the queue can be a few hours long). There are a few coffeeshops along Keong Saik street, just walking distance from the hawker that are very popular & I've seen plenty of tourists visit there for their yummy food - Kok Sen & Foong Kee Roasted meats are favourites of locals & tourists alike. If you like unagi (eel prepared Japanese style) - the best place is also along Keong Siak Road at "Man Man Unagi".
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Bird Show is a highlight. Well organised and entertaining. Looking down on hornbills and macaws in flight is a very rare and colourful experience.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Take in winning views of the city skyline and beyond on the Sands SkyPark Observation Deck.._x000D_
_x000D_
Located 57 storeys up from the heart of the Marina Bay area, the Sands SkyPark Observation Deck boasts scenic views of the panoramic vistas of Marina Bay and Singaporeâ€™s world-class cityscape. Take in a birdâ€™s-eye view of Gardens by the Bay and the impressive Supertree Grove, or admire the sea view that stretches from Marina South Pier to the Singapore Strait._x000D_
_x000D_
From above, try your hand at spotting Singaporeâ€™s iconic landmarks. Look out for the capsules on the Singapore Flyer and the durian-shaped domes of the Esplanade â€“ or the Merlion statue, another major tourist attraction in Singapore. Be sure to also keep an eye out for the orange-tiled roofs of the shophouses along the Singapore River.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Zoo is themed well and nice place to be with your young ones. Its a awesome place, my kid enjoyed a lot.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Should have allowed twice the time
REVIEW_BODY:
For the past several trips to Singapore I'd wanted to go to the National Gallery. We made it this time, but thoughtlessly only allowed a couple of hours._x000D_
_x000D_
The buildings are grand, but the artwork is outstanding, the latter telling a very powerful story of southern Asia. Once you get the hang of the p[lace it's easy to navigate. And there's some real history buried in there - such as the signed letter agreeing to the separation of Malaysia and Singapore signed by Prime Ministers Lee Kuan Yew and Tunku Abdul Rahman. A wonderful piece of history.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Enjoy the ArtScience Museum new Exhibition
REVIEW_BODY:
ArtScience Museum, sculptured like a Lilly._x000D_
Currently there is a wonderful interactive exhibition â€œWhere Art Meets Scienceâ€, adults can enjoy the exhibits but children will love it. As the museum is not far from the Singapore flyer it makes a good days outing, walking via the Double Helix Bridge. If you follow the estuary along Olympic Walk, towards the tall skyscrapers you will come to the bay opposite Marina Bay Sands Hotel with lots of restaurants along the waters edge opposite Sands Hotel.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Botanic Garden is one of the most popular attraction in Singapore. The garden is huge and collects plenty of tropical plant species. The landscape and plants are well organized with identification information on it. The garden was clean and well maintained. This garden is very good for family and kids.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing., Mind blowing. Go at dusk, wear old clothes as you will want to grab a bench and lie back to view the light and sound show. Easy walk from the MRT
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are like me and love nature in all its forms, the National Orchid Garden offers a couple of hours of educational fun. The flowers are absolutely gorgeous and even offered me very nice ideas to construct a vertical garden back home.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: WE caught a taxi to the Gardens by The Bay and the cost was not high. Wow what a place the cost was Two conservatories $28 Sing. and Skyway $8 Sing.
