We walked through the Flower Dome First and what a display of different Countries Flora. It was wonderful. We then walked through the Cloud Forest with the waterfall and then the mist. From there we went to the OCBC Skyway as the sun set the lights came on with a dazzaling display. Then a rhapsody of music and the lights were in time with the music. We walked away from the gardens with wonderful memories.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great to walk around but can get very crowded. Lovely scenery and facilities. Close to all the shops and MRT access is easy.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: No lover of cathedrals can visit Singapore without visiting St Andrew's. Set in its own city block and surrounded by trees, it stands out as a white beacon. In fact, the exterior with its many towers and expansive transepts is probably more impressive than the interior. Coming inside, it is a surprise that the transepts make no appearance in the worship space. However the sanctuary area is very pleasant, and I enjoy the West window of the Four Evangelists. I understand that this cathedral goes back to the early beginnings of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 11 St. Andrew's Road St. Andrew's Cathedral, Singapore 178959, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A piece of green heaven in the center of just Singapore, and definitely a better walk compared to the usually very crowded East Coast Park. I started walking from Kent Ridge Park and it was indeed a nice, and peaceful one. You can get to experience the secondary forests of Singapore and know a bit more about the WW II history of Singapore.
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: lovely greenspace in the middle of the city
REVIEW_BODY: plenty to see here in the gardens, amazing array of plants and attractions could easily spend a day meandering around, food onsite, toilets etc, also lots of lovely places to lie around and soak up the sun
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visiting here have remove shoes,they have sarongs and scarfs if you not dressed appropriately,if you want take photos inside you need a photo pass
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited China town around Chinese new year and it was great experience as it was packed with visitors. I loved the decorations, the traditional festive food and all the whole atmosphere.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We found this to be a nice walk around the Bay but shopping is expensive. I advise to walk slow and take it all in as it's a big area. A very good spot for photos. We ended up catching a Double Decker bus went to Harbourfront. From Marina Bay,there are lots of buses to catch to see he sights which I suggest. We didn't get to see it all but will be back next year to finish what we didn't get to see. It is worth the time to see except that the Merrion is disapointing.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really amazing il never done. You see Marina Bay Sand, Garden by the Bay. You can take lot of picture. Really fun.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was the most interesting and well spend Friday, that me and my girl won't forget. A day where all animal imagination come true. Feeding the elephants and donkey.. The animal shows... Is not to be missed
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It fell a bit short of my expectations as last years Tulip mania for far far better than this one. This seems to have been hurriedly put together as we could see bulbs at places too.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We stayed at the hotel so we could go to Skypark for free It is amazing view of the city. But I recommend it only at nights. The magic is coming on night hoursâ¤ï¸
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Don't need to fly to Japan and enjoy Sakura blossom, likewise to Holland for Tulip.
REVIEW_BODY: A place to get lost in Beautiful Flowers and plants with "cool" environment. Takes lots of photos with flowers from different parts of the world.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I would definitely recommend this skyway. You can great take pictures and it costs 8SGD per adult and children between the age 3-12 itâ€™s 5SGD._x000D_
You get great views of the Marina Bay sands hotel and of the park._x000D_
Itâ€™s quite high up so anybody with a fear of heights should avoid._x000D_
If itâ€™s raining they tend to stop entry into the skyway until the weather becomes better.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Stroll through a Chinese and Japanese Garden
REVIEW_BODY: A very large garden with various focal points, Zodiac, Trees, Bonsai, Pagodas, Bridges. If you look carefully near water you may be lucky enough to see crocadile size water monitors.
ADDRESS: 1 Chinese Garden Road Chinese Garden, Singapore 619795, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A walk on the high side
REVIEW_BODY:
We were recommended to check out the nature trail with tree top walk on our recent visit to singapore. We took a cab to the reservoir and stocked up on drinks and something to eat before setting off on the 11km trail. Half way round would be the tree top walk which we were told was a must. Unfortunately, as it turned out, can honestly say it wasnÂ´t. Massively over rated. Queues were rather long to go across the bridge as they only allow 30 on at a time, so if there is a relatively long line dont bother. Its up high but doesnÂ´t really add much. The monkeys that are around are far more entertaining as they search for food, some being rather bold and actually taking things from peoples back packs._x000D_
Overal everythng was pleasant enough walking through the forest/jungle with the wildlife all around and the reseervoir being well looked after with plenty of fish and wildlife._x000D_
Be careful when walking or those who are mad enough to run in the humidity the ground under foot is very uneven with lots of bricks and rocks that can turn an ankle so take it easy. If planning to go with small children and are going to use a buggy there are plenty of steps to walk up and down after the tree top walk._x000D_
Was a good work out and we did enjoy the walk but it isnÂ´t as good as we were told. So if you have a spare afternoon and want the exercise then its worth it but wouldnt make a huge effort about it.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is optional when visiting the Gardens in the bay, good views but if you are thinking of going on the Singapore Flyer or the observation deck at Marina Bay Sands these offer far better views._x000D_
You are only allowed 15 minutes to walk round (its a one way system) but we did it in much less time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: 3 major parts of GBTB - flower dome, cloud forest, supertree grove. All unique and creative. The dome lobby changes with the season, and the supretrees have seasonal activities too
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You've got to go, buy a ticket to both the cloud and the flower dome, it's so worth it. Afterwards, head up to the top of the Marina Bay Sands SkyBar and have a cocktail. The views are as exceptional as the Sky Deck one level lower and you don't have to pay for entry...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Flower dome is really wonderful , themes if different regions like Asia, Australia, America,Africa with Hybrid Flowers/Trees make even 2 hrs insufficient. Cloud Forest is amazing needs another 2 hrs and sight of endangered insectivorous plants is a visual delight for children.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful green oasis with a fascinating history
REVIEW_BODY: If you want to escape the hustle and bustle of Singapore by getting back to nature or if you're a history buff, then Fort Canning Park is the place to visit. The park is situated on a steep hill immediately behind Clarke Quay, so is very central and easy to get to. It's a reasonable size and some paths have a steep incline, which may be challenging for anyone with mobility issues. My overall impression was of green lawns, lush plants and lots of trees. There are also some impressive historical buildings dotted around the park as well as the WWII underground military operations bunker, now known as the BattleBox Museum, which is well worth a visit to do the highly informative 1 hr guided tour. Guided or self-guided trails through the park range from 0.6-2km in length.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Spend a day at the zoo
REVIEW_BODY: Lovely walking and if you get tired can buy a bus ticket. Enjoy the scenery and beautiful exhibits and animals. Many places to get refreshments along the way.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The Best Views of Singapore Skyline
REVIEW_BODY: The Helix Bridge is a great walking attraction in Singapore that offers fantastic views. The views of the bay with the Singapore skyline make this a perfect photo spot. Try to walk across when touring Singapore!
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Awesome place to visit! it just feels wow, when you enter this place. DONT MISS! Worth the dollars spent!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you are only in Singapore for a day or so, or even a week. You must go and see the Gardens by the bay, however, I personally would recommend you don't need to buy any tickets._x000D_
_x000D_
The Groves - which are the main attraction you can actually access without entering into the park._x000D_
_x000D_
Inside the park is the conservatories of; Cloud forest and Flower Dome which are just conservatories full of plants, not as interesting as I thought._x000D_
_x000D_
Instead you must book to do the walk way around the super groves as that is a must._x000D_
_x000D_
If you are on a budget however save the Â£30 and just get a cap to the gardens - you can take photos and enjoy them without spending a penny!!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The bridge is unique ans has lighting and design representing the double helix. Great views. Leads to the Marina Bay shopping mall and food court. You can also walk to the Gardnes by the Bayor the Sands hotel from here.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A great (wet) day at river safari
REVIEW_BODY:
It was a rainy day throughout our visit here but with the covered walkway it wasn't too much of a problem. We still enjoyed ourselves thoroughly with many great exhibitions of exotic fresh water animals. The red panda was not in the mood for an audience while we only managed to see Kai Kai the panda for less than 5 minutes._x000D_
_x000D_
Our favorites were the manatees, giant Mekong catfish and sturgeons. Keep an eye out for the baby manatee - too cute!_x000D_
_x000D_
It seems there were some boat rides and cruises but with the downpour we didn't manage to go on any._x000D_
_x000D_
In general the place is great - things in great condition, clear and well kept tanks and aquariums, animals in plain sight (mostly)._x000D_
_x000D_
The bathroom is definitely one of the cleanest and most beautiful with garden and natural light source incorporated.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: My Most Favorite Place in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: 5-story waterfall. 7-story tower. Epiphytes everywhere. Climate controlled and misty. This is my not-so-secret spot to visit when the heat and humidity drive me crazy. Be sure to take a camera and even take pictures of things inside and outside of the dome.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: compared to the mile road in chicago, orchard road is similar apart from their shops are all located in the buildings instead of "on its own"
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Waterfront Promenade is also one of the best walks to take in the late afternoon or early evening.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to buy souvenirs for your friends and family. Also a good place for eating some cheap food.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went for a walk along the promenade to see the Merlion and get something to eat! It was just lovely and even the tourists did not really matter as the size of everything is just gigantic.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very interesting any to spend a couple of hours wh8le visiting the harbour area. There are two domes to look in, one has a tropical rainforest to it with an amazing high indoor waterfall. You gradually make your way up to the top of the domes that give stunning views. Lots of tropical plants to see which would be of great interest to green fingered visitors.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fabulous way to see Singapore. On our visit the weather was clear so we got a clear view of Singapore, the bay area, Clarke quay etc. The ride takes approx 30mins so it isn't rushed with plenty of time to take some photo's and take in the scenery. Even though I've labelled this for young families, it is suitable for all ages and capabilities with plenty of room in the capsules for a wheelchair.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Too busy and didn't manage to do much
REVIEW_BODY: So I contemplated booking a visit to the Night Safari online which was a smooth transaction. Not an easy place to get to though but once I got there I stood in line like everyone else for 1.5 hrs to get to the Night safari. This already ate into the time to see anything else. The night safari ride was ok, probably best for the kids and saw possibly 45% of the animals. By the time I got back most if not all shows were booked or not running anymore so I headed back to the bus. Very expensive night that proved not worth it. Very dissapointed. Tickets should be limited as the attraction cannot cope with the volume of tickets sold in its current state.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My children loved it, full of beautiful plants and flowers. The indoor waterfall is amazing. At 2:00pm it even rains. For a snack we had delicious steamed buns sold outside the entrance opposite the entrance to the cloud forest they were amazing!!!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth a visit and better with a night stroll to walk off your food!
REVIEW_BODY: It is an expensive tourist attraction, and it is quite successfully done. I found it quite interesting about the twist of the structure and its clever use of fine mesh, which gives sufficient shading. The viewing platforms/balconies are a bit mundane though.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: GREAT TIME TO WALK AND TO ENJOY WATERFRONT PROMENADE, MAY 2018.
REVIEW_BODY:
During a 6 nights stay in Marina Bay Sands Hotel and 2 nights in Mandarin Oriental Hotel, I took the opportunity to walk several times along Waterfront Promenade. The most interesting parts are Helix Bridge, Merlion Statue (the big and the small one), the view on Marina Bay Sands Hotel and river cruise boats. It is really nice to do it by night, as the colors and light show in the evening are really of high quality and relaxing. Expect many people all around as this place is very touristic and many people like to make selfies all around the place._x000D_
Be aware of potential thunderstorms, which can start very fast and be very strong for a while. Try the river cruise also, which will give you the opportunity to see with different views of all the area. Last thing, the price for food in this area are very high compare with food price in Chinatown or in Little India._x000D_
I will soon add some photos to my review, for you to see what I'm talking about._x000D_
_x000D_
otterboris_x000D_
_x000D_
#wherethehellisboris
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Clarke Quay is an interesting collection of restaurants and bars along the river. You can find almost any kind of food you are looking for along with live music. Several restaurants have very pleasant seating along the river for a nice evening meal. It is over priced but the ambiance is what you are paying for.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Something you will never see again
REVIEW_BODY: This is a must to visit while in Singapore it is quite breathtaking.Book your tickets on line it will save you time when you get the as there is a lot to see.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very nice. Enjoy about 10-15 minute walk to the park. Nice gardens great waterfall exhibit, lots of walking even with shuttle service.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great ferris wheel, it wasn't just take a simple round. You'll get information about the city, and inform you about the surrounding places. Plenty of time at the highest point. Panoramic view for the whole city.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A zoo with successful breeding program
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore Zoo has a good reputation of one with a successful breeding program. It houses a good variety of animals from all over the world and re-invents itself from time to time. Together with Night Safari and River Safari, a local or foreign visitor who likes visiting zoos is able to spend the entire day and an early night in the locale and see all the animals. Although located in a rural corner of the island country, there are buses leading to the zoo. Be sure to apply sunblock generously and arm yourself with a bottle of water and an umbrella.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best part of our Singapore trip
REVIEW_BODY:
A must visit for those going with family - the visit will be thoroughly enjoyed by adults and children alike. There are a few shows to watch - we managed to watch all the shows except Animal Friends Show. All the shows need volunteers, so don't be shy and raise your hands._x000D_
Before going, check their website and take note of the animal feeding times - there is the normal feeding time where the zookepers feed the animals and we watch, and the more exciting event is token feeding where visitors pay SGD5 for a basket of food to feed the animals. This is usually limited to a certain number of visitor families to control the animals' diet, so make sure you're there well before the appointed time. The animals are well kept and are allowed to roam relatively freely in partial enclosures, so you get to see them in a comfortable environment for them. One exhibit we should mention is the Fragile Forest - you may be tempted to skip this as it's a bit off the main road, but don't! This is a true rainforest experience, where you can chase lemurs on the ground, watch fruit bats fly and eat upside down and let parrots perch (or bite in our experience) on your arm. There is a lot of walking, so wear comfortable shoes. Don't forget the Singapore weather is either hot or wet (we got both in one day!), so dress appropriately.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The SkyPark Observation deck is on the 59th floor where a lift takes you up in a very smooth ride. Once up, the view is amazing. You walk around the building, have a wine/coffee and drink in the view. There are information areas telling you what each building is. Its a must do in Singapore
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fun and buzzing place with some open air stalls (arrived in the lead up to new year). More 'real' than orchard road and shows the energy and real action of life in Singapore.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore has come a long way from merlion being one of the most important tourist attraction. Itâ€™s good to go if you want an open view, lots of tourist and that â€˜I was in Singaporeâ€™ pic.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice place to visit. Went as part of resort/ cruise. Spent 3 days in Singapore and then cruise to Thailand and Malaysia returned 7 days later. Quite hectic but worth it
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore skyline has become famous highlighting the Marina Bay Sands. Here you'll find a $$$ hotel, huge gambling casino, a ton of shopping, many food places, a Venice style waterway, and the must see Skypark at the top of the Hotel. I have visted the Skypark during both daylight and nighttime and I honestly can not tell you which is the best. Both day and night offer a super view of the city, harbor, and many other areas of the city.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very, very interesting tour with an extremely well-informed guide. Not much that can't be learned about the build up to and final invasion of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Amazing gardens, we went to the gardens and payed to go up to see the amazing views! Really worth it!_x000D_
After that we went to the flower dome and cloud forest it is beautiful! I recommend you to go early cause it takes like 30-45 min in each one of them..so if you get too late youll have a chance only to go inside one of them._x000D_
Take lots of water with you cause during the day its pretty hot walking in the gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lively with lots of peeps, food options, drinks
REVIEW_BODY: A relaxed night, with Music, Drinks although heavy on the pocket. But a must go to place if you are in Singapore and enjoy music and some stroll
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lots of variety of orchids, they are so beautiful and elegant, thumb up. Donâ€™t miss the swan lake too
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I was surprised, this is my second visit to Night Safari. I recall they had exciting attraction while you ride the TRAM. This time, there was simply nothing exciting. The Creatures of the Night was nothing to be excited about. the animals didn't do much, they were just showcased to the audience and thats it. i recall years bacl there were tigers doing some tricks and mo nkeys doing tricks._x000D_
_x000D_
The Tram ride was a 40 minute_x000D_
tour and it was basically just a simple tour seeing wild animals sleeping or resting._x000D_
there are nice souvenir shops and food is No big deal and really pricey. Meal would cost about 19 to 25sing dollars. normal lead time inside would be 2.5H to 3H, due to long wait in line.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Realyy educative and attractive especially the rainforest. They build and waterfall inside the aircon building that make it feel so real. The dome of flower is also insteresting although you should pick the theme because sometimes the theme not quiet popular.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A good water front to go for a walk or hangout in the evenings.A good place to have dinner lots of choices.The food around here is good tasty and cheap.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a nice place to be close to nature in comfort. The kids waterplay area located behind the cloud dome is also a free perk that comes along with the garden city reputation.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really great place to be in and more crouded in the evenings. I suggest to visit it twice: during day time and in the evening.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Watch the light show with the kids!! But ask someone what area its held.. We waited at the area where maccas is along with 100 other people.. but it was held on the other side... :(
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Did the flyer at dusk. It gives fantastic views of Singapore and well worth the price Queues were ok but you queue everywhere in Singapore ! Well run on and off in about half an hour
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The visit really makes sens with your tour guide who explains the history that was made here at the battlebox
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the Singapore cable car experience is a true eye in the sky it offers the visitor the opportunity to see the city from the lofty height of the cable car and absorb the beauty from high above
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The walk along this river is short, easy, and spectacular with lighted bridges, brilliantly painted underpasses, and towering skyscrapers as a background. Clarke Quay is pricey, but so well done. For a quiet drink by the water, big dinner, or rousing time in a dance club. If time be sure and take a boat cruise out into the Marina Bay by the Merlion. Round trip only about $20.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Been here both by day and night for the light show. Extremely impressed in both instances. The domes are super impressive by day and the light show at night. The gardens themselves are well worth the visit. It needs to have a day spent there to get the most out of it, then a little more at night. I most recommend the rainforest dome and the light show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A good view of the City
REVIEW_BODY: If you do not mind heights then this is a place to go for an excellent view of the city and bay area. You need to purchase a ticket ( $23 Sng. for adults) The area is closed during bad weather.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: All things in the world is here
REVIEW_BODY:
We have been walking in basement areas in ION to Takashimaya department stores many times. We do love their foodhall for lunch and many delicious food stalls and restaurants from all over the world. You could live in here and not get bored. If you like shopping please go and examine other floors._x000D_
_x000D_
Aircon all the way, nice
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Even on a stopover try to make time to see the Orchid Garden
REVIEW_BODY: Super place to see great orchids even if you're not a gardener.... Amazing plants with names like Margaret Thatcher and Winston Churchill.. Much more fun than you would think!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a must see while staying in Singapore. Although at times it was a little crowded, I was still able to take some stunning photos in this dome. Well presented and well worth the money. I could have spent all day here. The gift shop has some nice t-shirts and jewellery.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The breeze will dance off the water and give you some respite from the blistering sun and dampening humidity if you go at night. You will soon forget your achy body and relax to the light show from the Marina Bay Sands. You can also catch a show as there were some performers dancing and singing both nights we were there. And pics, you will take a ton of pics here and you will fondly remember your nights in Singapore.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We walked from Marina Bay Sands over to Gardens by the bay via the link. The sun was scorching and made it worst.. The view from mbs was beautiful. When we arrived, we wanted to buy tickets to the conservatories but the sign pointed us to walk further. We had to walk through several gardens in order to get to the main area to purchase tickets. We only realised after that we could have paid to take the tram and go easy on that walking in the sun. Luckily we managed to cool down a little in the conservatories. Beautiful flowers and decoration. Very well taken care of. I loved the christmas decorations
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Enriching & interesting! We were not only welcomed into a home, but treated to an experiential journey through the Peranakan Culture which is just captivating. As an icing on the cake, we were greeted with warm hospitality by the evergreen Alvin who played a great host during our visit. The Intan is a place to go. Highly recommended! (:
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: First visit to this museum. Went in the afternoon period and realised that time wasn't enough for us to walk finish the whole galleries there. We only have chance to walk one gallery which is the Singapore history gallery. And it already took a few hours time for us to finish that one gallery. We both took around 100 and more photos in one gallery. We were kinda shocked. Knowing that, we will be back again next time to visit the other galleries.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The whole tour was incredible and enjoyable. So many type of plantations and different type of flowers to see admire.A Garden dome with fully air conditioner!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not just for kids! Couples will love this place.
REVIEW_BODY:
This is an amazing zoo, and it's not just for the kids. My wife and I recently celebrated our 10th anniversary and started in Singapore for two weeks throughout SE Asia. We booked several activities along the way, and picked several impromptu things while in country. The Singapore Zoo was a last minute pick, and we loved every minute of our visit._x000D_
_x000D_
Compared to most zoos in the US, this zoo uses natural barriers. You'll find minimal "caging" and often it feel like you can reach out and touch them....and in some cases you can as part of a zoo feeding. Beautiful variety of animals here, many that you'll find unique to the region. We debated the night zoo, and after reading several other reviews opted not to partake. A Sunday visit around mid afternoon was not chaotic as one would expect. We did pay for the tram use, a great way to see the overall grounds and general planning of what to expect / visit._x000D_
_x000D_
Without a doubt our favorite experience was seeing Inuka the polar bear. This gentle giant is 27 years old, and you can see and hear the compassion his caretakers have. We went to an afternoon performance where upfront you're advised he will only perform if he chooses to. We love this. No pressure on the animal to "perform," they'll interact at their leisure. Ten minutes after the opening statement by Inuka's caretaker and he appeared more sleepy vs. playful. As the caretaker explained he's an older bear and he likely would continue to rest, this beautiful animal came to life and dove into the pool. He lives at his pace, his way: snow cave, pool, the waterfall or sun deck. It's obvious he's loved and well taken care of, just as every other animal is here._x000D_
_x000D_
There are several moments you forget this is a zoo. It's feels very natural, comfortable for animals and visitors alike. Plenty of food and drink options, there is something here for everyone. As a 37 and 32 y/o couple, we loved our visit. Inuka will hold a special place in our memories, and this was a great impromptu experience while in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Excellent value. I would highly recommend visiting the Gardens By The Bay when you visit Singapore. The Cloud Dome and Flower Dome were excellent. Take your time to wander around and enjoy these amazing gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A NICE SURPRISE IN THE CIVIC DISTRICT
REVIEW_BODY:
I was brought here by a local friend living in Singapore and what a nice surprise it was._x000D_
The Museum is only on two floors very easy to get around, with the main attraction on the ground floor - the Tang Shipwreck and second floor focusing on South East Asians heritage and cultural artefacts._x000D_
We had some refreshments at Prive, the cafe/restaurant before leaving. Very nice deco with local theme and food. I had the local tea._x000D_
Definitely worth a visit if you are in the civic district in Singapore, escape the heat and a great way to understanding of the history of S. E. Asia!
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best zoo in the region
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore Zoo has one of the best collection of animals in this region. There is also River Safari and Panda too. This is a place which is good to spend a whole day with family or as a couple. Best to go early in the morning in order to have enough time to see all the exhibits and take some breaks in between.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Feb 4th - Chinese New Year stuff still going on - floating platform and seating area packed with CNY events, music, stalls etc. A riot of colour!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: No need to cross the road for Prada, Gucci and the like they are on both sides. I have never seen so many high end malls and shops in one location. Very expensive but lovely.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Do not miss it by any chance. Its a must visit. We had a great time here. Beat the afternoon sun and spend time in this dome and the adjoining cloud forest. There is a 3$ shuttle available from the Bayfront MRT. Indeed heavenly.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We've been to these conservatories at least 3 other times, but we never tire of seeing the life and structures themselves. It is rather unique and provides so many photo ops. I last tried using mostly the GoPro in WA and got some spectacular stills and short clips which will assemble into a video of our visit. Having the Christmas displays up is also fun to see, but be aware - this brings more people, so best to go early (like early vs mid afternoon). These are a great rainy day option, but it is truly beautiful with some sun and white clouds in the sky!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the orchid gardens on a city bus tour it was fabulous the colours of the orchids were fabulous well worth a visit
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This Hindu temple in Singapore is most notable for its interesting roof architecture, with pyramids covered in ornately decorated figures. Definitely worth stopping by if you are in Chinatown._x000D_
_x000D_
When I visited there was some chanting being conducted by a man outside the gates of the temple. Whilst I have no doubt that there is particular religious significance to what he was chanting, it also served as an excellent atmospheric backdrop for my visit!
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Had a free morning before leaving Singapore so I went to the Garden of the Bays. So glad I came to see especially this time of the year. Wonderful Christmas decorations full of festive carols._x000D_
Also it makes you be more aware of the importance of the environment._x000D_
Overall a very refreshing visit!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An unbelievable construction, after all who could conceive putting a boat on top of 3 55-storey towers?
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I visited with my family and the Marina is another example of what can be built, especially if money is seemingly not an issue. The sweeping marina encompasses some great architecture and is visually stunning, especially after dark. You can access the famous Marina Sands Hotel (the boat hotel) and Gardens by the Bay or shop in the exclusive shopping mall, full of designer outlets.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Sakura blooms at Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: Sakura comes to support Singapore! For a limited time during this Sakura season we get to enjoy the lovely pink hues of the cherry blossom in the Flower Dome. Of course the regular flower exhibits are captivating as well. Lots of lovely photo opportunities!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Eat a satay street. Open at night only, Satay Street is literally a street in the business district which gets closed off after hours. It is attached to Lau Pa Sat. There are numerous satay stalls on the street, so you can take your pick. I went with a local and her view is that they are all similar._x000D_
_x000D_
We ate a mixed platter of pork, chicken, beef and prawns. We also ordered some murtabak from another vendor. It was really delicious._x000D_
_x000D_
Bring your own tissues and wet wipes - this is messy.
ADDRESS: Boon Tat St | Lau Pa Sat, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A great place to stroll around and spend a few hours to relax away from the hustle and bustle of the bigger picture._x000D_
Take in the views and walk alone the water side._x000D_
We were there as they were preparing for Christmas attractions so we were a little restricted, but were still able to do most things._x000D_
Go take a look it is well worth it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: See this by day and night. It's wonderful. The lighting at night is glorious. Yo can do skywalk there where you walk between the tree tops
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Best thing about the River Safari is that you can still visit it during a downpour. Most of the park is sheltered. I like the focus on aquatics although some of the tanks are a bit small and overcrowded._x000D_
_x000D_
An easy park to visit, take your time at the exhibits, best being the manatee exhibit. You
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When in Singapore you have to have a picture taken here especially at night when they lit up the trees.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Chinatown is the best place to get Singapore souvenir. The cheapest intown. Cheaper than Bugis market and Little India.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay was my favourite place in Singapore. You can spend hours there. We went late afternoon then stayed for the light show where those huge trees light up. Don't miss it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This road is full of shopping malls covering all tastes and budgets. It's quite overwhelming the share volume of places to shop but it's a one stop shop for those in need of retail therapy. Think mainstream shops not cheap market knockoffs
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The entire dome has an artificial waterfall and amazing plants and flowers on each floor. There is a pathway to walk down witnessing the amazing architecture. It is new and unique. You will love it. It is airconditioned.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Went for a morning jog during my recent visit._x000D_
1. Easily accessible using MRT (yellow / circle line); 2. Beautifully maintained trees, flowers & grounds; 3. Lots shade for joggers but lotsa open space for other activities e.g. Yoga, Taichi etc... ; 4. Different "gardens" throughout the park; 5. Good place for picnics & visiting for families with kids; 6. Nice fresh air!!; 7. No entrance fee, except for the National Orchid Garden inside_x000D_
Will definitely go again and will stay longer this round as i barely covered half the Gardens.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A nice and different experience . Very close encounter with the nocturnal animals . You need to have a very high end camera and real skill to click pictures .
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very much the heart of Singapore's tourist industry. You can wander up and down the river bank and cross over via one of the many bridges. A lot is rebuilt but there remains a scattering of history. Prices are at a premium on the waterfront.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Recommend booking the Night Safari with Dinner. Shuttle pick-up from hotel to main coach. Good, informative guide on the coach. The Indian buffet was very good and well presented. Various curries, rice, satay, salad, fresh fruit, ice cream. Tram ride with narration provided by a guide. The animals can be observed at very close quarters from the tram. Flash photography is prohibited. The walking trails enable you to observe various other animals. The fishing cat was amazing to watch as it literally fished for its own dinner. The show was well presented with some audience participation. A strong environmental message was well delivered. An excellent evening out.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very good, well worth the visit, lots to see and do, beautiful gardens from all over the world and the cloud forest is spectacular.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see for anyone interested in Singapore history.
REVIEW_BODY: There is a very good gallery with interesting displays covering the early days of the island through to the Japanese invasion and the post war creation of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you want to shop this is the place to be. Mall after mall of shops which stay open late and sell anything and everything. Many hotels are situated in the area but not a place to stay if you want a relaxing stay as it is the equivalent to Oxford Street but with more hustle and bustle
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The light show is definitely worth seeing. Make sure you get there early and grab a place to sit. We were early and got a great seat. However, the staff working the bridge entrance kept trying to get us to move. There was no way I was going to give up our seats. They should have told us earlier before all the other spots were taken or put up signs so we would not sit there. Other than that, the light show is worth the wait, the music that night was disco but it was still quite lovely. They should play classical music
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: i am in awe of this place!
REVIEW_BODY:
I had heard everyone say "You have to see gardens by the Bay!" and yes you absolutely do!_x000D_
the giant trees are just amazing and the surrounding gardens are just as beautiful. it is mother nature at her finest mixed with man made sculpture! I highly recommend going up to the top of the giant tree where they have a restaurant and bar.. sit inside or outside among the pink metal branches and enjoy the amazing 360 degree view! if that doesn't wow you then take a walk over to the glass bubble dome things! WOW WOW WOW! the flower dome sounds like something your nana would want to go and see but it is amazing! (and also nice and cool and a nice relief from the heat outside!) these domes are way huger than I expected and absolutely breath taking.. they take you on a journey through different types of plants from cacti to stunning rainforests and then amazing cherry blossoms where you would swear you were in japan! then just when you think it cant get any more amazing - you enter the rainforest dome. the waterfall and MASSIVE vertical gardens will blow your mind! the walking paths along the way take you up in, around, behind and in front of the giant waterfall. the mist makes it look even more special and there are some surprises along the way too ( I don't want to spoil it for you! )_x000D_
make sure you allow yourself enough time to really explore because it is way more amazing than you expect it to be! we went early afternoon and began our adventure with a trip to the observation deck of the marina bay sands hotel. well worth the $20! the enjoyed the gardens all afternoon and stayed for the light show at 8pm. I recommend finding a spot where you can see all of the metal trees because the show is really great and worth a look.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved this bridge esp. in the early morning on a Saturday when there is less people. There are also nice photo opportunities from the bridge. Good place to relax too.
ADDRESS: 221 Henderson Road Henderson Building, Singapore 159557, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you come to Singapore, whether you have kids or not, make sure you go to the zoo._x000D_
_x000D_
This is one place you feel that youâ€™re next to the animals and there isnâ€™t the sense that theyâ€™re caged like many perhaps more urban zoos have._x000D_
_x000D_
Make sure you get there early. It opens at 8.30. One because itâ€™ll be hot and two because they do feeding that you can get involved with ( at a small cost - it all goes to upkeep of the place). Elephants are a must as are the giraffes._x000D_
_x000D_
Make sure you have water although there are plenty of places to get drinks._x000D_
_x000D_
Taxi costs around S$15 out of town._x000D_
_x000D_
Recommended.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you do not consider the fact that the temperature inside is a bit cold (bring a sweat shirt), for the rest it is a Top sightseeing place. Absolutely great. I went there two times and it really has to be seen. During night, give a look on it from the top of the beside buildings. It's just amazing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Perfect place to have dinner (bars, fine restaurants, gourmet cuisine)
REVIEW_BODY:
In Clarke Quay there's a range of food and drink with different places for most tastes._x000D_
Long list of Bars and Restaurants of all types right at the river bank., most of them offer fresco dining which is really nice ...!!!!!_x000D_
lot of terrace options which is ideal for drink and dine._x000D_
_x000D_
Place is great after sunset onwards, the whole place comes to life without giving you the sense of being overcrowded or lost amongst them.._x000D_
_x000D_
You can see the Marina Bay Sands Laser show from this place..._x000D_
_x000D_
Happening place at night in Singapore and one should not miss....
ADDRESS: 1 Bonham Street Uob Building, Singapore 049782, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a very scenic ride and is a must do if you have kids. You can get really good pics and it's a convenient way to travel in Sentosa.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: one of our family destination trip. I do love their large flower glass house concept. you could see any flowers or cacti type in this place. luckily i got the chance to see the tulip festival during our visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a fantastic experience when visiting Singapore. The beautiful gardens, the fantastic indoor waterfall are amazing. We did the tree walk during the light show, it was unforgettable. Singapore 's must visit attraction.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We signed up for the City Tour and National Orchid Garden was a portion of the Tour. This orchid garden was beautiful! The friendly and knowledgeable tour guide was absolutely awesome! The garden is amazing.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I really enjoyed doing the night safari because most animals were quite awake, the zoo was too dark thought and they donâ€™t allow to take pictures with flash.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As very keen gardeners, the Orchid Garden was just spectacular and definitely worth a visit when visiting Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We had an enjoyable three hours what with the tour followed by the show followed by the fire act.We had booked in advance so got strait on a train although I understand there can be lengthy queues at peak seasons._x000D_
We had some time to spare afterwards and ate at one of the food outlets which was surprisingly goog
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Don't go on "men's Night" if you have daughters
REVIEW_BODY:
Little India is a pretty good resemblance to the real thing, it is bustling, has the vibe and aromas and is pretty cool._x000D_
_x000D_
At night they burn off the days rubbish, as per my photo. We went on Sunday night and it was a bit creepy. I have three attractive daughters who were wearing shorts and singlets due to the heat. The were ogled so badly and constantly that it was a real turnoff. Only after we got back to the hotel were we told that it was men's night at Little India. There are 2 nights that are men's night, Sunday and the other one I can't remember but I think it was Monday? It is seedy on men's nights, otherwise it's a cool place to visit
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These gardens are spectacular and the treetop walk is amazing although you only get 15 minutes at a time because the number that can be on the walkways at any time is limited.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great area to walk around with lots of shops and sights to take pictures of. Only problem is its popular (of course!). I wouldn't let that put you off but when its hot it gets a little tiring. Another must see area of Singapore
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Out of the world experience showcasing why Singapore is a world leader in architecture and climate initiatives._x000D_
_x000D_
Spent 3 hours doing the paid sections and stayed for the nightly lights and music show. Theme for November was Retro and the atmosphere was a treat for the senses. The dome gardens had a Xmas section which was nice._x000D_
_x000D_
The climate change and nature informative theater was moving and a great reminder of the fragility of nature and our impact on it._x000D_
_x000D_
All in all a place for people of all ages. Everyone can take away something out of this highly recommended experience.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is a must see if you like plants the flowers were so beautiful. I didn't realise how many beautiful flowers there were. Just do it
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic experience which must not be missed
REVIEW_BODY:
For me the city of Singapore itself is quite a boring and sterile environment full of modern skyscrapers and little history or culture._x000D_
One jewel in the City is the Botanical Gardens which must not be missed and is free to get into. Never in the world have I seen to many beautiful orchids and walking through the gardens you almost feel like you are in Paradise or another world with these wonderful plants growing everywhere in the open air._x000D_
The garden has one orchid which is named after our disastrous former UK Prime Minister David Cameron. I'm glad to report that the orchid seems to be withering on the vine much the same as his reputation and career post his disastrous decision to have a Brexit vote!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Zoo! We especially enjoyed Breakfast with the Orangutans!
REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore Zoo is beautiful. The animal enclosures are very nice and all the creatures look well-fed and content. We pre-booked "Breakfast with the Orangutans" and it was a great event. The buffet breakfast was excellent. Then, it was amazing to see the Orangutans "up close & personal." We saw a mother with her baby as well as three other Orangutans. They stayed on a raised log and you could have your picture taken with them (both with a professional photographer's camera as well as your own). When it was time for the Orangutans to leave, the animals held hands with their keepers and walked away. Simply amazing; such gentle giants! We also thought the White Tiger was a real treat. Throughout the day there are various feedings during which you learn about the animals from their keepers. You can also arrange to feed some animals for a small fee. We highly recommend this zoo.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An excellent place to visit.....lively, interesting, bargains to be had, good reasonably priced food., massages, suits made to measure etc. Fun just to wander around and see all the decorations. Lanterns, balloons , colourful clothes and knick knacks. A must in Singapore
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: C'est La Vie at Marina Bay Sands
REVIEW_BODY: Restaurant located at the top of the 1st tower with great panoramic views of Singapore and beyond. Amazing atmosphere and food. Staff very friendly and although the experience was expensive, for a special occasion, this is a fantastic experience!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Don't forget to bring swimwear for the Children's Garden
REVIEW_BODY: The water play area is a must visit if you have young children. There is a larger area with tons of rotating fountains, water jets and tipping buckets for the older kids and another area for toddlers, all dancing along to non stop Disney music . All free. There is a cafe next to it which sells reasonably priced takeaway drinks, snacks and meals like pasta, rice, briyani, and noodles. It also sells swimwear, towels and clothes for kids, if you forgot to bring them along. There is also a dry playground nearby which is also pretty interesting but it water play area is definitely where your kids will want to go.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Superb. Make sure to visit daytime and night time.
REVIEW_BODY: What an absolutely incredible place..we saw it during a monsoon and it was still really impressive despite the grey skies. The best time to visit is in the evening once it has gone dark to see the lights..unfortunately the sky walk was closed due to thunder when we visited otherwise we would of gone up. Make sure you visit satay by the bay within the park for very affordable and very tasty food during your visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit while u r in singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Thought was not part of our originally iteneanary. We are glad we visited it. This is increase place if u love nature. Beside ticketed flower and cloud dome . The entire garden with theme if gardens of the world is free for you to enjoy. U can also walk to it from marina by bay where there is also met connection.. don't miss the domes they are out of this world experiences..
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: dont forget to take the boat ride and consider yourself lucky if you get to see animal show where they show you certain rare specie animals in open
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went up the flyer just before sunset, so got the best of day and night pics. Great views over the city. Worth a visit
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lots of great things to do and see and the light show was amazing! Going again in September. Recommemd to all visitors.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gorgeous must see spot in Singapore. Cloud forest and flower dome are nice to visit and the Supertree grove is great, make sure you get to see the Garden Rhapsody light show while youâ€™re there, makes the trees extra special. Beautiful place to walk around, relax for a while and experience nature in Singapore!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing variety of orchids that are well displayed. Very colourful display. A special cool room for plants needing a less tropical environment. Interesting colonial building in the centre as well. A special place in the Singapore Botanic Gardens.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited in the day and at night. In the cool of the evening all illuminated it looks spectacular. As it was Christmas it was very festive and the music show reflected the season. This is one of the free attractions in Singapore and one not to miss. We did the walkway between the trees which gives great views over the city and of Marina Bay Sands. Cost $8. Do you have to keep moving so only get about 10-15 minutes. Still worth it though.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Such a beautiful place in the middle of a busy city. Toilet facilities are also available. You are welcome to light an insincere stick even if you are not of that religion.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Truly awesome to see animals active at night. Habitats are well designed and seem to have animal welfare as priority rather than viewing for guests which is great to see in Asia. Tip; walk round rather than getting straight on the tram. You see so much more in terms of animal feeding times and interaction with the animals. Save the tram until last, plus it's quieter queues later in the evening. We opted for the 8.15pm entry and left at around 10.30-11pm. Fantastic experience.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: To see the Gardens by the bay is free. Lights switch on every day at 7.45pm and absolutely beautiful in the night! Inside of this place you can buy tickets to see few things. Weâ€™ve only done the Cloud Forrest.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Obviously a massive attraction in Singapore. Loads of different places to choose from and a great tourist experience all round to see it all. Some well priced items aswell
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The queues are very long so do arrive in advance. Line up for shows around 30 mins before they start. The Creatures of the Night show is very popular and well worth the wait._x000D_
_x000D_
Buying tickets online will save you a lot of time and money. Asides from the official website, try tour agencies such as Klook which offer discounts._x000D_
_x000D_
It is very dark, and flash photography isn't allowed. You won't be able to get great photos, and it will be hard to see some animals, but still it is a worthwhile experience._x000D_
_x000D_
Plenty of food and drinks, restaurants etc available if needed. There is no MRT station near the night safari, but there are many buses that will take you to one. The staff are helpful and can advise you on how to return to your hotel via public transport, as taxis/Grab get very expensive at night._x000D_
_x000D_
The tram is not worth it as you won't be able to see the animals clearly from the tram. There is also a very long queue for the tram. Simply take the trails. There are many trails, so do take a look at the map and plan beforehand.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Oldest Hindu temple in Singapore ... absolutely beautiful.
REVIEW_BODY: Visited here in November 2017 whilst on holiday in Singapore. It is a beautiful temple, both the exterior and the interior which has many statues and sculptures. Removal of footwear is required before entering and modest dress ( covering of shoulders and no shorts) necessary. The interior has partitioning to prevent tourists from entering sacred areas but there is still much to see. I appreciated the serenity and got some lovely photos. As someone who has never visited a Hindu temple before I appreciated being able to visit and to have a glimpse into the Hindu culture. Wonderful experience.
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Second time here for Teamlab and restaurant
REVIEW_BODY: My second time here, overall experience and staffs are nice. So this time I especially visit there for Teamlab at the glass rotunda which is interesting and creative. Easy access with discount for student and senior. Event and exhibition may changes periodly. Cafe and restaurants there also interesting (michelin starred restaurant, famous restaurant included) and can be visit without museum ticket.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Super Tropical rainforest experience at the sunny equator
REVIEW_BODY: We bought tickets to both the domes and were impressed about the huge waterfall and rainforest through which one comes down through. The other Garden dome is good with variety of plants from around the world but very common for us Aussies where one sees these around the place...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing garden with different kind of plants and flowers from all over the world. Take your time and explore the place slowly and will find plants that you never imagine exist
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must to visit, to learn the authentic Peranakan history in a homely museum. Mr Alvin, the owner is very hospitable and I am impressed with his private collection.
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the best garden you will ever see that is man made.The detail is close to perfection and the set out is the best. Give youself a full day to explore this Amazing garden.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice circuit around the bay from Marina Bay Sands to the business district, the Merlion park, F1 circuit, Helix bride and back to MBS!
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: i and my friends occupied 1 car, we visited in the afternoon. the queue was not long, so it was very fast :) recommended to visit Singapore flyer.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful ride to see Singapore and specially bay area. It is more so beautiful to take this ride in evening.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the best bird park I have visited. Friendly staff, very well maintained enclosures, clean and hygenic bird enclosures, clear and precise signages and good bird shows
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One thing to see is the Cloud Forest, this is unique and magic. You can imagine yourself in the amazone and feel the nature
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The highlight of the zoo was the Elephant feeding. We would recommend including this in your visit - a fantastic experience. Also recommend getting a shuttle ticket to get around - it was pretty hot.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The views from the top of this building are outstanding. Well worth a trip up there if you are visiting the area. You can use the restaurant but the pool and park area only for guests. Everything looks so small from up there !
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A lovely temple to take some peace at! I especially loved the tranquil garden on top. Take some time to meditate and ponder your present moment here. It was lovely!
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: on the second time - just the same...
REVIEW_BODY:
came for the second time looking for some changes but not in this attraction. we came for the fog time - actually not special, the place need some better maintenance for the green mold growing. the water outlets looks artificial - can do better._x000D_
still a must see for 1 time as minimum
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Went not expecting much to pass some time however was an absolutely beautiful day out. Relaxing area, maintained by absolutely loads of staff. There are vending machines which provides food for the terapins & fish for you to feed for $1. There is a restaurant in the middle of the gardens with lovely food that's reasonably priced._x000D_
Lovely beautiful place highly recommended.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: i went to night safari and it was the coolst night ever, the workers are very friendly to explain and the animals are kept in good condition and its very clean.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore botanic garden is an awesome example of the preservation of the nature at the middle of a busy city. We will feel the change from the busy city to a well maintained area of trees and the entry to the area is free. Orchid gardens is located at the center of the gardens giving an awesome experence of tenthousands of varieties of orchids. It's a fantastic place to celebrate your holiday with near and dear ones. Kids will love the place for sure. Highly recommended.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Go there on a weekend n enjoy the fab food music live band in the small lanes of this area. Not to miss the iconic mosque and feel of arabic culture.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You have to go to the free light show at night, it takes your breath away, it takes place twice a night at 1945 & 2045
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a superb attraction! Its totally free to just walk the gardens but due to the heat we chose to pay and get a ride on the train that takes you around the entire gardens pointing out interesting features. This was well worth the cost as the gardens are very large with so much to see. this also gave us time to go back and explore the parts which interested us the most. Be sure to take your camera as there are so many photo opportunities. An excellent attraction well worth a visit when in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Flower Dome is one of four parts of the Gardens by the bay complex. It was my least favorite - not bad, but not exceptional. If I had to choose between this dome and the National Orchid Garden at the Singapore Botanical Gardens, the Orchids win out. But when combined with the other three parts of the Gardens by the bay, namely the Cloud Forest dome and the Supertree light and sound show, I would be happy with the Gardens by the Bay. If you have limited time at the Gardens by the Bay, go to the Cloud Forest dome first. The 15 minute long light and sound show at 7:45 and 8:45 (check website for times) would be my second pick, followed by the Flower dome. Hope this review and opinion helps!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Only a few words here I am afraid. No special wonder unless there is a flower show on. So save it for later if you need to. Unless you are a foreign visitor and do not mind the lacklustre compared to another garden around te world. Only conform is the respite from the heat on a humid day.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Throughly worth while experience on the cable cars, expensive like everything in Singapore , but my 8 year old loved it .would do it again next time.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The iconic singapore merlion lights up at night with loads and loads of people coming to see it. Good experience.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We had loads of fun. This place is full of fun activities for family especially young kids._x000D_
_x000D_
Unlike many other zoo's around the world, this place actually takes extreme good care of the animals._x000D_
_x000D_
Do not miss this attraction! This is a must do as you will never see it elsewhere.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice experience if you're into nature and greenery...
REVIEW_BODY: It was a beautiful setting and is worth visiting, however we were in and out in a short time. Not necessarily the highlight experience of my trip but worthwhile if you run out of ideas/things to do when in SG.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I am a big zoo fan, and as such have visited many zoos around the world._x000D_
This zoo is the best by a country mile. It is beautiful, clean and the animals look as if they are so well looked after. We paid the extra for the Orangutan breakfast, the food was not the best but that was not the reason we were there. It was a great experience and I would highly recommend.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Walked the four parks in a row starting from Mount Faber
REVIEW_BODY: I started at the Vivo City shopping mall, walked up to mount Faber, passed over the Henderson waves (great!) onto the next park (Telok Blangah), and kept going over the Forest Walk, the Alexandra Arch, Floral Walk, Horti Park up to the Canopy Walk (parts were closed). Took a nearby MRT back - hiked about 10 km's. Great experience.
ADDRESS: 221 Henderson Road Henderson Building, Singapore 159557, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
China town and like areas are our gomto places for markets and hawker centre food. Less tourists more fun. The food is amazing, variety great, quality stuff, hedge choice and very safe. If people are lining up for 30 min it must be good!_x000D_
Do yourself a favor and hang out with the locals. My girlfriend was a bit apprehensive, the had to keep going back again and again.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Did not like this at all, very artificial looking, never before seen a waterfall made of concrete etc.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Monkey situation at Macritchie Reservoir is bad
REVIEW_BODY: Used to be able have picnics in peace there. Now if you go there for a picnic and lay out the picnic mat laden with food, get ready to pack in a frenzy later.
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A Greeny space beyond the downtown Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY:
I went because it may be different than other busy and crowed places in Singapore._x000D_
Have MRT take you in front of the site. Not too many people, May was a raining season in the Island. Nice to take a stroll in different sections in the Garden. Go for the Orchid garden, which you need to pay extra to get in. Well, not to bad but not enough to Wow me. Beautiful but nothing too impressive. It is a good place to relax and appreciate the Beauty of the Natural for sure.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A birds eye view of Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY: Expensive but worth it for the wonderful views over the beautiful city skyline of Singapore. We did the Singapore Flyer with our two young boys aged 7 and 9 and they absolutely loved it. At night, the Flyer is lit up and looks amazing.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved the zoo, my favourite was the polar bear! The kids loved the waterpark and hubbyâ€™s favourite was that he was able to drink beer while walking around. Beautiful place
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a beautiful building - and one I was fortunate to witness during a Buddhist ceremony. For the ladies, be sure to bring a shawl to wrap around your shoulders (if they're bare). However, if you forget, you can borrow one at the temple.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went up there as a hotel guest. Beautiful view and looking downwards, the city was so well organised and neat. Was there at about 10.40am and it was hot. It'll be good if the hotel can out up some shelters. But it's worth visiting even to pay if one is not a hotel guest. Maybe the next round, I'll be up there in the evening. I think the view will be even much better.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A place dedicated to the Indian community in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
Little India is the home to the ethnic Indian community in Singapore that is popular for their temples, great eateries, traditional Indian clothing shops, flower shops, provision shops and for all your shopping needs. There is a wide variety of souvenir shops as well if you are a tourist and would like to get some gifts to take back with you._x000D_
_x000D_
If your are in the area, you must visit the Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple, dine at Apollo Banana Leaf (Race Course Road), visit Tekka market (2nd level) to buy some traditional Indian clothes and ultimately head down to Mustafa Centre which is a 24 hour shopping centre that sells almost anything you can think of! Mustafa Centre is one of the more prominent shopping centres for tourists!
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice place to go.Start with the show then hop on the train and then walk the zoo. You see a lot of animals very close, it feels like they are free.I liked the fruit bat the most.There are buses outside for returning to the city.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A pretty ordinary place, nothing special and the light show in the evening was not worth the wait, in fact we left before it finished. For what it is we found it to be very over priced, there are far better things to do in Singapore than this place, I would give it a miss.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Before we came to Singapore we had planned to visit this place and we were not disappoinred with what we saw._x000D_
Even though my wife hate heights, it was her idea to go here and we walked through the mists of the forest and under the waterfalls._x000D_
There are really good views across Singapore from the upper level
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nicely organised and easy to catch. Travels at a leisurely pace. Good way to see areas of the city from the water view.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
try visiting this attraction at night and be mesmerized by its magical light show. never mind the beads of sweat trickling down your face because of humidity. you'll just be transfixed in awe while viewing the interchange of colors with corresponding upbeat music._x000D_
_x000D_
coming here is free. be prepared with your camera and a lot of smiles.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If in Singapore, you will have seen many temples but this particular temple is so different. Walk in and be ready to be wowed. Do not forget to go downstairs where the relic is held.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good place to rest and recreated yourself in this garden even it was located in city center.Quite and peaceful place. Of course there has a lot of flowers and trees.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: At night there is a big light show
REVIEW_BODY: Very beautiful to walk around and take pictures. Many activities and shops. Altough the shopping mall is very high end and luxury products it still remains a good place to take a breath. At night they have a big light show on the water witch is breathtaking but be on time because there is allot of people and right before it starts it is pushing to find a good viewing spot.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Definitely the best place to have a great view of Singapore. Having lunch or dinner at the roof restaurant is always a good choice. It worths the effort to visit skypark at day and at night, a very different spectacle.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I love the Singapore Zoo. It's a place where I bring my kids (2&5years) every month. It's relaxing, fun (especially the water park) and it's all hassle free.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore
