REVIEW_BODY: An excellent tour,with an excellent guide, Aysha, who made the whole experince so interesting and enjoyable. A high point of our visit to Singapore.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A nice 25 min view of part of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: As wheels go this one has a nice view over the Kallang river and the city centre of tall building and historical places. At night its clearly a very colourful array of lights and during the day often a good viewing point to see the city centre (financial centre) and what is left of Tanjong pagar container Harbour. Another key aspect here is your in the middle of the F1 race course, so you can see the boxes or Pits during the period other than the race. It takes just under 30 mins to do the round. The facilities are ok but other than the view not much here.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can spend a whole day there walking around. The two domes are worth visiting if you love flowers and nature.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This garden is magical, I brought my mother here because orchid is her favorite flower. Needless to say she really enjoyed the visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: OK if you want standard shopping and lots of food
REVIEW_BODY: Orchard Road has the major standard brand names if that is what you are looking for. According to my American sister in law, shopping in Orchard Road is expensive compared to factory outlet shopping in the States. Personally, I don't find our sales to be interesting (including the so called Great Singapore sale) as most of the items are at most 10-20% discounted compared to sales in the States which can see many items at 40% discount or more. Many of the sales items also seem to be items which can't sell. If you would like to experience a more 'local' shopping experience (though you might not buy anything there), try places like Toa Payoh, Little India and Kampong Glam. While you might not buy anything, it might be a more interesting experience. I have bought batik in Kampong Glam for foreign friends- but beware, batik colours run so if you buy batik for anyone, do give them instructions on how to hand wash the batik.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The most beautiful garden in the world!
REVIEW_BODY: I specifically wanted to see the Cloud Forest and I was not disappointed. The layout was perfect and the colours and varieties were way more than I expected. The combination of bromiliads and ferns was so beautifully done. I would visit there every day if I lived in Singapore. You must see all the Gardens by the Bay but above all, go inside the enchanted Cloud Forest and be lifted into another world.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely trail of treetop walk... You will encounter some beautiful birds. Wonderful for a brisk walk exercise.
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: I only wish I had more time!
REVIEW_BODY: I try to go to a zoo on all of my travels and this did NOT disappoint. I started my day with the orangutan breakfast, although this is not as intimate an experience as advertisements make it seem, it was still great. I got a good deal on expedia and the food was honestly SO good. They had both western and local food. I spent several hours at the zoo, my favorite exhibit was lemurs/monkeys/fruit bats with no enclosure, so you can truly interact. It was not crowded when I went, and I could move through attractions quickly but you don't want to, it's way too fun. I would allot a large chunk of your day to exploring here. Check the forecast, a bit of a bummer if it rains.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Although it can't match the size and magnificent grandeur of the Louvre in Paris (France), this is where I must say it is something a Singaporean, like me, is very proud of. If I were to add up all the art & museum spaces around Singapore, we do have a size that could match the Louvre. As for the art, it is rightly asian centric. For European art, go to the Louvre. This place is where many pieces of important art and sculptures from asian artist are kept. The building that was renovated for this place is an art by itself. City Hall is a historical landmark. And if you venture up to the roof patio, many may not know it, the Singapore flag pole marks the survey datum point from which the whole of Singapore is measured against._x000D_
_x000D_
This is only free to citizens, there is a minimal charge for others. Check out the guided tours, the guides are knowledgeable and it would deepen your visit with their commentary.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Costs 23 SGD per person . but really one should visit the skypark for a breathtaking view . PS : Only residents get access to Infinity pool . You can not even see the pool from the observatory .

REVIEW_BODY: This is a must see to understand the history & culture of the Singapore Chinese and their hard working and resilient attitude even today. Need a good 1.5-2.5 hours - Great Value
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Don't miss this if you are visiting Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
This is a SG50 jubilee gift from the government to the citizens of Singapore, and what a gift it is. It is a visual arts institution which houses the most number of art from South-East Asia, and it is situated in the former Supreme Court and City Hall (which was given a full renovation while retaining the charm and historic structures of the old buildings). I set aside about 4 hours to look at the art as well as the architecture, as well as having a coffee at the end, and I was left impressed and wanting for more._x000D_
_x000D_
I would recommend you to visit this place at 10am when it opens so that you can view the art in relative peace and quiet. Start from the "City Hall" side where you can view the historic Singapore art and work your way up from the 1st floor. Cross the bridge at the top floor, and make your way down the "Supreme Court" side, viewing the rotunda as you go. The "Supreme Court" part has more gallery exhibitions which are mostly from South-east Asia. There are a few pieces there which are truly stunning._x000D_
_x000D_
The National Gallery also has an app which you can download prior to going so you can plan your visit. I think it's fun but it's not necessary. Sometimes the best thing about viewing art is coming round the corner and seeing a beautiful piece which captures your eye._x000D_
_x000D_
There is a expansive children's section on the Ground floor which is very impressive. Plenty of top-notch cafes and restaurants let you have breaks throughout your visit. Get a coffee from the cafes on the Ground floor (near the gift shops - I think they are called Vanilla Bakery Cafe - very good coffee). All in all, the NatGall is a very well-planned gallery, and truly an example of how Singapore can shine when she puts her mind to it._x000D_
_x000D_
Bravo, Singapore! Well done.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

And we stood in front of them for the obligatory photos. The Polar bear show was great. And getting up close with the Girraffes was a highlight for my Daughter. REVIEW_TITLE: Make sure you visit the River Safari
REVIEW_BODY:
In case you like nature and animals make sure you visit the River Safari! Itâ€™s entrance is right next to the entrance of Singapore Zoo so better plan visiting both on the same day as they are away from the city and itâ€™s quite a long ride to get there. You can also reach the placi by one of the hop-on hop-off routes. Otherwise taxi ride is the fastest way to get there._x000D_
Itâ€™s also worth to take the boat ride there (normally there is an additional fee for it). You ca see lots of river animals plus a red and giant panda. The sunk forest is actually the largest sweet water aquarium we have ever seen â€“ really impressive!_x000D_
We visited the place with iVenture pass so admission was free for us, including a 30 min lake cruise and the boat ride.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great view over the city & Sentosa Island
REVIEW_BODY:
We took the gondola up to Mt Fabor. Great views and they had a cute terrace hung with wishing bells. If you venture further through their garden at the top, you will come to an original old sailing shipâ€™s bell which is meant to grant lifelong happiness when couples ring it together. If you walk up to the top of the mountain, you get great views of Sentosa Island, the original Merlion (the sign for prosperity) which guards over the trading ship harbor, and views of Singapore city._x000D_
You can then take the gondola on a round trip to Sentosa Island which has a uniqueness including an alley towards the beach which you would think Gaudi had developed and designed! Definitely worth the trip!

REVIEW_TITLE: Good fun for kinds but would have been better to see more animals
REVIEW_BODY: We had booked the Night Safari tickets online & the booking was very convenient. Once we reached there, there was a long queue which got shortened quickly (they have number of vehicles & therefore it doesn't take too much time for the queue to get over). Once we were in the night safari (it is a big open bus), we went into the zoo/safari with a predefined running commentary telling us what were the animals that we were looking at. It was almost 40-45 minute Safari in that open bus. Now, let me tell you the pros & cons:Pros:1. New experience which we don't get to see at many places2. Very well managed even after heavy crowd (we were there in last week of December)Cons:1. Too few animals & therefore I felt the safari is overpriced.2. They try to make money from the photographs & photos are just too expensive.3. Apart from 1 tiger, no other wild cats were seen.4. Most of the time, the visibility levels were very very low.5. If possible, they should merge Night Safari & River Safari and have combined tickets for them.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

You just pay for the extra's like the bus and the entry to the closed gardens (that create a particular climate). Just walking around the park is for free. I learned quite a bit about the rainforest.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited there many times. Child likes here very much especially when feeding the bird in the park. Will come to visit again.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited both of the Gardens by the Bay flower domes, one is the cloud forest and the other is a display of flora from all over the world. They both were amazing and incredibly beautiful.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It takes about 30-40 minutes to go around one time....the movement is not too bad..I was afraid of getting dizzy. Obvious for me was the views of the city being the best part of this ride.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Would recommend night safari and the shows were brilliant too. A must do in Singapore! We ate in the restaurant, food was reallu good.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its a shopaholics dream loads and loads of good shops from cheak stuff to really exclusive shops. Plenty of cafes and restaurants too to relax and count the cost of your purchases
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: good for the first time in Singapore , views are worth it
REVIEW_BODY:
Great for first timers to Singapore, views are spectacular, price is a bit steep, a good experience taking in the views and being on a icon in Singapore._x000D_
Go the extra and visit the bar, where you get the view, for free and have a drink instead!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We spent time outside the Marina bay sands mall. Free Laser show at 7.45 pm and 8.45 pm daily. Both day light view and night time views are panoramic.It is near the Bay Front MRT station. Expensive food options are available at the mall. Toilets facility is free of cost. Ideal place for adults and children.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This garden is innovative, grand, true to the local environment. It is easy to get to and wonderful to walk around...... and it will get even better as it grows. The giant trees, already amazing, will only improve with more growth. A must see!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: You get on and you go around
REVIEW_BODY: Yes folks it's a Ferris wheel, where it differs is the, outstanding entry to the wheel. When we were there there were NO crowds, but judging by the long and winding path to get in, it could be like Disneyland on a National Holiday., anyway there is the most entertaing and engaging series of lighting, infograms, audio visual displays etc,etc.on the way to the ride. The big"cylinders" that you climb into are air conditioned and have comfortable bench seats in the middle. There are spectacular views of most of Singapore - you be the judge of the S$33 ticket
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Incredible temple, both exterior and the really impressive interior. It also has a small museum-make sure you visit all the floors for the full experience.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Is quite a distance to walk to the top but once you reach the top, the view is breathtaking! you can take the cable car from here or grab a meal at the restaurants.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak | Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Chinatown has maintained its old world charm despite the years of rapid development around other areas in singapore. You can find traditional chinese food n fusion food around all corners.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: we visited the skypark with some friends it was free to get up ,but the price of drinks made up for the elevator ride.The bar area is in the centre of the roof so you cant get too close to the edge this is reserved for paying guests of the hotel,it does give you a view of the city,the swimming pool area is also reserved for guests,glad I did it once wouldn't do it again
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great day was had by all.
REVIEW_BODY: Went to the shops and spent lots of money. It was great fun. Not a shopper really but enjoyed it. Then went to a restaurant by the river and had a great meal and a few drinks. Walking distance to everything.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fabulous Gardens, Domes, trees and Lake
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful gardens the Cloud Dome and the Fire Dome are special as is the skywalk and the walk by the lake
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Definitely worth a visit for the beautiful flowers
REVIEW_BODY: the light shows at night are excellent. You can catch it at 7:45 and 8:45 pm (free of cost). The flower dome is a jewel and definitely worth a visit for nature lovers. For me, the cloud dome took a distant third place, but it was nice to see. It is better to go to the Cloud dome at 10 am or 12 pm, when the mist is happening. Will give you a greater feeling of being in the clouds.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great attraction for all ages. Amazon river safari was highly recommended. Panda exhibit could have been opened a little longer as the park closing time is 7pm.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: It's such an amazing zoo in Asia
REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the most beautiful park where animals and plants live freely in open and natural habitats. The amazing setting and decoration will made you feel lost in the jungle. You can take a zoo bus to go around the zoo or go for walk. It's such a very nice place not only for kids but also for aldult.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
57th floor with club lounge access and infinity pool. Breakfast and snacks and great views of Singapore city and harbour and famous Singapore Lion statue, sky forest._x000D_
View of army jet plane flying over doing practice manoeuvres._x000D_
Infinity pool is always crowded! Night club is too._x000D_
_x000D_
Food is average and limited choices compared to other club lounges we have stayed in. Plenty of staff to cater to ur request. More food choices please.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best Public Park in South East Asia
REVIEW_BODY:
This park is perfect to all whom is visiting Singapore. It's a massive beautiful park by the ocean, full of matured trees and flowers. Visitors can also rent a bike as low as $6 / hour to enjoy cycling throughout the park._x000D_
_x000D_
It shows the govt have put a lot of thought into this place. Kudos!_x000D_
_x000D_
Ps- bring a food basket and go picnic
ADDRESS: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road, Singapore 455486, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This deserves a 5 star just because it is so cool to walk into after the heat of Singapore! It is so well organised, clean and there are no bottlenecks of people even though it was busy when we went. There are wide pathways, ramps and elevators so easy to navigate if you want to avoid the few steps that there are. When you first walk in it is so impressive with the huge waterfall. There are lots of interesting pieces of art dotted about and the whole thing is really impressive. It cost us about 100 SD for 2 adults and three kids but this also got us into the Flower Dome.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were disappointed in the night safari as a lot of the animals were not around to be seen. I think there are too many people on the trams and this makes it difficult to see animals if you are on one side and they are on the other. Perhaps only 3to a row would be better. Too much waiting around for things to open as well
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Flower Dome gets more raves but Cloud Forest is more educational
REVIEW_BODY: Interestin,g but if you live in Singapore, not too different from a walk in any of our nature reserves (except for the waterfall). The best part is the educational section that covers climate change, rising world water levels, world population levels, etc. Be sure to stop and read the facts here. Riveting. Bring the family and discuss with your children mankind's role in nature.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: a must for value, the vision and the food
REVIEW_BODY: An expansive China town by Aussie terms - several streets and laneways dotted with bars, restaurants fashion, memorabilia and a far bit of kitch/junk. Best vale bee in town ($7 a bottle vs $22 a glass in the main hotels) and be prepared to haggle on the clothes front - and be wary of sizes so try them on - my XXL shirt equated to an M. A lot fun and also some very good duck restaurants
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Superb piece of little known history
REVIEW_BODY: We were on the fence about this tour but went on a recommendation. It didn't disappoint. Learnt a lot from our very informative and passionate guide who was ex-amry. Thoroughly recommended (even the doubting girlfriend liked it!)
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful garden in the central of the city of singapore. Nice and sweet spot for selfie. Everyone can visit this place coz it's free......
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely way to spend an afternooon/evening
REVIEW_BODY: Worth staying till the evening for the light show. Also Satay by the Bay was a good cheaper alternative for food
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the best trail in SG. Almost 6 -10 km . Make sure u take enough water and food . Not good for rainy day. Free of cost. Very good for group trekking.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The view is amazing from every angle, no matter what age you must do this. Quite pricey just to get to top though at $63 sing Dollars for 2 adults and 1 child
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Perhaps we were visiting at the wrong time,it was raining. Nothing much to see. Even my 4 years old daughter were asking where are the birds inside the cage,most of the cages looks like empty. Perhaps the birds were sleeping or just hiding from the rain. But,i still recommend this place,it is to support wildlife reserves.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was a very fascinating exhibit. It was a good value for the entrance price and was a welcome relief from the heat.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Cable Cars to Sentosa Island and Dinner at Night.
REVIEW_BODY: Hi, this is a cool way to get to and from Sentosa Island. The views are great. We then had dinner at the restaurant at Mount Faber. Very good food. Great views.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak | Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful garden, informative and well organized
REVIEW_BODY: On our visit day, it was very crowded- hardly any space to walk near the main displays. Flower dome was more beautiful with good showcase. Suggest more written information would be helpful to read and explain to kids.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: enjoy all my visits to this garden whetehr it si day time or night. both have great views and people of all nations and the displays and lights are just serene and pleasant to view and be with.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Such excellent value for something quite different
REVIEW_BODY: For only $16 this is totally worth a visit, I enjoyed every moment of it. Kids and adults will love it alike.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit in Singapore. Come here close to night time, you won't regret it
REVIEW_BODY: This place was one of my favorite places in all of Singapore. The entrance is free, I wasn't able to go up on the viewing bridge because it was closed for maintenance and still this place was worth the visit. I have to admit, for me the light show at night time was the wow factor. During the day it looks nice, but if you come to the gardens right at sunset, walk a bit, take some pictures even visit the other places within the gardens, you can catch the first night time show and it is a great time to have. It's nothing out of the ordinary, music with lights but I'm pretty sure you wont find musical trees anywhere else. Not like this anyways. I highly recommend it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore has people with different nationality living together. The child of local woman of singapore and other ethnic origins is called "Peranakan". The museum gives me better understanding of Peranakans by guided tour and lots of exhibits, not just watch them but can be touched. It is an incredible museum.
ADDRESS: 39 Armenian Street Peranakan Museum, Singapore 179941, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Well worth the wander (Walk) around such a great place
REVIEW_BODY:
Every city in the world that is on the water front should have one of these. A great open space to wander taking in the view of the city, the light show, the water show, the water taxis or just the water, with no hawkers, no speeding push bikes or tacky tourist stalls, selling rubbish._x000D_
It is good the way Singapore sees the bigger picture of tourism and gives the tourist areas where they not only feel safe 24 hours a day, but can enjoy the area with out fear of being ripped off or pestered._x000D_
Take the time to enjoy, night was my preference
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Stunning interior. Located in China town. Great way to get a view of traditional Chinese religious traditions and culture especially when visiting China town.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a visit if you go early. Tends to get hot and busy after 11am. Very expensive as always in Singapore. Easy to get to vis SMRT. Ion tower is free and worth visiting.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Big Bus hop on hop off drove past this area so decided to revisit. Our map reading is pretty dire but managed to get there as the locals are very friendly and the golden mosque led us. We were in need of shade and refreshments so were pleased to find the winding streets full of places to eat, drink and shop. Would recommend the area as one to visit for an hour or so as part of your sightseeing trip in Singapore.
ADDRESS: Kampong Glam, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A place to see and be seen
REVIEW_BODY: People watching.Shopping and food. Shopping is more for 'high end user'. But you can find cheaper food outside the malls. Or if you prefer to walk from end to end of the street to explore.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This attraction is strictly passable in my opinion. It provides a view of the Singapore skyline, the Gardens by the bay, a part of the Harbour. No great shakes overall.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The icon of Singapore Merlion is locatef in this harbour side park. The place is more beautiful in the night with full illuminated Singapore skyline unwonding before you. The place is full of tourists and locals and is a vey popular eveninv hsngout. You have all cafes ans seafood eateries around. Real happening plsce and must visit in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens By the bay - Singapore a lovely few hours
REVIEW_BODY:
Had a lovely few hours just enjoying the Gardens by the Bay - these are free entrance and open to the public. Its just the domes you have to pay for._x000D_
_x000D_
Fabulous photo opportunities and an amazing backdrop to the gardens as they are surrounded by modern architecture._x000D_
_x000D_
Take a few hours - relax enjoy and put your feel up
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens were beautiful but they probably would have been better to see during the day. Also would recommend leaving a few hours to see everything
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Most tourists end up going to domes at the gardens by the bay and not going to the ocbc skyway. This is a fantastic attraction and you can have a great view from top. Give at least good 4 hours to properly enjoy domes and get up the skyway by evening. Also thereâ€™s a magical lightshow which you can enjoy from the ground
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: After Singapore Flyer, this may be the second best view
REVIEW_BODY: Once on the top, head to the restaurant bar and enjoy a nice snack and cold drink. You could have a look at the pool
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Awesome from top of the flyer
REVIEW_BODY: We have enjoyed an awesome view from the top of the flyer. Whole city can be explore from the flyer. It's a very good attraction for kids and of course for adult too. Everyone who wish to visit Singapore must take the taste of this ride.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: After hopping off the hop on bus (you get a discount if you show them you hav e a bus ticket), we were here fairly early in the day so we were lucky to get a cabin with just four other people who were very nice. It takes around 30 minutes to go round once. The views are over Gardens by the Bay, the Marina sands hotel and city skylines of Singapore. On a clear day like we had, you can see for miles. Worthwhile doing.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice place to visit, it's very big and has several parts. I decided to enjoy a walk in the free zone and was happy about it. You can go alone or with children. Located straight out of the metro station holding the same name !
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Was really nice to walk through and see the iconic Gardens by the Bay Super Grove. You can pay to walk along the walkway of the Super Grove for $8.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: From the train station a short walk takes you inside this venue. There is a shuttle train service to take you around the Gardens which we used and it saved a lot of walking in extreme heat and humidity. We visited the Cloud Dome which was really amazing with lots of vegetation as well as loads of sculptures, many in wood. There is a main way to get around inside so you will not miss anything. Just visiting the Cloud Dome took a good 2 hours so make sure you set aside a day if you want to get the whole place in.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the most beautiful places in Singapore and your trip won't be complete until you visit Marina Bay. To think that several decades ago, parts of this place was covered with water and has now been turned into an architectural wonder. If you have time consider spending the afternoon and the evening there, the scenes are different during the day and in the evening and they are both breathtaking - don't worry about killing time as there are lots to do in between - plenty of exciting shopping and restaurants in Marina Bay Sands. Definitely have a good dinner there or nearby like the Hawker Center at Gardens by the Bay. In evening start at the Helix Bridge and take a nice, slow stroll towards the direction of Marina Bay Sands and then walk all the way to the Merlion Park, take the time to enjoy the lights, the bay, the water shows, and the beautiful city and skyline. At the Merlion park look back toward Marina Bay Sands, simply beautiful. You will not regret it.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing value for money, lots to do and see.
REVIEW_BODY:
This zoo has so many different animals to see and things to do. You can purchase combination tickets which are valid for 7 days, so you don't have to try and cram everything into 1 day._x000D_
_x000D_
The river safari is a little basic and short, but you do get to see some of the bigger animals from a slightly different angle._x000D_
_x000D_
I'd definitely recommend the zoo for all the family. There is even a train that takes you from zone to zone if you have mobility issues._x000D_
_x000D_
Unfortunately we didn't get to see the pandas as they are shy and hide a lot._x000D_
_x000D_
The seal was wonderful, be careful if you are on near the front as you WILL get wet.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Located near the harbor, it's truly a good place to walk and see the sunset.You can find lot of restaurant near this place.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved it. My daughter, 7, was a little nervous but loved it in the end. We joined it at Harbourfront to go to Sentosa. Sign posts not obvious from Vivocity but we found it in the end. The deal at their office for Universal, Aquarium and unlimited Cable car was the best I had seen too - unfortunately I had already got the Hipopass but would know next time. The best bit was when you took off. Also try for sunset.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We just pass by. not really getting in there.. but we can say that it is beautiful on the nights as city lights always look beautiful.. it is super huge! would love to try in another chance
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Multiple shopping options for every budget
REVIEW_BODY: There are actually a huge range of different types of shops, its fun to just wander around and get lost. Within a fairly small area from the Orchard and SUmmerset SMRT stations, there are a number of interesting shopping centres to check out. Some of the more prominent brands are naturally easy to spot, but we also found a lot of more interesting and reasonably priced stores throughout and within the different shopping complexes. We likes ION orchard, 313 summerset, and orchard gateway more so for different japanese store options we like but don't have at home.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Stunning view of Singapore! A great place to grab a drink and just pause and enjoy the sights. Of course drinks & meals are not cheap but it is worth it in view where you are. Very crowded and if you are taking kids with you, please be extra careful. And people you meet here are very friendly always ready to take a picture for you. The outlets staff warm, friendly and very efficient! Highly recommended! For senior citizens you get a discount!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I would be far to scared to stay here but it looks amazing. Walking through and above the reception gave one an idea of the place. What surprised was the window boxes outside the rooms.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I love the place so so much! Went to this place with my camera and got many good pictures of this magical place
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Jurong Bird park is a well maintained bird park, you've to be there early in the morning it opens i presume at 8:30, closes at 5:30, we took a photograph with thee birds, as a momento, birds most of them are kept in the open, don't touch them i would say, our tickets included a tram ride, we first went on tram witnessed the flamingos , later took a walk , it was a good experience.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great view of the city. Quite windy up there. Few shops are there and needless to say, they are quite expensive.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This place opens up around 7.30 pm and finishes around 11 pm._x000D_
There are massive queues so important to book on line the time in advance._x000D_
You first go see a night show in an arena of various animals / Birds coming out to the Rangers ._x000D_
After that you queue up for the tramride which takes you through the Jungle type atmospgete and you get to see the animals in their natural environment. Its a unique tramride and you enjoy the appox 30 minutes ride through the Jungle trail._x000D_
Would recommend this place._x000D_
There are restaurants around to tuck in and have drinks.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: An evening I will never forget
REVIEW_BODY: I will never forget the midnight sarari which I went on during my stay in Singapore. Driving around in a golf buggy listening to the sounds (and smells) of the jungle at midnight is an experience which I will never forget. I remember turning a corner and on one side a mother and a baby elephant had literally just stepped out of the jungle and then unbelieveably the, I will call him The Daddy elephant, a huge beast stepped out from the other side and trumptted his arrival. Simply unforgettable.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Every time that I go to the Singapore Botanic Gardens (twice in 2018 & I live in the USA) I discover something new. Last time it was the rainforest that sits almost in the middle of this extensive garden. Also, the heliconia walk & the ginger garden are special spots in the oasis of green in the heart of bustling Singapore. And birding is possible as the photo of the somewhat shy Red-legged Crake shows. Admission is free except for the Orchid Garden that has a minimal entry and is well worth it. There's a subway stop steps away from the park.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Stunning views. Especially from the sky walk. Really great day out to just walk around and enjoy the beauty this place has to offer. Places to get refreshments. And also a chance for kids to have a splash in the water playground. We expected to have a short trip, but ended up spending the whole day just walking round. Really worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Cool place to visit or for dining
REVIEW_BODY: Very authentic place to cost by your own or with friends to have some cool experience or great dining
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Situated In the old Supreme Court Building and City Hall, many will find the actual buildings more interesting than the art._x000D_
Thereâ€™s a guided tour daily, at 11am which concentrates on the history of the building. Places are limited to 20, and photo ID is required (I think this is to ensure visitors do not walk off with the headsets). The tour should last an hour, but it actually took 90 minutes. The volunteer guide had worked in the court as an usher which made the tour personal. Also another of our group had regularly visited the courtroom in his lunch hour to listen to the proceedings._x000D_
Judging by our group, about 50% were local, so this tour appeals to everybody._x000D_
We also loved the views of the city from Level 6._x000D_
Excellent toilets are available in several places on every floor. Disabled access is great, with lifts and ramps as necessary. There were plenty of places to sit, except when waiting for the guided tour to start, where seating was inadequate (5 seats for 20 people)._x000D_
Our only disappointment was lunch, bought from Gallery & Co on Level 1. The sandwiches were tasty, but I really expect a cafÃ© in that price range to serve them on a plate, perhaps with a side salad and not just wrapped in paper. We had to get the staff to cut them in half to make it practical to eat them. And it was the first place in Singapore which hasnâ€™t offered ice with soft drinks. Better food options are available outside the museum._x000D_
We didnâ€™t have time in the end to see the art galleries, that will have to wait for another visit. But we really enjoyed learning about the history of the buildings, and the way the courts worked in Singapore both under British rule, and after independence. Donâ€™t miss this new attraction.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great collection of plants. So many wildlife. Many kids and parents plus people walking their dogs. Kids enjoy playing here and meet other kids.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent ages in here. Absolutely fantastic. So well set up and easy to get around. So worth the visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We have taken the cable car many times. Our first trip was the longer one from Mt. Faber. Other trips were from harbourfront._x000D_
You want to stay on it because it is so pleasant, especially on a blue sky and sunny day! Do not be afraid. The cables are quite thick, The access on and off are very easy. It is a great introduction to Sentosa Island and its venues. I recommend a round trip ticket. Families may wish one way and take the wooden walkway back to Harbourfront. Be sure to get a map when you land on Sentosa regardless of how you arrive. The map and trams are very helpful.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Definitely a place to visit. Huge number and variety of gorgeous orchids. A must see! Be prepared it can get quite hot and humid and very crowded walking around the garden so try to go early in the morning r when it is cooler.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Be prepare to climb up high..
REVIEW_BODY: didn't expect it will be quite high, for a first timer to hike, u really need to take ur timine and enjoy the nature.. the beautiful view once ur at the top, its Amazing !!! Try ur best okie, no regrets !! =')
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak | Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited twice and was still quite impressed by its exhibit. A nice place to chill on a hot afternoon before going to the evening performamce at the Supertrees. Love the concept of the entire area.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well you can spend all your evenings here without ever getting fed up of it ... do visit ... alone or a couple or family or group .. This place for everyone and everytime
ADDRESS: 8 Marina Gardens Drive Marina Barrage, Singapore 018951, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The outlook is awesome especially the pond surrounding is full of lotus. There are 3 exhibitions now, future, wonderland and floating utopian. I buy double exhibitions ticket at S$32 for Future and Floating Utopian. Honestly, if you are adult without kids, itâ€™s a little bit waste time to see Future. Floating Utopian is comparatively ok.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If in Singapore this is a must see. The variety of flowers,plants and trees is amazing. It is enormous and you need to give 3 to 4 hours if not longer. Admission price I think is reasonable for what you see and the staff very friendly and helpful.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place really impresses me. You can see the very nice view of Singapore. It is good to go there in the evening to watch sunset. Go with your lover will be nice because it is so romantic. Moreover, you can walk along the bridge or ride a bike. Go there in a clear sky day to catch a nice view and take a good photo
ADDRESS: 8 Marina Gardens Drive Marina Barrage, Singapore 018951, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautifully set-upped park for birds, here you can find almost all the species in world... They have a large collection of orange flamingos which was a treat to our eyes.......
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We got up to the park as it was just turning dusk. The views are breathtaking. We waited for the dark and the buildings displayed lots of lights. The trees in the gardens on the bay did a musical light show which could be seen easily._x000D_
The drinks were costly for Singapore
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good day out but a bit pricey
REVIEW_BODY: Visited here on a weekday so didn't queue for tickets for very long. The flower dome was very busy once we were inside but the cloud dome was quieter. Unless you like plants and nature it's probably not worth the entrance fee as you can walk round outside for free. Quite a trek from the Mrt station so bare this in mind with the hot weather. Would recommend this place just for the photo opportunities
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Take MRT to Bayfront station and be there before 19:45 to see the light show. The best spot to see and take a nice photos is the glass bridge that connected Gardens by the Bay to the shoppe @ Marina Bay sand
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good way to spend a day
REVIEW_BODY: Easy to get to via train and bus, beautiful place, interesting animals. I spent half a day here which was not enough. Wear comfortable shoes. Staff were helpful, place was easy to get around to. Lots of directions .
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Physical churches where established for people of God to worship. I was fortunate to visit the Singaporeâ€™s most famous church. I was awed by the grandeur and elegant facade of the church. The simplicity of the interior made me pray and kneel before God. Thank you was not enough considering that this was my second time to visit Singapore. Singapore made me realized that the world is not only Philippines; that there was a bigger arena for me to explore and wander. My trip to another country would not be complete if I will not visit a church. I felt at peace and guided when I was able to visit a church. Life is too short that one must attached himself to his Creator; that living is not only for oneself but importantly, for the love of mankind especially the needy and less fortunate. Indeed, traveling enabled me to view world in a dynamic perspective and that life is not a solitary thing.
ADDRESS: 11 St. Andrew's Road St. Andrew's Cathedral, Singapore 178959, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The night tour is nice and definitively worth a visit. We saw a lot of kids but I am not sure if it's appropriate for children smaller than 4.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My favorite part of the cloud forest is definitely the waterfall you see once you enter. Go early at opening time to avoid crowds and to get a great photo without photo bombers. It is also really cool inside which is great to escape the heat from Singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We arrived at this beautiful exotic place with the most wonderful gorgeous plants arranged so artisticly. We spent a whole afternoon and evening there as you can wander around at your own pace with so many interesting things to see and be amazed. There is so much to see and enjoy, itâ€™s a must to visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful place for bars and restaurants in a historic setting
REVIEW_BODY:
I read about this area from this site, it is not well listed in the tour books at all._x000D_
_x000D_
It used to be a convent that has been converted to an event space and also an oasis of restaurants and bars in a small area with tons of busting activities near by._x000D_
_x000D_
There is a great Wikipedia listing of this place giving its history. Suffice it to say that now it is a fun place to tour near Raffles Hotel (walking distance) where you can get a drink or a good meal at some places that have fun/robust settings in an historic area. Pretty relaxed too. Worth the visit if you are walking by the area.
ADDRESS: 30 Victoria Street Chijmes, Singapore 187996, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was my favoirte glass house in the Gardens - some where between Jurasic Park and Avitar - giant ferns, misty waterfalls - a trek through the jungle. Great fun - somehting different
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore Botanical Garden is an ideal place for both mummies and babies to have fun! Children can run freely and play various games while adult are able to relax, enjoy greenery scene and non-stop chit-chatting! A beautiful & spacious ground to have family and friend gathering as well as picnicking :)
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice day and night view. Can view spectacular fireworks during Festival period - NDP, Chinese New Year, etc. Please take note that it will be very hot if you visit during noon time as there are no shelter.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We really appreciated the National Orchid Garden. It was extraordinary. The special picture points are phenomenal and work well to divert traffic for â€œselfiesâ€. The special orchids for the international VIPs were so much fun to view. So beautiful. We really enjoyed ourselves. A must visit. Nothing worldwide that compares.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Whatever You Want to Eat is There
REVIEW_BODY: Had an early dinner before the light show. Lots of kiosks serving everything from burgers to curries, plus there were loads of fish & shellfish dishes on offer. The fish dishes were amazing. Mix & match worked well for us and gave us a chance to sample different dishes. The seating area was a bit like a cafe but we did not care as the food was to die for.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must do if you have time. We spent three hours and still didn't see all of this fantastic garden display.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Merlion statue is a must see while in Singapore. Itâ€™s fairly easy to find. The statue is fairly decent sized. This area seems to always be busy with people. The nearby Fullerton Hotel and other buildings, along with the waterfront, make this area a favorite to visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An interesting, somewhat sprawling complex, but without commentary its hard to know what its all about. Be respectful if you go and take your shoes of well outside of the front door.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Modern, futuristic and beautiful! Fantastic art together with difficult engineering! Must see in Singapore!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Cloud forest is the best place in this place. It is very pleasant walking round the cloud forest. Must watch place
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I dont have words to describe this place...it is just amazing, love the super trees and its ligths and music show, it can transport you to a fantasy land...i love it
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really itâ€™s absolutely fascinating. A vast number of wonderful orchids to marvel over. The overall layout is brilliant and the VIP section is particularly interesting. Costs to get in but well worth the expense.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The best way to get views of Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY:
The Singapore Flyer is one of the best ways to get amazing views over Singapore. It is a narrated journey that takes approximately 30 minutes. The narrator points out points of interest and landmarks as the wheel makes its journey around._x000D_
_x000D_
Do not miss this on your trip to Singapore!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: shopping paradise of Singapore only visit few shopping malls there there are lots of malls at Orchard and it sute for any budget you have
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You get an amazing view of Singapore from the flyer, and I think it would be cool to take the flyer while the light show in Gardens by the bay were on (7.45 pm, 8.45 pm), but also while the sun sets. No matter what time of the day you decide to go, I'm sure you'll enjoy - at least I did :)
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic, great, wow must be seen. Loved it, just loved it. It is an amazing place to visit. The waterfall and the way you interact with it is mind blowing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth Finding the time, even if it's just for the night.
REVIEW_BODY: Worth Finding the time, even if it's just for the night to see the Laser Light Show. We arrived after 7pm and didn't leave until 11pm and still didn't see it all.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the cable car that takes you directly to Sentosa.... offers unparalleled birds eye view to the waterfront and the underlying resorts as if you are flying into sentosa...
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A must visit for tourists. The Gardens is huge and covers several different areas. I personally prefer to explore the free area close to evening time as it would be much cooler and the lighting on the super tree is superb._x000D_
_x000D_
The 2 paid domes are called the flower dome and cloud dome. As the name suggests, the flower dome is decorated with different types of flowers and it is beautiful. They also have different kind of events running from time to time and they were having the Matsuri Sakura event. I was expecting more Sakura but hey at least I got to see some._x000D_
_x000D_
The cloud dome is a favorite. I love the waterfalls and the towering wall of plants. It is truly majestic and breath taking. This area requires a lot of climbing although there are lifts. The wait time is long though._x000D_
_x000D_
The domes have a very strict no food and drink inside them so when travelling with the kids, plan it so they do not go in hungry. Once entered, the paths are one way towards the exit and there are no re-entries._x000D_
_x000D_
The children can also visit the children's garden for some water fun._x000D_
_x000D_
Overall, I recommend spending half a day to fully explore the park at a slow pace.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We found this museum gave us a fascinating insight into the difficult lives that most Chinese migrants faced in Singapore in the 1950s and earlier. Everything is very well presented in what is only a very small space.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Pleasant way to spend an afternoon
REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are massive and beautiful. They're a great way to spend a quiet afternoon, though it can get very warm so carry water. On weekends they'll be full of Singaporeans having picnics too.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Loved it and would have stayed longer!
REVIEW_BODY: Takes some planning to get there (metro and bus) so we were too late but no worries, we could walk right in past the queue. Too long waiting time for the tram and too many tourists talking inatead of watching. Having said that, it was very interesting to see the night animals. I was a bit worried that the noise and light would disturb the animals but the seemed to be healthy and in good shape. So I can definitely recommend this experience for familie with animal interested kids. My youngest (11 years old) was sad to leave because even though we had spent almost 4 hours there, we had not seen everything.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: You don't need to go to Paris for shopping..
REVIEW_BODY: A nice, huge, easy to walk road, silent and calm traffic, very easy to find taxis, a vast number of shopping centers with big branda and as always, nice people..
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We had been here years ago for a meal with family and we were curious. It was afternoon when we were there and not many eating places open. It is mainly a hive of activity in the evening for drinking/eating. Some re-development being done, but not on our list for a revisit.
ADDRESS: 1 Bonham Street Uob Building, Singapore 049782, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was on the top thing on our to-do-list while in Singapore. It really is worth it! People everywhere but that is to be expected. Went in both the domes, absolutely amazing
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Stunning gardens - both indoors and outdoors. Well worth paying for the indoor experience. Spectacular with the lights also in the evening. Definitely a 'must do' when visiting Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you love animals then you don't miss out this. I loved the night safari and other than the usual animals there are few unique ones which you might find it only here. The flamingos are breathtaking even in the night and its an experience worth spending an hour here.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great attraction but totally deserted. This is good as there were no queues but surely they cannot last much longer with the total lack of visitors. Maybe reducing the price would solve the problem
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We wandered around the MacRitchie Reservoir for a couple of hours and we really loved being in nature in the heart of the red dot. The reservoir is large and very serene. Its a great way to spend a perfect Saturday/Sunday outdoors.
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you love flowers go to the botanic gardens and pay a small entry fee into the orchid gardens to see innumerable number of sensational orchids of all colours and sizes. It is most impressive range. Allow at least 2 hours just to soak up the ambience of the garden.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Seem to focus more on numbers in than the experience.
REVIEW_BODY: Arrived on time to wait in a room that didnâ€™t have enough seating for the amount of people doing the experience. Communication was pretty poor and given we were doing an experience that included alcohol I didnâ€™t expect children to be allowed (we had 2). We were herded into the capsule and it was incredibly crowded. Didnâ€™t enjoy the experience at all and would not recommend to anyone. If you want a view better to do marina bay sands observation deck.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a nice place to visit during the day. There is a statue of the merlion in the middle of a pond and water flows out from it. The location is very pretty and chilled out.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Separate attractions close to each other
REVIEW_BODY:
Initially one gets the impression that this is a 'different' zoo to others around the world - not so........very similar to most other large city zoo's. The advertised 'boat cruise' is deceptive -_x000D_
85% of this attraction is a walking experience; to see the panda's one needs to go on the cruise - they are not in the zoo itself; the night safari does add to the attraction and is worth the extra time spent.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: if you come to the gardens by the bay yiu must visit this attraction. It is unmissable. Just fascinating. Plants are so beautiful
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: All our trips in the recent past have been either relaxing at the beach front or shopping like crazy however this trip had to be different and this was totally for our kid! It was full of fun & experience for her to remember- Singapore Zoo, Sentosa, Universal, Jurong Bird Park, Butterfly Park, Aquarium & just everything what a kid loves! Singapore Zoo is a must visit with kids. It will take you atleast 6 hours to cover it including a couple of shows like Elephant Show! Visit to the Kangaroos, the White Tiger is fun!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visit the park on a Sunday. After going to church we rode a taxi from Vivo city to Singapore Zoo around 20 to 30 mins ride. Upon arrival at 2pm we go straight at the ticket booth to buy the tickets, no long queue. We availed the tickets with tram ride so if my kids get happens to get tired we can ride the tram. It only has 4 stations. We enjoyed the sight seeing of animals in the zoo. The shows and the meet and greet with the some animals. I recommend for families with kids to visit when you are in Singapore. There other attractions but we are short of time.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We only went for the light show and it was really very beautiful. Lots of people but as it mostly was high up in the supertrees everyone had a good view.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A haven for luxury shopping & people watching
REVIEW_BODY: I often stay at hotels on Orchard Road, as it is my favourite street for shopping, getting updated on the latest fashions and trends, people watching from dusk, cafÃ©s, eateries and bars along Orhard Road and nearby side streets, and more.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This visit is for all. Easy to get to by MRT or taxi, well worth a visit. The gardens are stunning and you could take a full day just wandering around and taking in the sights._x000D_
We visited the Orchid Garden within for $5 and it was simply stunning._x000D_
Itâ€™s very warm so take water but there are places to eat and toilets so easy to stop for a break.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: a good way to enjoy singapore at night
REVIEW_BODY: this place is just by the marina bay sands and is a good way of enjoying the river in singapore. you can also ride the river cruise from here.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went to the cloud forest and this was superb and a must as an education resource for understanding the implications of climate change - saw some venus fly traps - a must for a visit
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
These hotels are huge, basically a city within a city....however we were there to go up to the observation deck shaped like a ship onto of the 3 towers...._x000D_
_x000D_
Worth doing though you won't need long to do it. The entrance can be found at the bottom of the 3rd tower with a lift taking you to the top...._x000D_
_x000D_
You won't need more than an hour but the views are stunning....
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Parts are lovely as is the building and decorations. The ideas behind it I found boring. I've seen so many better sites than this and wouldn't go again.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We had already been to the zoo a few days before and went for the Safari. We got the hypo bus out at 6pm and back at 9:40. The safari is actually open until 12:00am and if you are close or can afford a private transfer I would do that as slightly rushed to get round being tied to the bus. It also stopped everywhere going back and was an open aired bus which on the top deck was interesting / fun on a motorway._x000D_
_x000D_
Anyhow back to the Safari. It was amazing. Tip avoid the tram as big queues and you donâ€™t get close to the animals. Head straight for the show then the walking trails. The walking trials are close to the animal enclosures and you really feel almost like you are in a Kenyan game park camp apart from you know the animals are in an enclosed zone. The animals are alert and nocturnal ones active. We were lucky to tag behind a game keeper that was feeding so brilliant. Really enjoyed the bat walk through with swooping fruit bats around you. There were quite. Few places to eat but we didnâ€™t have time to stop there due to the bus._x000D_
_x000D_
Has to be a must do on any Singapore trip! Would definitely go back and better than the day zoo which is a separate entrance and area to the night safari.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I spent the long weekend with my closed friend, got shock!!!! all the shops including the brand name even in the supermarket offered a lot of discount.. that's why we must be careful our credit card here 555 but we love it. My friend she's enjoy running in and out this two days. We won't go any other attraction place only Orchard road, I would rather call .. the street of the spent... love u Orchard
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Supergrove tree night show was the highlight of my visit here. If you have a bike, bring it. it's a lengthy walk but totally worth the sight.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best botanic gardens I've ever been in!
REVIEW_BODY: It is really wide spread, so bring some time. You can easily spend half a day in there if it is not too hot. There are a lot of different garden themes. The most impressing was the evolution walk, where the history of the earth is pictured with the different stages of plants. Really well made!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: How can you go to Singapore and not go to China Town? Not possible. Have fun, enjoy the banter, get yourself some lime juice, $1 a cup. Go to the D'Art Station. No 20 Sago Street. Its a tea pot shop. I don't even drink tea but I go there every trip and buy one of their little teapots. Have a look, Im sure you will be impressed. When you have had enough of shopping,or just need a rest, head to food street. Number 16 stall called Chinatown AH Hock Mini Wok has great food. Lemon Chicken, Black Pepper Beef, Great meals at around $9. We had maybe 5 meals there. Every one was fantastic!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a great area to see all the things you love about singapore at once, the flyer, marina bay and merlion. Great to walk around and just explore! Also do a spot of shopping and get something to eat at one of the many cafe/restaurants along the walk
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I brought my parenta to Gardens by the Bay and as expected they were delighted to see the conservatories and the light show in the garden. Truly a must-see when in SG.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Out hotel was up the river, and a very good, leisurely walk along the river towards the ocean. There are plenty of bridges to get from one side to the other to the different quays,, each offering different things. Some of the quays have impressive buildings and multi-storey shopping and commercial centres, whilst others have very pretty, pastel bars and restaurants.. Lots of live music around and a very good atmosphere. Considering Singapore's expensive reputation, the prices were not too bad and even McDonalds are represented there. Getting towards the ocean is a nice green park and Museum.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful Place to visit. Best is evening as one can see lighting show. Excellent cloud garden walk Too good. Beautiful garden. Flowers garden .... Overall A must visit if u r in Singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Marina bay is huge so many wonderful places to visit so many place be mindful it's a big area lots of walking but at night it's a pretty amazing place check out the laser show or a bar just go enjoy it
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We took our 1yr and 2yr old daughters and fun was had by all. Lots of slides for all ages. Went on a weekday and less busy Hours of entertainment!
ADDRESS: 1 Pasir Ris Close E!Hub@Downtown East, Singapore 519599, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Too much of crowd here. If you are really in to street shopping it's good for you but same time you can't move easily in shops and make selection as they are too crowded.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Magnificent display of plants and flowers from all over the world. The work that has gone into this attraction is unbelievable. A beautiful waterfall runs all the way down in the centre. Even if you are not into plants, you will still find this amazing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Not been to Little India for many years so went back to see what had changed. Much the same though slightly run down and during the day nothing much open except on Main Street. Not so vibrant - sad. However Indian lunch in Banana Leaf restaurant was good.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Taking the winding paths though the multiple sections of this garden is an incomparable experience. From the incredible scents of the gardenias and magnolias to the healing powers in the healing garden it is amazing every time I go. The swans on the lake and the aunties and uncles practicing Tai Chi. The garden's , a Unesco site, are a must see for everyone. Don't forget your camera!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was a Wonderful Ride. We have been on the London Eye to Las Vegas Farris Wheel, and it is a Wonderful way to see the whole City, just wish my night pictures came out better. But a Fun way to see the City
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Cable Car ride (just for the experience) not just for reaching Sentosa
REVIEW_BODY: The Cable Car ride came in as part of the tour package. However, this ride (on both lines) is worth making, just to have Ariel view of the Sentosa & Singapore port nearby.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud Forest was spectacular! Please don't miss it! The Flower Dome was good too, but this one was better. Can get a bit cold in places, but overall very comfortable.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Well Done and Fun for All Ages - But Time for an Update
REVIEW_BODY:
This was my sixth trip to the Night Safari - going back almost a decade. I still love the novelty of going to a zoo at night - and seeing the animals in a different light (or lack thereof) compared to what you see during the day. That said - I think its time for the zoo to either expand a bit (particularly on the tram ride) - or maybe refresh the exhibits so that there is more to look forward to on repeat trips. That said - I think that the park is basically being run as a novelty type attraction - grab the tourists once - and no need to focus on the repeat customers._x000D_
_x000D_
On this trip - we arrived around 8:45 p.m. - and the lines were very long and slow to take the tram ride. In terms of loading the trams - they were very inconsistent. Some of the staff allowed parties of two to have their own bench seat on the tram - while in our case (and many others) we were overloaded on our seat (thanks to some extra large guests on our seat) and our knees and shoulders were crammed in to make sure we all remained in the tram. When it's steamy and hot - you don't want to be in this position!_x000D_
_x000D_
The exhibits were great - although the Bengal tigers are looking very bored - and I suspect animal rights experts would say that they need more enrichment as the 15 minutes we were with the tigers all they did was pace back and forth in the same place in front of the glass window - which is far from normal behavior - even in a zoo environment. To make sure you see everything - including all aspects of what you see in the trolley - it is worth your time walking on the multiple paths. Not only do you see some great Asian animals you won't see in your home zoo - but you can get much closer to the animal enclosures on the tram path - and can notice much more of what's going on with the animals in the areas of the enclosures not visible on the tram._x000D_
_x000D_
As usual with all things Singapore - the park is clean, the staff were friendly, and while I think the cost is a bit high for the number of animals they are actually exhibiting, you are paying a premium for the night experience. It's definitely worth it for the first time Night Safari goer - a little less so for the repeat visitor.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the largest church in Singapore with breath taking stained glass panels. The high ceilings are reminscent of the gothic cathedrals that one sees in countries like England. Great photo opportunities.
ADDRESS: 11 St. Andrew's Road St. Andrew's Cathedral, Singapore 178959, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I didn't know what to expect when friends said they wanted to go. But what we got was spectacular. The imagination, artistry and execution of these gardens is mind boggling. The gardens around the two domes is magical. The domes themselves are so beautiful. Cloud forest is spectacular, with hidden sculpture dotted around all the levels. A surprise at every turn. The waterfall is cooling, wet and magnificent. The gardens of the world in the other dome has an amazing array of plants from around the world. Outside the domes u have the Super Trees, majestic columns of the steel softened by the multitude of plants growing within. There is also skywalk running above this canopy giving you wonderful views and dragonflies hovering over a lake or giant ants climbing a tree. There were masses of beautiful birds hiding in the trees for you to see and admire. All in all Well worth the visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you only do one thing in Singapore go to the gardens by the bay light show. Get there about an hour before the performance find your spot and lie back and watch the trees come to life. Most memorable experience!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
After a trip to China earlier this year, I thought I may have seen enough temples, but so glad we visited this one in Chinatown._x000D_
_x000D_
Admission is free, conservative clothing required - females need to cover knees and wraps are provided._x000D_
_x000D_
The temple raises funds for charity._x000D_
_x000D_
We were there during a ceremony, with monks but also a lot of locals. The chanting was very moving._x000D_
_x000D_
All faiths welcome to visit as long as respect is shown for actual worshippers._x000D_
_x000D_
Highly recommended.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
There's a new section added to the Botanics, near the Ginger Garden and past the waterfall feature of that area. The formal name of the new area's entrance is Tyersall Gate, if you find signs pointed to that area._x000D_
_x000D_
Give it a visit - it has new spots for visitors to see. There is a large shelter by the two new ponds, a 'treetop' walk above the water, and if you walk deeper into the SPH Walk of Giants you'll find a net area where people can climb on and look down to the forest floor below.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
ah so wonderful...Thats how i remember Night safari..never have been so up close with Lions,fox and hyenas (they are roaming freely mind you, with only a small artificial canal / pit between your good self & them )..and that animal show is superb..Kids will cherish every moment..._x000D_
Do check weather forecast though..avoid visiting on rainy days as some activities are cancelled during rains..
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful and well worth a visit
REVIEW_BODY: Paid a visit here during the daytime when I visited for the Formula 1. Very enjoyable with some stunning views to be had. The supertrees ae something else.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Interesting, Interactive, engaging for the family and friends
REVIEW_BODY: We are not able to touch the animals as we were advised that we may pass on germs to them but we can have a very close proximity for photo-taking. The breakfast is not super luxurious but substantial and good enough variety. Bring your own water for later walking consumption. The place is non-aircon, and the walk will be hot. Although there are vending machines and cool rooms, a bottle of water goes a long way.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I've been to the night safari a couple of times n so I think I've found the most efficient way around it._x000D_
I prefer taking the 8.30 entry instead of 7.30.. so we don't need to tackle the tour crowd. Then we do the show first n then the trails till 12._x000D_
The last time we were there we missed the last tram n had to walk all the way to entrance n ironic as it sounds, we had the most exciting n heart racing walk back. In the silence of the dark, we could hear the howls n cries clearly.. N could feel the animals almost preying us!!_x000D_
But of course there were staffs at regular intervals leading us out. So we were safe!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Only popped in to look at the trees whilst out and about on our hired scooters. The gardens are very well maintained and a must visit
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Enjoyed the flowers, cool air and the night lights.
REVIEW_BODY: Loved visiting Gardens by the Bay. If you love flowers - that's the place to be. Cool air, nice walkways and at night there's a free night show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Singaporeans should be really proud of what they have created in these gardens. Take your best camera as the photos deserve to be better than smart phone quality. Spent two hours wandering around and loved every minute of it, an absolute must see.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore
