REVIEW_BODY: You can enjoy this wonderful view in the day or night. The attraction last 30 min. Views of the city are spectacular.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really not worth the money. Animsls asleep dark and queues. Very expensive and really for no reason. Go to the amazing Zoo through the day but this experience is best left alone.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Interesting site but the weather can be punishing at times
REVIEW_BODY: Nice spacious area in bustling Singapore. The parking was easier than I thought - ample parking space. There is an airconditioned area - which enables you to view the special collection of plants in comfort but the entrance fee is not that cheap and the airconditioned area was not very large. The irony was viewing various desert cacti in the air-conditioned area. Maybe even the desert cacti cannot take Singapore's withering and stifling heat & humidity...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's a beautiful place to see. I went to supertree grove, and it's free.. at night the supertree has lighting show and it's very beautiful
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's a bit of a hike to get to from the station but is well worth the visit so beautiful.. Beautifully maintained gardens in front of their graves. They over look a stunning view..
ADDRESS: 9 Woodlands Road, Singapore 738656, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Just next to the Singapore zoo and in the same complex, this is a unique experience. You look at animals from a boat which passes through an artificial river.While you pass, animals can be seen on either side of the river including lions, cheetah, monkeys, swans etc._x000D_
Though a short trip, I would have loved if it was a bit longer but all in all a great adventure.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Build in 2007 I came here the second time already. Beside the architecture itâ€™s a very nice Buddhist temple. So color and peaceful. If any place would be like this! If you come to Singapore itâ€™s a must.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Booked a tour and meal. Meal was buffet style with great choices._x000D_
Safari was in open carriages that were comfortable enough for the occasion._x000D_
Unfortunately it seems the tours have become so routine due to the numbers of people going, including us, it has lost the award winning effect. Recommend doing the Night Safari by walking on the trials yourself._x000D_
.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A futuristic urban garden - which in itself is a contradiction. If one could think of a futuristic garden out of a science fiction novel, Gardens by the Bay would be it. All it lacks is a biosphere across the entire gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth a visit. We went just after CNY. It was crowded but the displays were excellent in a unique environment.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The air is so crisp and fresh it is almost tangible..._x000D_
The plants, flowers and trees at e such a treat to the eyes!!!_x000D_
Go there and give yourself a treat, breathing in the air so untainted is almost food for the soul and the body!!!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lots of people meandering through the garden. Ranged in age and nationality. All found something of interest.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Had a wonderful visit to the gardens. The orchid displays are spectacular and the place is maintained beautifully. Even if you aren't into gardening it is an amazing place to wander through. Allow half a day minimum.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: nice place to visit , have the shopping mall , casino , theater , food court in lower ground , nice place for activities
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was definitely the highlight of the botanics. It cost $5 but was well worth it. The rest of the botanics are highly manicured and a delight to walk round.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I went with my wife after the plane flight.Even though we were tired im glad we went.The gardens are magnificent and it makes you wonder how can such a place coexist with the bank scyscapers just a few blocks from there.A great collection of flora and the great solar plants are a sight especially in the night.Visit cloud forest.The best part was the fortunate fact that we happened to visit the marina at the digital arts exhibition with the eggs that changed color.It was magic..
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We enjoyed a wonderful visit to the Could Forest. Beautifully presented with enough to see over an hour or so. Also a great respite from the heat and humidity for awhile.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Natural & realistic forest in a dome
REVIEW_BODY: This is the best among the 2 domes. It's so unbelievable that how they managed to build everything indoors. The waterfall is beautiful. Some say, it shd be seen in day time but we saw it in the nite & found to be better with lightings etc. One can spend good 40-45 minutes here. Not to be missed at all.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore Botanic Gardens were magnificent and magical. Beautifully maintained grounds, easy to get around with paved paths, and an all-around wonderful day of forest bathing.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: beautful vision plants gorgeous very good at the different with the countries only downside was very crowded
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great even for the non-WW2 fan
REVIEW_BODY: Visiting the Battlebox was my husbands choice for the morning activity. I must admit going in I anticipated to be bored for the next hour. I was wrong- and so pleased to be wrong!!! The presentation (via a guided tour) keeps you engaged with an interesting story outlining the historical events leading up to the surrender of Singapore and the actually activities/ living conditions in the Battlebox. Our guide Matt did an excellent job of keeping us moving through the rooms and relating the history. I would highly recommend a visit for any WW2 enthusiast and can assure the rest of you itâ€™s a pretty cool site and worth your time to check out.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We stayed at the Marina Bay Sands and had access to the Skypark, where we enjoyed a unique spot to have break kfast. The views from the pool are amazing.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: this is one of the top attractions in Singapore when it comes to understanding the diverse culture of Singapore. I really appreciate the preserved buildings and stores that I saw from the MRT exit. Also,it is an ideal place to shop things for your family and friends. Authentic restaurants like Din Tai Fung and Yum Cha are also easy to locate. Plus, the popular hawker centers like chinatown food street and Maxwell.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice enough for a quick walk through
REVIEW_BODY: The arab quarter is very small and just made up of a few streets. It's also close to little India so easy to combine the two walks. It's just that there is not actually that much to do (ie see) just a pleasant walk. There was more of a buzz to Little India but maybe that was due to the markets there.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful oasis in a busy city
REVIEW_BODY: Walking through the park you gorget you are in a very busy city. The park is beautiful with lots of greenery and places to just sit and relax and enjoy the scenery. It is also where you will find the Battlebox, the WWII bunker under the hill used by the British as their command centre, and also by the Japanese after the surrender of Singapore
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
For a nominal fee a tram takes you on a 40 minute open air ride through the various regions of the world. You travel to the Indian subcontinent to the Asian Riverine Forest. There are lions, otters, mousedeer, flying squirrels, bongos, bats, hyenas, ETC. There are more than 1000 creatures to see either by tram or on foot exploring, always at night._x000D_
_x000D_
What a perfect way to end our 9 day visit to Singapore.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The bay is amazing- surrounded by hundreds of bars and restaurants to suit millionaires or those on a budget. Go early evening to see everywhere lit up and watch the light display in front of the Marina bay sands hotel.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We went on a Saturday morning and expected it to be teaming. However it was quite quiet until 11:00am. Fantastic layout, beautiful habitats for the animals and lots of info. We had tickets for the tram but everything was so well laid out we didnâ€™t use it._x000D_
_x000D_
We planned our visit and took just under 3 hours to do everything that we wanted. Good to get out before it gets busy - unpleasant when too many people.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Another place to keep coming back to.
REVIEW_BODY: I find it hard to explain to people sometimes, exactly what to expect here. The plant life is so variable, ranging from large flowers to minute orchids. You can walk up or down a large spiral walkway, circumnavigating the central â€˜mountainâ€™ of plant life. There is so much to see that return visits will always be rewarding.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you really want to enjoy the Bird Park, it is all about timing, for example, the Kings of the Sky show featuring eagles, vultures, hawks, and owls, starts at 10am and 4pm, during my last visit, we decided to go after lunch, we were there around 1.30pm, taking a stroll, we visited the penguins, macaws, etc. then we stopped for the pelicans' show at 2.30pm. After which we proceed to walk around other exhibits, stopping at the Waterfall Aviary at 3pm for the feeding of the birds. After that, we took a stroll to other exhibits and arriving at the Hawk Center for the Kings of the Sky show at 4pm. My son had an incredible enjoyable time as it was well paced out, and we are not rushing from one point to the other.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Although some sections are still closed for renovations there is still plenty to enjoy in the gardens. The orchids are spectacular as there is such a variety of types with many different shapes and colour. There is so much more than Orchids to see and you could easily spend a day wandering the paths to different sections such as the Ginger gardens and the Rain forest with its massive trees.. There are a number of delightful sculptures such as the Flight of the Swans at Tang Lake. While we were here we watched an Otter at play and two large Monitor Lizards swimming close to the edge of the Lake. Other sculpture such as the Cranes, Farfugium Fountain, the Geese and Girl on a Swing are artfully placed around the gardens. The vegetation includes a huge variety of plants and trees so that the range of colour, bark and leaf types is quite fascinating. It is very peaceful and quiet which is surprising with its city location. There is a souvenir shop that contains a large range of gifts and mementos all at a reasonable price.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the gardens and domes are great did not know which way to look first . The domes will blow your mind the gardens outside colourful and green take your time to look
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard Road is the main shopping area of Singapore. We spent a whole day just moving in and out of Malls on this road. Absolutely a shopperholics heaven
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We had a couple of hours to kill before leaving from Singapore (Changi) Airport so we caught the train to the Changi Museum, got off too far down the track and then caught a taxi back. We should have just caught a taxi in the first place as it was only about SD$6. We enjoyed the museum, being Australians and hearing some of the stories about the hardships endured during WWII. Interesting readings on the walls and some interesting artefacts, especially the quilts made by the women prisoners of war. Entry is free and the ladies at the entrance and gift shop exit were very friendly.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: First off, I don't know of any other place in the world where you can see all of this in one place. We walked the gardens, went into the 2 conservatories, and stayed for the light show. The conservatories were wonderful because they are climate controlled, and feel wonderful after being out in the hot sun for hours. They have a staggering assortment of plants from all over the world in them. It is very impressive. The Cloud Forest was definitely my favorite. Go just for the wood carvings alone. The light show was also very cool. We sat on the ground underneath the electric trees with a bunch of other tourists and it was just a wonderful experience. This is a must see if you are ever in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: After travelling to many countries, have to admit that they have made a fantastic park considering the size of land Singapore has.They have some opera schedule that worth to watch, might want to look out for the event schedule. Probably not the biggest park you ever see, and the weather quite hot to walk around during day time. Try to visit them in the morning or late afternoon-evening. They have some restaurant as well. Look nice, but have yet to try.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very interesting metallic structure! I found two wedding couples taking their wedding pictures on the bridge with their wedding bridge!! I would recommend to visit this place at night to enjoy the lighting and Marina Bay Sand. It will take hardly 5-10 minutes to cross the bridge by walk.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I love history and museums so this was a home run for me. Great way to get out of the heat, and learn about the history of Singapore. I spent a lot of time walking around the city during my trip so having a historical background on many of the areas and how the city was built was great. I spent majority of my time in the main Singapore history exhibit which is very well done. It is also extensive, I spent a good hour and half in that exhibit alone. It only took me another 30 minutes to go through the other exhibits on the 2nd floor. I did not pay extra to go to the 1940's exhibit._x000D_
_x000D_
Great museum. If you love history, this is the place for you. Also anyone who loves fashion - don't miss the exhibit on the 2nd floor with Singapore fashion - really cool.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Our visit to the River Safari was on a rainy day so we were worried we would be drenched by the end. However we were surprised and delighted to find the whole park is undercover! This is a fantastic fresh water aquarium and is great for all ages. Easy to walk around and can complement with the Zoo and or Night Safari on the same day. I felt sorry for the poor pandas because despite the staff telling everyone to stay quiet there were still children screaming and running around. Was disappointed that the River cruise was an extra cost after already forking out a lot to go to all of the parks. Overall a great park
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: High end brand lovers... this is for you!
REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic where you can find all the high-end brands in this mall. Accessible to MRT,won't burn your pocket to go to the venue.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Definitely worth a visit if you are in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Eye opening without being overwhelming, this is a great little museum, well curated with some lovely pieces. I only wish the Islamic art gallery had been open.
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Family Day at Zoo! Fun & Interesting learning journey
REVIEW_BODY:
A fun and interesting learning journey thru-out the Zoo, reach at 9am, spend around 4 hour walking around the Zoo. (Be prepared at least 4hr to 5hr, include shows) because there's so many animals and some of the animals have been bought out by the Zoological Staff to let us touch/feel them._x000D_
_x000D_
There's a feeding session at certain area (such as the goat, $5/pax to feed them personally and close up)_x000D_
_x000D_
There's at least two show at safari splash and animal friends (near the KFC)._x000D_
_x000D_
There's also a children waterpark beside KFC inside the zoo (free) so remember to bring swim wear for the kids for them to enjoy themselves. I feel like joining them too!_x000D_
_x000D_
There's some free-range animal that move around the zoo, you can take picture with them close up. Very fun for that! Singapore Zoo is rated as one of the world best Zoo. Can't miss it.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I'd heard about the Gardens in Singapore and the free Rhapsody show in the evening. The show had just started as I arrived, and as I walked along the dark pathway through the gardens I could hear the beautiful music and see the massive tree-like structures glowing._x000D_
_x000D_
I found a convenient place to stop and take-in the sounds and the wonderful light show - this is when I realised that I was sat amongst hundreds of other people._x000D_
_x000D_
Each musical piece differed from the last, so there was music to suit everyone - the light show was just amazing, as the structures constantly changed colour to match the music. The gardens are vast and the structures are colossal._x000D_
_x000D_
It felt really good to be immersed in the sound and light from these magnificent structures._x000D_
_x000D_
I would recommend this attraction to everyone visiting Singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There is no place better to shop or browse than Orchard Road. It can be a sensory overload of designer brands, but there is no pressure to actually buy. ION is one of my favourites which caters for all budgets.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Is this the best shopping place in the world?!
REVIEW_BODY: Shop' til you drop - shopping centre after shopping centre but you need plenty of money for all these designer shops. There is cheaper shopping in the Lucky Plaza Shopping Mall but the whole Orchard Road thing is truly amazing and so clean. A must for any visitor. Check out the Tourist Information Centre in Orchard Road - they are so helpful.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Packed with restaurants this place offers many different places to eat. Open for breakfast, lunch and specially dinner. At night restaurants turn into bars. Also some bars only to hang around. Loved the place, loved the atmosphere.
ADDRESS: 30 Victoria Street Chijmes, Singapore 187996, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must see when in Singapore. It is located within the Singapore botanical gardens and it is worth the $5 entrance fee. The landscape is beautifully maintained and variety of orchids are amazing.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Maybe because I went earlier on in the day, but nothing appeared to be open. Walked round the streets where all appeared to be was eating nooks which I was not particularly interested in as they were closed and I had recently had breakfast anyway. A bit tired and uninteresting really.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went around the market every day and bought many souvenir for my family and friends. Enjoy the yummy food at foodcourt there. This is an awesome place for staying when you come to Singapore.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not to missed when in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Merlion Park is located on One Fullerton road and considered as one of the famous landmarks you shouldn't miss when in Singapore. The ambiance is very nice and the park is well organized. I would surely bring my family on my next future visit in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My expectations are low. It's a bridge with a cool design. If you live in Singapore then you should visit this someday. The bridge is unique and there's a pretty treetop view. The best way to get there is by car or taxi unless you enjoy hiking uphill a decent amount. Some people sit and take some time up there. For me, I pretty much just walk across it and think to myself "That was ok to see".
ADDRESS: 221 Henderson Road Henderson Building, Singapore 159557, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Battle Box was a very interesting and informative part of our stay in Singapore The only negative was that the guide spoke so quickly that we missed some of the facts. He was a wealth of information.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A good experience for people who would like to see some flora in Singapore all in one place. The domes are beautiful. A bit pricey though when it comes to food. Pack snacks! Especially for those with kids!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must see - do not miss the evening light shows. It takes a while to get around the gardens (especially in the heat), but it is so worth the effort.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: How many times I go there.. but it's always feels fresh. so much of wealth of books and great place to read that book and get your thoughts cleared. Very nice for family as well, introduce your kids to books and let them pick up the reading habit.
ADDRESS: 100 Victoria Street National Library Building, Singapore 188064, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great located between Marina Bay and the skyline of Singapore. There are a lot of tourist....it's a must to see about the view
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Been there a few times. It was an amazing experience everytime I went there with my kids. Cloud Forest is a another place not to be missed. This is 1 of the places that made Singapore proud. Even "Hitman" were filmed here.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Spent the evening wandering the these gardens and waited patiently as they came alive. The gardens are clean and well maintained. When they come alive, it's magical. Be aware that after the evening light show, the MANY number of people attending wander to their "pick up" locations - it gets very sardine like...._x000D_
I will visit again when visiting Singapore and take the time to go during the day.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Even if you are not into orchids or flowers, no trip to the botanic garden would be complete without at least one visit to this centre.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I and my daughter have a wonderful day at Singapore Zoo. We are excited about giraffes, zebra, tiger and river safari ðŸ˜ðŸ˜
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Most amazing what a little lateral thinking can achieve. The point of never a problem always a solution. Truly amazing
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a good looking bridge and does provide an easy walkway across the marina. It provides an excellent view of the marina as well as the many and varied buildings aeround
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This lived up to expectations. We were a bit restricted for time but you could spend hours here. I particularly liked the sculptures as they really set off the gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice and busy place in Singapore with plenty of restaurant
REVIEW_BODY: This is where you need to go out at night to enjoy diner and a small breeze along the river. Near the Marina and connecting to Clark Quay where restaurant are of higher quality.
ADDRESS: 1 Bonham Street Uob Building, Singapore 049782, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic and informative. Tour guide was excellent. Gave a good overview of the fall of Singapore and events leading to it. Underground tour of the bunkers was very interesting.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely zoo.. Not good design for tram
REVIEW_BODY:
Lots of animals in this zoo just like I expected. I bought the tickets for my whole family with tram coz a few of my family's members had problems with knees. But the tram stops was too far away from attractions spots. Mostly we have to walking a lot. Not worth the money I paid._x000D_
_x000D_
The jurong bird Park tram design for stopping was much better than this place. It was always worth the money to buy it.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I stayed in Chinatown while I was in Singapore, and would definitely recommend visiting or staying there. Itâ€™s a bustling place with lots to see. Market stalls of many kinds, many food places, interesting buildings, temples, the list goes on. Bring your camera! My go to place to eat around here was the hawker centre upstairs on smith street near new bridge road.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The views were amazing from the flyer. Great 360 degrees views. It was an easy and pleasant walk along the river to get to it. There were no queues. The flyer is used for the laser show in the evening. Well worth a trip.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a must, you should buy the tickets to enter both enclosed gardens also, do that and you will not regret the experience.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Our tour took us to this temple which was neat both outside and within. Main level is beautiful, but the 4th floor is where you go to see the relic. Donâ€™t miss going up the stairs from there to the rooftop.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Caught the train here from the Promenade station near the Pan Pacific and had an awesome day. Grazing at various little food stalls whilst looking at shops and temple sites. Itâ€™s of colour and life, a very relaxing day. It would be beautiful at night
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited Garden by The Bay with parents. They totally fall in love with the place from the first moment they step inside. Nice environment, cooling condition and the most important is the variety of flower, plant makes you feel you were in another planet. Best time to visit garden by the bay should be after 4pm. Definitely will return for another visit soon.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: How well planned. Maintained and peaceful. Singapore in nature, perfect, clean. Don't miss it, take it all in
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can find all kinds of flowers beautifully displayed in the flower dome. There are terraces for flowers of various continents too. It has huge variety of trees & flowers and its a treat to the eyes. If covered in leisure, one can easily spend 3-4 hrs here.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful lighting, such pretty colours! Visited during the festive season and was so well lit. Great sight!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I have been walking in the Botanic Gardens for years. It is amazing how big the gardens still seem after all these years. We like to just ramble along the walking trails and visit the orchid garden. You won't be disappointed.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Do not miss if visiting Gardens by the bay
REVIEW_BODY: Excellent place to visit. Visit towards the afternoon and wait for the sunset to see the sound and light show. Take additional ticket to go up the towers and take the bridge.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Booked in late (we asked help ) thanks what a great tour. Opened my eyes as I was in the armed forces.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I had a great time here. The cloud forest and flower dome were both stunning. It was a bit chilly inside, but I loved it._x000D_
_x000D_
If you think the super trees look stunning during the day, wait until nighttime where the real magic begins. The light show is stunning.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We googled to know it was free...but when we reached-they mandated to buy 8 sgd ticket per person for light and sound show..._x000D_
We were 11 family members, had no choice than to buy it...but of no worth_x000D_
_x000D_
Its was not at All worth of an experience._x000D_
_x000D_
Not recommended to visit it...even if you have spare time
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
How lucky were we to have the Breakfast with the Orang Utan experience! Our table was right next to where the Orang Utans appear and the kids were enthralled. The breakfast itself was of a good standard with plenty of variety._x000D_
The Zoo overall was really pleasant with lots of shaded walkways and greenery and well set out enclosures and free space. We loved seeing the monkeys swinging through the trees. The water park at the end is a bonus for cooling down hot children
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A must watch for travellers to Singapore. While sentosa and US offers the artificial pleasures, this one is more attached to the natural way._x000D_
Beautifully maintained park , with kids friendly and family friendly options like battery operated cars , voice assistance on guiding throughout the Park etc etc. One should not miss the bird show at 11:30 and at 15:30. It's a great to watch. Overall , an excellent place to visit in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Night safari great but poorly organised
REVIEW_BODY:
We bought tickets for night safari for the first slot available (19.15) to ensure we could enjoy the night safari with our 4 year old before bedtime. Arriving at 7PM and long queues a head of us. We decided to watch the night-show first but we were informed 19.15 show was full.... come back for the 20.30 show was the message. We queued up for the tram ride for some 20-30 minutes, got on the ride and enjoyed it very much._x000D_
Very much worth the effort and we could even see most of the animals, great experience. What was less great was that when we returned to â€œstationâ€ some 8.10 PM we were told the 20.30 show was already full and we were asked to return 21.30! Really annoying to have ticket for 19.15 and still no guarantee to get into the show. Bad organised and planned by night safari!!!_x000D_
There are also 5(?) different walks where you can see the animals by foot. This is a well worth to do. We did some of the walks and then we returned home to put our son to bed and therefore we missed the show and I cannot comment what it was about. Night Safari is great but the poorly organised and lack of information of how it works gave a bitter taste to us and our 4 year old._x000D_
Hint of advice, try to avoid the weekend as that is even more crowded.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth at least one ride. Check the operating times as it doesn't run early mornings. You can go from Harbourfront up to Mount Faber or over to Sentosa.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The best way to experience the Sky Park is surely to stop at the hotel, but this absolutely worth the visit if you are not a guest at Marina Bay._x000D_
_x000D_
The view is amazing, and the chance to get that awesome photo with the whole of the Singapore skyline in the background one not to miss.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was just around the corner from our hotel and was a lovely quiet and cool place for a walk and some down time
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Just one word - Wow. Go visit and I promise you won't be disappointed._x000D_
_x000D_
Easily accessible and two tours for the price of one...this is a must._x000D_
_x000D_
Amazing waterfall and indoor tree world awaits whilst next door you'll find the largest array of flowers to stun all your senses._x000D_
_x000D_
The raised walkway amongst the trees with a departing message of saving the planet .... left us speechless._x000D_
_x000D_
Go see. This should be your first stop on any trip to Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The zoo is fabulous and a great day out with lots to see. Lots of walking so would pay to hop on the team next time. The main show was great but the other two were boring so donâ€™t bother running around to get to them. Always surprised itâ€™s cheaper for a meal in the tourist places than outside
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The most beautiful place in singapore! gets even more beautiful at night! you can go by metro. almost all best atraction is there.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very nice safari filled with marine creatures I have never seen. Was lucky to witness manatee feeding!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A friend and I (both under 25) took a trip over here after seeing amazing pictures and hearing good things. However after 5 minutes of walking we felt incredibly uncomfortable and intimidated receiving horrible looks from both both men and women. Although we were dressed very moderately we did not feel welcome at all. Singapore also prides itself on cleanliness and little India was a far cry from clean and also the only place in the city that we encountered wasps. We spent 5 days in Singapore and both loved it! This was the only downside of the whole city. Would not recommend for young women.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We took a walk around the gardens one evening and they were truly beautiful. The 'trees' are lovely and the lights really look fantastic. The different art light installations around were also beautiful. Definitely more than just your average garden!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
when we bought combo ticket for zoo & Bird park we thought the location of both will be adjacent but unfortunately it is located quite far away from zoo._x000D_
_x000D_
As we all know Singapore is hot & humid hence we should always go for Tram ride during the Bird Park visit._x000D_
_x000D_
Bird park is full of colourful birds & is divided into zones. The Tram will drop you at location you explore that then take Tram again drop you to next zone. You will change Tram frequently & use whatever is available.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good way to see part of Singapore from the air
REVIEW_BODY:
There are 2 short cable car lines - 1 in Sentosa island, and the other liking Sentosa Island to Mt Faber._x000D_
_x000D_
We visited on a weekday afternoon when it was very quiet, and were able to ride multiple times with an unlimited ride ticket. The cars are clean and well maintained and the attendants friendly. It's a good way to view Singapore and Sentosa Island from the air._x000D_
_x000D_
Tip: Google Onefabergroup and buy your Sentosa tickets online for a 15% discount. If you would like multiple rides on the cable cars, but the Fly & Explore Pass which give you entry into the SEA Aquarium in Sentosa and unlimited rides on both cable car lines.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Very interesting but more history than nature
REVIEW_BODY: We spent a good few hours looking at everything and learning the history of Singapore. This is a museum for history buffs as there was little in the way of flora or fauna on display.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing place to visit. One of the Singapore most famous and luxurious places to see. The malls at Orchid road are really amazing.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you like shopping, this is the place to go. Shopping mall everywhere. Clean, Easy to loose Time by shopping.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great space to get away into some nature. Directions are a bit obscure at times, & we had maintenance work to contend with (we were unable to go into certain areas which meant a lengthy alternative route or just as lengthy double back). Great views from Mt Faber & the Hederson Waves. Can easily spend 4-5 hours walking this track. Have a look through Hort Park as well, nice garden sections, and a market if you go on a Saturday. Take plenty of water. Also take a picture of the map at the start of the trail, is not perfect but gives some guidance along the way. We got off at Pasir Panjang MRT & was quite a walk through the â€˜suburbsâ€™, but felt it may have been better to get off at Kent Ridge MRT.
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: How many shops is too many?
REVIEW_BODY: There are more shopping malls down this street than you can shake a stick at. Each is stuffed with shops. However, it is mostly expensive clothing and fashion goods along with restaurants from McDonald's upwards. As a man I was easily bored here, especially as prices were higher than in the UK - And, yes, there is a Marks and Spencers here!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We just loved this place. The place is full of shops selling good stuff at extremely cheap prices. We got small gifts for all our son's classmates. Brought bracelets here , which were beautiful. The market is huge and has a lot of shops. You need time to select and shop. Its always buzzing with people. Has a lot of food joints , though vegetarian food choice is extremely limited. A shoppers paradise. Loved the whole experience of it. If u like small souvenirs to gift, and don't mind the rush ..this place is a heaven for u.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The conservatories are well done but very unnatural. There is no ecosystem at all, and the temperature, while a nice break from the heat, felt off as a habitat. More importantly, as someone who has visited nature preserves around the world, this stuff is just super underwhelming. All this messaging on climate change and I wonder how much power it takes to keep these gardens green and the lights on.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place for young and old
REVIEW_BODY: Clean and well maintain zoo. Good as a family trip even though its under the hot sun. Not much shelter area if it comes to raining weather. Lots of stop for seats and water refilled area for a short rest for everyone...
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We spent over five hours here during the day (and did not see it all) and then another hour in the evening as well._x000D_
The Gardens are split into several areas most of which is free. You only pay to use the sky walk in the super tree grove area and the Flower dome and Cloud forest dome (see separate postings) ._x000D_
The day we went it was overcast and light rain but this did not affect it at all._x000D_
You need to come back in the evening to the super tree grove as they have a light show twice a night which is also free.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Be prepared when you arrive for everything to be based on DisneyWorld - large crowds, queuing and plenty of eating establishments whilst you wait. Once on the road train (one every 10mins or so) then it reverts to what you are probably expecting. You do see plenty of animals and the non-dangerous ones you can almost touch from the road train. You cannot use a flash on camera, so taking decent photographs is going to need a very good camera. Once in the place you can go on multiple events, so it can end up reasonable value. Staff are friendly and helpful (as they are in almost all of Singapore's attractions). The shuttle bus from Khatib MTR was OK (and just a dollar) but expect a wait either end during busy times. I suggest avoiding weekends.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A Singapore great, lovely walking around the two gardens slowly. we relay enjoyed our re visit. ----
ADDRESS: 1 Chinese Garden Road Chinese Garden, Singapore 619795, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Vibrant area with bargains available at the night market
REVIEW_BODY:
I would recommending visiting China Town at night when the night markets are in full swing._x000D_
_x000D_
There are lots of bargains available, including tourist memorabilia and clothing._x000D_
_x000D_
Interspersed amongst the markets are some beautiful temples - tourists are free to wander into the temples and take pictures if they wish._x000D_
_x000D_
There are also a large number of eating options - from eat on the street quick Chinese food to more upmarket options._x000D_
_x000D_
Well worth a visit during your time in Singapore.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard street never fails to amaze. The large variety and diversity of shops never ceases to amaze me.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: If you like shopping, this might be the spot for you.
REVIEW_BODY:
I guess it depends on what moves your boat. This sort of attraction (shopping) isn't really our thing. Now, everybody needs to eat and this place definitely has some great deals, choices and locations well worth visiting._x000D_
_x000D_
What would you find here?_x000D_
_x000D_
Several department stores with famous brands on display are waiting for you. Looking at prices I can see there isn't much difference with Australia and it might be a tad expensive for an American. But the shopping malls are very interesting to watch. Inside some of these, you will find glorious food courts and restaurants. I do recommend these last ones, is a good representation of the food in Asia._x000D_
_x000D_
On this road, you will also find a few galleries and museums, out of which I think the Singapore Art Museum is well worth the visit if you are trying to escape the crowd and the busy noise of the street._x000D_
_x000D_
Is it a must-do thing in Singapore?_x000D_
_x000D_
It depends, do you fancy buying stuff? in that case, this place might be for you. Do you like to chill and rest? go somewhere else.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The BattleBox is an easy access reminder of Singaporeâ€™s military history and an interesting, educational and air conditioned delve into the Singapore Story, only a stoneâ€™s throw from todayâ€™s tourist-magnet Clarke Quay._x000D_
Amid todayâ€™s commercial and financial frenzy, you forget that Malaya and Singapura were the British Empireâ€™s military hub in Asia and hold important pages in the history of WW2 for the Commonwealth._x000D_
_x000D_
We took 11am guided tour with our two kids (7,5) and their two friends, also 7. Would definitely recommended the guided tour with kids as it keeps the information crisp and focused for the little ones over 75-90 minutes. Special highlights for the boys being the soldiersâ€™ toilets and everything that comes with that. Older kids can probably self guide but I always recommend using the knowledge that is available from people who have actually studied this stuff rather than guessing._x000D_
_x000D_
The tour is a walk through the various rooms of the underground bunker, 9 meters/3 storeys down, with artefacts, maps, recreations of the decision making moments and obviously the story of what unfolded so swiftly in the Battle of Singapore in 1942. I donâ€™t think it is wheelchair friendly, did not see any elevators._x000D_
_x000D_
Book tickets ahead as the BattleBox is small and underground and they obviously keep group sizes small otherwise it would get loud._x000D_
_x000D_
Tour guide was no nonsense, military style, kept the kids in check. They will ask noisy or uncontrolled children to leave as it is a bunker and the sound echoes. Note the dad with toddler who was asked to step out of the room several times and missed a lot of the commentary. Put a bit of a downer on the morning and made me as a parent a little more anxious of my kidsâ€™ behaviour._x000D_
_x000D_
But if your kids are well mannered and can listen to direction, youâ€™ll be fine. The reception building has souvenirs, drinks and ice creams for the well-behaved ones (and for adults too).
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a lovely walk around the reservoir and not too strenuous. The path is easy to follow and pretty smooth although it might be quite muddy in the rain. Keep an eye open for wildlife as you walk around.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place if you enjoy watching variety of birds
REVIEW_BODY: It is a nice place where you will find loads of varieties of birds. Really loved watching the orange flemingos..they were just awesome! If you are going with children, let me warn you there is a lot of walking and it is tiring. So kindly plan accordingly.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Intriguing glimpse into the early Chinese experience
REVIEW_BODY: We visited the recently refurbished museum and had an intriguing and informative glimpse into the Chinese history of Singapore. The audio tour with individual stories of the Chinese workers and their living conditions was innovative and well executed. There was a lot of information provided and extensive coverage of every aspect of the Chinese experience. The old photos gave a good idea of living conditions and we learned so much and gained a deeper appreciation of the contribution made by the early settlers.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fascinating, Right in the Middle of Town
REVIEW_BODY: Walked through the temple on my own. Many tourists and worshippers. Very interesting artwork, statues, gods, etc. Would have been better if I had a guide to explain what everything was and what worshippers and monks were doing.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the must visit attractions while visiting Singapore. One should plan to visit late in the afternoon so that you can get good views during the day time as well as during the night. The laser and light show is worth watching. There are plenty of options for shopping and eating/drinking around this place.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Get tickets at the visitor centre for all Singapore attractions And stop at the hawkers market right next door
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely amazing zoo, got there early to beat the crowds allow at least 4-5 hours if you don't do any of the shows.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful experience in cloud forest. Well maintained. The artificial waterfalls from the summit of the dome is a treat to all senses. You can easily spend 1-2 hours here.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went during the day and walked all the way round to boat quay. There was an exhibition on whilst we were there I-light it was very nice to look around all the different individual installations. We went back at night time and wow what a different place. Bars food stalls kids rides light show a really good buzz about the place.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Well worth the travel for this experience
REVIEW_BODY:
First thing to say is... could the Zoo be any further from the city centre?? We used the fab MRT + bus to get here and you kind of wondered how far we were travelling!!_x000D_
_x000D_
However, once we got there - wow!_x000D_
We went on a Monday night and so benefited from it being pretty quiet._x000D_
_x000D_
What didn't come over from other reviews is - the team runs every 5 to 10 minutes, not only at the entrance times advertised; those appear to be more about controlling the number of people in the park._x000D_
_x000D_
The tram trip is well done - the animals clearly get fed to keep them at the front of their pens. The commentary is informative but not obtrusive. It does go for about 40 mins and is a great way to get your bearings._x000D_
_x000D_
We then walked around too and enjoyed the ability to get within 30cm (& strengthened glass) from tigers, leopards etc + the thrill of walking through bush as the Lions roared._x000D_
_x000D_
Definitely a must do while in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A garden in the city which provides all year round flower/garden activities. A must to visit: Flower Dome and Cloud Forest Dome.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Depends remotely and basically helps you to orientate. A building that necessarily exists in the photos of every visitor in Singapore
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We are lucky enough to be staying at the hotel but enjoyed the views of the skypark, none the less! Views of both the gardens , ocean and city.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We spent a day walking around the site and visiting the orchid garden. The landscaping is fabulous with amazing plating sections, water sculptures and bridges. It is a beautifully tranquil site due to its size and you can find quiet spots away from fellow visitors
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Similar to Haji Lane, itâ€™s more alive and colourful at night. I didnâ€™t tried any of the Middle Eastern restaurants here but the food look amazing. It can be slightly packed at times, though. But overall, a great place to visit.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Not impressed - felt ripped off. When you pay your money and get up there, there is a wee juice kiosk. No seats, no shade. The complimentary photos are far from complimentary! It was hot when we went up, so we thought we would have a drink at the bar. However, if you cross over the step to the bar you are not allowed back into the observation deck. If you think you are going to see the famous pool, then think again - residents only. The view from the skywalk in the gardens by the bay was much more entertaining!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It has malls after malls and most of the top end showrooms are present. One can get middle range ones too._x000D_
Some of the malls we visited were Ion mall, Takashimaya etc. From Ion mall go to basement which is huge and many levels are there with rows and rows of shops which are mid range.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Being a local, i am abit ashamed to admit i never been to Gardens by the Bay until 2 weeks ago. I didn't enter the dome, but i walked around the area and went up to SuperTree at Indochine for a drink. And the view was spectacular! It was so awesome.. truly a magnificent view and totally worth the 20 bucks to go up to chill at night!_x000D_
Enjoy!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: far far away, not worth the travel
REVIEW_BODY: far far away, not worth the travel. nothing much to see there, especially it's at night and the animals are sleeping across the river to your car.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Girlsâ€™ heaven ! Lots of shopping spot here ! Lucky plaza for cheap perfume and go during june - aug , huge sales and you can get really cheap bargain !
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth the admission price and more
REVIEW_BODY:
I can't understand a recent reviewer complaining the venue was cold. Are they serious? Any relief from the heat is appreciated here._x000D_
We found the dome to be fantastic, and worth going to alone if you don't have time to view the whole precinct. Take your time to appreciate the subtle changes to the vegetation as you move up into the clouds. And make sure you time your walk through, for when the 'misting' occurs.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Little India is a shopping bazaar. There are many electronics, garments and jewelry stores along with many restaurants._x000D_
The Mustafa Centre has ALMOST EVERYTHING you could ever need from clothing to housewares to automotive to medical to electronics to cameras to toys to stationary to shoes etc etc.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well, when you hear about Helix Bridge, it's not like any ordinary bridge. It has a historical reference, it's a walking bridge where you can stretch along the lights, especially at night. I used it to reach Gardens by the Bay and used it on the return trip as I wasn't disappointed. I recommend visiting.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The statue itself is very basic and overly crowded by tourists. But said that, the view from the park is worth capturing. You get to the marina bay hotels and the cbd skyline. Just visit for the views around.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Marina bay on the Fullerton side is the best place to see the laser light show from Marina Bay Sands, lovely during the day and even better a night
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Chinatown is full of restaurants but suggest you go to smith street where you can watch your dinner being cooked we went to universal foods and when again the next night it was that good and reasonably priced .If you wish a drink there are ladies that run up and taking drink orders and take them back to your Table
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see while in Singapore !!
REVIEW_BODY:
We really enjoyed the time spent here and it is a must see while in Singapore. Allocate at least half a day here and best to stay and watch their light show in the evening. There are also many places to eat here .... including the opportunity to sample some local food. Both the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest are excellent._x000D_
_x000D_
You can take the train to Bayfront Station on the Circle Line. It is a short walk (15 minutes) to Gardens By the Bay ticketing area. Just follow the signs. You can also pay S$3 per PAX and take a shuttle too. S$28 for admission to both conservatories and another S$8 for the OCBC Skyway.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Its a place "if you visit Singapore have sometimes to vist"
REVIEW_BODY: I love the ambiance, lot of information's, I would recommend if you visit Singapore please do not miss this garden
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You will find almost any brand you can think of on Orchard Rd. It's a road completely dedicated to shopping. Although I find the prices in Singapore to be quite steep, there's also food courts in the malls for some yummy goodness.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Indeed it is amazing to see the skypark as it is very unique and thereâ€™s nothing else in this world like this. I would recommend coming in during weekdays somewhere in the afternoon where thereâ€™re lesser people and not so hot.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: 30 minutes ride in the sky. You can take photos at a maximum height of 165m. My experience was in the evening but you might try in the morning
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The ride up is 20 SGD and worth it. especially at night You have great views in a 360 degrees angle. Wonderful foto opportunity.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely walkway connecting promenades around Marina Bay. Go in the evening--the lights are lovely. We found it too hot to try to attempt during the day.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Love everything about this place! Itâ€™s amazing and breathtaking! Love love love! Price is Sing $23 using Klook. Worth every cent! Make sure you have your camera!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful view of Singapore waterfront from the sky
REVIEW_BODY: We traveled to Sentosa from mount Faber. It was an experience to enjoy. Car can comfortably sit 6 adults. They also offer romantic dinner for few of those who wish to experience the same. Night view on return journey was also equally beautiful.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We have visited Gardens by the bay before, each time we visit we find something different. Enjoyable day out lots of photographs taken
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can only see a small part of the skypark. Most of it is blocked off for patrons of marina bay hotel with pool and bar that you can only see from afar.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: wonderful day leave most of the day for looking around then relax at the garden cafÃ© if you are pushed for time think about going to this magnificent garden
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spend a full day here. Go to the observation deck in the afternoon, enjoy in the cafe, go to the gardens after that, watch the light show in the evening and then enter the casinos.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Our family really enjoyed the Singapore flyer. We booked tickets online but the queue was minimal anyway. We went just before sunset which gave us amazing views and photos. The small screens inside the pods allow you to learn about the various buildings etc that are visible from the Flyer. Well worth the effort (and money).
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Why would you want to put yourself through this? Consumerism gone mad. So many expensive brands all on the one street. It is not cheap here so not sure why everyone seemed to by buying stuff. Not the Singapore for us. Got away as quick as we could. Faceless and nameless mega malls ugh. Nothing quality about this street at all.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of our favorite places in Singapore. Lush, green, interesting, beautiful, peaceful. This is probably my number one must see attraction in Singapore. Good restaurants there too
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Queued for ages and turned away due to weather
REVIEW_BODY: Arghhhhhh I queued for ages win my 4 and 15 year old only to be turned away just as we were next to get on. Be aware that this attraction can suddenly close due to lightening risk. We were given a stamp to return anytime during the week. I'm inly here for another day and going to universal studios so now I'm not sure if I'll get on at all. I couldn't get a refund :-(
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit at night for free show
REVIEW_BODY: Free Garden Rhapsody show from 7.00pm to 8.45pm at Supertree grove. Wonderful, beautiful, light and sound show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We arrived early evening just before the sun went down. The plants and sculptures in the glass houses were fabulous. The forest with all the lights on after dark was beautiful.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Recommend to take the elevator to the top. It costs SIN$ 20,00 ( $ 15.00 US ). This does not give you access to the pool but great views over the whole city
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fun fact. Walking through the tree-covered walkways in MacRitchie reservoir is really pleasant, several degrees cooler than the city. The combination of a gentle breeze and shade makes the 11 km stroll completely doable, without sunglasses! Do bring bug spray though, there are a few mosquitos about, not terrible, and a water bottle. There are places to refill, but particularly the walk back from the bridge can be very long without water. Also, we encountered a monkey on the bridge, who stalked past us and hired menacingly at my daughter, when she studied him too closely. (There really was nowhere for her to go, they were both â€œtrappedâ€ on the bridge). She escaped with nothing more than a bit of a scare, but it would probably not have happened if she had taken the sign to â€œNot stare at the monkeysâ€ more seriously. Monkey passed me without incident.
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a beautiful, peaceful place with a variety of trails and areas to visit. You could get lost in here all day if you wanted to and can take your own picnic basket if you wish. The orchid garden was lovely and they had live entertainment in the outdoor theatre which was great. Very well laid out with signs everywhere. Very well kept and despite the heat, very enjoyable! Lovely!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens are very nice with a lot of different trees, plants... you can also see varans, squarrels, birds... If you are in a hurry you only see a little bit, like we did.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Shops and malls are everywhere...high end boutiques to inexpensive shops. Fine dinning restaurants to street food stalls. Good hotels, bars and coffee shops. It's a one stop shop area in SG.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really enjoyable walk. You could go as a group, family or even solo. So much to take in with the sights and scene. One of my highlights when visiting Singapore.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A 15 minute spot to have a picture with merlion lion on your back. Took some funny pictures and enjoyed a lot with my friends.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A place you shouldnâ€™t miss in Singapore with your family. You will get to see most of the plant in one place.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Easy to get to by MRT. Good signage.
REVIEW_BODY: Ticket applies to both domes. Consessions apply. Gardens surrounding are free. Good little coffee shop inside dome. Not crowded. Free maps.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited the Changi Chapel and Museum as part of a day trip around the island. Very sobering. No photos are to be taken inside the museum which is out of respect for the ex POWs. Ladies should NOT wear mascara as if you are like me, you will be bawling your eyes out.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We walked along the river from Richardson Quay. You can go by boat, bus, train or taxi. The park's main attraction is the mythical Merlion, although the surroundings ate also attractive. The views are very good.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: very interesting place. Cant miss while in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Very nice place, cloud forest reproduced in a Dome! you can visit garden by the bay and this place at the same day! dont miss!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The only thing you canâ€™t miss
REVIEW_BODY: An amazing statue-fountain at Singaporeâ€™s marina. During the night there is a light show from marina bay sands.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: its not what you expect,its very tour guide isle
REVIEW_BODY: i guess i was looking for comfort and view, not ques, costs, and exposure to elements. its not centerpoint , its the bridge climb without the harness or the steps.its ok, have the meal,see the civilized views and take in the atmosphere rather than the cattle muster.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Many shop and restaurant in this area. I think every visitor will go this place. So it is busy. I have eat pancake, it was so good. But I forgot the name of shop. There is in the middle of Road. Please seek and enjoy it.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of these things that will not disappoint you
REVIEW_BODY: Superb views and great atmosphere. You will definitely feel like being a part of a postcard setup. I will remember this visit. Simply walk and enjoy the views.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Merloin Park should be the very last thing on your list for a Singapore Visit
REVIEW_BODY: Its a figures of a Lion that has water from its mouth. Its highly overated and not really of any great specific interest other than based on an older (not ancient) myth. There are so many things to do that this item should be the very last on any sightseeing trip in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
You need to take your shoes off and leave them on a rack outside. Initially I was concerned about leaving my shoes outside but then I remembered that I was in Singapore and there is 0 chance of any theft._x000D_
_x000D_
Just from the outside you can see a lot of the exquisite statues and architecture. I'd never been in a Hindu temple before so I was really excited about seeing what it was like._x000D_
The temple was beautiful and there are many amazing statues and decorations. It is both functioning temple and also a tourist attraction. I think the temple could do with a bit of a clean as the statues were starting to look a bit dusty but that's a minor quibble._x000D_
_x000D_
Only problem I had was understanding what I could and could not do and where I was allowed to go. I didn't want to be disrespectful and so I played it safe. I didn't use my phone or camera inside (even though I wanted to take pictures of the stunning interior) and I tried to stick to areas that were obviously for tourists.
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If I say one word about this place is amazing..v could enjoyed the real natural beauty.. real experience for rainforest..
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The Gardens by the Bay is a must
REVIEW_BODY: The Gardens by the Bay is a must visit!. It is a world standard, beautiful design, bringing the nature right to you. You
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Been here last Saturday, Overall it's great and the kids like it so much, especially the Panda but too bad, only one Panda available during that time. Missed the Red Panda show caused it's only started on 10 Dec 2017.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Impressing waterfall and lots of beautiful plants, but if you are most interested in botanics, you should rather go to Singapore Botanic Gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the two domes in gardens by the bay. There is a tall man made waterfall inside with lots of different plants around it. It is a nice thing to see, but I do prefer the flower dome over this one.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful and unique elevated walk way. Great views of the surrounding area. Felt like a Dr. Seuss book.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I love flower and cloud forest, have to walk from marina bay. Not suitable if you bring child but you can buy ticket for roundtrip ride if you don't want to walk.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great building with easy to follow displays
REVIEW_BODY: We like visiting major museums as they can provide really good information about the country or city you are visiting. This was no exception and really told the story of Singapore from early through to modern times. The displays were easy to read and follow, as well as being rather interesting.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Last visit was in the early 80's to have breakfast with the Orangutan (in those days you sat and ate with him). The Singapore Zoo continues to remain one of the best in the world. The Zoo's setting, environment for the animals, the quality of the exhibits, the treatment & welfare of the animals, and the facilities for the visitors - all contribute to a memorable experience.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Must see venue. Please give yourself a treat an visit this attraction.
REVIEW_BODY: A place that will blow your mind and scintilate the senses. Congratulations Singapore on a great attraction.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Take the time to do all levels
REVIEW_BODY: We visited this temple last year but had limited time. This time we allowed a lot more time and were not disappointed. Catching the lift to the top floor we climbed the stair to the rooftop garden which is lovely and peaceful The garden walls are covered in thousands of small Buddha statues and provides a spectacular sight. We then worked our way down floor by floor taking in all that there is on offer here. Do allow yourself plenty of time and check out all levels.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: i went there for the sakura matsuri event. beautiful flowers indoors with air condition makes the walk comfortable.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: nice roads to have a walk and to do bit of a shopping. you can find many shopping outlets & malls in this road
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Must see if you are in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: There are 2 main domes. 1- Sky cloud was amazing. 2- Flower dome was meh. We also went to the Winter Wonderland, which was a complete waste of money.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An amazing park in an amazing city. Totally awe inspiring in its magnitude and detail. Be sure to see the Orchid Garden which exemplifies attention to detaiÄº.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing place at 6 km it is probably too long to walk it all. Especially with the SCâ€™s which are individual shopping centers containing department stores specialty shops cafe and restaurants. One side is called the mall and has side walk shops. You can buy anything here. If in Singapore you have to visit orchard road.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Many arab food in this area. It is good to see how multi culture fit together in SIG. However, this area was a little bit not as clean as others.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was super genius to make and create. Whether seen in the morning or at night, all day you get to see how amazing it is. Evening time you get to see it with the lightings on, pretty amazing and magical.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing to see such diverse Flora and fauna! The numerous plants are so well grown that it reminds me that Singapore is a disciplined City ðŸ˜€ very well maintained
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Excellent Asian cuisine inside the Chijmes court. We tried a selection of their starters (avoiding the fried stuff that everyone does) and looking towards spicy salads and delicate dishes._x000D_
Quality and taste at our table with lovely service and price below 50SGD pp._x000D_
Book in advance on Fridays and weekends
ADDRESS: 30 Victoria Street Chijmes, Singapore 187996, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A great way to see Marina Bay and more, having stayed in Singapore nearly two weeks we thought we should go and see the Singapore Flyer, luckily we were able to get a pod on our own, the staff are very accommodating._x000D_
_x000D_
The views are simply stunning, this is a must, you get breathtaking views of Gardens by the bay, and Marina Bay Sands, I thoroughly recommend it.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great variety of specimen and lovingly cared for. Feed the fish, watch the goannas and discover new species (the cannonball tree was new to me). Do not miss the orchid garden within it: it is a treat!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A free tourist spot and must visit of Singapore. You may need prepare your own umbrella. There are huge amount of tourists. I guess the only time where the place is less visitors are the mid-noon which is so hot with sun right up above your head.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I would suggest to keep atleast 6hrs aside for this attraction. We spent abt 3-4hrs and missed exploring all the displays. The flower dome is a bust of colours, however the supertree is icing on the cake. We experienced the light and sound show at 7.45pm and my god it's breathtaking. For 15mins songs from 80s and 90s is played with super light play. Food court and toilet are adequately placed. Keep aside 1/2day for this..
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: By Zoo you think that it might be a place for kids. But when you enter you realize that this is one of the finest zoo you would ever find. With large varieties of mammals and birds its a good entertainment place for every age group. You can skip night safari and go for Zoo instead.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The domes were surprisingly cool given Singapore's climate. The stuff inside the Dome was interesting and unique, hadn't seen those types of things in other Gardens. Be sure to check out Indochine at the super tree, great views for a reasonable price ($10 for non alcoholic entry). Ocbc Skywalk line was very long and in fact the skywalk itself was very short walk so that was definitely not worth it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Cloud Forest is the most amazing place. You are greeted by a huge indoor waterfall. As you walk gently upwards the plants and shrubs are beautifully kept with interesting and informative information provided along the way. A lift takes you to the top of the dome and on each level as you walk down there is so much to see and read about. It was a most stimulating visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This one one of the most impressive Buddha temples we saw in Southeast Asia. Unique exterior and fascinating interior.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I loved it so much I went back._x000D_
Satay by the bay is amazingly tasty and cheap. My fussiest child even ate there. If I had more time Iâ€™d go back and just keep sampling food from every vendor until I had eaten everything and given myself obesity and heart disease. Worth it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you have time and want to do something a little less touristy this walk is well worth it. The route is easy to find, and well sign posted and you can pick it up and leave it at many points._x000D_
We started at Mount Faber, having taken the cable car up from Harbourfront MRT station.
