The walk is on elevated steel walkways from much of the route and you really feel as if you're amongst the tree tops. The views are great, near and far, and there are butterflies, birds and sometimes monkeys to see. The route goes through Hort Park which is worth exploring in itself, as it's made up of many small individual "gardens" showcasing different styles. It also takes in the Henderson wave bridge which is a fascinating structure._x000D_
The elevated section at Ridge park is closed for maintenance at the moment (Feb 2018) but follow the signs for it to get to Burkit Chandu, a small museum in remembrance of the Battle of Pasir Panjang.
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Walk through history - how difficult it must have been in such confined quarters - the mannequins brought to life the realty of the situation
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing views across Singapore and the South China Sea. Get to the top of Mt Faber and then go for a walk to take in the beautiful rainforest and further stunning views.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Located within Gardens by the bay these man made trees are interesting. I think there are about 16 in total in three areas. The central area is where you will find the skywalk between the trees and indeed a restaurant located in one of the trees. Both require an entrance fee. However it is at night when these trees come to life with a free light and music show lasting about 20mins. (2 shows per night). This is a must see. Take your camera/phone and record the display. It does get busy but most people sit/lay on the floor and just look skywards so crowding does not seem an issue.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went with my family ... Bought the ticket on line to avoid the long queue though buying straight at the counter will have some card discount but buy it online really saves quite some time... There are basically 2 "halls" one with flowers dome and cloud forest. If u like greenery can go for the cloud forest otherwise I think the flower some is pretty enough. It is quite cooling there so do bring along a scarf or jacket.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I loved everything about the gardens at the bay including both domes. You pay about Â£25 and get a ticket to both domes, little bit expensive but definitely worth it._x000D_
_x000D_
Very beautiful flowers here plus different areas for different flowers from all over the world. really nicely laid out and good themes. When we visited it was just after Chinese new year so they had a whole section dedicated to Chinese new year which was very beautiful._x000D_
_x000D_
Great for people with green fingers._x000D_
_x000D_
I would recommend going here about 3pm, walking around both domes and then seeing the supertree light show around 7pm. If Singapore is particularly hot then the domes are a good way to escape the heat as well.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are beautiful, not crowded at all, and have nice restaurants for lunch or dinner. Parking is convenient.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A lot of restaurants are located on this place over looking the Singapore river. Majority of the restaurants are Indian, Chinese, Turkish etc_x000D_
_x000D_
There is also sheeshah available at some restaurants._x000D_
_x000D_
Please make sure to ask for Halal Certificate in case you are a Muslim and would like to eat Non -Veg food, though it would be preferable to stay away from Non - Veg
ADDRESS: 1 Bonham Street Uob Building, Singapore 049782, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Plenty of exotic plant species including the pitcher plants and lots of lovely wood carvings dotted around. Try and catch the "misting up" times for a bit more atmosphere.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
My husband and I went to Gardens by the Bay in August. This was my second time and I absolutely love it. I love it that much that I am taking my daughter back in one weeks time. I can't put into words how great this place and make sure you visit the "cloud dome" with the waterfall. It also has some amazing wood carving as well as some beautiful plants._x000D_
Well worth the extra money to see.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What an amazing hotel! Im not sure if I wanted to stay in it or be on the outside looking 'at' it! I have seen many wonderful hotels around the world but this was something special. It is like part of a Sci Fi movie and for me a must see when in Singapore. You can go into the atrium area and marvel at the size of it inside. There are quality restaurants and bars within. You can also pay to go to the observation deck on the very top. Well worth doing to see all around Singapore. Again well worth doing. Just go and see it up close and personal. You will not be disappointed!
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must see while in singapore. During the day the Tree top walk is spectacular. At night the light show is awesome. We we advised by our tour guide to lie on the ground for the show and it was great.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The garden city Singapore; Gardens by the Bay bring that status up another notch
REVIEW_BODY: This is definitely a place visitors to Singapore shouldn't miss. 2 separate domes offering different experiences. This place features many plants, flowers, trees, etc....from around the world. A very pleasant place for adults and little ones.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A good place to walk and observe.
REVIEW_BODY:
The gardens can be accessed by bus from the southern end and by MRT and bus from the north. There are other entrances too, but not sure about public transport._x000D_
_x000D_
We visited on one of the days when guided rainforest tours were being given, so took breakfast at Adam Rd food centre and joined the 10am tour._x000D_
_x000D_
This took us through the rainforest area, which is mainly accessed via slightly elevated walkways. Many of the tree species were pointed out, but they are well labelled even if not on a tour. After the tour we spent an hour or so wandering the gardens, and would have stayed longer but we intended visiting again on another occasion._x000D_
_x000D_
We revisited in an evening to take in the orchid garden and then strolled around in the cooler evening. The atmosphere is completely different, with many locals setting up a family picnic on the slope approaching the music stage in the lake. Unfortunately there was no music on our visit, but we had seen the Singapore Symphony Orchestra here on a visit some years ago._x000D_
_x000D_
There are plenty of places to top up your water supplies at various locations around the garden. There are signposts to the different areas, and a map is available to aid navigation.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a visit, some excellent scenery and as you would expect in Singapore clean and well organised
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Filled with statues that have evidently seen better days, this park nevertheless provides some outdoor entertainment if you don't mind walking in the heat. Easy to get to, as it's a short stumble from the MRT station. Children may be a bit frightened by some of the imagery.
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When we visited in February, it was Chinese new year and the shops in Chinatown were full and vibrant! There were so many people also. I visited last year, on October and it wasn't like that. Hotels are a bit pricier than usual at this time, but if you are looking to be welcomed with a festive vibe, then this is the time to go. Beautiful Chinese and Hindu pagodas line the main street too, and many wonderful places to eat.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Why the blaring bright lights at night?
REVIEW_BODY:
This place is absolutely incredible. The different floors you walk through make it feel as though you are ascending through a real 'cloud forest'._x000D_
_x000D_
One thing I do not understand, I have visited here many times across the years, and upon visiting this year, I see that extremely bright shining lights have been installed on all bridges and walk ways. At night this used to be a very special place in the dim light/dark - now the lights are so bright that at night time it just feels very... artificial, the mystique and atmosphere, ruined._x000D_
_x000D_
Please dim the lights at night again, add back the mist coming from the walkways.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best zoos in the world
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore zoo is a massive zoo that is located practically inside of a jungle so it has a lot more natural feeling that some other zoos. It's located a bit out of the main part of Singapore but because of the great transportation it is not difficult to get there
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Enjoy 3-4 hours walking the Garden and viewing some beautiful Garden Sculptures. It a beautiful Garden Day or Night as it is floodlit. There is a sky walk that gives you views of the garden._x000D_
Also there are two wonderful glass houses housing trees ans plants from all over the world._x000D_
An area that is a must if you have limited time in Singapore._x000D_
The surrounding area has Marina Sands hotel unique architecture and too many eating places to mention. A restaurant for all tastes.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Perfect birds eye view for those who canâ€™t afford to stay there. Reasonable price with a restaurant/bar to enjoy the view
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If your interested in looking a something spectacular then the Gardens By The Bay is a must. We spent a couple of hours looking around, went to the two conservatories and wished we could have stayed longer. We will be back!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went there last Sunday the first time and had a good time there with the family. The museum is absolutely state of the art and give a very good overview of the history of Singapore. The special exhibition with treasures from the British Museum was a bit odd since the pieces were all pretty nice but put together in a bit of a random way. The kids enjoyed a story telling session that we was very well done. I have learned a lot about the short history of Singapore which was really insightful.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is one of a handful of well-designed, aesthetically-pleasing buildings I like in Singapore. Comprising 14 floors, it houses the Central Public Library, the Drama Centre, a very useful Reference Library, and a pretty viewing point + discussion area_x000D_
_x000D_
Visitors are advised not to access the top floor (the library's admin centre - closed to the public) and observe the basic etiquette._x000D_
_x000D_
That said, please feel free to browse the large collection of books and materials, most of which are available in English._x000D_
_x000D_
The Library has lockers (free of charge) for visitors using the Reference Library on the upper floors. F&B is served at a cafe on the third floor. The Drama Centre regularly hosts up-and-coming theatre performances at an affordable price._x000D_
_x000D_
The Library building is on the itinerary of the annual ArchiWalks, during the Architecture Festival period; also the host of many cultural events, such as the Singapore Writers Festival.
ADDRESS: 100 Victoria Street National Library Building, Singapore 188064, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was very well presented and planned and the journey through the gardens on the train was excellent with very good documentary.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Music show at garden.. mind blowing
REVIEW_BODY:
As the name suggests its a beautifully built man-made garden but dnt being a garden doesnt mean it cant be a tourist attraction. It one of the most visited place in singapore both by locals & by tourists at night as the garden authourity organises music & light show each night for its visitors to take their heart away show them the actual beauty of the garden._x000D_
_x000D_
Entery to the gardens by the bay is totally free but it also have other attractions within which requires tickets. The garden is very big, nice & beautifully lighted at night that u would want to spen all night lookig at the fountains & tree accompanies with lights._x000D_
_x000D_
Here there are no restrictions on carrying ur own eatables hence u could call it a little picnic. Do take a moment to visit this place to relax eighter with ur family, friend or soulmate whom ever u go to singapore..
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A free nicely maintained safe park
REVIEW_BODY:
Its hard to think of anything 15,000+ others have not said so I will keep it brief. Its free, large, green, clean, safe and outdoors for whatever you want, plus it easy to get to with a MRT stop of its own._x000D_
_x000D_
There are several good places to stop and rest or eat in the garden. The Nassim Gate Malay food is cheap and excellent although mostly self serve.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: It is prime walking area in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This area is always crowded by tourists walking around and taking photos. It is a long walk around Marina , but is a must here . Starting from Lion-symbol of Singapore walking continues along water front passing numerous bars and restaurants. At the other bank famous triple hotel with ship on the top may be visited. Also Marina bay shopping mall with inner rivers and boats in them and top brand shops is a must to visit as well.Evening hours -7,8 and 9 PM wonderful light music show starts on Marina.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Alvin is a master storyteller and gives visitors great insights into the lives of Peranakans in Southeast Asia. Ask him about any item in this private museum and he has a story to go along with it. I recommend this without hesitation!
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Singapore Zoo is a world class zoo in terms of the variety of birds, animals, and live shows. Many of the birds and animals were seen for the first time face to face since they are not found in India. Highlights are the Panda couple (Kai Kai and Jia Jia) and the live shows._x000D_
_x000D_
Singapore Zoo, River Safari, Night Safari, and Jurong Bird Park are adjacent to each other and must be done on the same day. I visited Singapore Zoo, River Safari, and Night Safari in one day. These places can be visited on the day you arrive in Singapore but not the departing day as Night Safari gets over quite late in the evening.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The park is located in the western part of the country but is very accessible. Alight at Boon Lay (green line) and head towards the bus interchange inside the shopping mall (Jurong Point) which is next to the train station.Take 194 to the park and the bus driver will alert passengers to alight at the bid park stop(most people will alight too). To go back, you can take the same bus from the same bus stop (which will make a short u-turn) or go to the bus stop across the road. The entrance of the park is a short walk from the bus stop (5 min walk). Just walk straight in-front along the direction of the road and you can see the signage._x000D_
_x000D_
I spent half a day walking around the park. You can take the tram if you are tired which will stop at the various key stations. do plan your trip well so that you can enjoy the bird show.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited this place after universal studio and the place is really nice and relaxing and seat there for a while and then take the ferry from there take round of the river and either get down at Clark quay for dinner or come back and have dinner near merlion
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We purchased 5 tickets for the viewing platform @ $23 per person. Just a note you need to go to tower 3 to buy your tickets, it wasnâ€™t very clear. When you line line up before the lifts they take a family photo of you. When you arrive at the top they have the photo ready for you and hit you up for $85. We said no. What a view. 45 second up on the lift and 40 seconds down the lift. You will enjoy the view. We took a lot of panoramic shots. It is worth while going up you get an over vie wolf Singapore and the harbour. Our son enjoyed see all the container ships.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My two daughters and I visited this very interesting temple which is in Chinatown. Yes, there is construction going on nearby but once you are inside the temple you forget about it, We even saw a lot of monks in their saffron robes which added interest to our visit.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: An oasis of tranquility in the city
REVIEW_BODY: Could not believe we were in the middle of such a modern busy city. So peaceful, so beautiful, so relaxing. Pay for the Orchid Garden, it's not expensive and full of colour. They change the plants often to keep it looking great.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There is a lovely board walk around the dam, thick tropical vegetation on one side. Monkeys ready to pounce on food if carrying any. Large roof covered area with cafe and toilets to seat and eat own lunch or buy near car park. Beautiful green grassed areas. Kayaking on the dam
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It always nice to walk on Orchard Road, it has wide and clean pedestrian, the trees are big and well maintain.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Please do not be deceived by this, know exactly what your going to get. I genuinely thought we was paying to go up to spend several hours taking in the view, relaxing by the bar eating lunch and using the amazing infinity pool. In reality you pay s$33 to go up to a tiny and by tiny I mean the tip of one end of the Skypark to be crammed in to take pictures and use your voucher in a make shift bar for a almost non existent frozen Singapore sling!_x000D_
Please know what your paying for as we didnâ€™t!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: In my book on par with San Diego Zoo - World Class
REVIEW_BODY: Loved this amazing zoo.A wonderful experience especially with children. 2 year old daughter loved feeding the elephants and playing in the reptile house. The quality and presentation were amazing. Families should take note of the air conditioned locations (Polar Bear Habitat, Reptile House, and Kangaroo house) as it can get hot for little ones while trekking around the zoo.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A great way to get a bird's eye view of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: A must do if you want to orientate yourself in the Singapore landscape. Really enjoyed this activity and the view was amazing. Would recommend for all visitors.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Especially on a hot day (which is most every day on this tropical island), it's cool insides, particularly around the waterfall. Well worth it to go in, and see the beautiful exhibit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Stunning escape route from the city
REVIEW_BODY: Having visited Singapore several times, this was my first venture into the gardens across the road. On both occasions they were virtually empty, which amazed me. There is a huge amount of space, stunning numbers of orchids (a personal favourite hence the 5 stars!), plenty of birds, butterflies etc. All meticulously maintained as well. My only problem was humidity, which prevented my proper camera from working at all - one up to the iPhone, which worked perfectly. As an escape from the formality of the conference, I couldn't ask for better. Thanks to all who help maintain it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went with a tour group to see the night safari. Our first stop was at the restaurant for our included buffet dinner. The food was just OK, but there were plenty of options. Just as we entered the restaurant it started to pour down rain. This is not uncommon in Singapore. We delayed awhile, but then the rain slowed so we got on the tram that takes you through the part of the park for the night safari. You can't see the animals through the plastic that they rolled down due to the rain so we lifted it. The rain was now a drizzle so it was OK. We did see some animals under the low lights that they have throughout the ride. It is no where near like a real safari but interesting enough. After the tram ride, our guide took us for a short walk down a path that had other nocturnal animals. That's all we were able to see due to the timing of our visit.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a great place for a breath of fresh air and respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. There is only one restaurant (a bit pricey) and a snack bar in the grounds. Bring along a picnic basket or plan to eat somewhere else.
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My children immensely enjoyed the ride. I think this was the highlight of visiting Sentosa island. The cable cars appeared well maintained.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went to Labrador for office family day. Nice place with fantastic view of the clear blue sea. There's playground and few monuments around the place. There's lots of tree and sheltered area. Ample parking space. Near the mrt as well (within walking distance). Good for exercising and breathing fresh air.
ADDRESS: Labrador Villa Road Tanjong Berlayer Park, Singapore 119187, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Flower Dome is one of the most spectacular gardens i have seen. It was interesting talking to some of the gardeners to find that a lot of them are volunteers, doing a magnificient job.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing. Started from Hort Park to Henderson Waves then on to Mt. Faber then Harbourfront MRT. Better to do it in the evening if you're aim is to see the Henderson waves at night time. Plus, you won't worry about heatstroke as SG Temp can be quite overwhelming at times. Bring lots of water and change of clothing perhaps. Lots of photo op in the area.
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Cloud forest was enjoyable as you are walk around and up tot he top, the waterfall at the front provided good photo and video opportunities.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We had a fabulous day walking around and viewing all of the amazing animals. The rainforest setting is beautiful and animals can be viewed in a way that they are generally not behind a cage. We enjoyed the reptile enclosure and also being able to enter enclosures with lemurs and toucans. So many species to be seen. We also did the River Safari and Night Zoo.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Tumultuous display of blooms in a kaleidoscope of colours!
REVIEW_BODY: What a fantastic place to visit. The flower dome is packed with so many beautiful orchids and other flowers. You will also find very interesting art work all around. At night, you can also watch the light show and do the skywalk. A must if you are visiting Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Great experience at the Cloud Forest in Gardens By The Bay._x000D_
_x000D_
You can walk around the whole place within an hour and would recommend to go at sunset so you get to see the best of both with the beautiful waterfall during daytime and lit up at dusk._x000D_
_x000D_
you can buy a dual ticket for both cloud forest and flower dome although we preferred the Cloud Forest.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A mecca for serious shoppers who want high end clothing brands. Endless shopping malls connected by more than 2 kms of underpasses which contain more shops. Ghastly if you don't like shopping...
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing, sprawling world-heritage botanic gardens - something for everyone!
REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore Botanic Gardens really are impressive. Beautiful, tranquil, sprawling over 74 hectares (182 acres) with kids play area, fragrant garden, beautiful historic buildings, lakes, a performance stage and so much more. In a tiny island nation of almost 6 million people crammed into less than 720 sq.km you really don't expect anything like this - but once again, Singapore surprises and delights! With an MRT station at it's front door, it's also easily accessible. My friends, who live a couple train stations away, love to come down here and run. My partner and I loved taking our baby for a walk around the place. If I were there alone, I could have happily laid on the grass and taken a snooze. The atmosphere of the place makes you feel instantly relaxed and at ease, and you can put as much or as little energy into your recreation as you choose. Highly recommended! And free entry.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We enjoyed this zoo. We decided to see it at night which we hadn't experienced before. Well worth doing. A small train takes you through the jungle and spot animals in their natural habitat at night. Safe walking trails also. A good variety of animals. We saw lion tiger bear deer otter and more many of which are endangered.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Place to go with Kids
REVIEW_BODY: We went with a 5 year old. Make sure you collect your map and a cart (If your little one is fuzzy about walking A LOT). You can hop on to the internal coach which goes around the zoo and take a quick explore of each section of the zoo. Or else, you can always walk the walk. All animals looked healthy and the place is arranged in a very much educational way for both kids and adults. We spent a good full day at the zoo. Don't forget to go for the river safari too. You can buy tickets to the zoo, river safari and the night safari from the same counter.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful thatâ€™s all !!! Must see destination! Nicely breeze, wonderful lightings Just so chill in this place
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the zoo near to the Singapore Zoo. This contains all the fishes, water cost animals and animals with river as their habitat. This is much structured zoo unlike Singapore Zoo. They have shed all over to cover you from Sun. They have pretty huge fishes out there which are worth the watch. I would highly recommend the Amazon quest boag which is a memorable experience for me. They should all the animals that live in river coast with English commentry in the background. The flamingos are a must watch sight. I would recommend taking Park hopper plus pass to visit this along with other Flora and Fauna attractions in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Haw Par Villa (also known as Tiger Balm Gardens) is a free attraction which was just as well as it was very disappointing. Advertised as the theme park, there are numerous statues to see. The Ten Courts of Hell were very dark and not suitable for children. The place is very dilapidated and despite advertising a cafe and shop we didn't find them - only empty buildings.
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: in front of Sultan Mosque this was the easy place to get something to bring home for your families. its price are reasonable & affordable.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely fun place in the evenings
REVIEW_BODY: We walked around in the early evening and stopped at one of the many restaurants for a drink, right on the river. Great to watch the people and entertainment. It gets busier as the night goes on. Lots of places to eat and drink. Lots of lights and music. There is a bungee chair ride - looks amazing and great fun to watch. Great place to spend an evening.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great ride from Mt Faber to Santosa. Views of waterfront were good. A bit pricey but packages available if you plan on taking in attractions on Santosa mean you save a few bucks.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We booked the Night Tour for $64 per person. A bus picked us up at our hotel and dropped us at Gardens By The Bay. There we paid for the tour and then our guide showed us best where to be to see the magnificent show at 745pm. From there the bus picked us up and took us to Marina Bay Sands. We then heard to level 86 and out onto the Observation Deck... so beautiful. Once back down stairs we walked the link the hotel, past the casino and through the shopping mall to outside and into the Bumboat which took us along the river. What a wonderful night. Once off the boat we had the option of staying there around Clark Quay or being taken back to our hotel, we did that._x000D_
Stephen our guide was funny, informative and a lovely man.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great trails, but plan in several hours
REVIEW_BODY: This is a great set of trails with no entry fee. Unfortunately we did not realize how extensive they were before going or we would have allocated much more time. We had only an hour or so to spend and we did walk a bit of the trails, but would have liked to do much more. The trails were nice and easy to follow. It is very peaceful here and easy to get transportation. There is even a mall nearby with a food court to get some refreshments. I would certainly recommend going, but would suggest going in the morning and allocating several hours for the trails here.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It is something too late to finish the tour at night, and I got to take the last shuttle to go the the MRT and arrived the hotel at might night. I think it would be better if we can arrive the zoo before the sunset, because it toke a long time to admission._x000D_
Well the Night Safari is so funny.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must visit place in Singapore. Specially when the tulip festival is there. We were lucky enough to enjoy the same. Well maintained.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It put shivers down our spines listening to the soothing chants of the monks at the temple. This is beautiful and deeply spiritual place- if you are a lady with no sleeves or short skirts, you will be asked to cover up.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The orchids are displayed together with other plants and make the arrangement more interesting. There is an exhibition on hybrids but it is under renovation now.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: No place on earth makes a man go color mad except this garden. Be there to experience the color madness you would undergo. Have never seen such colorful orchids and the varieties, breeds. Appreciate the men & women who grow n manage them.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Not to be confused with the Sentosa Line Cable Car (separate listing) the line referred to as "Singapore Cable Car" or "Mount Faber Line" runs from the mainland (Faber Peak or HarbourFront) to Sentosa. It operates from 8.45am - 10pm, last boarding at 9.30pm._x000D_
_x000D_
Stations are Mount Faber, HarbourFront and Sentosa. Single Pass is around $26 Adult and $15 Child Senior. This also includes admission fee for Sentosa ($4)._x000D_
_x000D_
You can also get an all day pass which provides unlimited use of both the Mount Faber and Sentosa lines for a day. This costs around $43 for an an adult. In this way you can view both lines during the day and at night and keep going around until you get the perfect photo you're after. Stopping at a station for lunch or tea before embarking again.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely stunning. Make sure you go on a Saturday when they have free guided tours! And make sure you wear walking shoes. ... Cant wait to go back
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are an Indian ,you must visit this place for food and street shopping .it has restaurants for both south and north Indian people. you can walk around and can have glimpse of Indian style, you can get there by metro .The Tekka Centre is famous in Little India and across the rest of Singapore for its large selection of hawker stall and variety of cheap clothes stalls.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Mist is fun but not jaw dropping
REVIEW_BODY: This is a good adventure for the day and interesting but im not sure kids would love it and it seems more like a nice way to escape the heat rather than a top attraction. It looks like it is going to be better than it is but its still worth a visit if you have some time to spare in the area
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: walking through the garden was great. discovering the waterfall makes it more exciting. the souvenir shop offers a lot to pick from
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Just incredible plantations and displays of flowers. We loved every moment of our visit here and spent over 4 hours wandering through the parks and domes.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great Architecture. Surprised to see the plants needs a bit more tenderness and refreshing. Worth the price just to walk in for the aircon.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: You can't miss Chinatown in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Whichever country you go, you will find a Chinatown. I admit that Singapore has the most cleaned Chinatown in the world. You can find foods, souvenirs, and many other interesting things. People are very friendly. To me, they seem to have innate marketing skills.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud Dome is amazing! the range of plant life is unbelievable, so many colours and shapes. Well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Cool place, bit of walking but enjoyable. Throughout they try to create safe and future environment awareness among visitors, knowing statistics of how much our Mother Earth has been spoiled by human mistakes will surely make many to re-think and take one or two good steps personally towards better & safe environment._x000D_
_x000D_
Some photo spots and giant plants/flowers etc._x000D_
_x000D_
They stopped selling tickets to SkyWalk at 2pm due to windy and raining outside so we missed that experience._x000D_
_x000D_
Do NOT miss the light show (free show!) beneath the SkyWalk corridor at 7.45pm daily (just go to Super Tree area). There may be additional show at 8.45pm on Friday & Saturday, please check their website._x000D_
_x000D_
We planned to complete Cloud Forest, Flower Dome, Super Tree light Show and also the Water Show at Marina Bay area on the same day. Hence we entered Cloud Forest at 2pm, then finished Flower Dome, by that time it was around 7pm. went straight to 7.45pm Super tree show (not more than 30 mins show), then we had to walk (long walk 20-25 mins amidst crowd) straight to Marina Bay area (we need to cross the 'the Shoppes Mall' and then asked about the water laser show) for 8.45pm or 9pm show. We made it too:-)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We were totally clueless as to what to expect but were intrigued by the picture in the guidebook!_x000D_
What a place - we entered and looked around in amazement - each level of the temple showed something different, although we were not totally sure what we were looking at some of the time._x000D_
A fascinating, beautiful place that overwhelmed us to be honest and sparked an interest in what much of it meant!
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's cool how close the zoo, night safari and river cruise are so you can do all 3 in one day but come armed for the weather (the heat can be quite a nightmare). The great thing about Singapore Zoo is how easy it is to navigate. There are chances for interaction with the animals - rabbit feeding for the kids, goat feeding and also some shows featuring animals and trained handlers. You may even get a chance to witness some live feeding of the animals!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is absolutely worth visiting the Marina Barrage to discover that beautiful remote spot. An ideal location to relax from the hustle of the CBD and to enjoy the sun. Offers a great panoramic view of Singapore, too.
ADDRESS: 8 Marina Gardens Drive Marina Barrage, Singapore 018951, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You donâ€™t have to be a gardener to be impressed by these gardens. We were very impressed with them both day and night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There's something about this place that will keep you fascinated for hours, walking around and enjoying the sound of the water.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The old supreme court and city hall buildings have been remodelled in a brilliant way to create the New National Gallery of Singapore. When we visited the main exhibition was presented in conjunction with the Pompidou Centre of Paris and later in 2016 there will be one in conjunction with the Tate Gallery, London. Leave more time than you think you will need here, there is a lot to see.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The total experience was above and beyond anything I have seen in the past.The total area in the flower dome and the cloud forest was incredible and the way the layout was planned made it all worth while.i would say that at least a whole day should be planned for this visit as there is so much to see.To see the attractions all illuminated it as worth a visit at nighttime.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Back to nature stroll and embrace the openness. It was nice to visit the old oak tree in the compound. An opportunity to pick saga seeds as its trees are rare in Singapore nowadays.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you have had enough of the big name brands in giant shopping malls, then it's time to hang out in Chinatown. Eclectic and exciting, you can buy cheap gifts and eat well on a budget.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Part of the Marina Bay Sands is the curiously shapes Art Science Museum. Its exhibitions are world class and its design is iconic. It is symbolic of the welcoming hand of Singapore with 10 fingers. Natural light filters in through the tip of each finger so the exhibits are seen in the best light. There are 21 galleries spread over three storeys with a total floor space of about 50,000 sq ft._x000D_
As the name suggests, ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands beautifully fuses art and science to tell fascinating stories. This premier venue houses a constantly changing line-up of major international touring exhibitions, brought in through collaborations with organisations such as the American Museum of Natural History, the Smithsonian Institute and world-renowned furniture designer Herman Miller.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Tranquility from the busy cut centre
REVIEW_BODY: Too much to see in one visit Pick up a map and decide how to make best use if your time Wonderful experience!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A great place to start your adventure in Chinatown
REVIEW_BODY: The Temple is easy to locate and enter in Chinatown and can be visited in all weather. There are some requirements re clothing but nothing over the top. We were lucky to arrive as some event was taking place and able to watch what was happening. The people are friendly and there are signs and guides to assist both in behaviour and providing historical notes. There is a lift to enable people to move between floors and experience all of the building. There are some amazing sights and historical items on open display. There is a rooftop garden and a quiet pray room. It was hard to fathom at the end such a place of peace and tranquillity existing alongside the brothels and joss houses as it did in earlier times. Once you finish here you can dive into the shopping and food along the street.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The evening did not start well ..... the crowds were huge and we were queuing for a 2015 entry from 1945. Throngs of people just standing in heat and humidity. Once inside, it took is 45min in the tram queue, but this moved steadily. So moods were not great initially ....._x000D_
_x000D_
But when the tram ride started, we were left breathless. Every pen had animals and they were so close. The tour explanation was great, and pace was good. They have large animals like elephants, rhino and lions which were very impressive. It is more like a safari than a zoo. Our kids are still talking about it. Afterwards you can walk some trails, but for families with kids, the tram ride pretty much covers it._x000D_
_x000D_
So be prepared for an initial mass scrum, but the end result is worth it.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
There's a reason GBTB is the No 1 attraction in Singapore - it is sensational. There's nothing I can add to the thousands of glowing reviews this place has already received, so I'll limit it to this._x000D_
"If you visit Singapore without visiting 'Gardens' you will have missed not only a superb attraction but also an example of some fine engineering ingenuity and some of the best customer service standards you are ever likely to encounter".
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was shocked to find this Temple right in the middle of a modern day plaza, but we did and I was floored to see the beauty of what lies behind the facade. Now this is a functioning buddhist temple and we got lucky to see a ceremony of sorts. But if you are a female you must cover your legs and shoulders which I gladly did. They offer shawls and a wrap around skirt of sorts at the front door. My daughter who was in a tank top did not need to cover up due to her young age. This temple is beautiful and amazing and mystical... mystical you ask, yes it supposedly houses the Tooth relic which is believed to ward off evil. You can just feel the energy in the air.... so beautiful
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Busy road with lots of shopping options
REVIEW_BODY: Our hotel was situated on Orchard road. Lot's & lot's of shopping options & malls. Lots of eating options as well. Almost all major hotels situated on Orchard road.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Be prepared to spend some time to see the Gallery
REVIEW_BODY:
My first visit to the National Gallery Singapore and what a great surprise. Housed in the combined structures of the old City Hall & Supreme Court, tge building itself is worth the visit but pay the entry fee and experience the numerous galleries with collections of varied interests._x000D_
Allow at least half a day, if not more, to experience the collections and visit one of the several options for a meal. From sandwiches in one cafe to local and other delights in one of the others. Lots of choice for all budgets.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited gardens by the bay in late December when the Christmas lights were in their full glory, it was truly an amazing experience. We travelled to the gardens using the MRT Bayview was the closest station it is then quiet a long walk to the gardens by the bay exit a short walk from the exit is the ticket office where you can buy entrance to the plant houses, it costs $28 an adult for the pair also you can buy for $3 an on off shuttle bus you can travel as many times as you want well worth the cost it saves your legs for far better things especially some relief from the heat. There is also a children`s park bring shorts and a towel the kids can have a run round the water fountains and sprinklers my grand daughter had a ball. there is also satay by the bay another walk 10 min. along the river where there is a food hawkers market it was very busy when we were there but the food was very good with plenty of choice._x000D_
The light and music show near the giant trees is very good and well put together. We never had time to visit the plant houses this time so I cannot pass comment but what we saw was fantastic and well worth a visit you will definitely need more than the 5 hours we spent there to do the place justice. We are back again this year and do the things we missed on our last trip
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
My partner and I and her sister and her partner came to the night safari the day after going to the zoo... I preferred the zoo at night as the main animals come to life at night, so thereâ€™s a bit more action going on._x000D_
_x000D_
Now to the nitty gritty part of the experience. Firstly you have to book a time you want to attend but I really think that doesnâ€™t matter as itâ€™s a mad house when you actually turn up on the night. There are massive lines to get on the trams, so you could be waiting a long time... The best thing I recommend to do is walk to the feeding as by the time you get on the tram youâ€™ll probably miss it. So get there nice and early and go to the feedings and thereâ€™s also other shows on that we missed as they were all booked out by the time you got on the tram and back again._x000D_
So my best advice is find out the feeding times, go to those, go to the shows and then jump on the tram. All in all still a good experience.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Make sure you visit in the early evening so you can appreciate the structures before and after it gets dark. Great vision by the city of Singapore. These are amazing and once they light up at night it's terrific. Bring the camera and some bug spray. Great family activity.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wow this is huge with awesome views.
REVIEW_BODY:
Went on this and couldn't believe how big it is. Was a very quiet afternoon so only my hubby and myself on it which was great. Was lovely with awesome views . I did get bored after a while as it took a while._x000D_
Great thing to do while in Singapore
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Another must in Singapore is the cable car ride. The view is like no other, and it allows you to appreciate this splendid city. There are three routes, and I encourage you to take all of them!
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We tried it this morning as the weather was good and there was no line up. It was quiet actually, just the perfect time. It takes only 30 minutes but the view is great.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to meet, wander about or grab a bite to eat. Beautiful outlook. Be sure to get on a riverboat and view the laser-light show each night
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A very nice place to visit in the evening
REVIEW_BODY:
We went there at dusk, therefore we can see both the day and night views of the grove._x000D_
_x000D_
I would say the night view is very striking with all the trees powered with lights._x000D_
_x000D_
Many tourist visit this place as well as the locals jogging around.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Such an beautiful place and so typically Singapore. Head up to the cloud walk and make your way down from the top if you are okay with heights. We went on a Sunday evening and it was quite busy but still worth it. Plenty of places to wander around in the gardens when you are done.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Cloud Forest Excellent - visited by day and night
REVIEW_BODY: Cloud Garden was Excellent we were in there for the misting which gave some good pics. Spent time in the gardens. A couple of days latter we visited in the evening for the SuperTree light / sound show - that was very good, the main gardens were very different in the evening worth the 2 visits.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: For a relaxing walk and a spot of fishing in the centre of Singapore this is lovely. Get your fishing gear on Beach Road and head over to chat with the locals. Bring and hat and sunscreen and some water. Great for nature and animal spotting. Just watch out for the flying golf-balls.
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the â€œmust seeâ€ places in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: A wonderful journey through two pavilions filled with beautiful flowers, plants and waterfalls. Well worth the cost of entry. Also a magical place at night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was expecting more animals but most of what I can see were different kind of monkeys....way too many monkeys...my kids enjoyed the kids world though...
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the Gardens on a hot and humid day and enjoyed the beautiful and serene environment. A must-do when in a Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Decent gardens for early morning exercise or walking. Did start to get real busy after 11am, once tourists started to arrive.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is near National Museum. You will find the sign when you exit the museum. The park is known for the place where british surrendered to japanese.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The most peaceful and technologically advanced park in the world
REVIEW_BODY: From the supertree groves which had a stunning bridge with views of the city to the flower and cloud domes with stunning scenes about earth, gardens by the bay is the best attraction and place to spend time of all Singapore. It has wide walkways with paths going through amazing scenes of tropical plants as well as incredible wides of the city with the lake surrounding the gardens. It is also a good idea to take a break after the long walks in one of the many cafes or go to the flower dome or the cloud dome with a ticket to see the most amazing vegetation this world has to offer.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Rain Forest was a MUST SEE. The Zoo is awesome, but River Safari, Amazon Cruise, and Night Safari were less so.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing Views over City of Singapore and the Harbour!
REVIEW_BODY: I was so worried as I am usually getting sick of heights, but I really wanted to see Singapore from the top. It goes very slow, I didn't really feel much moving, no swinging or anything. We were lucky, it was a Tuesday, early afternoon. There was no long waiting, approx. 5-10 min., Ticket cost 33.00 SGD p.Adult, takes around 30min. We were 7 person together in one cabin. We didn't book in advance because we wanted to wait for a day with clear skies. As Singapore has a tropic climate, the weather can change easily and start raining. It was a great experience. Amazing views. Definatly a must do!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Bigger than the London eye, great views. We went at night and the light show was going on down at the bay (8 and 9 p.m.) Very pleasant way to see the city.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: So much thought and hard work has created this beautiful place. A lovely peaceful setting so you can wander round and appreciate the varieties from around the world. Amazing to think that if we donâ€™t do something soon a lot of these plants will be extinct in their natural habitat. Thought provoking
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great collection of orchids displayed in the best possible way. Some renovation is ongoing but will enhance these features greatly. Many celebrities named orchids are on display like those named after Margaret Thatcher, Princess Diana, various presidents and Kings. Great to get close to the best orchids and new hybrids too.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent half a day at the bird park. Although I'd purchased tickets online (to avoid the queues), I still had to queue at a ticket window to get the actual ticket???! WTF? Once we got in, mu blood pressure went down as we sought out the many & varied bird species. Easy to spend longer there, esp with children in tow. Gift shop is expensive (of course).
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Incredible that such a wonderful park is free! OK some of the internal attractions are not but well worth their price anyway. The environment is so relaxing, so well kept, cleam, peaceful.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you have a late flight fill in your late morning to mid afternoon here. it is amazing and well worth it. If you travel Singapore airlines you will get a reduced admission rate, take your boarding pass...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must if you enjoy heights...and even if you donâ€™t, this is a wonderful way to get a birds eye view of Singapore. Take in the busy shipping lanes, the various city sights, all from the comfort and silent travel.screens located in the pod display the various attraction. Staff are very helpful and ensure the pods are not overloaded. Donâ€™t miss this treat.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Itâ€™s a very good place to have a great view of Marina Bay Sand. You can have beautiful shots when youâ€™re up there on those super trees.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best place for a 2 year old to run around
REVIEW_BODY:
We took a taxi from Singapore city (was around $20-25 and took around 20-25min)_x000D_
_x000D_
We went early and did the zoo breakfast. Book early and request a table near were the orangutans sit. Breakfast was pricey but there was a great selection of food. Make sure you get there early as it can get pretty busy and gives you time to eat your food then line up to see/get photo taken with the orangutans._x000D_
_x000D_
Get a program for the zoo so you can see the animal shows. We only did the elephant one, which was ok._x000D_
_x000D_
Our little boy loved it! He ran around the zoo for 4 hours!_x000D_
_x000D_
I would recommend not booking a tour from your hotel. It's cheaper and easier to get a taxi there and buy your tickets at the zoo and book/reserve your breakfast over the zoo website. Plus a tour usually gives you a time limit. they drop you off at 9am and pick you up at 12. That's not enough time to see everything. Getting a taxi means, when your toddler has decided he's had enough you can leave when you want._x000D_
_x000D_
Also recommend going at Non peak times (not school holidays or weekends) we went on a Tuesday and it wasn't crowded.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Cool visit if you have an hour left to spend
REVIEW_BODY: It's well laid out and beautifully made, a nice spiral walk from the 'moutain' in a comfortable climate
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I visited this two years ago with teen no 1 so was pretty familiar with the displays but was still incredibly moved visiting a second time with teen number 2._x000D_
_x000D_
It was interesting just watching him move at his own speed.. He (15) is not normally big on reading museum information boxes, he just tends to move at a fairly rapid pace through museums, stopping at whatever catches his eye however he read pretty much every display box and was quite quiet and reserved afterwards. I could tell he was just processing it and needed time to take it all in, even though he did have a basic understanding of the story before going . The Individual tales moved him._x000D_
_x000D_
This is a must see for anyone interested in war history and certainly for any Australians because of the strong link to our war story. Its a bit tricky to get out there so we took a taxi to get there and then bus and metro home.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One can easily mesmerised by the view from the top sky garden on the Marina Bay Sands Skypark. As the name entails, the view comes with a price of $20 per entrance. Worth the visit.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lot of people meeting at that area itâ€™s good viewing and some of graduations Student come to take photos as the merlion of the city there to have luck and strengths .
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A great place to take the kids so they can shop for cheap gifts and toys. The whole place has a wonderful atmosphere especially when the sun goes down and all the markets light up._x000D_
_x000D_
I would recommend eating in one of the many restaurants on the mall. The delicious smells of fresh food being cooked, families sitting around sharing meals and chatting make the place so much fun.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: the best veggie food in Chinatown and the cheapest
REVIEW_BODY: Always fresh and great tasting food. All vegetarian but so good even a meat eater would be content. One of my favourite places.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: An amazing place I hope endures!
REVIEW_BODY: A unique place that my hotel happened to be right next to! The food is amazing and there is tons of shopping to do. Modest dress is a must in general but especially if visiting temples. People are nice and will help with directions!
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Better than the London eye - and cheaper and bigger!!
REVIEW_BODY: Good views of the harbour and downtown Singapore. Air conditioned pods. Get there before ten to avoid queues. Staff helpful, price reasonable.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This Mosque is located close to Haji Lane and Arab Street offering many shops and eateries...plus photo ops. I was not able to go inside the mosque but walked all the way around to get pictures from all angles. It truly is beautiful.
ADDRESS: 3 Muscat Street Masjid Sultan, Singapore 198833, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a great place to visit. They have tram services inside and also it is completely mind blowing. Good artificial waterfalls that makes you relaxed
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a must see place in Singapor offering 360* degrees views towards the city and harbour. Highly recommended.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Another typically Singaporean display. Absolutely amazing. I truly found it fascinating. Where do i look first. Brillant
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
She was very existing about this area as because this is a place for female shopping. We reached here early morning & wanted to be the 1st customer of a shop on that day (à¦¬à¦¨à¦¿ à¦•à¦¾à¦¸à§à¦¤à¦®à¦¾à¦°)._x000D_
Very colorful shops full of woman cloths, dress of various design & fabric types, ornaments._x000D_
And the food shops though they are a little bit costly. We wished to try the â€˜selfie coffeeâ€™ shop, but didnâ€™t able to find it ïŒ_x000D_
Many Malaysian shop keepers helped us to try their products; but they always stay at their fixed price._x000D_
_x000D_
May be we have to visit again & again this are for HER interest â€¦
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Tickets were purchased on line. ( so we didn't have to join the very long queues to buy tickets on the day, especially as most people were taking the CC straight to Sentosa). We bought a round trip from Singapore/ Mt Faber/ Sentosa/Singapore._x000D_
Awesome views on the way up to Mt Fabre. Took time out at the top in a cafe called Spuds and Aprons and enjoyed magnificent views from an edge seat. Took the CC down, and just stayed on the car as it went back down through Singapore, on its way to Sentosa. A great way to get a birds eye perspective of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's a different feeling to ride over a city, a bay n through a building. Nice way to enter sentosa. Take a ride from Faber hill to enjoy the entire ride.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Whilst we didn't pay to go up to the skypark $23, we had full buffet breakfast at spargo which is at the top of the second tower at $44. Great deal!! Plus the views. You can also go up to the top of tower 1 for free as there is a small viewing area for a happy snap.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are just beautiful. You do have to walk a bit to get to the trees so wear comfy shoes. Bring a selfie stick too as you will take a lot of pictures
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An absolute must do! Make sure you visit both this and the Cloud tower as they are both impressive! In this one, you will be marvelled by all the gorgeous varieties of flowers.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place has potential but has ageing infrastructure, is overpriced and very smelly. An abundance of birds but whole flocks of too many of one kind. The penguins are hard to see through dirty glass and most birds are behind thick wire mesh which is hard to see through. The extra costing tram only has 3 stops so not user friendly and should be included in cost of ticket. The highlight of visit is bird show but only shows are 11 and 3 and 4 hours at park is just too long to stay. There is a senior rate which at $13 is reasonable but they only give it to LOCALS...SENIOR IS SENIOR NO MATTER WHERE YOU COME FROM....
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Supertree Grove is great to wander in. The trees are magnificent, particularly at night when they are lit up.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great experience. Good to visit both by day and night. The trip up the top of super tree is a decent view but not the best skyline view in Singapore. The cloud forest dome is amazing and the better of the two domes.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: More than a sculpture! Don't miss the views
REVIEW_BODY:
Tip: try to plan your trip to the Merlion Park with your visit to Marina Bay, they are within walking distance and can be enjoyed as a whole._x000D_
_x000D_
The Merlion Park is one than a sculpture of the Merlion which in itself is magnificent and iconic. Take the time to enjoy the surrounding views as well especially Marina Bay and Marina Bay Sands right across. These views are especially breath taking at night with the Merlion elegantly lighted up. Think about this, just a little over 4 decades ago, when the Merlion was erected, there was no Marina Bay as it exists today, no tall skyscrapers behind, where Marina Bay Sands now stand was just reclaimed land. The Merlion would be proud of the progress it sees over time which is now made available for all to enjoy._x000D_
_x000D_
If you can spend an afternoon to an evening at Marina Bay, start at the Helix Bridge and walk towards Marina Bay Sands, then keep walking all the way to the Merlion Park, it will be one of the most unforgettable and enjoyable strolls you will ever have. Plenty of photo opportunities.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a lovely zoo. Lots of great exhibits, easy to walk around and a very picturesque part of Singapore. We did the orangutan breakfast and it was great to see those animals up close. Only disappointments were that we had trouble getting a table at breakfast (even though we had paid) and the poor polar bear looked very old and frail (especially after the great polar bears we had seen in the Copenhagen Zoo).
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I enjoyed my stay in Garden by the Bay and climb to Supertree by stairs, was a good exercise. Walking in the platform itÂ´s an amazing experience, taking pictures, the Lion dance during CNY. DonÂ´t forget to walk in the gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Unfortunately man made attractions can't compete with nature
REVIEW_BODY: It was ok..maybe we didnt get the hype seeing as we live in the tropics with waterfalls and rainforests so I guess if you live in a city then this is a chance to experience that. It was nice escaping the city to see all the greenery and the aircon inside us a welcome relief.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We stopped outside one of the Temples & were amazed by the colourful decor. There is so much to see in china town-lots of stalls selling local crafts & of course lots of delicious food stalls & restaurants. My partner got a silk made to measure shirt for 50 dollars!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
...Visited Botanic Gardens(,UNESCO World Heritage Garden a) when I was in school.._x000D_
Finally we visited this year in Dec ..the park is easily accessible by MRT(train) on Circle line,just alight at Botanic Garden station.Garden has many old and majestic trees.There are 2 or 3 cafes in the garden.Lovely place to relax and have coffee or tea.There is also Orchid Garden ,and a shop whereby you can buy orchid designed shirts,and also cute sovenirs from Singapore..You get to see squirrels too..:))) Well maintained Park!! Good place to escape from the city.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Only seen half of it but alredy enthusiastic
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful, expansive botanical gardens we've been around half of it and already love it. It's more like a park and there's so much space that it never feels over-crowded. Will go back there, and again, to see the rest. Free entrance!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited the Supertree Grove on our first night in Singapore as we were very excited to see this sight! it is a set of 'Trees' which have plants growing up the 'Trunks' a very ecological installation._x000D_
_x000D_
You alight at the MRT stop 'Bayfront' to get here and it is a short walk to the grove itself. Bayfront is right underneath the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and Skypark- if you want to visit here at the same time (Or later.)_x000D_
_x000D_
you can see the Trees from a viewpoint right near the Bayfront exit before you walk down, also._x000D_
_x000D_
We arrived at the Grove just as the evening light show was about to start (7:45pm) and the theme was Star Wars. I guess the themes change, but I am not sure how regularly._x000D_
_x000D_
This was fab as we love Star Wars. Lights and sounds (Star wars music in this case) were played in time with the light show. Which was fascinating to watch and a lot of fun. It lasts for around 15 minutes and you can stand below or sit nearby and enjoy the show._x000D_
_x000D_
There are small stalls to get drinks and ice cream nearby that ring bells to attract attention before and after shows._x000D_
_x000D_
You can also visit the restaurant which is at the top of the main Supertree. and do the path between the trees- named the OCBC Skyway as this is the sponsor. This is $8 SGD and closes early evening (around 17:30pm when we were there.)_x000D_
_x000D_
We didn't do this as we had planned to visit Marina Bay Skypark later in the trip; which is the highest view of the city._x000D_
_x000D_
Recommend this sight, it is different and very beautiful, both night and day.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Wonderful experience of what can be done with flowers, ranging from the dreamy and sweet to the eclectic and space-agey._x000D_
_x000D_
Orchids lovers will have a wonderful time with the blooms currently on display at the Flower Dome. These range from huge blooms to tiny miniatures of all colours._x000D_
_x000D_
Catch the festival before it ends on the 31 July.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was such a peaceful area to regenerate among all the lovely displays. The sculptures were amazing. Easy to spend an hour walking thru here. So pleased I spent the money to visit both this and the cloud.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We wandered round here and there were loads of different eating places, but didn't feel it was very authentic.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: We only did the free sections and still loved it.
REVIEW_BODY: We spent a couple of hours walking around the different areas of the Garden by the Bay. We skipped the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest as we were a bit short on time as well as did not want to pay $28 SGD per person for those attractions.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited early evening when it was light and stayed until after the light show when it was ark. It was great to see the place in day light and how it changes with all the lights in the night time is amazing and highly recommended. The light show at night is also great and very enjoyable. As you can imagine though the place is popular with locals and tourists so expect there to be crowds
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited here and have never seen so many different types of Orchids growing in the gardens it is beautiful You can spend many hours looking at the display A few examples are in the photographs attached
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful area with lots to do
REVIEW_BODY:
The marina Bay Area us great for shopping and eating._x000D_
The area has water taxis that cabin take you for a ride around the bay._x000D_
The theatre is also situated on the bat hosting various shows,_x000D_
A superb photo opportunity for everyone around this area in the day and at night
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A real pleasure for a few hours. Not something that you will see everywhere. Was very pleasantly surprised having been to other botanical gardens. Very well done.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful, spectacularly designed garden. The walks, ponds (check out Swan Lake, ) orchids, trees - all of it beautiful and redolent. It was a crazy hot day and we saw signs for the cold room (actually about the plants, not the people, but welcome nonetheless.) Sculptures worth seeing throughout. Fragrant and revitalizing. Decent restaurant in the gardens too. Totally worthwhile. Enjoy.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We had come on the Monday and the cloud was closed so managed to pop back._x000D_
It was well worth the trip as this place has a real space age feel to it!_x000D_
As we had dinner in between the two dimes the evening was drawn in and the place had a fantasy look with the lights from around marina bay._x000D_
_x000D_
Take the car shuttle to save your legs!_x000D_
_x000D_
Supatrees lights show was awesome too
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We walked quite a lot at this place though the place was quite crowded. We visited the place in the early afternoon and left the place late in the evening. The view in the evening was worth it. Overall a good experience.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A very beautiful quiet place in the heart of the city. Like any other park in Singapore,Fort Canning Park, is the place for strolling jogging and cycling around with fresh air. It used to be a fortress and bunker in World War II. It's convenient located in Southeast of Singapore. The highlights include underground crossing to the park is covered with shady of many trees.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great space to enjoy by day or night, really love the evening light and music show, just another free thing that make Singapore a great place to visit
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I couldnâ€™t stop taking photos the entire time I wandered through. So many different varieties in many different colors and sizes. They garden was incredibly well maintained and you could see more work going on to make it even better (but that did not hamper my experience). Very much worth the money.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My visit to the Singapore Botanical Gardens just happened to be a night with a performance by the Singapore Philharmonic Orchestra. Families and children very orderly and listening to the amazing sounds from the gem of the country. I continued my visit and walked every manicured corner of the gardens. Everyone coming to Singapore must visit!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Flower Dome is constantly refreshed with unique flowers from overseas e.g. tulips, sakura, dahlias, orchids. Very picturesque place and perfect for a date - a garden in an air-conditioned environment. You get the best of both worlds.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore Zoo is really worth seeing. One should have the stamina to walk. There are carriages in some places. Some of the animals are rare. One should not miss the long nose monkey, the polar bear and the penguins. The water elephant is also a rare sight. On the whole a great experience
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited with my family during Christmas break can didnâ€™t really enjoy the safari was it was too crowded. Tram ride was fine but the rest of the shows and line to get to it was just ridiculous. Would suggest to control the crowd in future so visitors can enjoy the safari
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: actually it is modified by the Singapore zoo at daytime. Therefore when I visited the zoo at day time and ride by tram at night, I feel not much amazing. The arrangement is not good, sometimes the staff cannot give clear instructions. The environment is very dark so it is hard to see animals. The show is good. It promoted environment protection.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore
