REVIEW_BODY: Family visit and we adored this place. Give yourself plenty of time and do stay for dusk and see the domes light up.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Thereâ€™s have so many restaurants and looking to city ðŸŒƒ you have to take so many pictures there I recommend to visiting there!
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Was lucky to see the tulipsmania. Very beautiful. Did not expect to see so many varieties. A lovely place to spend time
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The light show at Gardens by the Bay is shown twice each night and well worth a look. Not too crowded and a few vantage points to see from. Plenty of taxis to take you on for dinner or back to your hotel after the show is over.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Take time and wander and explore everything this location has to offer. There is no point typing loads of narrative - just go and love it! What a joy with access to the Metro too. Simply stunning day & night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great attraction and I always try to learn the history of the countries I visit. Especially ex-colonies. This museum certainly didn't dissappoint
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Be sure to visit this area during your stay in Singapore. There are all the big brand names and lots of glitz. On the day I visited, there was a line to get into the Chanel boutique with an attendant letting a few people at a time in. But, there is a mall off to the side where you can find some of the cheapest goods ever. Cash only!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The little museum is one of the few places in Singapore that showcases the Peranakan heritage. I've been there twice and each time, I learnt something new. Book your visit with the owner and you will learn about the story behind each piece of heritage. A nice place for photo taking.
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Since my father-in-law spent about 6 months in the infamous Changi Prison - as a POW during WWII - this was a must see for us.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lots to do and see at Marina Bay, but best by night in my view.
REVIEW_BODY: As the sun goes down Marina Bay lights up. This is a lovely area to wonder around and enjoy. There are not nightly light shows as well as your high end shops to enjoy. It is probably one of the most westernised areas of Singapore and where you are least likely to get a local feel, but well worth a few hours at night.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A great way to spend a few hours - located in the Gardens by the Bay it really is a must - beautiful plants within a temperature controlled dome with information about, global warming, rock crystals and the climate itself._x000D_
_x000D_
Take some time to enjoy the experience
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Not as active and bustling as San Francisco Chinatown but itâ€™s still plenty big and you can still buy all the Chinese staple goods like fresh vegetables and meats, BBQ, Dim Sum, and authentic restaurants
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can find many things here for shopping while enjoying walking in this clean Chinatown You can have great Day here with great photo You are in China enjoy
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was amazing. If you want to see the Singapore skyline then this is the best view. 360 degree views and takes 30 minutes from start to finish. We did it at night and it was just so colourful. A very smooth ride.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Have been here both during the day and night and I found the night visit to be much more enjoyable. The city lights and skyline is amazing and there are a lot of people around enjoying their time. It is definitely a must see place when in Singapore.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you only have a few days in Singapore I would add this to your list of things to see we only had a few hours to visit it but you cloul spend the whole day here
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This visit at Garden by the Bay was just superb. The flower dome and cloud forest were something out of imagination. So very well arranged and beautiful.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore Zoo is a really excellent example of free roaming exhibits. It is wonderful to see Tigers swimming in their water hole. Giraffes eating their food so close. Zebras close enough to see how they interact with other animals. The oranatanges are so amazing to watch. Hippos, reptiles, penguins, lizards, etc all fabulous. Highly recommended.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lost of words ... one small country gives you the glimpse of the flora and fauna if the universe ... trees and plants you. May have never seen and at the end .. they leave a message on conservation of water - recycling of rain water .. and lastly save trees and save the planet ... its spectacular...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I am not generally a great fan of cities, but the waterfront promenade around the Singapore Harbour is so dramatic one can't help but be mesmerized by its surroundings. The elegant, sleek buildings soar into the sky with glamour and pizzazz. At night, spotlights shine from the Marina Bay Sands hotel in a dramatic display, and the lights of the buildings give a magical feel to the city. The impeccable quality of this city is highly evident from the promenade.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: great addition to the botanical gardens!
REVIEW_BODY:
the gardens by the bay are really wonderful with a large variety of plants and themes! they compliment the botanical garden well and offer a great way to spend some time in fresh air. several restaurants allow easy access to food and in particular the skywalk and the flower dome and of course the cloud forrest are fantastic._x000D_
also great view in the evening on the skyline of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A totally dry display with almost no connection to the actual POW prison
REVIEW_BODY:
Very disappointed with this museum which has been built outside the area formerly occupied by the infamous POW prison. The trip from downtown Singapore is, frankly, not worth it. You could get more information from a book. The museum is not accessible from the MRT train so it's taxi or number 2 bus._x000D_
_x000D_
Given the historical significance of the Changi POW prison, a room full of photos with descriptive text, even with the benefit of the audio guide, was really lame.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
But it's very busy. We visited and the queues are crazy. Once inside, the walking trails are great, and there are definitely a few cool exhibits (the bat enclosure stands out for me)._x000D_
_x000D_
The tram is supposed to be a great way to see more, but the queue looked like it was going to take upwards of an hour so we didn't wait. I don't think this was helped by the tram stops mostly being closed with only the one at the entrance being available on the night we visited. I think if we did this again, we'd pay for the queue jump for the trams. If you only have time for this, or the zoo, I'd say go for the zoo. It's definitely better.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The merlion itself is very cool and there are some great photo ops. This whole area is nice to walk around and we even walked across via the underpass to the Fullerton Hotel (beautiful)._x000D_
However, it is very crowded and we found the tour groups to be very rude and constantly pushing in front of us. I know they are probably on a schedule, but there is no need to be so inconsiderate. I got really sick of this and it dampened the experience._x000D_
Great views of Marina Bay Sands and a must see even with the crazy groups.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A unique garden with gigantic and beautiful tree like towers
REVIEW_BODY: Our visit here was nice. The views were great and seeing the trees and the garden up close is truly breathtaking. So if you are within the Marina area, this is a must-see location. It's great for taking photos also.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: It is worth visiting once in a while
REVIEW_BODY: It can be an eye opener for many as Singapore Zoo is the best in the world. There are many attractions to see and experience animals first hand through feeding time and the shows. I also like the awareness the trainers bring across to the audience in preserving our mother nature and the importance of it.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wanted to visit both Little India and also Chinatown and having been to Chinatown, left a little underwhelmed. The old buildings when you looked around were interesting but didnâ€™t feel the need to stay long. Perhaps we missed the best bits?
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Gardens by the Bay have 2 flower domes-the Cloud Dome is the best with waterfall & easy access elevated walkways. Supertree light show is incredible -see it twice - once from under them (to get full benefit of the music that a companies) and once from the back of Marina Bay Sands to see all trees simultaneously
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The permanent plants like the very old olive trees and other exotic trees are what make this place for me._x000D_
The seasonal flowers, like poinsettias for Christmas along with Christmas decor are rather cheesy! Its sacrilegious as Christmas IS a religious observance, reduced to nutcrackers and snow scenes? I wonder if they do that for Vesak Day or Prophet Mohammed's Birthday in this multi-religious state?_x000D_
The tulips around Easter are my favorite, but no mention is made of another religious holiday - just Spring, but they do not say where? Same with Lunar New Year! I caught the Cherry Blossoms once and that was beautiful. But other times of the year, pretty floral offerings. These special floral offerings must cost a bomb. And that must be why it's so expensive to go in._x000D_
I found all the African sculptures completely out of place._x000D_
Forgot to mention that for the Waterfall dome. Those carved dragons and all, really detract from natural beauty!_x000D_
That Cafe, Pollen is good though pricey!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Bring your thin sweater because the temperature inside is a bit cold. Like 18 C I think, It really feels like spring because of the low temperature and beautiful flowers._x000D_
If you want to save money you can buy the ticket online by your local online vendors. I bought the ticket to both Flower Dome and Cloud Dome for $20 instead of $28 if you buy right there. And with this kind of ticket you dont have to queue, because the line is different. Mostly tour guides are on this line._x000D_
After seeing how well they maintain the flowers and objects surroundings, the ticket price is totally worth it. Even the flowers outside dome are nice.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: High end shops....High end malls must visit in Singapore..... Excellent coffee and munch shops which have Street seating too
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: gr8 place to go I recommend this place coz of the flower dome and the cloud garden...don't forget your jackets, its chilly there...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best moments of our trip
REVIEW_BODY: Definitely one of the biggest highlights of our trip. The views (despite Singapore being shrouded in the haze which has blanketed much of South East Asia of late) were spectacular. Nothing more romantic or memorable than watching the sun set over Singapore, frozen Singapore Sling in hand, with your loved one and see the lights of the city glow.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Unique place for dinner or drinks
REVIEW_BODY: Definitely worth visiting for dinner or just for drinks! Great variety of restaurants (we went for indian and mexican) for every taste. You definitely can have kids there too. This is really a well hidden gem!
ADDRESS: 30 Victoria Street Chijmes, Singapore 187996, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Never seen anything like this before. Brilliant idea and brilliant architecture, it's a must do on your visit to Singapore. There is no entry fee to walk around the Supertree Grove, but it costs 8 SGD to access the Skywalk
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I love that place. Besides the fact that it reminds me when I lived in Singapore and used to run in that park, the variety of trees is extraordinary. Trees you never heard of and and feel of what Singapore may have looked liked many moons ago before people built the island._x000D_
I love the trees that were planted by Lee Kwan Yew in 1955 and more. A great feeling to be next to a legend.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A fascinating experience with children. The birds are tamed so well that you keep you smiling all along. Spend atleast 2 hours there.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not very exciting place to see exotic see birds and expensive entry fee
REVIEW_BODY: Not very exciting place to see exotic see birds. Entry fee is expensive and pay extra for a train raid around the park. Entrants not allowed to take photos with exotic birds, only if entrants have the photos taken by the park's photographer at the entrance of the park. You need to buy feeds to feed rainbow lorikeets.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was like paradise. I can't even believe that this place exists in earth. The smells of flowers were perfect. You can find any kind of information about flowers that are there. And also the water fall was also amazing. Totally everything was great.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Brilliant atmosphere in the whole area. Busy and bustling and bursting with character wherever you go. Some fantastic eating areas and plenty of shopping if thatâ€™s your thing. Otherwise just browse the area and enjoy the vibes
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spoilt for choice in Singapore, day zoo, night zoo and river safari All very high class exhibits and well cared for animals Well worth a visit
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We always see to it we visit this place every time we are in Singapore. There's so much flora and fauna to see and enjoy. Do try to spend a few hours here to get the most of what they have to offer. Come in the afternoon and catch the light show in the evening.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We had been recommended to do this but we were underwhelmed by this. The trip around the park was short and whilst we saw some animals as it was night there were some you couldnâ€™t see.Not worth the time or money.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Entry is free but you then pay for the "big" attractions such as the Cloud Forest and Tree-top walk. Top 5 activity for Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very good guided tour. A very informative piece of Singapore's WWII history and background as to why things occurred.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is MOST beautiful at night. In the centre of the super trees around 9pm everyday there is a light show with music, very very enchanting and fantastical. Romantic and children-friendly.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The buildings that surround this bay are fantastic. We eally enjoy the history of the area and the beauty of it all.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to visit and to spend your time with partner. The best night zoo we visited in the world
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: hey have a great range of animals and most of them seem to have very nice areas where they are held. I always enjoy seeing the Lions, cheetahs, pumas and Tigers. The monkeys allowed to move around freely inside the zoo are also fun to see.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Relaxing, beautiful and a city escape
REVIEW_BODY: It's a perfect escape from the city and heat. It's a beautiful and well kept park near Orchard Road and Bukit Timah so a lovely place to visit. There are often open air concerts and other events organised so keep an eye on the national park's website
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was very relaxing to walk through and take in the beautiful scenery. There is a park towards the end of the Garden where we saw flying kites and you could see the Marina Bay Sands hotel from there - good to go near sunset.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited Gardens by the bay in raining day. Although weather condition was not great but still worth go to walk around and see the show
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went up to the bar not the viewing deck at night. Very dark up there. Food, well snacks very expensive we didn't realise the wedges we ordered were $19 for a small bowl as it was so dark. Alcoholic drinks were nice but expensive as most places in Singapore. The view is amazing. It costs $23 pp to go to the viewing deck then if you have a coffee or something up there is will cost you mid $30. Better to go up to the bar for free and order a drink and enjoy a lovely night out.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Delightful gardens which are free to walk round, there is a charge for the skywalk, with themed areas based on different cultures._x000D_
_x000D_
Close to the MRT station and across the road from another shopping mall there is something for everyone and somewhere to escape the heat of the day.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We were fortunate to visit during the Garden Festive and Orchid Show. The displays in the flower dome were absolutely beautiful. We were amazed by the variety of orchids as well as the displays from various parts of the world._x000D_
The waterfall and displays in the cloud dome were well worth seeing and the Super Tree walk gave a great view over the park and surrounding skyline. There is plenty more to see at ground level. Probably best enjoyed over two visits.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one place you should not miss. Reach by evening so you can see the daylight views as well as city lit up dusk. Itâ€™s easily reachable and ticket pricing is justified. One can also see the laser show at Bayfront
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visiting Jurong bird park is a great way to spend a day in singapore. I always check out zoo's and national parks when abroad and i must say that the jurong bird park is truly unique. Very well made with a lot of different species of birds. I would recommend to firstly taking the tram to get a good feel of the place. You can hop on and hop-off several times on the tram so one doesnt have to cover the entire park on foot. As soon you enter one should find out the various timings of the shows and encounters and plan visiting the other sections accordingly. Feeding the birds at lorry loft was awesome fun!! Dont miss that. Let the birds sit on your heads, shoulders fingers etc. They are totally safe and playful. Total duration was about 3-4 hours.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you enjoy primates, this is a wonderful stop. There are many different open spaces for Gibbons, orangutans, and apes. Go early to see them in full playing form. I enjoyed a few hours walking around. It was a nice start to the days.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: definitely worth a visit - go early morning or in the late afternoon as it can get very hot whilst walking around. Comfortable shoes and a hat is recommended. The whole gardens are immaculately kept and the orchid displays are stunning.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Singapore Botanic Gardens is a national park is open daily and features beautiful lakes, animals, flowers and plants, including the National orchid garden which has 1 of the largest orchid collection in the world._x000D_
_x000D_
Admission to this park is free & open daily. Located near busy Orchard Road, this is a "must-see" for locals & tourists but wear comfortable shoes & prepare to do lots of walking.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: It's like looking down from a plane
REVIEW_BODY: This is a great view of the Marina Bay area and the coast, it gets busy up there and there is no regulation on the numbers of people and how long they can stay so to avoid the crowds, get there early they open at 0930, and because Singapore weather is not always clear. be flexible with your chosen day. @ $23 each you don't want to be in the mist, if you're staying at the hotel, it's free.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: By far the most impressive of the domes on the property. Beautiful orchids and waterfalls. A cool place to spend some time on a hot day.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is part of the 10km Southern Ridges hike. One of the highlights in fact. A nice place to take a break and have picnic in the midst of your walk._x000D_
_x000D_
Advise to either start at Hort Park and make your way up to Fort Canning through Henderson waves or the other way round. Very managable hike with great views (different as well) along the way!
ADDRESS: 221 Henderson Road Henderson Building, Singapore 159557, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful orchid display here. Would highly recommend a visit when in Singapore ðŸ‡¸ðŸ‡¬. We were visiting with a guide which was interesting.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a view over the City and especially the Bay Gardens. We thought we couldn't visit Singapore without going to the top of this iconic hotel, although you are separated from the main hotel, and we were not disappointed by the views. We bought our tickets at the tower for Â£11.20 each, which we felt was quite reasonable. Be careful at the viewing platform as if you go into the cafe you are not allowed back.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A really goodood view over Singapore and surrounding areas with English commentary. 30 SGD per adult for 30 minutes ride.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I visited Gardens by the bay recently with my family and we all loved every bit of it. And my toddler always enjoys the free light & music show in the evening there. Overall, a great place for nature lovers and for clicking some amazing pics with natural beauty!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun place even if you are not an avid shopper
REVIEW_BODY: We were staying in the Mandarin which is at the 'top' end and wandered around here several nights after dinner - lots to see and do - plenty of shops of course and not all Brand names either - some bargain basement outlets in the numerous malls - plenty of fancy restaurants but again if you look some good value food courts - there was a Disney theme over Christmas and New Year with sidewalk 'displays' for a unique picture experience - off this road is the preserved Peranakan enclave of Emerald Hill - if you are coming from elsewhere take the MRT to Somerset.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Bustling place to visit, good place to buy Singapore souvenirs etc They say fixed price but we had a wee man try to be our guide - he told us to bargain and the shopkeepers accepted this. Good advice. More expensive than Laos and Cambodia, but not too bad._x000D_
We were a bit 'marketed out'. Get out of the main tourist area to eat, as it is more expensive in the shopping area. Pop up and see the Hindu temple. MRT takes you to the heart of Chinatown...easy!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore Botanical Gardens are magnificent. So many works of art nature has to offer. The Gardens staff keep the facility spotless and clean. And of course we'll trimmed. So many countless works of art produced by nature.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: EXTREMELY mixed experience - great architecture and horticulture, but horrible entertainment atmosphere
REVIEW_BODY:
Went to see this masterpiece of horticulture combined with novel architecture and landscaping. Truely marvelous feat especially the cloud forest dome - giant artificial trees also very interesting. And everywhere beautiful flowers and greenery. BUT and it is a very big BUT - the asmosphere is 100% like an amusement park - piped music in loud speakes in the flower dome? How tacky can you make it. Carved wooden eagles and other animals suddenly protuding from an otherwise impeccably made flowerdisplay or brilliantly sculptured wall of greenery. Again the way this place as suddenly been turned into an entertainment venue is truely tasteless. And to top it off - some of the most horrific CHistmas displays including a cinderrella snow landscape in the middle of of the Baobab and catus displays._x000D_
_x000D_
Go for the Botanical gardens if you have even an ounce of good taste - otherwise you will be sorely disappointed here.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went to see the Star Wars lights at gardens on the bay and it was amazing. Would suggest going and checking it out. Worth it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Went several times on several different occasions. In my personal opinion, if you're a tourist coming to visit Singapore for the first time, Botanic Garden might not interest you much since there are many other more popular tourist attractions out there to visit._x000D_
But if you're a frequent visitor looking for a nearby place for a leisurely walk or picnic in the evenings surrounded by greeneries, then this is definitely the place for you._x000D_
_x000D_
The white gazebo there was a great place to take pictures as well. Many couples do their pre-wedding shoots here.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Interesting - both for locals and visitors
REVIEW_BODY:
This is a lovely museum in which there is so much to see. It's got a lovely 'walk through the ages' type of exposition about Singapore. So much to learn and see and all very nicely done._x000D_
Once you have purchased tickets, you can choose to be taken round by a guide (free of charge- they are all highly trained volunteers), or stroll around by yourself, at your own pace._x000D_
A great place for all ages._x000D_
There is a cafe inside which sells delicious cakes - but if you walk round the corner there is a Janice Wong cafe for chocolate lovers (also very tasty lunch menu!).
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We decided ti visit Chinatown as part of the hop on hop off bus tour. Good to visit and very busy. We had lunch which arrived very quickly and was very good. Quite expensive but everything is in Singapore.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore is called Garden City for a good reason. Just visit the Gardens by the Bay and you will understand why. The place is wonderful on a fine weather day but try staying inside the two enormous flower dome (can fit quite a few football field) on a rainy thunderous day and experience the serenity inside it why all hell break loose outside. Unforgettable.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best zoo in Asia
REVIEW_BODY: Went with my nephew, the zoo is huge with lots of different species of animals and we love the open area allows Orangutans climb around. Definitely one of the must-go attractions in Singapore if you visit with children (also rive safari is another good option)
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent. A must do if visiting Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY:
Worth visiting during watering/mist times - the cool as you enter is amazing._x000D_
Long queues to get tickets._x000D_
It's not on the brochure, but foreign visitors can buy a single entry ticket - do that and just visit the Orchids, the other garden doesn't look nearly as interesting._x000D_
The Orchids and gardens are amazing. Take your time and enjoy it - most seem to rush through._x000D_
A must do!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Not cheap but something we wanted to do during our stopover in Singapore. We had a pod all to ourselves. The 'journey' takes around 30 minutes and the views are awesome over the city, the harbour, the barrage and beyond to the shipping lanes. It's a must do.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We enjoyed the light works display. The river cruise is a simple show off the Singapore River and learn how the conservation works to restore the clean water. Evening time is the best time for the river cruise.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I came here with my 2 y.o child and took Raffles Place MRT station as our destination from Bugis.. Because we brought stroller, we looked for lift.. From lift exit, it was very very hard to find where this place's location.. I found nothing about direction.. So I had to ask some people.._x000D_
_x000D_
After getting direction, we also have to walk about 15 mins to reach this place.. Again, there were no clear information about this location.. We depended on asking people.._x000D_
_x000D_
This place is a Singapore's icon.. It's a good place to get some photos.. This place seems to be crowded all the day.. Just find the best spot to take your pictures.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Needs time to really take everything in - amazing collection of plantings - loved Swan Lake and the orchid collection...
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a visit. Also there are lots of other things around the area so wouldn't have to be a special trip. Great light and music show in the evening as well.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A lovely area to stroll around, nice bars and restaurants and also Harryâ€™s Bar where Liam Neeson allegedly liked to frequent. You can cross both Elgin and Cavenaugh bridges on the way round and there are some interesting statues depicting some historical stories.
ADDRESS: 1 Bonham Street Uob Building, Singapore 049782, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing day out,everything is so organised at the venue and extremely clean we really enjoyed the laser show
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic visit and suitable for all!
REVIEW_BODY: I have been here before and it is certainly a must see when in Singapore. Inside you will find an amazing garden and climate control, meaning you may even need a cover up as it got pretty cold for me inside. There is no place in the world like it!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Without question, the most beautiful gardens in the world, and I travel a lot. World Heritage Site and a Must See._x000D_
_x000D_
MRT access is easy and get there early as there's a lot to take in. If your still adjusting to the Sg weather, take your time, bring a water bottle [use the refill stations] and have lunch. The food is great. Recommend the salmon sandwich and chips [enough for two]. My favorite spots were the orchid and prehistoric gardens. The evening concerts are also special. Check their schedule for days and times.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic view of the Merlion, Casino & various waterfront structures... great place to have a coffee & chill by the river to watch the world go by...
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We really enjoyed walking around these gardens and found them to be well worth a visit. Having seen them on Blue Planet 2 it was really nice to see them "live" and the gardens will develop into an even more amazing park in years to come. Well recommended!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: very large, you will see so many different tropical plants. it's well managed. we also saw some water monitors which were pretty cool. wear comfy shoes and enjoy it! can be pretty warm though.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: good during day time, able to oversee the view of singapore. yet to try out night with the lightings.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We came here as an extension of our Sentosa Island visit and it is worth paying extra for. There is a restaurant if you want to eat there but we came and went quickly.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Cool exhibits, but I prefer the Zoo and Night Safari
REVIEW_BODY:
The River Safari houses a huge variety of wildlife that you would not see in a typical zoo, from prehistoric types like sturgeons to the mesmerizing manatees to what were undoubtedly the star of the park, the pandas._x000D_
_x000D_
Unfortunately those were the few highlights for me as I am not terribly fond of fishes (and trust me, there were loads of them). The river cruise was calm and relaxing but was essentially a ride in a reservoir, while the Amazon River Quest boat ride was cool but finished way too quickly for the extra money paid._x000D_
_x000D_
Another downside of the park is the lack of affordable & tasty food options._x000D_
_x000D_
Both the zoo and night safari are better value, in my opinion.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the iconic place in SINGAPORE for visitors, who like a feel of INDIA. The streets are full of Indian fares and eateries. The famous department store, MUSTAFA, is located near the end of Little India towards the City Square. Before the control of Alcohol sales, the place would be packed in the evenings/nights on weekend. It is more quieter now. There is a wet market near the other end of Serangoon Road towards Sim Lim towers. There are again many food stores selling all types of Indian food. Some Asian food are also available here. Do visit and have a taste of Little India !!!
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went here on a rainy day so went to the bar instead of viewing platform. Still an amazing view. And around same price but with a drink. An amazing building with so much to see
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Itâ€™s beautiful, imaginative and itâ€™s different from anything weâ€™ve seen before. And if that werenâ€™t enough, itâ€™s delightfully cool, a great place to escape Singaporeâ€™s heat! Loved the walkways above it all surrounded by beautiful plants and great views. It reminded us of something you might find in Disneyworld. Very well done.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good Place for Family with Small Kids
REVIEW_BODY: Me, my wife and my 3 year old son had a blast at Singapore zoo. There are a lot of animals to see and several shows to watch. There's just a lot of walking involved but there is a tram if you want to go around the zoo. Great place to visit in Singapore!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We entered the Cloud Dome right on 2pm when they did the misting (every two hours). It was 34C outside and temperature inside was bout 10 degrees cooler. What a spectacular place. The range of plants is amazing and as an Orchid lover, I was in heaven.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good for shopping, not so great otherwise
REVIEW_BODY: There is every kind of shopping on Orchard Road. It seems like there's either very cheap food or very, very expensive food.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: stunning place. been there with friends and we enjoyed every minute of it. the place is cool and interesting and close to many different attractions.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
An interesting and rewarding experience. You should go into the sunset as the most beautiful._x000D_
You can go there by MRT, get off at Promenade station, walk about 500m to arrive. On the way you will see a cabin identical to the cabins on the Flyer on the ground decorated as a banquet room_x000D_
I bought ticket online is cheaper: Adult 36$ SG. Child 26$ SG
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Iâ€™ve been here just walking through the park, on Sunday, during a business trip. This place is perfectly taken care of. Well organized, and clean. Although there is a lot of people visiting, it is a quiet place. Must see it.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit to Gardens by the Bay , Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Beautifully landscaped gardens but a little overhyped in terms of must-see attractions. They look much better in the night with the lights on, but in the day, it's just another nicely done garden.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is a wonderful place for a walk. It is very well designed and is a lovely place for a stoll. It is very nice a night when it is cooler and it is lit up.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An unexpected joy! We began with the trolly ride around the Gardens, which was well worthwhile and put all the areas in context. It is a large complex, the weather hot and the commentary was very interesting. All the gardens are well, cared for and planted with imagination and flair. The sculptures were many and varied throughout the gardens. We visited Cloud Dome and The Flower Dome ...again beautifully created and well worth seeing. Donâ€™t miss any of this!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This Supertree is located near the entrance of the gardens by the bay. This area still free for public. The interesting is when night time this tree will full of lights and very nice to be a backgroud for taking picture
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Pleasant and a nice place to wander but not terribly exciting or interesting. Good to see it has UNESCO heritage listing though. And I was interested to learn (elsewhere), that an earlier iteration of it on Government Hill was started by Raffles to investigate viable crops for the region. It was instrumental in developing a viable rubber industry.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Night tour included the giant treesâ€™ show
REVIEW_BODY: Took a night tour that brought us to the â€˜Avatarâ€™ trees light and music show. It was retro night and the music was excellent. My son and I loved the tunes including â€˜Saturday Night Feverâ€™ and Abba songs. It was not as crowded due to the rain so we had prime viewing. Do be ready for people unaware and who wander into your video taping area. We didnâ€™t have time to explore the Walkways linking the trees but it looked fun. The Garden Rhapsody light and sound show is a definite must visit and if you have time the flower dome and cloud forest look like good places to visit as well. The trees mimic live trees in that they have technology which allows them to convert sunlight into energy and collect rainwater. There is also a restaurant at the top of the tallest tree but we never made it there. Overall a great place to visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Close to the centre of the City of Singapore, but right out in the jungle. Great walk to see monkeys and other animals as well as beatiful local trees and plants. It will take about 3 hours and a lot of sweating, so bring enough water.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Along with Gardens By The Bay the Singapore Botanical Garden which also incorporates the National Orchid Gardens is a MUST SEE when in Singapore. The Botanical Gardens is free to walk around but the Orchid Garden only cost S$5 - well worth a visit . They are constantly replanting different types / colours of orchids.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Family visit - long way from Singapore city
REVIEW_BODY: Good time pass for 2 to 3 hours. Highlight was the aviary, parrot park and the shows were good. Visit it either in the morning or in the evening as the birds will be resting or tired in the hot times. It was slightly monotonous towards the end as same birds were repeated in different cages. The trams were a well thought out idea, especially for the elders and those with small children, but to discover the park thoroughly, it is best to go about it on foot. All in all, it's an entertaining attraction for those who love nature and are curious about birds.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I did not know I would see that many plants within a small area, they have every single kind of flower/plant you could imagine. A fun afternoon
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A little Garden Wonder of the World in the City at at Gardens by the Bay, 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953.
REVIEW_BODY: One can find and enjoy the wonder of a great garden right in the city state of Singapore. It's so convenient to reach the destination either by taxi or MRT train.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It appears to be as the coolest jungle ever. It is a Singapore postcard for a reason. That is definetly the best garden man built.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Flowers and plants of different colours and designs adorn this attraction...Too beautiful to miss...Loved the variety.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We paid for the cloud gardens and this was ok but over-priced. The must-do are the outdoor gardens which are stunning especially on a hot night after a long flight
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Singapore Flyer liike the London Eye is worth a visit for a first time visitor.
REVIEW_BODY:
Went on the Singapore Flyer with friends & family and it was quite enjoyable. Do it if you have the time since it takes a good 15-20 minutes apart from taking the tickets._x000D_
The flyer gives you a 360 degree view over Singapore skyline and you can have a panoramic view of the city . they also offer special ocassion visits with F & B arrangements as well. Specially recommended for Honeymooners and young couples.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: If you like orchids this is a must
REVIEW_BODY: Next to marina bay sands very convenient. Unusual greenhouse experience. Magnificent floral displays.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The number of sunflowers less than my hair count. I was expecting to see 4metres sunflower or sunflower seeds. or sunflower oil. No sunflower products available in gift shop. The ambience is good. It isnot too crowded. The place is kept clean and tidy. Definitely worth the visit to see variety of sunflowers. The flowers look healthy and beautiful.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This giant observation wheel offers 360-degree city views, a panorama that stretches to parts of Malaysia and Indonesia on a clear day._x000D_
_x000D_
The whole of singapore is great to look in the evening.Don't miss this ride.Its also awesome to look from such an altitude.Wow experience for me!!!!!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Took my godchildren to the Night Safari. It is one of their favourite places to visit during the school holidays. Grandparents always came along and they love it too. So if you are visiting, I suggest not on a day that threatens to rain and avoid public and school holidays. Check beforehand if there are any promotions. Really good for animal lovers and those who lovely touring about in the night. A must visit.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Children of all ages will love this park. I especially like the lory feeding programme whereby you can buy cups of nectar to feed to the lories at the open air aviary. However, the 1/4 cup of nectar is quite expensive at $3 but its towards conservation purposes. My daughter was absolutely fascinated by the sight of these birds feeding. Also don't miss the shows put on by the park rangers as they are quite impressive, especially the King of the Birds show. This showcases the various types of eagles and vultures found in the park._x000D_
_x000D_
I would strongly suggest buying the tram ticket (they are sold separately from the entrance tickets) as the park is situated on a hill slope. It's quite a grueling walk uphill to reach the major sections of the park. All-in-all, this is one of the best bird parks I have ever visited.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Once I got over my nervousness of going to the edge.....I loved it! Beautiful views of Singapore. Would rate this as better value than the Eye which we had done 2 days previously. Frozen Strawberry Daiquiri was just the icing on the cake ðŸ¹ðŸ¹
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful, peaceful and stunning at the same time
REVIEW_BODY:
Coming from Melbourne, I would call this place a botanical gardens on steroids. There are plenty of species to see and enjoy. The area is huge with a walking path segmented into different themed gardens. There are also two huge conservatories - rainforest and world themes. The rainforest conservatory has the most amazing orchids I have seen. Whilst I have no idea how they keep such beautiful succulent in the air conditioned world theme conservatory._x000D_
There is a tree top walk for those that are not afraid of heights. I am afraid of heights, but did the walk anyway. It is 22 metres above the ground and gets you to the tree canopy. I'm still afraid of heights after this, but glad I got through it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was magic to walk in the gardens by the bay at night. Me and my wife was walking at 00.30 a.m. To see the supertree grove shine at night is fantastic.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: My 5yr old simply loved this place
REVIEW_BODY:
Being in Singapore for many years, this was our first visit to River Safari. The climate was pleasant as it had rained the whole of previous night._x000D_
The place is full of marine life. Have been to SEA Aquarium many times (my daughter is an expert at sea creatures through books and the cartoon series Octonaughts). This place was similar in many ways and yet had some things unique._x000D_
The walk along is not taxing. If u have young children and elderly, it's very easy to take them along. The only issue we had was the restrooms. There is one at the entrance and the next one only after visiting the Panda._x000D_
I will strongly recommend this place as it's value for money. Btw don't compare this place with zoo and night safari. It's animals vs marine life._x000D_
Visit the Panda kitchen and taste the "Panda Pau" (Red bean and Chocolate Custard flavours). The Giant Panda Cappuccino is good too.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was hard to see the animals and many of them will either not visible or not present. We understand that the animals are norturnal, however when you are trying to spot animals at every exhibit, it becomes quite dreary, especially with kids.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Gardens by the Bay are pleasant enough during the day but at nighttime they really become quite magical. Don't miss the spectacle of the light & sound show at Supertree Grove (19:45 and 20:45)._x000D_
The Gardens are free of charge if you just want to wander around but admission to the two conservatories (Cloud Forest and Flower Dome) is pretty expensive. (We didn't go in.)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Modern artistic building housing various displays from time to time , check out what's on . It's sited near the Marina Bay Sands hotel and casino and is reachable by taxi or the MRT.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Quirky and unique to Singapore; you can't possibly find this anywhere else. We went on a night walking tour, which made the experience so much better. The park is free. Tour incurs additional cost, but it was awesome. There's a lot of walking, though.
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This walk on bridges in the jungle is quite pleasant. It offers views on the city. The walk is short enough but go in the morning as it gets hot in the afternoon.
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful bridge but not like DNA. Selfie or groupie area. You can see from here most impressive views of Singapore.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I actually am a bit undecided about how to review this attraction, I did like it but... it's an amazing structure and pretty cool but really it is just a huge vertical garden inside a great big dome. Pretty to look at though. If you aren't interested in gardening skip this.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
A large expanse of greenery near to Marina Bay. Entrance is free to most parts, however charges apply for the domes and the skywalk._x000D_
_x000D_
Just wander around the area and take in the plant and treelife. There are also a few sculptures dotted around including a large baby resting on one hand. There are plenty of eating places and toilet facilities as well as gift shops. One slight negative for me is that signage could be better. Will review domes and supertree grove seperately.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Such a variety of things to see and do, the skywalk through the man made trees gave a wonderful view of the gardens and the city and port. Everywhere was so clean and litter free and the facilities were able to cope with the number of visitors. The metro station is so close to the entrance it makes it easily accessible.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You must see this exhibit. Wonderful flowers and plants plus a waterfall. Great views out to the supertrees and bay.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Many empty shops... has its time passed but best satay in town!
REVIEW_BODY:
I think the best days of Chinatown are behind it. There is however one place that you must go to if you are a lover of satay. It is in the Chinatown complex which is not particularly attractive but it is vibrant despite the number of empty or closed shops._x000D_
_x000D_
You must go to stall number 168 for satay chicken. This is the reason I go via Singapore.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: From an average visitor perspective, I think it is not as many things to see as zoo. From my personal view, I enjoy it.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's a bit touristy, but it's worth it for the view. Each pod can accommodate up to 30 people. Also, there is an iPad to get more information about Singapore as well as a pre-recorded commentary!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The cabin was surprisingly large n queue wasn't that long. We had a nice time going up n down as sun set. Perfect for photos of marina bay itself
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Psychedelic Indoor Playground For The Young & Restless
REVIEW_BODY:
Yes it is a iconic architectural landmark with a catchy and deceiving name._x000D_
This lotus inspired, ingeniously named 'ArtScience Museum' is_x000D_
privately owned by the Marina Bay Sands Group, who own the casino and hotel of the same name._x000D_
Feng Shui is said to play an important hand in the design here and it literally does! Surely you can visualise the shape of a palm seemingly grasping or trying to contain something. Probably the hefty 19sgd entrance fees, LOL._x000D_
The ArtScience Museum is far from being a proper museum per say, as are the Singapore National Museum, Art Museum and Science Centre, which are the real deal. Yes, there are often free exhibitions in collaboration with who's who, that are worthy of a visit here if you so happen to be in the neighbourhood. This is just one section perhaps dedicated to the subject of Arts and Science which is free. This in turn tempts one into imagining what's to see in the paid section of the ArtScience Museum. Many assume there should be more of the same, only better. Yet it is the actual ArtScience Museum that one gets dissapointed with and anyone who reads the grouses on on TripAdvisor should know if this is really their scene._x000D_
Do not expect the ArtScience Museum to be at all like Singapore's mainstream museum. This is pretty much a OTT children's amusement centre in technicolor. Albeit, a fusion one at best. Not at all recommended for anyone above fourteen years of age._x000D_
The only adults you will find inside the ArtScience Museum is likely to fall into one of the categories below. They would be :_x000D_
1. Tourist's who believed it was Museum of Art & Science. (They would be the unhappy in expressing their views here)_x000D_
2. Extroverts on social media chasing the selfies and instagram likes. ( Because it might be raining outside or they have nothing currently worthy to post)_x000D_
3. Parents/Grandparents (myself included) who accompany the young children. (They will be looking for the true art and science section of this museum only to find none)_x000D_
It is claimed the future is created here at the ArtScience Museum, but all I felt the entire time, was like I was walking thru a long psychedelic kaleidoscope. In all fairness thou, my fourteen month old grandson enjoyed himself here immensely attracted by all the movements and colors._x000D_
Entertainment for some perhaps, but certainly not Science and if at all it is deemed as Art, it is Art without much content._x000D_
Go if a myriad of moving projected images of luminous technicolor on the floor, walls, ceilings and slides is your kinda playground. Yes, that's right, there are two slides and I betcha this is the only museum with a indoor slide in the world._x000D_
Older children who enjoy illustration can have their works projected on the walls while there and that's about as arty as it gets. Activities for the children will keep them occupied in a low light environment for some time without parents ever having to worry about sun stroke._x000D_
Do remember to bring a camera for low light photography as no flash photography is allowed. One exits by walking thru a prism of blinding bright white LED lights set against mirrors. The grand finale of harsh lights to walk thru was a Christmas overload._x000D_
Overall an entertaining time for young children. Hopefully, future playgrounds will not be as dark and mindless as this self proclaimed museum!
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Who knew Singapore housed some of the worlds most unusual plants in some of the most beautiful settings. Never miss this one.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard Road is a Heaven for shoppers. Luxury brands, all lined up right next to each other, making shopping super convenient. For others, who feel quite inadequate when just getting too close to those malls and shops, the Orchard Road in itself is nice to look at. Separating pedestrians on a super wide sidewalk from the street are tall trees that provide quite a lot of shade on really sunny days (except for noon, obviously). The street is covered with huge decorations depending on the season and there are many seating opportunities for our elders, and stairs leading up to the malls with statues where kids like to run around. There is also a small, but really informative tourist information office with lovely and helpful staff.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We entered the cloud dome after an extremely hot walk across the gardens and immediately felt reenergised! The waterfall as you enter is spectacular and very cooling; we all enjoyed the range of plants and walk down from the top. The only negative is the stalactites and stalagmites that were apparently harvested from caves - this seems inconsistent with the environmental message they're trying to get across.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best place to collect items for interior design work for your home
REVIEW_BODY: The only place in Singapore where I felt that things are not too expensive.You get almost everything in Chinatown.Of which I felt that u can get many nice and inexpensive things to decorate your house.You have very good open restaurants at the end of the street.A must visit place for tourists.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place for a wonder and chill
REVIEW_BODY: I thought it was really good. I enjoyed just wondering around the paths. It didn't feel like you were in a city which made it relaxing and peaceful
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good place for Families and specially for Kids. They also conduct birds shows at different intervals. Should be included in your trip itinerary.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: good place for family, pay attention for when you coming
REVIEW_BODY:
good place for families and elder. they provide good access for disable and elder._x000D_
_x000D_
flower dome and cloud forest is a good place for relaxing. but beware of seasons, because when we coming there, there is a little flowers blooming._x000D_
_x000D_
garden rhapsody is a must. just enjoy the music and look at a lights dancing
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely day away from the city
REVIEW_BODY: So lovely to spend a few hours or the day walking around MacRitchie. Wear proper footwear and bring your bug spray ;)
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent around 4 hrs there. Gardens were beautiful. Flower Domes worth the entrance fees and dont forget to take the elevator to the top for the view from the top of the dome. Loved the light show although I would like to see it from a distance as well as close up. A lot of walking but well worth it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I am not one for heights, but this trip is unmissable! The flyer takes approximately 30 minutes and goes so slowly you do not realise you are moving and by the time you reach the top the views are so breathtaking you forget how high you are (at least I did) .definitely worth the 33dollars per person (approx 16Â£ at today's rates)
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We ended up only having 2 days in Singapore due to flights being disrupted, so had to reduce our list of places to see - we're so glad that the Gardens by the Bay stayed on there!_x000D_
_x000D_
We walked here from our hotel fairly early in the morning to try to avoid the heat, but even so we were so glad to get into the domes as they were so much cooler than outside!_x000D_
_x000D_
There were no queues for entrance tickets when we were there, but you can buy tickets online to avoid long queues at peak times._x000D_
We went to the Cloud Forest first, which was just incredible. We then headed to the Flower Dome, which was still very impressive but didn't have the same wow factor._x000D_
_x000D_
The grounds are amazing, with so much green space and a huge variety of different gardens. It perfectly reflects the mixed cultural heritage of Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
This is a must do!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: a very enjoyable visit but a little short at the time there are so many varieties and all very well displayed take time to see it all
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: From my point of view, it's not the best place for shopping, because it's so huge, you get lost easily and it's very tiresome to try to find something. On the other hand, I must admit, it's fascinating and great experience. Fortunatelly, we stayed in a hotel located literally in the street, which was convenient- Orchard Parade hotel.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you want any of your top end shops then this is the place to be. Also plenty of malls for the bargain hunters. Plenty of bars and restaurants again with a tremendous variation in price. Always try for the happy hour in bars and eat in the food courts as they are delicious with great choices._x000D_
In the evenings the working girls come out but unless you are easily offended they are no problem. Certainly not bringing a sleazy atmosphere to the area._x000D_
If you are on a budget check prices before ordering food and drink and check if the prices include tax and service charge as this can add a chunk on.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Me & my family enjoy going there. Alot of animals that we haven't seen before & knows. My kiddo very happy going there. But I don't like the route there, it makes us to going back because there's animal that we miss it & make us tired. It better made single route, with this we will no miss anything & not wasting time.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful place, but you have to visit Waterfront Promenade during sunset or by night. Check the time of laser show and you will have for free a spectacular performance. Chill out in Starbucks , or other restaurants, bars and coffeeshop. Some nights young artists or bands use to perform in a open stage.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The orchid garden is a must when you visit here,so many in one place,just gorgeous!!Lovely,peaceful gardens and so easy to get to via MR,just step out of the station and you are there.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Lion State can't be visited without going to Merlion Park on Marina Bay. This Iconic Statue is just one of the must do sights. The whole area is wonderful to walk around with plenty of things to see and do. From a ride on the Singapore River to high end eating. Go by day and come back at night to see the transformation. Wonderful.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: International convention, decent food, good A/V, large format. Proximity to shopping and accessibility to transit ok.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I had to work at the NUS Bukit Timah Campus for 3 days. I took the MRT there and had to walk through the Botanic Gardens every morning and evening. It was a pleasant start and end to my working day._x000D_
_x000D_
So much greenery and flowers, fresh air, peace and tranquility. I wish I worked full time there so that I can walk through the gardens every day._x000D_
_x000D_
I plan to bring my daughter there in the future - and go to the children's park. I wasn't allowed in without her.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Most Singapore attractions don't start until 10am. Be an early riser and walk through the gardens at first light. Magical. Spend the hottest part of the day under cover and see the National Orchid garden ($5) in the late afternoon.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited the Marina Bay hotel & Sky Park one afternoon during our 3 day stay. Quite expensive if you just waned to go to the top and look at the view. ($23), but once up there the view was amazing.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you're planning to go to Singapore anytime soon, you should check this area. they have literally everything you need. From food, fashion until the best photo spot. So, don't forget to go here anytime you visit Singapore!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Big, brash, impersonal guest processing production line
REVIEW_BODY:
We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights._x000D_
I knew it was big and have been to plenty of large hotels. It was the first time that I had to wait in a managed queue line to check in to a 5 star hotel. In reality It is at best 3.5 stars._x000D_
It's owned and run by the holding company that owned similar monstrosities in Las Vagus. So I guess if that is what you are after this hotel is for you._x000D_
_x000D_
Our family room was comfortable for 4 of us but the room was beginning to show it's age and the musty smell beginning to creep in._x000D_
_x000D_
The building is an engineering masterpiece._x000D_
The only other positive was the roof top pool. To get to it we had to use 3 different lifts and every single person, including kids need their own room key to get in. Once there it was a scramble to get a bed. There was people everywhere!_x000D_
_x000D_
I realised fairly early that I made a mistake in booking this hotel. My 3 night stay booking made directly with the hotel were deemed non changeable by the guest processing officer and I was told politely to sod off.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place, lots to see, plenty of places to eat. Orchids are just stunning, nice surprise was the air conditioning.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Each of my visits brings so much feeling to me. Be it day or night, dusk or dawn, the cityscape and it's architecture will never disappoint you. The place might get touristy a times. There's a lot of place of interest nearby like the Helix Bridge, Merlion, Gardens by the Bay, Singapore Flyer so definitely spare some 2-3 hours here to enjoy the view
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A nightmare to cross the Road
REVIEW_BODY: Most pedestrian crossings have now been replaced by subways to cross the busy road.Unfortunately when you descend the subways directions are not always clear.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited in the evening to witness the light show in the amazing vertical gardens. The light and music show was spectacular. We then walked around the gardens to Satay by the Bay where we enjoyed fantastic satay and drinks...well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The inside is stunning, but you can not show shoulders or too much legs, so try not to wear shorts or skirt..however they do have covers there. I would highly recommend stopping by this place.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We were pretty excited to see this place after reading the reviews and seeing the incredible building it is located in, however after spending 40mins queuing to buy a ticket, what we actually witnessed was probably one of the worst "museums" I've ever witnessed._x000D_
_x000D_
There was an initial light show which was quite interesting, but after that, the place was just one big children's playground, with really nothing interesting to see as an adult couple. Most of the exhibits are just walls of light with no real explanation on what they are, and I'd say it's only of real interest to kids._x000D_
_x000D_
I'd could forgive all of the above with the understanding that the place is great for kids, but literally, after you've seen the 10 min light show, we had walked round and seen everything in less than 5 mins. A complete waste of time and the literally the worst $36 spent._x000D_
_x000D_
Unless you have kids, I wouldn't bother.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth having a ride on them both to Sentosa, and in Sentosa. They are very high, as they cross from Singapore to Sentosa, so the view is specacular.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: They couldâ€™ve made this way better for visitors
REVIEW_BODY:
Any normal tourist would want the opportunity to visit the top of the Marina Bay Sands hotel. There is a beautiful view of the Central Business District and Gardens by the Bay._x000D_
_x000D_
However, there is nothing up there other than decking and a coffee shop with no seats. Iâ€™ve visited tourist attractions as the top of buildings before (N Seoul Korea Tower, Empire State Building, Eiffel Tower and Rockefeller) all were way better designed for tourists and more comfortable for enjoying the insane view._x000D_
_x000D_
The staff at the ticket desk were also very slow, quite rude/abrupt and not very accommodating - unlike most of the other tourist attractions in Singapore!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Only if you are a outdoor person.
REVIEW_BODY: Its a nature place right in the middle of the country. You have nature trials for you to hike and the reservoir has kayak for you to rent and do kayaking and fishing. If you are really into hiking, you can hike from this place to Bukit Timah Hill. Nearest MRT station is Caldecott or Marymount, about 15 minutes walk to this place.
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: never expected that museum looks like this before. they can combine between art and science became a wonderful museum.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good place to eat real, authentic food and do some shopping for local souvenirs. The cheapest place in Singapore.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Boat Quay is fabulous. Close proximity to the CBD of Singapore. Restaurants galore, beautiful restaurant architecture. The Singapore River is at your feet. Beautiful to stroll along and take in all that Singapore has to offer. Not to be missed.
ADDRESS: 1 Bonham Street Uob Building, Singapore 049782, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Breathaking Singapore views from MBS Skypark
REVIEW_BODY: Simply the best views of Singapore from up here. Why we haven't done it before is mysterfying ut we have now and highly recommend to everyone else? The Singapore Flyer is good but this is better. Great pics.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a must see location for any trip to Singapore, as it is something that is totally unique and offers great value for money even when paying for certain exhibits.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The views are stunning, the environment so peaceful, definitely one of the highlights of the city. There is a children's garden very well equipped with a little zoo and water games and it's complimentary!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard gardens is good place to visit, nice scenic pit stops with full of different orchids. Should make out a trip to visit for everyone staying in Singapore
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Typically well done, immaculate park with the highlight being the giant artificial trees and skywalk. Kids also like the little water park and spent a few hours getting wet.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth the $33 dollar fare. Amazing views of Singapore from the pod. Very efficiently run and interesting pre flight information
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are in Singapore, this is a must! Stunning views and the best light show at night. Very popular so be on time to get the best seat.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I bought the tickets and actually had no idea what to expect. Walking in the waterfall greets you and instantaneously cools you down. It is informative and really amazing. I'm so happy I went. Would recommend this to anyone who wants to see something different.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore flyer was the best experience ever for watching the Singapore city from a bird eye view... book tickets online to avoid rush and save time.. it gives u a complete 360 degree view of the city and we did the tour in the evening as itâ€™s best time to look above the city with melting sun.. itâ€™s a 30-40 minuets ride in total and gondola has 28 capsules and accommodates 7-8 people in one capsule to give u better breathing space and view.. capsules are fully air conditioned and has a seating arrangement too.. gondola rotates very slowly and gives u a better view of entire city.. a must do thing when in Singapore.. we did this particularly as to get the feel of it.. this flyer is near to gardens by the bay and can be done walking too.. it takes 15-20 minuets by walking from gardens by the bay ..
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: first time we went and we had enjoy a lot it had rain but we still could see a lot and could make some pictures nextime when we go back to singapure on vacation we will sure go back
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the place of all the photographs and where all the tourists hang out. It is as picturesque as the books make it look. In our view it is better looking from the city area towards Marina Bay Sands then going up MBS and looking at the city skyline. That said if you want to have a good view of the daily light show, you need to be over at MBS. Nice to walk all the way round in the evening but is further than it looks !
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Loved it. One of the highlights on my trip
REVIEW_BODY:
It is just beautiful._x000D_
But make sure before you go to check if they are all open. They were doing updates to one of the displays so we had to come again. And we had gone out of our way to visit._x000D_
_x000D_
Well worth the visit. Just stunning and creative.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My kid and wife loved the experience here with various animals to lookout here, Kids Zone with small play area, Good walking to do or you could use the paid tram for inside journey. You need to lookout for 11 AM animal show, 3 PM and 5 PM etc...inside the Zoo.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I walked along the area of Chinatown and the buildings / houses in Chinatown area are special, colorful, and decorative - this is I enjoyed the most, especially after I visited Chinese Heritage Center! The area might be different in 50s.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore
