REVIEW_BODY: Sadly the night experience wasn't what we remembered. They are pushing out several shows a night and the animals were not really cooperating. The train tours was nice, but the sound track had problems and wasn't well coordinated. Night zoo, day zoo and river cruise - should all be one place to visit.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is one of the best garden for holiday and relax . All thing are interesting for every body
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: So much beauty is hard to convey.Top garden design and such a large variety of orchids. A must for any garden enthusiast.Places to stop and rest or contemplate as you go round .Easy to visit using the mass transit train service .We enjoyed a great coffee in the actual botanic gardens where the orchid gardens are set.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the Most Beautiful Places on Earth
REVIEW_BODY: I wasn't especially excited about going here at first, but after arriving, I was very happy that we went. These gardens are immaculate! They the most varieties of orchids I have ever seen and they even arrange the plants where they look like they are in bouquets. Every inch of this park is beautiful.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Happen to be here at Chinese New Year. Great excitement and activity in Chinatown. The street markets are good and the buildings very interesting.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely fantastic few hours spent here. Paid $S28 to go into the two conservatories and it was worth every cent. Not only was the environment nice and cool the gardens were well tended and beautifully spectacular. The Flower Dome showcases garden areas from across the world, peppered with some fantastic wooden sculptures. It was also very picturesque and peaceful outside in the free areas, albeit extremely hot. There is a skywalk you can try for a fee but it was getting a little warm so gave that a miss. Worthwhile coming back at night to see the impressive light show which begins at 7.45pm and goes for about 15 minutes.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is the other side of Singapore, that some tourists don't get to see - but it is just as amazing and beautiful as the modern Singapore._x000D_
We took the taxi to the nature trail from the Singapore Botanical Gardens - it is a good plan to do both the same day of you can._x000D_
We were unsure we were going to see any monkeys that day, but there they were, tens and tens of them, hanging out on the trail, next to people jogging, in the trees above you and in the bushes next to you. It was amazing to see these beautiful little creatures in their natural habitat, not behind a cage._x000D_
We could have spend hours just looking at them interacting._x000D_
Be aware not to stare at them directly in their eyes, and NEVER feed then, or have food with you. If you leave them alone and follow these rules, they will just ignore you and go about their monkeying around._x000D_
The day we went on the trail was excruciatingly hot, so we did not get to the bridge, but one day we will go back.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You have the usual bustle of the city mixed with so much amazing shopping. There are also many food options, all amazing and very cheep.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good choice anytime for a visit!
REVIEW_BODY: We had dinner along the Singapore River @ Boat Quay. This area offers a large variety of restaurants with different food selections and bars. River views of the city skyline is also a speciality. A very popular night spot area sightseeing and just sitting. People also use it for strolling or eating takeout along the waterfront to enjoy some people watching. Photo opportunities of the sights and smells of this fabulous city available in many directions!
ADDRESS: 1 Bonham Street Uob Building, Singapore 049782, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Had a 9 hour stop over in Singapore so went into the city. Well worth doing this. Awesome way of seeing the city. Spectacular views. This is one way of seeing Singapore from up high. 360 views of the city. We were fortunate to get on before the weather changed which put a stop to people being able to get this experience. Highly recommend you making time to do this if in Singapore. There were not any queues so we got straight on.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Be prepared to spend a long time
REVIEW_BODY: This is a great place to visit. More importantly, it is just one of three attractions in this complex. There is also the Night Safari and the River Cruise. The zoo is about a $20-25 taxi ride from the CBD. It is veryt popular so it is best to get there as soon as you can. If you are early enough, you can have breakfast with the orangutans. That is quite an experience. The zoo itself consists of many open enclosures where the animals are roaming freely. if you look up as you alk around you may well find monkeys following and watching you. If it is hot, bring plenty of water and there are free refill stands along the way. There are, of course, extra costs along the way. You have to pay for photographs taken by professionals at the orangutan feeding etc. They will take photos on your camera butdo a sloppy job by photographing into the sun, out of focus etc. Food is reasonably expensive which explains why we saw a lot of familie4s with packed lunches. An excellent day aout and a chance to give your camera a good thrashing.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is an interesting and beautiful attraction, with a good mixture of paid and non-paid activities, and traditional/non-traditional gardens. The Cloud Forest was a hilight, not only botanically, but also to get out of the Singapore heat! Make sure you bring adequate sun protection for walking around outside. A good tip is they have lockers at the info centre - $2 for as long as you need, and very secure.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You have to see the main shopping areas in any city. Orchard road is not that different to most however you can still find some little specials here & there if you look hard.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The best zoo in the world!
REVIEW_BODY: If you want to visit the best zoo in the world - this is the place to go. Genuine interest in the animals. None of the usual cage feeling. Interaction with the animals. Great photo opportunities.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Smashing place to visit, wander, eat and take in the atmosphere. Very friendly with lots to see and do.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Easiest to reach from the Promenade MRT station, this is almost identical to London Eye. On the other side of the bridge you can also visit the Marina Bay Sands Skypark observation deck, which is a bit cheaper (Infinity Pool is only for hotel guests).
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Evidently reopened last autumn after extensive renovation, this is an excellent facility which leads you through an easy to follow journey of Singapore's history. Very imaginatively laid out._x000D_
The success of this tiny country since independence from Britain and subsequent separation from Malaysia is well illustrated. It has been really remarkable, and sometimes by the skin of its teeth!_x000D_
A guided tour night well be worthwhile though we chose to go alone._x000D_
A must visit.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very pretty exhibit, worth the fee. The smells are glorious and colours amazing. We enjoyed an afternoon walking through the park and exhibit.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The massive dome houses a lot flowers that you don't see in a tropical country like Singapore. Tulips from Holland, exotic flowers from US - you name it. It is climated controlled (air-conditioned) so you can stroll leisurely. The supertrees are outdoors and there is a apparently a restaurant/bar on one of the SuperTrees that you can go to._x000D_
_x000D_
There is a also an indoor man-made waterfall and you climb up to take a look or take pictures.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good for a trip with family, friends Children can enjoy by seeing animals at a near distance Must for tourist
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely place for morning or evening walks when the weather is cool. I take my dog there for long walks.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I really enjoyed my tour of the Battlebox site. The guide was very informative and interesting. The only downside was that we were not allowed to take photos. So I only have memories of the tour. It would have been good to receive a pamphlet or glossy photo handout. So I can only relay my experience to my friends and not show them how authentic it was._x000D_
regards
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We went on an organised trip sold to us in the hotel from a Mr Hoon. He told us that dinner was included but it was actually that you got to sample 3 satays._x000D_
I think it would be something easy to organise yourself. It was enjoyable, the flowers are lovely and there are some good exhibits to look at. When you go at night there is a free light show where some "space age looking trees" are lit up to music, it is quite impressive.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are in Singapore, this is the place for a must visit. The best place to spent a whole evening. You can spent 3 to 4 hours very easily, be a solo traveler or with friends or family. The most happening place for shoppers , travelers be it local/international. A nice walk/trail along the river side will really allure you. Starting from high rises to beautiful construction will amaze you. There are many restaurants and bars throughout the area. Awesome food ,love to be back again and again. You also may take a ride into the heritage Clarke Quay from different points of the bay.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The merlion is a great symbol of the cosmopolitan city of Singapore. The statue and fountain itself is dominated and overawed by the high story offices! Still worth going to and always take visitors to see.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I've been on this twice now with tourists. It's really a great view. It's a big pricey at about $25 a person. It gets you a great ride to Sentosa. And then there are 2 other cable cars you can ride while on the island with good views too. It's great to be in the cable cars. Sentosa is great to see but the cable car ride is better for me than actually being on sentosa. While I don't think this is a must do, it's one that you should consider. If money isn't an issue for you, then definitely do it.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I'm no gardener but wow! What a slice of paradise in big town! So many plants at such a small place! Very very impressive
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Had a great time on Singapore flyer. Fantastic views over Singapore. A definite must do. You can hardly feel the wheel move but you are up very high!!!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Tourists pay more than locals to visit this attraction, which is very sad and unfair as most tourists earn a LOT less than the average Singaporean. The Flower Dome boasts an assortment of flora and is managed well. It's cool inside and less crowded than it is outdoors. I have visited this attraction thrice and it has not disappointed (except for the price). Most recently the theme was Christmas, because it was just that season. The fake snow was there, the letters to Santa were ever present and the unwrapped boxes beneath the displays enticed the imagination and excited the children._x000D_
My focus was, however, on the immaculately landscaped gardens and healthy flowers that gave my macro lens reason to dance, sing and be merry... ho, ho, ho! If you have the time and the MONEY for this attraction, Go, Go, Go!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Not Soo excited... you can see Pandas_x000D_
You will enjoy One show which will last for 10-15mins with some animals kids probably enjoy this,_x000D_
One river cruise itâ€™s like Boat ride in river surrounded by thick forest full of greenery which will last for 15mins_x000D_
Amazon river quest like some guided boat ride you can see some birds and some animals
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
East Coast Park is perhaps the most beautiful natural spot in Singapore. It's vast, clean and endless sea line melts in to the horizon. It's green, well planned and vast._x000D_
You would have just enough people around, plenty of options for eat out such as McDonald's, The Coffee Beans and a hawker center._x000D_
It's a peaceful place, you can rent bicycle to unwind yourself and enjoy the breeze._x000D_
_x000D_
ECP is easy to reach by bus.
ADDRESS: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road, Singapore 455486, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is similar to the wheel in other cities around the world. On a clear day the views are terrific. They are very organized and the queues move quickly. Worth doing once!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Perfect environment, rain or shine. Weekend crowds was quite terrible at certain places but staff were great in facilitating with human congestion. I like how educational videos were available for cloud forest.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is a clear winner among kids. There are so many species of birds and kids love it. Place is very nice and clean and you can even feed the birds which was cool. There is a tram that you can take (separate ticket to buy) and roam inside. Nice place. Can finish in 2-4 hours depending on how serious bird love you are.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went to Merlion Park twice. This was the second visit. Many tourists took picture here. We came here around 5pm ( the best time ).
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A-MAZ-ING and FREE. Two words every traveller wants to hear.
REVIEW_BODY: In 2014 we visited Gardens By The Bay by day and when we adjusted to the heat we loved the variety of the plants we were seeing. In 2018 we visited at night. The taxi driver knew exactly where to drop us off, we headed for THE trees found a place to sit under them and waited. It was worth it. What a spectacle of color and light and music. The next stop was the light show on the other side of Marina Bay Sands. No need to rush though, there are two shows of each.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I understand how reviewing a place without actually visiting it seems unfair to the business, BUT given the unbelievable and disappointing customer service received the last two months I am surprised they even operate..._x000D_
_x000D_
Made the first enquiry mid November to which I was given all the information and told 2-3 weeks time confirmation will be sent. I was excited so 2 weeks in to the enquiry I emailed, it was referred onwards and was told that it had not been 2-3 weeks as mentioned, our place was reserved. No payment details though_x000D_
So i waited._x000D_
A month later I emailed again_x000D_
I was already a little frustrated as I had tried organising everything before our holiday. Was informed that the 'rates' hadn't been confirmed / changes may have occurred... Next day I was given an email with the pricing, link to the site for general info. Request for deposit. Busy enjoying our last day in Phuket Thailand before we went on a trip into the national park I didn't respond._x000D_
_x000D_
During our holiday we have been away for a few days in the national park (5th-7th). No net. No phone. No hassles._x000D_
During this stay the safari emailed on the 6th titled FIRST FOLLOW UP. At this stage I should mention during my holiday I have an auto'out of office' email saying I am away. They wanted to hear from us within 48hours. So today I got an email titled GIVING UP BOOKING. We were told that 'due to the lack of confirmation' from our end... You're kidding me. We tried to organise this well and truly in advance. First come first served (their words). we were first come and... Left out to dry._x000D_
_x000D_
After two emails expressing my disappointment and intent to cancel, I then had to explain in another email that I had already written to them about if I wanted to continue or not with the booking._x000D_
_x000D_
Overall a pointless endeavour. Can't believe I considered spending $200 each at a place that can't even get their bookings and emailing customers right..._x000D_
_x000D_
If you get over that obstacle I hear the safari is great
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: On a friday, Saturday and Sunday at the open air theater looking of Marina Bay is well worth a visit to listern to live music looking over marina bay with strode lighting around the bay and the beautiful back drop of the financial district. Also its not so hot and humid.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Convenient and enjoyable time at the Singapore Zoo
REVIEW_BODY: We travelled with a 6-mo old. Appreciate that there were many changing stations around the zoo. Loved the commentaries at the different attractions as it gave us more information about the animals, their current state and how we can help preserve their existence.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went there recently with an elderly parent and the tram ride was a good way of experiencing the park. It's all very well done though the queue to get to the tram was long - we waited 45 minutes on a Friday night. The attendants are very helpful. There are plenty of dining options, and good souvenir shops too. If you are able to walk then walking the park rather than the tram would be a better idea.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth getting a drink at the Ce La Vie bar right at the top of the building for the views. Laser show no good from here though.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must see. We came twice. At night and then in the day. Better in the day time. A remarkable experience. I would go again next time in Singapore. For anything who appreciates the diversity of flora on earth, this place is a remarkable experience. I was speechless from the moment I entered the dome to the moment I left.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Felt like it took a long long time to get to the top but the view was worth it. Good view of the marina bay area and iconic buildings like Marina Bay Sands and Esplanade. I love the views at night but I imagine it would be nice to visit durimg sunset too._x000D_
_x000D_
Ticket for the half hour ride was rather pricey at $33 for adult and $21 for kid. There was a discount with krisflyer acct when we were there.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Just a quick walk away from busy Orchard road. Nice park , some peace in the city centre. Nice collections of tropical plants
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: After spending 1 hour traveling on Singapore MRT arrived to be told closed for renovation. Reopening 2020. Maybe tourist authorities should have signs indicating the closure
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful cool and nice place To have a walk with your partner hand in hand it's a beautiful place to visit. Being inside even if outside is hot it will be pleasant inside. It was gr8
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Before travelling to Singapore I heard so many people comment that you must go to the zoo. So okay we went to the zoo.Don't get me wrong its a great zoo but it is just a zoo.If you have been to Taronga zoo or Australia zoo I would say those zoos are more impressive and keep their animals in more spacious enclosures . I ended up feeling sorry for most of the animals especially the polat bear in her enclosure all by herself.She looked depressed. If you need something to do to fill your day then yes it was a pleasant enough day out.I personally would have rather done something else with my money and time.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This place is a must if you are visiting Singapore, beautiful garden to view and entry fee is needed to gain access ( a word of advise ) if you are travelling with Singapore airlines keep your boarding pass it will give you a small discount to the gardens._x000D_
Also visit this place at nice .... the lights are amazing
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A Must to Visit when you are in Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY: Well Done, with climate well control and nice botanic plants of various kind can be found here. I am a member there since day one, friends of the garden. Plant and flowers lovers cannot miss!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: See the cloud forest and flower dome
REVIEW_BODY: The cloud forest has a stunning waterfall. You take an elevator all the way to the top and walk down the path. Along the way you see the plants as well as crystals. Very doable in a short time
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a stroll, particularly at night when there is often a laser light show. Can get photos during the day and at night of the Merlin Lion (symbol of Singapore, not sure of the history). Some vendors selling snacks if you get hungry.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We wanted an authentic Chinese meal and experience and our taxi driver dropped us on a side street...proved to be the wrong choice as the next taxi driver told us this area is just for tourists,. our meal was terrible, the service slap dash and the price extortinate.Avoid
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: In the evening it is really beautiful. There is a light and sound show at the superthrees one shouldn't miss. The IndoChine Rooftop bar offers a great view over the city and of course good trinks.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the waterfall and the whole experience of the dome was really nice. getting up with a pushchair is possible but the queue for the lift was somewhat long.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My wife loves exploring new places while travelling and we love exploring the city on foot so this was a must visit attraction for us. Entry to this botanical garden is free except the Orchard Garden. It was pretty sunny when we went but it started drizzling midway so it made the experience all the more amazing. The garden is huge with a lot of entries inside. Visit if you have a lot of time in hand so you can relax and don't need to rush.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the most shopping mall street. and famous street. it would good visit for everyone. The MRT connect to the mall very simply to reach
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of popular landmark of Singapore, so crowed because many tourists would like to take picture with Merlion
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Alight at Clarke quay station and take a walk by river side and view is mind blowing. Reach merlion take a deep breath to see the majestic one.... From this point you can see full view of marina bay and marina bay sands building.... Treat for photography
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must visit place in Singapore. Shows are very nice and there is a large variety of birds. Children and adults will enjoy alike.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are a must see in Singapore. The trees lighting to music is a beautiful evening. The heritage gardens are relaxing and gorgeous. A variety of plants and flowers. The. CLoud Forest is not to be missed. Trees and plants from all elevations. Walkways on all levels, towering waterfalls. Hard to imagine until you actually experience it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: All friends of nature should go there on their visit to Singapore. The site is very well done and well maintained. From misty areas to the wanterfall as well as the massive amount of wonderful orchids are not to be missed!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Super evening and great views and music
REVIEW_BODY: Well you have to come here for the views and the amazing atmosphere. I have never been to a nightclub this high up and open air. Just fantastic and a must.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good to visit , especially the flower dome
REVIEW_BODY: This is good visit, especially the flower dome. There is a shuttle from the entrance to the flower dome. Gets very busy when the sun sets as there is a light show. Queue for the sky walk very long and you must be tickets first.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's well known that many animals sleep during the day and hunt at night. So the Night Safari is a true experience for anyone who loves animals. I prefer the Zoo by day, but the Night Safari is also well worth doing.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These trees are definitely super!! Never saw anything like that before. Definitely do the skywalk and take a lot of pictures!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As decided NOT shopping this visit (the clothing here has become MORE expensive than home) we decided to spend more time visit some of the city's cultural venues. This museum provided an interesting history of the region.
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You and your habitat in nature. That's an experience you'll get if you have a chance to reach your foot to the Singapore Zoo. An exciting place for knowledge and education. Do not miss the chance to see a particular show at a certain time. Get the map provided for your reference while doing 'adventure' in it.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited this on a day of 90 degrees and 90 moisture and it was the Chinese New Year weekend. The place was packed with people all with selfies jumping in front to take pictures. We would go back when not so crowded.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great for a bargain and food is great. Can negotiate a little but prices are pretty much fixed. Good perfume shopping.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Actually, I have seen some Hindu statues in India, but this place was a bit fascinating. We spent about 2 hours here, strolling around the statues, reading the signs about them, and seeing the history of the 2 brothers- Haw and Par- who developed Tiger Balm ointment. all us, it was a good find for us, and it's free to enter, too.
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you got deep pockets you will love it. but a bit of browsing and window shopping has never hurt anyone either.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Helix bridge spans over part of the river near the Marina Bay Sands hotel and casino complex._x000D_
It's a short bridge overlooking an iconic area of the bay in Singapore ._x000D_
In the day you get to see many new skyscrapers in the area. While at night you see the beautiful lights in the buildings nearby. During the National Day celebrations, fireworks may be seen from here.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was my highlight of our trip to Singapore, absolutely stunning and unlike anything you will ever see elsewhere.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This place really needs to be visited at night. The "super trees" are lit up, and there is a light show using the trees and the lights surrounding you._x000D_
Free to get in and walk around, although you will need to pay if you want to go up to the walkway which connects the main super-trees._x000D_
Many people bring their own straw mats or blankets on which to lay down, so that they can watch the light show laying on the ground.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The whole city gets more beautiful by night and that is so cool to watch. Very good place to be to enjoy the modern city views.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You must see. The uniquely beautiful place. If visiting Singapore is required, must find time to see it.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth spending a couple of hours or more
REVIEW_BODY: This museum is well set up, really interesting and really shows the history of Singapore.. Highly recommend spending the time to sit and listen to the videos and clips of Singapore's history.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Went two times to the flyer,once at night time and once during the day,just to catch a glimpse of both the night and the day light view._x000D_
From the flyer we could see most of the attractions esp when we reach the top. For example, Gardens by the bay,MBS and many more._x000D_
I would highly recommend it to the first timers visiting SG as not only we could enjoy the great wide view of SG but also inside each compartment of the flyer,there is a small screen tablet where we could see and view the different places of SG and that tablet could be very helpful if you have still not decided on where to go next in SG.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Definitely the best way to visit Sentosa. Great views of the main island as well as the little Sentosa island from above. It is highly recommended though a bit too expensive for the short distance ride. That's the only reason I gave it very good rather than excellent.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The City Gallery was an unexpected highlight of my Singapore visit. The massive island and city centre models give a great overview of how this city-state functions and the following displays are truly fascinating. How a tiny country makes do with such a small space is clearly explained for the housing, energy, water, economic, transport, conservation and environmental sectors and is a fascinating story. There are lessons here for visitors from around the world to take home to their own cities.
ADDRESS: 45 Maxwell Road The Ura Centre | The URA Centre, Level 2, Singapore 069118, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its a walking bridge connecting Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands. Its position is such you get a excellent view of Singapore with plenty of photo opportunities. Its worth a walk between these to great attractions.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Although it is not the only or best spot to see SG from above and entry is now charged, it is worth it.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If I was to pick out one photo that signifies Singapore, other than the front of Raffle Hotel, it would be Merlion Park.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great park to go for a walk around and enjoy the peace full surrounds. Just of Orchard road a very easy place to get to.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit with a friend to the China Heritage Museum Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: A wonderful journey through the museum of the Singapore early pioneers who left their villages in China and made their way to Singapore. The Museum is well organized and it is a very clear exhibition. Well done!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place but NOT on weekends
REVIEW_BODY: Definitely do the night safari but avoid Fri-Sun. Buy tix in advance online and use kiosk to check for a safari time once there. Be careful: animal area close at about 6 except for special safaris and such. Queues for night safari was an hourâ€”even with reserved time.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore sure knows how to entertain, its great for photographers and also great for young children to lay back and watch the trees change colour. Excellent show, went for around half hour. Get there a little early to get a great vantage point. It's free of charge unless you climb to the treetops, but for the light show in the evening it's free to just sit under a tree and watch the show
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great views of bay and Marina Bay Sands property in backdrop. It does get crowded but there are many angles to pick from. Venture under the bridge across the street to purchase local fruit or chilled coconut water from refrigerated displays. Well worth it and affordable and shaded!
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You must go here while you're there. Colourful and vibrant full of fantastic sights, sounds and smells. New year celebration was in full swing when we were there so was extra busy.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Our visit to this zoo was wonderful as they have done a great job with everything. It is as clean and organized as the city of Singapore is!_x000D_
_x000D_
In 2020 when the expansion is done (and the bird park will also be moved there) we would like to return to see what is new.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's a beautiful place for a relaxing family outing. It's also a great place for photo sessions If you visit during December, its worth to stay till nighttime for the beautiful lighting
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the supertree grove while visiting the gardens in the day and night. We went to the top of the walkway in daytime and watched the Gardens Rhapsody at night from underneath which was spectacular
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Jurong Bird Park is an easy way to fill in a half day in Singapore, and well worth the effort. The enclosures are large and the birds seem at ease and healthy and there is certainly plenty to see. There are a couple of shows - again worth a look, and the "lunch with the Parrots" was a highlight for us. It was a bit pricey at $25 over the admission ticket, and the buffet lunch that was included was horrible - so bad my wife wouldn't eat, but getting up close and personal to macaws was worth it. Overall it was a great experience. We caught a cab, which again, by Singapore standards was a bit pricey at $26 - largely due to it being peak hour, but I'm sure if you wanted to tackle public transport you could.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The day we visited they had the daffodil and tulip displays, divine colors and varieties apart from all the other types of flowers from around the world, worth a visit!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a great place to visit if you like Military History! I go back every time I'm in Singapore! A great way to see how Colonial Singapore was involved in WWII.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent value as an excursion from your cruise ship
REVIEW_BODY:
Although we only saw the FOREST DOMB, which is one half of the sites, it was good enough for our needs. We had a one day excursion from our cruise ship, and this place was close enough, we could take a quick taxi ride. Well worth it. The forest has a trail of walking, elevators, escalators, downward steps, and more walking. In total, about a two hour journey, if you stop and take pictures. You can see a variety of rain forest plant life. The vegetation grows artificially along a man-made mountain enclosed in a domb. I found it enjoyable past time, for a day trip into Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
If you see the photos, you will discover the various high elevation walks over suspension pathways, that take you into and out of the mountain. A journey.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent an afternoon wandering amid the beautiful flowers. On a very hot, humid Singapore day, the coolness of the gardens was welcome.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth it. Make sure you allow plenty of time and catch the nite show. Can also walk over to the casino for an interesting look and a massive shopping plaza with canal cruise inside. What the. !!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The area around the reclaimed land with the MBS hotel as its centre is worth visiting. The MBS hotel is really busy and I found it hard not to be impressed every time I looked at it both from inside and outside, from the Gardens by the Bay walkway and even from the air when flying into Changi Airport. The light show which we watched after the Gardens by the Bay light show was a total waste of time.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Magnificent gardens and light and music show not to be missed
REVIEW_BODY: Loved the gardens and all the pieces of art and activity signs. The light and music show at night is awesome - don't miss it. Very hot so take water!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: This park is worth taking time out to visit
REVIEW_BODY: Fort Canning Park is a nice tranquil place to visit, get away from the concrete jungle and take your time walking around the park, its situated close to the city which makes it convenient everyone can easily walk there. Allocate yourself at least two hours to see and take in what the park has to offer. Donâ€™t worry about the heat as there is plenty of shade and rest stops.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wasnt very impressed with Night Safari
REVIEW_BODY: I had heard so much about the night safari that i we went to try it out. Honestly i was disappointing with the whole experience. It was Okish experience i guess but not worth the effort and money it takes in my opinion. I guess kids will enjoy it more so maybe a family (with young kids) activity.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: If you only have time for one touristy trap, make it this one
REVIEW_BODY: We are only in town for 2 days, so down to just one tourist trap we really could afford to spend time on, and we chose this. Even though this was the third visit, we still thoroughly enjoyed it. Whoever dreamt of this night safari idea should be given some lifetime honour. And the show is run very well, many different types of animals nicely laid out. A must for any visitor to Singapore.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went on Friday evening to do walk. They sold us 8:20 pm spot tickets around 7:45. We left 8:30 with at least 100 people in front of us.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Asian Civilisations Museum features themed galleries, including Chinese ceramics, ancient religions, trade, and Christianity in Asia._x000D_
_x000D_
But my particular interest when I visited was the Tang Shipwreck display._x000D_
_x000D_
In 1998 a shipwreck was discovered off Belitung Island in the Java Sea. It turned out to be a Tang Dynasty ship trading to the Middle East and contained more than 70,000 ceramics, plus gold and silver objects._x000D_
_x000D_
Many of the items were in a remarkable state of preservation and now form a breath-taking display in their own gallery at the Asian Cicilisations Museum._x000D_
_x000D_
For some reason when I fronted up to the ticketing counter I was told that admission today was free, so I did' argue and enjoyed my free visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Transforming the City in a Garden
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is a nature park spanning 101 hectares (250 acres) of reclaimed land[2] in central Singapore, adjacent to the Marina Reservoir. The major attractions are Super Tree Grove, Cloud Forest, Flower Dome and beautifully designed green space with plants and foliage. The entire area exudes technological respect for green environment and hope for a great future of human civilisation. Energy efficiency and conservation of natural resources are highlights of this peaceful surrounding. While the huge tall structural figures of Supertrees, large mountainous looks of Cloud Forest and Flower Dome make one awestruck by the sizes, the beautiful foliage and wide variety of flowers of different continents including miniature orchids add to the amazement. These gardens by the bay have made Singapore a city in a garden.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited on part of a tour of Singapore and really glad we did. Beautiful gardens with fantastic displays of orchids. Wish we could have spent longer there.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We went to the bar, not the observation deck. The bar overlooks the deck and the entry fee is given as a credit for a drink from the bar or towards a meal, so seems better value than just standing on the deck, which is below the bar._x000D_
_x000D_
Spectacular views over Singapore skyline.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: So much to see, do, explore and enjoy AND eat
REVIEW_BODY: From Robertson Quay all the way through to Merlion Park the Singapore River offers every cuisine imaginable plus ready access to museums such as the Asian Civilizations Museum. Along the way there are some fun sculptures and pieces of history such as the Cavendish Bridge. Great for walking or boat tours.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: one of the most exciting places ever
REVIEW_BODY: we loved the 2 indoor attractions we visited. The 6 story waterfall was amazing to view. We loved the walkways from the top to the 3rd floor above the floor level. The scope of the view was exiting. The flora was beautiful. The other attraction inside was equally as enjoyable with all of the beautiful plants and flowers.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely loved this place... Especially how cool it was. So much to see, to take in. So many good photo opportunities, bit hard when busy although we managed to get some pretty awesome ones.. definitely worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a beautiful place for visitors to take a gentle walk. From the perspective of architectural excellence, there is so much to see in this area. I started my walk on The Helix Bridge, walking past the Art Science Museum and the magnificent water lily ponds complete with carp, past Marina Bay Sands Hotel and the shops continuing on the pathway to Clifford Pier (I took a round trip bumboat ride to Clarke Quay), then continued on to The Esplanade (the buildings that resemble Durian fruit). This is a great free activity giving a snapshot of this unique part of Singapore all built on reclaimed land.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great visit Worth the little extra $SN's
REVIEW_BODY: This was just breathtaking. So may orchids in what was there almost natural environment ( our grow on the window sill at home) We were in the Botanical Gardens and found the direction and it was worth paying the little extra to go in.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A great place for family and friends outing or picnic
REVIEW_BODY: Itâ€™s great outdoor place to chill ou t on a off day and have a picnic or a family outing. Just avoid it completely on a rainy day. It has unesco heritage site too that I would shout about too much but overall itâ€™s a nice green place to get away from the concrete and all teh modernisation for a while.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We felt very safe even though we were high up. A wonderful view of Singapore and Sentosa Island and we could see the storm clouds roll in.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: calm and cool and quite relaxing. lots of flowers to look at and enjoy. it was busy but not overly crowed you never felt rushes nor you being bumped into constantly
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: River Safari is a unique way to see and explore the zoo. located just next to singapore zoo it has a feel of a rainforest.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Orchard Road is truly a must visit road in Singapore. Lots of malls along the entire stretch of street. My favorite thing to do here.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I love running through this place! It is clean, beautiful and quiet, compared to the rest of the city!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We purchased our tickets online before we left the UK, directly from the hotel, and included the option to have a frozen Singapore sling. When the tickets were emailed, there was a time on them of 9.30am. I was slightly concerned as during the booking process it had not asked for you to specify a time to visit. As it turns out, that is the time the Skypark opens. You are free to visit anytime you choose. We decided to visit the Skypark after dark. There was very little queuing time to get in the lift to go up. Once up there the views across Singapore were stunning. Its worth noting that only the front end of the skypark is open to the public. The rest is closed off and is only accessible to hotel guests. The frozen Singapore Sling is collected from the Ce La Vie Kiosk up on the Skypark.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Scary (if you're afraid of heights) but DEFINITELY a MUST DO!
REVIEW_BODY:
Went to Universal Studios over the weekend and chose to travel from Harbour point to Sentosa via cable car._x000D_
_x000D_
I'm afraid of heights hence the title (I didn't think it was going to be that high) but after overcoming it after 5 mins or so, the view and experience is well worth it._x000D_
_x000D_
SGD 33 per head, roundtrip from Harbour Point to the Merlion point. (Seems pricey, but I thought well worth the experience)
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Extreme activity on Marina Bay. The small boats move about the Bay transporting people from the various docks. The activity from the Singapore Lion and the Marina Bay Sands seemed to continue non stop.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Was everything expected. Would love more time to explore without being mobed by busloads of tourists.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very large green space in the city. Good to roam around and relax, check if there are any gigs in the park. Must see the tallest tree in Singapore and the old British era band stand. In evening time a lot of turtle come out of the lakes/ponds which is quite a sight.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Marina Bay Sands has become one of the world's most iconic buildings......and the view from the skypark is worth seeing.....however, maybe not for the price being charged._x000D_
We only spent around 15 minutes up there. For mine, there are better ways to spend your valuable time and money in Singapore than visiting here.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: After a visit to the Marina Bay Sands it was a simple walk to the Garden by the Bay. There is easy walking through the gardens and two super huge glass houses. The evening was topped off with a spectacular light and music show performed utilising the forest of gigantic artificial trees and contemporary music. Well worth the stay into the evening.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Can get bit a crowded with happy snappers, but get in and get your pic too! Went at dusk / night. Was a great experience. Baby cub Merlion is here just behind the big one.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A good and budget place to stay for all travelers coming to Singapore. Good hotels and hostels for budgeted people. MRT and a big mustafa shopping mall is here in little india
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A lovely way to spend an afternoon or morning. Can get very busy though. Can purchase a ticket to include the gardens.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Stunning Birds in a beautiful setting
REVIEW_BODY: I hadn't been to the Jurong Bird Park for 20 years and was keen to see whether it was even better than last time. And I am pleased to say it was. Hornbills and Toucans are a highlight. Birds of Paradise were stunning. Lots of beautiful parrots. Really nice day out.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The outdoor gardens are free allowing you to walk in lovely landscaped gardens with unusual sculptures and themed garden areas. Within the gardens are several other attractions. The Super Tree Grove with futuristic trees towering 15-20 metres above you with vertical gardens up the trunks, photovoltaic panels hidden at the top collects solar energy that goes towards the stunning light displays that take place twice nightly. You can pay to climb to the top of one and walk the high level path. Within the garden area you can also pay to visit the giant cooled conservatories of the Flower Dome and Cloud Dome, both with an amazing display of plants (reviewed separately). There are also plenty of dining options including restaurants, McDonalds and Satay By the Bay a food court of 20-30 food stalls offering meals in their Hawker style.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It just blew my mind on how much thought, planning, construction went into this wonderful park. You gotta see it at night as well.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
There are two options to do the Marina Bay Skypark._x000D_
1. Pay S$23 to go to the viewing deck._x000D_
2. Pay S$20 to go to the bar and restaurant area but no access to the viewing platform.._x000D_
We took option 2 and spent our S$20 Singapore Flings at the bar. Don't expect to get and change and be prepared to pay tax on top depending on what you order. Lowest price on the drinks menu was S$17 + tax. Having said that it was well worth it. This is a tourist attraction only with no access to guest areas. Views we great and a must do attraction.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One visit must in the travel schedule
REVIEW_BODY: We enjoyed our visit as we had two small children who were eager to see this place. Although it started raining but we could enjoy the looks in the tram ride itself. The Jurassic park is superb. The live shows must be planned as per their timing. make full use of Tram as its quite a walk to see it fully.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of it's kind... Safari.. must visit for people visiting Singapore..!! Excellent collection of animals altogether in their wild surroundings.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must visit place with several places of attractions like Merlion park,Singapore flyer and Marina Bay Sands in the vicinity. you can even visit the spot at night to enjoy the various light effects.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A perfect place which explains the importance of nature in our life in a very modern and succulent way. Must visit the flower dome and waterfall dome. A perfect way to spend your day.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We are older folks and found it most enjoyable, they had places where we could rest and enjoy the beauty. We were delighted with the orchid display absolutely beautiful._x000D_
We thought the S$64 each was a bit on the high side but probably well worth the money. Gardens of the world and the light show a must when in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was absolutely amazing experience. We arrived by show time, where there was light and music show for 15 minutes. Everything was so beautifull. It is amazing, that Singapore authorities agreed on such a contemporary project.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a treat to walk around the Marina to visit the stores and buildings. We visited the Marina Bay Sands Observation Deck which was nice. I would not recommend it , however. It does not reflect anything other than consumerism in Singapore.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I didn't expect to enjoy my time at the garden much but I did. I got to see the tree, forget the name, in "Little Prince" that only grows in Africa I think, the whole place was well organized and kept well, must a see in Singapore!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Singapore Zoo is one of the better I have seen. The grounds are well maintained and they are very nice to walk around. The Zoo is split into different Zones to easily group the animals. Like all zoo animals, they are well fed so unless you watch a show, they don't really move a lot._x000D_
_x000D_
The Zoo was easy to get to. I caught up the Ang Mo Kio (North / South line). Then jumped on the 138 Bus from the terminal across the road. The bus takes about 30 mins but it drops off and picks up from the Zoo.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you love shopping this is the street to hit up. Tons of shops mostly high end. If your not a shopper its still worth taking a walk down this street to see whatâ€™s its all about.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We didn't know what to expect we enjoy plants but not enough to say this place rocked our world .So dont waste your time if you dont love flowers and dont take your kids there is nothing for them to do and they will be bored. But if you love plants and enjoy a walk then give it a crack its just not our choice of fun.Definetly bring a jumper or something warm we found it freezing inside but the gardens outside were much easier to enjoy because of the climate
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: we were there for the night outdoor sound and light show. it was worth it. crowded but the place is huge.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I spent a great deal of time walking in this area. It's especially nice at night. Very safe to walk around.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A Must Must Visit! Extremely unique attraction.
REVIEW_BODY: It is simply awesome. Light and sound show of the super trees is simply breath taking. The two conservatories are huge and spectacular. Unique in their own way. Just loved every bit of it. Even the Singapore Garden Festival was one of its kind. Extremely beautiful. Thank you Garden by the bay for such wonderful memories. Would love to visit again.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you're visiting Singapore, you'll want to go here at night and on more than one occasion. The history of the Quays ("Keys") is most interesting but the food is the reason to go. There are hundreds of restaurants along the Quays and plenty of nightlife.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard road is now like one large airport shopping mall but possibly even more generic. Prices are the same or even higher than airport malls with maybe even less range or choice. Sadly distinctive local shops and brands have all buy disappeared. Itâ€™s a bit like going to a zoo where you only ever go to look, although at a zoo the animals that you cannot afford are at least diverse and interesting.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: another attraction in marina bay sands
REVIEW_BODY: just next to flower dome this is also fully air conditioned ....there is a huge waterfall inside and large variety of plants.....
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You canâ€™t go wrong with the botanical gardens. Itâ€™s beautifully manicured and maintained. Thereâ€™s a lake with a couple of resident swans and many fish and tortises. While on your leisure walks you may spot the resident monitor lizards basking in the sun. Put on sunscreen and wear a hat when you go there.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This beautiful park consists of attractive, well kept walkways, well labelled specimen trees and framed historical notes. Approached by an escalator from a lower level, it is an oasis sitting above the city_x000D_
on a hillside, with lovely views East and West, as well as towards Marina Bay. Raffles's original house is situated here, but is undergoing renovation at present, and is closed off to the public.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: huge variety of orchids on show here, giving an Impression of what variety nature can really offer us
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This probably is the only night safari in the world. It was an amazing experience to watch so many animals up close (including wild animals like Tiger and Lion). Also, one need not walk if they cant, and can hop on to a road tram and take a trip of the Safari.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spend a couple of soothing hours in this beautiful garden. Rainforest walk with many interesting and informative signs; the orchid gardens are spectacular! Cloud forest glasshouse was fascinating and we really enjoyed our trip here.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard rd is the best area to shop in the World, better than Oxford rd in England. You can find from luxury clothes to very cheap.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We loved the atmosphere of Chinatown, that allows you to go back in time to the roots of this population that built Singapore. Don't miss the Chinese Heritage Center that tells you the story of these immigrants.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you want a lovely walk that isn't too long then do the walk around the bay. Only 3.2km, very picturesque.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A good quality kite will be of the best usage here, due to the strong coastal wind, kite flying can never be more satisfying. Do remember to get a thicker string to prevent your kite from being cut away by other kite user.
ADDRESS: 8 Marina Gardens Drive Marina Barrage, Singapore 018951, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Singapore city viewing and not a typical giant wheel
REVIEW_BODY: The speed is next to zero. Takes about 40 min for one revolution. It is meant for viewing from different heights and different angles, the great city of Singapore. Must experience. Paradise for photography lovers.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The view from the Singapore Flyer is better than the one from the top deck of Marina Bay Sands. I would rather spend money on this than pay money to the top deck of Marina Bay Sands.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was my my first visit to Singapore so Gardens by the Bay was not to be missed. The large 'trees' are great to see close up. The gardens are adjacent to the two large greenhouses where the Cloudforest is housed so can be included in your visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I went there in January and there were limited orchids on view. However, those that were in bloom were beautiful and worth the visit. Be aware that there is plenty of walking and changes in level.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We travelled over to Sentosa on the cable car and really enjoyed the experience. It was good value for money and a lovely way to enjoy the view of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: View is amazing. Large deck, can get busy. Definitely worth a visit. There is a cafe/souvenir shop there as well.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited river safari with a few friends recently. not many things to see though. We love the boat ride.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Six of us of varying ages, mobility and degrees of height phobia took the cable car from the Mount Faber terminus to the far end of Sentosa and back. Part of the trip was during a tropical storm. Everyone enjoyed the views, the ride and the amazing weather contrasts. We all felt safe. Well worth the visit - whatever the weather!
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Summary: 30 mins of shuttle, 30 mins of animal show, and 1 hour of nighttime zoo. Very good experience._x000D_
_x000D_
Note: The later you arrive, the less light there is to see the animals through the camera._x000D_
_x000D_
Our family was confused of what was to be expected, but got into line and onto to a open-air shuttle. Think Disneyland parking shuttle. From there, we drove slowly through animal enclosures taking pictures in the artificially made moonlight. It was hard getting shots to even be visible, but it was very cool to be so close to the animals. The ride lasted around 30 - 45 mins._x000D_
_x000D_
We followed the crowd into an animal show that got cancelled due to rain 1 minute into the show._x000D_
_x000D_
We then walked the Wallaby trail and found that it weaved between the roads used by the shuttles. The temperature was perfect and it was wonderful walking through the jungle seeing the animals. Definitely the best part of the safari._x000D_
_x000D_
Unfortunately, we had to run through half of the trail to catch the next show. Which consisted of well-trained exotic animals and fun acts. Everyone's favorite was the otters, of course.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Restaurants, Scenes, Climate, Culture, Variety, Expensive, MRT, Accessible, Travel, Vast, Endless Options
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The night safari was fun to do for a family, and a nice way to enjoy Singapore after the heat of the day.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A place that every member of a family enjoys. Children enjoy it best. The tram service inside makes the walk easy. The tram has three stops. Once you pay for the tram, you can avail it as many times as you wish. The bird show at four PM is the highest enjoyment. We get all the prominent bird variety. The birds get enough space and are happy to be there except the great Hornbill perhaps. The Waterfall aviary is an exciting place where the birds are very nearer to you .
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I have visited Zoo with my friends in total 5 young kids and i was surprised i could not find water to drink. I found two top ups areas but they are too far each other. I cannot believe is no drink water at vending machine. How do you think I can give to my small kids to drink coca cola and any other similar juice in a very hot weather. We reached the Zoo at 11am and left at 5pm almost dehydrated.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went there in the day time and it was very hot. The best time to visit is during the evening hours with the lights lighted up and the view of the Marina Bay in the background.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This Gallery is very popular with locals and tourists alike. Consequently the line for tickets is very long and takes a long time to get through - we noticed that it stayed that way all day - which was a shame as we were exhausted before we began and quite disoriented on how to get to the exhibition we most wanted to see. As one of the guides said "this place is a huge maze". We were excited to see the works of Yayoi Kusama and were not disappointed. The exhibits were beautifully curated, though it became stressful figuring out which works could be photographed or not and, with huge numbers of people determined to get as many selfies as they could, made for very stressed museum workers. Next time I would try and go when it is quieter. Very unique and beautiful colonial building.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice relocation of the Merlion, with platform for visitors extending over the river. Lets you get close now vs. the old days.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth a visit to see the old ways of Singapore. You will enjoy this if you are into looking at historical features
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Unfortunately the food court was closed down. I spent a few hou s here and went to hawker stalls close by. So much to see here and so many inexpensive shops around.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the Most Scenic Places in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the landmarks you must go if you visit Singapore. You get one of the greatest views this city has to offer and it is not as crowded and touristy (yet) as Esplanade.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Suggested by my son. Have some knowledge of the history of Singapore. My brother was stationed there in the Malaya Emergency with the Royal Signals. The lady who took my group around the Battlebox did a very good presentation. i did not attend the discussion at the end, as I was short of time.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great place close to Bughi street to see the religious practice of Singapore Chinese. The temple is dedicated to Kuan Yin and people come to pray and predict their fortune in interesting rituals. The temple is freely accessible, but no photographs inside.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Kuan Yin Thong Hood Cho Temple
ADDRESS: 178 Waterloo Street Kwan im Temple, Singapore 187964, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to take a walk and take some pictures. Lots of impressive architecture and photo opportunities. Also Plenty Restaurants of all varieties to experience.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of my favourite gardens. There is an interactive garden suitable for young children. The park often has special events such as movies and symphonies. A perfect place for all.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Get a good view of the city
REVIEW_BODY: It was worth doing, but it is really about just seeing the view of the city. There is no information regarding sites and places provided.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It cost money to get up there but you won't find a more spectacular view of Singapore. I just wish they would let you in to that infinity pool!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Trip to Singapore is incomplete without visiting Gardens by the Bay. Do take a walk on the OCBC skyway and then experience the evening light and music show
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Flowers from right around the world. Beautifully laid out and vivid colours. Do the Cloud garden too!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Reasonably priced with amazing views. There is heaps to see from the top, a must do while spending time in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went to the gardens by the Bay.... The flower dome N was mesmerized with the man made waterfall.... It was clean N beautiful.... We were so tired after the whole day travel but the sight of the waterfall kept us energized....
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Everybody had told us about the Marina Bay Sands Skypark (called "MBS" by locals), so we were looking forward to visiting. The experienced definitely was worth the wait! Amazing views of the city! Well worth doing.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Plenty of shops that sell everything from cheap gifts and chinese and Singaporian gifts. Tailors will harrass you to make you "a very good suit or dress"
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As most would ask... is this bridge really necessary.?? But hey, most of what we see in Singapore are unnecessary but then then wonders to the eyes. Same is true for this bridge, built not for necessity but to enjoy the possibilities of what Singaporeans can offer to the world. Creating pieces of architecture / buildings for the whole world to be jealous about. A great looking bridge which can be most enjoyed in the night to marvel at the MBS complex and the skyline and the old Bay area of Singapore.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I really enjoyed this zoo with the experience of wildlife and aquariums . The panda experience was excellent. Did not think much of the boat ride but rest of park made up for this . Otter enclosure was fun along with watching the graceful manatees ._x000D_
Have now visited several times and enjoyed each time .
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Singapore have certainly got this right! Bringing beautiful green areas into a bustling city, quite remarkable!_x000D_
Seeing is believing, this is truly a stunning place to visit, a work of art._x000D_
_x000D_
It is well worth the extra to go up the 'trees' and walk along the connecting walkway, stunning and excellent views. Get there first thing in the morning, you have the place practically to yourself!_x000D_
Sept 2017
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As someone who didnt know much of the history of Buddhism, this museum answered a lot of questions of the origin of the buddah. Free museum on the third floor. If your interested in history, this is worth checking out.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: An insight into the fall of Singapore WW2
REVIEW_BODY: This was a short four worth going on. You actually can't go in any other way and the information is fascinating.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the bay is a very unique garden with beautiful tree-like structures (iconic ones you see in most pictures). In day light, these are just ordinary but the real magic begins in the evenings. The tree lights are turned ON and it looks more attractive. Best time to visit is in the early evenings. These are musical light shows twice everyday for about 10-15 mins. You can go to the sky-bridge which is just a bridge connected between 2 trees (it can be fun specially for a family). There are even small garden trails to explore the nature with some info of types of flowers and insects and nature in general (if thatâ€™s you thing).
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a better way of an aerial view of the Southern part of Singapore than from a cable car! We saw fantastic views of the southern waterfront, the awesome architectural characters of the buildings around it, the economic & social activities below & Sentosa Island with its boundless attractions. The area is vibrant even on a weekday, theming with locals & tourists having a good time! The loop system of cable cars from 3 key points- Harbourfront, Mount Faber & Sentosa make good sense & offers satisfying birdâ€™s eye view.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens were just amazing and I was lucky enough cos it was a rainy day and by the time I got there it stopped :) I would suggest you pay and go up the main tree so you can enjoy some air con and have a really expensive coffee or water and of course have a great view of marina bay sands sky deck!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Place for A Walk or Picnic
REVIEW_BODY: Also known as Kebun Bunga Singapura and city's first UNESCO World Heritage site. Great place for a walk especially not weekends coz itâ€™s less crowd/people so you can enjoy more the place and less noise. Youâ€™ll definitely will see interesting plants or trees and flowers around including animals. No entrance fee, most recommended to bring your own food and drinks and the shops there can be very expensive. Bring some extra clothes to change incase you get wet due to the hot weather and umbrella/raincoats incase it rains.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: It's worthy to visit & night lazer show is so pretty
REVIEW_BODY: This attractive although will charge you some money, but still worthy to visit! When the night you can see the lazer show~ However, we choose another place to see also good! é€™å€‹åœ°é»žé›–ç„¶è¦æ”¯ä»˜ä¸€äº›è²»ç”¨ï¼Œä½†é‚„æ˜¯å€¼å¾—é€²åŽ»åƒè§€çš„ï¼ å¤œæ™šçš„æ™‚å€™ï¼Œå¯ä»¥çœ‹ç‡ˆå…‰ç§€ï¼Œä½†æˆ‘å€‘ä¸æ˜¯åœ¨è£¡é¢çœ‹ï¼Œæ˜¯åˆ°ç©ºä¸­èŠ±åœ’çš„è§€æ™¯å°è§€çœ‹å…¨æ™¯â‹¯é™¤äº†ç‡ˆå…‰ä¹Ÿæœ‰éŸ³æ¨‚ï¼Œéžå¸¸çš„ç¾Žéº—ï½ž
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Compared to the Cloud Forest, this was a bit of a disappointment. All too mumsy. Lots of flowers and plants from all over the world. Good, but if you have time or money for one, choose the Cloud Forest over this.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a visit. If you are visiting on more than one day get the pass, it means you can spilt the visit and return any number of times and you get discount in the shop and cafes
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I have visited this place a few years ago before. The surrounding area is really change now. It looks nicer with a lot of restaurants in the surrounding area. It's located close to the Fullerton hotel. It's a good place to visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited Singapore Zoo last week to experience breakfast with Orangutans. There was a great choice of breakfast fare to cater for all tastes and whilst eating, a small group of Orangutans come down from the tree canopy to a platform adjacent to the dining area to be hand fed by their keepers._x000D_
_x000D_
To see these wonderful endangered primates up close is a wonderful experience. Guests are also invited to have photos taken in front of them as they munch their way through corn on the cob! After theyâ€™ve eaten their fill, they return to the tree tops.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Histories about Chinese immigrants - a must to visit!
