REVIEW_BODY: With audio (included in the ticket price) explained about the history: the terrible situation and rough condition of Chinese immigrants with simple display about the mini square rooms they used to live, I felt impressed with this heritage center. More than just room display, I got a lot of information about how they lived, survived, and what challenge the immigrants faced during that period. Definitely a must to visit with audio. Don't skip the stories available in the audio!
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This dome is very impressive. As soon as I entered this dome, the giant waterfall spellbound me. Walk up and then down the cloud forest was a great experience.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Visionary modern gardens - a must see in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
My partner and stayed at the Marina Bay Sands and we walked around the Gardens early over two mornings. What an amazing job Singapore has done in balancing up the downtown high rises with such a large open space for residents and tourists alike._x000D_
_x000D_
The gardens are just beautiful, very clean and the man made vase tress which are growing plants over them will look truly amazing when fully covered in the next few years._x000D_
_x000D_
Don't miss this place on any visit to Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A peaceful place to sit and contemplate. The rooftop garden is worth the climb up from the 4th floor, with a very large prayer wheel and 10,000 small buddhas. Located close to Chinatown this temple is worth a visit.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is so nice for morning walk, quiet, clean, and beautiful. There are so many spots to explore here and it's free for public. This place located right in front of MRT station, to get there just take East-West Line MRT to Chinese Garden.
ADDRESS: 1 Chinese Garden Road Chinese Garden, Singapore 619795, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Soak up the atmosphere of Marina Bay
REVIEW_BODY: Such a fascinating focal point in Singapore. The Marina Bay Sands hotel is the imposing backdrop to this area. The vast Gardens by the Bay is located directly behind the hotel & definitely worth a visit - also at night it takes on a completely new persona when itâ€™s colourfully lit up. There are many (& mostly designer) shops in front of the hotel which attract a lot of visitors. On the opposite side you have the old colonial Fullerton Hotel in complete contrast to the modern buildings around. The many tall tower blocks of the business & financial district sit close behind. Crowds gather to visit the popular Merlion statue. The best way to experience this close up is to jump on an electric powered boat tour in nearby Clarke Quay & enjoy the guided trip along the fascinating waterway leading to the Bay Area. If you time it right in the evening you can be in the bay as the nightly laser show is projected from the Marina Bay sands hotel. Another crowd pleaser. It is now possible to walk the entire way around the Bay Area taking in all the various & diverse buildings & attractions along with the atmosphere. This walk also takes in the walk across the fascinating Helix Bridge. Another fascinating feature which must be viewed.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a must see attraction and part of the Garden by the Bay area thatâ€™s is just amazing, Photoâ€™s donâ€™t do this place justice but I tried with my ultra wide lens. Take a jumper with you to wear because itâ€™s not hot inside. Enjoy
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Excellent view of singapore. This is a must go for all Travellers. The view is stunning especially in the evening. Can view almost 360 degree of entire singapore. Definitely a place for folks to take selfies and the view. Very romantic
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's so beautiful just chilling there at nighttime with an ice cream. It's really beautiful with all the lights.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was fortunate enough to get there as a ceremony was just beginning and the smell of incest and the chanting was mesmerizing.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went on this tour after it was recommended by a friend. The tour takes you into the bunker/battle box where the Malay Campaign was planned. The tour was really interesting, with great models and artefacts to look at as well as videos. If anything, it would have been great to have a bit more time in the rooms to read the display boards. Better signage to find the Information Centre would be REALLY helpful! An insightful tour showing a different side of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lots to see ,lots to eat , the place gets very busy with local at lunch time coming from offices to eat. A large number of shops and retailers of just about everything. I like to eat , pick stuff from various street vendor and walk rather than to be tied down in the one venue. Late afternoon or night is great and if very hungry may plonk in a venue for main meal ,quite an experience.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best attractions in Singapore is the Sands SkyPark Observation Deck
REVIEW_BODY:
One of the best attractions in Singapore is the Sands SkyPark Observation Deck, some 57 floors into the Singapore skyline. From there you can see most of the city State and experience a beautiful sunset (partially blocked by skyscrapers). You get an amazing view of the marina bay, the city and the Garden by the Bay park. If you hang around long enough you can get a nice view of the lit up garden below you and other buildings. Tickets cost around Â£23 (US $17)._x000D_
You can also book a night at the hotel and get access to the famous infinity pool they have.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I am not a Hindi so my review is based solely on the visual impact of this wonderful place. I don't know that I would make a special trip to see it, but it is certainly worth seeing if you are anywhere near this location. It's bright and colourful and if you are fortunate enough to be there at the time of a ritual, it is also quite a moving experience._x000D_
I must add that you are made to feel welcome here, so don't feel you are intruding.
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Simulation of the Animal's Natural Habitat
REVIEW_BODY: First time I saw a Zoo were you don't feel that animals are in captivity. All of the animals inside the Singapore Zoo were like in free roaming in their natural habitat. But there are safety partitions like glass, trenches, fences for the visitors depending on the animals. Unique and one of the best attractions in SG. Makes you feel one with the animals habitat.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I found the experience too expensive as the safari was too short. But was definitely different so for the experience one could say it was worth spending the money.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Music and light show is amazing one. Big artificial metel trees are looks nice in this garden. Walking at night is amazing experience.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the World's tallest indoor Waterfall
REVIEW_BODY: The large, climate-controlled dome has spiralling walkways and one of the worldâ€™s tallest indoor waterfalls that rains down from over 30 metres above. It's exciting - bring your camera & enjoy.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fully air conditioned during the day, very pleasant to walk around for hours, spectacular floral displays
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
To those who, like me, came to Singapore in the very early seventies, whet is left of Chinatown isn't much. To the vast majority of the others it's fun even though it now looks like a vast souvenir shop. The best part is the food and the food stalls_x000D_
in the evening or the food courts where you can choose from an array of stands.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is one of my favourite places to take the kids. Usually we donâ€™t manage to see everything. Itâ€™s way too exhausting for the littles but riding the tram around will cover the main animals (rhinos, zebras, giraffes, lions, tigers, some monkeys). Then weâ€™ll pick a few exhibits to see and go see those, timing them to coincide with some feedings and a show if the kids want (sea lion show is the best)._x000D_
_x000D_
Feedings we love: hamadryas baboons (I could watch these all day); giraffes (blue tongues!!)_x000D_
_x000D_
Favourite exhibits: fragile forest (up close with a variety of birds and small animals like sloth and mouse deer); those baboons; cheetah (get nice and close thru the glass. It paces quite a bit so good for little ones who find it hard to spot still animals from afar); all the apes and monkeys._x000D_
_x000D_
Playground: this is why you need your swim stuff. We always cap our zoo visit with the water playground because you will surely be hot and sticky and thereâ€™s nothing like jumping in a pool of water to fix that. Slides and fountains galore. Let the kids loose and you can sit aside and veg for a bit. Or if your kids are little, itâ€™s nice to stand in the pool too. There was minders keeping an eye out but if you have an under 3 year old, youâ€™ll have to be more mindful cos the water is about knee high for an adult. We adore this playground and iâ€™d Keep at least an hour for this if you donâ€™t wanna deal with a lot of whinging about leaving._x000D_
_x000D_
Tip: the day zoo is a full day trip with kids. Donâ€™t plan to do all three parks or even two in one day. This way, you can go at a non stressful pace and spend as much time as you like staring at one animal._x000D_
Of the three zoo parks, this is the best one for little kids. (Night safari is crowded and small kids find it hard to spot the animals in the dark, river safari was underwhelming for me... plus, no water playground!!)_x000D_
_x000D_
Food: limited options and all crowded. We usually just do KFC at the playground. Pizza and ice cream at the entrance is also good. The restaurants inside are ok too if you really need a nice place to rest. Expect high prices and mediocre fare tho. Of course, you could just pack sandwiches and picnic somewhere._x000D_
_x000D_
Strollers: the zooâ€™s pretty accessible so thatâ€™s totally an option. You can rent one at the entrance or even a buggy if you are lazy.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: good walk through the forest of singapore, although humid but with the right outdoor wear it will be a pleasant walk but remember to bring 1.5liter/person of water to be comfortable.
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of my favourite places in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Lots of stalls to find little bits and pieces for yourself, family, or friends. Restaurants to eat many different types of food. Cheap beers (always a big plus!)
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is must visit place if one is visiting Singapore...It is located at Marina Bay Sands...From Singapore Flyer it is walking distance...Don't miss it if one is in Singapore...It is easily accessible by local transport...The place offers marvelous view ..
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Today we had visited the River Safari it one of the beautiful place to visit and it is told that it is only one of this kind ; But worth to visit here we feel that we stein seaand moving with animals so that much beautiful arrangements especially kids will enjoy lot we can see birfsshow and rare star fish etc and great e responds are main attraction
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing at night and for sunsets - prepare yourself for loads of tourists
REVIEW_BODY: This is a must-visit sight - it is near shopping complexes and restaurants so you are not short of things to do. This is a great picture taking opportunity as you can see all of Marina Sands Bay connecting to the rest of Singapore.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Huge nature park to relac with freinds n loved ones.Has a rustic yet neat look with some activities going on..cycling jog walk or simply gazing at the plants trees ponds etc..
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is a fantastic experience. We did the flowers and the cloud garden as well as the outdoor sky bridge. We spent hours looking at all of the plants - they have really done a magnificent job pulling together species from around the world. Highly recommend this for anyone who's interested in plants even a tiny bit._x000D_
_x000D_
One suggestion to the team curating Gardens by the Bay is that we really would have appreciated more labels for the different, exotic flower species. Also, just note that there are loads of rude tourists stopping traffic to take family photos like this is Olan Mills. Ugh. But that's not really a reflection on the place - enjoy your time there!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Must do if you have never been to any other china town outside of china
REVIEW_BODY:
This is a good place to go shopping for soveneirs and if you are a TinTin fan to go there to visit and buy TinTin memorabilia as there is a full shop dedicated to TinTin._x000D_
_x000D_
ALso, if you are here, do visit the Buddha tooth relic temple. This is an active Buddhist temple, well built and maintained..
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lots of bars, pubs and restaurants
REVIEW_BODY: I think every city has a area like this the meeting place for locals after work and a tourist trap on the side. In all fairness I walk through it in the afternoon. It was quiet and uneventful. FYI This is where you can catch the boat ride tours.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The zoo has a nice selection of animals, reptiles, birds, etc.There were several atypical specimens to entice one. The one that stood out for us was the African painted dogs. The enclosures for animals seemed okay to us. We walked the full zoo and we were tired, but not exhausted, by the end.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a great place for an afternoon or evening drink. Loads to do and see with some fantastic photo opportunities .
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: In singapore with many highrise building this looks abit redundent. The price tag of $30 was too expensive for experince
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great atmosphere and lots to look at, really enjoyed my time here. Plenty of shopping and restaurants plus interesting temples
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Get the annual pass if u live in SGP with kids!
REVIEW_BODY:
Took my 1.5yr old daughter early a few weekends ago. She was fascinated by all of the animals big and small. But particularly the elephants, lions and chimps were highlights judging by her squealing and excited chatter._x000D_
Easy to get around and just enough to feel like you've experienced a wide variety of animals. The walk in enclosure with bats, toucans, lemurs and other mammals is awesome. And we timed it just right to see a feeding session. Looking forward to our next visit.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you dont want to spend your money to visit Garden by the bay, u can go here and u can see 3 places in a row.. Marina bay sands view, Garden by the bay view, and one cave I dont know that name..
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I have never seen a better botanical garden. Great concept and very well executed. Must must visit. Wow
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Perfect outing with family on a sunny day !
REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore zoo is very well kept and maintained . It is a good place to sepnt time with family. Lots to learn and know.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited during the day and spent hours walking round the gardens and the exhibitions in the domes.We also paid to climb to the skywalk which was great.We had a lovely lunch in the beautiful cafe_x000D_
We returned at night for the light show which was amazing and not to be missed.Very busy but still had a great view.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Canâ€™t understand the good reviews:_x000D_
_x000D_
Nothing, I mean absolutely nothing there to see, long huge empty rooms/walls ; poorly indicated,_x000D_
_x000D_
We did it in less than 50mns._x000D_
_x000D_
Think about art as jam... the less you have, the more you spread it on your toast._x000D_
_x000D_
See my pictures: long boring empty corridors, not even a picture on the walls!!!_x000D_
_x000D_
Absolute waist of time and money, just go to the national museum nearby.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Had never heard of Battlebox before so was not sure what to expect. Venue easy enough to get to from train station. Our tour guide was extremely knowledgeable and friendly and this enhanced the tour experience. Very large area downstairs, bigger than we expected, but very interesting with some short videos and written information on the events of the war and what happened in the Battlebox. Would recommend a visit.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a lovely Buddhist temple said to house a broken tooth of Buddha. This is good to incorporate with more activities for the day as the visit isn't time consuming. It houses some beautiful statuary.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were pleasantly surprised to almost walk right on the Flyer the first day we were in town. We went on a Sunday morning around 10:30 AM.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Super collection from across the globe . Cool environment inside the huge dome .. dream place for flower lovers .
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The super trees illuminate at night at 7:30pm and 8:30pm, so twice a night._x000D_
You can get a good vantage point from the connecting bridge of the MBS hotel to the garden without having to pay to actually be inside the area or on the skybridge. The illuminations lasts for approx' 15 mins and its quite spectacular. At day, it's quite a site and it really comes alive at night.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I think this place was overrated. Although the falls was breathtaking, and the man made trees were works of art, but other than that, nothing really extraordinary. We went there at night to avoid the heat of the afternoon, and to see the lights at night. We were able to watch the Light Show, which was ok. Not really something unforgettable. The queues were long, especially going to top of the falls. Onlyto find out thereâ€™s really nothing more to see.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Take a parasol for a stroll through this beautiful park and gardens. It's very hot but your efforts will be rewarded!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful view of the city from the marina bay observation deck. Noting much though. But if you visit Singspore you got to visit the marina bay sands it gives you a look of the infinity pool.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Flower Dome is great as a visitor attraction, with well-planned paths and signposted routes to organise large numbers of visitors through a confined space. There is an impressive collection of succulents upon entry, and there are samples of plants from around the world throughout the dome (including some dwarf baobabs). There is clearly botanical input, but this is not Kew Gardens or Kirstenbosch by any means (and I don't think it aims to be)._x000D_
_x000D_
The centrepiece to the Flower Dome is their seasonal themed displays. I visited during their Tribal Tempo display, which is African-themed and had lots of King proteas in beautiful bouquets which reminded me a lot of my Cape Town home. There was also carpets of begonias and gerberas, with wire renditions of the Big Five (including a fake lion on a manmade klip, which clearly harked to the Lion King version of Africa). It was a beautiful display, but about as authentic to Africa as the Night Safari is to a drive in Kruger Park.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Feast for eyes of nature lovers
REVIEW_BODY:
This is one attraction in Singapore I would highly recommend. One requires one full day for casual tourist. For serious botanist 2-3 days required to relish the place. Need to walk a lot....full day so carry proper shoes._x000D_
Must have a camera to capture the variety of the flora maintained at this place._x000D_
Special recommendation is to visit the dome when the mist is released, one feels walking through the cloud._x000D_
The small night show at 'Super Trees' is enthralling!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This must be one of the very few weather-controlled gardens in the world. There are 2 giant air-conditioned domes. The Flower Dome's exhibits changed with the season. Tulip and cherry blossom in spring, rose and dahlia in summer etc. The other dome has a permanent exhibit of tropical plants with a water fall. When you are overwhelmed by the tropical heat in Singapore, always good to make a stop here and linger in the gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The Place to go for Orchid Fans
REVIEW_BODY: Second time we have visited, last time was 5 years ago. Still as good as we remembered it. The place to go if you love Orchids.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The gardens can be brutally hot in the Singaporean day, but step into the Cloud Forest Dome and watch a gigantic waterfall cool a dome designed to mimic the borneo cloud-forests. It's partner, the Flower Dome, is sadly a lot less awesome._x000D_
_x000D_
The other thing the Gardens are famous for is the Supertree Grove, an artificial structure of 50m tall steel sculptures resembling trees, with a dense network of climbers and other greenery clinging to the side. Once it's done (and the plants have completely covered the outside), they'll look like giant living trees._x000D_
_x000D_
You can pay $8 to access the Skywalk that hangs suspended amongst the trees, but a better value might be to go to the central tree, which contains a restaurant. Pay a $10 cover charge (which includes one drink, or $18 if you want an alcoholic beverage) and you can lounge either inside or on the rooftop overlooking the gardens and the grove. The restaurant itself is surprisingly scruffy for such an expensive location, so I probably wouldn't plan for an extended visit, but the view is nice.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place to have a dinner
REVIEW_BODY: great view along side the river, many seafood and any other restaurant , like europe, italian, japanese, and more..
ADDRESS: 1 Bonham Street Uob Building, Singapore 049782, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Make sure you visit at night for the light show. This was our favorite attraction in Singapore. We were lucky to find seats and the show was free.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I last visited the zoo about 8 years ago and was still amazed by this park. The enclosures are fab and everything well kept. The rainforest setting ia perfect and fun to walk around and relax._x000D_
The highlight for me are still the orangutans who are able to free roam in the tree topa above you. One of the best enclosures I have seen._x000D_
The rainforest walkthrough is also a must and getting pretty mucb face to face with fruit bats having thier lunch was great._x000D_
_x000D_
There were a few new bits added since the last time, including a reptile house, which had some great specimens and a walkthrough also._x000D_
_x000D_
I got to the zoo via Safari Gate (at Suntec City) which cost $12 return and was much easier than train or taxi._x000D_
_x000D_
If you are in the area go, its a must! And depending how long you stay you can also go to the newer River Safari or Night Safari in the same day.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited this area of the botanic gardens - you have to pay a small entrance fee but its well worth it the displays are beautiful.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Clarke Quay during the day time has lots of restaurants, shops etc and is a nice place to chill by the river, at night it turns into a party area, loud, lots of lights and a fun place to be._x000D_
_x000D_
It gets very busy, and you can also pick up the river boats from here._x000D_
_x000D_
Well worth a visit if you fancy a fun night out
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is what the future should look like, buildings covered in plants! Beautiful place! Bring your umbrella, we got rained on.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can spend much of your time underground in air conditioner splendour if you want. Lots of shops to See and shop In.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a few hours of our time. A stunning Cornacopia of plants from all over the globe, set inside and outside. Only a short walk from the Marina Bay Sands. Unfortunately very little information on opening times and they closed for lunch. The cloud forest was our favorite. Take some time out and go!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A wonderful green oasis in a vibrant city
REVIEW_BODY: This large city park provides a lovely experience with a wide range of plants (including the national orchid garden for a small charge). Entrance is free and it is served by its own Metro station. There is plenty of open grass for picnics etc. You will need nice weather, but there are some shelters and a decent range of eating places.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Iâ€™ve been on this twice now, first time at night, which was really pretty with all the city lights, and this time during the day, which gives you a much better view obviously. Day or night, I think itâ€™s a must do in Singapore!_x000D_
Itâ€™s a â€œshare rideâ€ so unless youâ€™re in a group of 8 youâ€™ll be sharing your capsule with others who may not respect your personal space, so bear that in mind. But itâ€™s a glass enclosure so thereâ€™s plenty of room for everyone to get photos (although some people feel their need for a photo shoot over rules your needs, but thatâ€™s people huh!)_x000D_
Itâ€™s a great view over the Marina and surrounding areas with running commentary the whole way. Takes about 30 minutes all up, is air conditioned and has a bench seat, along with a touch screen information point._x000D_
Itâ€™s an enjoyable experience!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing place , large gardens and fantastic attractions
REVIEW_BODY: It was a amazing place, not what I expected at all, the outdoor gardens very nice, did have not much time, but will for sure have more time, the indoor gardens were unbelievable, the view from inside to outside part of the experience , the plants and trees very good arranged and you did feel in all the parts of the world,we then went into the rainforest, with big waterfall and a special spectacular skywalk, we were lucky to have a big thunderstorm outside what to me was part of the inside experience,, a worthwhile visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Very Good, Shame About The Poor Crowd Control
REVIEW_BODY:
Booked in for the 20:15 bus, the queue started from 19:30. Some people just do not know how to queue, trying to push themselves through to the front by saying their family is there. Staff were not bothered about this. Once you are seated on the tram, you are taken at a slow speed through the park, you get to see the animals in the night which was very cool. Its a shame that it is quite quick, a stop of a minute or so would be nice so you could look for the animal._x000D_
There is also a walking option should you want to do this too, but we decided not to.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Singapore Zoo closes door at 6pm everyday but from now till end year, it welcome visitors to a mesmerizing night walk trail in an interactive, illuminated forest - as part of 45th anniversary of the zoo._x000D_
_x000D_
This experience will treat visitors to a mesmerising multimedia experience around the enchanted world of the Singapore Zoo after dark._x000D_
_x000D_
Rainforest Lumina at Singapore Zoo will open from 1 July 2018 onwards. Admission time will be from 7.30 pm to midnight. There are 7 entry timings daily. Last entry will be at 10.30 pm._x000D_
Admission costs for Rainforest Lumina are $22 per adult and $15 per child. *Take note that admission to Rainforest Lumina is separate from admission to Singapore Zoo and Night Safari.*_x000D_
_x000D_
The experience is designed by Moment Factory, creators of the original Forest lumina in Parc de la Gorge de Coaticook, Canada._x000D_
_x000D_
There are NO real animals but only virtual animals. Two interesting part was the "Sing Like An Animal" - With your voice(Sing or scream), bring light and awaken the digital creatures at the Zooâ€™s iconic White Tiger enclosure. Very beautiful!_x000D_
_x000D_
The other was "Play Like An Animal" - Fun & short interactive exhibit â€“ Bunny hop to summon the Creature Crew._x000D_
_x000D_
Most recommended for families with small children, those with teens/teenagers usually will be there to take their Instagram photos. And we see many!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a beautiful park which is very large so remember water and sun cream as it is very hot walking around. The cafes in the park were very disappointing and very expensive for what they are
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best of the Parks in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
Personally, this is my favourite park amongst the Zoo, Bird Park and River Safari._x000D_
There are seriously so many interesting animals and birds to encounter along the way, and very often right up to your face. It is a wonder how come these animals do not bite! haha! Take the tram ride, but my advice is that you SHOULD stop at every stop and walk the trails in that area, lest you miss out all the fun and close encounters with exotic animals.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Our tour was from the top deck of the City Tour bus-Lots of small shop-house shopping and eating opportunities
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Take the MRT to Bayfront and follow the signs for Gardens by the Bay. Once there, there are signs all over the place to the various attractions. We had no queues at all for the OCBC skyway and just went straight up in the lift. The cost is SGD 8 per adult and SGD 5 for children (up to 12 years). They say that you have 15 minutes before they move you along but I'm not sure how this is enforced. The views are great from the walkway and you can time it to go up when the light show starts (7.45pm and 8.45pm) if you like, but I think the views would be better from below for that. The lift is available for coming down too but you can take the stairs if you wish. No worries about vertigo at all on this and I'm a bit scared of heights!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Gardens by the Bay is a must see for all travelers to this jewel of a country. I spent several hours jogging the garden, and ending with the Skywalk, and a lovely dinner at the restaurant at the super tree Grove. Enjoy the special shows of light and sound, you will not be disappointed!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to spend several hours.
REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore Botanic Gardens is more expansive than I expected. Such a variety of trees and plants as well as a beautiful lake with swans and turtles. Plenty of places to sit. Limited food available. Entry is free.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We are given an in depth knowledge and explanation of the culture and history. Our queries are answered professionally.
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Supertree Grove is an amazing site to see. Huge metal trees are covered in plants and flowers. There is even a walkway between some of the "trees". Come here for the light show at 7.45 and 8.45 in the evening. The light show is free, although there is a charge if you want to go on the walkway.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: So many shopping malls, so much to see and shop for!! We did some homework before we arrived to know where the locations of shops we wanted to see but when we got there all that went out the window and we went wild.. The streets are so clean and beautiful with the gardens and building architecture, once inside the malls it is another level of amazingness... We were lucky enough to be there for the start of their GSS - Great Singapore Sale. Very happy with the bargains we found!!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: With the MRT making little India an easy get to I would suggest that you pay a visit once you get of the train the aroma is a real sense to the nose, just wonder around and enjoy every thing it has to offer the food,culture and every thing else that go's with Little India
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I want to go back here. My favourite place set in a plantation. So many different themed gardens, the jungle of which was my favourite. There were hundreds of big tortoises swimming in the lake together with monitor lizards which were a few feet long. The monitor lizards were also walking about the park which was very surprising due to their size, absolutely brilliant.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of a kind, a must have experience in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The best way to arrive there from the city was in a taxi, direct, simple and witnout re-selling or overexpenses for a tour. The zoo is great, as the main parkl. The river exciting and awesome. Do not buy the 4 parks ticket. They are not in the same location: The Zoo and River :they are!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Went here for the cherry blossoms display. It wasn't fun because the guides kept telling us to move along, so there wasn't really much time to enjoy the flowers. Also, the information displayed wasn't sufficient, in my opinion -- it's more like a "look and see" than "look and know more about" place. It was nice that they have desert plants though, because it wouldn't be comfortable going to the desert just to see cactuses._x000D_
_x000D_
The Cloud Forest is more interesting for me.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Had a chance to be there before the Chinese New Year and the entire street was packed to the gills with a sea of people shopping from the numerous shops._x000D_
Had a chance to see the many decorations used for the Chinese new years and got a sampling of the food too.Easy access by MRT and a really cool place.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place has everything, crazy busy with people, food on every corner and you can shop and buy just about anything, totally typical Chinatown!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We stayed at the hotel so the admission to the Skypark was included in our hotel price. Could visit as many times as we wanted which was great. The view from the top is amazing with both city views and garden views. If you are visiting Singapore its a must see attraction. Is it worth $20 dollars?? you decide.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Yup. Roar! That may be all that you will hear cos most of the time (unless you're equipped with night-vision device), you'll be hearing roars and whistles, but unable to see animals. Some maybe obvious, but the dim (natural) lighting will not help if you also have night-vision problems._x000D_
_x000D_
Skip this, even though you can get an all-access pass that may save you some money. Trust me, the return-trip (if you're travelling by public transport) is not fun at all with the crowds all competing to get out of Mandai zoo at once._x000D_
_x000D_
Be patient. Exercise lots of patience. Do not harm any animals, and humans.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Skip this place; donâ€™t care about customers
REVIEW_BODY:
Booked 30 people for a pleasant evening meal. The only positive thing is the nearby botanical garden. Meal was forgettable and poor. Service abysmal and they could care less about the customer. Tables not set up as asked; they argued. Then they served â€œfamily styleâ€ dishes for each table (nice concept) but NOT ENOUGH PORTIONS ON THE PLATES FOR EACH PERSON!!! For instance, at our table of 8 people, they served a basket with 4 rolls only and a chicken dish with only 6 pieces!!! When we complained, they only brought more portions for some of the food AND THEN CHARGED US EXTRA ON THE BILL. So we paid extra just to have one portion per person, when they knew exactly how many people we were going to be. The waiters and waitresses were totally disinterested during the meal and the manager at the end totally unapologetic. You could see that customer satisfaction was the LAST thing on his mind._x000D_
See the botanical gardens and stay away from the 2 restaurants in the park (same management and kitchen)._x000D_
By the way, food quality was only average. Nothing special and certainly nothing memorable except the bad experience.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: this is amazing and was not what I was expecting at all, green and cool and so well thought out...we loved it
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good experience but super crowded on weekends. The waterfalls were quite spectacular and it was really cooling in the dome. May need a shawl if you dun like the cold.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Very old temple here in singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
This temple has a very long history. I remember when I was just a small kid, my godmother did bring me to this place and I believe it must have been at least 35 years ago._x000D_
_x000D_
This is a very famous temple in Singapore and most probably, 80-90% of the Singaporean have been to this temple in their life at least once. It can get very crowded during the lunar 1st and 15th day of the month and also, especially during the Chinese festival like the Chinese New Year.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Kuan Yin Thong Hood Cho Temple
ADDRESS: 178 Waterloo Street Kwan im Temple, Singapore 187964, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This morning visited this temple located at South Bridge Road (Chinatown)._x000D_
_x000D_
At 7.45am, the temple was having a ritual. Many devotees were asking for blessings. More and more people started coming in. Colourful interiors, many little shrines and many deities. One temples but many gods and goddesses. One shrine was dedicated to the Elephant God "Ganesha"._x000D_
_x000D_
Admussion is free but video camera ($6) & camera ($3) need to pay a fee at the counter next to the entrance. Took the pictures discreetly using a mobile phone but I did not pay._x000D_
_x000D_
About 20 minutes to complete touring.
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You will be enchanted by the display and varieties of the Ochids. Great care is taken in the layout and thought of the garden (within the Botanical Gardens).
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
From the gorgeous super tree structures, to the delicious Hawker centre Satay by the Bay this place is a must visit. Entry is free but there are extra charges to enter some of the areas._x000D_
If travelling with younger children, be sure to take swim wear and a towel and visit the children's garden. There is a free water play area and gorgeous tree house playground.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Only thing that seems to be open before 10am
REVIEW_BODY: Went as nothing else was open before ten am. Nice walk around, orchids were beautiful and the rainforest walk was good
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Chinese and Japanese Gardens in Jurong
REVIEW_BODY:
Chinese and Japanese Gardens in Jurong._x000D_
Had a chance to visit these 2 gardens and was charmed by their beauty. Do allocate more time when visiting the 2 gardens their unique architecture and buidings, eg. the teahouse, the pagoda and the bridges._x000D_
Great for locals and visitors to visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Chinese Garden Road Chinese Garden, Singapore 619795, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We walked around the gardens in the morning. What an amazing place to be, went into the domes where they have the cherry blossom trees and heaps more, it was amazing. Walked along the sky walk and had a great view of the garden any the marina bay hotel.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went for the view and also ordered cocktails and snacks which were the price of a meal in an upscale restaurant. Oh, well, the view was worth it. Panorama of the city and breathtaking as afternoon turned into night. Even if you are just in town on a cruise ship, donâ€™t miss it. Donâ€™t bother with a tour, this you can do own your own.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Supertrees are OK, but probably not worth it
REVIEW_BODY: The concept is cool and the trees are quite impressive. But the view from the walkway (which you have to pay to access) really isn't that much better than many other free views around. While it is cool to be walking around up there, not sure it is worth the price.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Cloud Forest brilliantly done, but WAY too crowded...
REVIEW_BODY:
The Cloud Forest is a victim of its own success, it is so instagramable that every millennial in the world seems to be there doing just that._x000D_
_x000D_
Kew gardens and Eden Project both are similar to this in concept, but not scale.I'd say go to England and see the latter.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This gives an aerial and panoramic view of Santosa Island.. cable cars are very neat and newly made. Staff was good too..it makes us see forest to harbor to island. Very small kids would not love it very much but adults would really like it..
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is definitely a place for night life enjoyment. It's setup where it's out in the opened and you can enjoy drinks. Overall I find it ok but not super wowed.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I think this attraction is best watched either from the flyer or from the rooftop of Marina Sands Bay
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Early in the morning we went to the Singapore zoo with friends and kids. Thinking it would be nice for the kids to take a nice boat ride at the zoo. This thing is new for us because we visit the zoo many times but this time is with the boat ride. However, we did not know that there is a height limit so please bare in mind if you want to bring small kids to the boat ride. In the end we leave the place a little disappointed because the kids are too short according to the height limit. But will definitely go again next time when the kids are bigger.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Too long to wait for tram
REVIEW_BODY: This is my second visit to the Night Safari and this time I was disappointed. After having a wonderful afternoon at the River Safari we went to the Night Safari. The show has good but then we were told to wait for the tram and it would be only a 20 minute wait but instead we waited in line over one hour. I feel the staff should have suggested we walk around the Night zoo first and then come back to the tram. We were all tired and cranky after waiting an hour for the tram. On a positive note, the food at the restaurants was really nice.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Have been here a number of times and really do enjoy going. Some days more crowded than others (go early!) but a great place to spend half a day viewing wildlefe, often without a large fence in the way. In general humane treatment of animals, as opposed to many other places throught Asia, and nice habitat in the enclosures. Definitely worth a stop.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: interesting view on the way up
REVIEW_BODY: I wouldn't put it at the top of your list... It is a little out of the way as you need to get to it from the old Harbor front mall. The cars are not air conditioned either. There is not really much to do at the top. Best to do it first thing in the morning before it gets too hot.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I visited the National Gallery Singapore on 9th of June 2017 which was the first day for the exhibition of the art of Kusama. I was lucky to attend that exhibition before I left Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Having 3 days in Singapore we often came to Clarke quay in the evenings just for the nice atmosphere, you will not pay more for a drink in Asia though, $60-$70 for 4 drinks was enough each night, food quite prices too
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: In Singapore this is one iconic park that is a must on everyoneâ€™s list. Accessible to young children up to senior citizens , those in wheelchairs or with strollers. Magnificent especially at night . Donâ€™t miss the light show
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: You just have to do it
REVIEW_BODY: The sky park sits on top of a very strange shaped hotel but apart from being expensive to use the lift to the top the view is breathtaking and should not be missed
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is a rip off. Pay SG$23 per person for a 45 second ride to the deck, on which you are restricted to one small area unless you are a hotel guest. As a visitor you can't even access the bar to enjoy the view while having a drink._x000D_
Don't waste your time or money.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The entrance is in the heart of Chinatown. After paying the entry fee you receive a individual guide in the language you require. Itâ€™s easy to operate and the tour is numbered with commentary at each location. It explains the early arrivals to Singapore and which Countries they came from and the reasons for migration. The heritage centre is over three floors. One floor is a replica of the typical living conditions and traders than would have occupied a house like this in times gone by. There is a full explanation of how the City was divided into districts and the hardships that they had to endure. It was a really interesting visit and I was glad I visited on my first day in Singapore to have a better understanding of the history and culture. I would choose your time as it can be busy as the building is narrow. When we visited there was a school trip which at times was chaotic!
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We came here near closing time, about 5pm. Probably because of the time there were very few people, it was very tranquil. Stayed till almost 7pm, they close at 6pm, rangers didn't find us earlier. Need about 4 hours to see everything
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Artificial Technology garden,great music and light show.Good time to visit is in the evening time of the day
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We spent a full day at these gardens. Wonderfully presented with two huge domes housing such a display of Flora and Forna from all over the world. I suggest that visitors take the audio tour first then walk around the areas that interest them. The Singapore heat is something to be faced when walking outside but the two glass domes (the largest in the world) are cool and inviting.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Walk about the gardens and take in the sights and smells of the plants, enjoy the quiet and relax.Take time to see the many differing plantings from around the globe.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice place for a stroll around......but I'm a sucker for Chinese temples so I may be biased! Worth a visit
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gorgeous inside with tons of "gold" and over 100 VERY nice statues of Buddha. This is a genuine temple, so you will encounter many people praying. I liked the "zodiac" Buddha's with a statue and description for each of the 12 signs. Be sure to wear sone thing that covers your upper arms and knees. If you forget, they have "aprons" for wearing while in the temple.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was amazed at the activity on a Saturday night.Small shops, beautiful temples and small restaurants, you can't forget China Town. Best way to travel to is the Subway.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Hello!_x000D_
_x000D_
This temple is well kept and worth a visit! We arrived early in the morning and was able to observe morning ceremonies/prayer (I am not sure exactly what they were doing so it's a general statement). If you are in the area check it out!
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A marvel in itself, great infrastructure and a breath taking view. The outdoor swimming pool on the 56th floor and the roof top restaurant on the 57th floor are amazing
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bay is free and I guess it's a 24/7 attraction._x000D_
Night: the lights are on and it's very gorgeous. Not hot at all so you can walk easily around. Only disadvantage would be that you can really enjoy the beauty of the plants._x000D_
Day: It's indeed very gorgeous if it's not raining. You get to see clearly the plants and the river/bay. However the heat can be an issue if you're planning to visit the whole garden. Brings lot of water and sunscreen. Or just take the shuttle.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Head up to this interesting destination at around 5pm for Sundowners ! Great outside area for drinks and nibbles. You pay an entry fee but get the same amount back in credit for refreshments. Note not cheap when your up there - S$20 for a pint of Stella. But for a drink worth it. You may need to hover around the seats and tables. But they do turn over. Have a peep at the pool at the hotel which is on the same level, quite something. The view around is great and with the golden sun coming down a great end of the day. Cheers !
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful park, comparable to Central Park or to Regent park. Nice, well taken care of ponds and lawns. Enjoyed by families during weekend. Orchid gardens worth visiting. Good for jogging in the evening.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Having visited Eden Project in Cornwall, England we felt a bit underwhelmed by it all . But , it is unique in its own way and therefore would certainly advise visiting it even if you have visited similar projects elsewhere.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic even if you dont like flowers !!!
REVIEW_BODY:
This was a great place to bring our 4 year old to. She was captavated by the place. There is a lot to see here. And the Supertrees were her favourite. The light ahow is fantastic too but it does get crowded. It is best watched from the ground level but there is an option to be up in the canopy for a little extra._x000D_
_x000D_
There is a really nice place to eat here just behind the ticket office._x000D_
_x000D_
And talking of tickets... try and get them in advance as the actual queue for the place can get very long !!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I love how they have different exhibitions every few months. I visited during the sakura blossoms and tulips exhibitions. The flowers were stunning._x000D_
_x000D_
The themed exhibitions are in the flower dome, the temperature inside can get quite quite cold. Skip the Cloud forest if you have already been there before. Floor is slippery in the Cloud forest, be careful when walking especially near the waterfall entrance. I've been here 4 times, still mesmerized by the beautiful flora and fauna._x000D_
_x000D_
Buy tickets online to avoid the hassle and the long queue.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Colourful and full of life ...you can get excellent food joints and if you are looking to buy cheap souvenirs for loads of people ..this is the place.. from light lanterns to Chinese Dresses to watches everything is well within budget.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore has made a big investment in the Gardens and it is amazing to wander around the trails and see the gardeners at work and the plants and wildlife
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This temple is very well decorate and very different with other temples in Singapore._x000D_
It's full air condition which is good for visit in a hot tropical island :-) The lay out and design is really making you jaw drop! very very nice and peaceful when you enter to the temple, it open all level for visit, just make sure you dress up properly or get a scarf at the entrance if you are wear sleeveless or short.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful views and definitely a must in singapore. We went during the day so didn't get to see the night lights, but during the day it was still very lovely and good half day outing. The cloud forest, ect were very nice and worth a look also.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: You can see everything from top
REVIEW_BODY: Just amazing how this tiny island has so much to offer! best to go during 6.30pm! and enjoy the sunset and night life! Restaurants available to grab drinks at the skypak!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gives some nices views of the city. It's worth it if you are in that sort of thing, otherwise it will not change your mind.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a lovely park that houses a huge variety of beautiful birds...must see when visiting Singapore. My daughter loved it n so did we. Watch them, feed them n capture them in your memories forever
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: That was mu pleasure to visit Singapore Botanic Garden. I was alone on this visit and i would like to show once to mu family too. thank you for your wonderful service to visit in side the garden.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing night zoo experience from Rachel
REVIEW_BODY:
We arrived late due to mother and children in tow and Rachel at the entrance gates made the whole experience a dream come true! She went over and above._x000D_
_x000D_
We were shown straight to the tram and then off the tram to the animal show! This woman is seriously sorted.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It has a lot of different animals...monkeys, alligators, lions, monkeys (oh did I say monkeys you will see a lot of them), zebras, and it's all in a really natural habitat. Go early or late at night. They are sleeping in the day time.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Ample sheltered areas, and Hyflux water dispensers conveniently located throughout. The River Quest boat ride is short but entertaining! The complementary river cruise was boring though.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This review is quite late. For visitors arriving Singapore late at night but want a place to explore during the wee hours of the evening, the Night Safari is a good way to spend the evening outdoor.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We only had a short time around 3 hours so didnâ€™t get to see everything would need close to 6 hours to get all the way around. Is well run as per usual for Singapore.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It is a part of the Singapore Botanical Garden. You need to buy an admission ticket. Go as early as possible as it will be cooler and lesser tourists and easier to take photos too!_x000D_
You can enjoy the peace._x000D_
Part of it is under upgading but don't miss the VIP Garden and the old black white colonial plantation house in front._x000D_
Do pick a non rainy day for your visit as most of it is in the open.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: What an interesting place to watch bird s
REVIEW_BODY: There are two bird shows that you can't miss. The show with Falcons and raptors and the show with talking, singing birds. The rest of the park is fascinating and well laid out. During non peak hours the taxi is about S$20 each way so with a group of four it is not a reason not to go. Just get there early enough to se the shows mentioned. A special shout out to Elyn at the ticket counter. She spent extra effort to make our visit to Singapore special.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My visit to the night safari was wonderful, with lots of nocturnal animals to see. The staff on site were friendly and helpful in guiding us our directions. It was a totally new experience in visiting the animals at night, as compared to the day when you visit a zoo.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fascinating place to see, to those who wanted to buy local goods exotic fruits and vegetables this is the place to be.Well, for me. Thereâ€™s so much to see that you get this overwhelming feeling about everything.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As student campers, we had been to The Intan as part of our camp heritage trail. Earvin, the resident at Intan, was really nice and explained so many things and was very hospitable and open to many questions too!! He was aware of the Pernankan culture in depth and really enhanced the Intan experience! We also had some homemade tasty Kueh and even free wifi! Truly an amazing visit! â¤ï¸
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Do it !!!i will help you reach this
REVIEW_BODY:
How you will reach this?_x000D_
Take mrt to harbourfront station.follow the exit signs which leading you at vivocity mall.when you are vivocity mall you will see everywhere and every 20 metres signs that lead you to cable car.i d like to inform you that cable car station isnt at vivocity mall building.it is at a building next to vivocity mall but dont worry the labels will guide you.you will find the entrance/ticket office at ground floor.when you have tickets you will take lift to the top of the tower to take your ride.ii hope to help._x000D_
_x000D_
It is a must do in singapore.there are cheaper ways to go to sentosa but this one you will remember all your life. Search to internet for combo deal with S.E.A. Aquarium and you will get lower prices.there are many combo deals for exaple cable car-S.E.A. Aquarium-universal studios.so its on you._x000D_
_x000D_
It is brand new and not scary like the cable car of genting highlands malaysia. The view is amazing.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The Night Safari is a different experience from a day trip to the zoo and its popularity was evident from the throngs of tourists there, only second to the Universal Studios._x000D_
Buy your tickets beforehand to avoid queues, although there are many more queues to encounter in the Night safari. There is a queue at the entrance but you can see the fire show while you wait and do not rush, as you will not be permitted to enter before your stipulated time. After the entry, you again queue up for the tram._x000D_
The tram takes you around the park, with commentary on all the animals - we did see quite a few animals but since the tram did not stop and it was dark, we could hardly get good pictures. Don't bother clicking pictures of animals while you are on the tram. After you disembark, do witness the creatures of the night show - which is presented beautifully._x000D_
We went walking along the trails after the show, and managed to see quite a few more animals up close. The trails should not be missed even if you are tired for they give you the actual feel of being on a night safari._x000D_
Be sure to carry water and mosquito repellant. Do not talk aloud or the animals shy away.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great area for food and buying items for cheap. gets very busy here during Chinese New Year so best to avoid them times if you hate large crowds
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A lovely lush garden visit to recharge after too much city. Just enjoy the beautiful surroundings and keep an eye out for squirrels.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice view for the indoor domes, but it's only great for the first time.
REVIEW_BODY: Went there cause i thought that it'll be a nice place for my grandma to visit last month. However, i realize that the place (be it the open gardens or the indoor ones) is only good for a 1 time visit. I've been there a few times and i realize that the staffs at the gardens are getting more rude and unprofessional. For example when I was buying the tickets for the indoor domes, this staff that served me was just talking to his friend beside on what to eat for dinner. Most of the staffs there kept using their phones as well when they are supposed attend to customers. The food there are just so so, it will be better to go to other hawkers or restaurant to eat. The indochine restaurant located around the supertree grove is good though. They serve decent food and drinks over there and when you go up you get to view the spectacular view of the ferris wheel and MBS at night! :)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: * Singapore's answer to Kew Gardens * It's also an excellent party/ wedding venue * Lovely for a stroll * The gardens have wonderful displays * A nice family day out
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Blast to the past: Asian Edition
REVIEW_BODY:
The museum is located near the station, just a short walk and cross the Cavanaugh Bridge and you'll be there._x000D_
_x000D_
There's entrance fee but it's not too expensive. The galleries give visitors a glimpse of the products of civilization in Asia (pottery, jewellery, fabric and literature), from Southeast Asia to Middle East. The artefacts displayed are well preserved too. In some corner, there will be interactive display that shows people humming their traditional song._x000D_
_x000D_
A nice and enriching experience overall. Suitable for history buff, couples or family with children.
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
There's an exhibition on now at Asian Civilisation Museum worth visiting. It shows the old trade routes in Asia & the effects on the culture the trade has brought. Peranakan or Straits born Chinese is well reflected in the exquisite kebayas. The clothes on exhibit are a stand out as well as the jewellery on display._x000D_
After the exhibit, make a bee line to the gift shop where a good selection of Singaporean gifts._x000D_
Next stop is the National Art Museum
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fabulous walk - I've done it 4 times and I love it
REVIEW_BODY: I love the Southern Ridges walk, it's amazing how you can still be so close to the city of Singapore and yet feel so far away from it. You can really enjoy the walk and relax away from the busy city life. The tree-top walk goes on for 1.8kms (I think), and is amazing. The Henderson Waves bridge is a beautiful piece of architecture. You might be lucky and spot some wildlife along the way, but even if you don't, you'll be sure to get some fantastic photos and stunning views.
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Was Mesmerising taking the singapore flyer and it was a memorable one... hope there is some kind of a stop right at the top for the cabin like a 2 min stop just to enjoy the view
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We needed to get out of the Singapore heat and humidity. A placard invited us to the St Andrewâ€™s Cathedral cafÃ©._x000D_
_x000D_
The cafÃ© occupies a large space. Its air conditioned, modernised and nicely painted. Itâ€™s so peaceful. The staff are plentiful, very friendly and helpful. And, the coffee was actually very good. A great place for a cool coffee fix.
ADDRESS: 11 St. Andrew's Road St. Andrew's Cathedral, Singapore 178959, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The cherry blossoms display is not yo be missed. The display is amazing and it is such a joy to see such beautiful trees. Best to go after 5pm to catch the display both on the day and night setting
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Decided to splash out for the annual 4 park pass for $269 for 2 adults and 2 kids. Plus an extra $20 for the annual parking at Singapore Zoo only. A long time since I was last at the zoo but it's always a good place to go. A bit tiring for the kids on a hot day but plenty to keep them entertained. Probably just the first of many visits for the upcoming year!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Escape the city in the middle of it
REVIEW_BODY: Nice place to go for a walk. Was of particular interest to me as it contains lakes which are the main water source for the city. The bridge was quite cool and you can get very close to the monkeys. Got a bit long after a while and there isn't a train station nearby so we had to use taxis to get from the train station to it.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Full of life. It's filled up with restaurants, bars, disco, pubs. Somehow the food and drinks can be a little bit more expensive than any other places.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to spend the day. Food halls are quite an experience and very cheap if you like to eat as the locals do. Good money changing booth in the main department store too.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The evening light show is a great diversion when in Singapore. Imagine the Disney Light Parade with better music... Its a bit of a zoo getting in and out but the quality of the show won't change too much if you arrive late...but you may be more comfortable if you arrive a little bit earlier and grab a towel or two from your hotel to sit on... Recommendation: It may be even better if you sneak in a bottle and glasses...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Empress resturant at the museum, good for museum resturant
REVIEW_BODY: Invited to a party at the empress resturant at the museum and was pleasantly surprised at the food and wine selections. The location is a gorgeous waterfront venue in the museum. The staff were very attentive and the food better than your average museum resturant. Was a worthwhile and enjoyable experience
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It was a lovely sight seeing tulips of different colours at Tulipmania today. They are really beautiful. We managed to get a 15% discount off using OCBC credit card for residents. The only downside was that the carpark system at the main entrance carpark was down and we had to park at Satay by the Bay's carpark instead._x000D_
_x000D_
I have always enjoyed every trip to Gardens by the Bay and it was a short visit there today as we went there mainly for Cold Storage run event. We will be back for other attractions soon.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are looking for an escape from the busy streets this is the place to go to for that relaxing time. You can walk for hours or just sit and enjoy the wonderful landscaped gardens and the shade houses.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I love Orchids! So this was a real treat for me. Free entry into the Botanical gardens and only $5 to get into the orchid garden. This is a good price considering the Gardens by the Bay is atleast $28. Lovely variety of orchids. Worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The best part is that only the domes have paid entry and the rest of the area is free to explore. You can rent scooters and ride along the riverside. It is green all around and the light show is free every night. Must visit this area, just explore the free area.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by The bay is a must do if visiting Singapore. It's an amazing to wander through the domes, around the grounds and experience one of the best gardens anywhere. As you go through the domes, there's something different or wonderful to look at. This was an amazing experience.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Birds Eye view worth the time and effort to find it!
REVIEW_BODY:
You can see the Flyer in front of you but negotiating the way there can be challenging if you are on foot. Pedestrian crossings underpasses and bridges make the journey from hotels in the CBD far from direct and the heat makes it tempting to weave your way via the many shopping centres with air conditioning. Then you have to cross under a major highway._x000D_
_x000D_
Best bet is to get a cab. They are relatively cheap outside the peak time rush and the walk isn't that scenic after all... You can admire the architecture more easily from the Flyer when you get there without the noise of the traffic._x000D_
_x000D_
The flyer is billed as the largest Ferris wheel and it is certainly impressive against the skyline. Early afternoon was quiet with no queue and we didn't feel the need to linger in the dingy exhibits lining the approach. The capsules were only half full so plenty of space to move around and enjoy the view. Strangely the places shown on ribbon posters inside the capsules were not aligned with where that building or landmark might be found but did give you a reminder of what you should be looking for._x000D_
_x000D_
Singapore's cityscape is best viewed from above and the Flyer gives ample time to do so. Even the Zeppelin like structure forming the top of the Bay Sands Hotel reveals some of its detail from the Flyer. Well worth the visit and time spent there though be aware that the commentary (limited) could be louder and clearer and the music that accompanies your rotation could be quieter!_x000D_
_x000D_
Allow time as you can't be sure how long the queue will be and ignore the rather soulless and frankly shabby shopping area at the base of the Flyer. Why spoil an impressive landmark with yet another shopping mall? It all looked quite sad and we were happy to eventually find a way out. Signage could be better! Shame that tainted an otherwise good experience.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent a day up here walking around. Very interseting and always something different to see round every corner. Orchid garden is a must see. Was a little bemused by the amount of people who were walking round glued to their cell phones/tablets, not even looking around at times. I guess it's an information tool for many but just looked weird in a place full of natural beauty.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Stunning area with loads of different sculptures and gardens. The light and music show is stunning to watch and a must see when visiting Singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A cool respite from the hot and humid Singapore weather
REVIEW_BODY: It is a good walk from the MRT station to get to the Cloud Forest dome, best to bring a bottle of cold water. We bought both tickets to the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome at a discount. AirAsia, Singapore Airlines, Malaysia Airlines (may be other Asian airlines as well) got a promo and if you tell them which airline you used to fly in you get additional discount (15% I think). The exhibits inside the dome is very interesting and a good way to see the vegetation in a cloud forest without having to climb perilous mountains. The trip to the Cloud Forest brought back memories of my field days. The place is always packed with tourists even on weekdays, there's a lot of waiting for turns to take a photo. But take your time, you can do both tours in half a day. After the tour we headed back towards the direction of the MRT to Stay by the Bay where there are food stalls with more local varieties at very reasonable prices.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The sights and smells are amazing, not to mention the colours all around. This is a taste of India not to be missed. The markets stock an array of beautiful Saris and other clothing, as well as the daily fare of the locals, fish, fresh vegetables, fresh herbs etc. Itâ€™s a really interesting place that is not manufactured for tourists but a snap shot of life. Sample the food in the markets sold by the hawkers, fresh, tasty and cheap.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
What can I say after every praise has been mentioned about the place?_x000D_
_x000D_
If you are visiting Singapore for the very first time, make sure that this is on top of itinerary list. It is something like you have ever seen before and the duration is really worth it._x000D_
_x000D_
A man made forest that is a must for every nature lover to visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The sheer size of this conservatory is almost overwhelming! There are plants and trees from various parts of the world and the ever-changing themes for the major displays keep people coming back time and again. Coming from Australia I saw some of our native plants that I hadn't seen "in the flesh" at home and this was interesting.
