There are stunning views from the various raised areas around the conservatory and, although I haven't been there yet, the restaurant in this dome is apparently very nice. I was lucky enough to visit in March which was a quiet time crowd-wise except for the many school groups who were there. Well worth the entry fee and visit!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was lucky enough to be in Singapore before Christmas, during the Christmas Wonderland event at the Gardens. We went at sundown, and walked around the gardens, lovely plants and its well signposted and has great paths. (we had a pram and two kids with us). The Christmas Wonderland was amazing, with the main trees lighting up in time to the music. It was truly magical and my kids loved it. I didn't manage to go into the domes but the rest of the gardens are fantastic, with restaurants and gift shops around the edge. Highly recommend for families, couple or lone travellers.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We loved the Cloud Forest because it was so many plants, vines, trees mixed in with the True rainforest feel. Very fun walks by higher and higher experiencing the beauty of all of the plants and water features. Air conditioning + ðŸ‘
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best place in Singapore for nature lovers
REVIEW_BODY: If you are looking for vast areas of natural beauty within singapore city this is where you head for. I just loved the tranquility of the place. Next time palnning for a picnic here with friends.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A nice area to wander through, just off Orchard Road. Interesting Peranakan buildings, lots of shops, places to eat and drink. Good bit of old culture.
ADDRESS: Off Orchard Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay was not there the last time we visited Singapore. Fabulous and I suggest that you visit the respective 'clouds'
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great view, but so many people!
REVIEW_BODY: The view from the 57th floor of the Marina Bay Sands is quite spectacular, but be warned, you will be sharing it with lots of other people. The Infinity Pool looks at times more like human soup. But the view's nice.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Just wish we had been able to spend more time at these lovely gardens.
REVIEW_BODY: Firstly, the entrance to the gardens through the surreal Mariner Bay Sands Gives a quick insight into how the other half lives! You then enter a lovely, big gardens that you can visit for no cost at all - although we (all five of us) felt it was well worth the cost to go into the two domes. Firstly, they are cool havens from the Singapore heat and humidity; secondly, they are beautifully designed, planted and maintained. The Super Trees are impressive and fun, and we could not resist the sky-walk - but seriously, do not do it if you suffer from vertigo at all! Although it was interesting to see how the trees are constructed and maintained, the views are amazing, and there was a lovely cooling breeze up there - I personally found the height a bit much! We had thought that food would be expensive in the gardens, but all five of us enjoyed a very reasonably priced lunch.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great for shopping addicts but has a lot more
REVIEW_BODY: Long road in centre full of shops, hotels, restaurants and bars. This road is generally buzzing and even the shops are open well into the night
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: What more can one add for superlatives for a botanical garden
REVIEW_BODY: This is just a wonderful place, a vast area in the middle of a teeming tropical metropolis. Clearly laid out by the British but lovingly maintained and developed since independence. And amazingly, it's free! There isn't as much signage for all the many plants as I have come to expect in smaller gardens in the US but there is plenty of information nonetheless. Plan on spending at least two hours and better a whole day and possibly a night. I was not able to come at night, when the Fragrance Garden is apparently most effective. And it's open late!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its a beautiful Journey through the Wilderness midst in the city of Singapore! Take it all in, enjoy and stun your mind with the botanical beauty of this place
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a nice waterfront, well kept and at 11 pm you get a bit of a sound, light and music show. Now quite the Bellagio dancing fountains but a reasonable effort
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I have traveled a lot in my life but never saw such clean streets before . Beautiful roads and trees and the buildings . Shipping is amazing there they have everything
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Merchants practically twist your arm to buy something. Hot and crowded, couldn't get away fast enough.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was so excited to visit China town after 15 years. How much it has changed. For the worse. Now mainly endless restaurants, no bargains or atmosphere
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A paradise for all photo enthusiasts. I was expecting a greenhouse, but this is equator dahhh... nice walk, beautiful flowers. Good way to start shaking off the jet lag
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is an amazing place and the work that has gone into making the indoor waterfall is amazing. It really is a beautiful place.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Garden by the Bay has a futuristic feel, nature in a dome in precise, highly controlled environment. Love it!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Had great time with family during garden by the bay visit. Alhough abit disappointed as bad weather was prohibited to visit OCbc skyway.. The whole environment.. Is well maintained. Extremely worth for price and able to fully spend our time in sg.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As usual, day was warm but the gardens have a cooling and soothing effect. Easy walk around with the rainforest area under renovation. Orchid garden was superb and they were beautiful to see. Had a great stroll around the many exhibits.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You should go there at night. See the Merlion changing color and Marina Bay Resort water and light show. Helix bridge lighted up. Boat rides going up and down the river. Lots of places to eat too.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A Must See attraction in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
My wife and I visited this attraction after seeing the Super trees._x000D_
It starts with a great view of the huge waterfall at ground level. You then take the elevator to the top level and work your way down through stunning floral displays._x000D_
A bit disappointed to see imported stalagmites which were taken from elsewhere in the world and would have taken tens of thousands of years to form naturally. Completely unnecessary if you ask me.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Unbelievable experience. Loved every minute. Went in the day and heard about the light show. We went back to the light show and it was one of the best things I've ever seen. The music was brilliant and the atmosphere was something else._x000D_
_x000D_
One of the best things to do in Singapore! Must visit the light show of a night!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Must arrive this place early so that you can get the best spot to watch the show. Make sure you lay down like you are going to do star gazing activity. The 15 minutes performance is very good. They have song from all over Asean. A romantic place. :)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Night zoo who would have thought !! Jump on a tram, then wonder along four different zoned paths to see all the nocturnal animals awake and active and some free range as well. wow a great way to spend an evening
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The view from the top is fantastic. It was fairly quick going to the top despite it being the peak season.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Views are good, but like many others
REVIEW_BODY: The location is fabulous, giving the best city views. But there are many other places like bars etc where we could get similar views while grabbing a drink n catching up with friends for almost the same price!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A truly wonderful place to spend a day and stay for the evening light show. A must is to climb the stairs or take the lift to the treetop walk and admire the views over the park.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Though there was a lot of constructions and upgrading done, overall experience was still okay. Go for the shows cause itâ€™s so good!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: More like a flea market than "town"
REVIEW_BODY: Easy to get to via the underground. There are many shops and smaller stores and although it is like a "flea market" the shops are larger and more formal. Almost everything is sold from cheaper knock offs to genuine antique asian stuff. Some of the jewellery stores have some well priced and genuine stuff and you can find almost anything you are looking for. There are many food stalls and although we did not eat there, it all seemed quite well priced.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great restaurants, shops and lots of old and new buildings to explore and photograph. You can take the subway here from most hotels in central Singapore.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place for culture and bargins
REVIEW_BODY: What a cracking place to lose a few hrs bargins everywhere, everything from shirts and dresses to souvenirs and nicknacks and the food was some of the best ive tried, but to truly get the best food the locals go 2 streets down from the main street this is the cheapest and best food chicken and rice $4.50 satays $3 and the variety of seafood amazing and of course the chilli crab loved it. all great for families with young I kids and elderly as well easy to get around a must for everyone
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a must if you visit Singapore. Especially at night. Wait for the right time (7.45pm when we were there) and let the magic begin.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wow!! One of the best things IMO to do in Singapore. Starts at 7pm. Take a ride safari ride at night through lots of different animal enclosures! Really really great thing to do, we loved it!! Must must do attraction - we got a ticket for $70 which included the zoo, river safari and bird pack)
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Came here on the Barbie special carriage and had the whole carriage to ourselves. We felt very well looked after and loved the whole experience. Fantastic views of the bay and would recommend to anyone. Look out for the special carriages as they're really worth the extra money in my opinion.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The zoo was very nice and my younger sister really enjoyed. The animals and their compounds both seemed well looked after. The only negative thing is that I found it a bit confusing where we had to go and that they don't have like a planned route where you see all the animals.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The highlight of Gardens by the Bay!
REVIEW_BODY: The Flower Dome is great but we loved the Cloud Forest.....there's just something magical and otherworldly about it. You need to see both....but see the Dome first and visit Cloud Forest next.....it's like the icing on an amazing cake.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice but for lovers of orchids
REVIEW_BODY: So hot and a lot of walking to get to the garden. You have to pay to enter. Take comfortable shoes, a hat and a cool drink.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is essentially a botanical garden in a "vertical" concept. Truly beautiful and refreshing, well done!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was one of the most gorgeous gardens we've ever visited. There was a wide variety of orchids, each seemingly more beautiful than the last. They are displayed in a beautiful natural setting, with the exception of a room where you can see special breeds named after noteworthy individuals; for example, the Princess Diana orchid, or the Margaret Thatcher variety. I would highly recommend visiting the National Orchid Garden (and the Singapore Botanic Gardens also). All in our group of four, were grateful to have taken the time to visit here.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A memorable team outing experience at The Intan
REVIEW_BODY: Comparing to other Peranakan musuems ive been to, the Intan has a larger variety of beaded slippers, tingkat and many more. Some of the displays, you could even can touch and feel (just dont break any). Nonya kuehs with special fragrant tea was served while listening to Peranakan stories. The host- Alvin Yapp even surprised us with a musical performance. Indeed a memorable experience for our team to remember.
ADDRESS: 69 Joo Chiat Terrace, Singapore 427231, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visit to this Garden is a must for locals & travelers. Huge area to stroll around. Flower Dome, Cloud Forest have entrance fees & not to be skipped by any means. Different season displays different blossoms in the Flower Dome. It's always better to check online for the updated calendar of events before planning a visit. There are many exciting activities for the kids at Gardens by the Bay.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We did the Chinatown Trishaw night tour with tour guide Joicce. What a delightful night. We looked through the Buddhist Temple at the start then had a guided commentary of the origins of Chinatown. Then it was off to a restaurant for a 5 course dinner which was very nice amongst company from the UK, Canada and Australia. Then it was time to shop. Interesting sights throughout the markets and being a Saturday night, everyone was there. We were then loaded on to trishaws with a peddler who took us to Clarke Quay for a river cruise. Half way there on 4 lanes of traffic, a bus didn't see us and nearly crossed into our path. A very excited Chinese peddler soon had the bus in give way mode and we proceeded. Lots of laughs and very loud music. A great night of colour, sights and sounds.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore Botanical garden is an excellent place to visit with children n grandkids as itâ€™s a huge place to play with. You need to spend a minimum of three hours.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I've had the light show on my Singapore bucket list for ages and was finally able to attend last night. It's great that it is on every night and free of charge as well as being easily accessible from the MRT - all good points for tourists! I thoroughly enjoyed watching the trees come alive and would return to see it again if I am ever back in Singapore. My only negative thought was that it could have been little bit longer than fifteen minutes. Definitely recommend!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Immerse yourself in history and culture
REVIEW_BODY:
Spend a couple of hours exploring the National Museum of Singapore and you will walk away with a newfound knowledge of this intriguing country's history and people._x000D_
_x000D_
It is worthwhile spending the extra few dollars and purchasing a ticket which gives you access to the all of the special exhibitions as well (S$14). The What is Not Visible is Not Invisible exhibition in the basement gallery is particularly interesting (exhibition showing until 19 Feb 2017)._x000D_
_x000D_
This is great activity if you want to escape the humidity or heavy rains!
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is amazing, if you have nothing to do I would really recommend going here and maybe having a picnic or even just walking around!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is one of the best botanic gardens I have been to anywhere in the world. I make a point to stop by every time I come to Singapore (2-3x a year). It's big enough to spend an entire day walking around a mixture of manicured and natural settings. Keep an eye out for water monitors in the water, or even sunbathing on the trails.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This part of the Singapore botanic gardens is well worth a visit! The orchids are exquisite and immaculately maintained. The gardens are very well laid out. But take a hat it was very hot.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A bit crowded if weather is good. The east coast park is biggest open area park in Singapore. One can sit and chit chat by Sunset or you can hire Cycle to move around. A lots of place available for Kids to keep them happy. Get some time and enjoy your evening with your loved one at ECP (commonly known in Singapore)
ADDRESS: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road, Singapore 455486, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very lovely place with a lot of natural beauty like green fields and trees, flowers and ponds. I would suggest that you buy a ticket of 5 dollars to see the orchid garden too.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth a visit during the day and at night. Free admission! Very good light and music show every evening.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
What an experience._x000D_
_x000D_
A jawdroppingly top notch evening spent watching the Light Show, wandering the grounds, taking in the plant life, the Cloud Forest and much, much more._x000D_
_x000D_
We spent around three hours, perhaps more, exploring and looking at everything there is to offer. Peaceful water features and exotic flowers can be found here, with several good amenities and gift shops._x000D_
_x000D_
It is worth noting that one should maximise the photograph opportunities because there is such much to capture. We arrived late afternoon and saw the evening draw in and darkness fall so the experience could be remembered from daylight through twilight through to nightfall (see images)._x000D_
_x000D_
Our standard ticket, including the Cloud Forest, was 14 SGD and the overhead walkway overlooking the trees, facing the Marina Bay Sands hotel with some stunning views, was an additional 8 SGD. All, totally, totally worthwhile._x000D_
_x000D_
The Light Show was equally brilliant and reminded me of the Dancing Fountains in Dubai, UAE, keeping in time with harmonic music in the background._x000D_
_x000D_
All in all, this has to be a priority for any tourist in Singapore City. A memorable experience.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An excellent place to spend a wet afternoon ! Very complete on every subject. Books in english and chinese.
ADDRESS: 100 Victoria Street National Library Building, Singapore 188064, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We have nothing but admiration for this place. It was so beautiful and very clean. We went here 3 times and I never got tired of this place.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Gardens are a must see when in Singapore! It offers both inside and outside gardens that are immaculate. Instead of going to another mall, escape to either or both The Flower Dome and Cloud Dome. It is absolutely tranquil and therapeutic. You will not regret it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The best garden in the world for orchid lovers
REVIEW_BODY: If you are an orchid lover, this is paradise. Its has the biggest collection of hybrids in the world, and if you are in Singapore, you simply cannot miss it.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We love this ride. This takes about 30 minutes to one round. Experience is fabulous. You must take a ride on this.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went both day and night and the views of the MBS and bay are amazing, also the Merlion fountain is pretty cool, very crowded and lots of tourists but to be expected. Worth a visit
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Always worth a visit, especially in the morning
REVIEW_BODY: Take a taxi to Nassim gate entrance and follow the path through the rainforest, old trees. Also the orchid gardens are stunning to look at.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great to hang out and see materials and arab culture.. Also grab a kebab
REVIEW_BODY: I am a frequent visitor to Arab street, the materials are abundant and there are so many restaurants and bars. Wander on over to haji lane as well for a very welcome ale
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really enjoyed this even after a long day the domes are amazing and the the light show is breathtaking
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Very interesting piece of Singapore history post war during Japanese occupation.
REVIEW_BODY: Off the beaten track but worth a visit. Tells the stories of ex pats who didn't make it out before the surrender to the Japanese, and were imprisoned here. The stories of the women particularly interesting.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Just beautiful. Went to Cloud Forest and Flower Dome. Enjoyed walking through the gardens. Peaceful. Immaculate. Delightful afternoon.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The must go destination to see is Garden by the bay both in the day time or at night. Appropriate for family, friends, couples or even students. You will see the garden, lots of flowers and plants. Cool destination to visit and take a deep breath. Just prepare your camera ready to shot, you can get a lot of beautiful photos here. You can walk from here to marina bay sand, Merlion park, Singapore flyer.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The masjid is Grand and well maintained. Knowing the history of it was enriching and seeing how it transformed in construction. You may enjoy the exterior architecture and design as well as the interior._x000D_
The praying area is kept isolated to avoid interrupting prayers._x000D_
Worth checking out while in the area_x000D_
The surrounding area is cool for hanging out after the visit
ADDRESS: 3 Muscat Street Masjid Sultan, Singapore 198833, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Makes you feel like youâ€™re in India
REVIEW_BODY:
Located on Serangoon Road, a few minutes walk from the Little India MRT station. This impressive Hindu temple is open between 5am to 12pm & 4pm to 9pm and free to all visitors._x000D_
southern part of Singapore. As with most Hindu temples you will need to take off your shoes (leaving them at the entrance), take off any hats and cover bare shoulders and legs (there are wraps available to use at the entrance)._x000D_
_x000D_
The temple, built in 1881, is one of the oldest in the City and is dedicated to the Hindu goddess Kali. Images of Kali throughout the temple show her wearing a garland of skulls and ripping out the insides of her victims but are counter balanced with motherly images of her with her sons; Ganesha and Murugan._x000D_
_x000D_
As i visited on a Sunday it was crowded, noisy, colourful and vibrant all of which Iâ€™ve learnt to expect after visiting many Hindu temples in India. If youâ€™ve never been to a Hindu temple then this is an experience that is worth trying.
ADDRESS: 141 Serangoon Road, Singapore 218042, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth a visit day or night
REVIEW_BODY:
Very well set out, beautiful gardens and a wonderful sound and light show in the evenings._x000D_
The night show is on twice a night, but is very popular so worth getting there well ahead of show time._x000D_
There are a few places there to eat beforehand or just settle in for the show._x000D_
The best spot is around the centre tree but you can see well from all around also._x000D_
Advise to take your camera or smartphone to get some great photos or video.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Stunning views of the skyline reflected in the water and wide pathways make this a magical place to walk or sit and take in the light show.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: An enjoyable place to wander around
REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are centrally located and make for a pleasant walking area. Access is free unless you want to walk on the elevated walkway or go in the greenhouses. There are a series of different themed garden areas to wander through. The tall trees area is very futuristic and this is where you can walk high up amongst the trees.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's a really cold place. But this place is amazing, it really looks like a real forest with rich biodiversity. It was nice feeling walking in the sky walk. I can't tell if this place is better than the Flower dome as we did not visit it but I;m sure kids and kids at heart will enjoy here. Worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice gardens in Singapore - although it is man-made, I would proudly proclaim it the most spectacular garden in Singapore. It looks nice from any angle, day or night. In the day, the sheer amount of green makes viewing the gardens pleasant to the eyes, and at night, the lights emitted by the supertrees makes the gardens look like a lively one that never sleeps. The conservatories were cooling and I learnt a lot from the conservatories, such as the many different species of flowers in the flower dome and the geography behind the water cycle in the cloud forests. A wide range of flora and eye-catching flowers with vivid colors. For those who a hungry a meal at Satay by the Bay is recommended, and although their prices can be slightly higher than the regular hawker centre/food court in Singapore, it is definitely cheaper than most of the restaurants in the city area. It is a short 5-minute walk from the Marina Bay Sands Hotel where we stayed, and an even shorter walk from the Bayfront MRT Station (through the underpass).
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As a zoo loving family, Singapore Zoo is one of the best we have been too. On a hot day, the shade of the well designed gardens makes wandering around bearable, whilst the free water park for children is another means of escaping the heat and having some good old fashion fun. The animal section is comprehensive and enclosures are designed to enhance your view not obscure it. You find yourself forgetting at times you are in a zoo and not simply experiencing these beautiful creatures in their nature environments. The park itself is well laid out and beautiful in its own right. Amenities are impeccably cleans and food options are varied. Whilst we selected to go for the sake of the children, my husband and I enjoyed ourselves just as much ... Perhaps even more.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is good for street shopping It can be cleaner, but cheap gift items available here Food is mostly non veg
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We went on here as part of our Chinatown walking tour and had time to look around the lower floor and made the effort to go back ourselves afterwards to visit the upper levels including the museum._x000D_
One of the most impressive temples that I have visited and so glad we did.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A very pleasant experience to enjoy the beautiful cherry blossoms at Flower Dome. Everything was well organized. I will definitely would like to repeat my visit with family and friends.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you like museums you will enjoy this art museum. What impressed me the most was the contemporary Asian art but there was plenty here to spend half a day without being bored. It is a great museum and the view from the top is fabulous.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We opted for MBS Skypark as we we were told SD20 per person to access the bar couldn't guarantee a table with a view. For us this was a good choice, especially with a 15% Singapore Airline discount (just needed to show boarding pass)._x000D_
_x000D_
Once up there, we were able to stay for as long as we wanted, taking us from day to sunset, and we enjoyed the views during this golden hour._x000D_
_x000D_
At this time (7pm-ish) there were no queues for tickets, and the viewing platform wasn't particularly crowded, though by contrast the bar area looked very busy.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What an architectural marvel. The design is so astounding and breath taking, you just stare at the architectural marvel and wonder who designed it and build it. One of the best designs i have ever seen in my life. The place to visit when you are in Singapore. Nice place also to take a stroll along the Singapore river.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must visit floral conservatory at Singapore. Don't miss out on cloud forest dome also. Good experience.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best Zoo Iâ€™ve ever been to
REVIEW_BODY:
This, like many things in Singapore is the best Iâ€™ve been to._x000D_
It has so many different animals and enclosures you will spend hours and hours here and still not see everything._x000D_
The grounds here are beautiful to walk around and it is such a pleasant experience._x000D_
Itâ€™s a bit away from the main part of the city and we found the best way to get here was to take the MRT to Ang Mo Kio station then get the 138 bus from the station to the zoo (final stop right outside the zoo so you canâ€™t miss it). Bus takes about 30 minutes from the station.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard Road is beautifully lighted up at night with malls putting up their own decorations particularly for Christmas. At Centrepoint this year, the theme is food and kitchen. There are also promotions and sales. Also, Christmas carols and 'Celebrate Christmas' where the story of Christ coming to earth is proclaimed.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: So many shops and malls along Orchard Road, most likely the mot popular shopping strip in the whole of Singapore. Brand names are everywhere, but there are still bargains to find in places like Lucky Plaza.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing architecture as well as a variety of exhibits. You could easily spend a day here. Well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was inside the botanic gardens. You have to pay to go to the orchid garden but it was worth the ticket. Beautiful garden.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Peaceful temple in the very busy Chinatown With the visit for Buddhists ! For non Buddhist can go there and admire the architecture of the temple
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The parallel street below Arab Street, Hajlin, is worth a visit and the Mexican restaurant - Piedra Negra - a very pretty restaurant on Hajlin x Beach Street produced an unexpectedly good cheap lunch!
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the place to go to when you want to go shopping. Covered in malls you can find high end brands to smaller more mainstream brands here as well. This is 'the' place to shop. A wide selection of restaurants as well but mostly high end. You can find Hard Rock Cafe just off this road as well.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
An impressive place of attraction indeed. I felt like I was so close to nature, from the fallen water, the sound of nature, the smell of the plants. And all very edutainment, as I become more aware the importance of understanding the planet we live in._x000D_
_x000D_
This place gave me some kind of wake up call. To stay close to nature, especially for the city folks like me, I tend to be ignorant about our planet and other living creature or plants that give balance to our lives.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great free (almost) attraction to visit. Fantastic views and planting. The small fee for the Orchid Garden was most definately worth it. Whilst the temperature and humidity may put some off, with perseverance you will take away memories and photographs you will not find anywhere else in the world.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Rare to find a place so near to where you live that you can walk to everyday, allows you to breathe fresh air , and release the stress in absolute peace,Botanical gardens is the perfect place for a daily walk but with all the flowers especially the orchards the expanding landscape views it can be much more . So well maintained yet accessible nearly 24 hours Botanical gardens is truly an iconic place you must visit and enjoy
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: save time to drop by here!
REVIEW_BODY: exit the the met station on PAGODA street and enjoy all the souvenir shops! i advise also to see the indian temple down the street its totally amazing we could go inside to watch a prayer or a ceremony performed. worth seeing!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Expensive. If your hotel view is good then don't waste your money
REVIEW_BODY: There were 11 of us and the price for tickets was expensive. It's nothing wow, you get to see the view which our hotel had any ways. There are other places to visit and see so save your money for this as Singapore is generally expensive
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A visit to Chinatown in Singapore takes you away from the big commercial areas of the city into a different area. The low rise buildings, markets and food street are great to walk around. The area is easily reached and easy to walk around.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were overwhelmed by the facilities and the care given to the animals. Our baby who is fond of animals was really happy and enjoyed his day. I would recommend it for every one who visits Singapore.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My friend from college and his two sons came to the orangutan breakfast and explored the zoo. It was so nice. Coming early was great because the temperature was much cooler. The orangutan breakfast was so exciting and the animals at the zoo were in such beautiful open habitats. We will definitely come back.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It looks great, really upholds Singapore's reputation as a Garden city. There's different types of plants, small and large.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Helix bridge is one of star attraction of Singapore. this connects to reach Arts and science Museum. a very neat bridge and will offer neat and clear view of Singapore elite area and buildings.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I like the thought of Buddhism & really wanted to pay a visit!_x000D_
_x000D_
Out of respect cover up, they gave sarongs & scarves available for you to use & only take pictures in suitable places!_x000D_
_x000D_
The temple is beautiful, so many buddhas & details of the Buddha that covers your Chinese both sign! There is also a gift shop on the way out!
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: one of the most interesting attractions in Singapore with many shops and restaurants that should not be missed.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Iâ€™d recommend visiting the park and seeing the iconic Merlion statue at least once. Itâ€™s a busy area full of people trying to get a selfie with the Merlion.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very clean with nice view and has good collection. Better go there in afternoon on 5 o'clock until night. Sit down in the grass, lookin the view. it was so comfortable.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Much hyped but generally worth it
REVIEW_BODY: Great view but crowded even early morning. Nice they control access but is a little weird to have to pass security to go to the pool
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Clarke Quay is a good starting point to walk along the Singapore River
REVIEW_BODY:
Starting from Clarke Quay, the walk along the Singapore River is a MUST. Aside from shopping, this walk has to rank among the top 3 things to do. Because:_x000D_
1. It is easily accessible - MRT station = Clarke Quay._x000D_
2. A walk along the river covers many things; from Heritage Buildings; to Museums(eg museum of Asian Civilizations); to famous hotels(eg Fullerton Hotel); to famous sights(eg Merloin & Park); to shopping malls.. etc_x000D_
3. The walk can be taken at night when the lights are varied and beautiful; or during the day when things are open._x000D_
4. It can be tailored to your time requirements - one hour or four._x000D_
5. Must see sights include: Clarke Quay's heritage buildings; Merloin; Museum of Asian Civilizations..._x000D_
6. Refreshments are plentiful.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Second visit to the Singapore flyer ..this time at night
REVIEW_BODY: We chose to return to the Singapore Flyer. Last time views were during the day , this time, chose the evening. Great service , super views, take your camera..got some good shots
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: In this garden you'll see lot of strange, beautiful, alien flowers, trees and other kind of plants. Though there are a lot of people you won't fell crowded. There wooden statues made of sticks? Those are really marvelous! For tourists the ticket is valid both to Cloud Forest (the other glass dome) and here so don't miss it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You have 3 things to look out for at this place... While we visited we walked along the Biggest Mall here and also had a great time towards evening around 7/8 pm at the laser light show which was just amazing using water itself. We had taken a video of this and keep watching it. Another thing you could do is boat ride around this time to view the laser water show and also there is a Merlin around the corner which we could click free photos around this place.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There were 2 options here. One being the trip up to the viewing gallery - a long queue. Or the other (which we did) was $20 each to go up the bar area. the cost was then deducted off the price of the drinks. Sat up there and watched the sun go down over Singy - fab!
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to spend a couple hours. Plenty of cheap food places just outside the most touristy parts. However, great food and cheapest beer I found right in the heart too. Yes, it's touristy....big I'm a tourist and I loved it! Enjoyed the Chinese heritage museum, took in a few temples and used the services of the Information Centre.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A visit to Singapore will not be complete without a visit to gardens by the bay. The light show at night is superb and expending the day walking thru the garden is absolutely good for you soul.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: My favorite place in all Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: After living in Singapore for 10 years I still make sure to visit the gardens every time I'm in Singapore. Gardens By The Bay are nice but you can't beat the history, tranquility, tradition of the Botanic Gardens. Lots of things stay the same but others are being updated and developed. They're not just a tourist attraction but well-used for lot of activities.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My first visit to the Flower Dome last week, having recently taken advantage of the half price annual pass. A great selection of plants and flowers to be seen and quite remarkable that the whole place is air-conditioned under a large dome with views of the city in the background.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
What a magical place._x000D_
Situated in the Grounds of Gardens by the Bay this biosphere is well worth a visit._x000D_
The plants and waterfall, the slow incline to reach the Clouds is so well worth a visit._x000D_
On a hot or wet day outside this garden is a haven as the temperate climate is refreshing._x000D_
The floral displays of orchids and other exotic flowering plants was an absolute treat.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: a piece of nature in the heart of singapore
REVIEW_BODY: a weekend favorite among families and expact, huge nature reserve and well maintain by Npark. Possibility of using canoes
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Battlebox is well worth a visit when in Singapore. The tour guide was excellent in his knowledge and the films viewed fantastic. Also the mock displays very well done.Many Thanks for a great visit.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Besides housing the Cloud Forest and the Flower Dome, this "park" has many other smaller gardens showing displays from many different countries. It is definitely worth a walk-through, even on a hot and sultry Singapore day (better of course if there's a breeze, but...)
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I found the tour very informative and well dun. They could do with more artefacts. Overall very good.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not For the Faint of Heart, But Definitely Worth It
REVIEW_BODY:
Singapore does a great job of striking a balance between the demands of a developed urban metropolis and preserving green spaces around the island for people to splash around in. Macritchie is part of a much larger reservoir and catchment basin located in the middle of Singapore. They have carved out a 15 km round-trip trail that loops around the reservoir, and while it takes you through some really interesting jungle (I almost got run over by what I think was some kind of pig once), it also butts up against a pristine country club golf course._x000D_
_x000D_
The trail is great exercise, but you should be warned: if you are not used to physical exertion in this climate then you should take it slow. The trail is not a tough trail, but the thick jungle foliage traps the heat and humidity and it will suck the moisture out of you quickly so bring at least a 1.5 litre water bottle. The Tree Top Walk is of course gorgeous, but the walkway is also really narrow so you can easily get trapped behind a group of photo-snapping looky-loos for long stretches of time._x000D_
_x000D_
Also, a word to the wise - keep on eye on the sky. There are shelters spaced about every 1-2 km, but in Singapore the rain can come quick and hard at the drop of a hat. I've been caught in torrential downpours that flooded the trail. It's actually quite fun to get splashed by the rain while walking around a rain forest, but it also short circuited by iPhone so I'm not sure if it was worth it or not.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A pretty impressive development close to the city
REVIEW_BODY:
We walked from Gardens By the Bay through the Marina Bay Sands, the Shopping Centre & then along the boardwalk with the great views of the city, past the museum before crossing the river on the Helix bridge enroute to MTR._x000D_
_x000D_
Would be a great place to stay, but unfortunately we didn't have the opportunity, nor did we have time to visit the casino (next time)._x000D_
_x000D_
A very impressive development, and a great tourist attraction including the Skypark & amzing pool.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was a rainy day when we were on top, but the view was great anyway. We had umbrellas, so it was ok. It's a beautiful hotel/building/pool complex and well worth the price for the ride up in the elevator.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: nice spot for a peaceful walk
REVIEW_BODY: We had a great time here. it was the highlight of our visit and certainly one of the nicest botanic parks we have been too. the quiet refreshing walks, albiet a bit humid, but that is what rain forest walks are supposed to be. stay hydrated.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Views from the skypark were stunning. I especially loved the views of the Gardens by the Bay and Marina Bay at night. However, as expected, somewhat busy.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Took the guided tour (S$20). Very interesting and informative. Life in 1950s Singapore was so different and itâ€™s amazing how far weâ€™ve come from that. Glad that thereâ€™s a museum like this one to remember the life then and educate the more privileged generations of today and tomorrow.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The most beautiful view of Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY:
It's a 30 minute ride. We walked from the helix bridge , caught a quick glimpse of gardens by the bay and walked to the flyer over the beautiful bridge._x000D_
_x000D_
It's best after dark. The ticket was about 33$. Not much queue on a Sunday evening. But the queue did build. So make sure to be there just at sunset.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A wonderful place to walk around in especially in the evening when the lights come on a the food joints open up. Spend an evening here before heading out for dinner.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We have never seen so many orchids. Park is beautiful. Was a little let down that during our visit we as tourists had to pay yet huge signs advertised residents go in for free during December .....food expensive. My advice would be to take water, food with especially when going with kids. Well worth a visit
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great tour for those with an interest in WW2
REVIEW_BODY:
Located on Fort Canning near the hotel this is an interesting tour of the nerve centre for operations during the Japanese invasion of Singapore. Tour guide was informative and paced the tour well._x000D_
Tour lasts just over an hour and came away having learnt lots and got a real feel for what it may have been like at the time.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spectacular! Go late afternoon early evening so you get to enjoy the gardens by day and the night lights. To enjoy an elevated view go towards the MTR platform or walkway towards Marina Bay Sands.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Botanic Gardens are really beautiful with lots of different areas to explore. The gift shop also offers some lovely items with really helpful and friendly staff. Just be prepared for lots of walking, which in the heat of Singapore, is quite hard work! Also there was a lot of building work going on just outside the Tanglin Gate which made finding our way a bit tricky.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A LONG ROAD WITH GREAT SHOPS
REVIEW_BODY: We went to Orchard Road quite a few times whilst there. We were lucky to have a bus stop right outside our hotel but it is a very easy walk from the Regent Hotel. There are some great shops there and needless to say we did buy a few things to bring home.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Gardens by the Bay is amazing, there is so much to see. the architecture is fantastic. The gardens are really well kept, we loved walking through it. We saw the Otters too which was a great bonus. there are cycle paths and pedestrian walkways. There is a gift shop,Toilets and cafes too.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When you are going to Singapore , Taking a picture in the Merlion is a must. and of course this makes the place a tourist magnet where people strangely post in order to get a nice picture. The merlion is an invitation to the "Singapore Culture" but I suggest on going to Sentosa's merlion because you will really know the culture from their.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: VERY NICE BOAT TRIP ON SINGAPORE RIVER, FROM MARINA BAY TO CLARKES QUAY.
REVIEW_BODY: My wife and I used the chance to make a boat trip from Marina Bay up to Clarkes Quay, a very nice moment, around 45 minutes, with a quick stop next to Merlion Statue. I would advise to do it by night, the view and lightshow should be perfect, we did it unfortunately by day...
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Just went to Mandai Zoo on 16 September 2017. The last time i have been here was over 15 years ago. Came here to accompany my wife._x000D_
_x000D_
Pros:_x000D_
1) animals you won't be able to see in a city like Singapore_x000D_
2) the animals in glass enclosures were better as you can see them up close_x000D_
3) was able to see the animal show about monkeys/apes & snakes - the highlight for me was the snake handler walked around for audience to touch the snake: i was able to pet the snake for 2 seconds which i never had the chance to do in my life - that was very interesting!_x000D_
_x000D_
Cons:_x000D_
1) It was raining on & off. The entire place though it has covered walkways was not all covered so we were wet: the management should think about upgrading the place since Singapore is always raining. They didn't have umbrellas for sale so we had to wait for 1 hour for the rain to stop_x000D_
_x000D_
2) Many of the animals were just sleeping or very far off so we couldn't see much. About 50% were like this. The design of the zoo was not good._x000D_
_x000D_
3) There aren't many signs so we won't able to tell where the next exhibits are. Very confusing. Bad map._x000D_
_x000D_
4a) VERY lacking in variety: if you see the map - a lot of animals are MONKEYS lol_x000D_
4b) Missing animals: camel, tiger, seal/walrus, horse, deer, different kinds of goats, buffaloes, wolves, foxes, bats, etc, etc. The big cat sections was also SO disappointing_x000D_
_x000D_
5) The dinosaur section got to be the lamest thing I have seen._x000D_
_x000D_
6) the snake / reptile sections is VERY lacking: there are so many snakes species out there lol!!_x000D_
_x000D_
I really do not know how this zoo gets its award. Certainly not world class lol_x000D_
If i am the in the board of directors, i will fire the CEO. Don't waste time unless you are a city dweller & never seen animals before. Not much improved since 15 years ago.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Price quit expensive, but nice to take a picture in this area. Orchard Road is famous place for Shopping holic.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I have managed to be on Orchard road around Christmas, continuously for the last three years and every time the decor and the festive look steals my heart. In the evenings, the whole place is lit up- high on spirits, fantastic crowd, every type of eateries and coffee shops, it has pretty much something for everyone._x000D_
_x000D_
I have been there on during Chinese New Year, other festivals and normal times- Orchard Road never disappoints. No trip to Singapore can be complete without a walk down the Orchard Road
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was a great way to get to Sentosa, giving you lots of view's of the bay, it was safe & enjoyable.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: So many plants from so many regions of the world are on show in this enclosed dome, and there is also a lovely restaurant if you wish. We were lucky enough to see one of the special exhibitions, which had tulips of every colour!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was a very great experience at Tulipmania, gardens by the bay. I brought my nice from Australia and she was impressed especially with the light up at Super Grove. She is definitely coming back with her friends from Australia. Lovely day
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really great place for shopping and eating. Good food and shopping joints are near the Chinatown MRT exit A. Food options are also there for the vegetarian diet preference. Marriamman temple and a mosque is 1 minutes away from exit A. Buddha Tooth relic temple is at 5 minutes walking distance. Modest dress code is required for these places of worship. Maxwell food court is near the lane opposite the Buddha Tooth relic temple. It offers cheap food options 1.5 to 5 SGD per dish and the food quantity is generous. This food court is open from 11 am till 10 pm.The Chinatown food street is open from 11.30 am to 10 pm. But some restaurants in the vicinity of exit A maybe open from 7 am to 11 pm. There is a 7-11 shop and a pharmacy right outside the MRT exit A. One can buy breakfast items, toiletries and drinks at these places. The Singapore skyline buildings ( that we see from Marina Bay Sands Malls) are at a 20 minutes walking distance from the MRT exit A.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I went to this place to get a view of Singapore skyline. The fare costs S$25 and we were told to get a small change since the guy didn't have a change. They only accept cash. The ride was smooth and educational. Definitely worth it because you could see all Singapore skylines, such as Merlion, Esplanade, etc. from the boat. Perfect for picture taking.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very nice to stroll here in the gardens. The interesting lizards were fascinating and the ginger garden and ponds were lovely.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice option for the ones who visit Singapore .. I had a night safari in the very first day of my tour. English language safari guide.. Photography is allowed with out flash lights
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The place is a must visit. The sight of the Marina Bay Sands and the other buildings and structures around the area.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This was my second visit to the MacRitchie Nature Preserve. The first visit was in April but second visit was in June. During our June visit we were able to see the beautiful monkeys. We were hoping to hike the treetop trail but that trail is not open on Mondays. Although we did not hike the treetop trail we were able to continue on the trail and just skip that part! It is a long hike but just take your time and bring water. The trails are mostly paved but I still wore hiking boots (gym shoes will be fine)._x000D_
_x000D_
It was great breathing in the fresh air. As you walk you will enter a gulf course, which seemed extremely odd, but not too distracting._x000D_
_x000D_
Note: Treetop trail is closed on Mondays. Wear mosquito repellant.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
My husband and I stayed at the Marina Bay Sands so we were able to walk across to the Skypark....beautiful gardens and water fountains.....and the show at night worth the look...colourful and with music played._x000D_
Lots to see there...unfortunately we didn't have enough time to see all.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I must point out, I am really not a nature loving kind of person, but this place got me._x000D_
It is incredibly beautiful._x000D_
What they have done with the place is both educational and relaxing. Something about the trees and flowers and plants just makes you feel emotional._x000D_
I loved it._x000D_
I only give four stars because after a while, I was just bored... again because I can only take nature so far._x000D_
But it is definitely a must see._x000D_
The kids on school tours looked to be having the time of their lives. They made me want to be young again._x000D_
Ps: make sure to stay for the lights show after 6pm. Its amazing
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must seee if you are visiting Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Great place to visit, the kids loved it as much as the adults. Lying under the stars watching the light and music show was a highlight and the water park was a welcome cool down on a ridiculously hot day
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I enjoyed my first visit last year and was pleasantly surprised to discover that there are many improvements made in the Cloud Dome that would make one appreciate Forests more. They also changed the plants in the Flower Dome. I'd say you can visit many times and each time would be a different experience.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are wondering through the botanical gardens then it is well worth a visit! Entry is $5 a person which seems fair given the beautiful orchids on display.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved orchard road.. was very busy when we went.. shopping malls everywhere u go.. they also had indoor markets which were good and worth it to buy gifts and souvenirs to take back home.. lots of places to eat.. we downloaded a map of Singapore before we went out.. made out life 10x easier
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Observation deck at 57th floor of iconic Marina bay sand hotel,have amazing view of Singapore. We visited last 1st week of September,as it was off season and weekday so no rush,didnt have to wait for a minute till lift,only few minutes for lift.Ticket price is 23 SGD but on different apps its less,i bought from Klook and it cost 21 SGD plus a limo bubble tea.The mail from Klook is itself a ticket which can be directly scan at turnstile We reached top around 6 pm and stayed there tilk 8 pm,got chance to view both during light and after sunset. Views were majestic. Worth visit in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Interesting artifacts and history. If and when you are in the vicinity of Chinatown, it is free to visit this temple. Of course donations are appreciated to help maintain the temple.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very pretty flowers. All kinds or orchids and other flowers. I would go back time and time again. It is a bit of a walk to get there but worth each step. Go there I am not a flower guy but it was with it.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I'm not a huge fan of art galleries but this one had me hooked on it for 3 hours._x000D_
It's also a beautiful colonial building in the center of Singapore._x000D_
One thing I should point out is the "social table". Here, with the excellent help of the member of staff (Saturday 27th October), you can select art items from the rolling digital display table and email them to yourself. It really is fantastic so you can keep a record of your favour pieces of art. Once emailed you could print it, make a t-shirt or put it on a mug._x000D_
Many thanks to the member of staff that day who was very helpful.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fun visit with the kids, a large variety of animals include a rain forest area where the animal is walking around (not caged). Also a cooling area with water play ground to escape the heat :)
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Same as everywhere else in the world
REVIEW_BODY: Loads of shopping malls but ultimately the same brands you get world over so don't expect anything new or exciting.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Peaceful... Calm...Amazing.. Definitely worth a visit
REVIEW_BODY: A very nice, calm and serene place and well worth a visit. Its very close to Chinatown, The Temple Wals are simply beautiful and amazing with Buddha figurines in various mudras. This place is one of my favourite since, this was the first ever place i visited when i Landed in singapore. There are strict dress coded for Ladies.. hands and legs should not be exposed. However stolls are provided free of charge. Museum and gallery above the main hall is also great to visit. Lot of Different Buddha Figurines are on display and place to meditate too.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is an interesting attraction which is worth for the tourists to walk around. The skywalk has wonderful scene but some are very scare when walking through it. The Domes are nice and highly recommended to the tourists.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful displays in dome, much to do
REVIEW_BODY:
I went to both domes and am amazed at the quality of displays for all types of trees, plants, flowers, etc._x000D_
_x000D_
Very cool in domes, so a welcome rescue from the heat. Weekends are busy, but manageable._x000D_
_x000D_
EVERYONE is taking photos of each other, selfies, etc, which is somewhat a nuisance if you're aiming for an uninterrupted stroll. Probably the single greatest displays of selfie sticks I've ever seen...._x000D_
_x000D_
Plan to go to both domes, maybe a break in between for lunch or snack. The Super Grove is beautiful, OCBC Skyway is a fun walk, but not a big highlight for me._x000D_
_x000D_
Skip the shuttle into the park, unless you really are unable to walk well. The walk into the park is very nice. Plenty of places to wander alone in the park - you could spend a full day enjoying this.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Superb ! I know it's a man made artificial garden but it's beautiful both during day and at night. Love it - if you are in Singapore don't miss it
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What an amazing area! Well worth the entrance fees to the flower dome , cloud forest dome and skywalk. Lovely just to stroll through the various free garden areas.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When we enter you will feel as we are entering our own garden. Because it is so clean. We can a cess every corner of the garden. We can relax at water poundage.
ADDRESS: 1 Chinese Garden Road Chinese Garden, Singapore 619795, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As an architecture fan, I was really amazed by this bridge, from its form, length and design. A very nice view can be seen from here and you can also chill while watching sunset here... NICE!
ADDRESS: 221 Henderson Road Henderson Building, Singapore 159557, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Vibrant Walk , with access to all brand and food joints
REVIEW_BODY: We dint have shopping on our minds ,so just went there for a short while on our way back from Universal. Good vibrant walk , and unfortunately for me , my wife found TFS and ended up shopping :) . The place is bustling with regular and high end brands and has numerous good eateries also.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: English and Chinese explanations in the temple. Showcases Buddhist faith. The temple is also air conditioned and beside a food market.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Like Chinatown in most cities, Singapore's Chinatown has lots of market style shops and cafes to delight. A lot of fun
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Huge structures. Very beautiful at night with those lights. Amazing view. Try to find a good spot to take photo.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When we visited there was only a small queue and 10 people in total in the capsule. It is a longish walk in the heat from the closest MRT to a multi level complex, tickets can be purchased on the ground level. The ride was excellent, not too fast or slow, but some information on the view points of interest would have been useful. Worth doing a value for the cost
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I am not normally a zoo fan as keeping animals locked up does not sit well with me. However, this zoo has created a space that is open and comfortable for animals to roam. The enclosures for some of the bigger cats could have been better, the cheetahs paced up and down the moat looking very unhappy. Overall, a respectful place for animals.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing swimming pool and restaurants day and evening
REVIEW_BODY: At the beginning of the spring it was very beautiful to walk around. The garden is nice and well taken care . It is very warm so it makes it difficult to stay out. But the beauty of flowers makes it worth.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Visited using a hop-on, hip-off bus, very easy to get to. Absolutely beautiful place, well worth a visit. We saw a number of Clouded Monitors walking around, just look off the path and you may see/hear them walking through the leaves._x000D_
_x000D_
This is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and itâ€™s easy to see why. Itâ€™s great that Singapore has preserved this land as you get a sense of what Singapore may have been like before it was developed. So many beautiful trees and plants, very relaxing walk (and many different trails to explore).
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I found this Chinatown to be huge in comparison with the ones we have in California--yes, even San Francisco. This Chinatown stretches on for what seems lie miles. We visited near the Chinese New Year and the area was beautifully decorated!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Is not that extra ordinary. You can skip this if you done have time. It started raining heavily when we were there. So it ruined our experience.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Lovely area to walk around._x000D_
_x000D_
Plenty to see and very picturesque._x000D_
_x000D_
Laser show every night which is worth a look and impressive images are projected on a mist created by the water._x000D_
_x000D_
Also hope to the iconic marina bay Sands hotel which makes a very bold statement to the area
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Excellent historical tour and a truly excellent guide. Can definitely recommend to all ages. The detail of the main "decision" room with the wax figures was very professional. Our guide was very knowelgeable and delivered her message with good presentation and a touch of humour for interest. Simply a superb tour.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the bay is very attractive place with very nice show. I enjoyed the show with super tree, also music and light.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Itâ€™s always a joy to visit the Botanic Gardens
REVIEW_BODY: We visit the Botanic Gardens regularly and every visit is a joy. This time we walked into the forest near the entrance which led us to the orchid gardens. It was a very enjoyable stroll. :D
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a wonderous place with a "wow" around every corner. The Cloud Room was my favourite. Even though the day we visited was overcast, the exhibits were amazing. We took the opportunity to go the Roof Top bar where we saw the entire Gardens from a 360 degree view, whilst having a bite to eat & a wine. Buses will take you anywhere around the garden, without any trouble.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: we walk in this street every night the atmosphere is high and shopping is good with every thing is available
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You should take a walk around the Merlion during the day and at night as well, the view to skyscrapers and marina hotel are great you can enjoy a drink in coffees and restaurants nearby
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Walking Tour in the heart of financial (central) district
REVIEW_BODY: Interesting walking trail to discover the Peranakan and different Chinese cultures and heritage. Museum is tacked away in the heart of the financial district. Artistic pieces (original) and option of replica design. Very limited street parking.
ADDRESS: 39 Armenian Street Peranakan Museum, Singapore 179941, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Time your visit from 4.30 pm to 9.30 pm due to our weather. The early hours visit the 2 domes with its amazing rain forest and flowers. After the sunset this area will light up with beautiful colors and not forgetting your cameras . Food is within reach in the area,_x000D_
International flower shows are held yearly. Need to check with the S'pore tourist Board.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a great experience both daytime and nighttime. The grounds are kept immaculate and free of charge. The 2 conservatories were an extra fee but kept cool so a great way to cool off from a hot humid day. And the light show on the metal trees was set to music and fabulous twice a night. Walk around the garden both day and night. (Kids water park too) A must do while in Singapore. A great view of the garden from atop the Marina Bay Sands too.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This popular Buddhist temple is located along Waterloo Street. The temple is easily accessible and is about 5 to 10 minutes away from the Bugis MRT Station. Do note that the temple will be very crowded with devotees on the 1st and 15th of every lunar month.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Kuan Yin Thong Hood Cho Temple
ADDRESS: 178 Waterloo Street Kwan im Temple, Singapore 187964, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A wonderful temple. Very beautiful. Very pious. Very neat and clean. Always full of visitors and devotees. Very near to China town MRT station. Free entry for one and all. Picturesque place. A must visit to see it and appreciate.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This view is great! I can have an overview of central Singapore from there. However, it would be recommended if service provider gives tourists a small free picture as souvenir (I/o charging them $25) since the price is quite high in comparison with other places
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: THis is one of the most peaceful and beautiful things you can do in Singapore. Highly recommend it for a few hours.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I was staying at the Marina Bay so I did t have to pay to access the Sky park._x000D_
I must say the view over here is just spectacular. You get a great view of Singapore with all the buildings, the harbour and the Ferris wheel and also garden by the bay._x000D_
I would definitely recommend this attraction for people visiting Singapore
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: great place to relax, people watching, get some sunlight sitted on the chairs, or do a bit of jogging. there are often also boat races.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is by far so amazing that I really feel short of words to express the beauty of this place please to visit
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You should not miss this attraction when you visit Singapore. It is an amazing place. Highly recommended!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Starting from the Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands, me and my friend walked past the very shiny LV building, over the bridge, past the Fullerton Hotel until we reached the Merlion._x000D_
_x000D_
We proceeded to take every touristy pose possible with the Merlion in the background. Also caught an Eggexcutor pokemon. Really good place to hatch eggs for the walk.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I am well travelled and seen many light/music shows etc but these gardens and the light/music show is just truly something out of this world._x000D_
_x000D_
We visited Gardens by the Bay as a family of 10 people, we went at approx 4pm. No queue for tickets to get into the two domes, and a relatively easy process. They recommend that you wait to by the sky walk passes once you are down there as they can close the skywalk dependant on weather conditions._x000D_
_x000D_
We opted for the flower dome first which had an orchid festival on. The orchids were amazing and so pretty and beautiful - patterns and colours that I have never seen before. This dome is split into gardens from all over the world and their native flowers and trees. After, we completed the cloud dome and again this was amazing. We were in the dome for the misting and that is fantastic for picture opportunities. The museum at the end of the cloud dome is eye opening - it describes all of the damage that we are doing to earth and the predictions that professionals are making - I highly recommend watching the short movie clip â€œ+5 degreesâ€_x000D_
_x000D_
Both domes took us around 3 hours but you could easily spend more or less time depending on how much time you want to spend in them. After the domes we headed to the skywalk also where the music and light show takes place._x000D_
_x000D_
Now in hindsight and what I would recommend doing is being down there as early as possible unless you want to do the skywalk in the evening. We done the skywalk around 730pm, which by this point it was dark. However the show begins at 745pm and they recommend that you are down underneath the trees lying down to look up and watch the show under the â€˜starsâ€™. We started queuing for the skywalk at around 630 so we waited in the queue for approx 1hour, completed the skywalk and were back down for the show to begin. The recommended time up in the skywalk is only 15mins and you have stewards that move you along if you are spending too much time up there._x000D_
_x000D_
The show itself is amazing, especially when you know that the entire gardens/domes/show is self sufficient and runs on solar power and collected water (for misting). The show is highly recommended and I cant stress this enough, it is truly magnificent and something you have to experience yourself to truly appreciate the beauty of it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Does anyone even need a recommendation for this place?_x000D_
