Every night there is a light show startig at 7.45, which lasts around 15 mins. Make sure to be up while it lasts cause of the amazing view and experience. To go to the bridge you have to pay 8SGD. By the time you go down and find yourself a place to lay down and enjoy the lights new light show starts at 8.45. Donâ€™t miss it. Breathtaking.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I love how this place looks like in person. I just went on a quick stroll to this place since I just live nearby and haven't really gone inside._x000D_
_x000D_
Remember that this is a temple so you need to wear appropriate clothing. They also have Introduction to Meditation classes there. Be sure to come early so you can check the schedule.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We arrived around 7pm for the 8:15 show. When we arrived, there werenâ€™t any staff to show where the line started, and were wandering around the entrance for about 10 minutes._x000D_
_x000D_
We waited in the line for an hour and a half. The line was long because they mixed both 7pm and 8pm groups. When that was done, we went to another line for another hour. By the time we got inside the tour car, we were already tired, and sweating._x000D_
_x000D_
That being said, the attractions and animals we saw were amazing and I was able to see new animals Iâ€™d never seen before._x000D_
_x000D_
I hope to be back as soon as the problem is fixed.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Known for all the top brands in Fashion!
REVIEW_BODY: A broad selection of shopping centres almost along the entire Road. Though this time we also discovered several quality restaurants that focus on being open in the evening! Great to find several large granite benches on which to sit, and an underpass can take you from one side of the street to the other with little effort required.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best value ever for a sight seeing extravaganza
REVIEW_BODY:
I cant believe how amazing this place is! Just walking into the cool was bliss on legs, then walking through mist to see the hugest array of plants I have ever seen. The pathway becomes an airial l walk way once you take the lift to the 6th floor then walk down. Apart from the plants, what was truely amazing were the statues made out of driftwood, which were attached to walls or protruding out of the plants. Dont skimp on time - one could spend at least 2 hours in this place - and then there is the other plant dome to explore._x000D_
There are posters along the way that provide clear information about the plants and the habitat they are from. Definitely worth a visit
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I went to Garden by the Bay last Aug with my family, it was the best experience I had in singapore , the garden, the lights were amazing n breathtaking...so when I was in singapore again last week, I went again n had the same amazing time..this is one place everyone should go when in singapore...hope to return next year..
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Despite many reviews, I think we enjoyed this more than the Cloud Dome. Cool, and inviting with many different types of flora to see.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to see SE Asian Art
REVIEW_BODY: I was amazed with the depth and breadth of collection. I visited this place during a 8 hour transit in Singapore and I only had 2 hours to explore this but it provided ample opportunity to enjoy it. Amazing architecture.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: very hot walking around this very large garden, take water with you, what more can be said its a large green area with plants and trees in it,
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Most tour guides suggested that the Flower Dome should be visited. Although I'm not a mad flora fan, our family visited this site and we were not disappointed. The various species of flowers and plants and the way they were presented was amazing and incredible. It is a photographers dream. All in all, we were highly impressed and we enjoyed the visit immensely
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent part of the Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: To any Flower lovers this is a must see when visiting Singapore. One can easily spend several hours enjoying this cool respite from the heat and humidity of Singapore. I have never before seen so many different colour and variety of orchid. Brilliant!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice place to visit..i visited there first time even though it was memorable. Best place for bird lover.. Must visit in lifetime..
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The cloud forest is amazing, really really amazing. Maybe leave it till last as everything else pales in comparison.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We caught a bus to Chinatown and had a look around. But nothing really that we hadn't seen before. The architecture seems to be the same as we have been before and the Temple that we saw as well.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited with wife and teenagers son. So.many species of Bird can be see. Very well maintained. Don't miss the shows, they are too good. You should be prepared to walk a lot. But nice greenery and so.many birds to see. It feel energetic to be with the bird in park. Nice place to visit , when in singapore
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gorgeous flowers, plants and cute wildlife. It was a smoggy day and it was so humid there. I mean, it's humid a lot in Singapore, but this place took the humidity prize. No breeze could make it through all trees. The garden itself was lovely though. Recommend it, but maybe check the forecast before you go.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent 6 nights staying here. The location is awesome. So close to restaurants, bars and public transport. Well worth the stay.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Never seen anything like this. Must must visit for everyone. You have to be there in evening around 7pm to see the awesome light show that happens each evening. It's unique, magical and a thing that you will never forget.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth it we licked out and go the light show which was fantastic with the musical background, absolutely take the kids they will love it so will the adults awesome place to meander around recommend for sure
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great for a walk or to see the nightly water and laser show
REVIEW_BODY: The promenade is great for a walk of to watch the nightly laser and fountain show at 8pm and 9pm on weekdays with an extra show on weekends. The Esplanade is a good place to watch the show from that is in front of the iconic Marina Bay Sands hotel with the lasers coming from the hotel.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great atmosphere but too much hassling.
REVIEW_BODY: Very busy, very noisy. Lots of shops selling the same things. Be wary of entering the jewellery shops - for us the hassling by at least 2 staff was endless and prices decreased by 75% in minutes! It wore us down so much we left.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I had been looking forward to visiting this museum for months and it exceeded every expectation. The collection, which is not fully up yet, is simply amazing. The more modern southeast Asian collection did not do much for me but that's my own personal taste. All the rest, however, REALLY REALLY great. The buildings which house the museum are also a destination in their own right. If you only have time for one museum in Singapore, make sure it's this one!
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Emerald Hill is a nice place for a stroll. The buildings have all been well preserved. There are plenty of bars and restaurants to choose from, but being in the middle of Orchid and Expat Central, the prices are not cheap.
ADDRESS: Off Orchard Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Main attraction here is treetop walk. Lesser known attraction is jelutong tower & it also offers stunning views
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: If love flower, must enter this place
REVIEW_BODY:
Flower dome is not only to see flower or plants but Entertaiment education for children. They put signage name and country of plants._x000D_
_x000D_
We spend two hours inside. All families member happy and read the signage._x000D_
_x000D_
For Christmas celebration , they decorates all area with spectacular ornaments._x000D_
_x000D_
They designed amazing place for people who love flower and plant
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore Zoo vs San Diego Zoo ... Probably top 2 on earth. This is an amazing experience; getting close to animals like never before ... take your kids and don't forget their swimsuits :)
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing light in the night when we walk through it. It is better to go to the bridge in the end of afternoon until night.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice place to shop shopping malls are all big foods is everywhere but very crowded on Sunday signatures are everywhere
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you love the tropics and can handle the humidity spend a day here. The fauna is green and lush and theres plenty of birds and butterflies. Expect to take half a day. Pack a lunch or get food there and don't forget your water and umbrella the afternoon storms are drenching
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Arrived in a huge downpour but continued to look around and it was so worth it! Rain didn't last long. Even if you are not a gardener it is still worthwhile to take a walk through here._x000D_
Costs to view the orchid garden which was impressive.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Have walked past this place many times and finally called in here last month. What a find! We ate and had drinks at a cafe on the first level. Food was good and beers were $5.90 a pint. Then went downstairs to the Irish Pub. Had the best Singapore Slings and they were $10 each. Great atmosphere in there.
ADDRESS: 30 Victoria Street Chijmes, Singapore 187996, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a sort of Eden Project and Heligan rolled into one, wonderful plants and trees full of colour and imagination well worth a visit
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The best part of the "Gardens by the Bay" is the sound and light show conducted at evening. The sound and light show is called "Divine Rhapsody" and its truly divine experience to view it. The garden is spread over a significant area with sky bridge, lakes, super trees and other attractions.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Learn about Cloud Forests - respect Nature
REVIEW_BODY:
GRT indoor activity._x000D_
Educative apart from being beautiful and overwhelming in terms of architecture and splendour._x000D_
The recreation of varying temperature zones along with plants and cloud forests is touching._x000D_
The waterfall is the icing on the cake._x000D_
Learn about global warming and how cloud forests are so important to conserve._x000D_
Must do with children bet 10-15 yrs of age.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Wait! Come here at night time! It the best time to appreciate the main feature of why Itâ€™s Supertree!_x000D_
_x000D_
The scenery alone here at night time is awesome and amazing!_x000D_
_x000D_
Then it blows your mind with the light symphony!!!! You must wait, I just donâ€™t know what time they play that but we were there around 9 PM and we witnessed it twice! Youâ€™ll never tire of it!_x000D_
_x000D_
Make sure get a good place to sit down or even lie down so you wonâ€™t have a neck crick, some were already lying down around the tree when we got there and when it started that how we understood. Anyhow, itâ€™s also worth recording the light symphony:)â¤ï¸
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: First rent the TV show Danny Forster's Marina Bay Sands Skypark episode. Then go see the skylark. You will really appreciate the engineering!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic bridge across to Marina Sands
REVIEW_BODY: What a lovely bridge. Like a spring laid on its side and stretched across the bay, holding up a walkway. On both sides there are platforms to stop at and enjoy the views of the skyscrapers in the city.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is quite a show piece for Singapore and whilst bordering on the overtly designed for tourist attractions it is just one that is worth experiencing if you are in Singapore. The super grove trees are just a great design.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is exactly as you would expect a Chinatown to be, busy, noise, crowded full of restaurants, shops and people trying to attract you in. Shop keepers are persistent but ridiculously friendly. They may give you a bad deal but always with a nice tone. Really, what is not to like?
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic tour but book in advance
REVIEW_BODY: Incredibly well presented overview of the events leading to the Japanese occupation of Malaya and Singapore during WW2. The â€œStory of Strategy and Surrenderâ€ tour takes you around a former (and fortunately now air conditioned!) command bunker whilst unveiling the causes behind the British surrender in Singapore. A well spent 1.5 hours for anyone interested in wartime history. Make sure you book in advance via email and are there early otherwise your tickets will go!
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nice park to see variety of sea animals. Key attraction is the 2 pandas from China and you can spot the red panda too in the same air con enclosure. It's mostly sheltered thus good on rainy days and hot weather too. Good information on the fishes and the place they came from.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Chinatown in Singapore takes you back to the Chinatown of old, filled with hawkers, food stalls, traders selling all imaginable goods. Amongst the souvenir & trinket sellers there are some wonderful things to see and explore._x000D_
This is a place definitely worth spending a few hours exploring and perhaps enjoying a meal from one of the many stalls or restaurants selling every foot type imaginable.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good for an overview of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: We went on a clear day in the morning, but I suspect it's really good at twilight time. Great views and well organised.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It is great to have a taste of another country within a city/country, and similar to China Towns in many places, I guess Little India in Singapore is great for the Tamils living here. I have been here twice on this visit, but although as a South Asian I like to stroll along Serangoon Road, and browse in the shops selling clothes, bangles, incense, music, some handicrafts and jewelry, and offer a variety of Indian food, it still feels short of much that could add value to its name._x000D_
_x000D_
Given that the majority of the Indian community in Singapore hails from the south of India, one wishes to come across glimpses of the huge diversity of that country, and a bit of representation from at least a few of its many states. This is sorely missing from Little India. There's gold jewelry galore, and many shops that sell heavy, bridal gold jewelry. One wants to see many more saree shops, many more handicrafts from India's different regions, music in various languages of that country, and more variety in the cuisines._x000D_
_x000D_
The large 'everything under one roof' kind of store called Mustafa is a complete clutter. Though it has every imaginable item - from fresh fruit, vegetables to cosmetics, from detergents to electronics, but the place offers no sense of design and it presents a picture that's more like a bazaar than a department store._x000D_
_x000D_
Some maintenance of the footpaths and fewer or no encroachment on them could also elevate the general ambience of Little India. However, it is nice for the South Asian as well as other communities to get a taste of India here, albeit a small taste.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: if you want to escape the rat race of Singapore, this a great place to visit, very peaceful and tranquil
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went to visit the gardens by the bay around 5pm so you can visit and after see the light show, it is beautiful, take some repellent with you, when the sunset all the mosquitos come! You can walk 10 min, just cross the bridge or pay 3 dollars for transfer to the trees, the entry is free but if you want to go inside the conservatory you have to pay!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You will not be disappointed as there are truckloads of fab malls here, boutique shops from top end to affordable. We will return!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: At night it is brilliant perhaps almost a must do in Singapore. The views are brilliant you will enjoy it.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful place really different and plenty of staff looking after the gardens nice leisurely walk worth going to the top even if you don't like heights
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If youâ€™re looking for something with a label, this is the place to visit, designer shops in abundance from Michael Kors to Prada to Louis Vuitton, itâ€™s very expensive but well worth a look, itâ€™ll take you at least 3-4 hours just to wander around get your bearings & see one mall, but there are some interesting sculptures & pieces of art along the way.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: 4th time at the safari. Queuing for the show was messy. It caused us to miss the train which stops 1h hour before closure.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I wasn't sure about going on the Night Safari but was glad I did. You were so close to the animals and viewing them was quite the experience for nighttime. You do the tram ride and then can do the walking tour. The rain forest is quite impressive.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went here for our first diner in asia. Finding a place for diner is easy here. Very crowded but nice to look and to be seen. Queue for the entrace of a restaurant was new for us :-)
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: it was a bit scary as it is really high worth a trip up to Mount Faber and then to the end of Sentosa
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved every minute! The laser tree show was amazing! We loved walking in the cloud garden and tree art was amazing. We also visited the flower garden which was stunning, the colours of flowers was fabulous.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Got the cable car over to sentosa island from harbour bay mrt station, fantastic views of the harbour & beyond, it goes over the top of any cruise liners in the harbour, well worth the trip
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Being from Vegas, I must visit some foreign casinos. However I didn't visit this one because you must pay to get into the casino area...hmmm. So never went to the top but did walk around and being adjacent to the subway made that walk ok. Located near to the Singapore gardens.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Cool place but not as cool as Cloud Forest Pretty much smelly since there're a lot of flowers here Two hours should be enough to get around
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is a unique way to travel to Sentosa - very fun! Clearly, if you have height issues this is not for you, but it felt very secure for me and was a wonderful way to get the lay of the land. You can purchase both a round trip ticket and a day pass since there are separate lines on the island to help in getting around. No lines to speak of - got a private car both rides._x000D_
_x000D_
The best surprise was how beautiful Mount Faber was! Worth the cab ride just for the view. They have a very cute restaurant that we unfortunately not get to try. There is "Happiness Bell" you can ring (also a great photo op). You can also purchase a small personal bell at the gift shop (2 sing - very reasonable), write a personal wish on it, and then tie it with many others to the fence at the view point. It was nice to feel we could leave a little momento.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Another visit to Orchard Road from Australia
REVIEW_BODY: Always something to see each time one visits Orchard Rd. We have been going to Singapore yearly since 2005. What changes & shopping experiences we have had. We always stay about a 5 minute walk to the centre of Orchard. Everything at your finger tips. MRT in the ION will take you anywhere you want to go . Taxis readily available at a very cheap reliable rate.Just a beautiful Rd & full of shade trees.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is like the other iconic flyers around the world, in London, and now even in Vegas. This one is in a prime spot on the water with great views of the City from every perspective._x000D_
_x000D_
Plan for an hour or more, go either at sunset or a little later when all the lights are on, especially in the Harbor area._x000D_
_x000D_
I loved that the pods are air conditioned also. Kind of a chill way to get a taste for this great City. Go early in your trip too.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore's shopping district, and one of my favorite places in SG. Lots of designer brands are in the area, as well as coffee shops and restaurants. Love the fun and vibrant atmosphere of the place.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Nicely decorated due to Diwali An average market for daily routine amenities. Wonderful vegetarian options available like Komala's and Kailash Parbat. Only Mustafa centre is worth to visit.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The waterfront is spectacular. So clean and so well maintained. Hint : To get a full appreciation take a boat ride from Clarke Quay around the bay. Tour guides are very friendly and you get an audio of the history of the area. Great mix of the old buildings and the new
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Hopped on MRT to Kranji & transferred to bus outside the station. Bus driver did not have good English but a passenger was so helpful and assisted me in paying fare and best jump off point from bus. I was greeted by a reserve guide who gave me a personal presentation of the reserve map and to watch out for wildlife (monitor lizards, crocodile) which worried me a bit but realised there are dedicated raised walking tracks. I had the best time walking in the reserve and could imagine migratory birds from the northern hemisphere during the peak season (September to March). Walking tracks were well kept with dedicated access points to lagoon & Johor strait overlooking Malaysia. Saw herons in the lagoon, crocodile in the strait of Johor & lots of fish in the shallows. I highly recommend this reserve.
ADDRESS: 301 Neo Tiew Crescent Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve, Singapore 718925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: 6 of us had breakfast with the orangutans then toured the zoo. Great to be up close with the orangutans but would have been nice to have "contact" with them. We all thought the zoo was terrific. Plenty of animals to see, very well presented enclosures, good shows. Well worth a visit. Allow at least half a day.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Had to go on as this is the 4th Big Wheel in the world. Great views. We went on during the day. We pre-booked before visiting Singapore.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing place to visit in Singapore for nature lovers.
REVIEW_BODY: Garden by bay has two Conservatories Flower dome and Cloud forest with entry fees of 28 S$ PAX and free entry area with the nightly Garden Rhapsody lights and music show at Supertree Grove 7:45pm and 8:45pm. The Flower Dome replicates the cool-dry climate of Mediterranean regions and houses a collection of plants from deserts all over the world. Cloud Forest is 35-metre tall mountain with man made water fall showcases plant life from tropical highlands up to 2,000 metres above sea level.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Located right next to Orchard, it's refreshing to visit during the weekends when town is packed with people. If Garden by the bay is wonder of Singapore then Botanic Gardens would definitely be the nature legacy of Singapore from 150 years ago. The park is filled with different varieties of tropical species plus beautiful Orchid garden in the middle (with admission), so you can see and study plants all around Asia. Not to mention, you can bring dogs too.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Itâ€˜s the cheaper variation to the clarke quay.. itâ€˜s also very alived there.. also a little noisy, but not disturbing noisy.. the restaurants are mixed with brs together.. so on the one side you have a quite restaurant and on the other side you have a loud beer bar for example.. if you like to go eat or drinking does not matter, go there..
ADDRESS: 1 Bonham Street Uob Building, Singapore 049782, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of a kind greenhouse attraction in tropical Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Visit for a breath-taking experience. It is the gem of the huge Gardens By The Bay. It also gives a welcome respite from the heat in the open park.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the must do things in Singapore, really interesting and with great views of the Marina by day & by night. The light show was cool
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This free show on at 7.45pm and 8.45pm every night is a real treat for visitors to the city to enjoy. It is a stunning riot of colours, flashing and sparkling in movement to a variety of well known tunes. I saw it twice, and both times it was on time, and well supported. Easy to get to on the MRT to Bayfront.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Do not purchase tickets from Voyagin. We bought tickets to the 7pm session from Voyagin and arrived to find that the 7.15 and 8.15 sessions were sold out and that we would have to wait until 9.15. I found the information on the Voyagin website deceptive as they allow you to book into a session time but do not explain that it doesn't mean that you are guaranteed a spot at that time._x000D_
It takes a couple of hours to see the animals, and then it is a fair distance to travel back to the city centre so be prepared for a late night!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing mid-Autumn moon festival display at the Gardens by the Bay! Magical experience highly recommended!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We have been here several times. Having the combined zoo, river safari, night safari and bird park pass is helpful - very well priced and recommended if you intend on going several time a year._x000D_
_x000D_
This park entrance is next to the zoo. It is fully sheltered and some sections have aircon so this makes it a great choice for those who can cope with the humidity/sun or even in a rainy day._x000D_
_x000D_
It is very pram and wheelchair friendly with ramps everywhere for an easy walk._x000D_
_x000D_
This park is really about the different rivers around the world and the animals and fish who live in those ecosystems. It includes the Amazon, Ganges, Mississippi, Murray, Yangtze rivers, just to name a few. The main stars are the pandas, Piranhas, and the manatees._x000D_
_x000D_
Great for all ages and it's like an outdoor sheltered aquarium with some land animals like panda, monkeys etc._x000D_
_x000D_
Note the River cruise is free as part of ticket price and the Amazon cruise is extra plus height restrictions so young kids can't go onboard. Enjoy!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Decided to walk around the neighbourhood whitest staying in the area. Full of fabrics, textiles and food. Only ate once at a north Indian restaurant but wasn't too impressed with the food._x000D_
Nice atmosphere, clean and prices are better than downtown so your dollars will go a little further.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's a great escape from the bustling city. There are many different sections to this garden. Plants and trees are labelled and makes a great educational trip for students too.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very well planned and organized. Loved the restaurant at the entrance. The best part of the visit was Children's Garden ground where my son spend 20-30 minutes with the water play. They allow 6-12 years old children. Kids cafe also offer a good variety of snacks and meals. Could forest was amazing and in the Flower dome orchid extravaganza festival was mind blowing. We missed the Supertree Grove due to shortage of time. However, we will visit next time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The greenhouse are wow and much bigger than you think. At certain times of day a Mist is generated which some people may like to avoid. Great plants!!!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Matthew was our very knowledgeable guide, and provided a comprehensive account of WW2 events in Singapore and surrounds. He talked rather fast, and could perhaps have injected a bit more animation and fun for the younger ones on the tour with us. We did follow his advice and wandered around above ground to find the other historic structures. An enjoyable morning.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: There is a big merlion and a couple of small merlions in the park. Always packed with tourists. Nice if you can walk around the area as there are special bridges nearby and a small mall.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: What a fabulous place to see at night
REVIEW_BODY: This is a great place to eat out and watch the world go by, we were lucky to hear and open air concert and see a traditional puppet show.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: went during the christmas season, main exhibitions were christmassy flowers with fake snow, bears, reindeers and toy soldiers. for the spring season now, they've got cherry blossoms! bring a jacket if you're sensitive to cold, as temperature in the domes are lower than outside. the waterfall dome is much colder and windier though.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful view of the city at night
REVIEW_BODY: The water show is amazing. The space is very big and windy. It brought me so many emotions and inspiration when I see the whole beautiful city from an unique point of view
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Great place for a walk._x000D_
_x000D_
Botanical gardens and visitor attractions in the gardens such as the cloud forest and of course the super tree grove where you can watch the special light effects in time with the music which is great fun at night._x000D_
_x000D_
And if you are there make sure you visit Satay by the Bay. Really good choice of vendors to choose your street food satay from. Worth going just for this
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is very far even by MRT. It took us almost 45 minutes to reach by MRT from orchard road. So plan travel accordingly. You do have a direct bus to orchard from the bus stop which is right outside the MRT. If i remember it correctly its 131. its adjacent to the MRT station. the place is under renovation and hence we could only see the ten courts of hell. It depicts the various punishments a person has to go through for their sins and then reach salvation. No entry fee and is made by Haw and Par - 2 brothers. Its the off beaten thing to do and I personally enjoyed visiting this place even though its far..
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the bay is absolutly beautiful....a must do when visiting Singapore....you won't be disappointed. Visit during the day and then again at night for the light show....amazing
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the best man made botanical garden. Lots of varieties of different plants brought from different countries.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Roof top bar was amazing. The view of Marina Bay all lit up at night is awesome. Drinks took awhile though. But worth the view! At ground level, music theatre songs playing in the courtyard. Loved it!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is such a great experience day or night. You can walk right round the bay stopping off for drinks along the way. Make sure you catch the light show with the Sky Park as the main attraction.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I really enjoyed my time here. Its a great temple to visit and pretty big. I found my visit fun and educational
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing place, well worth a visit. Great value and views Fantastic on every level. Fabulous day out.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A cool (literally) place to go, the plants were very interesting and the walk down on the raised platforms was exciting. We are not really excited by plants and gardens generally but this experience was well worth it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are in Singapore for a night head to China Town especially there main food market area which now has a roof over it. There are many carts to choose your meal from and grab a beer. Great fun atmosphere. Then do your shopping through the many stores around. No one hassles you to buy and there are so many trinkets to buy especially to take home and use for your travel gifts you haven't got yet. Go to Cart #7 for a great duck meal.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely Brilliant, we arrived late afternoon and went to the cloud forest, then the flower dome. We then headed down to the light show. An amazing experience enjoyed by us all. The waterfall inside the cloud forest was spectacular
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Critical WW2 visit for all travelers wanting to know history of this island
REVIEW_BODY: The most important historical event in Singapore's modern history as it creates the Physc of how SG thinks about defense post Britain's time and in its independence
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth a visit near Chinatown. Dates back to 1827 see photo for history. Like all temples you need to take shoes off,can leave socks on. Quiet a bit of history.
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went on a night tour, 4 50 yr plus...was great...well worth it....took the local bus to the zoo. The animals were active, much better than a day experience
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great street food, in very unusual surroundings, with the multi coloured buidings adding a new dimension to one of the older sections of singapore. Great place to find a sari, or other Indian delights, or just spend some quality time enjoying a chai tea ceremony and tasting
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great for photo ops and flower lovers
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is one of the signature tourist attractions in Singapore and there are lots of places in the Gardens for a great photo op. Right across the Marina Bay Sands, the Gardens by the Bay gives visitors free access to its themed garden patches, and has a few food carts spread across the gardens for those looking for a quick snack while strolling around. There are two giant air conditioned domes, The Cloud Forest and The Flower Dome, which you can enter for a fee. There is also a trolley you can take to tour the gardens for a small fee. In the Flower Dome, flora enthusiasts will appreciate the variety of blooms to be seen inside. There is a cafÃ© and a souvenir shop near the domes. At night (around 7:30 pm), the Supertree Grove has a lights and sounds show which you can watch for free. There are many more attractions such as the OCBC Skyway and the Children's Pavilion so you can easily spend a whole day going around the area.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are a 1st timer in Singapore this is a must see. I love the flower dome and how it has different theme each time. My husband loved the cloud forest the most. It would be better to visit during the weekdays.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: While walking through the garden might allow you to observe each flower in great detail and close-up pictures. The skywalk offers a whole different experience of bird-eye view to the gardens surrounding.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You take a lift up to the 52nd floor, walk out to the end of the 'ship' deck that bridges the three Marina Bay Sands towers and get fantastic views of the bay area and city - well worth the ticket.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This zoo is one of the better ones that Iâ€™ve been too. Itâ€™s large and there is a lot of walking. Itâ€™s also hot for someone from north. There are some animals that Iâ€™ve never seen in the US. The enclosures are very well done and everything is in English. A nice time.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Another great attraction at the Lion City :)
REVIEW_BODY: Great panoramic view of the City. Hope you can time your visit to avoid heavy rain storm. It could ruin the experience.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful experience, Needs atleast Half Day, preferable time to visit is after 2 PM. Variety of Plants and flowers, Well maintained, Worth for the Money
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a good place to chill after dinner and watch the skyline of Singapore at night which is extremely beautiful.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are visiting Singapore, it's a must try place to visit. If you have time visit the place by walking. There is also Shuttle service available. One of the biggest highlight is the Waterfall...
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good time! A lot of exotic birds to see along with live shows & all. Definitely better than the River Safari & Night Safari! This park would also take nearly a day to complete! Great for kids!
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We were on a city tour and one of our stops was the orchid gardens. Itâ€™s a beautiful spot to spend a couple of hours. Great walking paths, easy to get around. Gift shop and public toilets.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It has long history of this garden which it is very well maintained and conservated area. Located in center of Singapore._x000D_
Now you can access with MTR which located at one of it gate._x000D_
I love the big trees(a 30mins rain forest walk inside the garden), the flowers and grassland which you will find many ppl taking wedding photos here._x000D_
The garden is very nice, comfortable which I think is a must to visit during you SG trip.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
One of the absolute bucket list items of our recent trip to Singapore was the Skypark at Marina Bay Sands. It lived up to our expectations and then some. 360 degree views of the city and harbour were absolutely stunning, including a Birdseye view of the other bucket list item, Gardens by the Bay._x000D_
Reasonably priced and easily accessed, it is an absolute must do when in Singapore. A photographers haven, but if you want the professional touch, a professional photographer is on hand and for a reasonable fee, will supply you a selection of amazing shots using green screen technology. Sure itâ€™s cheating but so what, the pictures are impressive.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I lone Gardens by the bay. Being in a tropical country, we get to enjoy all types of flowers of the world. That is really amazing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went in Chinatown at night when it was already closing time. We did some shopping but we spent most of our time eating. We are looking for stalls selling Chili crab but our budget is limited so we passed eating the chili crab (crying..huhu..). Maybe not that special if compared to other places but I think still worth a visit especially if you want to buy souvenirs.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Have visited the Cloud Forest a few times now. It is ever changing and beautiful. Not as many orchids out in June as at other times. Still plenty to see. Loved it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is our favorite spot in Singapore. We have been to this city state four times as a family, and we have visited the Botanic Gardens each time._x000D_
_x000D_
It is quite a large place, and you would have to be ready to be exposed to the sun a lot. There are several eateries inside including a couple of popular ones, none of which I have tried. There are some stalls selling drinks and snacks._x000D_
_x000D_
There is no admission fee unless you get into the Orchid Garden._x000D_
_x000D_
They sometimes organize free tours organized on weekends; they are guided by some knowledgeable volunteers. We enjoyed one this time and really liked it. For the information on the tours and other events, check their Website._x000D_
_x000D_
There now is an MRT station called Botanic Gardens near one of the gates.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I'm sorry but i'm quite uninmpressed with the zoo because:_x000D_
1. The don't have like clear path so all the visitors have to go to the same way not like they can go right or left or straight that we ended up tired of walking but didn't see all the animals_x000D_
_x000D_
2. Lack of animal show, we only see the elephant show but the visitors seems not impressed in my opinion_x000D_
_x000D_
3. put more attraction in the kids area_x000D_
_x000D_
To sum it up for the kids who love animals it is fun experience but for the adult it was just a okay..
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Shows were interesting and eye-catching, however my trip was kind of ruined by other visitors. Will definitely visit again
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the place whereby it controls the reservior water level and a gallery to educate on previous of water. It also having a green roof for visitors to walk to the top to enjoy the city view.
ADDRESS: 8 Marina Gardens Drive Marina Barrage, Singapore 018951, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was a highlight of our trip to Singapore. Amazing architecture and plants. Limited to 15 minutes walking the structure as limited numbers but enough time to take in the views and take some photos. A must visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lucky us to be there as they were getting ready to celebrate anniversary!
REVIEW_BODY: The flower dome was truly full of flowers and plants with lots of information on where in the world plants were from - different countries or areas having their own display which then just flowed into next area - really stunning flowers with terrific art work interspersed.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Had a wonderful day here in both the greenhouses._x000D_
_x000D_
Great exhibits in both the rainforest dome and the Flower Dome._x000D_
_x000D_
Lots of information about environmental damage and ways we can help including information boards exhibits and video films. The domes are self sustaining so they practice what they preach._x000D_
_x000D_
Beautiful planting and sculptures within a fantastic modern design and the architecture of the structures is fascinating._x000D_
_x000D_
Wear good walking shoes as there is a lot to see!_x000D_
_x000D_
There is a shuttle train($3 ), to take you to the domes if you want to save your feet but it's only a 15 minute walk from the ticket office._x000D_
_x000D_
You must visit the highest indoor waterfall !_x000D_
_x000D_
There is a restaurant serving variety of dishesfir lunch and also an informal cafe for simpler food and drink._x000D_
_x000D_
We had a great day here. I would say value for money as it kept us entertained for around 4 or 5 hours._x000D_
_x000D_
Good labels on the planting in the Flower Dome so would be great for avid gardeners and anyone with a general interest in art and the natural world._x000D_
_x000D_
Very sobering thoughts about the state if the environment but ends on a positive note giving advice on how we can change our behaviour to reduce the risks to the planet_x000D_
_x000D_
Lovely grounds. There is a guided tour train around the grounds in the afternoon at extra cost that looked very good too.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Long stretch of shopping. We just did not have enough time. Excellent place to shop and shop the whole day. Singapore Sales was on.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Didn't appreciate the show much, bought tickets online and would have love a map and more explanation on how it works. Wonderful to see the animals at night. Would have liked to stay longer.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Visited during short Singapore stay and was surprised about how good this place is._x000D_
You can see the way they used to live as well as visit all the shops and stop over for a genuine Chinese meal, all at reasonable prices. Great way to spend a few hours browsing around.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Magnificent Orchid Garden in absolutely full bloom in March
REVIEW_BODY: I liked the garden very much - very well sculptured, perfectly maintained, not too crowdy, with a lot of orchid species and a lot of descriptions. This is one of the top three nature things to do in Singapore, along with the adjacent National garden and the Gardens by the bay. Get there with the touristic double-decker and spent about two hours - it is really hot, but every minute spent is a magical one. The pictures I attach cannot tell how beautiful the place is.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Stunning attraction with a fascinating variety of gardens and information.
REVIEW_BODY: We visited twice: first visit by taxi and we did a guided tour and later we returned by MRT and did a lot of walking. It is good to break up the walking with time in the cooler Flower Dome and later the Cloud Forest. Both well worth visiting. There was concession for seniors and again for people who had Singapore airlines boarding pass. Good variety of places to eat.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Come any time of the year and you will be awed with the view. Especially during special festivals like Mid Autumn, the place will be lit up by thousands of lights. Truly a must visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the guides were knowledgeable and pleasant. the surroundings are truly breath taking and very holy. We enjoyed our visit.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Almost complete history of china town and chinese in singapore
REVIEW_BODY: We visit this place to spend our time waiting for shops around the place are open. Actually we surprise the museum tells us very complete story of chinese tradition, cubicle place and journey of chinese people since beggining in spore. Wish this place always maintained as well so we could take our kid to this place....really recommended especially for you who have kids to know history
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Singapore Botanic Gardens, a place that good for relax and exercise.
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore Botanic Gardens, a place that good for relax and exercise. Can go with family, friends or even alone. See the trees, small insects, flowers, sunshine, wind blow, cool!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
There is sooooo much to do here. It is worth a few visits, both at day and night. The gardens are amazing - day time to see the gorgeous orchids and night time to see the lights. Same applies to the Singapore Flyer. The river journey by tug boat let you see life from the river, and are also a great way to transit from one place to another $12 fare one way. The shopping complex it huge - didnâ€™t do any shopping as the shops all seemed to be labels - far too expensive for this poor tourist!, but it was worth a wander to find the food mall and have ice cream_x000D_
The area is beautifully upkept, with amenities scattered throughout._x000D_
Donâ€™t rely on your gps amongst the many skyscrapers, the little gadgets get very confused. Get a good map!_x000D_
The public transport system is amazing and puts Perth public transport to shame. Each journey is about 80c. Well worth purchasing a tourist pass for a few days - you can easily top it up at the stations.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Beautiful gardens which are free to explore. The tree light show at night was great and technology behind the whole thing is amazing. We paid extra to go into the cloud dome which was beautiful and refreshing as the eh flower dome is beautiful._x000D_
_x000D_
Well worth a visit!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens by the Bay lights Show
REVIEW_BODY:
If you are staying in Singapore overnight then you must not miss the Light Show put on in the Gardens by the Bay. This starts at 7.45pm every night and admission is free. The easiest way to get there is by taxi which drops you off at the entrance. The walk in isn't too long and is accessible by everyone. It pays to get there a little early as every man and his dog goes an positions fill up!_x000D_
The lights which are accompanied by music are absolutely fabulous and are not to be missed. If you have the time during your stay the Marina Bay Sands also has a light show which starts at 8pm and 9pm.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If high-end fashion is your thing, then Orchard Road is your place. Luxury rules at many of the malls that are connected via an air-conditioned subterranean system that provides easy access to the MRT, Singapore's lightening fast mass transit system. There are also a number of more modest malls featuring bargain electronics and low-cost easting establishments.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
It was an awesome experience for me and my family after we returned from the flyer. I had done jungle safari at day , but at night , it was a new experience and adventure for me when we were in an open rail car and in front of open lions and other wild animals and surprisingly they did nothing to us ...._x000D_
_x000D_
Very decent experience !!!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great way to beat the heat with the kids
REVIEW_BODY: We decided to take the kids here. We don't have any libraries where we live so it is a fun excursion for our family. Go to the basement for the kids room. There is tons of space, wonderful selection of English books and a fun little tree to sit in. As a tourist you cant check anything out, but it's a nice environment to sit and read together as a family. Closest MRT station is Bugis. But Bencoolen will be close too once it opens.
ADDRESS: 100 Victoria Street National Library Building, Singapore 188064, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Pretty nice place to visit. Great to escape from the hot weather and to see plants one would not normally find in Singapore. Beware of splashing water from the waterfall and it can be quite humid inside.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore Botanic Gardens are definitely worth a visit if you're into parks and gardens to any degree. The Orchid Garden is well worth the separate entrance fee. Beautiful flowers presently in an elegant garden. Just remember Singapore is steamy! Shorts, T-Shirts and sandals for any westerner!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Relaxing place to read and reflect
REVIEW_BODY: Good location, wide range of books to select, read and reflect plus good family activities organised from time to time!
ADDRESS: 100 Victoria Street National Library Building, Singapore 188064, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: creating the atmosphere of being on a hill station by having mist around all the ferns shrubs, plants and flowers.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Who knew there were so many colors and sizes of Orchids? Be prepared for the heat, though. It can be very hot
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Local and tourist flocks here to pay a visit to the different type of birds species around the world. Great for family outing. Bring along extra clothes as children can enjoy the water playground within the park. Few selection of restaurants and eateries available. Enjoy the live shows that is available however to check on the showtime. Overall, a place to visit.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: It needs a mild day and patience
REVIEW_BODY: I walked some of it and quite enjoyed. I have to say this little country have done well in creating new landscape and preserving the nature. I would recommend a half day trip to walk it all, along with some capable good friends.
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was our first time in Singapore and were excited to see the wonderful trees and were much happier that this was a free attraction.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The park is open to the public 22 hours a day, from 5am to 2am. I suggest visit it in say and at night. There is a nightly lights and music shows. The colourful lights in middle of vertical garden is powered by solar power. There a 2 paid facilities under the dome within the gardens too which I didn't get to visit. There are fast food restaurants in the park too. A great place for a family to hang out.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely day out, but get used to the humidity
REVIEW_BODY:
A beautiful garden, very cheap to visit and a good day out to walk around and relax. easy to get to by cab (and cheaply), there were a couple of school groups walking around while I was there but the gardens are so big I rarely saw them. Maps are available but honestly it's much better to just wander._x000D_
_x000D_
A word of warning, if you get hot easily. you will sweat buckets!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If it werenâ€™t for the structure of elevators and concrete walkways you could be in the rainforest. Still how else can people enjoy such a place on a mass level. It was beautiful- all the ferns, orchids, begonias it was very much an almost real forest. Spectacular engineering!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A great place to relax enjoy the view!
REVIEW_BODY: We often go for a walk along the waterfront promenade when in Singapore. There are some nice cafe's and restaurants in the area and we sometimes call in and have some refreshments at the Fullerton Bay Hotel and sit out on the front veranda and enjoy the views of the waterfront area. Along the promenade you will see the Merlion; three interesting; huge flower structures which are ideal for a good photo; two silver coloured panda bears sitting on the lawn near the Fullerton Bay Hotel; people exercising in groups in the park area and along the waterfront walk, and beautiful views day and night. As you walk closer to the Marina Bay Sands hotel coming from the Merlion area you will see some giant fans which also double as weather protection. These are solar powered and only come on when someone comes near them...very clever! Close to those fans is an entrance to underground shops and cafes. It goes for miles underground.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Botanic Gardens are a great place to walk around, take some pictures, and just relax amidst the hustle bustle of city life. You'll see some great greenery, quite a few geese, and maybe even some tree snails if you look close enough! It's also free, so if you're on a budget, pack a picnic and relish the cheapness of it all :-D
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went on the Singapore Flyer because its a landmark and a must for tourists. It takes around 30 mins for a full round and is similar to the London Eye. You have great views of Marina bay, Gardens by the bay and the financial hub. We went at night so didn't had to wait very long in the queue. There's a bench inside to sit on and the temperature inside was quite pleasant. There are restaurants in the building connecting to the Flyer but they close at 10pm and won't take customers after 9:30 pm.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place was so pretty to see in the day or at night. It lights up and makes you feel like you are at Disney World. Hey, where's Mickey and Minnie Mouse?
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to visit - a MUST see in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic exhibition, both from the perspective of touring the exhibition plus explaining the history of Singapore and WW2 (why Singapore fell)Firstly, the environment. To be underground and feel what it was like, as if you were in WW2 was brilliant. To understand how Singapore stood alone and the decision made to surrender was so easy to comprehend.We recommend to all visitors to visit.Surrounded by great gardens too
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Excellent sanctuary for animals but visitors here should behave in a more civil manner. Why? Because they are shouting at their top of their voices and chattering and laughing. It may not mean anything to you but you can spoil the shot of a photographer who has been waiting for hours or disturb a nesting animal or bird. Oh, please dun retort when other visitors advise you to keep your volume down.
ADDRESS: 301 Neo Tiew Crescent Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve, Singapore 718925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spectacular attraction, well worth a visit and keep your eyes open for the wildlife. Recommend an evening trip when the amazing light shows enhance these structures ten fold. Enjoy!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: nice playground and water play area for kids. nice peter rabbit deco for pictures. the bird show was entertaining and awesome. will def bring kiddos there again!
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Too much dark didnâ€™t see anything wellAnd lots people almost waiting 40min but safari less 30min i think
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This exhibition of nature was fabulous. It exceeded my expectations and is well worth the visit. My teenage children were also interested in the dome and that's saying something
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We arrived in Singapore Christmas day morning, and decided to go to China Town for lunch. It was very busy with a good atmosphere. We went for a foot massage which was nice and relaxing after a very long flight from the UK. There are lots of stalls selling souvenirs and a good choice of restaurants.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's one of the world's unique light shows (personally I haven't watched something similar in my travels) it's only 15 minutes long so it's not tiring or boring, the track list is really nice and the finale of the show is taking your breath away! Definitely a must-see experience while in Singapore!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Arab quarter is quite small and compact but is really worth a visit when in Singapore. The mosque is quite impressive to look at and the street leading off from it is very scenic with some great restaurants and photo taking opportunities abound.
ADDRESS: Kampong Glam, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Busy big road, the famous one
REVIEW_BODY: One of the most famous part in Singapore, I knew it since I was young. A lot of mall and hotels along the streets, heaven for shoppers
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful place to visit. Interesting story behind. Was exited like a child to see it. If you are in Singapore, definitely one of the top destination!
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited cloudy forest, flower dome and floral fantasy, very special designs,amazing views, my child wants to be there everyday!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Saw a very nice tropical forest with waterfall etc. It's totally man-made and worth a sight. The plants are all from the forest and they are kept healthy. Mist is sprayed giving a cloudy sensation is great. Do watch the small educational film while going out
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It's worth a visit for some chili crab, but effectively it's just another Chinatown. Tonnes of Chinese restaurants lined the edge of the street, just too many to chose from!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Clean, perfectly manicured plants and trees. Moves a lot of people in an effective manner. Highly recommended to visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We were given a half day tour to the bird park. We only had time to do the tram ride around the park, have a walk in the waterfall aviary, and do the two shows, at 10am and 11am. The latter show, with the parrots, as well as flamingoes and pelicans, we enjoyed the most. The talking & singing parrot was very clever! We would have liked more time, so we could have walked around the park. Next time we go to Singapore we will go on our own and spend most of the day there._x000D_
We were told by our guide that the intention is to shift the bird park to another location, near the zoo, in 5 to 10 years time. When it is moved it will also be enlarged.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
you must see it .very beautiful._x000D_
the cost of ticket is about 25$.but it really worth it ._x000D_
do not forget an umbrella. and bring a warm clothes with u because inside one of them is cold .one of the beautiful places in the whole world.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is a must-visit attraction in Singapore. We went there to admire the lights and was shocked when at around 7:30PM, a light show performance was held. But then, there were too many tourists and the it was very hard to exit the place after the show.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a must see place. The flower dome is breathtaking and the Cloud dome is spectacular. You can lose a lot of time in this place, so much to see and itâ€™s well worth spending the time there. We also went up to the Rooftop bar at the Supertree and it was just glorious sitting there and watching the sunset.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a great place to visit with family. Kids will be able to see the wildlife in their natural habitat. Crabs, storks, mudskippers (fish found only in marshlands), lots of big spiders, wild dogs and Kingfishers can be seen here. Some times one can spot crocodiles also. Families will be able to go around peacefully since this place is not overcrowded. Sungai Buloh is one of the last places in Singapore where people can see marshlands. It is free to enter. It is better to carry some mosquito spray or patches.
ADDRESS: 301 Neo Tiew Crescent Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve, Singapore 718925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a wonderful place to see the gardens and the night light show of the super trees which now become the icon of Singapore rather than Sands hotel and the merl ion .
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Well planned covered sidewalks beside great shopping
REVIEW_BODY: The design of Orchard Road is such that even when it's raining, you can more or less make your way without getting too wet. The selection of shops is very good. All within easy walking distance of each other.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Ideal place to spend an evening
REVIEW_BODY: Live music, drinks and all kinds of food available here. Take river cruise to enjoy the beauty of this place.you must spend atleast one evening there.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Was always a well kept secret
REVIEW_BODY: The Southern ridges was always a great quiet place to go for a long walk with some good views of Singapore. Lately it is becoming more and more popular. My only gripe is when it rains, and it often does when I go out walking, it is often difficult to find shelter.
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Awesome place to wander around for souvenirs
REVIEW_BODY: It is like a lot of touristic places, but the setting is still very nice. I really enjoyed strolling around the stalls and also the Hawker Centre which is right in Chinatown!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Visited the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest as well as sitting in for Garden Rhapsody one evening. The Flower Dome was decked out for Chinese New Year, so very festive! It was very well set up with different sections of plants from different parts of the world, but it all flowed in very smoothly, makes for a very pleasant stroll. The Cloud Forest was my favorite because it was cool in there. The waterfall made for an impressive entrance, and the flowers and plants were constantly sprayed with mist, so it does make you feel that you are up in the clouds. The only complaint I have is that the way out is not well marked. We entered onto the 3rd floor ( there is no 2nd floor ) and you exit on the first floor. But there are no stairs to exit, you have to use the elevator. Fortunately, there is someone manning the elevators, so you just have to let him or her know that you wish to go out instead of going up again. There are a total of 7 floors._x000D_
Garden Rhapsody is a music and light show out in the Supertree Grove, and itâ€™s free, they have a show at 7:45P and 8:45P. The show is approximately 15 minutes and is really spectacular. Even without the music and light show, itâ€™s quite pleasant to walk among the lighted trees at night in Gardens by the Bay.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing amount of shops selling a variety of wares but check prices carefully. Certain items extortionately priced compared to home. Worth a visit though.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Visiting the Zoo is a must
REVIEW_BODY:
We travelled with a 6 years boy and an 18 months girl and we really enjoyed it ( the kids had a great time) our kids really enjoyed the shows as well._x000D_
_x000D_
We made a mistake when we booked the zoo tickets online, somehow we purshased the tickets twice in different promotions and we only noticed while we were leaving the zoo. Although the tickets were non refundable or transferable; when we told one of the staff what happened with us she said she will try to help us and she sure did. We were so lucky to get a refund on one of the tickets......we wish that we took the staff name to make sure to thank her through this post, hopefully she will read it and will know that this was dedicated to her...Thanks loads for the great help
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The river provides the tourist with a variety of combinations to provide things to do. Water cruises available from Clarke's Quay running through the center of the city. Restaurants offering great food and drink along the river. Great entertainment along the river. Terrific views, photo taking and people watching from the river. River conveniently runs to a good portion of the city providing a great asset for the city and tourist.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We strolled through this area today evening. The architecture is incredible inside and outside. I highly recommend going in the night to check out the lights.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Peaceful Haven in the Bustling China Town
REVIEW_BODY: Went looking for this attraction one morning as we wandered through China town and I can truly say it is worth a quick visit if for nothing elder to enjoy the architecture and stunning colours of the Buddha Tooth Relic Temple. It wanâ€™t crowded although there were tour groups in attendance and the people moved freely through the temple from either end.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The best zoo I have ever been too.
REVIEW_BODY: Wow, what a variety of healthy looking animals. It strikes me the conservation work the zoo is doing also. Large areas for all of the animals to move around and play with each other. You can get so close to the monkeys and other animals in the displays also-we stumbled across a large lizard on the path minding his own business. No problem he just made his way into the bush. The monkeys may as well have been shaking our hand they were that close. And not so good either. I think just to be inquisitive. Great day.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Has everything. Great visually. Great amenities for push chairs. Great food options. Great attractions. A day is not enough.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A great sensory experience. The music and the light show were a wonderful event for everyone! There are many locations inside the park to take advantage of the show!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit in the heat of the day
REVIEW_BODY: Pretty walk through of some beautiful plants and stalagmites / stalactites. Good for the hot afternoon. Wear walking shoes and take your time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This large dome within the gardens, houses a massive 35 metre manmade waterfall and mountain upon which there is a planted tropical rainforest - certainly gives a good impression of one & the spray from the waterfall aids the whole atmosphere. Worth a visit whilst in the gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Shops shops and more shops - lots of malls to see - expensive ones and then the not so expensive ones - at the very top of orchard road you have the mall with the cheaper shops - some of the same shops we get here but more expensive than back home - eg Victoria Secrets - amazing hearing all the birds in the trees at night and not seeing one of them !
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An interesting attraction in the Marina Bay Gardens. Tickets are $14 per person (there are two attractions which mean $28 for both). There is a lift to the top followed by a walkway through a simulated rain forest experience. The better of the two attractions - but only visit once !
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The lights of the garden are spectacular at night. It is not very big but definitely worth it, especially as it is free!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Impressive even for those not into plants or gardens. Can spend the whole day exploring and discovering. Would highly recommend.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: a good workout and a nice place to stroll for an hour or so to see the skyline and beautiful buildings and shore line of the harbor
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very atmospheric, lovely enjoyable place to wander around, reasonably priced and you could spend hours there
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great selection of places to eat from yum Cha to burgers and beers. In regards to the market, it is like many other markets around the world with most stalks selling similar lines. Some silk stores are great for selections but the fun side is chatting and making a deal. Hawkers stalls are great value for a quick bite.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
As the weather was not looking too promising we decided to forego another visit to the Botanic Gardens and go to the National Museum. Dare I say I was glad the weather was uncertain? This museum is really worth a visit, rain or shine!_x000D_
The displays are very well set out and the information boards are clear and interesting to read. The history of Singapore is far more complex than I thought and so it was also a very educational trip. We didn't coincide with the guided tours which are currently held at 11.00 and 14.00 but this meant we could wander round at our own pace. It took us over three hours! An excellent introduction into the varied past which has made Singapore what it is today.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very interesting but very dark. I have night vision issues so it was a struggle to see along the pathways good mix of animals to view
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: An amazing attraction that draws thousands of tourists daily. Can be very busy and people tripping over each other to get the best shot. Choose a good weather day if you can. Spectacular views of the bay and Marina Bay Sands hotel.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
