JURONG BIRD PARK is a must visit attraction in Singapore & whether old or young is absolutely a fantastic attraction & possible the best bird park in the world. The huge numbers of bird species you can see up closely is fantastic. The avaries are in deed huge & so well appointed. Same with the enclosures you can walk in & be up close & personal with the birds. Beautiful, clean outstanding._x000D_
There's a huge man made waterfall in a jungle setting & it's truly unbelieveable. The photo's you can take will give you amazing memories of Jurong. The walkways are safe & easy. Steps easy to climb, even for an oldie like me. But, for $5 extra when paying for admission to the park you can travel around & see the park at ease. Hoping on & off at different stations to then look at the birds on display.
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We spent a lovely morning at the Gardens. Opportunities for great pictures everywhere. It can get very hot, don't forget to bring your sunscreen, a hat of some kind or even your umbrella to use as a parasol.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We booked this hotel just to experience the infinity pool. We were unlucky probably because there were lots of people at the pool that time. We have to wait until the sun goes down yet the pool still a bit crowded even at night. We have to wake up early to avoid the crowd at the infinity pool. The price is too high without free breakfast. Checkin is 3pm and check out is at 11am for an expensive stay that we weren't able to enjoy.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The best way to enjoy the view of Marina Bay Sands and Merlion statue
REVIEW_BODY: I truly enjoy visiting this place as it allows visitor to enjoy the sight of Marina Bay Sands with its "ark" on the top, as well as getting close to the iconic Merlion statue. It may be a good place to see sunrise too.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The museum is with good number of collections. Ticket cost is reasonable. The location is also with other interesting places and "instagrammable" spots in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Empress Place Empress Place Building, Singapore 179555, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The only downside of my visit to Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: I might have been wrongly informed. And my expectation was different from what the gallery actually holds as art reliques. All is nevertheless very well conserved.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited the Children's Biennale on a weekday and thoroughly had a ball of time at the National Gallery. Given that it's the School Holidays now, the crowd was very huge and we were glad to reach there early because the ticketing queue was very long._x000D_
_x000D_
Actually, if you just want the General admission tickets , you just need to go to the staff standing beside the ticketing counter to get a sticker after showing proof of citizenship (for singapore citizens). There is no need to join in the ticketing queue. It will save you a lot of time!_x000D_
_x000D_
The hands-on activities were very creative , interesting and fun! it is a must-visit place of interest in Singapore!
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Hard to see animals and need knowledge to enter earlier
REVIEW_BODY:
<Before enter>_x000D_
Although purchased tickets on internet in advance, need to stand in a long queue to collect tickets. Be careful the ticketâ€™s condition. Moreover, one counter staff rejected my ticket collect request although I waited for long time in a queue while aligning another staffâ€™s indication after my consultation with him. Staff quality depends on each staff, but appreciate if the zoo encourage staffs._x000D_
_x000D_
There are 4 time-slot to enter Night Safari such as 7:15pm, 8:15pm, 9:15pm and 10:15pm, but earlier time-slots were sold out soon on consecutive holidays. Thus, I could collect tickets for 9:15pm although I arrived at this zoo around 4:30pm._x000D_
However, there are express pass as multi language tram ticket by S$10. When we have this pass, we can enter the zoo immediately even though I have later ticket. I recommend this way if you accept this cost._x000D_
_x000D_
<After Enter>_x000D_
Honestly speaking, hard to see animals since they were hiding or lying on the ground and also darkness when I had been walking around the course._x000D_
But, I could see while I have been riding the tram._x000D_
My experience which I could see white lions was great for me._x000D_
We saw a animal shows, and there were cute animals, so we enjoyed._x000D_
_x000D_
....._x000D_
We have been to Singapore Zoo before Night Safari. Singapore Zoo was soooo nice, thus we expected Night Safari is also so good as well. Unfortunately we were not so satisfied, but the zoo in the dark is rare experience._x000D_
_x000D_
I wish your experience will be nice!!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: huge gardens, lovely indoor waterfall, beautiful landscape and all type of plants from around the world. well maintained and things to remember.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth paying the small admission fee to enter the orchid garden, beautiful to see. So many types of orchids in such beautiful colours. Well looked after garden.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful venue. Light show in the trees awesome. Accessible by MRT A highlight of visiting Singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great fun and saw nearly every animal
REVIEW_BODY: There was always a chance with it being night that we wouldnâ€™t get to see many of the animals in the exhibit, but we were lucky and saw nearly every single animal there was to see! As you would expect, it is a bit tourist attraction and so was incredibly busy but there are ways to manage this. Booking online in advance is important first, not just because of the small discount to price but to make sure you get the earliest slot at 7.15pm as they do sell out. The other option is to try and go on a weekday instead of a weekend if possible. We arrived on the day at around 5.45/6pm and had dinner there; the buffet looked incredibly busy, but the range of normal stalls offered a great range and we had a really tasty kung pao chicken where one portion was enough to share between two. By the time weâ€™d finished, we went towards to entrance around 6.50 by which time queues had already formed to get into the park. They started letting people in around 7pm, which meant that we missed the fire show but it was worth it to get in earlier and see the first animal show inside. Do this first as the stewards suggest when you enter, but ignore them when they try and funnel you onto the trams when you come out of the show. Everyone else will go this way, leaving the walking trails nearly empty for you to explore. That way, by the time you complete the walking trails in comparative peace, there will be absolutely no queue for the tram to finish the evening. We saw everything there was and we were finished by around 10/10.30 before we caught an uber back to our hotel, about a half hour drive back into the city.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing gardens from all over the world, great for families and people of all ages. Does take a number of hours to get through and is very busy but worth a visit
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Having miss 3year old grand daughter and my nephew with us we enjoyed an early Breakfast with the Orangatangs firstly followed by the day at the zoo. Last time I walked through as 2 adults but it is very different with children and I enjoyed new experiences like the Waterpark at the Zoo also. It is very well planned with hop on and off train if needed. You really have to allow the whole day to see everything and well worth it. Good food amenitites also.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a place that one will never get tired of visiting. The flowers exhibit is refreshing. Even this round I went, is a display of our national flowers which is appropriate for our 52nd National Day Celebration, being a Singaporean i m so impressed with new species of orchids. Enjoyed the soaking in the freshness and feasting the sea of flowers under perfect air condition temperatures.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Skypark is an observation deck on the 56th floor of the Marina Bay Sands hotel. The cost f is approximately $17 USD and $15 USD for senior citizens to visit. If you have booked a room in the hotel, access to the Skypark is included in your reservation. This deck is well worth the money to be able to get a 360-degree view of the Singapore skyline. You can catch a glimpse of the infinity pool for hotel guests only. There are restaurants, night clubs, gardens and trees for your enjoyment. From the skylark, you can get a fantastic few of the Supertree Grove, the Gardens by the Bay and other landmarks of Singapore. What makes this deck unique is that it is in the shape of a boat sitting on three towers of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Recommend this great view of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a wonderful day out, loved the gardens. The waterfall area was worth seeing. The views from the top of the trees was worth it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good science centre for all ages
REVIEW_BODY:
After few years, it was my second visit and my son still like it._x000D_
_x000D_
The centre is well maintained and I could see different exhibitions. This time they have mirror maze which my son explored it happily several times._x000D_
_x000D_
It has a water playground so prepare yourself with extra clothes if your children plan to spend times in the playground._x000D_
_x000D_
You can also visit Omni Theatre or Snow City which are located next to the centre.
ADDRESS: 15 Science Centre Road Singapore Science Centre, Singapore 609081, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A quick stop is fine for this tourist trap...
REVIEW_BODY:
You can get there the hard way, either by walking from the VivoCity shopping mall, via the Marang trail, a steep uphill, and from the other side via the Southern Ridges walkway continuing onto the Henderson Waves Bridge via Forest Walk, which is slightly easier, mostly downhill, but longer... Or the easy way, via Sentosa - Mount Faber cable car, if you are a sucker for the views;)_x000D_
_x000D_
If you have more time and are not completely out of shape, I highly recommend getting yourself to the beginning of the Southern Ridges, to the bus stop near Alexandra and Depot roads and make a nice walking, or running, trip to combine all the interesting sights between the Southern Ridges and the VivoCity mall. The whole walk isn't that long... 4-5 kilometers, I think, manageable for almost anybody._x000D_
_x000D_
The Mount Faber, is very touristy spot, with decent hill views of tropical vegetation below, Sentosa island to the one side and the Singapore's downtown skyline to the other._x000D_
_x000D_
There is a "Bell of Happiness", a definite photo op for all the Instagram and selfie fiends;)_x000D_
_x000D_
To spend 10 minutes here is too many, unless you want sit down and get something to eat...
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak | Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Upscale shopping for the shopping buffs. We were not there to shop, so walked through the streets. Had lunch at the food court.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Prefer the evening / night view with the lights. A unique display of mother earth design. An experience for the children to enjoy nature.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place to go for an afternoon, get in the shuttle to take a tour around which also offers a audio guide.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Magical experience so close to the wonderful Orangoutangs. breakfast was so-so... lots of kids.. fantastic... the seal show was very entertaining as was the train around the zoo and the real pink flamingos!!... the dinosaur garden walk was wonderful._x000D_
The Zoo is incredibly clean and well presented. Smoothies at the cafe: delicious
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A very beautiful mosque near Arab street in Singapore. It is an architectural marvel. Five times prayers are held here. Non muslims have fixed timings to visit and see this place. It is surrounded by shops selling gift items and food stalls etc. One can go around this place with family & friends in the evening and spend their time & can also make purchases. There are so many mosques in Singapore and it is visited most by tourists & a famous one.
ADDRESS: 3 Muscat Street Masjid Sultan, Singapore 198833, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Good value. Make sure you go at night and watch the light show. What an experience! I'd definitely go again.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Our Singaporean friend recommended and took us to this park._x000D_
Thereâ€™s a fire dance just before to gain entry to park. Started with a nice pint of Tiger beer - recommended ._x000D_
Then most tourists jump to the tram but i advise taling the walking tour first. Shy creatures do come out when fewer people around. When the tram queue peters out, then tram is recommended. Itâ€™s a must-do though._x000D_
â€˜Creatures of the nightâ€™ is fun. Gets filled up quickly but you will definitely get a place. Recommended seat in the ampitheatre would be left side down( whilst facing the stage), about 3 rows behind the stage._x000D_
Nice eateries as soon as you exit. Not very expensive._x000D_
Photo below of a ghariyal.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: its filled with malls and regular stores. after being in china town you don't want to pay full prices.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We got there by walking from Marina Bay Sands MRT station. Ticket bundle for both flower garden and tropical garden was 33sgd. Both were surprisingly amazing and do not miss any of them.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Been last weekend with the kids to look at dinosaurs. it was well done and very nice atmosphere.. always a pleasure to go back
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A totally relaxing way to spend a few hours. The designs and architecture is really far beyond other cities and is awe inspiring.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Because of my job I 've been to Singapore many times over the years. Every time I make at least one stop at Marina bay._x000D_
The view from roof garden it s amazing !_x000D_
Ce la vi lounge bar witch is located at 57th floor has very friendly and professional stuff!_x000D_
_x000D_
Access to the pool is available only to guest of marina bay sands hotel._x000D_
_x000D_
I suggest it 100% if you ever been in Singapore !!
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great for a quick overview of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: If you only have a short while in Singapore a trip on the river ferries is the way. Catch it from Clarke Quay and head towards the stop at Merlion and get off and have a stroll. Then continue to Marina Bay and have a wander there before walking across the bridge to the Singapore Flyer. The river trip gives a good audio of the sites along the river and is well worth the fee.
ADDRESS: Boat, Clarke, Robertson Quays, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The tour around The Battlebox is a highly informative and engaging experience telling the story of Singapore's involvement in WW2._x000D_
The tour leads you through the original underground bunker with various rooms set up as they would have been during operations._x000D_
Our tour guide was exceptionally knowledgable, adding to the whole experience and kept the whole 90 minute tour entertaining and interesting._x000D_
I would recommend this as it really captures the events and consequences of the surrender of Singapore, and how that fitted in within the greater context of WW2.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very popular during the evening as the view of the area is great. Particularly, Gardens by the Bay. Make sure you go on a clear day/evening.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: You can walk up to and around the trees for free. Sg$8 to walk on the raised walkway. Free wifi around the trees. Light and music show twice a day in the evening. Around 7.45 and 8.45. Lots pretty at night when alluminated.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic design though not sure how safe I was when trapped crossing it during a thunder storm. Still I survived lol. Great views back across bay from viewpoints all along bridge. Another amazing Singapore attraction.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Just enjoy the place, relax, it's so cool especially late at night. See the majestic skyline and forget the world!
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Garden is well presented and offers many varieties of orchids. There is a $5 entry fee for an activity that will keep you engaged for about an hour or probably a lot more if you really love your orchids. I enjoyed viewing the displays.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Used the CEAX bus $12 return (taxi one way was around $18 after 9:30am) Part of the ticket price we paid include the tram within the park which was handy to get back & forth to shows if your in a different part of the Zoo.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I was fascinated by the view, the dancing water and who huge this place is amazing. You havenâ€™t been to Singapore if you donâ€™t spend an hour or two at Marina Bay.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a Muslim area of Singapore.Lots of Muslim food out lets here.There is big mosque also here.If you have time go for a walk nothing special.
ADDRESS: Kampong Glam, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth a trip and worth the $$. Fantastic views of the city and beyond. Lovely air conditioned capsules make it even more enjoyable!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Don't miss this museum-provides a great history tour of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: You can easily spent half a day- a whole day here learning about the history of Singapore. Join one of the free tours run by very knowledgable volunteer guides; you get a much better and personalised glimpse into Singapores past.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Top place to visit in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Keep an eye out for special events (such as Lantern Festival in September, or Christmas displays). This is truly an amazing achievement and one of the most special gardens in the world.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A lovely collection of orchids, very well laid out and labelled. Easy to walk around even at 36 degrees, not to be missed if visiting the Botanical Gardens.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Probably the first ever zoo with a wildlife feel and experience. Avoid the trams, if you are not in a hurry, and walk your way around to all the open exhibits and the animals behind the fences for a closer and up close view! The pandas were a delight to see, and the polar bear was amazing! Photographs taken at the zoo are expensive so be careful. If you have a lot of time on your hand, you can spend half day here.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: #1 Attraction in Singapore and worth it
REVIEW_BODY: A national garden and premier horticultural attraction for local and international visitors, Gardens by the Bay is a showpiece of horticulture and garden artistry that presents the plant kingdom in a whole new way, entertaining while educating visitors with plants seldom seen in this part of the world, ranging from species in cool, temperate climates to tropical forests and habitats.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Not as good as the Zoo
REVIEW_BODY: We went to the Zoo before heading to the Night Safari in the evening. While it wasn't bad, it probably didn't live up to the hype, and we found it really wasn't better than the zoo. A lot of the animals are not necessarily nocturnal, and so many were sleeping. A good experience, but make sure you don't miss the zoo!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best tip for Marina Bay Skypark
REVIEW_BODY: Prior to visiting Singapore I had read a review suggesting that visitors opt for the bar â€˜Ce La Vieâ€™ on the sky deck rather than the promoted option. Prior to our visit I did not realise that the infinity pool was not an option at all unless you are a hotel guest. I had left options open in case this was included with the Skypark, once I realised it wasnâ€™t, it was a no brainer. No wait, the entrance fee was slightly lower ($20)and you get food/drink vouchers for the same value. Kids were free. The view is amazing and I donâ€™t see why anyone would really take the other option. It was ok for the kids and not crowded. A Singapore Sling was $22.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The best place to recharge your batteries in a beautiful busy city
REVIEW_BODY: Take time out when in Singapore to spend at least two hours (or more) in the Gardens by the Bay. The two indoor domes are stunning and the Tree Walk is a must for the very best views of Singapore. We had lunch first in Pollen and then explored the domes before taking the tree-top walk. I think there must be every plant on our planet on show within the two domes. A must for the single visitor to the family outing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visit this at night. It's just amazing. The structures look huge in the daytime, but at night they really are surreal. Some look almost alive and from another world. Incredible how these were built. The living garden on them makes it even more impressive. The park where they are at is huge. Despite the number of people visiting, there ware places you can find that ere quiet and romantic as though you have the whole park to yourself. You literally forget your smack in middle of a huge metropolis.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Looks great from the outside, ok on the inside
REVIEW_BODY: The temple entrance is probably what looks the most impressive. Inside of the temple is spacious, sometimes they have some shows there. They even hand out free food but we did not like it (maybe because it is vegetarian). No more than 30 minutes to spend there.
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very good use of the land between the Marina and the bay. Huge sculptured trees with a great music and light show each evening.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice area to take in the atmosphere of this special part of town
REVIEW_BODY:
One Saturday back in April I had a free day to explore the better parts of Singapore - mostly by foot. The Waterfront Promenade is a nice place to unwind and take in the views. There is always movement on the water and it's nice just to do some quiet, relaxing people watching._x000D_
_x000D_
Having spent a large part of the day strolling around it was nice just to sit down, plug in my music and relax.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Garden is nice, but nothing much in the Domes
REVIEW_BODY: This place is very nice ! Strong recommend oversea and local visitors to visit this place for at least once. It's big, nice and free. However, the paid visit into the 2 Domes was very disappointed. The plants are nice but... just normal. And the entrance fee is not cheap.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must visit when you are in Singapore! Try walking on the top most tier of the place. My knees buckled a litlle seeing how high we were.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Came here for a walk with my fiancÃ©e to start off our year, we decided this place cos of our curiosity with the location, turns out to be quite a nice place!_x000D_
_x000D_
Scenery: 3.5/5_x000D_
Ambience: 4/5_x000D_
Cleanliness: 3.5/5_x000D_
Physical Ease: 3/5_x000D_
Fun: 3/5_x000D_
_x000D_
Our Activities:_x000D_
Petai Trail: 3.5/5_x000D_
_x000D_
The Good: Nature, the sights and the sounds, great place to catch monkeys in action if you are keen, a good place for a chillax walk._x000D_
_x000D_
The Bad: We thought the place can be cleaner, and the trails are quite Long. Bring more equipment along, cos it's quite a distance from the nearest amenities._x000D_
_x000D_
Bottom Line: We would come here again with more gear, nice place, just that there are other nicer trails that we have been to. Careful of the monkeys!
ADDRESS: Off Lornie Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Bigger than before bit not as much vintage as it used to be
REVIEW_BODY: After renovation period, our family came back this place and it was much bigger than it was in 2007. Eventhough there are more sections and places, we all do prefer the historical environment that it had before. What we liked most was the new eggtart section as it smells beautifully.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: went to the night light show and it was amazing, set to music the trees light up and the light display is set to the music. Very well done and not to be missed.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: For anyone seeking markets for a ramble and souvenirs just pop down to Chinatown. We did a bit of shopping, had some food and visited a temple. It's like a one stop shop. We found better deals here for gifts than on Orchard Road obviously. I even got a couple of Singapore Christmas decorations. People are lovely and friendly. Felt very safe here while exploring.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Worth a walk around even if you're not into the plants. Didn't both paying to get in the greenhouses but a pleasant break from a bustling city
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Would be fantastic on a clear day.
REVIEW_BODY: The day we chose to take the Flyer was rather hazy so our experience was lessened. The cabins are large and clean with seats (if you can stay in one place to use them). We were lucky in that there were only 2 other couples in the cabin so we had lots of room to walk around taking photos.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These gardens are lovely and a great escape from the bustle of busy Singapore. It is easily accessed by car, taxi or bus, and in fact we found it a great break in the Duck and Hippo tourist bus run around the city. You can hop off at the Botanical Gardens and get on again later in the day. The gardens feature a range of environments ranging from jungle, through palm forests, ginger plantations, flowers and the highlight the National Orchid Gardens. There are good public facilities including a busy restaurant with a range of foods and although there are kilometres of paved walks around the gardens there are also some stalls selling water and snacks (and the inevitable souvenirs) as you go. A well recommended visit while in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic place to visit for kids and adults. Current exhibit is future world. It merges art and computer science into a digital art work. The displays are innovative and interactive. The highlight for me was the space light room. My kids loved creating art then having it come to life on a digital world computer screen.
ATTRACTION_NAME: ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its almost like walking in the forest !! The zoo is designed so beautifully !! There are a lot of animals...and its almost like they are in the open...this is a definite not miss !!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Thought I had seen it all in Vegas . But this one surprised me . Last 15 mins , a long walk in to it so give your self at least 45 moins to get to it without rushing . Think the display is on 7.45 and 8.45 nightly . You can get the metro to the Bay Area and walk but you might need googl maps . Taxis cheap so maybe get a taxi to it. I had friends stay in marina bay sands hotel , they led the way for me but I would have got Laos so to me get a taxi to get as near as you can
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Yet another visit, the culture locals great to see plus shopping and bargaining. We used MRT to get back.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is amazing during the day and really is very beautiful when lit up at night. Do try and see both whilst you are in Singapore. We visited both the flower and cloud domes (pay extra for) and both were interesting and amazing. Really loved this place, very futuristic but real. We went to Marina bay hotel at dusk to get great views over the city and to watch the light show at the gardens. Great place.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Redeeming the ticket was very easy
REVIEW_BODY: Exceptional zoo I have ever been to, saw so many animals and loved the way they were been taken care of. The shows conducted was too good and timings suitable for everyone to catch one show
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a nice long avenue with MTR and bus access featuring top stores as well as trinket and trash stores with shot glasses and t-shirts
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Recommend this for people of all ages. We went in the evening to watch the light/music show. Really loved it. A great free option when spending time in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: a wonderful place to visit after the plants dome
REVIEW_BODY: This artificial fall with its galleries , beautiful plants and lush green trees .... everything is just wonderful...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful gardens, meticulously maintained. Very hot and a 2 km walk from one end to the other. Orchids are well worth it though. Train access at one end only. Bus access at the other. MRT card works for both though.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: My family,(a party of five,) went to the bird park. The bird park had lots of kinds of birds and the birds were also really pretty. The bird exhibits were very interesting bird trick show. I loved it a lot! I also could see that the zookeepers/birdkeepers did their part and took care of them and loved them. I really enjoyed the Jurong bird park! It was super duper fun!
ADDRESS: 2 Jurong Hill Jurong Bird Park, Singapore 628925, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Whatever youâ€™re looking for youâ€™ll find it here! We visited the Apple store, a supermarket for sandwiches and fruit and looked at clothing A bonus was the hop on hop off bus driver knew where everything was and directed us.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wished here when at the botanical gardens Well worth 5$ or 1$ if you are over 60 A very interesting attraction
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Nice for a walk, beautiful the orchid garden inside the park._x000D_
People gather there to practice yoga or just for a stroll in the green away from traffic. there is a nice outdoor restaurant, pleasant in the evening for dinner._x000D_
MRT stops there so very convenient to reach.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A fair bit to travel to get there but worthwhile
REVIEW_BODY: Lovely zoo not to expensive with options to visit other parks and river cruises. Well laid out when you get to understand the map. The animals are very visible in each zone, overall very pleasant day spent walking around the zoo
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: best location to view and make some photo work , u you will get awesome experience here ....casino also available, walking street , relaxing places , flyer is walk able distance , gardens
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was a total difference to the Flower Dome that we visited prior but just as impressive and different to anything else I have visited previously. You need a head for heights if you are to go to the top and use the walkways back down that weave in and out of the centre of the dome but the overall effect is worth the effort.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The light show at night is spectacular. If you are in Singapore you must take the time to see the show set to music. it is breathtaking.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place was lovely.......we caught a lift up to the top so we had really good views of Marina Bay Sands hotel so we could take some really good photos. We came back at night when they had a light show with music and it was really good to watch. Get there early if you want a good spot for the light show as it gets really busy.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This is not my first time at the Gardens, and every visit is a different experience with changing floral themes for its displays. In Sep 2016, I spent the latter part of an afternoon at the Flower Dome with its theme "Tribal Tempo" (South African floral display). Having booked a dinner for two at Pollen restaurant for our wedding anniversary, my wife and I rode the buggy to the private entrance of the restaurant where we first took a tour of the Flower Dome before settling in for a exquisite dinner (European cuisine) with a waterfront view._x000D_
_x000D_
Although we did not visit the Cloud Forest this time round, we will definitely be back as it too held fond memories of a great experience. And by the way, the exterior is also great for outdoor walks in the gardens - there is the Children's Garden (by Far East Organization) which is great for kids, the iconic Skyway linking the Supertrees, and others. You will need at least half a day to enjoy all that the Gardens by the Bay can offer.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a lovely few hours spend with my family at the Battlebox. It is located in a beautiful park surrounded by lots of greenery. We were thoroughly entertained while being educated on the history and journey Singapore had to go through during the II World War. Our boys ages 5, 10, 16 all enjoyed the experience and was always captured by the presentation. The guide was very informative and did a really good job at retelling this very important history lesson. Will definitely recommend this tour.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best tourist thing to see in SIngapore
REVIEW_BODY: Given that most Singapore 'for-tourist' attractions are, well, a bit rubbish, this was a real surprise. A great walk up and through a rainforest dome. Some great plants to see, views of Singapore and some good art too. Must-see for Singapore for sure, and can combine with a walk through the Marina gardens.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: The Gardens are must see when in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
Whilst there is a fee for access to the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest in the Garden, for people interested in gardening they are a must see place for them to visit. The other part of the Garden are free with the evening light show that was on in the Supertree Grove during our visit, providing an exceptional experience._x000D_
The Gardens by the Bay was one of the highlights of Singapore visit, and when back in Singapore a visit to the Garden will be a must do on the itinerary.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: At 2045 hr, there is a 15 minutes spectacular music and lights display. Visitors just lay down and look up to enjoy the beautiful lighting. My overseas friend was impressed.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We spent a few hours here going through the cloud forest and flower dome. Both are exceptional. While we were there they had a special Japanese garden display with cherry blossom trees, Japanese food and you could even hire Kimonos to walk around in. The High platform walk in the cloud forest gives an amazing view over the gardens and even my height challenged husband had no trouble going around on it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent just over 90mins in here - audio guide very informative and staff very welcoming. I suggest arriving early (I went at opening 9am) as the centre is quite narrow and small. Appreciative of the free wifi also. Thank you for a lovely morning.
ADDRESS: 48 Pagoda Street, Singapore 059207, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: More tranquil than other parks in the city
REVIEW_BODY: Great place to relax and escape the high-rises. Easy to get to via the green line. Nice way to spend a weekend morning (before it gets too hot - not much shelter)
ADDRESS: 1 Chinese Garden Road Chinese Garden, Singapore 619795, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved these gardens, have used them for inspiration in designing our new Gardn in the UK. Not crowded, very easy walking round, good for photographs, very enjoyable.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a visit with kids, or without them! Well maintained grounds, easy access to all and good to get out of the city!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you like Botanical gardens and Singapore has one of the best then you must visit the National Orchard garden whilst you are there._x000D_
Only a small entry fee $5 dollars and $ 2 dollar's for seniors._x000D_
Vist early morning or late in the afternoon to avoid the heat._x000D_
Metro Station right to the gardens entrance makes it very easy to get to from any location in Singapore
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: a must-see attraction while in Singapore, and best visited during the day. This location is one of those must-have photos to add to your travel collection.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: These are definitely worth a look
REVIEW_BODY: Best to visit later in the afternoon and into the evening so that you can see the gardens in the daytime and then the lights at night. There are the usual crowds and as per most things in Singapore it's quite pricey to get into the conservatories. We only did the cloud dome and would recommend it as a nice way to spend your time whilst in the gardens. The light show in super tree grove is also worth viewing after dark.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fun and Family Place to Be
REVIEW_BODY: The place generally huge but it was easy to walk around the park with the map. The attraction was clean. It was not crowded when i visited the zoo in the morning. So it is best if you go early before afternoon. Especially if you want to watch the shows, do look for the timing on the map. I managed to catch the elephant show but i was watching it from outside the amphitheater cause it was full house.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is for kids n not for couples ... We got a lil bored.. This place is good for families with kids or the people who are interested in seeing animals though the zoo was very clean n well organised.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: ONe time see. Nothing much special . May be because we missed a show scheduled at 6.oo pm . Its along with the way of Gardens by the bay
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: journey thru the entire stretch is so enjoyable. Around sentosa island will give a new experience.To and fro to Universal Studios also make you feel as unique experience
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
As far a zoos go - Singapore has mastered it! The way they use natural barriers to separate animals from people is perfect. I love the rainforest feel - the lush landscaping & the lighting creates such a magical mood._x000D_
The fire dance show at the entrance of the night safari is spectacular - don't miss it - I think they perform every hour or half hour.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you are only in Singapore for a short time and love light shows then this is the bridge for you._x000D_
Grab a position over the gardens before 7.30 and watch the Garden Rhapsody light show that starts at 0745. As soon as that finishes you can gallop to the other end of the bridge to catch Spectra - a laser, light and water show on the bay. I think the show is better from the ground floor but if you prefer less crowds stay on the same level and swing right before the escalators and elevators and you will be able to watch from slightly obstructed platforms._x000D_
Take your time leaving, thereâ€™s big crowds here
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Shop till you drop mega shopping area every thing you want a good place toooo spend you money. Also some nice place to eat. Worth a visit the president of Singapore has his palace at the Botton end of orchard road. Has a good picture complex.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Straits Chinese Malay culture integration in the last 100 years
REVIEW_BODY:
Exhibition of past cultural relics showcasing the integration of early Chinese migrants ; by intermarriage with local Malay women to create a new subculture in the Malay peninsula . It included Singapore , malacca and Penang._x000D_
Colourful dresses , jewellery and porcelain tableware mark the priceless collections of that era._x000D_
The museum has priceless historic items that was part and parcel of the Singaporean identity.
ADDRESS: 39 Armenian Street Peranakan Museum, Singapore 179941, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I'll preface this by saying that the Chinatown in my home town is full of poverty, illegal activities, and homeless people so perhaps I'm biased, but_x000D_
_x000D_
This place was amazing! Very large, lots of booths full of fun knick knacks, clothes, and souvenirs, and cheap and delicious food. This also had some of the cheapest beer we've seen in this exorbitant prices for liquor city. I'd definitely recommend a visit!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Tourist spot for sure but there is a reason!
REVIEW_BODY: Great views and probably the most iconic spot in Singapore, always packed with tourists doing the tourist thing but if you are visiting this then you are probably one too - so soak it up and enjoy it! Wonderful spot.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Always crowded but a really great place for shopaholics. I prefer to shop at 10.30am when the stores open and it is reasonably quiet. There are a good mix of high end retailers and some less expensive stores.I find Metro department store very good for shoes._x000D_
_x000D_
This visit I also did an evening visit as the Christmas lights and they were spectacular.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A Tribute to the Staff of this Wonderland
REVIEW_BODY: We spent a few hours in this wonderful garden - words are difficult to describe the beauty that abounds here - the dedication of the Staff and Management of this treasure of Singapore is to be congratulated - we loved every moment of our visit. Thank you
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Better than the Flyer, much higher and better views. Tacky shop at the top but ignore that and concentrate on the view. Lift to the top is fast and quiet, you don't realise you are moving.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth it for the cute and adorable pandas! :)
REVIEW_BODY:
I highly recommend a visit to River Safari just to observe the lovely pandas. Kai Kai the male panda was a bit sleepy and shy on the day I visited but Jia Jia the female panda was very playful and climbed all over the place and even ate some bamboo in front of her captive audience. There was an adorable red panda housed in the same part as the pandas as well. The lively otters were another highlight for me._x000D_
_x000D_
River Safari is well laid out and informative with fish and wildlife grouped according to which major rivers of the world they are from. The Amazon River Quest (an extra 5SGD for adults and 3SGD for children) lasts around 10 minutes and is worth doing to see the majestic jaguar, whereas the River Safari Cruise (also an extra 5SGD for adults and 3SGD for children) that lasts for around 15 minutes was a bit dull and you do not get to see very much wildlife on it._x000D_
_x000D_
3 hours is sufficient to cover every bit of the attraction as this is the smallest park out of Singapore Zoo, River Safari, Night Safari and Jurong Bird Park. For dining options, there is a panda themed cafe called Mama Panda Kitchen that does cute panda decorated buns but I did not eat here as I thought the prices were a bit expensive and heard that the food tasted a bit bland (although you would get a fantastic view of the reservoir if you ate here!). Give yourself plenty of time at River Safari to chill out and watch the lovable pandas! :)
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I first visited LKCNHM before its renovation in 2008. I am now a student of NUS and admission is free, but I did not drop by until National Day 2016 when I brought my HK friends around. The exterior of the building has obviously been upgraded but I was amazed by the transformation inside. It used to be cramped and unattractive but is now spacious and well-ventilated with strategic lighting to showcase the exhibits. The ground level has a dinosaur fossil light show that we did not manage to see. As my friends had to rush off, I didn't really explore much of the mezzanine level. There are also interactive displays which were an interesting touch that enlivened the experience. The museum has lift access and wide pathways, making it wheelchair friendly. Saw families with schooling children who were sketching and reading up on the exhibits. Seems like a good weekend activity for families.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum
ADDRESS: 2 Conservatory Drive | National University of Singapore, Singapore 117377, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I would recommend night safari over Singapore zoo.Singapore zoo is well maintained and good,but if you have been to couple of zoos around the world,then Singapore zoo isn't a must go.But a night safari option,and a chance to watch the animals at night,we won't be doing it that often,and that makes it a different experience all together.The 7.15 pm slot is the most crowded.If you go for 7.15pm,first opt for creatures of the night show,and then the tram.or else queue to tram would be too long in the beginning.After the initial crowd,the safari is less crowded past 8pm.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: During the day, the beauty of these beasts simply can be overtaken by the surrounding Gardens, but at night.... Oh my! The entire place just concentrates on these magnificent structures and then at 19:45 nightly, the light and music show starts. This is when you really can say WOW
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Walking into this place was extremely beautiful, such a huge botanic gardens and amazing walk throughout. My favourite was the bonsai garden, so much beauty and thought was taken into setting this place up for public. Truly feels like bliss.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to spend the day
REVIEW_BODY: The cloud forest is an amazing place to spend a hot morning! the nature, the waterfall and the mist give you the impression that you are in a different place and time!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Singapore flyer...An amazing experience full with joy and enthusiasm for all people of different interests...May anyone be feared by height but this flyer takes it all out!!
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great cocktails. Expensive. worth the view. Lots of pushy folks with cameras and the like, but still worth going.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A great place, even in the rain!
REVIEW_BODY:
This is a large area on the bay side of Marina Bay Sands hotel. You get super views of the hotel from almost anywhere in the Gardens._x000D_
There are two large enclosed areas of which the Cloud Forest is by far the most interesting and spectacular if you are pushed for time. This was our second visit and it was still inspirational to see. There are plenty of places to eat and drink as you wander round and the walk around the lake was especially good to do and had impressive stainless steel sculptures of dragonflies. We didn't see the otters unfortunately but they are around if you get lucky.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A good place to visit along with the Kids
REVIEW_BODY: The Singapore zoo has an amazing range of animals. Its a good place to visit along with kids and family.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you have not visited the Flower Dome when in Singapore, you have missed out on a true visual delight. The variety and number of flowers here is amazing and for a flora enthusiast a real treat.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was amazing gardens to suit any taste, from a family outing or a date night. Exceptionally well kept and informative. A must visit in Singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good range of food and souvenirs
REVIEW_BODY: We stayed close to Chinatown and enjoyed the food and amenities. Good shopping and also one of the few remaining fish spas.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Gardens by the Bay are a "must see" attraction during any visit to Singapore. During daylight you can enjoy the wonderful and vast selection of plants, trees and Cacti and at Night the Amazing spectacle of the light show as the 100 foot high artificial trees flash, twinkle, shine and dazzle all set to music. The venue is very busy in the evening but much quieter during the daytime.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These beautiful gardens and the nightly light show were a wonderful destination following a long flight into the city.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We stumbled across this and it ended up being one of the highlights of our trip, it is truly incredible to see.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We walked across from marina bay sands and absolutely loved the gardens. Beautifully set out and so colorful and creative. The tulip display was stunning. Would definitely recommend to even non gardeners.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very beautiful gardens ....... highly recommended do not leave Singapore without visiting the gardens
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth the money for the view
REVIEW_BODY: Cost a lot to get up there but it was worth it for the wonderful view of the bay and the city. Be aware that if it rains (which it does quite a lot in Singapore) they will make you leave. Seems short-sighted but there you are.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: even though this was NOT the 1st time i did the flyer...the feeeling was still exhilarating. the entire singapore skyline is withing your horizon and if done after the sun has set, its awe inspiring. Crazy photo ops crop in and the feeling when yiu are done with the irde is like can we do it again.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Huge beautiful garden, great place to spend an afternoon with kids._x000D_
_x000D_
We just went to the 2 indoor air conditioning dome, botanical garden and the rain forest._x000D_
_x000D_
The botanical garden has many varieties of plants, flowers and trees. There is also a restaurant inside, very relax as you can get natural sunlight through the huge glass roof top. The rain forest has a big waterfall and very educational photos and videos regarding nature and how to protect them._x000D_
Both adults and kids enjoy a lot._x000D_
_x000D_
A little tip: the temperature inside is around 23 degree especially the rain forest, suggest to bring a thin jacket with you.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Free, Excellent Show, If you have time, SEE
REVIEW_BODY: This is a free show, two times a night. Light and music and right in the city. The gardens are beautiful. Lots of places to eat. It is a little hard to find your way from the MRT to the Gardens at times. Just be aware of signs.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Tucked away in the heart of the Botanic Gardens, the Orchid Garden is one of the exotic places to visit if you like flowers and donâ€™t have the time or the money to pay big bucks at Flower Dome in Gardens By The Bay. It can be covered in 30 minutes, has an interesting mix of various Orchid species and several unusual ones. Photo opportunities are plenty and the place is pretty quiet most of the time. Would definitely recommend you visit when at the Botanic Gardens. Easiest to reach from the Nassim Rd entrance.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Itâ€™s A Must Do Even Though You Really Donâ€™t Have To
REVIEW_BODY: The view is impossible to beat and like every observation deck around the world you pay for the privilege and you are there for only a few minutes. There is nothing undercover so wind, rain and sun are all going to be your friend. You wonâ€™t see anything you wouldnâ€™t see from the Sentosa Cable Cars or the Singapore Flyer, that being said I enjoyed every minute of it and you will too.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely area but prices for a drink were prohibitive! 16 dollars for a lager it was sipped very slowly !
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: nice relaxing romantic visit to gardens by the bay
REVIEW_BODY: Both domes are worth going to. flower exhibitions are so nicely planted and provide natural feeling in nature. really worth the visit to relax and date. architecture os the domes are beautifully done like a green house. we liked the efforts of gardens by the bay to educate on conservation which is valuable for future generations.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A beautiful walk among the best of plants in the midst of one of the worlds most advanced and crowded city .. WHO THE HELL IS NOT GONNA LOVE IT ?? Every ounce of it was lovely .. well maintained .. There is also a lake in the area .. and refreshments area too .. you can spend hours and hours of walking ....
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Elephant, Tiger, Monkey, Bear, Hippopotamus, .... A live introduce to the kids. Good time to bonding. Animal shows always a good time to enjoy. Walking track is just great to connect you from this end to another end. A small water park make the kids like crazy under a hot Sun! If you have children, is good to bring them to see the real animals world here.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice side for quality family time
REVIEW_BODY:
As a Mum of a young child, I'm a very usual guest to Singapore Zoo, but even for nature lovers without kids the Zoo would be very nice experience. Singapore Zoo is one the best and largest Zoos in the world. They have changed and keep changing the Zoo a lot for last few years. For now - the main attraction of the Zoo is the Polar bear Inuka, white Tigers, the biggest population of orangutans in the world and newborn Giraffe. Apart from it, you can find a lot of other animals as lions, elephants, kangaroos, flamingos, otters, zebras, rhinoceros etc. Singapore Zoo is done very nicely - you don't see really cages, the animals are kept in environment as close to natural as possible. It's pretty hot during the day and you may be tired of walking, so it's a good idea to take a tram - it costs additional 5 SGD, but provide you audio guide and relaxing way of traveling inside the Zoo._x000D_
If you have kids definitely bring them to Kidz Area - it has pony rides, carousel and amazing water playground. Kids would love it!!_x000D_
It's better and cheaper to buy a special combined ticket for few parks (called Park Hopper), as 3 main Wild Nature Parks: Singapore Zoo, Night Safari and River Safari are very close to each other and each provide very unique experience for visitors.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: too dirty for my me. i didn't like it at all. for me it was just an hour walk without having to offer something unique.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good for jogging, walking, close to nature
REVIEW_BODY: A good place to walk if you want to see a landscape in Singapore. Very wide area, suitable for kids to run around. If you go on Sunday, you will see a lot of people sitting and picnic on grass ^_^ few places for kids to run around, playground, they can play sand too... not suitable for those who can't take heat or can't walk much.. little shelter. not suitable to go during rainy days.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well, no picture is allowed, souvenir are VERY expensives and the tooth is....very very big. The are a lot of relics inside and I am not sure about the meaning as it looks like small plastic various color ball, which are supposed to represent or to be, parts of the Buddha body. Anyway, it's a nice place to visit. Just to mention, it is Chinese buddhsim.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great excursion to enjoy some nature encased in interesting landmark architecture
REVIEW_BODY:
The gardens are a nice getaway for any group. No problem with children, wide open spaces and beautiful variety of tropical plants. For tourists from cooler countries, the cooled conservatories are perfect to cool off, while the skywalk offers great photo opportunities. Perfect place to go for a calmer day in between the city buzzle._x000D_
_x000D_
Don't forget to bring (student) ID for discounts (resident/senior) and a light sweater if you're sensible to the temperature shift when entering the cooled conservatory.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
1. Read about this 10km ridge walk and decided to give it a try. I started from the suggested starting point at Marang trail._x000D_
2. Fairly easy route, and felt it was like a walk in the park, as the route is all paved roads, man made structures and some steps._x000D_
3. There are lots of big beautiful trees along the way but some paths are quite open and hot._x000D_
4. I exited via the entrance to Kent ridge park, and decided to take a bus ride (across the road) to Kent Ridge mrt station as it was getting quite late in the evening._x000D_
5. Southern Ridge is something worthwhile to try if you enjoy walks , listening to birds chirping, and admire flowers, greenery, or just getting away from crowded places.
ADDRESS: Alexandra Road | Mount Faber Park; Telok Blangah Hill Park; or Kent Ridge Park, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a visit if you are interested in the story of WW2 in Singapore and Asia. I really enjoyed it
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The story of the forest is a fantastic installation, comprising of 69 animations shown over three levels in the rotunda, we went for the history of Singapore but this was a very pleasant addition. The local history is really well displayed broken up into four different galleries. A very busy museum but plenty of amenities for everyone. If you want to walk through Fort Canning exit on level three rather than try to negotiate it from the front of the museum.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Need to visit location besides shopping malls in Singapore. Free to enter this temple. No problem taking photos
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I am not sure of what is considered good in Asia for safaris and zoos? However it is very pricey and under delivers compared with Australia. May be ok for locals to enjoy a night out but not an international tourist destination.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful, diverse garden with many potential areas to fully enjoy and explore, including getting lost. Experience amazing flowers, park areas, entertainment (such as music), having a picnic or dining at one of the wonderful restaurants.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Fancy Bridge like lots of other bridges in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore has unique bridges in random areas. The Helix Bridge is really cool and unique. I wouldn't say it's something that tourists need to see but it's pretty at night and interesting. I do like going to one of the platforms off the bridge and looking at the Lotus. So there are some good views. I'd recommend doing this if it's nearby.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The area started as a ghetto ethnic Indian immigrants would reside under the British policy of ethnic in this section and away from other groups to help keep trouble controlled._x000D_
As the community has grown temples, markets and small back street industries. Some creating statues, model, clothing and food._x000D_
The markets touch all your sences with spices, fruits, vegetables, meat and fish._x000D_
Small dining areas with a single specialist food. Others offering full menus._x000D_
I notice comments say the area is a waste of time but I do agree it's worth seeing how immigration effected Singapore.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went here at night and it was amazing . Experienced the light show when we where doing the walk among the trees
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent shopping Plaza that is unique
REVIEW_BODY: Lovely place to wonder around, they have gondolas to ride inside with excellent shopping, great restaurants. Ease of access to the fabulous Gardens by the Bay.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We stayed at mbs and also went on the Singapore river cruise, and the flyer. Each offered different angles and provided information from the tour groups about the bay. It is a major key of the new development and plenty to see.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A feel of India and its arts
REVIEW_BODY: Its like a small city in a city, this place is wonderful. We rode a MRT going to this place and as we got out, I felt the India feeling in this place. The people, arts, living, food and shrines are indeed a unique setting. Traffic here however is good compared to the real India place. Beautiful architecture and tasty food are some of its greatest features here. In a mini market here, indian music is playing. Small stores often offers discounts on their dry goods. A must visit place in Singapore to stroll and take pictures.
ADDRESS: Serangoon Road, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visited early evening as park began to light up We went up to super tree bar at the top of one of the trees. Fantastic view and stunning lights
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited here as part of an organised tour, it was breathtaking and the views are amazing. I have just looked back at some of my photo's and it has given me Goosebumps revisiting such spectacular shots and views.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
We visited the Arab St. area on our last day in Singapore._x000D_
A visit to Singapore would not be complete without coming to Kampong Glam neighborhood._x000D_
_x000D_
Lots of small unique stores selling the traditional Kebaya, hand blown glass perfume bottles, and of course the usual souvenir shops._x000D_
Also lots and lots of restaurants offering halal type of food, Lebanese and Turkish food._x000D_
_x000D_
The highlight of this area is the grand Sultan Mosque, an terrific Muslim architecture in the midst of peranakan architecture.
ADDRESS: 3 Muscat Street Masjid Sultan, Singapore 198833, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A bit pricy but well worth the trip up to the 56th floor to see it. Souvenir stall at the top, but nowhere to sit and have a beer unless you are a hotel resident, shame.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Me and my husband werenâ€™t too sure whether to come here or Little India- glad we chose here! Lovely friendly area, Great Wall art, beautiful mosque and lovely souvenirs. Some lovely bars too! A must see if in Singapore.
ADDRESS: Kampong Glam, Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: the helix bridge is a great structure linking you to the mariner bay with great views of the river and skypark, excellent photo opportunities along the way, dont miss out
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Housed within the Singapore Gardens. Has stunning orchids. Well maintained. Has a large hall inside that happened to be hosting a wedding when I visited. Small entrance fee ($5), but with it if you're already visiting the Singapore Gardens.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These gardens are a nice way to spend a lovely afternoon. The flower garden is just beautiful with an amazing array of plants from all over the world.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We loved Gardens by the Bay & enjoyed the nightly light show so much, we went twice. The light & music show is just so amazing & so mesmerising. The flower dome was closed so we only visited the Cloud Dome which was also fantastic. I am afraid of heights and did find the Dome Skywalk a bit frightening but worth doing. Light show is free but there is a charge to enter the Domes. Whilst there, a visit to Satay by the Bay is a tasty & cheap meal. Well worth a visit.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Enjoyed this very slow ride. A very good opportunity to get great photos. The carriages are quite big with lots of glass to the floor for good views and some are set aside as dining carts which is a great idea. The views across to the Gardens in the Bay, Marina Bay & the Marina Bay Sands building puts it into perspective how large this complex is. The ride was worth the money & being air conditioned it was a most enjoyable activity. Felt totally safe as the structure is well built & well maintained.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The place was a Christian orphanage with a school, and has now become a large complex with many restaurants and bars. Architecture is very interesting.
ADDRESS: 30 Victoria Street Chijmes, Singapore 187996, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Go at night to see this fantastic exhibit and make sure you see the show. It is amazing!! Beautifully done and makes for great pictures and memories.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Good way to see the city
REVIEW_BODY: Tickets purchased on site, have read that they are cheaper on line but we didn't have internet during stay in Singapore. Went during the day, it was great to see the city. However, there is no guide available so it's just a case of looking but not knowing what you are looking at. Would have liked to take the trip at night as I think seeing the city lit up would have been an enjoyable experience
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: All year long of beautiful spring temperature, cool n nice with beautiful flowers everywhere! So proud of Singapore, making our homeland truly "Ours"!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Oh my do Singaporeans like to consume!!! Orchard road is no different. Full of malls and mini malls and outside shops...if you couldnt find what you needed at the marina bay shopping mall then you will surely find it here.. beautiful wide footpaths and clean streets, nice place to even just go for a walk!!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Half-fish and half-lion, the iconic Merlion resides at the Merlion Park waterfront. Merlion's body symbolises Singapore's humble beginnings as a fishing village when it was called Temasek, which comes from the same root as the word tasek ('lake' in Malay)._x000D_
_x000D_
Its head represents Singaporeâ€™s original name, Singapura, or â€˜lion cityâ€™ in Malay._x000D_
_x000D_
Today, you can glimpse this legend at Merlion Park. Spouting water from its mouth, the Merlion statue stands tall at 8.6 metres and weighs 70 tonnes. #marinabaysands #MerlionPark #Singapore2019
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard Road in Singapore is a shopping paradise with lots of malls and branded shops catering for high end products to smaller basement shops catering for cheaper products but of still good quality. People will find souvenirs, gadgets, trinkets, clothes, shoes, accessories to electronics easily.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is a real nice place. Lots of flower including rare ones. Easily can spend a whole afternoon. Worth visiting
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Plan one hour queue to enter and very expensive
REVIEW_BODY: We arrives at around 2:15pm a thursday during christmas holidays. Only one desk open so very long queue. I ask one staff about it but told us he was only security staff. After 30 minutes, the staff finally got the idea to open new desks and it went faster. Really a pity to wait so long, with kids being impatient. Better go to Marina bay sand water games, free and no queue!
ADDRESS: 1 Pasir Ris Close E!Hub@Downtown East, Singapore 519599, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Such a different experience for us. Amazing to be inside such a structure with real live plants growing and the amazing waterfall. Loved how you can walk around on the sky trail. Refreshing temperature inside too to cool you down after walking around outside.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is the place to be, to get the best view of Singapore! Beautiful views during the day,Lovely skyline of Singapore. Quite slow pace to enjoy beauty. This is a must visit place on your visit to Singapore. Enjoy the fabulous view of the city.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Spectacular displays from top to bottom
REVIEW_BODY: I love the way the path takes you on a tour around the outside of the forest but also at times through to experience the water falls from within. The displays of flowers, trees and art work are skilfully placed but generally close enough to take beautiful pictures and smell the delightful fragrances. Careful thought has been given to provide access and enjoyment for all.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Relaxing and educational, great hike, don't miss the tree top walk
REVIEW_BODY:
Walking in the tropical forest on the trails is a wonderful experience. After half and hour or so your mind winds down after a hectic work week. The tree top walk is highly recommended. It takes a couple of hours, 3 for me from starting at Venus drive and ending as MacRitchie reservoir. Easily accessible using the excellent bus system in Singapore, just tap you credit card on the bus, which bus is easily found on Google._x000D_
Don't miss this for a free half day excursion in Singapore.
ADDRESS: MacRitchie Reservoir Park, Singapore 298717, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place - Keep a full day!
REVIEW_BODY: We spent the better part of a full day at the Zoo recently. Fab place. Take the tickets for the tram as well, and do a quick round-up, and then explore on foot. The place is even better when there's a slight drizzle. Get a poncho out and walk! Be on time for feeding sessions as well - kids can have lot of fun. The shows too are quite good. Get the parkhopper plus tickets - quite a good deal.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you are a botanical boffin you will love this area. The presentation of the plants and trees are quite beautiful. You need to go there in daylight to enjoy its full beauty.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautifully created gardens right in the heart of a modern city. It is an absolute marvel and a must-see for Singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We had a long day visiting the zoo from morning n the river safari and also the river cruise. Actually we were tired but also took up the night safari. We were inside the venue at about 6 45 pm. We were guided to the place of start of trams. It is a guided tour with explanations of the animals around. It is a big adventure like in the forest which is dark n dimly lit. It takes around 40 minuets ride n we were back , then we had good vegetarian dinner n started back inside again on a walk trail which takes us to the natural habitat with the lions roaring tigers walking n other wild animals in the vicinity , which make u feel so happy. We had a good one hour walk n enjoyed so well. We came back round midnight to a taxi stand to welcome us back home
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Love this place as almost Everyday run by .. I get to watch the swans, birds , pp working out,....the beautiful trees.. It is amazing place in the middle of the cityðŸ‘ðŸ˜€
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: cool inside need a cardigan! even though its 36 degrees outside. waterfall you are able to walk around the tops lots to see gardens out side sculptures and the amazing trees
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Its a must visit when in Singapore although have become more rushy with waiting periods & ques as compared to 2011 when i last visited. Still its very good
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
My husband and I spent almost the entire day here. We loved going into the flower dome and seeing the gorgeous orchids that are in season. We bought tickets to go in because the orchids are Singapore's national flower and they are in season. The air was so clean inside!_x000D_
Our favorite part was the Garden Rhapsody. The music was awesome and we couldn't help but sing and dance as we laid there on the ground looking up at all the lights. The flower done was pretty and nice to walk through, but the Garden Rhapsody is where it's at! We would definitely see it again!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore
