REVIEW_BODY: Visited the gardens to fill a couple of hours and it was just magic. So pleased we went there. No entry fee to the main gardens - we went through the Nassim Gate. There was a ridiculously small fee for the Orchid Gardens- $1 because we are seniors! It was breathtaking and such a treat to see so many varieties. Plenty of scenic spots to sit in the heat and the cool house and the mist house were were beautifully laid out with spectacular displays. Take water and make sure your camera/phone is fully charged, there are so many gorgeous shots to be taken. Be prepared for the usual high priced mementoes at the exit gate.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Simply stunning ...awesome place. Both cloud forest & flower drum brings you closer to some of the natures gift that cant be found in asia. Guess a visit at night is much recommended then day time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Makes for a delightful visit, a walk with Nature, super opportunities for photographs, And yes the visit provides knowledge on plants, flowers and trees for the student of Biology especially for fauna from various other parts of the world thanks to the preset temperature domes. Wonderful waterfall, extremely well planned use of space and better make this trip when not rushed, leisurely with loved ones. Also Worth the visit when you have time to spare and want to take it easy.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Best if you can ride it
REVIEW_BODY: We rode the singapore flyer and it was an awesome experience. The trip took around 1hour and provided ecstatic view of Singapore and the coastal area.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A little pricy (around SD$23 pp if I remember correctly) but well worth the price. We joined at Vivo City and bought return tickets that got us to Sentosa, over to Mount Faber and back to Vivo City again. We had (quite some) difficulty finding the cable car building when we arrived at Vivo and also had some difficulty understanding what tickets to buy. Assuming you are going to visit Sentosa as well, I would recommend paying an extra couple of dollars for the Sentosa cable car as well because it takes you to many of the attractions in the middle and Fort Siloso end of the island. Definitely a highlight of our trip.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must if you go to Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: These Gardens are fantastic. I would recommend a visit. There are tow very large greenhouses that I would recommend paying the $28 to visit. The gardens themselves are free to enter though.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We picked a clear day for paying to go up to the top and we weren't disappointed. The view really was terrific and we stayed up there a long time so although it was expensive I would still say it was worth it. Only part of the deck is open to non-hotel guests but that is made clear to you by the staff at the ticket counter. They also forewarn you if there is a chance of rain to give you the opportunity to re-think before paying the entrance fee.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Tang the big department store makes David Jones look like k-mart with prices to match but you can buy all the big designer brands here.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This area was somewhat recently recently extensively renovated, with the addition of giant umbrella style coverings of the spaces between the buildings, allowing for all weather use of the many venues that offer outdoor as well as indoor seating. We were here last night during intermittent heavy rainstorms, and were able to sit outside, under he canopies, without any hint of rain. The area is chock full of restaurants, bars, and music venues, with something for everyone. It's a very lively scene at almost all times. It is also a main embarkation point for the popular river cruises, and is handy to the MRT. For us, it was a must see location in Singapore, where food and drinks can be had at what for Singapore, are reasonable prices.
ADDRESS: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay | Nearest Train Stattion: NE5 Clarke Quay MRT and DT20 Fort Canning Station, Singapore 179019, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: I always enjoy a trip to Chinatown
REVIEW_BODY: For interesting souvenirs, I always like to go to Chinatown. It's crowded and hot during the day, but fun.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: When visiting the Singapore Zoo, I got the feeling that we are the entertainment for the animals not the other way around. There is minimal confinement even for the potentially dangerous "cats" and they are free to look out at the ever-changing lines of faces starring back. The monkeys get the best deal of course because they are so mobile - scampering up and down trees and lianes strung between trees and posts. It was a very relaxing and enthralling day and not that expensive !!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The Flyer provides a great view and orientation of the city. Was only a few people in our pod so was great to be able to wander around and look at differing heights. Would recommend doing.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Unfortunately I apparently have cherry blossom allergies. Or perhaps it was the mad crush of people ......but if you are planning to attend an exhibit on the weekend, be prepared to brave the crowds. By the end of the queue to get in and the queue to go through the blossom corridor, I was hot and having allergy symptoms._x000D_
I went to the other cooler lower temp pitcher plant and orchid haven instead and boy was that a relief. All in all a pleasant interlude for the hottest part of the day.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: been here with my cousins who were all 7yrs old, it was an amazing experience as we have hopped on the tram for thorough and educational explanation by the instructor, and the signboard in all trip are very precise. it was my first time to look at the fruits bat without any boundaries, and they weren't as scary as I thought! during weekdays, the number of visitors is just nice. 715pm entrance is the best time! however, since we're not Singaporean, the procedures in purchasing ticket for shuttle bus service make us unable to hop on the bus from Khalid mrt station to the night safari, as we do not have an ezlink card to pay for the ticket, and the driver does not accept sgd coins ><
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Spent a few hours enjoying the beautiful gardens, will be back to enjoy it all again one day, Need to stay on in to the night or have a cocktail at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: No trip to Singapore would be complete without visiting one of its most famous sites. One of the best times to visit is in for evenings when the light shows make the sight even more spectacular.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Awesome place to see singapore from sky
REVIEW_BODY: One of the best ride in singapore. We loved the place. Just beside marina bay and if u ride the flayer, u must enjoy it. You can see the best view from here
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Visiting Singapore's first world heritage site
REVIEW_BODY: The iconic national gardens created during the early days of Singapore's founding. It is as natural yet orderly as you can envision. Many old trees, palms and tropical plants as well as medicinal herbs are grown here. It is a great place for a morning or evening walk amongst nature in the heart of a busy city. Best of all, it's free except for the National Orchid garden enclosure which is worth a visit for a few dollars of entrance fees.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What a lovely space - vast, beautiful, well taken care of and free! Amazing spot for contemplation, people watching, reading or just enjoying yourself! Must when in Singapore
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This a very neat place, In the day light, it is colorful and amazing. But at night, it is awesome. The solar-powered trees are almost surreal; can't take enough photos of them. And they are right next to the massive "ship" that dominates much of the Singapore skyline.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What an amazing experience. The music accompanied light show was phenomenal. The 80-160 ft tall vertically planted "trees" were covered in lights that changed color throughout the show. Worth every minute. Great for kids.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
I have been to this temple a few times now. Located in China town in the hustle and bustle of the place you tend to come across it all of a sudden while hunting for bargins in the many stalls._x000D_
The temple has a number of interesting features that are worth taking the time to examine. However, after traipsing through Vietnam, Cambodia, Thailand and Brunei I must confess to being a bit over temples._x000D_
The Buddah tooth is worth the vist when you go to china town but if you have done temples do not make a special trip to this one. That is unless you are deeply into temples that allege to hold a tooth from Buddha.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Simply the most beautiful place I have ever been.
REVIEW_BODY: No photos give back the feeling when you step into this wonderland, and feel like in a dream. I can only recomend to see Cloud Forrest, even if you have time for one attraction only.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great place, catering for all tourists with spectacular views of the bay and lots of places to sit or eat. Do not miss the nice lights and sound show in the evening!
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely zoo. Wide variety of animals. Clean.
REVIEW_BODY: We love to return to the zoo. It has a wide variety of animals. The shows are great. The feeding times of the animals are great to watch.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth doing but a slight disappointment
REVIEW_BODY: We were very excited to get to the top of the Marina Bay Sands hotel. We'd seen photographs and read about the infinity pool and although we knew we wouldn't be able to swim in the pool (that privilege is reserved for residents) we were looking forward to seeing it up close. The lift to the top takes you up one side of the hotel and it is almost impossible to get a view of the pool. However, there are still some very impressive views from the top and I'd still recommend doing this. That said I actually thought the Marina Bay Sands hotel was more impressive from the ground. It is a spectacular structure.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are amazing, especially the artificial trees. We really loved the flower dome. Very beautiful during both night and day.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Very Nice garden offering pleasure with learning. Very Good Collection of plants & trees. As a part of a team event we enjoyed visit to this garden.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Must go place in singapore ..enjoi the cloud dome..flower dome during the day..but do not miss the mesmerising light show of the night..
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: must be the best orchid garden in the world
REVIEW_BODY: you are in a garden paradise here and it only cost 1 Sin dlr if you are over 60. the staff pick up dead leaves and flowers all over. have never seen so many beautifull orchids in one natural setting before
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A clever divide between worshipers and travelers allowed us to visit despite a service being given at the time. Beautiful main hall.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We went to club 55 at 9 PM and spend around a couple of hours enjoying chocolate & cheese buffet along with some drinks. While the quality of the food wasn't out of ordinary the views definitely were. If you go an hour earlier you can also enjoy light and water show.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Visit this to see the unusual architecture. this bridge connects the Marina bay sands from Esplanade side. The lighting to the bridge and view of Marina bay sand, river and the down town from this is one of its kinds.
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: In a group of 4, we were lucky enough to have a car of our own. The views Mount Faber through to Sentosa were wonderful. The staff are very friendly. The car itself was nice and clean.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is a heritage place well preserved. Lots of good and authentic Chinese food here. You can look for bargains and souvenirs here too. Prices are very reasonable and if you got a good bargaining skill, you can get the price down. It's a must visit for me each time I am in Singapore.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Must do experience when in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
The Gardens by the Bay is a must visit attraction when in Singapore. Be there 30 minutes before the light show start and experience the whole atmosphere around the garden._x000D_
_x000D_
The light show is spectacular and a fantastic experience which by the way is free. You can go up in the boardwalk for only 8 SGD but i wouldn't bother, its great from below too. Really a cool experience and I would prioritize this experience both on a business trip and when on a family holiday
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We took our young children to see the light show. It was fantastic. We got there early and walked the gardens for a while. There is a splash park there which the children enjoyed and were appreciative of being able to cool down. There is a big food market with a wide variety of stall to choose from. We were there on a Saturday and it was very busy, you could easily lose a wandering child in the crowds. The sunset was amazing to watch over the river. The light show was great and we all enjoyed it. It had the children completely mesmerised. Getting out can be a bit hectic with everyone leaving at once.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We loved this place and could have spent hours exploring the gardens. One of our favorite conservatories was the Cloud Forest with it's epic garden and educational elements throughout.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Sandwiched between Haji lane & Muscat street
REVIEW_BODY:
Arab street runs parallel to Ophir road & stretches from Rochor canal road on one side & ends at the junction of Beach road in the central part of Singapore. Similar to China town & Little India, it is a conservation area under Kampong Glam. However, the back drop to this place at night can be a glittering nearby modern building from few angles._x000D_
If arriving by train Bugis is the nearest station. More than 25 bus routes pass via nearby North Bridge road, Victoria street, Ophir road & beach road. Other nearby roads have names like Baghdad street, Bussorah street, Jalan Sultan etc._x000D_
The iconic structure nearby is that of a mosque with golden dome. Minarets of the mosque are illuminated after evening with changing lights. If properly dressed, one is allowed to visit this religious place during visiting hours. Village hotel located above Golden Landmark shopping complex is at a stoneâ€™s throw away._x000D_
The entire area has unique shop houses that offer fabric, carpet, handicrafts, perfume, carpet & lot of cafÃ© & restaurants serving halal food. This is charming place with a lot of history attached to it & you will notice a different vibe that is missing in the shopping malls anywhere.
ADDRESS: Singapore 199745, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Night tour on a bum boat, just spectacular
REVIEW_BODY: After a vigorous trishaw ride to Clarke Quay it was time for our boat ride. We had background commentary in the boat and we had a glorious ride along the waterfront. Under bridges past all the building with the highlight the laser show at Marina Bay Sands Hotel. The whole ride was spectacular and everyone in our group really enjoyed the ride. This is a must do again ride on our visit to Singapore.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Pretty views. Ordered round trip tickets online and had vouchers on phone. Receives cardboard tickets that I misplaced at the other side of the island. Whereas everywhere else in the developed world they would give you a one way trip back to your departure, to replace the ticket, this company refuses. Horrible situation for my two children of 4 and 6. Terrible management for an otherwise nice attraction. Shame on you.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Just to spend the day but nothing special. If you're looking for buying souvenirs, then go for it but nothing special, everything made in China and the prices are above quality.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A one of a kind nature park... gardens conservatory developed on reclaimed land.. with flowers and plants from almost all over the world.. million species.. a man made waterfall.. lush green vegetation and what not.. so very well preserved .. feels heaven on earth.. A must visit...star attraction of Singapore...
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is, in my opinion the best botanic garden in the world bar none. Including the famous orchid garden, the whole botanic garden is a world heritage site. Glorious displays year round. A must do attraction in Singapore
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went to singapore on June 2017. Visited this place on an evening. Exellent atmosphere. There are several section containing different tree's around the wolrd. The most attracting thing was the super tree show. Typically there will be a big line if you want to go up stairs to watch the show. However, you can enjoy the show from ground also.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Both Marina Bay Sands Skypark and Singapore Flyer offers entire City view. But if have a choice, select Sands Skypark Observation Deck View than Singapore Flyer. The very reason - this one is located on 56 level which is higher than the height of Singapore Flyer. If you chose both if money is not the problem._x000D_
Please look at weather forecast before you chose Sands Sky park as Singapore Flyer still works during moderate rains but Sands Sky park can be closed or you may not enjoy the city view during the rain.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This was one of my favourite places in Singapore. The food in China town is amazing. I would recommend to anyone visiting to go over and try some of the food from the street stalls.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Bar prices where big, like the view. There is not much cover from the sun and limited places to sit. Staff are friendly but had trouble understanding our questions at times. For the price to travel up the lift you may get better value elsewhere.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: While most people head to Chinatown for the food street and shopping the Buddha Tooth Relic Temple was a delightful surprise. It is beautiful and welcoming. Don't forget to go to the 4th level where the relic is kept. There is also earmarked space for meditation and prayers. Loved the Orchid garden and prayer wheel on the rooftop.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Breakfast with orangutans and handling the snake was nice. It is a little overrated but worth once. Quite informative specially for the kids._x000D_
_x000D_
Animal shows are really good. Seeing what the creatures can do and the message of conservation and deforestation from the authorities is really good. Donâ€™t miss any of the shows. They play it twice a day (once in morning and once in afternoon)._x000D_
_x000D_
Huge variety of animals neatly categorised into sections. Most of the animals are free to go around reasonably sized enclosures resembling their natural habitat without any cage, including the lion!. This was quite unique._x000D_
_x000D_
Getting around the zoo using a tram is a breeze. Audio service within the tram also makes it an interactive ride._x000D_
_x000D_
Food options are not plentiful but most people would find it just fine. Vegetarian options are limited!_x000D_
_x000D_
Overall,my kids loved it. Worth spending a full day rather than hurrying through.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We enjoyed our tour of the gardens a lot. It would be nice to see at night , we saw it during the day. The flowers are incredible. The orchids in Singapore are so beautiful and so many varieties. We definitely would recommend you see this.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: one must visit this architectural beauty and a morden marvel. It is definitely a must visit and I am coming back here again.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visisted China Town a couple of times while we was in Singapore and enjoyed it very much. We had food and drinks here which was reasonably priced and food was very tasty. Always has a good atmosphere day and night
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing experience. Very few wars museums mesmerize you and this is up there with the very best. The guided tour was very thorough and although the exhibitions are limited, you do get the ghastly feeling that youâ€™ve paid for! Joanne is an absolute top notch guide and Iâ€™ll remember this experience for a very long time.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: As SG is a city that requires walking, this attraction is good for one visit only, second visit is not a good idea. It will ask you to do uphill walking through metal pathways going to the top with nothing much special to see. As many times that I can visit Gardens by the Bay, sorry for Cloud Forest but a second time is already too much. By chance, I got to see CF at night and getting pictures is always a terrible mess. Try to visit it with natural light if your priority is pictures. But at night, city view at the top is quite interesting.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Mesmerizing light show you shouldn't miss
REVIEW_BODY:
The booths at the entrance are selling tickets for the shuttle buses at a cost of $3 per person. It is not considered necessary as it is better to walk around the garden on foot. Don't be tricked for misinterpreting that an entrance fee is necessary as the outdoor garden is absolutely free. Besides, one is allowed to hop on hop off at only designated stops._x000D_
_x000D_
The light show under the Supertree Grove is mesmerizing. It runs daily at 7.45 p.m. and 8.45 p.m. The music and lighting arrangement are amazing.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A selfi with Merlion is a must for Singapore. Nice place fully surrounded by tourists. A good view is offered from Frolino hotel.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The walk toward the Merlion was enjoyable as the view of the river and the buildings was great. There were a lot of people there so getting a good shot would be tricky. I suggest getting up on one of the seats to get a less crowded shot of the sights._x000D_
You can also enjoy your afternoon tea in one of the restaurants.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Merlion park houses the symbol of Singapore - The Merlion. Good place to take some family photos with the mythic creature in the background._x000D_
_x000D_
Feasting on an ice cream and soaking the atmosphere around it makes it worthwhile. View of high rise buildings and marina bay sands is quite nice._x000D_
_x000D_
There is an option to take a bum-boat ride from the pier. However, they were accepting only cash so decided against it.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Me and my husband went to the cloud forest while we were in Singapore and it was lovely to see how much a city still cares about the nature. The whole are surrounding this is lovely and peaceful, we went at night time to be able to see all of the lights. It's amazing to see the waterfall inside this dome and to see all this different types of flowers. It is worth a visit but we didn't need too long here, it depends if you are the type of person who reads all the of the signs.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A great experience day or night
REVIEW_BODY: This place has to be visited day and night.A walk around the shore brings up some amazing sculptures. The parklands are so clean and well kept. The best way to look at Singapore in a 360 aspect.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It costs $8 per person to go up to the sky bridge and walk along for amazing views of gardens by the bay. At night they have a brief 5 minute light show which is free to view. If you want to visit the cloud forest and flower done it is a further $28 to enter both.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
There is a lot of hype worldwide on the Christmas time decorations on Orchard Road and thus we did a special drive through on our return from the Singapore Night Safari._x000D_
_x000D_
However much to our disappointed there was nothing extraordinary except for the continous decoration of the two reindeers the entire road and the other decorations on the two sides._x000D_
_x000D_
Overall the decorations were nice and beautiful but nothing extraordinary or above the norm anywhere close to what is spoken in social circles about Orchard Road at Christmas time !
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We have been to Singapore a few times but hadnâ€™t been to the zoo & friends of our said the night safari was a must do , oh dear what a mistake it was , it was a waste of our $â€™s & our time ($64 each) you can hardly see any animals , most are asleep or very hard to see in the dark!!! Maybe a better time in the daytime but we thought it was not worth it , lots better things to do in Singapore
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: wonderful to feel some nature in this green but urban jungle of Singapore.... especially recommend the national orchid garden which thought a bit fragile in places still reflects the nature that was here before Singapore and will be once more when it is gone.. unless we manage to save nature first before we destroy our species...
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: returned after 8 years. Still love it
REVIEW_BODY: Fantastic zoo.One of the best I've been too and I've visited dozens in my time. People have probably mentioned all the great things but I'll add a few little things that makes this zoo go the extra mile. Things like fans and air cons in all viewing areas that help you cool down on hot days. Or the free bottle filling stations that allow you an endless supply of cool water.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: If you like nature, this is a good place where you can walk while admiring the trees, shrubs, artificial tree, and take a walk at the OCBC Skyway. The $5/head is worth it. From the top, you have a better view of the Singapore landscape featuring Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flier, and the greenery below. From Marina Bay Sands take the lift from the ground floor and take the bridge to the Gardens by the Bay.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It was great place for kite flying. And it was a nice place for friends and family to go. Just that there isn't much food to eat. And the carpark place is limited.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Orchard Road was all decked up for Christmas with wonderful lights. The malls are very glitzy and attracted crowds. The food courts at the basements of some malls were good value for money and had ample choices.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Indescribable celebration of the natural world
REVIEW_BODY: This is an all-ages, all-interests, all-engaging experience. Give yourself at least half a day to taste, and a couple of days to deeply explore, this complex mini-world. The Cloud Forest dome transports you far from the heat of Singapore, while the Flower Dome celebrates the incredible variety of flowering species found in the Mediterranean Zone worldwide. Then you can ascend the Super Trees for a literally bird's-eye view of the gardens from the skywalk, lunch at the hawker center called Satay by the Bay (or one of the tasty but pricey restaurants on site), and let the kids play in the undulating fountains of the Children's Garden. You cannot have a bad day here.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
The National Orchid Garden is under renovation now and the exhibits are limited as those in the green house were closed._x000D_
We visited this place during the school holidays, whereby locals received free entrance._x000D_
Do visit the Botanic Gardens early in the morning, as it can be quite hot towards noon However, there are many shady spots under the trees._x000D_
Come in your sport shoes with mineral water.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is very nice place. We spent a day on the zoo and river boat trip. It was very enjoyable and children enjoyed it. Though tickets are little expensive and we bought it from downtown tourists places as there was long queue at Zoo ticketing offices. We enjoyed the animals at shows that been shown to visitors. There are endanger animals such as polar bears and Kola. The food places were very crowded and food quality is not good for non Asian.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Outdoor garden with best view of many flower inside. You will feel back to nature in there. Excellent maintenance
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We had a terrific day at the National Gallery. We did a free tour of the architecture , which gave us a good understanding of the significance of the building, Loved the art which we viewed before and after a memorable lunch at Odette. It was great to see such an eclectic gallery.
ADDRESS: 1 St. Andrew's Road #01-01 National Gallery Singapore, Singapore 178957, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a bridge to link the Sand and Garden by the Bay, therefore, you can enjoy both the view of the Sand, Garden by the Bay, Singapore Flyer, I think this view is better than the Marina Bay
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Last time I don't think there was a time slot allocation but the new system was really good to prevent over-crowding! But was disappointed when I couldn't find the Suspension Bridge. Really wanted to show my birthday girl that. Also, really, prepare to bring your guts out when you drop by!_x000D_
_x000D_
I got scared by a Tapir that was camping in the dark near the tram route, our tram went over maybe a tree branch? and I thot there was an animal in the bushes and I freaked out. An unidentified animal ran across the walking trail and lastly I got hissed at by a fruit bat/flying fox when I wanted to take a pic. (And I'm 32 : ( what fun huh?!) My birthday girl had lots of fun especially her interaction with the keeper at the Wallaby exhibit.She learnt new stuff that day too!_x000D_
_x000D_
I really love how the Night Safari has evolved over the years, you should go visit if you haven't been!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Rolling in the Singapore Flyer was quite an experience it provided a wonderful picture of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: It is one of the best place in Singapore it was rainy day but we could enjoy it very well it was beautiful garden in it is unique way with beautiful show in night never miss it
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I went with friend and her kids to this event. It included the admission to the museum. It is not too big but suitable for the family with kids. There are 3 dianasour skeletons which the staff there told me they are all real. It is quite informative place.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum
ADDRESS: 2 Conservatory Drive | National University of Singapore, Singapore 117377, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Great experience! If you want to relax, eat nice food, have great view, do shopping, if you want to meet real Singapore- I believe this is right place. Clean, safe, amazing architecture, few of the most important city's landmarks are situated here. You can also go for river cruise from here. Gardens by the Bay are 15 min walk away. You can take subway directly form great Marina Bay Mall. The Mall itself is state-of-the-art. Marina bay must be seen both by day and night. Do not miss night light-music-fountains show which is played every evening (three times)
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is a very nice temple in China Town. The downstairs has the large statures and areas to pray. The 4th floor has the tooth.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
My family and I opted for the Sky Dining experiences - four courses, two turns of the observation wheel and incredible views over Marina Bay._x000D_
The food was really good and we were particularly impressed with the fact that the main courses were brought in fresh and hot when the observation wheel had finished its first cycle._x000D_
We had lovely food with beautiful views over Singapore, and finished with (what else?) a Singapore Sling.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: So close to the city center and just above Orchard Road the famous Shopping and Entertainmem District linked by Mass Rapid Trains ( MRT ). Don't miss the National Orchids Enclosure, Nature Reserves and it's also lighted up till late at night. Watch wedding couples taking wedding shots, Tai Chi to joggers as early as 6 am. Beautiful lake with Swans and Carps to very tall heritage palm trees and Band Stands,. Historial as the Founder of Singapre Sir Stamford Raffles a Botanist himself had the Mater Plan for the Gardens just a few yeras after founding Singapore in 1819. Rubber seeds from Kew Gardens were found to suit the climate here and eventually gave rise to the Rubber Tree planting in Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam and South China.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A less typical museum containing many artifacts from POW and interned civilians during WW2. The presentation of the artifacts is slightly cramped. One needs to do some reading to get the most out of this museum. We visited this location as part of a private tour.
ADDRESS: 1000 Upper Changi Road North, Singapore 507707, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Many themes available from mekong river to amazon river. a big aquarium for fish watching. Great for family outings. It is sheltered. Not hot.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Soo beautiful!! Flowers and plants in A Fantastic combination._x000D_
_x000D_
The place is very clean and not A brooken plant or brown leaf placed on the ground._x000D_
_x000D_
Not many plants to buy in sterile glasses! And very easy to go to with the hop on/off bus. Same place as botanique garden
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited Gardens at the Bay in the evening so we were able to see them during the day and as the evening turned to darkness with all the lights coming on. We were lucky enough to be on the sky walk when the light show started at 7:30pm. This was fantastic. I enjoyed my visit to the Gardens!
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Historical Haw Par Villa{Tiger Balm Gardens}
REVIEW_BODY: Visited here on a very wet day and we had the whole place to ourselves in the morning. Very quiet and empty which was a real shame as this is a very interesting place to visit with plenty of ancient, mythical Chinese legends and skilful craftsmanship in all the statues.It was a real shame that the whole place needs an immense renovation to bring it up to its original glory ,as I have visited this place a very long time ago, and everything was in immaculate and pristine condition. Free admission and very easy travelling on the MRT to this attraction. Highly recommended tourist attraction to visit once, in spite of it being rather run down.
ADDRESS: 262 Pasir Panjang Road Haw Par Villa | 1-min walk from Haw Par Villa MRT Station, Singapore 118628, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Great way to get over to Sentosa Island and enjoy 360 degree views of the locality._x000D_
However if you don't handle heights too well, then I would not recommend this form of travel over to the island - the cable does rock and wobble a little bit._x000D_
Good value and different form of transport in getting to the Sentosa.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Would highly recommend visiting here. Beautifully maintained and a peaceful place to walk and enjoy nature in the middle of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is heaven!! If you really want to see a place that you will be amaze and fall inlove, this is a place to go if you travel in Singapore.. i love it.. i will surely come backðŸ˜Š
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: this is one of the attractions we wanted to do and enjoyed it. we went in the morning being Christmas and to avoid the crowds. they should ban selfie sticks.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place to walk around and have a drink
REVIEW_BODY: Walk out of the Fullerton and search for the lion fountain, There are some nice terraces for a quick beer, then take the new commemorative pedestrian bridge and continue right along the water front to the helix bridge for views with a different angle.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Garden by way: really cool place
REVIEW_BODY: If you like to spend time with various kind of plants, flowers then this is the place. My 7 year old daughter simply loved this place. A must to visit if you are un Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Must Try When in Singapore, Especially With Family
REVIEW_BODY:
I have heard many good reviews about the zoo. I decided to visit the zoo with my friend and it was good. The zoo is clean and the animals, excellent. White Tiger and the Lemur (King Julian in Madagascar - haha) are two of my most memorable attractions._x000D_
_x000D_
If you walk around the zoo, you will notice that it is actually quite similar to the Taronga Zoo in Sydney (minus the cool weather)._x000D_
_x000D_
Zoo is clean. Staff is friendly. Good infrastructure. Definitely a family outing place. I learnt a lot about the animals. Haha.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: we traveled to Santosa on the Singapore cable car.enjoyed seeing the bay from to top.in fact you can see a lot of the islands attractions whilst reaching it.it was a different experience n a lot of fun.
ADDRESS: 109 Mount Faber Road Faber Peak, Singapore 099203, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: whenever you go Chinatown, this place is a must visit. All the Buddhism people come and workship in this temple. Yes, the temple is so quiet and peaceful. There are a lot of meditationers and monks inside. One thing that you can't wear shorts inside. The monks will offer you a shalon to wear over. On the top of the building they have a beautiful flower garden with Bell.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing place. A â€˜must seeâ€™ for anyone visiting Singapore. We went for the 7.45 sound and light show. Stunning. As it was the 4th May they had â€˜Star Wars â€˜ as the music. The light show was truly amazing. Spotlessly clean. Beautiful place in the middle of Singapore city. Easy to get there MRT station very close.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We made a mistake trying to fit it in at the end of a day of sightseeing. There is a lot of walking involved & therefore I did not get to see all of the attraction due to tiredness.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We stayed at the York Hotel near Orchard Road. The shopping on Orchard Road is similar to Rodeo Drive in California or 5th Avenue in New York City. There are multiple Gucci, Louis Vuitton, Ferragamo, Rolex, etc. You will NOT get bored shopping. The underground tunnels allow you to cross the street to shop some more without worrying about traffic.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The trees are such a big highlight of a trip to Singapore as they are so beautiful and breathtaking. You do not realise how tall the trees are until your next to one. I would recommend going at night so you can see the light show and the trees all lit up.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay | Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: One of the most beautiful an well done gardens in the world. Take a break from the high temperatures outside to slide into these astounding structures. It is like taking a tour of the world in one building.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Stunning architecture, vistas, flowers, waterfalls...and all in air-conditioning...an absolute must even if you don't like gardens. a must.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A very interesting hour, and left me with desire to find more
REVIEW_BODY:
The Battlebox reopened in June 2016, and so as a regular visitor to Singapore on business I was interested to visit and see more about the Second World War history of Singapore._x000D_
_x000D_
Set in a location within Fort Caning Park, the Battlebox in easy to find. Access is only by guided tour, and Nancy, our guide set the scene when we met her so that we had some ideas of the background to the history of the Battlebox._x000D_
_x000D_
A thoroughly interesting 1 and 1/4 hour tour followed during which I learnt more about the history of Singapore in the War than I did at school history lessons._x000D_
_x000D_
Off the the National Museum and the Asian Civilisation Museum to find out more._x000D_
_x000D_
Highly recommended.
ADDRESS: 2 Cox Terrace | Fort Canning Park, Singapore 179622, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Super fun! Really enjoyed a sunset cocktail at the top of the flowerâ€” then the evening light show. A much appreciated stop in Singapore
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
If you want to see how a botanical flower garden and cloud forest could be prepared and presented, this is the benchmark. Admission for adults is Singapore $28 for non locals and $20 for locals. This interaction of sounds and visual elements automatically puts people at ease and in good mood. Real harmony._x000D_
_x000D_
As a special treat we saw U.S Seventh Fleet Band's popular music ensemble â€œOrient Expressâ€ perform.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great views to the City and Business District (CBD)
REVIEW_BODY: The Promenade is a very enjoyable location to stroll around. Pedestrianised, peaceful, views of the Bay and City and shopping on hand ... if you can't resist!
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Amazing says it all. A great educational experience to be enjoyed by all ages. The scale of this attraction is mind boggling and how they are able to maintain it is just incredible.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice way to spend an afternoon
REVIEW_BODY: The river safari allows you to explore the exhibits at your own pace, and is sheltered from the sun and rain. The only exception is the actual river safari boat ride which costs extra and whisks you by animals that aren't otherwise visible. I would recommend purchasing it online with your ticket. Though it would be nice if it was possible to see the animals without taking the boat.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road Singapore Zoological Gardens, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This place is so interesting that you must go here and spend at least half a day but probably more especially if you want to see the night light show also. So much to walk around and see on the outside of the domes and then a whole lot more in the domes plus the Sky Walk. Not just for garden lovers but for everyone with so much to see.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A nice place to walk and enjoy the beautiful view and attractions of Marina Bay. The tour is different both day and night. Book a time of your trip to go there and just delight with Singapore.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Location was slightly away from Marina Shopping mall but easy walkways to the Flyer. Walking in morning or late afternoon is good. The ride takes about 30 mins. And No toilet in the capsule. Do your things before the ride. AmaZing view of Singapore .
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful botanic garden. Amazing orchid garden. It is marked as UNESCO site. Better go early in the morning. It can be very warm in the afternoon.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Best collection of orchids I have ever seen. You can literally spend 2 days roaming around! If short on time, pay the extra $5 to see the Orchids.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
This was our first venue at Gardens by the Bay and we walked into a huge long dome shaped structure that was well air-conditioned. Despite being fairly crowded we found the place really enjoyable. It is full of baobab trees, cacti, succulents, palm trees, and all kinds of flowers in bloom so it was really colorful. There are also dragons and birds such as eagles carved from tree roots scattered around the place and also large model mushrooms with an Alice in Wonderland theme._x000D_
_x000D_
The flower dome is ideal for taking photos, especially of colorful flowers. So many people were taking selfies against beautiful backgrounds too. The great thing about this place is that you can wander around the paths and end up in all sorts of places, so it is really interesting to see what is around every corner._x000D_
_x000D_
We probably spent about 45 minutes here, took lots and lots of photos and had a really fun time.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing Zoo.. must see if Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
I am a great lover of animals so of course Singapore Zoo was on my list of things to do and i was not disappointed._x000D_
_x000D_
I payed for breakfast with the orangutans at the Zoo and this was a great experience, breakfast options were large and wide variety available._x000D_
_x000D_
If you like to take your time and view or the animals attend shows, talks etc then i would recommend at least 5- 6 hours to fully enjoy the zoo and all its animals._x000D_
_x000D_
Token feeding is available at the zoo for certain animals, they ask for $5 for each basket of food, but this is a great way to enjoy the animals up close._x000D_
_x000D_
Tram around the zoo is available if mobility or children, it was fairly cheap and had multiple stops. in terms of amenities, many places to eat within the park, drinks machines etc_x000D_
_x000D_
My favorite thing about the zoo were the free roaming orangutans they have.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: These gardens cannot be described. An amazing experience. Easy to reach via MRT and lots of venues for a snack or lunch. You will need 3-4 hours minimum.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Marina Bay is just so beautiful to be described in words. The walk around Marina Bay is around 2-3 kms and gives the most beautiful and scenic views in the evening and night. Like most places in Singapore, this place is very well planned and clean n tidy surrounding with tall buildings adding to the beauty of the place. The Merlion, Marina Bay Sands buildings and the Fountain show in the evening is a must must watch.
ADDRESS: Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018980, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We made a short trip to Singapore, and given this placeâ€™s designation as a World Heritage Site, we put in on our list of â€œmust seesâ€. VERY glad we did. It was one of our favorite sites in Singapore. Beautiful, grand, and peaceful right in the middle of an enormous city. Impressive, like everything else in Singapore!
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I would like to have seen this bridge from the road as I reckon it would be pretty speccy but could not face going downhill and then having to come back up to continue our walk! Still it was quite speccy while walking on it and the views from it are great.
ADDRESS: 221 Henderson Road Henderson Building, Singapore 159557, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Lovely experience. Accessible to wheelchair users and the accompanying persons gets free access. The staff are very helpful and nice.
ADDRESS: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Chinatown Singapore is a lovely vibrant place with an interesting history and good food.....but, DON'T BUY ELECTRONIC GOODS HERE!_x000D_
We recently visited and bought goods from E-Lifestyle Connect. Very good Salesman who lies effortlessly and confuses you with figures. In retrospect we were seriously conned and paid exorbitant prices.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Do not come to Singapore without visiting this amazing garden. Supposed to take a couple of hours but I stayed 4hrs so if you like outdoors, flowers, animals, etc and learn about them, this is the place to visit.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: best zoo we have been to
REVIEW_BODY: because every local recommended us to visit, we decided to, and we were happe about it. we took the complete ticket set, however the cruise is very very, disappointing
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I only went during the day, saving a night trip for the future, when travelling with my wife! Plenty of walking. The food street prices were realistic with several good options.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Went there by myself on a weekday afternoon, you should expect quote a lot of aunties / uncles tour since its a slow-pace activity no matter which day you go. Very relaxed and get to see different varieties of orchid. Definitely worth going if Botanic Gardens is on your agenda.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Rd | Within the Singapore Botanic Gardens, Singapore 259569, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Plenty of shopping malls line Orchard Rd. Designer labels if that is your thing. Decent eateries dotted along the way also. Pay a visit at night to see it glittering.
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: A must see in Singapore. The view is magnificent - not to be missed at night. The restaurants on the top of the towers are incredibly delicious. If possible stay at the hotel and enjoy the amenities. An architectural treasure.
ADDRESS: 10 Bayfront Avenue | Level 57, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore 018956, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We spent a morning in this fabulous garden. It is big and obviously well kept. The orchid display was beautiful with a huge amount of effort put in to present these flowers to the public. Itâ€™s big and you could spend days there. Visit early in the morning as itâ€™s starts getting hot approaching midday.
ADDRESS: 1 Cluny Road, Singapore 259 569, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: What an experience, everyone happy though tiring.
REVIEW_BODY:
My kids just simply loved it, going around with trams again and again. Popping into restaurants for food and coffee, could be found easily within the zoo._x000D_
We visit this place every time we visit Singapore._x000D_
We usually spend the whole day there._x000D_
It is neat, easy to navigate, staffs are wonderful and very helpful,
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Didn't have too much time for here but wanted to see it..didn't pay to go into anything and maybe if I ever go back I would do so . The gardens are well kept and I just walked round them more to get to marina bay sands hotel than to look but what I saw was very impressive.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We visited the Gardens and we into the flower dome who had a magnificent display of orchids. The variety was very big and the displays where very pretty and well displayed and looked after. Likewise the cloud forest dome lots of beautiful flowers and plant in the amazing display Centre. Outside of the domes the gardens surrounding are also very well maintained and manicured with the large avatar looking structures. Very worth while visit and not far from Marina Bay sands.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Despite the Merlion is famous as the icon of Singapore, there isn't much to expect from a statue. Only worth taking a photo, as you need to force yourself through large groups of China tourists.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The inside of this temple is stunning, with its gold statues and walls lined with Buddhas. It's free to get in, but you must have your knees and shoulders covered. They supply brown wraps that you can put on. Located in the heart of Chinatown.
ATTRACTION_NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
ADDRESS: 288 South Bridge Road, Singapore 058840, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: a lot of big trees, more than 100 years with natural around. It was a history place in World War II park. I had a good walk and enjoy to take pictures here.
ADDRESS: River Valley Rd, Singapore 179038, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Long shopping road with all the fancy brands...
REVIEW_BODY:
Just a long wide road where ceossing isnâ€™t easy having all the fancy malls and brands you can find anywhere else._x000D_
_x000D_
If it rains you better be prepared and geared up with an umbrella._x000D_
_x000D_
In evenings and at night time it becomes the racing track for hiso kids in their German and Italian sport cars pulluting the sceenery with noise...
ADDRESS: Singapore, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Really enjoyed this. The icon of Singapore. Great photo opp with Marina Bay Sands in the background. Enjoy.
ADDRESS: 1 Fullerton Road One Fullerton | Merlion Park, Singapore 049213, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the 2 busy areas of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: After Little India, this area is full of people and tourists exploring the hustle and bustle of Singapore by walks and shopping. Good place to change money and buy chinese stuff. Explore the lanes on foot and you will be amazed to find hidden gems.
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Visited last September 25, 2018._x000D_
The plants was hang on the wall with the beautiful exterior design and view behind. (Although in our country Phillipines, We have the same plants and other flowers too. :) and for me it was an ordinary plants). We amaze on how they put it together to make a picture perfect. I am sensitive to cold and it was cold inside the dome bring light cardigan or jacket.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive Gardens By the Bay, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: The oldest Hindu temple in Singapore dedicated to a goddess-healer. This temple is particularly picturesque.
ADDRESS: 244 South Bridge Road Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore 058793, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: This is such a wonderful place to go to. imagine a man-made fall at the center of an island. Just the sound of falling water will relax your mind while inside the Cloud Forest. Brilliant Idea
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Decided to walk back to our hotel from the Marina Sands to Merlion area . Bridge is beautiful - it has areas where you can step out to take photos -
ADDRESS: Linking between Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
To fully enjoy the garden, it'll take at least half day. Best time to visit is afternoon. Try to visit cloud forest and flower dome while the sun is up, then head to the skywalk and enjoy the light show in the noon._x000D_
Free entry to garden complex, visitors will only need to pay if they want to enter some spots (cloud forest, flower dome and OCBC garden)._x000D_
The price is pretty affordable and really worth since they provide very well build and maintained attraction, wide variations of nature beauty, plus instagram-able ambience.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: I went here several times already and never get bored. If you want to come, try to search online about their shows, make a plan so you wonâ€™t miss any show. Definitely must visit!
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: We lived just bedside China Town! Plenty of stores&food!the kids loved to see around and looking all the China souvenirs!
ADDRESS: Crot | Trengganu, Singapore 048942, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: After few years we went there again and itâ€™s amazing. Full of life, spirit, colors and smell of India. The is only once to say: Incredible India! Definitely a must in Singapore.
ADDRESS: 141 Serangoon Road, Singapore 218042, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY:
Such an amazing experience. I was so lucky as the Sunday that I was there....they offered free entry to their special exhibit (usually an additional cost above the museum entry fee). Definitely take the free tour as it is soooo amusing, educational and entertaining. I didn't expect to spend so much time there but we had to rush through the last section to avoid being locked in._x000D_
_x000D_
One sad thing is that the flow of the museum is not clear so the timelines might jump a bit if you walk through the wrong section first.
ADDRESS: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: What an amazing place. The evening light show is something to see. Make sure leave plenty of time to do this. It's at least an afternoon and into the evening. Have a drink at the bar atop the largest super tree. Whilst it's a pricy drink the views are worth it.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Yes! You heard it. A whole day is not enough to truly experience everything this place has to offer. Lots of plants, flowers, birds... The sky dome is really amazing and cold and has high walkways to. The flower dome looks even bigger inside. This, for me, is a romantic place. I think it's nice to come here not on a tight schedule so as to enjoy what it has to offer. Locals even come to this place to jog. You can do lots of bird photography in the outdoor gardens too. The light show at night is really nice.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Cloud forest Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: A must go place in Singapore to get close to nature. Breath-taking man made waterfall and wide range of plants and flowers from all over the world. Spend the afternoon here to escape the harsh heat of Singapore.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Loved how the scenery changed from beach to greenery along the path.. Nice to try, especially after you got bored of all the malls.
ADDRESS: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road, Singapore 455486, Singapore

REVIEW_BODY: Had a 24 hour layover between flights so spent a few hours in Singapore. This was somewhere I had not been before and it did not dissapoint. Beautiful gardens well laid out with arrangements covering all areas of the world. Quite busy on my visit, could be because it had been wet that morning but as it is all contained in a giant greenhouse it didn't really matter. Highly recommended.
ADDRESS: 18 Marina Gardens Drive | Bayfront Plaza, Singapore 018953, Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A long wait for a 20 minute safari
REVIEW_BODY: We booked the hop on hop off bus service to take us to the zoo for this activity. I was greatly surprised that there were so many people here. From queue up to finish it took us and hour and a half for a twenty minute ride through the zoo! Also there is the hour and a half return trip from town to the zoo. I would recommend if you don't mind queuing but otherwise forget it. Some of the animals were not visible or present and the ones that were were hard to see as they use white light instead of red so your eyes can never get adjusted to the darkness. On a good note, they say your attendance costs go towards preservation.
ADDRESS: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826, Singapore
